description: MW Company is an engineering, design, manufacturing and marketing company with a portfolio of leading brands in the automotive and lifestyle industry, including WELD, MOMO, Forgestar, ADV.1, CCW, Driven Motorsports, Reds, HiPer Technology, and Tikore. It is headquartered in Kansas City, MO, with main offices in Orange County, CA, and Milan, Italy. MW Company employs more than 200 people worldwide.  MW Company is part of the Cisneros Corporation, a third-generation global family enterprise with experience in numerous industries across media, telecommunications, consumer goods and automotive brands.  Territory Sales Representatives are responsible to maximize market penetration for MW Company’s portfolio Street Performance products that include WELD OFF ROAD, WELD Performance, MOMO Road Wheels, Forgestar, ADV.1 and CCW brand wheels, in assigned territory. Directly prospecting for potential dealers in assigned territory, including cold calling and qualifying valid dealer accounts. Will be responsible to maintain regular and consistent customer contact to develop and increase share of accounts wheel business. Record and monitor customer contacts initiate minimum of semi-annual contact with every lead and dealer in assigned territory. Continue to learn and stay abreast of technical details of brands, market trends and customer preferences. The territory area is Spokane WA and Idaho area.  Under the supervision of Regional Sales Director, you will: Assume responsibility for the effective and professional completion of sales function Creates great business relations customers Handles problems and complaints in a prompt and professional manner Accomplishes all weekly reporting as it relates to Sales Assist with inventory accuracy, warehouse, shipping and receiving functions as needed Demonstrate strong interpersonal and communication skills Assists in verifying accounts, checking product availability, and mailing correspondence Keeps management informed of area activities and significant problems Works with and ensure functions are effectively and accurately performed in accordance with established policies, standards, and security procedures  REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS -      High school diploma or equivalent.  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS 5 years of experience in sales, marketing or customer service Experience with ERP systems preferred, experience with PLEX a plus Understanding of automotive, performance and motorsports preferred

Regional Sales Director                             Philadelphia, PA  Tioga Pipe is a privately held supplier of pipe, tubing, fittings, flanges, and related products in chrome-alloy steel, stainless steel, carbon steel and nickel alloy steels primarily servicing the global energy, refining, processing, and power generation business.  The Company has been in business for 75 years and is one of the top material suppliers for:  Global Power Generation Nuclear Power Oil Refining Gas and Chemical Processing U.S. Military Shipbuilding  Tioga Pipe operates from three Regional Centers located in Pennsylvania, Texas and Tennessee where the inventory is among the largest and most comprehensive in the United States. Our core competencies that support our continued success are professional project management, comprehensive inventory, worldwide mill relationships, quality programs and our unsurpassed experience and market knowledge.  Position Summary Responsible for developing profitable sales growth of Tioga’s range of products to the Power Generation, Hydrocarbon and Chemical Process Industries through Tioga’s “channels to market”. Plan and execute strategic and tactical plans to achieve the assigned sales objectives.  Lead the regional sales team to meet goals and objectives. Sustain and grow the sale of, and market share of, the company's products and services within their defined area of responsibility. Develop new business accounts within their region. Maintain and expand their industry and product knowledge so to be relevant and beneficial to our clients and prospects.  This position requires the ability to analyze current environments, create a compelling business solution complete with detailed financial analysis. Present the findings and have the ability to propose specific technology recommendations to improve current business processes.  The Director must possess a high degree of creativity, organizational and process development skills and have a proven track record of presenting solutions to Senior Management.  Responsibilities Have frequent contact with both internal and external customers. Have the ability to give and receive feedback, recognize and act on customer needs, building rapport and gaining closure. Have frequent contact with other departments, vendors and customers. Possess tact, charisma, and the ability to negotiate. Communicate clear and concise expectations, goals and provide feedback on results.  Have excellent internal communication via phone and in person with company staff, other sales professionals, managers, administrative, support and development personnel.  Interpret, comprehend and apply complex material, data and instructions. Prepare, provide and convey diversified information which may be of a technical nature. Understand that the work has cyclical stress due to monthly goals and deadlines, and daily stress due to the impact the incumbent's decisions have on other people.  Participate in the preparation of the regional and company strategic and financial plans. Lead and develop the sales team to support sales strategies and deliver exceptional, profitable sales growth and results. Identify and build relationships within the regional office to help produce future leaders  Maintain and expand customer base by coaching Regional Sales Representatives; build and maintain rapport with key customers; identify new customer and market opportunities.  Develop a dynamic sales team through coaching, teaching, and mentoring for improved performance. Lead execution of a successful sales cycle and selling the Tioga core line of products/services. By focusing on customer needs, provide market analysis to improve product service positioning and increase effectiveness of the sales team. Proactively assume a role in developing & executing strategies to build an outstanding sales culture. Advise senior management team on sales directions, competitors and market trends. Develop strong ties with key customers and suppliers and be proactive in understanding the trends and issues likely to impact the market.  Execute day-to-day sales management, using a wide variety of techniques, from traditional sales philosophy’s to highly technical consultative sales techniques. Be able to present a compelling and effective case for Tioga’s project management, quality programs and supply chain capability.  Recommend and obtain buy-in and implement any changes needed to align the sales organization with our overall strategy. Drive improvements in the sales process and organization to increase the effectiveness and efficiency of team.  Conduct weekly sales team meetings to address concerns & acknowledge individual/ team accomplishments. Manage the sales forecast accurately. Track results and communicate to senior management regional results. Expected to meet or exceed assigned revenue, margin and target metric objectives within the assigned region.  Create and sustain effective collaborative partnerships with all other managers and departments. Interface with Regional Operations Managers, Accounting and Purchasing to provide support and to achieve the overall company profitable growth-oriented revenue goals and objectives.  Responsible for leading the company’s sales efforts in calls, presentations, demonstrations, proof of concepts, internal training, assessment services and proposals related to our products and services. This involves applying a consultative approach and ability to direct our support resources in analyzing the customer’s requirements and developing customized solutions to fit the need.  Prepare accurate and timely sales reports. Work with Senior Vice President of Sales to identify and implement new opportunities within major accounts. Drive and coordinate account planning sessions based on revenue potential.  Maintain a commitment to the company’s sales processes, values and business code of ethics. Assist in resolving any ongoing technical or commercial issues with the customer as appropriate and requested. Protect and increase a profitable revenue stream within current accounts.    Qualifications Requires knowledge typically gained through the attainment of a four-year degree.  5-10 years’ with demonstrated experience leading a sales team with a strong track record in the area of technical sales with experience calling on major accounts and selling high value complex solutions. Familiarity with distribution environment preferred.  Should be self-motivated, competitive and possess outstanding organizational and interpersonal skills with ability to assemble additional technical assistance as required.  Proficient and demonstrable experience in prospecting, qualifying, creating value-based demonstrations and presentations, ability to write and direct proposal preparation, experienced in objection handling and negotiating. Must be familiar with contractual language and provisions, terms and conditions.  Proficient computer skills (i.e. Microsoft Office Suite) with data analysis capability.  Strong verbal and written communication skills and excellent listening skills.  Compensation Compensation will be commensurate with experience. Tioga has a fully competitive compensation package including:  Incentive commission program Comprehensive health plans 401K with employer match Life and Disability Insurance  We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer

WHO WE ARE SwipeSense, a sister company to SC Johnson Professional, is a healthcare technology company on a mission to eliminate harm and waste in medicine. Hospitals use our platform to prevent infections, make greater use of their equipment, and improve the patient experience. We believe in the power of data and partner with hospital teams to provide them with insights to sustain positive behavior change and deliver a predictable patient journey. We value relentless experimentation, a locked-arms attitude, and a shared purpose to improve the future of healthcare. Our vision is to be the safety platform for hospitals with a growing number of applications such as hand-hygiene compliance monitoring, asset tracking, and nursing insights.  WHO WE NEED We are looking for an experienced enterprise sales professional, who has sold into multi-hospital systems as well as independent facilities, and has managed complex agreements with long sales cycles (6-12 months). You will leverage your industry expertise to build the sales engine for SwipeSense.  The ideal candidate has experience building a new territory and selling into new growth markets. Sales records include selling technology/software as a service to C-level executives. This is a dynamic leadership position that will be responsible for developing strategic plans and expanding our commercial efforts.  At SwipeSense, we build products that help save lives, and in turn, you are excited to imagine and integrate industry standard best-practices, introducing the value of new technology offerings/solutions for a safer healthcare experience. You’re a value-based leader who puts people and building relationships first.  PRIMARY ROLE You are responsible for building and managing a sales pipeline to help achieve business objectives, and which is aligned to fiscal year targets set by corporate leadership. You will guide sales relationships from prospect to signature, manage the team, and partner closely with marketing to craft strategies for growth and expansion.   KEY RESPONSIBILITIES Develop, close and manage business with major health care systems, hospital GPOs, and national/regional accounts; including and not limited to hospitals, ALFs, and SNFs. Generate ROI analysis for prospects, leveraging public and private data, to demonstrate financial impact created by SwipeSense Work closely with senior management to reach strategic goals and to provide input into the company’s healthcare strategy. Develop annual sales plan and team budget, analyzing the national market to determine customer needs, trends, and practices Generate and execute on strategies for expansion and growth within enterprise systems. Maintain, analyze, and present sales projections and data. Manage the sales and marketing team; providing coaching and development, and fostering an environment of collaboration. Lead channel partnerships including go-to-market processes. Support promotional campaigns in concert with the Director of Marketing. Manage the contracting process through pricing proposals, preparation of new customer contracts, renewal, expansion and cross sale agreements. Continuously educate the market on the impact of SwipeSense technology and maintain the organization’s position as an industry thought-leader.   QUALIFICATIONS 8+ years in leading healthcare sales initiatives as a seller and a leader Experience with long sales cycles and SAAS products in healthcare Enterprise sales experience Demonstrated ability to think strategically and lead in a complex environment Preferred experience selling a new technology to a market Strong empathy for customers and passion for revenue and growth Ability to engage and energize internal and external stakeholders Motivated by the opportunity to introduce new technologies to the market Bonus if you have: Experience operating in a start-up environment  Please note: position is full-time, at our Chicago headquarters. Must be local or willing to relocate. Candidates must be a US Citizen, or a foreign citizen with a required work visa.

Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges  The future is what you make it.  When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.  That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.  Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.  Are you ready to help us make the future?  We don’t just sell things. We offer solutions to tomorrow’s challenges.  Our sales approach begins by identifying customer demands before they become challenges. We’re committed to delivering customer success through our comprehensive expertise in software and technology  The Texas Channel Sales Rep will represent Honeywell Fire’s portfolio of products and solutions (primarily Gamewell-FCI and Farenhyt) while managing all aspects of engagements with existing customers and prospecting for new customers. You will build relationships and understand your Customers business to provide appropriate products and solutions. You will define sales and growth strategy with key customers while aligning with critical sales business objectives. You will identify opportunities and build credibility with customers utilizing your product knowledge and technical expertise to deliver the value proposition. This is a remote position covering the Texas territory and will be expected to travel consistently within the territory.  Job Responsibilities Overall management of the Texas Territory developing and cultivating relationships with our ESD’s acting as the primary contact for the business. Consistently deliver against all revenue and profitability targets. Develop and execute annual business plans for each ESD with mutually agreed upon goals and actions, conduct quarterly business reviews, monitor and review monthly performance against plan/forecast and lead in-depth reviews to explore variances and needed corrective actions. Working with ESD key stakeholders to adopt our new products & breakthrough initiatives. Using market data and analytics, provide recommendations to leadership where opportunities exist to rationalize and / or add more ESD’s within the territory. Create, maintain, and develop relationships with engineers, Authorities Having Jurisdiction (AHJ’s), and end users across the territory. Provide Customer inputs regarding market conditions, competitor strategies and industry trends that drive real-time feedback into the business and contributes to the product development process by articulating Voice of Customer and User. Work with Honeywell Marketing Team to develop sales kits, product collateral, and MDF campaigns. Utilize Salesforce.com to effectively self-manage activities. Responsible for building and managing an active pipeline of new business opportunities. Support the SIOP process to validate forecasted demand, product mix and delivery requirements are communicated and understood by Honeywell. Negotiate pricing and contractual terms as required, in line with company guidelines. Professionally represent Honeywell Fire at all applicable tradeshows, meetings, trainings, industry associations, public events, etc. Act as a liaison between the local National Account branches and our National Account Manager to ensure alignment and execution on Honeywell Fire’s growth objectives. TRAVEL Willing to travel 80% of the time YOU MUST HAVE Minimum of 3 years of related fire alarm/life safety industry experience Valid Drivers license WE VALUE Bachelor’s degree Possess a high degree of self-motivation. Driven by metrics and produces results. Combines strong hunting and networking instincts with the ability to develop and manage long-term business relationships. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Can establish and build collaborative relationships and has the ability to influence cross functionally. Strategic mindset with the ability to execute tactically. Uses instincts as well as data to accurately assess business situations and industry trends; makes timely, appropriate recommendations and implements appropriate plans. Personal leadership style that desires to continuously improve. Accepts feedback, understands and maximizes strengths while working to develop weaknesses. Ability to develop learning/understanding of new products and technologies. Leads with a strong set of values. Maintains high ethical standards. Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to influence at varying levels across an organization. Ability to handle multiple priorities and navigate in a highly matrixed environment. Additional Information JOB ID: HRD140497 Category: Sales Location: 3019 Alvin Devane Blvd,Bldg 4, Suite 430,Austin,Texas,78741,United States Exempt Sales (HBT)  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

description: Creating Opportunities!! Being an SDR is one of THE most life changing jobs you will have. It will build you, break you, and mold you into a very important asset to ANY space in the Tech Sales World. There's a lot of money to be made as an SDR my friends.. Come join me at TIDAL!!

ACUMEN INTERNATIONAL is a global provider of Global Employment Outsourcing/Global Employer of Record/International PEO services. We enjoy a culture of mutual respect, growth and development, and professional attitude. We are looking for an ambitious and high-skilled Global Sales Manager. About the position: Responsible for sustaining the business with existing customers, the role will also include finding new clients, both end employers, and partners, and developing relationships with them. In addition, the sales manager will be responsible for selling new SaaS products. Key responsibilities: Communicate with clients, both end clients, and partners and create and sustain a long-term relationship with them. Discuss and understand the client requirements and fit the Acumen services to this requirement. Maintain customer relationships and ensure our customers are provided with accurate product knowledge and guidance on compliant global employee onboarding and offboarding. To provide customers with an efficient solution through aligning customers ‘needs with realities of a country labor law, requirements of an ideal buyer profile and Acumen’s profitability standards. Competently explain in-country legislation and practices. To work with figures and prepare accurate calculations from total employment cost simulations to commercial offers to clients; discuss proposals with clients and agree, and reciprocate terms in service agreements with in-country partners. Provide quotes to international clients. To work with legal documentation – to review service agreements, non-disclosure agreements, employment agreements, and other HR documents. Review client and partner contracts to ensure the terms and other information is correct before sending it to the client. Work with inbound leads to increase sales of the global PEO solution (95% vs outbound) To dive deep and acquire knowledge on Acumen’s products and provide value to customers based on this. Monitor and analyze business trends, and find new leads from channels, including outbound calling/ To assimilate complex data and information from disparate sources and process it to address a certain need or issue in the sales department. Participate in the new products – online SaaS calculator and country hiring guides – market launch and fulfill sales KPIs. To conduct reviews on the existent sales department strategies and weigh them against results to identify areas of improvement. To work together with other departments, such as finance, marketing, network, and customer support, to coordinate efforts and achieve the best results. To work closely with the customer care department when setting up new projects. Participate in monthly, quarterly, and annual reporting. To participate in other cross-departmental tasks. Requirements: University diploma in business, marketing, economics, or other closely related areas 1-3 years experience in international sales, experience in industries like recruiting, contractor or contingent workforce engagement, staffing, global PEO is required/a big plus. Advanced English verbal and writing skills. Proficient computer and digital skills including knowledge of the MS Office, advanced knowledge of Excel, experience in using CRM systems. Figures-oriented and detail-oriented. Good at multitasking and with strong project management skills. Self-starter who takes the initiative, capable of accountability Excellent communication skills, strong practical experience, and customer service skills Capacity to work with versatile complex data, both text and figures Ability to communicate with global clients in a global environment, both orally and in written form. Why Join Acumen International: Excellent compensation package Excellent opportunity to pursue an international career in a global company; Professional growth and development, training programs; Fantastic team

Growth Sales Team Lead - Brand, Agency, and Direct Response  Company Overview: TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. We have global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.  About the Team and Job: The Growth Business team is a scaled midmarket sales team that is part of TikTok's Global Business Solutions Division. The focus of this team is to connect TikTok's vibrant and growing creators and users with the brands and businesses they know and love. The Team Lead role is directly responsible for building relationships and helping clients drive business results on TikTok through consultation, education, and support. Ideal candidates will combine an exceptional ability to lead and grow a team of sales professionals, acts as a consultative sales player/coach, and deliver against sales quota. This person should have a passion for growing our business exponentially, an outstanding ability to set the strategic vision, and a willingness to develop and execute scaled processes. Success in this position requires strong sales and problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to thrive in a dynamic environment. We are looking to hire Team Leads within our direct sales team which separates focus on Brand, Direct Response, and Agency on our Growth sales teams. The position is full-time and located in our Austin, TX office.  Responsibilities: - Collaborate with our Growth leadership to establish a sales strategy and execution plan to achieve team goals. - Partner with cross-functional subject matter experts to develop, identify, and implement effective client advertising strategies. - Leverage data to identify consumer trends - spot wins, opportunities, and optimizations. - Become an expert in the assigned segments – collect and analyze competitive intelligence and market factors to anticipate client opportunities. - Consult clients on TikTok product offerings and demonstrate a deep understanding of product capabilities, measurement, attribution, and KPIs. - Coach Brand Partnership Managers in setting long and short-term goals, milestones, and tracking performance towards revenue objectives. - Guide Brand Partnership Managers on consultative, client-centric selling and best-in-class presentations, coach and develop for career growth. - Act as player-coach and support team to develop client leads, onboard, and cultivate long-term brand partner relationships.  Qualifications - 7-10 years of marketing, brand advertising, agency, sales, and/or e-commerce experience. - Direct people management experience.  Preferred Requirements - Expert knowledge of social media, mobile apps, digital/e-commerce, and performance marketing. - Knowledge of the self-serve ads platforms and biddable forms of digital ads buying. - Experience in Media/Publishing, Healthcare, CPG, Finserv, Entertainment/Hospitality, EDU. - Excellent verbal, written, and presentation skills. - Proven track record of reaching and exceeding sales goals. - Creative, outside-the-box thinker, and strategist. - A team player and collaborator, strong relationship-building, and leadership skills. - Passion for leading teams and career coaching. - Strong analytical and consultative selling skills to help identify and measure customer objectives. - Ability to thrive in a rapid, agile, and often ambiguous growth environment.  TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We believe individuals shouldn't be disadvantaged because of their background or identity, but instead should be considered based on their strengths and experience.  TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process. If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at accommodations@tiktok.com.

If the challenge of growing an organization to the next level delights you, and if building an effective sales team and growth engine sparks your passion, then Reekoh may the right place for you to build your career as we scale globally to become a market-leader in industrial integration.  Reekoh is an Industrial IoT Integration Cloud with global partnerships and sales channels. We are an emerging industry segment leader and well positioned at this time of digital disruption in the global industrial market. We’re looking for an experienced and entrepreneurial industrial B2B sales leader to join us and help execute our regional revenue strategy.  As our Sales Director in North America, you will hold the overall responsibility for the performance of all new revenue operations through channel partners and directly with enterprise customers, and for meeting revenue goals.  You will design and oversee go-to-market, business development, sales and relationship-building initiatives. With a solution-focused mindset, you’ll leverage your unique sales approach and our existing client and channel relationships to drive and scale revenue.  As part of our US operations launch team, you’ll require the ability to hunt your own deals and seek out opportunities, as well as be a champion for the sales teams in our channel partners and support them with everything they need to help close partner-led deals. As we bring on new partners, you’ll also play an important role in enabling them to become effective in positioning and selling Reekoh themselves.  This is your chance to make a major contribution to the global growth and scale of the next technology leader in the data integration market, and to lay the foundations for future team growth and success.   Some of your responsibilities will include Ultimate accountability for driving revenue growth in your region Develop and refine growth strategies with the global executive team, and monitor the revenue pipeline and leads, adjusting as necessary. Work closely with channel partner sales teams to compliment and support their sales efforts and collaborate with them on customer engagement to drive outcomes Present to key decision makers (CTO, CIO, Enterprise Architects, Technical Sales Consultants) around our core value proposition Grow industry knowledge through evangelism, gain visibility through attending and presenting at industry events, professionally representing the company to the industry Recruit, retain and develop a high-performance enterprise sales team Develop and implement robust sales management processes – pipeline, account planning, and proposals Define and establish effective sales approach, methods, activities, benchmarks and expectations that will ensure appropriate and accurate pipeline, close rate, controlled sales cycle and performance measurements Operate in a “lean start up” style environment of constant experimentation, learning and collaboration    Qualifications, skills & attributes  Relevant enterprise B2B software sales / solution selling experience Industrial technology/software (OT, SCADA, factory automation, etc) or Integration Platform (iPaaS) experience highly advantageous You have a genuine passion about technology, but your greatest passion is for selling Ability to work in an agile, start-up environment where not everything you need has already been done for you, and where change is the only constant Track record in over-achieving quota and handling all revenue generating processes, and accelerating business growth and profit expansion, particularly within channel / distribution focused businesses Experience in building, managing and leading digital B2B sales, partnerships, and channel teams Bachelor's degree or higher, preferably in Business/Finance/Marketing, but past experience will count the most ·      Excellent proposal writing and wordsmith skills with amazing attention to detail Strong communicator with a positive, optimistic mindset, and a willingness to be very hands on in the early stages   What we offer Competitive salary and bonus structure Work directly with global market leaders in their fields at a time of growth and disruption Establish yourself in the leading edge of disruptive technology companies that are driving and responding to rapid industry change We believe strongly in a sustainable work/life balance and flexibility - we’re all adults here and it’s about outcome so tell us what you need to make it work for you   Location & Travel We expect that you live in and/or be very accessible to the Midwest region, with an ability to travel as required.

URGENT NEW SENIOR FINTECH SALES/ACCOUNT MANAGEMENT ROLE! NYC, Chicago or remote for rock star.  One of my front to back investment technology SaaS clients is looking for a Senior Sell-Side Strategic Account Manager, aka VP of Sell Side Account Management.  Leveraging their experience with both buy-side and sell-side, the Account Manager will generate sales leads and connectivity revenue through the executing broker channel, while at the same time broadening and improving their relationships with the existing broker community in the US, including billing, certification, support coordination, etc.  - Overseeing a defined segment of existing OEMS broker relationships including the renegotiation of contracts and associated commercials.  - Build relationships with key brokers and OTD teams to generate sales leads covering both Platform and OEMS connectivity.  - Meet regularly with broker client base to review information specific to mutual clients and their overall relationship with the firm.  - Work closely with other departments and partners to address broker issues, concerns, and opportunities, including but not limited to FIX onboarding, Marketing, and Buy-side account management teams.   Requirements:  - Experience in relationship/account management for large, multi-faceted organizations  - Ability to navigate large customer organizations to identify key stakeholders  - Customer service focus, with the goal of building and maintaining brand reputation  - Ability to serve as a brand representative in facilitating business between our external partners and mutual clients  - Most notably: the ability to synthesize all of the above in generating leads from third party partners

jobTitle: Vice President of Sales, Wholesale Apparel - Special Market Accounts
description: Directly responsible for sales and profit performance by brand. Responsible to achieve sales and margin goals Handle all open to buy, gross margin analysis and markdowns. Develop account specific product initiatives to drive profitable sales. Partner with President of Sales to develop sales budgets by account. Successfully present and negotiate financial plans that secure budget Manage annual marketing spend against budget. Manage ATS and secure reorders and additional product opportunities with accounts Build and manage annual promotional calendar in coordination with Sales and Planning teams. Manage quarterly and seasonal markdown budget. Solicit and open new accounts Collaborate and partner to build strong relationships with senior management at key accounts to grow the business. Develop new product ideas/ concepts to fill white space within the department store channel. Stay abreast of emerging trends/ monitor changing landscape at retail and propose new strategies accordingly. Develop and present strategies to improve shippable. Internal relationships include planning, design, Finance, retail development, production, allocations and marketing (at all levels including senior management) to exchange information to effectively manage the brand. Regular communication and collaboration with external customers to include buyers, planners and senior management (DMM) at key accounts in order to maximize opportunities, negotiate and grow the business.  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Minimum of 10 years of related sales and management experience Wholesale department store experience required Management of large business in excess of $20M Must have strong computer skills including excel, power point Knowledge of RLM and Retail Math Exceptional presentation skills to senior level executives and large groups Strong analytical, selling and negotiation skills

description: Innovate to solve the world's most important challenges  The future is what you make it.  When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.  That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.  Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.  Are you ready to help us make the future?  We don’t just sell things. We offer solutions to tomorrow’s challenges.  Our sales approach begins by identifying customer demands before they become challenges. We’re committed to delivering customer success through our comprehensive expertise in software and technology  The Texas Channel Sales Rep will represent Honeywell Fire’s portfolio of products and solutions (primarily Gamewell-FCI and Farenhyt) while managing all aspects of engagements with existing customers and prospecting for new customers. You will build relationships and understand your Customers business to provide appropriate products and solutions. You will define sales and growth strategy with key customers while aligning with critical sales business objectives. You will identify opportunities and build credibility with customers utilizing your product knowledge and technical expertise to deliver the value proposition. This is a remote position covering the Texas territory and will be expected to travel consistently within the territory.  Job Responsibilities Overall management of the Texas Territory developing and cultivating relationships with our ESD’s acting as the primary contact for the business. Consistently deliver against all revenue and profitability targets. Develop and execute annual business plans for each ESD with mutually agreed upon goals and actions, conduct quarterly business reviews, monitor and review monthly performance against plan/forecast and lead in-depth reviews to explore variances and needed corrective actions. Working with ESD key stakeholders to adopt our new products & breakthrough initiatives. Using market data and analytics, provide recommendations to leadership where opportunities exist to rationalize and / or add more ESD’s within the territory. Create, maintain, and develop relationships with engineers, Authorities Having Jurisdiction (AHJ’s), and end users across the territory. Provide Customer inputs regarding market conditions, competitor strategies and industry trends that drive real-time feedback into the business and contributes to the product development process by articulating Voice of Customer and User. Work with Honeywell Marketing Team to develop sales kits, product collateral, and MDF campaigns. Utilize Salesforce.com to effectively self-manage activities. Responsible for building and managing an active pipeline of new business opportunities. Support the SIOP process to validate forecasted demand, product mix and delivery requirements are communicated and understood by Honeywell. Negotiate pricing and contractual terms as required, in line with company guidelines. Professionally represent Honeywell Fire at all applicable tradeshows, meetings, trainings, industry associations, public events, etc. Act as a liaison between the local National Account branches and our National Account Manager to ensure alignment and execution on Honeywell Fire’s growth objectives. TRAVEL Willing to travel 80% of the time YOU MUST HAVE Minimum of 3 years of related fire alarm/life safety industry experience Valid Drivers license WE VALUE Bachelor’s degree Possess a high degree of self-motivation. Driven by metrics and produces results. Combines strong hunting and networking instincts with the ability to develop and manage long-term business relationships. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Can establish and build collaborative relationships and has the ability to influence cross functionally. Strategic mindset with the ability to execute tactically. Uses instincts as well as data to accurately assess business situations and industry trends; makes timely, appropriate recommendations and implements appropriate plans. Personal leadership style that desires to continuously improve. Accepts feedback, understands and maximizes strengths while working to develop weaknesses. Ability to develop learning/understanding of new products and technologies. Leads with a strong set of values. Maintains high ethical standards. Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to influence at varying levels across an organization. Ability to handle multiple priorities and navigate in a highly matrixed environment. Additional Information JOB ID: HRD140497 Category: Sales Location: 3019 Alvin Devane Blvd,Bldg 4, Suite 430,Austin,Texas,78741,United States Exempt Sales (HBT)  Honeywell is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status.

jobTitle: Vice President of Sales and Marketing
description: Vice President of Sales & Marketing Cadenza Innovation, Inc. is currently seeking a VP of Sales & Marketing to lead the commercialization of Cadenza lithium-ion battery technology and battery products. Cadenza was founded by a high-profile battery industry team, including our CEO, CTO and COO who together have a track record of creating and commercializing ground-breaking technologies and building high performing teams to serve global markets.  Based at our headquarters in Danbury, CT, just an hour from NYC, this highly visibility role will challenge you both technically and creatively while providing an opportunity to work across several business disciplines. Cadenza offers an excellent opportunity to help grow our innovative and exciting startup company into a meaningful player in the global energy transition.  Responsibilities: Drive our sales and customer relationships - both from an executive outward facing and internal leadership prospective Develop new and maintain existing business accounts Manage our product, communication, and branding activities Analyze market trends and competitor activity and product offerings Serve as customer voice inside of Cadenza to champion commercial opportunities Quickly gain thorough knowledge of Cadenza Innovation Inc. product lines, technology, and competitive advantages and through market intelligence help shape product direction Represent Cadenza’s current product line, and influence the creation of new product lines through customer feedback and market understanding Effectively manage and grow sales team of both internal and external resources Modify existing and create new marketing materials Work with executive team, finance, operations, and engineering to create profitable business models Daily, weekly, and monthly sales updates   Qualifications: BS in Engineering/ Science/ Marketing is preferred MS or MBA highly desirable Superior management skills, with the ability to inspire and lead a cross functional team Proven sales and marketing track record Excellent verbal communication skills, with the ability to listen and translate customer need into a sales action strategy. Strong writing acumen with the ability to capture and influence through the written word Emotionally intelligent, able to develop relations with target customers through online or virtual mediums. Experience in Lithium-ion batteries, energy storage or renewable energy highly desired  Cadenza Innovation, Inc. is an emerging energy storage company answering the call for safer, longer-lasting lithium-ion batteries. With our management team of recognized authorities in the battery industry we have dramatically improved quality and safety while delivering performance levels never previously seen in the industry. Our focus is to commercialize these innovative technologies and drive improvements that enable the success of lithium-ion batteries powering innovative, economical, and environmentally sound products, including utility grid storage and automotive applications.  We offer an attractive compensation and benefits package, an entrepreneurial environment, and the opportunity for employees to enhance their careers and achieve greater levels of responsibility as the company grows.  Position is based out of the company’s Danbury, CT headquarters office near Exits 1 and 2 of I-84. Candidate must be able to easily commute to Danbury daily from CT or eastern New York state and be available for occasional travel to global business partners as well as state and federal agencies within the United States.  Cadenza Innovation, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Job Type: Full-time / Not Remote

JOBTITLE: VP OF SALES   MAYAFAB is one of the biggest and best Chinese textile mill with showroom located in High Point ,North Carolina. we have been supplying high quality fabrics to fabric distributors and home furnishing manufacturers around the world since 1990. with thousands of fabric designs available for contract and home furnishing industries, MAYAFAB has established sound business relationships with many fabric distributors, furniture manufacturers, design firms and hotel groups in US .   Our website: www.mayafab.com  We are currently seeking experienced, motivated Vice president of sales  to manage the sales team cross US to achieve the sales goal .  Vice president of sales is responsible for: Promote company products and services Develop plans and strategies Manage sales teams Organize and maintain sales operations Manage sales budget Take charge of recruiting and hiring sales staff Motivate the sales team to achieve workplace goals Develop sales training programs Monitor market and competitor activity Improve customer satisfaction by anticipating consumer needs Identify where improvements can be made and develop success-driven plans Manage detailed sales expectations and plan accordingly Work closely with the marketing department Monitor customer activity Create sales reports Communicate and foster relationships with clients  Requirements Recent and rich experience in managing sales team to achieve the goal successfully. Good resource and relationship with key customers in textile industry. Sincere commitment to sales performance. An independent, self-sufficient sales management professional who can identify opportunities and has the drive to pursue them. An understanding of the unique needs of home textile industry and needs of customers. Appreciation for our product and enthusiasm in making recommendations to customers Excellent listening and communication skills. Professional demeanor and outgoing personality Ability to function in a multicultural environment  Desired qualifications: Bachelor degree with major in Marketing, Business Administration or related major. At least 5 years experience in Textile sales managment or related position.  Location Preference : NC

We have been providing successful Communication solutions to Contact Center organizations of every type and size across the world for nearly two decades. With customers across the USA, Europe, and Australia, and certified by leading technology providers, Geomant is a well-established, innovative Software Developer and Systems Integrator specializing in Microsoft and Avaya technologies.  We’re looking for a Territory Sales Representative in our North American Region. The ideal candidate has managed or supervised Call Center or Contact Center agents and has also sold in a B2B environment. Competitive base salary plus commission and bonus, full benefits. Remote/Work From Home with some travel.  Your Responsibilities will include: ·      selling software, cloud applications, and professional services to new accounts in the contact center industry ·      full sales cycle management from prospecting through closure. ·      finding, qualifying, and developing leads to maintain a steady pipeline of opportunities in all stages of development ·      investigating and understanding the Customer’s business objectives in order to execute a successful sales strategy ·      establishing and maintaining a cooperative network of Reseller and Referral Partners ·      developing effective relationships with End User coaches, influencers, and decision-makers across multiple departments ·      building a convincing business case for investing in our solution. ·      delivering an engaging and effective solution presentation including application demonstration ·      working within a cross-functional team to ensure a positive customer experience both pre and post-sale ·      maintaining accurate revenue forecast ·      utilizing a CRM system to thoroughly document all customer interactions and sales plans  You are a good candidate if you have: ·      2+ years of selling experience with a successful track record ·      excellent questioning, listening, and presentation skills, at all levels of the customer organization. ·      the ability to work remotely and manage time effectively ·      technical aptitude ·      the willingness to be trained and work under the close guidance of the Sales Director for an initial period ·      strong verbal and written communication skills, professional appearance, and are well organized ·      availability to travel approximately 20%, post-covid.  You are an ideal candidate if you: ·      have a Contact Center or Call Center background, either selling to or working in ·      successfully completed a formal sales training program ·      have Spanish language skills ·      are in the Atlanta metro area  Listen to our colleagues. They say it’s good to work for Geomant because ·      “You feel part of a team. It is very supportive and everyone believes in doing what is right for the customer.” ·      “We are trusted to work remotely, there's a culture of “do what you need to do”. It makes work-life balance attainable rather than just a buzzword.” ·      “It’s easy to find a niche you enjoy here. There’s a wide variety of jobs to do.” ·      “At Geomant, I am proud to say that I trust the engineers, install team and help desk to deliver valuable products and great customer service.” ·      “We have an International working culture without the “multinational company” attitude.“ ·      “We form a camaraderie with the folks on the inside of our customer’s companies, and sometimes it’s just fun.” ·      “Management has a direct relationship with all of us”

Collaborate with Innovative 3Mers Around the World Choosing where to start and grow your career has a major impact on your professional and personal life, so it’s equally important you know that the company that you choose to work at, and its leaders, will support and guide you. With a diversity of people, global locations, technologies and products, 3M is a place where you can collaborate with 96,000 other curious, creative 3Mers.  “At 3M, we excel by combining our talents while leveraging creative and curious minds. This is most impactful when we center our objective at improving the customer experience. It’s a privilege to work for such a great company, with amazing people, and leadership that cultivates a growth-mindset.” – Eric Hammes, executive vice president of Enterprise Operations at 3M  This position provides an opportunity to transition from other private, public, government or military environments to a 3M career.  The Impact You’ll Make in this Role The Inside Sales Representative will establish and maintain customer relationships, drive sales growth through virtual sales, up sell, and cross sell strategically aligned products within focused markets. This will be accomplished by utilizing detailed product and market knowledge in order to aid distribution partners and customers. This sales representative will be accountable to achieve monthly phone and activity goals while driving sales pipeline health and exceeding sales forecast through customer interactions, business plan creation and execution, and teaming with field sales representatives when appropriate.  As an Inside Sales Rep, you will have the opportunity to tap into your curiosity and collaborate with some of the most innovative and diverse people around the world. Here, you will make an impact by:  Driving 3M sales to assigned distribution in managed territories. Establishing and maintaining customer relationships through a comprehensive understanding of the customer’s business/sales models to help manage and influence business growth. Introducing new products, and communicating promotions to relevant customers and prospects Maintaining and updating a working sales plan with strategies and tactics to achieve annual sales forecasts Demonstrating a proficient level of procedural and technical product knowledge to identify products that meet customer needs Working to attain sales quota, sales quality, and sales productivity metrics Sharing best practices with the team to promote a positive team environment Proficiently identifying market trends and account needs in order to react to market activity and reach favorable sales goals  Your Skills and Expertise To set you up for success in this role from day one, 3M requires (at a minimum) the following qualifications:  Bachelor’s Degree (completed and verified prior to start) from an accredited institution   Additional qualifications that could help you succeed even further in this role include:  One (1) or more years of outside sales and/or inside sales experience Account management experience Previous experience in Oral Care/Dental Industry, or Personal Safety Products/Industry is preferred Salesforce.com experience is desired Skills include solution selling, listening skills, gain commitment Ability to work effectively in a sales team environment - Creative problem-solving abilities are preferred  Ability to adapt to a rapidly changing work environment Strong organizational skills, with the ability to stay on tasks and maintain high productivity levels while working both in the office and remotely  Location:  Positions will be performed remotely within the continental US and are not located at the corporate campus.  Travel: No Travel is anticipated or will be required Relocation Assistance: Is Not Authorized  Must be legally authorized to work in country of employment without sponsorship for employment visa status (e.g., H1B status).  Supporting Your Well-being  3M offers many programs to help you live your best life – both physically and financially. To ensure competitive pay and benefits, 3M regularly benchmarks with other companies that are comparable in size and scope.   Resources for You  For more details on what happens before, during and after the interview process, check out the Insights for Candidates page at 3M.com/careers.   Learn more about 3M’s creative solutions to the world’s problems at www.3M.com or on Twitter @3M.  Responsibilities of this position include that corporate policies, procedures and security standards are complied with while performing assigned duties.  Pay & Benefits Overview: https://www.3m.com/3M/en_US/careers-us/working-at-3m/benefits/  3M is an equal opportunity employer.  3M  will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.  Please note: your application may not be considered if you do not provide your education and work history, either by: 1) uploading a resume, or 2) entering the information into the application fields directly.  3M Global Terms of Use and Privacy Statement  Carefully read these Terms of Use before using this website. Your access to and use of this website and application for a job at 3M are conditioned on your acceptance and compliance with these terms.  Please access the linked document by clicking here, select the country where you are applying for employment, and review. Before submitting your application you will be asked to confirm your agreement with the terms.

description: HemoSonics, LLC is seeking a Clinical Sales Specialist based in the TN/AL/GA territory who will be responsible for implementing the Quantra in clinical areas of new accounts and departments, and expanding the utilization of the Quantra in existing accounts and departments.  Key Attributes of the Successful Candidate: Knowledge of perioperative bleeding management. Excellent communication, effective time-management and relationship-building skills. Strong technical/clinical aptitude to understand and train customers and users on products (including running the Quantra solution and understanding application of results). Team player with strong desire to see the group succeed.  Key Responsibilities: In collaboration with other HemoSonics personnel, ensure the successful implementation of Quantra into initial and expanded clinical settings. Identify expansion opportunities and increase product usage within new and existing accounts to enable HemoSonics to become the standard of care for bleeding management. Ensure customers can independently, safely and efficiently operate HemoSonics equipment and related disposables through clinical education and training. Identify and develop key accounts/key opinion leaders/product champions to serve as “reference sites” for potential new customers and/or conferences. Collaborate with Sales and Clinical Affairs for development activities. Provide customer feedback to Sales and Marketing regarding product enhancements, service and policies. Increase professional and clinical knowledge/competency by attending educational workshops, reviewing professional publications, establishing personal networks & participating in professional societies. Support clinical demonstrations/evaluations and tradeshows/conferences as needed. Perform all assigned administrative responsibilities (monthly reports, conference summaries, expense reports, etc.). Achieve revenue and expense goals. Work collaboratively with HemoSonics personnel as requested on special projects.  Education and Experience Required: Bachelor’s Degree in related discipline (Life Sciences, Nursing, Perfusion) 2 - 5 years of industry experience, preferably in critical care, diagnostics or surgery Experience in execution of clinical education and training programs Clinical experience in critical care areas of the hospital/OR, with emphasis on coagulation and hemostasis preferred Professional credentialing (RN, CCP, PA, etc.) preferred  This position will be home-based in TN/AL/GA and will require 60-75% domestic travel. HemoSonics requires employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or meet the requirements for a medical or religious exemption.  HemoSonics, LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

jobTitle: Shopping Sales Specialist, Large Customer Sales
description: Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: New York, NY, USA; Atlanta, GA, USA; Cambridge, MA, USA; Chicago, IL, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; Ann Arbor, MI, USA.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience. 5 years of experience in performance digital marketing. Experience with managing a book of business and sales pipeline.  Preferred qualifications: Experience with pitching digital marketing and measurement solutions. Experience in performance digital marketing, working with retailers and/or manufacturers using Google Shopping Ad products, Google Ads, and Merchant Center. Understanding of performance digital marketing across planning, buying, and optimization. Ability to deliver insights from data that creates business value and drives client action. Ability to provide thought leadership and effectively lead discussions at C-level/Director level.  About The Job  Businesses that partner with Google come in all shapes, sizes and market caps, and no one Google advertising solution works for all. Your knowledge of online media combined with your communication skills and analytical abilities shapes how new and existing business grow. Using your influencing and relationship-building skills, you provide Google-caliber client service, research and market analysis. You anticipate how decisions are made, persistently explore and uncover the business needs of Google's key clients and understand how our range of product offerings can grow their business. Working with them, you set the vision and the strategy for how their advertising can reach thousands of users.  Our Shopping Ad solutions build delightful experiences that bring users, retailers, and manufacturers together throughout the shopping journey whether they’re at home, on the go, or in the store.  In this role, you will have an opportunity to work on a wide spectrum of initiatives from collaborating with our Go-to-Market team on strategy, providing market feedback on product features, to consulting Google customers on our solutions that will help them improve performance and meet business objectives. You'll be a part of introducing products in Shopping that help improve user experience and shape modern retail. We care about our people and foster a culture of respect and inclusion within our team and cross-functional working groups. One key element of this is people development to ensure that everyone has room to grow and get the career guidance they need to get to the next step.  Our Large Customer Sales teams partner closely with many of the world’s biggest advertisers and agencies to develop digital solutions that build businesses and brands. We enjoy a bird’s eye view on the massive transformation occurring as advertising shifts to mobile and online platforms. We're uniquely situated to help shape how companies grow their businesses in the digital age. We advise clients on Google's broad range of products across search, video and mobile to help them connect instantly and seamlessly with their audiences.  Responsibilities  Develop holistic shopping strategies for retailers that align to customer business objectives and supercharge Google Shopping performance for clients. Articulate features and value proposition of shopping solutions including product listings, local, and showcase ads, as well as co-op and merchandising solutions to drive adoption. Manage Shopping business growth by forecasting your book of business, maintaining business and product implementation pipelines. Communicate client and market updates to Sales and Go-To-Market Leadership. Partner closely with many internal stakeholders across shopping.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

Responsible for supporting agency globalization strategy to meet commercial objectives with key agency and airline partners. Role has sales development responsibilities for American Express TLS contracting and performance, worth nearly $1B in revenue annually.  Summary Of Responsibilities (not Comprehensive Of All Tasks) Analyzes and summarizes global market and account performance using a variety of data sources including MIDT, ARC, DDS, and RPAD Works closely with Agency / Corporate Sales Development, Revenue Management, Sales Performance, Field Sales, and agency accounts to understand competitive environment / performance drivers Supports efforts with future partners to implement new strategies toward joint program implementation Oversees projects to integrate alliance partners into contracting tools / technology and agency incentive agreements Supports several Globalization efforts with cross commercial teams to improve worldwide contracting, technology, coordination and partner relationships Prepares internal communications including ad hoc reports, executive summaries, and formal presentations Embraces diverse people, thinking and styles Consistently makes safety and security, of self and others, the priority 3 years equivalent work experience is required Solution-oriented, multi-task capable and have demonstrated the ability to work well with others in a fast-paced time-sensitive environment Demonstrates initiative and self-directs work Possess strong analytical, sound organizational and planning skills, excellent verbal and written communication skills, strong interpersonal skills and a proven ability to make sound business decisions Highly proficient PC skills including advanced level knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word and PowerPoint Where permitted by applicable law, must have received or be willing to receive the COVID-19 vaccine by date of hire to be considered for U.S.-based job, if not currently employed by Delta Air Lines, Inc. Graduate degree in a business discipline and 5 years equivalent work experience Experience working with Delta and partner colleagues located in INTL regions General knowledge of Delta's markets and competitive market position, sales strategies, programs, processes, tools and infrastructure is highly desirable Travel industry sales experience, agency or corporate contracting, building incentive programs, working with field sellers, and executing cross commercial projects are a plus SAS, Tableau, Hyperion, and GSIS skills, along with working knowledge of RPAD and MIDT tables Experience with independently preparing analytical PowerPoint presentations

jobTitle: Sales Representative I, Spine- Charlotte, NC
description: Careers that Change Lives  Bring your talents to an industry leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions – we’re a market leader and growing every day. You can be proud to sell medical technologies that are rooted in our long history of mission-driven innovation. Our expanding portfolio delivers measurable clinical and economic value – and opens doors. You will be empowered to shape your own career. We support your growth with the training, mentorship, and guidance you need to own your future success. Together, we can transform healthcare.  Join us for a career in sales that changes lives.  Business Description:  Cranial and Spinal Technologies (CST) is redefining cranial and spinal procedures to reduce variability and improve outcomes with the goal of restoring long-term quality of life for more patients. We are the first company to offer an integrated solution that includes artificial intelligence-driven surgical planning, personalized spinal implants, and robotic-assisted surgical delivery to make patient care more customized.  CST is the market leader in spinal implants, robotics, and navigation. Our integrated operating unit is comprised 3 global businesses, Spine and Biologics, Enabling Technologies and China Cranial, Spinal Orthopedic Technologies.  This role will support our Spine and Biologics business.  Click here to learn more about our full procedural solutions for spine surgery and  Click here to learn more about our bone grafting solutions for spinal fusion.  A Day in the Life:  At Medtronic, the Sales Representative I, Spine is responsible for soliciting orders, selling Medtronic Spinal products assigned and representing the company in accordance with its policies and in the area assigned; for maintaining an awareness of local competitive conditions. This position will work in tandem with Spine Sales Representatives II and will have territory coverage responsibility and limited sales responsibility. Allocation guideline for core responsibilities include: Inventory Management, Case Coverage, and Selling (outside the operating room).  This is a field based role.  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned: Maintain, manage and track Consignments and Loaner inventory. Keep non usage and flight usage to a minimum level. Territory case coverage. Manage accounts in assigned territory. Prepare and submit call reports as required by the District Sales Manager. Maintain up-to-date customer record books and other records in accordance with District Sales Manager’s instructions. Aggressively solicit orders from present and prospective customers for the products assigned. Aggressively seek new customers and formulate and follow plans for such action as directed by the District Sales Manager. Resolve customer complaints in accordance with Medtronic Spinal policies and advise District Sales Manager and Medtronic Spinal promptly of any situation beyond scope of authority. Recommend the additions of new products and the modification or deletion of present products to the line as appropriate. Successful completion of all required product and sales related training curriculum. Meet or exceed sales quota and total company market share in assigned territory. Attend and participate in sales meetings, training programs and conventions as directed. Identify selling opportunities and work closely with the sales representative to increase sales in their respective accounts. Comply with all Medtronic Spinal policies. Work weekends, evenings, and Holidays as required on an emergency basis. We seek out and hire a diverse workforce at every level: We need fresh ideas and inclusive insights to continue to be an innovative industry leader —that’s why we make it a point to seek out, attract and develop employees who are patient-centric, passionate, and who represent the same wide variety of life experiences as our patients.  To learn more about Inclusion & Diversity at Medtronic Click Here  Must Have: Minimum Requirements  To be considered for this role, please ensure the minimum requirements are evident on your resume . High School Diploma or GED AND a minimum of 4 years of sales experience including 2 years of medical sales; or High School Diploma or GED AND 2 years of Medtronic RTG Clinical Specialist experience plus 2 years of prior clinical/ medical sales experience; or Associate’s Degree AND a minimum of 2 years of sales experience; or Associate’s Degree AND 1 year of Medtronic RTG Clinical Specialist experience; or Bachelor’s degree Nice to Have Ability to interact effectively with a wide range of people and personalities Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to work in an operating room setting Ability to accommodate a flexible work schedule Ortho, Spine or O.R. experience strongly preferred About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile Required to interact with a computer for extended periods of time, and communicate with peers and co-workers Regularly required to talk or hear Occasionally required to sit and reach with hands and arms Regularly required to stand; walk and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools , or controls Must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds Specific vision abilities required by this job involve normal vision Ability to travel Must have a valid driver's license and active vehicle insurance policy. In addition, your driving record will be reviewed and will be considered as part of your application. The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this position, but they are not an exhaustive list of all the required responsibilities and skills of this position.  The physical demands described within the Day in the Life section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  Additional Information Posting Date: Oct 7, 2021 Travel: No

SHOWA, a 100% wholly owned Japanese glove manufacturer, globally positioned, now seeks to appoint a Territory Sales Manager based in Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex to promote the brand and establish regional distribution to give full territory coverage in the Northern Texas, Oklahoma and Northern Louisiana markets. The role is to provide strong regional distribution coverage where extensive industrial end user knowledge is required, specifically within the aerospace, agriculture, food, and manufacturing sectors. As SHOWA wants to establish the market, relevant experience and a proven record of accomplishment is mandatory for this role. This position will also require strategically managed business development activities to achieve continuous market share and specifically target long-term business that provides continuity throughout the year.  Roles & Responsibilities · Manage, achieve and maintain budget · Proven track record of sales growth in the PPE sector · Good knowledge of the needs of regional and national distributors · Support and give training to the distribution network · Comprehensive recording with our Sales Force CRM program · Identify and secure major clients, both regional and national · Manage (key corporate) accounts, including the attainment of retention & growth targets · Proven ability to seek, identify and generate new business · Support distributor sales teams with joint end user visits · Introduce marketing promotions · Negotiate pricing and contract terms · Identify and visit key end users in multiple industrial markets · Maintain customer portfolio and good profitability  Education & competences · Bachelor’s degree graduate · 2+ years successful selling in the PPE sector · Successful experience and track record of sales growth selling through distribution · Strong communicating and negotiation skills · A positive and enthusiastic approach to account development and management · Good reporting skills · Organized and efficient · Ability and willingness to travel  · Ideally located in the Dallas/Fort Worth Metroplex  What can we offer you? · Gain access to one of the most fun, ambitious groups of people · Opportunity to further expand our current customer portfolio · Competitive salary · Bonus on achievements of KPI’s · Car Allowance

About Health Here  At Health Here, we believe that the patient-provider relationship is the essence of healthcare. However, if you’ve been to the doctor lately, we bet you have been frustrated by redundant paperwork, confusing bills, and long waits. We empower medical practices to turn this paradigm on its head with our Clinic Q platform. Providers use Clinic Q to streamline intake, accelerate patient payments, and offer new payment models. We’ve rolled out Clinic Q to hundreds of surgical specialists across the country...and we’re just getting started.   The SDR Role   The Sales Development Representative (SDR) is the tip-of-the-spear for generating new business at Health Here. You will be the “first impression” of the Health Here brand and will be counted on to expand top-of-funnel activity, generate new leads, and respond to inbound opportunities. You will hone your skills as a salesperson in a collaborative, fast-paced environment and have a significant impact on the trajectory of the company.   The role is based in Nashville, TN, but remote candidates will be considered on a case-by-case basis.  Responsibilities  Identify and qualify new sales opportunities Drive meeting and demo set-up with new sales opportunities  Support Health Here Sales Executives in introductory meetings and demos Represent Health Here at industry conferences Effectively communicate the Health Here value proposition in a variety of formats (phone, email, in-person, and conferences) Collaborate and share prospect feedback with the product team to identify new offerings to increase the value of Clinic Q Diligently update Pipedrive, our CRM, so we can learn more about our business and customers  Requirements  Strong desire to develop as a sales professional 1-3 years of sales experience preferred, with experience in technology companies and/or healthcare industry a plus Curious, self-starter interested in becoming an expert on the healthcare industry specifically healthcare technology and payments Excellent verbal and written communicator Comfortable working on a small team in a dynamic environment Committed to a data-driven sales process Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience
