description: We’re HackNotice – We introduced the world’s first company-wide threat intelligence platform, which helps organizations build a culture of security by using dark-web insights to improve employee security habits.  We are currently hiring Inside Sales Representatives to drive new business in a closing role and build out a sales territory. If you’ve had previous experience selling software-as- a-service, or are a strong, confident communicator, this would be a great way to build a career in sales in one of the fastest growing industries.  Primary Responsibilities Include: Driving conversations with security decision makers through demos, proofs-of-concept, and negotiations, to close Building a book of business in a territory by leveraging key wins to create similar deals Working with marketing and business development to qualify opportunities and hone go-to-market messaging  Some of the Qualities We’re Looking For: Previous experience in a closing role (Software-as-a-service) Previous experience building a new business territory Familiarity with CRM Software (particularly Salesforce) Coachable, well-rounded personality Self-starter Relationship builder  This role is key to continuing our explosive growth, and we want to add great people to our team. There’s no better time to join.  Looking forward to hearing from you!

Prime Panel Sales Manager  Benefits and Perks: Competitive salary and bonus structure 401K with employer match Company car Travel expenses reimbursed  Qualifications / Education: Preferred Bachelor of Business Management, Sales or Marketing. Preferred outside sales experience Maintain and grow existing accounts assigned to the Prime Panels division Demonstrated ability close deals while meeting established sales quotas. Professional demeanor, selling style, and appearance, with high level of integrity and work ethic. Solid experience in opportunity qualification, pre-visit planning, account development, & time / territory management. Strong knowledge of sales principles and have problem identification and objection resolution skills. Able to build and maintain lasting relationships with customers. Self-motivated, with high energy and an engaging level of enthusiasm, with the ability to work individually, and as part of a team. Able to manage multiple priorities, be self-motivated and highly organized, able to work independently and adaptable to a diverse and demanding environment. Proficient in MS Office Suite, and ability to navigate the web and construction data reports. Must possess a valid driver’s license, and a passport is desirable with frequent travel (as much as 50%) is required, often up to several hours of driving per day.  Duties and Responsibilities: Understand the complete Prime Panel business and manage existing customers and budget. Responsible for achieving annual sales and profit goals. Develop and maintain full business pipeline of prospective projects through existing accounts. Provide timely reporting of accounts and territory activity to supervisor. Always maintain professionalism, tact, diplomacy, and sensitivity to portray Nudo in a positive manner. Actively manage call schedule to adequately cover assigned territory in a time-efficient manner. Build and maintain ongoing awareness of new products and services & competitor activities Build relationships with inside client support and operations team  Candidate must pass a pre-employment background check, physical and drug screen. Nudo Products is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer.

Our Purpose  At Blippar our mission is to captivate, inspire and inform by producing breakthrough creative AR solutions using our own cutting edge technology. Blippar has been pioneering Augmented Reality for the last 10 years and our goal is big and unabashedly bold: to seamlessly and completely bridge the physical and digital worlds using our augmented reality technologies, making AR content creation easy and accessible to everyone.  Our team is creating ground- breaking experiences for the world’s biggest brands- showcasing how AR technology can transform packaging, global events, increase ecommerce conversion and elevate marketing campaigns with innovative and engaging content.  As our Sales Account Executive you will partner closely with current and prospective customers as a trusted advisor who deeply understands their unique challenges and goals. You will be a consultative solution seller with a passion for emerging technology and expertise in providing cutting-edge marketing solutions to multi-channel marketers.  We are a team that believes in enjoying what you do, having fun and bringing the world better experiences through AR.   Location This role is based in the US Remote (East Coast)  Role  Blippar is seeking an Account Executive who is personable, self-driven and passionate about AR. You will own the day to day execution of the sales strategy, identifying and building relationships with key influencers and decision makers within the executive teams of our customers, along with internal partners and cross-functional teams to create and present compelling AR solutions that meet and exceed customer expectations. You will generate a pipeline that leads to closed revenue and quota attainment partnering with internal resources in order to drive additional value and expertise. Most of all, you’re passionate about helping customers resolve challenges and achieving their short and long term business goals.  What You'll Be Doing  The development of existing client accounts and outreach to / prospecting of new clients, working collaboratively alongside our existing client teams   Effectively defining and scoping prospective customer requirements and objectives  The creation and delivery of proposals and client pitches for new projects Coordinate all customer touch points with your Customer Success Manager counterpart within your book of business Act as an advocate for customers, internally conveying their customer-specific needs across the organization to ensure proper alignment and prioritization of resources Create, implement and own a new business pipeline across your region  Build client relationships across all levels of the organization Grow and proliferate the Blippar’s Studio business across multiple lines of product and tools Pipeline development through a combination of outreach email campaigns and market sector knowledge/intelligence Forge a strong ongoing relationship with partners as part of the deal-management lifecycle Collaborate closely with key internal stakeholders including the Partnership, Marketing and Engineering teams Manage customer expectations and contribute to a high level of customer satisfaction Develop and maintain a deep knowledge of the company's products and solutions Maintain knowledge of competitors' products to determine the characteristics benefits and deficiencies of the products as well as market success  What We Are Looking For  3-5 years in sales with escalating experience selling cutting edge products in a fast-paced environment to Brands and Agencies (mobile, social, emerging tech, AR experience a PLUS) Strong ambition combined with great teaming skills Results driven and acute attention to detail Self starter who forms strong relationships, assesses opportunities, develops informed solutions and delivers measurable results. Work cross functionally to collaborate on broad organisational initiatives for top tier Global strategic accounts. Problem Solver with excellent organisation skills Experience calling on a wide spectrum of accounts in territory Maintain active engagement with new and existing leads through creative follow-up communications designed to increase customer interest Identify and close quick wins while managing longer, complex sales cycles Demonstrated ability to reach and influence customers and identify contacts that manage multiple budgets to grow client relationships Act as an advocate for customers, internally conveying their customer-specific needs across the organisation to ensure proper alignment and prioritisation of resources. Experienced in presenting relevant and innovative solutions based on industry knowledge. Collaborative team player who can work on their own and in a team environment Network of contacts within Fashion/ Retail or Luxury verticals  History of quota attainment and career longevity with a proven track record  Strong communication skills (written, verbal and presentation). Curiosity for both brand and performance based industry marketing solutions of past, present and future.  Passion for AR/Immersive technologies and innovation applied to marketing and storytelling    Equality, Diversity And Inclusion At Blippar  At Blippar, we believe that having a team of diverse backgrounds and voices working together will enable us to build innovative platforms that improve the way people communicate. Blippar embraces diversity in all of its forms and fosters an inclusive environment, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.   Blippar is committed to providing employment opportunities regardless of race, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy, childbirth and breastfeeding, age, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, or any otherprotected classification, in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

Position Purpose  Reporting to the Sales Director, is responsible for the overall customer satisfaction and serves as strategic contact with the customer. This position may either have lower-level sales functions reporting to her/him or have complete responsibility for a global foundational customer. Accountable for development and execution of strategic sales plans for foundational customers or market groups that support company growth and profitability objectives.  Essential Functions Leads and/or supervises account management, program managementand sales support functions in meeting customer and sales objectives. Accountable for strategic customer account or program plans, which may include task integration and schedules. Accountable for forecasting assigned accounts monthly and yearly demand. Responsible for pricing strategies to achieve maximum margin, growth and financial targets. Sets metrics and reports performance results internally and to the customer. Preparesaccount or program reviews to senior management regarding schedule status, margin/cost performance and risks. Responsible for proper negotiations of contracts. Provides input to the development of new product strategies, support strategies and roadmaps to meet customer requirements. Pursues business expansion with existing customers through Engineering/Contract change proposes; new product/service offerings and unresolves customer training needs. Develops and drives execution of sales strategies for new and existing products or services, aligned with product roadmaps. Accountable for customer proposals. Develop and nurture strategic relationships with customers. Ensures internal communication/cooperation is achieved. Manage Channel Partner/Representative relationships to execute sales strategy. Mentor and provide career development for direct reports. Responsible for staffing and performance management of direct reports. Accountable for compliance of regulatory or customer specific requirement (i.e., warranty process, import/export, licenses, proprietary information, FAA, IC, etc.). Develop and manage a departmental budget. Responsible for program risk management, including monitoring program status and driving required actions to resolve issues. Other Functions Responsible for engaging extended customer account team as appropriate. Accountable for receivables activity to payment terms. Ensures accuracy, distribution and record keeping of customer documentation per quality system standards. May be required to perform senior-level account management duties. Depending upon size of facility, may supervise otherfunctional areas within the location. May be responsible for demand management for a specific site as outlined in specific demand management procedures. Materials And Equipment Used General office equipment (computer, phone, fax, etc.). Working Environment / Physical Activities General office environment but may require visits to manufacturing environments. Significant travel, including international. Knowledge/Skills/Abilities Strong commercial skills including: selling process, pricing, costing, discount structures, terms and conditions, sales strategy development/execution, negotiating and sales proposal development. Excellent interpersonal skills. Effective relationship management. Strong oral and written communication skills. Ability to identify and use available resources. Able to work independently, self-motivated. Goal oriented. Excellent presentation skills. Solid understanding of business financial analysis. Sound judgment and decision-making skills. Ability to resolve complex customer issues. May require multi-language capabilities. Verbal and written English is a basic requirement. Product and application knowledge. Strong organizational and planning skills. Able to lead and motivate direct reports. Ability to adapt to different cultures. Education Or Formal Training Bachelor's Degree in engineering or business discipline. Additional formal training in specialized areas such as program management, negotiations and strategic selling. Masters in Business Administration a plus. Six Sigma training, minimum Champions Training. Experience Required 5-10 years experience in an account management, sales and/or marketing role in related industry. 3-5 years leadership experience or demonstrated capabilities. Woodward is an independent designer, manufacturer, and service provider of control solutions for the aerospace and energy markets. Our aerospace systems and components optimize the performance of fixed wing and rotorcraft platforms in commercial, business and military aircraft, ground vehicles and other equipment. Our energy-related systems and components enhance the performance of industrial gas and steam turbines, reciprocating engines, compressors, wind turbines, electrical grids and other energy-related industrial equipment. The company’s innovative fluid energy, combustion control, electrical energy, and motion control systems help customers offer cleaner, more reliable and more efficient equipment. Our customers include leading original equipment manufacturers and end users of their products. description: Kick-start your career in software as an early hire for a hyper-growth scale-up with major VC backing!  Salary: Up to $60k base + $25k OTE  Are you about to graduate or have you recently graduated? Have you considered a career in software sales? If not, here’s why you should: Join a future proof industry with continuous career progression Be part of a nurturing and fun culture with regular company wide trips Work for managers who genuinely care about your progression Learn from the best in the industry (and receive certified training) As well as your salary, receive shares in the company. This gives you a vested interest in the long-term growth and success!  We are looking for: Graduates who are eager to learn and enthusiastic to start their career No experience in sales, software or tech necessary, all graduates welcome to apply  The role...  With new leadership and processes in place to take this team to the next level, you will be a key part of the lead gen activities: planning and executing strategic outbound campaigns to target the biggest brands in your target region. Working closely with the field sales team, you will be taking part in discovery conversations, scheduling and attending demos, and strategizing and reviewing accounts. Prospects for progression are top notch – expect promotion within 18 months (into whichever area of the business you are interested in!).  The company… With a Series B funding round from premier VCs, this company is already a leading player in their field, securing over 80 of the world's biggest companies as customers. Their culture is forward-thinking and remote first, but will best suit someone who enjoys the chaos of a start-up! This is a great opportunity to join a well-backed company during hyper-growth phase, where you can work closely with the founders to influence long-term strategy.
jobFunction: Sales, Business Development, and Information Technology

description: Base Salary $40K - $45K, total comp at plan first year $80K - $120K. Uncapped commissions which makes your total comp the investment you put in the position.  Leading medical/surgical products distributor is seeking a full-time field sales representative for the South Houston and surrounding territory. This position requires an experienced sales person who can not only sell products but also recognize new opportunities with both new and existing customers. Preferred candidate would have a documented success history selling in the following areas: Operating room, inpatient pharmacy and/or compounding pharmacies, ambulatory surgery centers, and/or IV Therapy. The ideal candidate must be self-motivated and have a strong proven sales record with solid relationship skills.  The Company offers a Base salary, an uncapped commission program, defined and protected territories, approved expenses, mileage reimbursement, insurance benefits package and 401(k) matching. Your success will be measured by your ability to meet sales quotas, attract new accounts and build relationships. This is a phenomenal opportunity in the medical sales industry with an innovative and dynamic leading company. If you meet the above criteria and are looking for a new position with an outstanding organization, please apply as directed. Only qualified candidates meeting the above criteria will be notified.  The top reasons why the best reps want to work for Progressive Medical, Inc: A National Sales Team that is clinically prepared to support the needs of our clinical customers in any clinical environment. A National Account & Contract Team that understands the needs of Group Purchasing Organizations (GPOs) and Integrated Delivery Networks (IDNs) and how they play a significant role in the healthcare supply chain industry. A Customer Service Team that is second to none, fully staffed by Customers Service Specialists who personally answer every call, every time. Our Operations and Distribution Teams ensure our customers receive their product professionally and expediently. A Clinical Affairs Team that is available to answer questions and provide peer to peer training and support to our customers. Sales Education in collaboration with the Marketing Team provide extensive and continuous educational programs for not only our sales force, but the entire PMI organization. Our Marketing Team of professionals works in all aspects of both upstream and downstream marketing, from implementation to analysis, we understand how to take your product to market. Progressive Medical, Inc. is a leading distributor of specialty medical products throughout the United States. Our focus on innovative products helps clinicians to practice the highest quality care and increase safety, while also controlling overall costs in the areas of: surgery/anesthesia, interventional radiology, critical care and IV specialties.
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

jobTitle: Immunology Sales Specialist, Dermatology (Syracuse, NY) – Janssen Biotech, Inc..
description: Janssen Biotech, Inc., a member of the Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies, is recruiting for an Immunology Sales Specialist, Dermatology to support the Syracuse, NY territory.  At the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies of Johnson & Johnson, we are working to create a world without disease. Transforming lives by finding new and better ways to prevent, intercept, treat and cure disease inspires us. We bring together the best minds and pursue the most promising science. We are Janssen. We collaborate with the world for the health of everyone in it. Learn more at www.janssen.com and follow us @JanssenGlobal. Janssen Biotech, Inc. is part of the Janssen Pharmaceutical Companies.  As The Immunology Sales Specialist, Dermatology You Will Be responsible for attaining sales objectives, presenting complex clinical and business information on Janssen Biotech's immunology products and services to an audience of office and institutional based Dermatology healthcare professionals, government agencies, professional and patient groups, health plans and others involved in the decision-making process. Use discretion and judgment to execute the franchise and company brand strategy and tactics within the assigned customer segment, which may include physicians within specialty medical practices and their staff, specialists within local hospitals, clinics, and pharmacists within a specific geographic area. Influence decision makers and influencers within assigned customers to support the use of the company's products in the treatment of relevant disease states by developing and applying clinical and business expertise, and effective selling skills. Execute marketing strategies at the local level, leveraging resources appropriately and working successfully with company team members and counterparts to share ideas and information to enhance business results. Build customer loyalty by identifying and cultivating relationships with key decision makers at the local level who can influence decision making within the healthcare provider systems.  Qualifications  Required Qualifications: A minimum of a bachelor’s degree A valid driver's license and the ability to travel as necessary Must reside in close proximity to the geography or be willing to relocate to it Minimum of two (2) years of direct selling experience to healthcare professionals in the pharmaceutical, biotech, device or healthcare industry, or large account management, or business to business experience, or recently transitioned from Active Duty Military  Preferred Qualifications Experience selling injectable / infused products Working knowledge of immunology and/or the Dermatology field Experience managing through complex reimbursement issues Experience in project oriented selling situations in a high incentive and individual performance culture is preferred, along with a documented successful sales performance (high growth, results vs. plan Completion of Management Development course(s)  Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies are equal opportunity employers, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Primary Location  United States-New York-Syracuse-  Organization  Janssen Biotech, Inc. (6014)  Job Function  Sales  Requisition ID  2105970923W
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Medical Devices, and Pharmaceuticals

A Quick Summary About The Ticket Sales Service Coordinator  This full-time, seasonal position (October - April) will work supporting our sales teams, which include: our groups, tourism, premium, concerts, seasons and partial plans. You will work behind the scenes in an operational and administrative function and will also assist on game and event nights as needed.  What The Ticket Sales Service Coordinator Will Do Work as a key liaison for a variety of sales initiatives and logistics between Ticket Sales and other departments including Fan Experience/Operations, Live Entertainment, Social Responsibility, Special Events, Graphic Production, Retail and Marketing. Assist in executing DocuSign requests by Ticket Sales, Premium Sales, and Client Services reps. Prepare necessary game day critical documents, including sales opportunities, kiosk rotations, group sales blueprint updates, EID submissions and game night event forms. Assist in developing internal sales contest themes and celebrations. Organize, track and execute account benefits, incentives and fulfillment. Provide support for internal department meetings. Responsible for maintaining inventory accountability for Ticket Sales related supplies, collateral, giveaways, autographed items, etc. Schedule sales lead calendar rotations as directed by management and act as primary contact with ActivEngage representatives. Manage and track Amway Center event suites deposits and inventory, including concerts, family shows, graduations, etc. Work with Levy to fulfill food and beverage orders for prospecting suites. Assist in fulfilling comp ticket requests by Ticket and Premium Sales reps as approved by sales leadership. Update email templates for event confirmation and the Corporate Advantage Program. Assist in coordinating all Ticket Sales related events, promotions and fan experiences at Magic home games. Work with Group Sales Manager, Sales Representatives, Live Entertainment and Fan Operations in executing large group sales event logistics. Assist in the management of scheduling Group Sales fan experiences for both the Ticket Sales Department and other applicable internal departments. Oversee scheduling, logistics, communication and preparation for Ticket Sales presence at Grassroots and networking events. Assistance with season ticket and partial plan delinquent account communication and tracking Execute Group Fan Experience logistic training and communication to sales team. Assist management and sales executives with specific projects and events as needed. All other duties as assigned. What The Ticket Sales Service Coordinator Needs To Have Experience planning and managing event and campaign logistics required. Experience in reporting data and information in a readable, organized Excel format required. Ability to develop and execute creative and motivating contest/event themes required. Familiarity with Archtics or similar ticketing platform preferred. Proficient in all Microsoft Office products and other related computer skills required. Ability to meet tight deadlines and work well under pressure. Strong organizational skills, time management skills and attention to detail required. Strong verbal and written communication skills with an emphasis on business writing skills. Ability to prioritize and manage multiple tasks/projects. Ability to work independently without supervision, be self-directed and demonstrate initiative. Willingness to work a flexible schedule including nights and weekends and be on-call as necessary based on the changing priorities of the department. What We Have To Offer Competitive hourly rate + occasional overtime Staff tickets to Orlando Magic home games Subsidized RDV Sportsplex membership Company sponsored events & outings Culture built on Community, Innovation, Legendary and Teamwork! Fantastic benefits that include: medical, dental, vision, 401(k) with company matching Physical Requirements  N/A  If this opportunity is a job you're passionate about and it fits with your skills and experience, then we welcome you to take the next step and apply.  All offers of employment are contingent on successful completion of our pre-employment screenings, that may include a background check and drug screen.  The Orlando Magic are not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at the Orlando Magic via-email, the internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written Statement of Work in place for this position from Orlando Magic HR/Recruitment will be deemed the sole property of the Orlando Magic. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by the Orlando Magic as a result of the referral or through other means. description: EnGoPlanet is a well funded Award Winning Clean Energy Start-Up. The company was founded on a vision of delivering clean, managed “wireless energy” to meet the global need for reliable, low-cost solar power for street lighting, telecom, security, and IoT devices, as well as other mission-critical systems.  The company has recently completed a Series A investment led by Sallyport Holdings, who have  billions of dollars worth of exits under their belt, and are actively involved, young, and ready to support high-growth technology companies like EngoPlanet. You’ll be standing shoulder to shoulder with industry makers and company builders.   Position We are looking for someone that believes in our vision to provide environmentally-friendly and sustainable products. The Sales Executive will be an integral part of our business & sales team and will play a key role in building out our sales operation. This is an ideal position for a person that thrives in working within a young and nimble work environment that’s invested in the long-term growth and success of its business.    What You Will Do  Identify potential clients within target segments and geography. Participate in seminars and conferences in the capacity of speaker, panelist and exhibitor, thereby consistently adding new opportunities to EnGoPlanet’s sales pipeline. Qualify prospects, analyze their needs and develop a sales strategy for each opportunity. Negotiate all commercial aspects of contracts related to new sales. Close contracts related to new sales. Manage all phases of the sales process, including all relations to the customer.    What You Will Need to Succeed 1 – 3 years of applicable sales experience. Possess the ability to effectively prioritize and quickly solve challenges & roadblocks. Highly motivated self-starter who is organized, reliable, and sales-driven. Must have a growth mindset and be entrepreneurial! Experience working within the renewable energy space is a plus. Experience working within a complex subscription based sales model environment is a plus.     What’s in it For You You will have the unique opportunity to help develop EnGoPlanet’s North American sales operations.       As one of the first hires you will have a tremendous amount of opportunities for professional development and upward mobility.  EnGoPlanet is an equal-opportunity employer and committed to promoting the values of diversity and inclusion throughout the business. Whether it is through recruitment, retention, career progression or training and development, we are committed to improving opportunities for people regardless of their background or circumstances.

Principle Responsibilities: Drive sales of all Crane Instrumentation & Sampling (I&S) products within defined geographic territory to achieve profitable growth. Identify key influencers at Target Key Accounts and End Users to develop and implement sales strategies aligning our value propositions for their applications. Become champion of Crane Business System (CBS) and use the tools as part of standard work to achieve results. Work closely with Key Account Team within Crane to develop strategies for Target End Users in Refining and Chemical Industries. Drive execution of MRO business and develop conversion accounts. Identify and Manage projects in territory through IIR (Industrial Info Resources) and the Global Project Tracker tool from the Crane Business System. Maintain a detailed and comprehensive knowledge of the product line and the value proposition within specific applications. Work closely with the Crane CP&E Sales team to develop common strategy. Assist Business Line Managers in New Product Development and sales integration with Target End Users and Channel. Develop sales forecast for each product line to assist Business Line Managers with production. Monitor and report competitive landscape within territory for all I&S products. Conduct lunch and learns for distribution channels, end users, and EPC’s as required. Manage Midwest territory within the guidelines of budgets, reporting, and distribution management. Create and distribute weekly reports with information from sales calls and market conditions.  Qualifications / Experience / Personal characteristics: Bachelor’s degree in technical field. Five years of experience in Outside Sales managing similar product with Channel and End Users preferred. Applied experience working with mechanical valves, pneumatic and hydraulic systems, instrument hookups and process analytical samplers. Domestic travel is required. Proven track record of valve or instrument sales in Industrial or Oil & Gas markets (at least 3-5 years desirable) Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills with ability to quickly build relationships with Channels and End Users. Knowledge of how to create a product differentiation, value proposed, product advantage to win MRO and project orders versus competition. Strong listening skills with the ability to assimilate information and translate it into customer solutions. High energy team player and competitor. High proficiency with MS products (Excel, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint).

About BigTeams (Ashburn, VA) Since 1964, BigTeams LLC has been the leading provider of athletic management tools for high schools and state associations.  We have immediate, part-time opportunities available for Inside Sales Associates. These are remote positions.  Inside Sales Representative  We are looking for motivated and well-spoken inside sales representatives to join our sales team. The inside sales representatives will be responsible for developing new leads, communicating with prospects, understanding their needs, and initiating a smooth sales process. You should be able to complete a high volume of quality calls in a short period of time.  To be successful as an inside sales representative you should be able to build instant rapport and achieve customer satisfaction. A top inside sales representative should also be very competitive and a good listener.  Responsibilities: Making outbound calls to potential customers, and following up on leads. Understanding prospects' needs and identifying sales opportunities. Answering potential customers' questions and sending additional information per email. Keeping up with product and service information and updates. Creating and maintaining a database of current and potential customers. Explaining and demonstrating features of products and services. Staying informed about competing products and services. Upselling products and services. Researching and qualifying new leads.  Requirements: Previous experience in an outbound call center or a related sales position is preferred. Proficiency in Google Suite. Previous experience in Salesforce.com is a plus. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. Good organizational skills and the ability to multitask. Excellent phone and cold calling skills. Strong listening and sales skills. Ability to achieve targets with little to no supervision. Ability to work 15 - 20 hours each week. Availability to work between the hours of 8am - 2pm Eastern.

McKesson requires new employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as defined by the CDC, subject to applicable, verified accommodation requests.  McKesson Corporation is a Fortune 8 company and is one of the largest providers of healthcare supply chain management solutions, retail pharmacy, medical & pharmaceutical supplies, healthcare technology, community oncology and specialty care in the United States with revenues of $231 billion in 2020. The company was founded in 1833 by John McKesson and Charles Olcott in New York with a focus on importing and wholesaling pharmaceutical products. United by our ICARE shared principles, McKesson's 80,000 employees work together every day to make better care possible around the globe – one product, one partner, one patient at a time.  Area Sales Manager  Area Sales Manager covering assigned region within the Post-Acute Care market segment. Preferred candidates will live in Texas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, or Kansas (Texas is preferred to provide better daily access to territory).  This high-profile position will have full P&L responsibility for a region generating over $90M in revenue. Expectations are to grow both new and existing business by directing the sales activities of 12 outside sales representatives, developing strategic business plans, establishing and monitoring sales goals, developing close relationships with key accounts, internal stakeholders and supporting teams such as Inside Sales, Gov’t Sales, Clinical Support and Field Service.  Primary Responsibilities Create strategies to obtain new customers and market penetration within the SNF, ALF, Hospice and Home Health Agency space Hands on development of field reps via traveling within the sales region and visits with customers to ensure service levels are being met Provide reps with the resources they need to service and close business Hire, train and develop sales reps Performance management Achieve financial goals and other goals as assigned by the business Minimum Requirements  9+ years of professional sales experience and 1+ years of supervisory or management experience  Critical Skills Experience selling to C-suite Financial acumen Mature confidence and self-awareness (can influence others diplomatically) Demonstrated performance management skills Demonstrated sales leadership skills Proficiency with Excel, Power Point, Outlook, SFDC and Power BI Ability to travel daily within assigned region Additional Knowledge & Skills Experience in distribution sales. Demonstrated success in building and growing a new region / territory. Prior healthcare experience is preferred. Education  Bachelor's Degree in Business, Marketing or related field or equivalent experience  Physical Requirements Must have valid driver's license and acceptable driving record Large amount of computer-based work Must be authorized to work in the US. Sponsorship is not available for this position.  We take pride in our culture of connection and believe in a workplace where everyone can be their full, authentic self. We welcome and encourage veterans, individuals with disabilities and others with diverse perspectives to join our growing team. Your unique perspective and experience are valuable assets that can translate into a rewarding career path with us. Apply to join our team and help shape the future of healthcare!  McKesson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.Qualified applicants will not be disqualified from consideration for employment based upon criminal history.  McKesson is committed to being an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer and offers opportunities to all job seekers including job seekers with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation to assist with your job search or application for employment, please contact us by sending an email to McKessonTalentAcquisition@mckesson.com . description: About Lefty Lefty is a fast-growing software company on a path to revolutionise the $15 billion influencer market. We are a leading analytics SaaS platform that helps brands measure the impact of their influencer marketing program and optimize their talent management workflow. Lefty delivers results for the world’s biggest lifestyle brands, including Chanel, Louis Vuitton, Swatch, Adidas, Clarins, Tommy Hilfiger or Asos. In April 2021, Lefty joined The Independents, the largest global marketing and communications group for luxury brands, with the ambition to expand the our geographical foothold from our Paris base, starting with the USA, the world's largest market. We are currently looking for fast, growth-minded individuals who want to help revolutionize the logistics industry and play an integral role in a thriving startup environment. We are on the hunt for a unique and passionate General Manager to be based in our newly established New York office. This person will plan and execute all the commercial activities around the USA and Canada, and manage a team of like-minded individuals, to penetrate the market and emerge as industry leaders.  You: 8+ Years of Sales and operational management success Experience selling digital technology and service solutions (bonus points for Influencer Marketing, MarTech, or AdTech SaaS vendors!) Experience in managing a team  Leader that inspires your team to reach for their highest level of success Demonstrated experience partnering with internal marketing, inside sales, sales engineering, channel managers, and client/professional service teams Excellent oral, written, and interpersonal skills Exemplary communication prioritization and organizational skills Comfortable dealing with ambiguity, working in a culture of critique and iteration with all team members A background in any of our target verticals is desirable (beauty, fashion, health & fitness, food & drink) Technology savvy – the ability to understand tech concepts (BI, Algorithms, Bots, etc.) and fluent with modern tools (Zoom, chat, webinars, etc.)  What you will do: Launch and manage Lefty business operations across North America Define and execute strategy and goals, increase the bar constantly to ensure Lefty market expansion Understand the influencer marketing space and develop expert-level knowledge of our SaaS offerings Use data analysis of sales performance, customer accounts, competitive intelligence, and market trends to develop, implement, and make needed adjustments to market penetration plans and account-based strategies to compete and win enterprise software deals that increase net new revenues Structure processes and incentives that will increase sales of the company's products Hunt: Independently prospect, cold call and follow up on leads from our demand generation efforts and use our marketing automation platform and list services Demonstrate: Thoroughly discover pain points, then adjust your presentation of our solutions to be compelling and concise Close:  Convenience new accounts to sign up so you exceed quota Farm: Cultivate additional business and ensure satisfaction from existing customers or transition to our emerging CSM Team Manage: You will hire, train, guide, assist and oversee the success of your Account Executive Team Product enhancements: Communicate customer feedback for product advancement CRM Updating: Daily updates to records to enable your planning and progress Collaborate with Operations, Marketing, and Product teams to maintain a healthy Net Promoter Score (NPS) and LifeTime Value (LTV) of each customer

Sunday Riley Modern Skincare is looking for an experienced Account Executive to join our field team to build our business in the Greater Austin / San Antonio market.   The Account Executive generates & increases in-store sales through relationship building, impactful store visits, training, and events. Success in this role is achieved by positive team morale, team development, strong store relationships, and consistently increasing sales performance in all assigned stores.   The ideal candidate must have strong selling skills, outstanding communication skills, best-in-class customer service, and a passion for learning. All applicants must be a team player and have cosmetics experience.   Key Job Responsibilities:  Sell and educate in stores and manage / coach a team of Retail Sales Specialists to hit and exceed sales goals for the territory  Strategize and maximize personal and team schedules to drive the business. Develop and maximize store visit call cycle for self and direct reports.  Activate corporate-approved education and event initiatives and exceed sales goals  Coach and develop direct reports Develop and build strong relationships with retail partners  Support recruiting, interviewing, and onboarding  Collaborate with Regional Sales Manager to build impactful store-by-store action plans to address store needs and support sales goals regionally  Must have a passion for skincare and the Brand  Work Location:  5-day work week, total of 40 hours. Weekends are required. Monthly travel may be required depending on territory size  It is expected that 32 hours a week will be spent in the field   Other Duties: Please note this is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  Perks:  Competitive salary  Vacation days  Paid holidays  401k  Life Insurance Health/dental/vision benefits  Physical Demands:  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to stand; walk; sit; apply products on clients; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; talk or hear.   Preferred Qualification and Experience:  Minimum of 3 years of retail, sales and/or beauty industry experience, preferably in the skincare industry at the AE or AC level Memorable, positive, professional, and enthusiastic presence  Strong aptitude for product knowledge, brand messaging, training, and selling  Ability to manage multiple calendars and multi-store visits  Excellent oral, written, and presentation skills; email and phone skills essential  Ability to take strategic direction based on sales and business analysis  Basic computer skills a must- Microsoft Word, Outlook, Excel, Teams, T-Sheets scheduling app  Self-motivated, committed and goal-oriented  Energetic and passionate with an entrepreneurial, flexible spirit  Ability to travel required  Driver’s license a plus (in most cases a necessity)  Flexibility regarding work hours, i.e. weekend  Equal Opportunity Employer:  Sunday Riley actively creates a culture of inclusivity and respects that diversity in the workplace leads to a positive and stronger team. It is our policy to provide equal opportunity for all employees, contractors, and prospective employees, regardless of race, color, national origin, age, pregnancy, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other criteria protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.

description: Sales Trainer Sales training is essential to an organization’s success, and it’s a powerful tool for developing the full potential of every sales rep. The success of a program is due in large part to the individual delivering it—and the approach they take.  All applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. Location: Remote Storable is a distributed-first company, but is only registered for employment in a certain number of states. In order to be considered, you must permanently reside in the following states to be eligible for employment: Texas, Colorado, North Carolina, Tennessee, Florida, Illinois, Indiana, Kansas, Missouri, Pennsylvania, Georgia, Arizona, Alabama, Mississippi Louisiana, South Carolina, Oklahoma, Wyoming, Nebraska, Wisconsin, Virginia  About Us: At Storable, we believe storage operators should have one partner they can trust to help you get the results they need for their business. That’s why we’ve built the industry’s first fully integrated platform that offers facility management software, facility websites, marketing programs and services, payments, and deeply integrated tenant insurance capabilities all in one solution.  We leverage our platform in combination with our over 25 years of storage industry expertise to help our thousands of storage customers achieve their tenant experience and operational efficiency objectives every  single day.   What you will do everyday: Coach and develop our sales and CS reps Own all new hire Sales and CS training Review and improve our current sales process / training methodology - make strategic recommendations that help us drive to world class sales process and results  Leverage current call monitoring system that quantifies and calibrates call skill performance and identifies opportunities for improvement  Create, update, maintain, and report on rep coaching logs Work with Sales Leadership, Revenue Operations & Learning & Development to identify areas of opportunity, metrics, and behaviors to coach and monitor Assist sales management with driving adoption of processes and key metrics  Operational Activities & Responsibilities  Directly engage front-line sales team members to teach, mentor, coach and drive the sales process Engage and assist sales reps on active opportunities as needed Work with Learning & Development to prepare and organise digital and or physical job aids or other materials required to facilitate the learning process Facilitate the collection, sharing, and archiving of sales best practices Post training follow up and reinforcement Conduct regular recurring coaching sessions with their assigned reps Coach and assist reps with the activities and action items in their assigned coaching plans Monitor and evaluate sales calls with sales team members regularly  What you need to bring to the table: Strong background in sales and sales process training (at least 2-4 years of professional training experience) Sales Leadership experience is preferable Must be humble - the focus must remain on the participants and their development. Intellectually curious and facilitates authentic discussions Altruistic - motivated by having a positive impact on team members career Always looking for ways to improve their craft World class communicator - ability to communicate complex ideas that are easily absorbed by participants A great balance of strategic mindset with incredible hands on presence  A difference maker who loves helping a team to win  Benefits and Perks: Generous health coverage for you and your family, including short- and long-term disability coverage, 401(k) and HSA matching, company-provided life insurance, and more. Engage remotely! Since March of 2020, we transitioned to a fully remote environment and we run regular contests, trivia games and remote happy hours. Instant-Access & Flexible vacation. We trust you, so we have a ‘take what you need’ vacation policy. No waiting to use it or need for accruals. Do More, Be More – Company rewards and recognition that add up and can be redeemed for once-in-a-lifetime Bucketlist experiences! Get active in the community by joining one of our many quarterly offsite volunteer and community service events. Fun company events, including Halloween costume contests, ugly sweater competitions, baseball game outings, ice cream socials, food trucks, and more.  Storable is committed to providing equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Storable will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

jobTitle: Regional Associate Sales Consultant (Trauma) – Worcester, MA/ Providence, RI – DePuy Synthes Sales, Inc..
description: DePuy Synthes, part of the Johnson & Johnson Medical Devices Companies, markets one of the most comprehensive orthopedics portfolios in the world. DePuy Synthes solutions, in specialties including joint reconstruction, trauma, craniomaxillofacial, spinal surgery and sports medicine, are designed to advance patient care while delivering clinical and economic value to health care systems worldwide. For more information, visit www.depuysynthes.com.    Trauma/CMF: DePuy Synthes Trauma offers a comprehensive portfolio of trauma care solutions for the treatment of the most simple to the most complex trauma injuries using traditional and minimally invasive techniques.    The Regional Associate Sales Consultant (ASC) position is an exciting developmental opportunity designed to help you to launch a career in medical device sales. The Regional ASCs provide clinical and sales support in hospital settings, while providing excellent customer service for existing and new customers, sales logistics and asset management, and high-quality technical expertise and product knowledge. The Regional ASC will be assigned to support territories as needed throughout their assigned region. Ability and willingness to travel within the United States as necessary (potentially overnight and/or weekend) or to relocate to a geographic region assigned by the Company is required.  After 18 months of active employment, and assuming business criteria are met, the Regional ASC may apply for promotion to open junior level Sales Consultant roles with DePuy Synthes Trauma. To qualify for the Jr. Sales Consultant role, candidate must be willing to relocate (with company relocation assistance) to hiring area.  The Regional ASC Is Responsible For Supporting cases in an operating room setting including providing high quality technical information about Company products Coordinating equipment required for case coverage Logistics related to hospital billing and replenishment Maintaining/managing surgeon and account relationships  Qualifications  Required Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s Degree from an accredited university OR Associate’s degree AND two (2) or more years of professional experience At least four (4) or more years of professional experience OR Recently transitioned from Active Duty Military The ability and willingness to travel as necessary (potentially overnight and/or weekend) The ability and willingness to relocate to a geographic region assigned by the Company Valid Driver’s License issued in the United States  Preferred Qualifications 2+ years of professional experience, preferably sales experience in any industry Demonstrable mechanical aptitude and the ability to learn complex technical concepts Ability to understand, interpret, communicate and work in complex environment Strong interpersonal communication, influencing, and negotiating skills Strong problem-solving skills with experience in data analysis Results orientated and a sense of urgency with the ability to work to tight timelines Ability to work independently and autonomously Strong desire to learn and grow professionally The ability to work in an active operating room environment  Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies are equal opportunity employers, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Primary Location  United States-Massachusetts-Worcester-  Other Locations  North America-United States-Massachusetts-Boston, North America-United States-Rhode Island-Providence  Organization  DePuy Synthes Sales, Inc. (6032)  Job Function  Sales  Requisition ID  2105941815W

description: Davenport, FL, USA ? Haines City, FL, USA  Req #4517  Monday, December 21, 2020  Coca-Cola Beverages Florida, LLC (Coke Florida) is a family-owned independent Coca-Cola bottler that is the third largest privately-held and the sixth largest independent Coca-Cola bottler in the United States. Coke Florida's exclusive territory covers over 18 million consumers across 47 Florida counties, and includes the major metropolitan markets of Jacksonville, Miami, Orlando and Tampa. Coke Florida sells, markets, manufactures and distributes over 600 products of The Coca-Cola Company and other partner companies including Monster Beverage Corporation and BODYARMOR. In 2017, Coke Florida generated over $1.2 billion in revenue and the company currently has approximately 4,800 employees.  As one of the first US greenfield independent Coca-Cola bottlers in nearly sixty years, Coke Florida is at an exciting stage in its transformational journey to become a leading-edge beverage company, the best bottler in the Coca-Cola System, and one of the best companies to work for in Florida.  **Sales Account Manager**  The Sales Account Manager (** SAM) is responsible for business development and customer relationships. The SAM increases business by selling additional brands and packages within his or her sales territory's existing customer base. The Sales Account Manager at CCBF works across all sales channels. Account Executive WORLDWIDE EXPRESS  The largest non-retail authorized UPS® partner and No. 1 largest privately held LTL broker in the country!  The Account Executive position at Worldwide Express is a unique and rewarding outside business-to-business(B2B) sales opportunity for the salesperson looking for unlimited growth potential and uncapped residual commission coupled with a healthy base salary and monthly allowances. This unique compensation plan allows top performers to earn an annual six-figure income within 18 to 24 months. PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILITIES: Consult, educate and simplify supply chain practices through an innovative, web-based platform. Streamline in and outbound processes, providing customized solutions. ·      Lead presentations with executives/owners of businesses with frequent shipping volume ·      Partner with the operations and account management teams for optimal customer satisfaction ·      Solution selling; effectively present solutions through cost-benefit analysis ·      Present a streamlined technology solution developing a detailed analysis of customized needs in challenging areas and lanes ·      Take the lead in coordinating/developing/managing all aspects of the proposal process ·      Close, activate and train decision-makers on our exclusive shipping platform  WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU: A competitive and motivated mindset and a passion for new business development. ·      Bachelor's Degree preferred ·      Proven success in generating/qualifying leads through prospecting new business with a ‘hunter’ mentality ·      High energy, with a passion for your personal brand and the ability to carry yourself like an executive ·      Comfortable in a fast-paced, quota-driven, results-oriented environment ·      Effective communicator with strong business acumen and intuition ·      Self-starter with strong organization & presentation skills ·      Attention to detail to drive profitability ·      Ability to think strategically about the personal impact to the client's long-term business strategy ·      Team-oriented peer, with a thirst to compete to be the most valuable player  WHAT WE COMMIT TO YOU: Industry-leading compensation with aggressive residual, uncapped commissions. Unsurpassed training, nationally ranked growth opportunities and our insanely awesome culture. ·      Territory development with Targeted Company opportunities ·      Strategic, pre-screened lead generation supported by multiple internal/external parties ·      A competitive starting BASE SALARY with performance-based increases ·      Residual, uncapped monthly commission ·      Monthly/Quarterly/Regional contest with great reward$$$ ·      Fast track bonuses for quality deals your first year while ramping up ·      The compensation plan allows top performers to earn an annual six-figure income within 18 - 24 months ·      Nationally recognized sales training ·      Ongoing sales & management support ·      Progressive Advancement opportunity and national career mobility ·      Monthly auto & cell phone allowances ·      A comprehensive benefits package with medical, dental, vision coverage and a 401(k) program  WHY WORLDWIDE EXPRESS? ·      No. 1 largest privately held LTL broker in the country! ·      The largest non-retail authorized UPS® partner ·      More than 90,000 customers nationwide ·      Ranked a Top 10 Freight Brokerage Firm by Transport Topics for the past 5 years ·      Ranked a Top 50 Logistics firm globally by Transport Topics for the past 5 years ·      Nationally ranked/known for culture, training and career growth  WHO ARE WE? Quite simply, we make shipping simple. Worldwide Express offers customers a comprehensive solution for their shipping needs, whether it be small package, less-than-truckload or full truckload. We are a local partner for your global supply chain, providing consultative service from more than 125 offices across the nation. Through our relationship with UPS® and a highly selective carrier portfolio, we provide our customers with a breadth of shipping options unmatched in the 3PL field.  Worldwide Express has a strategic partnership with UPS for light package, domestic and international shipping to penetrate the small to medium size business sector. As UPS's largest business partner in North America our sales teams do what they do best, which is providing solutions to a C-Level executive while letting UPS do what they do best, deliver more packages on time than anyone else. In addition to our relationship with ups WWE has alliances with over 65 LTL, Domestic Air Freight, and International Air Freight carriers. WWE provides tailored services and individualized shipping solutions to fit the need of any small to medium sized business customers.  Worldwide Express is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Worldwide Express Operations, LLC and WWEX Franchise Holdings, LLC (collectively “Worldwide Express”) strives to make employment decisions on the basis of merit, seeking the most qualified individuals in every job.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin or ancestry, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or other status protected by law.  All employment decisions will be based on valid job requirements or other legitimate, non-discriminatory reasons.  Worldwide Express offers reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in the job application and hiring process.  If you would like to request such an accommodation, please contact the Human Resources Director of Worldwide Express.

description: Responsibilities The Regional Sales Manager is an individual contributor position with overall responsibility of the development and management of machine sales and market share growth either from direct sales or indirect sales via dealers or affiliate Liebherr companies, in their dedicated region (area).  Essential Job Duties Responsible for building and managing the assigned sales territory. Identifies, develops, and coordinates effective business relationships with customers and dealers to ensure maximum market share within the assigned territory. Meets with key clients, assisting dealer sales representatives with maintaining relationships and negotiating and closing deals. Acts as a liaison between sales department and other LUS departments as needed.  Data Maintains LUS Mining database of Liebherr and competitive mining machines (100T & larger OHT, D9, D10, D11 class DOZ, 100T and Larger HEX and wheel loaders) for assigned mines. (Del Year, Frame Hours, Repl Date, Operating/Parked, Phys Avail). Utilizes industry related data to develop in territory strategy and assess customer base  Quoting Supports development of sales strategy for the assigned territory while ensuring alignment with LUS-Mining’s overall strategy. Create and Deliver sales presentations to Prospective prospects Leads Quote and delivery process.  Reporting Maintains frequent and timely assessments and reports on market conditions; potential and current dealers and competitors; provide frequent and accurate forecasts. Must provide timely input/updates for call reports, lost sale reports and other similar reports as required by company reporting procedures. Actively updates CRM opportunities Provides Monthly Sales Reports to track activity within respective region.  Core  Competencies Customer Focus: Is attentive and responsive to the needs of internal and/or external customers. Builds and maintains customer satisfaction.  Competencies Job Skills: Applies the required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities (KSA) in the performance of essential job duties: Mining Knowledge: Knowledge of surface mining methods and basic machine technology, operations and applications. Specialty Application Knowledge: Knowledge of specialty HEX applications such as demolition, waste handling, recycling, and dredging. Engages customer, gathers information and negotiates contracts for LUS Mining to be able to obtain profitable orders in providing products and services to the market, which satisfy customer’s needs but also improves the image of Liebherr Mining Equipment Co.’s (LME) equipment, facilitates new equipment sales and ensures growth in the area. Supports development of sales strategy for the area while ensuring alignment with Liebherr’s overall mining & specialty equipment strategy. Identifies, develops, and coordinates effective business relationships with dealers and alternative distribution channels to ensure maximum market penetration Provides guidance and support in the development, implementation and maintenance of profitable service contracts. Develops and manages major account customers. Coordinates and conducts sales presentations including participation of other MIN factory representatives. Liaises with LEC/LWT/LME Sales support departments in preparation of quotations and tender documents. Coordinates the submission offers to customers and follows up. Represents Company at trade association meetings and/or industry events to promote products. Demonstrates cost consciousness.  Requirements A Bachelor’s degree, and or a minimum of 5 years of prior technical sales experience, or the equivalent combination of education and related experience.   Our Offer An interesting and ambitious role in a successful international company. We offer a secure work environment with a comprehensive benefits package that includes major medical, dental and vision insurance, 401K plan with company match, paid vacation and personal days and competitive salary.  Have we awoken your interest? Then we look forward to receiving your online application. If you have any questions, please contact Beatrice Bushee at: beatrice.bushee@liebherr.com. Liebherr is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. Liebherr - One Passion. Many Opportunities. The company In line with its international growth, Liebherr’s venture into the United States began in 1970. Within a couple of years, the company expanded and completed its production facilities in Newport News, Virginia, for its product line of hydraulic excavators. It was later converted into Liebherr’s manufacturing facility for mining trucks and remains home to Liebherr Mining Equipment Newport News, Co. In addition to its production facility, Liebherr markets a wide variety of products and technologies through its companies located across the United States. The companies are Liebherr-Aerospace Saline, Inc., Liebherr Gear Technology, Inc., Liebherr Automation Systems, Co., and Liebherr USA, Co., the umbrella company for 12 product segments that are positioned across the United States.  Location Liebherr USA Co. 5800 South Douglas Highway 82718 Gillette, WY United States (US)  Contact Beatrice Bushee beatrice.bushee@liebherr.com Rachel.Swicegood@liebherr.com

NextPath Career Partners is currently seeking a Sales Executive to join our client’s team. This is a direct hire position with remote flexibility.  Responsibilities Expand customer base for your target accounts/region Develop and execute a sales plan to hit or exceed quota Strategize and execute an outreach and lead gen plan with the SDR team for your accounts/region Generate 25% of your pipeline (Marketing will generate the other 75%) Market and sell with current partners, including Microsoft, and expand our partner ecosystem in your assigned accounts/region when and where necessary Partner with prospects to understand their business needs and objectives to effectively communicate our unique value proposition through demos and presentations Establish a sales forecasting cadence to report on pipeline and ensure Salesforce is updated weekly with our KPI’s Reporting on forces that shift market needs and strategic direction of accounts Requirements 5+ years of experience selling enterprise collaboration and communication software to senior executives in large and distributed organizations Proven ability to effectively manage a long and complex sales cycle and align to the buying and procurement process Natural collaborator who operates with integrity Coachable and open to learning with a focus on continuous improvement A self-starter who takes initiative and has a sense of urgency Amazing communication and presentation skills (both oral and written) with the ability to translate technical concepts into business value Demonstrated creativity in finding ways around sales barriers and ability to convert opponents into champions Ability to articulate differentiators and position company against competitors Strategic and adaptive thinker who can understand client’s business & processes and adapt your selling techniques accordingly Nextpath Career Partners  NextPath is a candidate centric recruiting firm focused on your career goals to help you find your next path! Our team of professional recruiters have over 80 years of combined experience to help you navigate a job change. Our clients span local and national with roles in sales, creative, marketing, and staffing on a direct, contract-to-perm, and contract (project) basis.  If the position above doesn’t appear to fit we do have a host of clients with roles that could be a match and not every position will be posted. description: VP of Sales ⚡ HealthTech Start Up – Digital Telehealth Solutions (Payer & Broker Space) United States (Remote) $130,000 - $160,000 + Bonus/Commission + Equity  A Series B funded East-Coast based HealthTech startup is seeking a driven Sales contributor to take a key role in driving revenue, owning the full sales cycles and developing both existing an new client relationships. The company is driven to make real change to employees' lives and to ease the providing of care through both virtual & in-person appointments. The company prides itself on internal progression and therefore desires an individual looking to take a step up in their career. The product is a digital health SaaS platform, to be sold into health plans, the payer space and benefit brokers.  Responsibilities  Full ownership of the sales cycle, from lead generation through to closing and onboarding Have full product knowledge and demonstrate platform usage to prospective clients Work cross-functionally with product, marketing and customer success Embody the company values and mission as a key sales role model within the company Directly contribute to processes, strategy & budget management  Requirements  A desire to generate revenue and close deals of all sizes Hunter mentality and a strong knowledge of the payer and broker sector 5+ years' of experience in sales Great communication and collaboration - the team is spread across the US, and you will work closely with all members of the organization. Ideally you will be just as passionate about revolutionizing the HealthTech industry as the founding team  Benefits  Competitive salary - based on experience Bonus/Commission Equity - the company already has significant interest in the investment community Healthcare 401k Remote work, offering great flexibility Great maternity & paternity benefits Opportunity to join a fast paced, high growth start up in a meaningful industry Great company culture with a focus on diversity  🌎 United States (Remote)  📧 Interested in applying? Click on the ‘Easy Apply’ button  ⚡ Storm3 is a HealthTech recruitment firm with clients across London, Europe and North America. To discuss open opportunities or career options, please visit our website www.storm3.com and follow the Storm3 Linked In page for the latest jobs and intel

description: Account Executive WORLDWIDE EXPRESS  The largest non-retail authorized UPS® partner and No. 1 largest privately held LTL broker in the country!  The Account Executive position at Worldwide Express is a unique and rewarding outside business-to-business(B2B) sales opportunity for the salesperson looking for unlimited growth potential and uncapped residual commission coupled with a healthy base salary and monthly allowances. This unique compensation plan allows top performers to earn an annual six-figure income within 18 to 24 months. PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILITIES: Consult, educate and simplify supply chain practices through an innovative, web-based platform. Streamline in and outbound processes, providing customized solutions. ·      Lead presentations with executives/owners of businesses with frequent shipping volume ·      Partner with the operations and account management teams for optimal customer satisfaction ·      Solution selling; effectively present solutions through cost-benefit analysis ·      Present a streamlined technology solution developing a detailed analysis of customized needs in challenging areas and lanes ·      Take the lead in coordinating/developing/managing all aspects of the proposal process ·      Close, activate and train decision-makers on our exclusive shipping platform  WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU: A competitive and motivated mindset and a passion for new business development. ·      Bachelor's Degree preferred ·      Proven success in generating/qualifying leads through prospecting new business with a ‘hunter’ mentality ·      High energy, with a passion for your personal brand and the ability to carry yourself like an executive ·      Comfortable in a fast-paced, quota-driven, results-oriented environment ·      Effective communicator with strong business acumen and intuition ·      Self-starter with strong organization & presentation skills ·      Attention to detail to drive profitability ·      Ability to think strategically about the personal impact to the client's long-term business strategy ·      Team-oriented peer, with a thirst to compete to be the most valuable player  WHAT WE COMMIT TO YOU: Industry-leading compensation with aggressive residual, uncapped commissions. Unsurpassed training, nationally ranked growth opportunities and our insanely awesome culture. ·      Territory development with Targeted Company opportunities ·      Strategic, pre-screened lead generation supported by multiple internal/external parties ·      A competitive starting BASE SALARY with performance-based increases ·      Residual, uncapped monthly commission ·      Monthly/Quarterly/Regional contest with great reward$$$ ·      Fast track bonuses for quality deals your first year while ramping up ·      The compensation plan allows top performers to earn an annual six-figure income within 18 - 24 months ·      Nationally recognized sales training ·      Ongoing sales & management support ·      Progressive Advancement opportunity and national career mobility ·      Monthly auto & cell phone allowances ·      A comprehensive benefits package with medical, dental, vision coverage and a 401(k) program  WHY WORLDWIDE EXPRESS? ·      No. 1 largest privately held LTL broker in the country! ·      The largest non-retail authorized UPS® partner ·      More than 90,000 customers nationwide ·      Ranked a Top 10 Freight Brokerage Firm by Transport Topics for the past 5 years ·      Ranked a Top 50 Logistics firm globally by Transport Topics for the past 5 years ·      Nationally ranked/known for culture, training and career growth
