description: Position Type: Full-Time Location: Remote  FLSA Status: Exempt Hourly/Salary: Base + Commission  Overview  Are you sales savvy looking for an opportunity at a growing company in a rapidly expanding industry? We are seeking a Regional Sales Representatives who will collaborate with our customers by finding ways to improve their production environments. Successful candidates are curious problem solvers willing to dig in and find solutions to any customer issue. You will be exposed to exciting industries as you seek to bring value and efficiencies to the marketplace. MVP offers extensive initial training, as well as ongoing programs investing in your future. MVP is an industry leader in mix, meter, and dispense equipment for fiberglass reinforced products, epoxy and adhesive markets. Our renowned reputation and 80+ years of history serving these industries gives you a significant advantage in growing your customer base. Learn more about us at mvpind.com and apply today!  Company Culture  At MVP, we take great pride in our family-owned business roots, and we still adhere to the family values that made us who we are today. We maintain a corporate culture Family, Friendly, Forward to support, develop, and sustain a vibrant environment. Family MVP has been a family-owned business for over 80 years. When you join the MVP team you become a part our family. Ask many of our employees who have been with us for over 40 years. Friendly MVP is a fun and exciting place to work. We pride ourselves in always communicating openly and honestly. Forward MVP stays on the leading edge of manufacturing by inspiring innovation. We are continually developing new products and solutions to serve our current customers and expand into new markets. Position Requirements A minimum of 2 years industrial/manufacturing sales experience with a proven record of success A Bachelors degree is preferred Ability to communicate with all levels of an organization and build business relationships with customers and co-workers Sales aptitude demonstrated ability to increase profits and market share Technical aptitude ability to learn and understand specific products, processes, and strategies to best serve the customer Significant travel within assigned sales territory, up to 75%, willingness to work flexible schedule including overnight travel Valid Drivers License Benefits  Working for MVP has its perks! MVP proudly offers a competitive medical (partially Company-paid), dental, vision, life and disability plan; 401k retirement plan with a 3% match; Paid Time Off (starting at 13 days per year); and 9 Company-paid holidays. This position also includes a company vehicle, laptop, and cellphone.

jobTitle: Diabetes Sales Specialist - North Atlanta, GA
description: Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals, and branded generic medicines. Our 109,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.  At Abbott, we believe people with Diabetes should have the freedom to enjoy active lives. That’s why we’re focused on helping people with diabetes manage their health more effectively and comfortably, with life-changing products that provide accurate data to drive better-informed decisions. We’re revolutionizing the way people monitor their glucose levels with our new sensing technology.  What You'll Do  Diabetes Sales Specialist: A Unique Opportunity  The Diabetes Sales Specialist is responsible for growing sales with HCPs assigned to the territory by developing customer relationships, being an ambassador for Abbott’s Freestyle products, and strengthening overall market presence. This role is instrumental in delivery of sales and profitability objectives, as well as expanding brand reputation. This is a field-sales opportunity.  Primary Function Meeting or exceeding sales quotas/objectives for ADC Products. Collaborating with various channels, Managed Care, Retail, and Point of Care representatives. Establishing strong relationships with a broad base of internal and external health care constituents (e.g., physicians, nurses, pharmacists, CDEs, etc.). Acting in a friendly, respectful, adaptive manner while focusing on the needs and interests of others. Keeping current on internal and competitive products and positioning by utilizing a variety of resources. Understanding and conveying information professionally and accurately. Effectively planning for and following through with short and long term results based on business trends by developing plans that include goals, action plans, time frames and the appropriate resources. Keeping current in market trends and competitor’s strategy. Engage in sales-focused activities including: Conveying information and ideas clearly and concisely, answering s questions, responding to others, and listening s carefully to understand the needs of providers and patients. Positions products and services using appropriate resources and confident, convincing logic; tailor sales approach to meet customer needs. Utilize and distribute appropriate resources. Handle disagreements and objections by exploring perspectives and tactfully addressing them. Develops and implements plans (e.g., territory, account and call) that include goals, action items, time frames and resources. Regularly tracks and reports progress against plan, redirecting efforts as necessary. Completes all administrative tasks accurately and in a timely fashion. Document daily activity in call reporting / tracking system. Maintain accountability for all samples in accordance with Division guidelines. Work within quality guidelines established for compliance. Responsible for implementing and maintaining the effectiveness of the quality system. Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and performing other duties as assigned by management Required  Experience You'll Bring Bachelors Degree, or equivalent experience, required. Minimum of 3-5 years previous experience with commendable sales track record from previous positions preferable in health care industry. Excellent communication skills, high energy, integrity and ambition to succeed. Preferred A strong preference given to candidates with 4+ years of relevant experience. Diabetes clinical knowledge This position may be hired at different levels depending on the experience of the candidate.  What We Offer  At Abbott, you can have a good job that can grow into a great career. We offer: Training and career development, with onboarding programs for new employees and tuition assistance Financial security through competitive compensation, incentives and retirement plans Health care and well-being programs including medical, dental, vision, wellness and occupational health programs Paid time off 401(k) retirement savings with a generous company match The stability of a company with a record of strong financial performance and history of being actively involved in local communities Learn more about our benefits that add real value to your life to help you live fully:  www.abbottbenefits.com  Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that provides the growth and strength to build your future. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.  Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.

About Alpargatas: Alpargatas represents a powerhouse of hyper-connected and iconic brands. The company vision focuses on becoming increasingly global through major investments in digital, innovation and sustainability. Alpargatas is the largest footwear company in Latin America including brands: Havaianas and Osklen. Havaianas is the largest brand in the portfolio producing nearly 250 million pairs a year making it the largest flip flop brand globally. Osklen is a surf luxury brand from Rio de Janeiro and is one of the most sustainable apparel companies in the world.  About Havaianas: Havaianas is the largest brand of flip flops in the world and is increasing the product offering in apparel, accessories and new styles of footwear. The iconic design of its classic flip flop has been unchanged for 60 years and represents the most timeless design in open toe footwear. The brand is geared for growth in the US with 10+ stores, Havaianas.com, and surf specialty, apparel specialty, and presence in major department stores. Alpargatas is making significant investments in the NA&C operation to ensure Havaianas will take a leadership position in the market in the coming years.   Purpose of the Role:  Provide support and assistance to the Key Account Sales Manager in achieving sales targets for key accounts.  Key Duties and Responsibilities Run and format weekly/monthly selling reports. Track and analyze WTD-MTD-STD sales figures to identify trends and opportunities/ risks across all key accounts. Vendor portal management and order/forecasting - Nordstrom, Macy’s, Bloomingdale’s, Saks, Dillard’s, Kohl’s, Von Maur. Manage account requests for completion of new item setup templates, product attributes, image requests, inventory updates, etc.  Manage Key Account Order File. Review daily EDI to ensure bulks are reduced properly, work through corrections/PO extensions with accounts/customer service, and ensure all EDIs are received in a timely manner. Responsible for all seasonal updates in NuOrder to ensure product linesheets are loaded accurately with all relevant information for accounts to place orders. Work with Retail Assistance monthly to review reports, identify opportunities, track in-store presentations and report issues/findings. Responsible for organization and management of seasonal sample lines  Capabilities (Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities including Technical Requirements):  Min of 3 years of Wholesale experience (Sales or Buying) Working knowledge of retail math and concepts  Ability to be resourceful and problem solve effectively  Strong presentation, written and verbal communication skills   Proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook Prior experience working in SAP, NuOrder, SPS Commerce strongly preferred Bachelor’s Degree  Talents:  Proactive Results Oriented  Analytical Capability Organizational Skills Interpersonal Relationship Skill

description: Sales Trainer Sales training is essential to an organization’s success, and it’s a powerful tool for developing the full potential of every sales rep. The success of a program is due in large part to the individual delivering it—and the approach they take.  All applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. Location: Remote Storable is a distributed-first company, but is only registered for employment in a certain number of states. In order to be considered, you must permanently reside in the following states to be eligible for employment: Texas, Colorado, North Carolina, Tennessee, Florida, Illinois, Indiana, Kansas, Missouri, Pennsylvania, Georgia, Arizona, Alabama, Mississippi Louisiana, South Carolina, Oklahoma, Wyoming, Nebraska, Wisconsin, Virginia  About Us: At Storable, we believe storage operators should have one partner they can trust to help you get the results they need for their business. That’s why we’ve built the industry’s first fully integrated platform that offers facility management software, facility websites, marketing programs and services, payments, and deeply integrated tenant insurance capabilities all in one solution.  We leverage our platform in combination with our over 25 years of storage industry expertise to help our thousands of storage customers achieve their tenant experience and operational efficiency objectives every  single day.   What you will do everyday: Coach and develop our sales and CS reps Own all new hire Sales and CS training Review and improve our current sales process / training methodology - make strategic recommendations that help us drive to world class sales process and results  Leverage current call monitoring system that quantifies and calibrates call skill performance and identifies opportunities for improvement  Create, update, maintain, and report on rep coaching logs Work with Sales Leadership, Revenue Operations & Learning & Development to identify areas of opportunity, metrics, and behaviors to coach and monitor Assist sales management with driving adoption of processes and key metrics  Operational Activities & Responsibilities  Directly engage front-line sales team members to teach, mentor, coach and drive the sales process Engage and assist sales reps on active opportunities as needed Work with Learning & Development to prepare and organise digital and or physical job aids or other materials required to facilitate the learning process Facilitate the collection, sharing, and archiving of sales best practices Post training follow up and reinforcement Conduct regular recurring coaching sessions with their assigned reps Coach and assist reps with the activities and action items in their assigned coaching plans Monitor and evaluate sales calls with sales team members regularly  What you need to bring to the table: Strong background in sales and sales process training (at least 2-4 years of professional training experience) Sales Leadership experience is preferable Must be humble - the focus must remain on the participants and their development. Intellectually curious and facilitates authentic discussions Altruistic - motivated by having a positive impact on team members career Always looking for ways to improve their craft World class communicator - ability to communicate complex ideas that are easily absorbed by participants A great balance of strategic mindset with incredible hands on presence  A difference maker who loves helping a team to win  Benefits and Perks: Generous health coverage for you and your family, including short- and long-term disability coverage, 401(k) and HSA matching, company-provided life insurance, and more. Engage remotely! Since March of 2020, we transitioned to a fully remote environment and we run regular contests, trivia games and remote happy hours. Instant-Access & Flexible vacation. We trust you, so we have a ‘take what you need’ vacation policy. No waiting to use it or need for accruals. Do More, Be More – Company rewards and recognition that add up and can be redeemed for once-in-a-lifetime Bucketlist experiences! Get active in the community by joining one of our many quarterly offsite volunteer and community service events. Fun company events, including Halloween costume contests, ugly sweater competitions, baseball game outings, ice cream socials, food trucks, and more.  Storable is committed to providing equal employment opportunity (EEO) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. In addition, Storable will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

description: My name is Rick Alexander, an Account Executive with Management Recruiters of Davidson. My client is looking for a Field Sales Representative in a Remote location. Please read through this description below and contact me if you are interested in discussing it further. Also, if you might know of someone who would be interested in this position, please let me know.     Field Sales Representative   Job Description:  The Field Sales Representative will manage assigned accounts to market, position, and sell fluoropolymer resins. This position will take direction from the business manager and work with the Technical Support and Business Operations groups to ensure the growth and profitability of the business.   Functions:  Develops and meets annual sales budget from existing, targeted, and prospective assigned accounts through direct, written, and verbal sales contact. Maintains relationships with customers through planned sales calls, telephone, and written contact. Maintains strategic account profiles in CRM and communicate key issues, short and long-term sales strategies, and opportunities to maximize the sales volume and margin in the assigned territory Negotiates short- and long-term contracts to secure business by establishing pricing, terms, volumes, grades purchased, release quantities, packaging, shipping details, and creates and implements rebate programs to protect market share. Work with outside agencies and inside sales and marketing groups to develop sales and marketing programs. These can include webinars, lunch, and learn presentations, email blasts, technical presentations at conferences, industry magazines, and website articles, and videos   Requirements:  5-10 years of sales experience with coating raw materials or coatings.  2-5 years of technical service experience with coating raw materials manufacturer Familiarity with industrial and architectural coatings and markets. 2-5 years of R&D and formulation experience in the coatings industry, including work with urethanes and polysiloxanes. Experience with PPG, Sherwin Williams, Akzo Nobel, Carboline, Tnemec, Arkema, Dow, Evonik, Axalta, BASF, Hentzen, APV Engineered Coatings, Covestro, Allnex, Lubrizol, Polynt, Univar, Clariant, Huntsman, Eastman Chemical

description: Cocoa Beach, FL 32931, USA ? Merritt Island, FL, USA ? Port Canaveral, FL 32920, USA  Req #4906  Tuesday, January 26, 2021  Coca-Cola Beverages Florida, LLC (Coke Florida) is a family-owned independent Coca-Cola bottler that is the third largest privately-held and the sixth largest independent Coca-Cola bottler in the United States. Coke Florida's exclusive territory covers over 18 million consumers across 47 Florida counties, and includes the major metropolitan markets of Jacksonville, Miami, Orlando and Tampa. Coke Florida sells, markets, manufactures and distributes over 600 products of The Coca-Cola Company and other partner companies including Monster Beverage Corporation and BODYARMOR. In 2017, Coke Florida generated over $1.2 billion in revenue and the company currently has approximately 4,800 employees.  As one of the first US greenfield independent Coca-Cola bottlers in nearly sixty years, Coke Florida is at an exciting stage in its transformational journey to become a leading-edge beverage company, the best bottler in the Coca-Cola System, and one of the best companies to work for in Florida.  **Sales Account Manager**  The Sales Account Manager (** SAM) is responsible for business development and customer relationships. The SAM increases business by selling additional brands and packages within his or her sales territory's existing customer base. The Sales Account Manager at Coke Florida works across all sales channels. This role will focus on the Port Canaveral,Merritt Island and Cocoa Beach areas. **Role Responsibilities**  â€¢Make sales and obtain orders from customers  â€¢Customarily and regularly perform primary duties in the field visiting customer accounts away from a company facility or office  â€¢Build and maintain profitable customer relationships  â€¢Execute and close all sales calls  â€¢Sell in incremental displays and equipment placements; sell in promotional programs and ensure dealer compliance  â€¢Review business results with customers  **â€¢**  Ensure company assets meet performance requirements and develop a plan of action for those assets generating zero or low volume  â€¢ Ensure outlets comply with Coke Florida standards  â€¢ Communicate account activities to appropriate parties  â€¢ Merchandising and rotation inspection  â€¢ Resolve customer inquiries, including researching and closing customer service tickets  â€¢ Transport, replace and maintain Point of Sale advertising as appropriate for account  â€¢ Maintain regular and punctual attendance  â€¢ Work overtime as assigned  â€¢ Comply with all company policies, procedures and applicable laws  â€¢ Identifying and reporting any unsafe working conditions  â€¢ Comply with dress code or appearance/grooming standards  â€¢ Work shifts and work schedules as assigned  **Role Requirements**  â€¢ High School Diploma or equivalent, Bachelor degree preferred  â€¢ Must be 18 years of age or older  â€¢ 1+ years of general work experience  â€¢ 1+ years previous sales experience preferred  Â€¢ Food/beverage Industry Experience Preferred  â€¢ Ability to create and conduct sales presentations  â€¢ Strong attention to detail and follow-up skills  â€¢ Excellent planning and organization skills  â€¢ Proficient in computer application skills  â€¢ Ability to use and understand mobile applications  â€¢ Ability to work variable schedule, weekends and holidays  â€¢ Must have and maintain a valid driver's license  â€¢ Must have and maintain current vehicle liability insurance, as specified by company  â€¢ Must have a driving record with no major moving violations in the last three (3) years*  â€¢ Must provide and maintain a personal vehicle for use during employee working hours  â€¢ Frequent lifting of 25+ pounds. Occasional lifting of 50+ pounds, bending, reaching, kneeling, and light merchandising  â€¢ Ability to read information in small, medium, and large print  â€¢ Ability to stand a minimum of 6 hours during the workday  â€¢ Ability to walk a minimum of 4 miles during the workday Major moving violations include, but are not limited to, leaving the scene of an accident, driving under the influence, and reckless driving. Minor moving violations include, but are not limited to, speeding, driving too close, failure to stop, and improper lane changes. Driving records, including minor moving violations, will be evaluated according to Coke Florida guidelines to determine eligibility for the Sales Account Manager position. Physical Abilities  â€¢ Ability to repetitively lift, carry, and position objects weighing up to 50 pounds without assistance  â€¢ Ability to repetitively push and pull objects weighing up to 50 pounds without assistance while kneeling; squatting; reaching above the head; reaching at the waist; reaching below the knees; and bending at the knees  â€¢ Ability to repetitively push and pull manual transport equipment (for example, pallet jack, handtruck) containing product loads a minimum of 100 yards without assistance  â€¢ Ability to repetitively grasp and manipulate objects of varying size and weight requiring fine motor skills and hand-eye coordination  â€¢ Ability to exert oneself physically over sustained periods of time to complete job activities  â€¢ Ability to read information in small, medium, and large print  â€¢ Ability to stand a minimum of 6 hours during the workday  â€¢ Ability to walk a minimum of 4 miles during the workday  â€¢ Frequently work in a hot/humid outdoor environment  Coca-Cola Beverages Florida is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.  **Other details** Job Family Sales Job Function Sales Pay Type Salary Apply Now Cocoa Beach, FL 32931, USA Merritt Island, FL, USA Port Canaveral, FL 32920, USA

ADP is hiring an Account Executive - Outside Sales. In this position, you'll identify and cultivate new prospects from relationships built with Bankers, Accountants, existing clients, as well as direct prospecting efforts. In addition you will cross-sell solutions to existing clients, and effectively close sales, with the support of exceptional sales training and the rewards of advancement opportunities and industry-leading compensation, benefits, incentive trips and awards.  Unlock Your Career Potential: Sales at ADP. It takes a relentless team to lead an industry. ADP's world-class sales team is driving our global growth as a worldwide leader of workforce solutions. If you believe in the power of relationships, we'll give you the tools, training and support you need to connect with new and current customers, ranging from Fortune 100 corporations to small start-ups. And as you achieve success, you'll enjoy the rewards, support and recognition you deserve.  At ADP we are driven by your success. We engage your unique talents and perspectives. We welcome your ideas on how to do things differently and better. In your efforts to achieve, learn and grow, we support you all the way. If success motivates you, you belong at ADP. We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility. RESPONSIBILITIES: Develop and execute a cold calling strategy to target prospects Mine existing clients for referral business Build mutually beneficial relationships with Bankers and Accountants Reach or exceed assigned sales goals Implement sales strategies Connect customers' business needs with ADP products and services Cross-sell other ADP solutions to existing clients Build network in person and via phone with key decision makers in a designated territory  QUALIFICATIONS PREFERRED: Bachelor's degree  At ADP, we believe that diversity fuels innovation. Our diversity benefits our associates, clients, and our communities. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, non-job related physical or mental disability, or protected veteran status. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.  ADP is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer; M/F/D/V. ADP believes that diversity leads to strength.

SALES EXECUTIVE - Digital Marketing  Let's talk about the role.   Attane is seeking a self-motivated, results-driven Sales Executive to join our rapidly growing organization. As a Sales Executive you are a hunter with demonstrated over achievement. You enjoy a challenge, and have a love for the fast paced, variety that working with multiple clients provide. You're a master at owning the sales cycle from beginning to end, identifying key stakeholders, and driving solutions to complex business problems. You will drive the sales process in a performance-based environment, be responsible for engaging with new customers, accelerating the sales process, and closing new business. We have an amazing team that works to deliver in a collaborative and innovative manner. This is an exciting opportunity within an environment where you understand the value of sales to an organization and incredibly sales growth opportunity for you.   The Sales Executive will be responsible to cultivate and secure new business relationships, selling Attane products and services, in their defined territory. Success in this position is based on the achievement of defined new business sales and revenue production goals.   Some challenges you’ll tackle:    Achieve defined new sales targets and in year revenue production goals. Develop and present a comprehensive, annual territory plan designed to articulate the best options to achieve assigned sales targets. Develop and present Target Account plans, as requested, designed to surface large scale new business opportunities. Proactively drive new pipeline development through appropriate sales engagement tactics which may include but are not limited to cold calling, email communications, social media, and trade show participation. Engage and educate prospects regarding Attane’s solution offering and value proposition with the intention of driving quick qualification decisions. Facilitate prospect meetings whether in person, via conference call or leveraging digital collaboration tools and achieve volume and quality-related goals for sales engagements. Responsibly engage internal subject matter experts in support of sales cycle progression when required. Leverage the sales methodology employed by Attane to qualify, progress, engage and close new business opportunities. Manage detailed pipeline and opportunity information updates in Attane’s Salesforce system. Communicate market and competitor related feedback to appropriate Attane resources (i.e. Product Management) in support of solution evolution. Travel is required   What you bring to the team.  5 years’ successfully selling digital marketing services and/or SaaS sales experience  Bachelor's degree in sales, business administration, marketing, or related field. Significant market expertise and connections within the target segment(s). Strong communication capabilities that include tailoring communication style to the audience. Proficient with online collaboration technology such as WebEx, Zoom, Microsoft Teams, etc. and sales engagement platforms such as Outreach.  Strong discovery and closing skills are critical  Preferable but not essential – Experience in the Senior Living industry.   What makes you stand out?  Ability to navigate a prospect organization and uncover their buying process. An understanding of best practices related to SEO, marketing automation, paid media is highly preferred.  Experience in providing realistic and achievable forecasts. Proficient in objective & decisive deal qualification. Familiarity in selling digital solutions. The ability to assess and critique existing website and digital marketing tactics Ability to effectively prioritize work efforts and operate independently with a strong sense of accountability. Must be energized by a fast-paced environment and able to work as part of a team. An appreciation for the relationships that exist between potential clients and the company currently, as well as historically. Knowledgeable of marketing services trends and best practices. “Hands-on" personality; a willingness to be involved in day-to-day activities associated with B2B sales; strong sense of ownership and ability to work independently. Curiosity/desire for continuous learning. This position provides a competitive salary based on experience, a commission structure and comprehensive benefits package.   Get to Know Us  Attane, formerly GlynnDevins, is the leading marketing solutions provider trusted by the senior living and healthcare industries to drive sales and business success. Our data-driven understanding of the customer journey and more than 30 years of experience delivering results provide unparalleled value to clients — empowering them to engage with success.  Attane is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Director of Sales The Role of a Director of Sales is to motivate, mentor, and develop their team to reach their highest potential in event and catering sales. The Director of Sales not only sells their own Events, but oversees the Sales Team to drive Event and Catering Sales for the Location. The Director of Sales is the bridge between sales and operations and works in close contact with the General Manager. The responsibilities include Leading the Sales Team, Teaching and Coaching the Sales Team, Communicating efficiently with the General Manager and Executive Chef, executing the Sales Strategy and Plan for the Location, Managing incoming Leads and BEO details, and Managing Reports and Financials. Pinstripes offers many types of Events such as Birthdays, Graduations, Weddings, Mitzvahs, Corporate Meetings, Corporate Team Buildings, and Off-Site. The Director of Sales will work with Clients who vary between all Markets, such as Social Events, Corporate Events, and Off-Site Catering Events. We are seeking an individual who is dedicated to keeping Guests as our Core Focus, Driving Sales, and Consistently Delivering High Level Experience to our Guests.   Responsibilities: o Owns the Quarterly Event and Catering Sales Strategy set by Chief Sales Officer o Effectively communicate the strategy progress and results to CSO o Distribute incoming event and catering leads to appropriate team members o Educate team on conversion and develop team members to reach and maintain conversion goal o Understand all Event & Catering Packages and Options o Add input on monthly local Store Marketing calls o Understand competitors and how to win against them o Stay on top of market trends o Stay connected with community and top decision makers in market o Manage the team to maintain a guest-centered focus o Ensure that Sales Reporting is accurate, and understand individual and team sales numbers o Understand sales team’s strengths and areas of opportunity o Assist with onboarding new sales team members o Own the initial sales team training program and hold team accountable to their potential o Perform sales team personal evaluations o Ensure team is upholding to systems & SOPs  Requirements • Previous High Volume Sales Experience (5+ Years) preferably in hospitality, restaurant, and/or entertainment venue • Previous Director Level Experience (2+ Years) • Ability to motivate others • Ability to create a positive culture • Demonstrates deep knowledge of the location market • Capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously while remaining calm under pressure • Extremely Organized and Efficient • Flexible in approach, can readily adopt to business and team needs and changes • Excellent Computer Skills (Microsoft Word, Excel, Gmail) • Previous CRM usage preferred • Excellent Communication and Leadership Skills  Expectations: • Flexibility in Responsibilities and Tasks • Responsible and Reliable Schedule and Transportation Benefits: • Competitive Base Salary + Commission Structure • Bonus Program • Stocks in a Growing Company • 401K Program • Health Insurance Options • Personal Time Off

HempFusion is one of a select few CBD and supplement companies that are today fully prepared to meet or exceed expected FDA guidance.  We are a leading health and wellness company whose family of premium consumer brands include HempFusion™, Sagely Naturals™, Apothecanna™, and Probulin Probiotics™, one of the fastest-growing probiotics companies in the United States according to SPINs reported data.  We are looking for an experienced CPG and FDMC sales expert to lead the sales efforts for the HempFusion Wellness Family of Brands.  This enterprise-level role will work with brands like Sagely Naturals, Apothecanna, HempFusion, and Probulin.   The  SVP of Sales is responsible for developing the sales and growth strategy for an industry-leading globally recognized CPG company.  This role leads our sales strategy for multiple brands selling into the FDMC, Amazon, Convenience, and Natural channels.      As a member of the Executive leadership team, the SVP, Sales will be responsible for executing and driving a comprehensive business plan that will result in the delivery of sales and profit growth.    What are the characteristics of success? As we are a growing startup, the role requires someone who is resourceful and willing to take on responsibilities outside of traditional CPG operations responsibilities and scope. Highly empathetic and thoughtful - compassionate and exhibits kindness towards others Passionate about wellness HempFusion is a category creator - we are looking for people who are naturally curious and constantly looking for ways to innovate beyond the status quo. However, we are not looking to break things. “In a gentle way, you can shake the world” Positive, welcoming & collaborative, and values the diversity of the team and their perspectives Cultivates positive energy in one’s self and others Autonomous in nature and able to achieve high impact in an unstructured environment Highly analytical with a sense for solving problems that others may not realize exist Integrity - Doing the right thing even when no one is watching - because it’s the right thing to do Sees the value in being part of a strong team and wants to take part in building one  Responsibilities: Develop and communicate the overall vision of the sales team, ensuring alignment with company goals and strategy. Responsible for developing short-term buyer-sales plan as well as multi-year sales strategy and plan. Develop and execute successful sales strategies for rapid revenue growth and market share expansion in key markets. Ensure strong alignment with marketing across all channels at both the strategic and tactical levels. Work internally with executive leadership to accurately forecast revenue and sales goals as well as providing vision and business focus Develop a high-performance team through effective management, organization, development, and motivation of personnel. Develop comprehensive business plans for branch locations to meet overall business objectives. Oversee the implementation of new services and programs that meet the customers’ needs and organizational goals. Encourage new ideas and foster a shared understanding of programs and market concepts that are pertinent to target markets. Coach, motivate, and direct Sales team in generating new accounts and revenue streams while achieving annual sales quota. Develop and maintain key strategic regional and executive relationships with key accounts, target accounts, and manufacturing. Ensure that revenue objectives are met or exceeded. Plan and execute sales and marketing activities to maximize and develop the company’s sales revenues. Set and monitor sales and marketing strategic direction and growth strategies. Ensure the development of sales and marketing programs and improvement initiatives that support business objectives. Establish and monitor key indicators and other tools that measure accountability in the area of sales including SPINS, IRI, and Neilsen; monitor efficiency of sales team operation. Monitor competition within the industry and develop plans to impede competitive advances.  How you know you’re a fit: BS/BA Degree in Business Management, Operations, or Marketing. MBA Preferred. 5+ years sales leadership experience in the CPG industry, specifically health & beauty and/or supplements, working with FDMC accounts and Amazon with at least 3+ years as the functional sales leader driving all sales strategy. 10+ years of experience as a Sales Director including a proven track record of achieving overall sales targets, strategic planning and implementation, market development, and new product development. Demonstrated experience in working within dynamic, fast-growth organizations that have managed tight budgets, scrappy teams, and short timelines. Understands how to interpret third-party sales data (e.g. IRI barcode data) and apply findings to KPI development, sales, new product development, and channel strategy. Ethical brand leader proficient in product strategy and identifying product opportunities. Intimate understanding of key stores within territories and nuances by channel and region. Highly analytical thinker who has strength in retail sales analysis and detailed short and long-term planning. Entrepreneurial self-starter who thrives wearing many hats and works well independently. Strong track record of business acumen, knowledge of the consumer-packaged goods and specifically food and beverage industry, distributor network is preferred. Excellent sales and negotiation skills with the ability to analyze business through case, revenue, and margin growth. Financial acumen, FP&A responsibility. Strategic thinker, with an insight into the key actions that will make significant contributions to the food and beverage industry.    Salary and Benefits: In accordance with Colorado’s Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, The salary range for this position is $175.000 - $200,000 US. Actual compensation may vary depending on factors such as experience level, education, and location.  HempFusion Wellness offers a full suite of benefits, including medical, dental, vision, and generous paid time off.  This position may be eligible to participate in the company's options plan, subject to approval by and at the sole discretion of the HempFusion Wellness Board of Directors.   More About the Company: At HempFusion, we are committed to supporting wellness, for our customers and our own employees. Sure, we work hard, and we also believe it's important to create both products and an environment that values the whole person. That means creating a culture that values physical and emotional health, as well as financial stability, community involvement, and spiritual wellbeing - which we know means different things to different people. We value diversity, belonging, integrity, and inclusion. We believe everyone can be a leader in his or her own way, and we seek ways to help our employees, retailers, ambassadors, and customers all help lead along our journey of greater wellness In addition to health and wellness, we also focus specific efforts on improving the quality of our environment and, thus, the future of our planet. We practice targeted philanthropy, with the belief that the result of thoughtful support will have a ripple effect through the community, and perhaps the world.  HempFusion is one of a select few CBD companies who are today fully prepared to meet or exceed expected FDA guidance, HempFusion Wellness Inc. is a leading health and wellness company whose family of premium consumer brands include HempFusion™, Sagely Naturals™, Apothecanna™, and Probulin Probiotics™, one of the fastest-growing probiotics companies in the United States according to SPINs reported data.  Utilizing the power of whole-food hemp nutrition, the HempFusion family of brands’ product portfolio comprises 112 SKUs including USDA Organic Certified Tinctures, proprietary FDA Drug Listed Over-The-Counter (OTC) Topicals, probiotic supplements, and skincare products, a Doctor/Practitioner line, a White Label division and more. With a strong focus on research and development, HempFusion Wellness has 43 products under development.  Available from more than 15,000 US retail locations across all 50 states, HempFusion Wellness products are also available in China, Mexico, Ireland, United Kingdom, United Arab Emirates, South Korea, and Canada and may be purchased online from each brand’s website, The Probulin Store on Amazon.com, Alibaba’s Tmall.com, the world’s largest cross-border online marketplace, and a multitude of additional e-commerce sites.  For more information, visit www.hempfusion.com. Follow HempFusion on Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.
industries: Consumer Goods, Health, Wellness and Fitness, and Alternative Medicine

description: Looking for a successful Local Account Executive that is a high-energy hunter focused on building relationships at all levels. The Local Account Executive is motivated by identifying and solving advertising problems on behalf of the customer. They must be a strategic thinker with exceptional prospecting skills, high energy and a structured solution selling process. They are natural leaders with a desire to win in a collaborative, team environment. Key Responsibilities: • Identify, uncover, and develop account opportunities. • Up selling and leveraging business from new and established customer relationships. • Excellent ability to properly qualify projects to maximize an efficient sales cycle. • Develop and deliver custom sales presentations and demonstrations. • Choreograph and conduct on-site assessments of customer requirements and needs. • Collaborate with internal creative department and clients to assist in development of effective advertising campaigns. • Partner with Charting, Creative, Operations and Administrative staff to ensure on time delivery of advertisements in agreed upon locations. • Assist in the resolution of issues related to billing and accounts. Knowledge & Experience: • Ability to successfully work under tight project deadlines. • Ability to understand existing business processes as well as investigate and troubleshoot issues in a time critical environment. • Ability to link vision and strategy with overall business objectives and communicate rationale in a compelling, concise manner. • Demonstrate a repertoire of skills such as scheduling, prioritizing, organizing, planning, problem solving, decision-making, financial savvy, and attention to detail, and follow through. • Maintain a big picture, strategic outlook with the ability to iterate from company strategy and planning • Self-motivated, standout colleague, action-and-results oriented. • Well organized, exceptional communication and presentation skills- effective communicator/presenter to groups of all sizes and levels of management • Extraordinary selling capability • Ability to sell at all levels including C-Level positions Preferred qualifications/Education: • Demonstrated relationship building skills that extend to internal team members in pre/post-sales. • Proficiency in all aspects of the sales cycle, including qualifying accounts. • Experience selling mobile mobile/digital advertising ecosystem a plus. • Ability to understand products and effectively identify how it can provide value to a prospective customer. • Ability to work within a dynamic and fast-paced environment. • College degree or equivalent practical experience. • 2+ years’ experience in OOH advertising, media sales. • Local Market knowledge preferred.

jobTitle: Regional Vice President - Sales Meritain Health
description: Job Description  Sales Vice President in the Mid-South (NC, SC) to drive profitable membership growth in the self-funded market. Develops strategy, distribution, and collaboration with local market Aetna teams to target clients who prefer a TPA value proposition.  The Sales Executive is responsible for new sales growth for Meritain Health, an Aetna Company in their local market.  Meritain targets customers who prefer to self-fund their benefits plan using a customization third-party administrator model. *we are only able to consider candidates with prior insurance (Health - self funded ideally) sales experience at this time.  Lead all Meritain sales efforts to solve complex benefit challenges using customized self-funded solutions.  Works through the external broker community to promote and develop the Meritain brand in the local market.  Establish local market partnerships with Aetna sales teams and sales leaders to maximize the Aetna distribution channel. Identify products, services, and strategies that solve challenges for TPA clients. Assist with strategic planning, budgeting and forecasting process.  Required Qualifications  Sales professional who help build our business in the Middle Market, distribution channel, group insurance and specialty products areas.  Sales Executive goal is to meet customer needs and help them make better decisions and about their health care and health care spending.  Develops and cultivates strong relationships with key constituents (producers, plan sponsors and/or consumers depending on business) to maximize sales opportunities and achieve profitable growth.  Oversees a block of business or may develop new business opportunities to ensure profitable customers and help grow the business through consultative selling, issue resolution and superior service.  Ensures product, pricing and services meet client's needs while meeting Aetna revenue growth and profit objectives.  Manages and builds producer relations as needed depending on book of business or market segment  being supported.  Identifies various ways to partner with the client by drawing from entire spectrum of product line illustrating a keen understanding of client's multifaceted needs and benefits of Aetna's full product array.  Collaborates with internal partners and/or external constituents to uncover profitable growth and cross-sell opportunities within new or existing customers and to support post-sale activities.  Coordinates sales materials, testimonials and subject matter expert involvement in support of the successful delivery of constituent presentations.  May participate in constituent meetings including finals presentations.  Develops/maintains and communicates expertise on products, industry and emerging marketplace trends.  COVID Requirements  COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement  CVS Health requires its Colleagues in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated. If you are vaccinated, you are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status within the first 30 days of your employment. For the two COVID-19 shot regimen, you will be required to provide proof of your second COVID-19 shot within the first 60 days of your employment. Failure to provide timely proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status will result in the termination of your employment with CVS Health. If you are unable to be fully vaccinated due to disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief, you will be required to apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 30 days of your employment in order to remain employed with CVS Health. As a part of this process, you will be required to provide information or documentation about the reason you cannot be vaccinated. If your request for an accommodation is not approved, then your employment may be terminated. Preferred Qualifications  Sales/Delivering on the Promise  Service/Demonstrating Service Discipline  Sales/Selling Products and Services  Sales/Cultivating Distribution Channels  Leadership/Collaborating for Results  General Business/Demonstrating Business and Industry Acumen  Health Insurance Licenses in applicable states  Education  Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

Location:               Southeast Regional States (AL, GA, MS, SC, NC, TN, FL) Title:                     Regional Sales Representative, Cayman Islands Dept. of Tourism Department:          Sales Reports To:           National Sales Manager        JOB SUMMARY: Conducts ongoing sales promotional activities within the assigned region in accordance with established sales targets and DOT approved sales and marketing plans. Researches demographic, psychographic and other lifestyle profiles in order to identify target markets and clients within the assigned region. Determines the most effective sales techniques and carries out the sales activities in order to achieve sales targets. In this position, extensive travel is required within the region. Some travel to other locations in the United States and the Cayman Islands.  Essential JOB FUNCTIONS include the following. Other duties may be assigned.  Promotes the Cayman Islands as a preferred travel destination to the travel industry and to consumers through a DOT-approved sales and promotional mix. Develops and executes a marketing and promotion strategy for the Cayman Islands that considers the specific/unique characteristics of the assigned region and the target population or groups within that assigned region. Includes detailed support of direct, nonstop air service routes within the region. Develops, in conjunction with the National Sales Manager and General Manager, and implements the sales activity targets and schedules as well as the marketing and promotional plan for the region within a designated yearly budget. Participates in and coordinates a variety of sales, marketing and promotional activities including sales calls, sales blitzes, destination training to agencies, trade and consumer shows, seminars, public speaking engagements and familiarization trips within an assigned region/territory. Reviews Arrival Destination Information and other data. Monitors sales activity performance within the assigned region; identifies poor performance areas and opportunities for increased performance within the assigned region; develops strategies to address poorly and/or underperforming areas within the assigned region. Maintains databases of contacts, event schedules, participants’ lists, etc. Fulfills or ensures fulfillment in a timely manner, all requests for collateral information from prospective clients, agencies, etc. within the region. At times, may be required to conduct or direct specific projects or studies and provide progress reports within a specified timeframe. Reports to the National Sales Manager on a regular basis on progress within all areas of responsibility.  JOB SPECIFICATIONS:  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.   Individual must reside within the assigned territory.  Qualifications/SKILLS: Essential: ·      Associate degree or equivalent in Marketing or Business Administration, with a concentration or certificate in Marketing or Tourism ·      A minimum of 3 years experience in a tourism-related field ·      Minimum 5 years experience Marketing Tourism in lieu of degree ·      Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite ·      Detail orientated and highly organized ·      Self-starter ·      Outstanding customer service skills ·      Excellent written and verbal communication skills ·      Ability to multi-task ·      Experience with sales and promotional events ·      Routinely handle objects weighing up to 25 lbs. and on occasion may be expected to lift objects weighing up to 40 lbs. ·      Have access to an automobile and possess a valid driver’s license. ·      Must be able to travel internationally and hold a valid passport.  ·     Desirable: ·      Practical knowledge of and exposure to the Cayman Islands and Caribbean region ·      Scuba diving certification   Additional Responsibilities: Supervises/coordinates activities at promotional events.   Please send resume to recruitment@caymanislands.ky                                  Deadline for receipt of a resume: October 8th, 2021

Account Executive  Company Overview Bardy Diagnostics, Inc. (“BardyDx”) is an innovator in digital health and remote patient monitoring, with a focus on providing the most diagnostically accurate and patient-friendly cardiac and vital signs patch monitors in the industry. Currently, BardyDx has FDA 510(k) clearance and CE Mark approval to market the Carnation Ambulatory Monitor (CAM) Patch and is presently launched in the U.S. and multiple international countries with over 60,000 patients helped already.  Position Overview & Purpose Bardy Diagnostics is building a team of passionate people who share an entrepreneurial spirit and are dedicated to making a difference in advancing patient care. It is our desire to create a “family – like” culture among the commercial team and across the company as we continue to build the team and grow. Currently, we are looking for Account Executives to join our Sales Team who are passionate about digital health and helping cardiac patients through our innovative remote patient monitoring body sensor technologies. The right individuals will join a dynamic and fast paced start-up environment and work with cross-functional teams to raise awareness about BardyDx and our innovative CAM Patch, and to drive market adoption of the CAM Patch as the new standard of care in cardiac monitoring. Ideal candidates will have a combination of medical sales (ideally with a focus on Cardiology or EP) and B2B sales experience, with some start-up or small company experience preferred. The ability to deal with adversity, and to quickly adapt new sales strategies as market conditions change, are ideal traits for this position.  Core Job Functions & Responsibilities • Develop and implement a territory business plan and sales strategy • Increase revenue in assigned territory by promoting BardyDx’s Core products and services • Develop relationships with Electrophysiologists, Cardiologists, Internal Medicine, Family Practice, Neurologists and Emergency Medicine Physicians to drive increased adoption of products & services • Develop and maintain relationships with physicians, office staff, and practice/hospital administration • Spend 80% of your time in the assigned territory promoting the company’s products and services • Gain a deep understanding of customer needs, determine ways to improve the overall customer experience, and generate new sales and marketing tactics that grow market share, and drive growth • Manage your business ethically and stay within company budget guidelines with business expenses • Train staff, physicians and administration on the proper usage and billing codes for our products & services • Perform other duties as assigned or required  Required Experience & Skills • Bachelor’s degree with a combination of successful medical sales (ideally with a focus on Cardiology or Electrophysiology) and B2B sales experience is the ideal target background experience • Previous Cardiology or Electrophysiology Sales experience preferred • Previous Medical Device or Diagnostic Services Sales experience strongly preferred • Previous Cardiac Monitoring or Cardiology preferred • Experience selling to hospitals, including Emergency Departments, is strongly preferred, but not required • Some start-up or small company experience preferred (ability to deal with adversity, to execute with limited resources, and to quickly adapt new sales strategies as market conditions change)

MEDICAL DEVICE / SURGICAL SALES OPPORTUNITY  BALTIMORE "Sales Associate"  Great opportunity to land a career position in surgical device sales with our client, a national leader in surgical devices, instruments and implants. 1+ years of outside B2B sales required. Candidates need to live in greater Baltimore area and will work in 100% support of the MD Sr Sales Consultant. Once trained, you will be working with current accounts (hospitals/surgeons) and standing in surgeries as a consultant on your products.    Compensation  $65k Base Salary  $10k Annual Bonus $400/mo Car Allowance + all gas / business expenses reimbursed First Year Total Compensation = $80k Excellent Full Benefits package  Requirements  Must live in Baltimore metro area BS/BA degree Minimum of 1 year outside B2B sales experience Must have a car and ability to travel as needed Candidates must WANT medical device sales where a high percentage of the day is spent working in hospitals and in surgery... Candidates must be very personable / self-driven / solid work ethic / high integrity  Typical candidate loves to hustle & provide superior customer service; is hungry to increase market share (competitive), wants a performance based compensation plan, brings a very personal, professional & engaging personality and a track record of success/accomplishments.  SkillBridge is a professional search firm.

description: FIELD SALES AND MARKETING REPRESENTATIVE – Techtronic Industries, NA (TTI) About Us: TTI is a world-class leader in design, manufacturing and marketing of power tools and accessories, outdoor product equipment and floor care for consumers, professional and industrial users in the home improvement, repair and construction industries. Our unrelenting strategic focus on powerful brands, innovative products, operational excellence and exceptional people drives our culture. This focus and drive provides TTI with a powerful platform for sustainable leadership and strong growth. Our brands and products are recognized worldwide for their deep heritage, superior quality, outstanding performance and compelling innovation. Our products include professional power tools and accessories, outdoor power equipment and floor care. Brands represented include Milwaukee®, AEG®, Ryobi®, Hoover®, Dirt Devil®, HART®, Oreck ® and Vax®. TTI is fast-paced, our team is high energy, and we reward out-of-the-box thinking to foster innovation in order to be the best in our industry. We provide a multi-faceted training program and hands-on field experience that will stimulate, challenge and reward you!  Duties and Responsibilities: • Perform best-in-class sales and service to consumers while demonstrating knowledge and enthusiasm for TTI products. • Maximize sell through of TTI Power Tool brands by properly merchandising point of purchase material. • Support and implement strategic corporate brand marketing initiatives and promotional activities. • Strengthen and maintain positive relationships with customers, Team TTI Management, and our retail partners. • Maintain regular contact with assigned retail partner store associates and management to cultivate strong relationships. • Monitor weekly sales and analyze monthly results to identify additional opportunities and understand the competition. • Participate in the training program and implement all acquired skills to deliver results. • Initiate and provide in-store product training sessions and demonstrations to educate store associates, management and customers. • Professionally communicate with all peers, customers and management. • Plan and execute demo events, stores walks, trade shows, etc. • Develop primary knowledge of the market place (users, applications, products, competition, and channels) to effectively analyze market potential and communicate competitor market data. Note: Employee's duties and responsibilities are not limited by the above. Other duties may be assigned as deemed necessary by employee's supervisor. In addition to the basic requirements of the position, all employees are expected to meet the company's goals of continual improvement in the areas of knowledge, skills, processes and quality.  Education and Experience Requirements • Bachelor degree or equivalent work experience in retail sales, field sales or customer service required. • Valid driver's license required. • Relocation may be required for future promotional opportunities. • Ability to work nights and weekends. • Capable of lifting and transporting heavy tools (up to 50 lbs.) and requesting assistance as needed. Capable of reaching and/or lifting overhead in addition to ascending/descending ladders to move product. Capable of using hands to maneuver small objects, assemble tools and build displays. • Applicant should be self-motivated and a team player with strong organizational, planning and time management skills. • Applicant must be MS Office proficient.

WHO WE ARE: Here at Medix, we are dedicated to providing workforce solutions to clients representing a variety of industries. Our recruiters and account executives live out our core purpose of “Positively Impacting Lives” by connecting the right people to the right opportunities.Through our recruiting efforts, we are committed to fulfilling our core purpose as an organization—to positively impact 20,000 lives. Our commitment to our core purpose guides not only the way we interact with our clients and talent, but also with our co-workers! The goal is lofty, but it is made attainable through the hard work and dedication of our teams and their willingness to lock arms together. Are you ready to lock arms with us?  WHAT YOU'LL DO: • Phase 1: Learn the fundamentals of the Medix recruiting process Identify qualified candidates through a number of creative outlets (i.e. job boards, networking groups, social media, etc.) Assess candidates through phone screening, interviewing, skills testing, and reference checks Consistently meet and exceed quotas Obtain and generate sales leads and set new meetings with potential clients Participate in weekly progress meetings to determine product knowledge  • Phase 2: Learn the fundamentals of the Medix sales process and start to integrate sales skills while continuing to work as a recruiter Participate in sales role plays Review the Medix Sales Playbook and learn about various products and sales strategies Participate in weekly progress meetings to determine product and sales knowledge  • Phase 3: Sales development Cold call to set new meetings Attend meetings with current account executives Continue to participate in weekly progress meetings, coaching, role plays, etc.  • Phase 4: Move into Medix Account Executive role Maintain and develop relationships with new and potential clients by building a strong network (joining associations, networking groups, social media, etc.) Obtain and generate sales leads and set new meetings with potential clients Effectively sell Medix staffing services Develop and execute a territory plan Negotiate client contracts Assist, develop, and manage a team of recruiters Consistently meet and exceed weekly and quarterly quotas Serve as point of contact for candidates and clients by resolving any issues that may arise  WHAT YOU’LL NEED: • 1-2 years full time or internship experience • Proven track record of success in previous role • Service-oriented, positive attitude • Competitive mindset • Proven desire and ability to take initiative • Ability to multitask and work in a fast paced environment • Interest in working in a results driven culture with visible KPIs • Bachelor’s Degree preferred  WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU: • Competitive salary + uncapped commission • Traditional and Roth IRA 401(k)with employer matching • Comprehensive medical insurance • Dental/Vision insurance • Pet insurance • Competitive paid time off program and 8 paid holidays • Employer financed life, long term and short term disability insurance • Comprehensive training and professional development program • Promotion opportunities • Opportunity to participate in community and philanthropic events • Employer sponsored Day of Service • Gym membership reimbursement • Student loan repayment program
