description: Job Description This opportunity is perfect for someone looking to break into medical device sales world or someone that is looking to further their career with a revolutionary company within the space. If you have a passion to lead from the front in the innovative and growing field of point-of-care diagnostics, then this is the position for you. The position of territory manager will provide you the opportunity to sell multiple ground breaking and cutting edge devices within the private practice, hospital, physician network, treatment, government and staffing space(s).  What You’ll Do One of the perks of working for a fast growing company is that the Territory Managers are given autonomy, responsibility, and an environment where they can utilize their creativity. Your main objective will be to increase revenues in your given territory by opening new business and managing your own clientele list. You will have the opportunity to regularly call health care and C-level professionals to educate and support the promotional effort behind our innovative products.  Responsibilities · Responsible for executing all aspects of the sales process in terms of promoting our products directly to a sophisticated audience comprised of healthcare professionals, hospitals, laboratories, C-level executives and other untapped industry requiring diagnostic products. · Responsible for customer support and training, complaint handling, and collections. Ensure customer service standards are high and continuously over delivers to boost client success and loyalty. · Responsible for representing Lochness Medical as a leader in our industry and market place. · Be able to manage a profitable, cost-conscious business including appropriate work expenses, price negotiations, and contracts. · Maintain a strong technical knowledge of products and territory trends · Self-motivated and autonomy- creating efficient route plans and weekly schedules to achieve pre-set sales objectives and commitments. · Fosters and emulates a supportive company culture, and motivational environment for top performers to excel. · Develop and maintain partnership relationships across multiple industries to foster growth and long term sustainability.  Job Expectations · Needs to be prepared to spend up to 90% of time in the field with customers and sales professionals. · Overnight travel up to 20% · Would need a personal car to transport product inventory and travel to support customers · Daily communication with manager  · Learns from set-backs and develops tactics and strategies to minimize recurrence. · Team player- takes initiative to concisely and regularly communicate with Senior Sales Manager, fellow Territory Managers, and C-Level Executives. · Organized, positive, proactive, intellectually curious, self-motivated, enthusiastic, interpersonal skills and using appropriate language. · Thrive in a fast-paced environment developing relationships with multiple individuals on a daily basis.  What We Offer ·  Salary + Uncapped new and residual commissions on existing and new accounts (1st Year OTE $75K-$95K, 2nd Year OTE $110K-$130K, 3rd Year OTE $150K+) · Monthly bonus package · 401K · Health, vision and dental insurance coverage  · Hands-on training with Senior Sales Manager(s) · Coaching and sales education training daily · Travel Allowances · Team Competitions · Reimbursement per mile driven · Marketing & Conference opportunities · Corporate Retreats and Travel Opportunities  Ideal Candidate · Superior professionalism and charisma · Attention to detail   · Creative approach to problem solving · A ceaseless drive to excel and succeed · Ability to learn and adapt quickly in a dynamic market · Effective listening and presentation skills · Intellectual curiosity and confidence · Able to work remotely, autonomously and be a self-starter · Practicality and the ability to “think on your feet” · Organizational skills · Natural born leader  Required Qualifications  · 1-5 years of sales experience · Bachelors Degree from an Accredited University · Personal Car and Driver's License   Preferred Qualifications  · Roles or experience in a competitive environment (Sports, clubs, volunteering, etc.) · Involvement within the community

A World-Changing Company  At Palantir, we’re passionate about building software that solves real problems. We partner with the most important institutions in the world to transform how they use data and technology. Our software has been used to stop terrorist attacks, discover new medicines, gain an edge in global financial markets, and more. If these types of projects excite you, we'd love for you to join us.  The Role  Around the world, data is being generated at an exponential rate, and many government agencies and commercial institutions worldwide are ill-equipped to handle data at scale. Palantir’s software helps these organizations build data assets that enables efficient analysis and more effective management of their data, empowering them to solve their most critical problems.  The Sales Team is responsible for getting Palantir’s software to these organizations. Sales Reps find, evaluate, and pursue new business opportunities for a targeted institution or geography, seeking partners whose missions, objectives, and values align with our own. Each institution is different and each country has its own way of procuring software, and Sales Reps see these distinctions as opportunities — for creative thinking, diligent research, and value creation. Successful Sales Reps tailor their approach to Palantir and to each unique opportunity, rather than relying on past strategies for selling other enterprise software.  Armed with a deep knowledge of the product and its real-world applicability, Sales Reps cultivate existing relationships and work diligently to build new ones. Motivated by the knowledge that the software they sell is directly responsible for uncovering fraud, stopping wrongdoing, and saving lives, Sales Reps exceed ambitious sales quotas and come up with new targets.  Core Responsibilities In coordination with Palantir leadership, develop and execute a comprehensive strategy for growing the company's presence in a defined government or commercial institution and/or geography, typically focused on a single or limited number of customers. Generate new leads and business opportunities, working closely with Palantir counterparts to determine goals and targets. Serve as the key point of contact between Palantir and given institution(s), and represent Palantir's Sales Team at industry events and conferences. Develop deep familiarity with Palantir's software platforms and how they can be used to solve a wide range of real-world problems. Exceed stated sales quota by winning enterprise contracts. Work with the other Sales team members to improve and streamline internal processes. What We Value Proven track record of large-scale enterprise sales to government or commercial institutions. Intricate familiarity with procurement processes. Excellent communication skills. Ability to compellingly articulate Palantir's product offering to audiences with varying levels of technical skill and seniority. Ability to understand potential customers' requirements and how Palantir's software can address them. Demonstrated project management skills and a love of getting things done, no matter the circumstances. Experience building and managing relationships, and collaborating with internal partners and external counterparts. Ability to travel (50%+) per business needs. To Apply Please submit a cover letter and resume along with a record of your sales experience, including the size of the deals you have closed (feel free to use X for the values you are not able to disclose; for instance, $XX million). Please upload them as a single PDF file using the “Attach Resume/CV" tool on the applicant page. If preferable, you may respond to the Optional Additional Questions instead of (or in addition to) submitting a cover letter. Palantir is committed to promoting a culture of diversity, equity, and inclusion and is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We believe that all Palantirians share the responsibility of upholding our commitment to these values and encourage candidates from a wide range of backgrounds, perspectives, and lived experiences to join us in solving the world’s hardest problems. Palantir does not discriminate based upon race, religion, color, national origin, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as a protected veteran, status as an individual with a disability, or other applicable legally protected characteristics. Palantir is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodations to applicants with physical and mental disabilities. Please see the United States Department of Labor’s EEO poster and EEO poster supplement for additional information.  Palantir is committed to making the job application process accessible to everyone. If you are living with a disability (visible or not visible) and need to request a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application or hiring process, please reach out and let us know how we can help.

jobTitle: Premium Practice Specialist (Los Angeles, CA) AMO Sales and Services, Inc..
description: At Johnson & Johnson Vision, we have a bold ambition: to change the trajectory of eye health. That’s why, through our operating companies, we’ve developed solutions for every stage of life—to help people see better, connect better and live better. We partner with eye care professionals to provide some of the world’s leading products and technologies to address refractive error, cataracts, dry eye, and beyond. We are committed to using our reach and size for good, and strive to put quality eye care within reach of everyone, everywhere. Visit us at www.jjvision.com. Follow @JNJVision on Twitter and Johnson & Johnson Vision on LinkedIn.  The Premium Practice Specialist plays a critical part in the long-term success of accounts after the installation of a Catalys by concentrating on post-sales support and increasing volume and adoption. This position drives customer value with all AMO Premium products (TMF, Toric, and LOIs). In addition to serving as the lead for practice education/promotion of Premium products, this position plays a major role in customer retention, satisfaction, and add-on sales. This position works in collaboration with Account Executives, PhacoSpecialists and the Catalys Sales team and is supported by the District Manager & Director in helping develop strategies to gain new Catalys /Premium Customers.  Core Job Responsibilities Responsible for compliance with applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies and procedures. Works closely with the District Manager & fellow AMO Catalys Laser Sales Managers to maximize efforts to identify new customers, maintain existing customers, address outstanding customer needs and provide feedback for improvement. Delivers proactive customer contact strategy to drive adoption of Catalyst and Premium AMO products. Increases customer satisfaction by understanding customer business needs and implementing programs to drive adoption/education of AMO Premium products. Monitors and tracks expected vs. actual product usage. Provides overflow support for Application Support Managers (training). When needed, attends Trade Shows and meetings (e.g. AAO, ASCRS, etc.) throughout the year  Position Accountability / Scope  The position reports directly to the District Manager. Must be able to build meaningful relationships with both internal & external stakeholders. Excellent computer skills with efficient use of Excel, MS-Word and PowerPoint. The ability to create and edit large scale PowerPoint presentations are a must. Position will interface with Physicians/Administrators/Nurse Managers and Purchasing and be expected to understand all aspects of cross departmental selling. The PPS should have a broad understanding of Premium IOLs, practice adoption concepts, and the ability to work well within diverse settings (Practice, ASCs, and Meetings). Organized and reliable: able to work independently and make decisions based on data & facts.  Qualifications  Minimum Education Bachelor’s Degree at an accredited college/university  Minimum Experience / Training Required 3+ years of professional selling experience. Knowledge of/experience in ophthalmology and pull through of IOLs/LOIs is desired. Experience calling on an office environment is desired.  Johnson & Johnson Family of Companies are equal opportunity employers, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.  Primary Location  United States-California-Los Angeles-  Other Locations  North America-United States-California-Santa Clarita, North America-United States-California-Ventura, North America-United States-California-Valencia  Organization  AMO Sales and Services, Inc. (6238)  Job Function  Sales  Requisition ID  2105940619W
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Medical Devices, and Pharmaceuticals

jobTitle: Regional Vice President - Sales Meritain Health
description: Job Description  Sales Vice President in the Mid-South (NC, SC) to drive profitable membership growth in the self-funded market. Develops strategy, distribution, and collaboration with local market Aetna teams to target clients who prefer a TPA value proposition.  The Sales Executive is responsible for new sales growth for Meritain Health, an Aetna Company in their local market.  Meritain targets customers who prefer to self-fund their benefits plan using a customization third-party administrator model. *we are only able to consider candidates with prior insurance (Health - self funded ideally) sales experience at this time.  Lead all Meritain sales efforts to solve complex benefit challenges using customized self-funded solutions.  Works through the external broker community to promote and develop the Meritain brand in the local market.  Establish local market partnerships with Aetna sales teams and sales leaders to maximize the Aetna distribution channel. Identify products, services, and strategies that solve challenges for TPA clients. Assist with strategic planning, budgeting and forecasting process.  Required Qualifications  Sales professional who help build our business in the Middle Market, distribution channel, group insurance and specialty products areas.  Sales Executive goal is to meet customer needs and help them make better decisions and about their health care and health care spending.  Develops and cultivates strong relationships with key constituents (producers, plan sponsors and/or consumers depending on business) to maximize sales opportunities and achieve profitable growth.  Oversees a block of business or may develop new business opportunities to ensure profitable customers and help grow the business through consultative selling, issue resolution and superior service.  Ensures product, pricing and services meet client's needs while meeting Aetna revenue growth and profit objectives.  Manages and builds producer relations as needed depending on book of business or market segment  being supported.  Identifies various ways to partner with the client by drawing from entire spectrum of product line illustrating a keen understanding of client's multifaceted needs and benefits of Aetna's full product array.  Collaborates with internal partners and/or external constituents to uncover profitable growth and cross-sell opportunities within new or existing customers and to support post-sale activities.  Coordinates sales materials, testimonials and subject matter expert involvement in support of the successful delivery of constituent presentations.  May participate in constituent meetings including finals presentations.  Develops/maintains and communicates expertise on products, industry and emerging marketplace trends.  COVID Requirements  COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement  CVS Health requires its Colleagues in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated. If you are vaccinated, you are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status within the first 30 days of your employment. For the two COVID-19 shot regimen, you will be required to provide proof of your second COVID-19 shot within the first 60 days of your employment. Failure to provide timely proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status will result in the termination of your employment with CVS Health. If you are unable to be fully vaccinated due to disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief, you will be required to apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 30 days of your employment in order to remain employed with CVS Health. As a part of this process, you will be required to provide information or documentation about the reason you cannot be vaccinated. If your request for an accommodation is not approved, then your employment may be terminated. Preferred Qualifications  Sales/Delivering on the Promise  Service/Demonstrating Service Discipline  Sales/Selling Products and Services  Sales/Cultivating Distribution Channels  Leadership/Collaborating for Results  General Business/Demonstrating Business and Industry Acumen  Health Insurance Licenses in applicable states  Education  Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

About this Role As we scale, we are looking for an experienced sales leader that is excited to help drive growth and create a new category with our retail partners.  We are looking for a Director of Sales with both the experience and the energy to build a strategic plan and execute day-to-day responsibilities such as key account management, forecasting, data analysis, new product launch plans, marketing & trade programs, and in-store execution.  Core Responsibilites  Drive topline revenue growth, new customer acquisition, and same store sales through the creation of channel-specific selling strategies Effectively manage outsourced sales team and broker partners. Drive accountability and motivate the teams to achieve overall sales objectives Build bottoms-up sales targets and achieve company sales goals. Drive and regularly report on key metrics, including ACV, velocity, and customer-specific P&L Optimize selling strategy by providing retailers with a compelling, data-driven rationale for building a new meal-solution based set within Produce Develop quarterly joint business plans to drive performance at key retailers. Understand the retailer’s needs and build short & long-term strategies that support their goals and Haven’s Kitchen’s sales target’s & financial expectations Build and maintain direct relationships with key retailers – positioning Haven’s Kitchen as a category leader, a source of innovation & consumer expertise Monitor retailer account performance utilizing distributor and syndicated data. Develop action plans to increase distribution, drive velocity, and improve pricing/promotional strategy Work with Finance to evaluate trade spend ROI and sales spend to drive profitability Ensure alignment and work closely with Marketing to develop retailer specific marketing campaigns, leveraging shopper marketing programs, in-store & digital merchandising levers, and HK owned platforms (social, website, email communication) Develop retailer-specific digital merchandising plans to drive e-commerce sales and ensure optimal selling experience across dot coms, including Target.com, Instacart, and Amazon Prime Evaluate field marketing opportunities and ensure third-party partners are delivering on KPI’s and meeting business needs Own and continuously improve selling tools, such sell sheets and sales decks Maintain and develop a sales forecast, working directly with Operations to ensure alignment on demand planning and product profitability Participate in and lead sales for industry and distributor trade shows Support initiatives to launch innovation and drive distribution of new products  You Are / Have 10+ years of experience leading sales for a fresh food company Produce experience preferred Track record of significant new customer acquisition and driving performance in existing accounts Proven success in developing retailer relationships built on trust & mutual goals Experience selling better-for-you products into multiple sales channels – natural, conventional, mass, e-comm and club Experience with a category disruptive, innovation forward brand preferred Reputation for driving performance of and actively managing a team of salespeople & brokers Experience building selling strategies for Kroger.com, Target.com, Amazon Prime and Instacart Strong analytical skills and use a data-driven approach to decision making Effective leader with an ability to motivate others & pivot quickly to meet changing business Strong organizational and cross-functional skillsets. Ability to build process and communicate effectively with other business functions Great communicator – you adapt to your audience and effectively communicate across the organization and with external partners Strong attention to detail allows you to closely monitor performance across multiple retailers, meet deadlines, and deliver on aggressive sales goals Reputation for working well with others. You are described as empathetic, curious, and passionate. Cooking and exploring new flavor profiles excites you  What you are looking for... A close, driven team that is constantly communicating and collaborating Competitive compensation in a high-growth startup Full health, dental and vision benefits An environment that encourages and rewards entrepreneurialism and learning An opportunity to build out a team and take a brand from great to amazing

Looking for ambitious individuals who are looking to join a high paced / high growth team.  Responsibilities Drive top-of-the-funnel lead generation for account executives and sales managers A lot of cold calling and cold emailing. Update and manage all sales activities, opportunities, and account information in CRM Consistently achieve monthly quota of qualified opportunities  Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business or a related field At least 1 - 2 years' of relevant work experience Excellent written and verbal communication skills Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work

jobTitle: Specialty Molding Sales Manager – Eastern US
description: Company Details: Spectrum Plastics Group is a global supplier of engineered medical components and value-added solutions for the medical device and contract manufacturing industries. With a footprint that includes 20 sites around the world, SPG provides custom extruded plastic solutions, injection molded components, and complex assemblies to manufacturers and end-users primarily in the medical device and life science market segments.   Job Location: Remote (access to a major airport, ideally Massachusetts, New Jersey, New York, Connecticut, Vermont, New Hampshire. Rhode Island, or Pennsylvania)   Job Summary: Reporting to the Vice President of Sales – Medical Tubing/Specialty Molding, this sales leadership position will have full commercial responsibility and accountability for injection molding and medical tubing products.  The objectives will be focused on year over year profitable net revenue growth for the defined territory with a strong emphasis on uncovering and closing new opportunities.  Primary Responsibilities and Ownership: • Support, deliver and implement SPG’s go to market strategy for the defined selling assignment which includes establishing and maintaining a strong working relationship with the SPG’s various manufacturing sites during the entire selling process. • Establish credibility and trust with internal and external customers. • Develop successful win-win business relationships with customers (internal & external) that leads to profitable year over year net revenue growth. • Attend and participate in trade show activities to network and generate new business opportunities, all in a professional manner that delivers a defined return on investment. • Provide and present to the SPG Executive Management Team market and customer intelligence in a manner that is professional and easy to understand and analyze. • Develop strategic marketing and business development relationships with current and potential customers that will support strategic new business development. • Fully utilize Salesforce.com, which is a web-based Customer Relationship Management operating system used by SPG to effectively communicate & manage the process of aligning daily efforts with the annual strategic plan. • Work closely with:  • Plant leadership teams to research potential new product offerings that are in alignment with strategic objectives. • All associates within the expanded SPG sales & marketing teams to reinforce a ONE SPG Team selling environment that supports the SPG Operating Way. • Program management, customer service and engineering teams as required throughout the entire quoting process to make sure SPG consistently delivers win-win customer solutions. • Engineering, Customer Service, Program Management and Manufacturing Teams with solving problems and creating solutions both internally and externally. • Establish an executive business relationship with all customers/potential customers within the defined territory or account assignment. • Provide the professional leadership skills that will consistently support and deliver the SPG core values. • Support the Annual Business & Strategic Planning Process which includes both written and verbal presentations. • Participate and support key industry organizations and functions to promote the mission, value statements and objectives as outlined in the annual business plan. • Timely and accurate completion of expense reports.  Position Requirements:  EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: • BS Degree, with major or emphasis in Engineering or Science. • Three-five years minimum of new business development, account management, R&D engineering or Operations engineering experience. • Demonstrated creative problem-solving skills and the ability to influence internal and external customers. • Strong organizational skills supported by a self-disciplined operating structure. • Timely and accurate completion of expense reports. • Superior time management/prioritization skills. • Leadership skills associated with influencing people and processes. • Self-starter that takes initiative and is action oriented. • Excellent written and oral communication skills to share your findings, observations and opportunities with a wide audience. • Computer Skills to include, but not limited to Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Salesforce.com, CONCUR and other business and database programs. • Strong business analytical skills. • Ability to  • create, establish, and implement win-win Solutions. • think strategically and implement tactically. • adapt to a constantly evolving organization. • Possess the vision and leadership skill sets that will successfully drive change and position SPG as the lead supplier in the customers supply chain. • Ability to work and communicate effectively with diverse disciplines and audiences (marketing, customer service, program management, engineering, manufacturing, supply chain, human resources, information technology, finance and the corporate leadership). • Willing to travel and spend the business time away from home that is required to accomplish company goals and objectives as outlined in the annual business plan.

As a Sales Development Representative, you are vital in leading our company to the highest quality of strategic pipeline while engaging prospects through multiple outreach techniques. You will help fuel the revenue by actively creating new opportunities through collaborative outreach in a fast paced, collaborative and fun atmosphere.  Job Functions: Contact potential clients through phone, email, and social media campaigns Develop methods to increase the success rate contacts and follow-ups Become an expert in our internal technology systems  Achieve established activity targets to meet or exceed sales lead quotas  Expectations: 0-1 years of sales experience in the SaaS space A strong interest or track record in building a career in sales An entrepreneurial mindset – you should be highly motivated and competitive Cold calling and email outreach experience
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Information Technology and Services

description: Our AAA Five Diamond Resort is recruiting a On Site National Sales Manager to join our team! Ponte Vedra Beach Resorts is looking for a seasoned Resort Sales Manager to manage accounts, solicit new group sales accounts and maintain relationships with existing accounts to meet and exceed revenue goals in rooms, food, beverage and room rental.    Candidate should have a Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or Sales or have equivalent experience. Must have experience at a similar size and caliber hotel. Advanced knowledge of the mid-west market preferred. Duties & Functions include: The National Sales Manager is responsible for soliciting, qualifying and closing of quality group business for the resorts. As a manager you will set up client visits, conduct site tours and attend industry events on behalf of the resort. Your main responsibility is to secure business for the Ponte Vedra Inn & Club and The Lodge & Club at Ponte Vedra Beach. Previous Hospitality (Hotel/Resort) Sales Industry required. Bachelor’s Degree Preferred. Conduct outside sales calls to existing and new potential clients. Prospect new business opportunities through existing referrals and/or market data. Consistently participate in the re-booking of repeat business by having a track record of long term client relationships. Actively participate in industry related organizations. Thorough knowledge of sales techniques including closing skills as well as negotiating skills. Monitor group room blocks and pick up, relay client comments and information for the operating departments. Comfortable with hotel site inspections and client presentations. Excellent creative skills to provide innovative set-ups, menus, and function for groups. Prior experience in the field of hospitality with specific experience in sales is essential. Knowledge of sales skills, revenue management, training and motivation of peers. Knowledge of hotel features, benefits, and competing hotels within the market. Ability to execute appropriate action plans. Monitor group room blocks and pick up, relay client comments and information for the operating departments. Benefits: Medical/Dental/Vision/STD/LTD/401(k)/Vacation/Sick Days/Holidays Equal Opportunity Employer DRUG FREE WORKPLACE

The Communications portfolio is Session Border Controllers (SBC), Signal Transfer Point (STP), Policy Server and 5G Network Functions (NF).  Qualifications Experienced sales representative with at least 10 years of successful service provider sales Experience selling VoIP, Voice Traffic, SIP Trunking, Routing, Session Management, SS7 and 5G Network Elements Knowledge in Communications Applications, Over the Top (OTT) applications, service providers issues and revenue streams Additional Qualifications Sales Professional (ability to scale in large Accounts) Technology Competence (technology in business process) Collaborative (build a relationship with channel for success) Closer (have track record of growing revenue) Organization (ability to handle multiple accounts at once) Process Oriented (capable of working systems / process to closure) Internal Selling (ability to navigate internal process) Communicator (excellent communications skills) Team Builder (can manage internal team across organizational boundaries) At Oracle, we don’t just value differences—we celebrate them. We believe innovation starts with diversity and inclusion.  https://www.oracle.com/corporate/careers/culture/diversity.html  This position is responsible for new account development and/or expanding existing accounts within an established geographic territory.  Works as part of an account team to identify, qualify and deliver Hardware products/ solutions. Responsible for the account plan to drive goal attainment in assigned territory. Coordinates with the other members of the sales team (employees and partners) to support account sales and business development strategies. Helps identify and engage the appropriate partner to meet customer specifications. Becomes trusted advisor to key customer influencers and decision makers. Ensures that the company's sales programs are known and executed in assigned territory, including personal follow-up and engagement in selected opportunities. Achieves or exceeds the quarterly and annual sales goals. May travel frequently.  Acknowledged authority within the Corporation. Acts as a leader of large-scale company initiatives. Viewed by peers as a leader and top contributor and by line management as a key business partner. 10 plus years experience. BA/BS degree preferred. description: Sunday Riley Modern Skincare is looking for an experienced Account Executive to join our field team to build our business in the North Los Angeles market.   The Account Executive generates & increases in-store sales through relationship building, impactful store visits, training, and events. Success in this role is achieved by positive team morale, team development, strong store relationships, and consistently increasing sales performance in all assigned stores.   The ideal candidate must have strong selling skills, outstanding communication skills, best-in-class customer service, and a passion for learning. All applicants must be a team player and have cosmetics experience.   Key Job Responsibilities:  Sell and educate in stores and manage / coach a team of Retail Sales Specialists to hit and exceed sales goals for the territory  Strategize and maximize personal and team schedules to drive the business. Develop and maximize store visit call cycle for self and direct reports.  Activate corporate-approved education and event initiatives and exceed sales goals  Coach and develop direct reports Develop and build strong relationships with retail partners  Support recruiting, interviewing, and onboarding  Collaborate with Regional Sales Manager to build impactful store-by-store action plans to address store needs and support sales goals regionally  Must have a passion for skincare and the Brand  Work Location:  5-day work week, total of 40 hours. Weekends are required. Monthly travel may be required depending on territory size  It is expected that 32 hours a week will be spent in the field   Other Duties: Please note this is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  Perks:  Competitive salary  Vacation days  Paid holidays  401k  Life Insurance Health/dental/vision benefits  Physical Demands:  The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.  While performing the duties of this job, the employee is required to stand; walk; sit; apply products on clients; reach with hands and arms; climb stairs; talk or hear.   Preferred Qualification and Experience:  Minimum of 3 years of retail, sales and/or beauty industry experience, preferably in the skincare industry at the AE or AC level Memorable, positive, professional, and enthusiastic presence  Strong aptitude for product knowledge, brand messaging, training, and selling  Ability to manage multiple calendars and multi-store visits  Excellent oral, written, and presentation skills; email and phone skills essential  Ability to take strategic direction based on sales and business analysis  Basic computer skills a must- Microsoft Word, Outlook, Excel, Teams, T-Sheets scheduling app  Self-motivated, committed and goal-oriented  Energetic and passionate with an entrepreneurial, flexible spirit  Ability to travel required  Driver’s license a plus (in most cases a necessity)  Flexibility regarding work hours, i.e. weekend  Equal Opportunity Employer:  Sunday Riley actively creates a culture of inclusivity and respects that diversity in the workplace leads to a positive and stronger team. Job Description  This candidate must drive new business sales and exceed sales targets sold through producer channels and direct opportunities in assigned territory. The territory will include the Mid-Atlantic and Southeast Regions in the United States. The role provides an opportunity to a professional who is eager to join a large healthcare company and exceed goals by finding and developing new business opportunities, cultivating winning relationships, and driving strong results in the global expatriate market.  Fundamental Components & Physical Requirements include but are not limited to: Develop new business opportunities to ensure profitable customers and help grow the business through consultative selling and market research Ensures product, pricing and services meet client's needs while meeting Aetna revenue growth and profit objectives. Manages and builds producer relations as needed depending on book of business or market segment(s) being supported. Identifies various ways to partner with the client by drawing from entire spectrum of product line illustrating a keen understanding of client's multifaceted needs and benefits of Aetna International's full product portfolio. Collaborates with internal partners and/or external constituents to uncover profitable growth and cross-sell opportunities within new or existing customers and to support post-sale activities. Coordinates sales materials, testimonials and subject matter expert involvement in support of the successful delivery of constituent presentations. May participate in constituent meetings including finals presentations. Develops/maintains and communicates expertise on products, industry and emerging marketplace trends. Required Qualifications 3-5 years of health insurance experience Strong presentation skills Organizational skills managing producer activity and quote volume Preferred Qualifications Licensure as required by state (must obtain within 90 days) Education  Bachelor's Degree or higher is preferred  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

Job Overview  Account Sales Manager for Hollywood/Sunrise, FL  The Account Manager Combination is responsible for up-selling and fulfillment/replenishment, focused on execution and merchandising. Accountable for retention and penetration of small and large format customers by geography and may handle some on-premise customers.  Schedule Full-time; Monday- Friday; 1st shift (6 am) Benefits Mileage reimbursement for the use of your personal vehicle (avg. 250 mi/wk) Full benefits package available Day 1 Medical, dental, vision 401K with company match Position Responsibilities Sell Keurig Dr Pepper brands to maximize brand growth, share growth, brand distribution, and to obtain specific volume objectives. Contact key personnel in assigned accounts pre-selling products, promotions, displays, point-of sale material, beverage section revamps, service requirements. Develop and implement beverage shelf re-allocations designed to maximize the sales of Keurig Dr Pepper brands. Participate in the installation of revamped beverage sections, displays and placement of POS material according to company merchandising standards. Stock and merchandise Keurig Dr Pepper brands in the allocated beverage section, including racks and secondary displays. Assist in the sale, placement, and changing of vendors in chain store accounts; check regularly for proper mechanical operation, cleanliness, selection and product availability. Maintain accurate sales records for all assigned accounts, including special reports on promotional activity, competitive sales and space allocations. Maintain adequate amounts of back stock in each account to ensure product availability for in-store stocking and merchandising. Requirements 2 years of customer service experience in a retail environment or in a sales position being held accountable for sales targets/upselling Lift, push, and pull a minimum of 50 pounds repeatedly Valid driver’s license Company Overview  Keurig Dr Pepper (KDP) is a leading coffee and beverage company in North America with dual headquarters in Burlington, MA and Plano, TX, with annual revenue in excess of $11 billion. KDP holds leadership positions in soft drinks, specialty coffee and tea, water, juice and juice drinks and mixers, and markets the #1 single serve coffee brewing system in the U.S. The Company maintains an unrivaled distribution system that enables its portfolio of more than 125 owned, licensed and partner brands to be available nearly everywhere people shop and consume beverages. With a wide range of hot and cold beverages that meet virtually any consumer need, KDP key brands include Keurig®, Dr Pepper®, Green Mountain Coffee Roasters®, Canada Dry®, Snapple®, Bai®, Mott’s® and The Original Donut Shop®. The Company employs more than 25,000 employees and operates more than 120 offices, manufacturing plants, warehouses and distribution centers across North America.  Benefits built for you: Our people are the heart of our business, which is why we offer robust benefits to support your health and wellness as well as your personal and financial well-being. We also provide employee programs designed to enhance your professional growth and development while ensuring you feel valued, inspired and appreciated at work.  Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and affirmatively seeks diversity in its workforce. Keurig Dr Pepper Inc. recruits qualified applicants and advances in employment its employees without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, disability, genetic information, ethnic or national origin, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected by law. EOE Minorities/Females/Protected Veterans/Disabled

description: Why join us  Brex is reimagining financial systems so every growing company can realize their full potential. As the financial OS, we’re building software and services in one place—disrupting long-entrenched institutions with products and experiences that better serve the ambitions of our customers.  Working at Brex allows you to push your limits, challenge the status quo, and collaborate with some of the brightest minds in the industry. We’re committed to building a diverse team and inclusive culture and believe your potential should only be limited by how big you can dream. We make this a reality by empowering you with the tools, resources, and support you need to grow your career.  Sales at Brex  The Sales team is the driving factor behind revenue for Brex. Every member of our team directly affects our bottom line. We focus on generating new opportunities, acquiring new customers, and building even stronger relationships with our current customers. We have a unified culture recognizing big wins daily and celebrating individual accomplishments weekly and monthly. We make sure that top performers are recognized and have built a competitive environment to keep the team motivated and unified.  What You’ll Do  As a Sales Development Representative, you will be responsible for prospecting and identifying new customers for Brex. You will partner with Account Executives to help startups understand the value of Brex as a corporate credit card and the rewards that it provides fast growing companies. We’re building a team from the ground up that will require a “whatever it takes,” attitude, a high sense of urgency, and a passion for sales. As an SDR at Brex, you will have the opportunity to help create processes and build pipelines for $1 million deals immediately. The opportunity to start your sales career at a unicorn start up and grow your career into an AE and beyond!  Responsibilities Identify growing startups and tech companies that would value from Brex Prospect companies that are growing and spending; educate them on our modern corporate card built just for startups. No personal guarantee on the MasterCard network with embedded expense management software! Navigate through a conversation flow to uncover business needs, understand pains, and position Brex as a compelling solution. Maintain and update an accurate log of activity in the CRM system Use email to correspond with leads to follow up and/or to confirm appointments Provide feedback to others in department related to information prospects share that could be helpful in advertising/marketing as well as our overall programs Requirements 1+ years of experience in a phone sales role OR a driven and eager to learn new grad who thrives in fast paced, constantly-changing environments The ability to proactively engage new clients through email and phone A high sense of urgency that can adapt and pivot in every conversation The skills to passionately and clearly articulate the value of Brex A team-player attitude with a desire to improve internal processes beyond your day-to-day tasks A desire to learn, grow, and get in on the ground floor of a unicorn startup while launching your career in sales Bonus points SaaS or B2B experience Experience with Salesforce, Outreach, and/or ZoomInfo
industries: Computer Software, Internet, and Financial Services

description: This is an individual contributor role. This is a pure hunting role.  Key Responsibilities ►    Serve as a respected business development leader, able to open doors, influence and manage complex client relationships at scale. ►    Orchestrate and manage strong sales discipline, be on top of pipeline management and be rigorous and disciplined around the forecasting process. ►    Be perceived as a strong “player-coach” for Astreya’s capability and solutioning teams, partnering with them on developing relevant, bespoke and strategic solutions and delivery capabilities with their clients. ►    Be a strong external-facing client-services leader, oriented towards “making the news and not just reporting the news”. ►    As relevant, build and expand relationships with Industry Advisors, Industry Analysts and other similar influencers in helping communicate Astreya’s value propositions and differentiations targeted to the technology services market. ►    Be part of the broader leadership team in attract and retaining top talent – be a “talent-magnet” into Astreya as a whole. ►    Be an enabler and a supporter of other business units; and be vested in the success of other teams, besides their own – for the broader benefit of Astreya.  Pivotal Experience and Expertise ►    Domain Knowledge: Ideally a deep vertical / domain focus on the High-Tech, Financial Services and Healthcare/LifeSciences  space. The individual will demonstrate and understanding of their client’s target industry dynamics. This is critical since digital transformation is a major theme across these industry segments and the leader’s domain credibility and knowledge will be a critical aspect of the individual’s ability to open doors and build the relationships that Astreya desires. ►    Relationship Builder: History of leading customer relationships and the ability to foster new client relationships. Seen as a credible partner to senior leaders around; and demonstrated abilities to build key internal relationships to advance cross- selling, upselling efforts in a collaborative and inclusive way. The individual will bring a well assessed capability of influencing without authority. ►    People Management: Proven ability to attract high quality talent (strong followership). Experience mentoring and managing individuals towards a positive high-performance culture. Thoughtful when it comes to resource management and decisive with necessary workforce initiatives to achieve efficiency and growth objectives.  Personal and Leadership Attributes ►    The successful candidate must be a high-energy, intellectually curious, assertive, and hands-on leader who is able to motivate with a vision for success and a dedication to customer satisfaction. S/he must have a passion for, and focus on, innovation and an exceptionally unwavering focus on achieving client delight. This executive will know how to leverage core competencies, drive efficiencies, and develop strategic relationships to achieve stated objectives. Furthermore, s/he will possess strong team skills and the highest integrity and be smart, low maintenance, non-political, and detail-oriented.

At Karbach, our beer is Crafted for Fun, and we think where you work should be too. We don’t take ourselves too seriously, but you can be damn sure we take our beer seriously. And like our beer, we strive for our workplace to bring all kinds of people together. Whether our folks are brewing beer, operating behind the scenes, or serving in our pub, it’s their passion, grit, and attitude that make it all happen. We make quality beer and hire quality people. Come join our Karbach team!  Job Summary The Sales Director oversees the complex function of company sales as it relates to various states, distributors, retailers, etc. This position manages Area Sales Managers and the Key Account Managers to ensure that territory sales are consistent with goals and projections. This position largely oversees the program and system of sales as a whole, to include managing how: Karbach partners with distributors, maintaining market competition, pursuing on and off premise accounts, enters new territories, tracks and manages targets/progress, and any other facet of company sales. This position also requires significant analytical skills for market analysis, and for developing annual/quarterly adjustments contributing to the production schedules.  Job Responsibilities Work directly with wholesalers to develop strategies and to educate them on quarterly and annual goals and projections and execution plans. Derive data and sales reports, as well as other sources of analysis to support future growth plans Manage chain sales, including contract work and wholesaler communication Work with Marketing Director to ensure appropriate marketing strategies occur Use research and analysis to develop quarterly and annual goals and analysis and sales trends to support budget recommendations Oversees sponsorship budget Develop and maintain cohesion between territorial employees and managers Work with the Marketing Director to ensure territory cohesion between sales and marketing employees Maintain Sales Department budget on an on-going basis Troubleshoot problems between wholesalers and warehouse delivery/availability Orchestrate and conduct regular meetings with sales management team to maintain consistent communication Draft reports and prepare for wholesalers and company leadership   Job Qualifications 10+ years of Sales or Business Development experience Experience in the craft beer industry preferred Demonstrated success in consistently meeting sales objectives Proven track record of establishing and maintaining long-term relationships with executive level clients/counterparts at the decision-maker level Ability to understand and articulate strategic and financial value propositions and concepts Excellent communication skills, both written and oral, as well as the confidence and polish to represent the company in both formal and informal settings  As a leading brewer, we are committed to finding innovative ways to continually improve. It's this kind of thinking that creates a unique work environment by rewarding talent, celebrating diversity and encouraging forward thinking. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Talent Hawk Recruiting is assisting a client with a search for a Business Developer/Sales professional. This unique role is an exciting opportunity for a talented Business Developer to showcase their skills to make a direct impact on the company and on their own financial security! Attractive base plus commission. On target performance results in earning $100K+ your first year and strong performers have doubled that their second year.  This is an exciting time to join us as we are ramping for growth. To be a strong candidate for this position, you must have: Bachelor's degree or equivalent work experience Experience managing multiple projects in a well established territory At least 3 years outside sales experience, with at least 1-2 of those years selling contract services (uniforms, coffee/break room focused sales, copiers, etc.) to businesses

description: At CrowdStrike we’re on a mission - to stop breaches. Our groundbreaking technology, services delivery, and intelligence gathering together with our innovations in machine learning and behavioral-based detection, allow our customers to not only defend themselves, but do so in a future-proof manner. We’ve earned numerous honors and top rankings for our technology, organization and people – clearly confirming our industry leadership and our special culture driving it. We also offer flexible work arrangements to help our people manage their personal and professional lives in a way that works for them. So if you’re ready to work on unrivaled technology where your desire to be part of a collaborative team is met with a laser-focused mission to stop breaches and protect people globally, let’s talk.  About The Role Sales Development Representatives drive net-new business and work alongside Account Executives to drive revenue The SDR role is an entry level sales role that is the stepping stone for anyone entering technology sales. It is a highly competitive position at CrowdStrike given the explosive career opportunities within tech sales and at our company Discover and drive new business opportunities within mid-market and enterprise accounts. Conduct high level discovery calls with the C-suite and their VPs Become a cyber security expert and thought leader Earn a black belt in competitive selling and objection handling Collaborate with marketing and channel partners to execute on a successful pre-IPO go-to-market strategy Qualities We Look For And Appreciate High EQ, IQ and business acumen A go-getter that sets his/her sights above and beyond to blow out his/her established targets and quotas Persistent – Doesn’t stop at “no”. Believes they can overcome anything Demonstrates a passion to learn and grow Proven track record of high achievement and leadership skills Embraces the massive impact that cyber security has on the world Takes a unique approach to every problem Interest in mentorship from some of Silicon Valley’s top sales professional Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike Market leader in compensation and equity awards Competitive vacation policy Comprehensive health benefits + 401k plan Paid parental leave, including adoption Flexible work environment Wellness programs Stocked fridges, coffee, soda, and lots of treats We are committed to building an inclusive culture of belonging that not only embraces the diversity of our people but also reflects the diversity of the communities in which we work and the customers we serve. We know that the happiest and highest performing teams include people with diverse perspectives and ways of solving problems so we strive to attract and retain talent from all backgrounds and create workplaces where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.  CrowdStrike is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex including sexual orientation and gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local law.  CrowdStrike participates in the E-Verify program.  Notice of E-Verify Participation  Right to Work

description: Moore & Giles, an industry-leading leather company, is seeking a hospitality/contract sales executive for the New New York metropolitan market. The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 3-5 years experience in selling to interior design firms and purchasing agents. This position is remote (New York metropolitan area) and a rare opportunity to join a dynamic and successful team. Salary is commensurate with experience.

Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s protein and salt business, where we provide wholesome, high-quality food products to a wide range of customers, from foodservice operators and grocery stores to manufacturers and exporters.  Job Purpose and Impact  The Sales/Account Manager will, with guidance, sell directly to the consumer or business purchaser or indirectly through various sales channels. We seek a results-oriented professional who is comfortable conducting face-to-face and remote sales with new and existing customers. In this role, you will assist in evaluating customer needs and suggesting appropriate products, services and solutions.  Key Accountabilities Help identify potential customers and handle existing customer relationships. With guidance conduct market research and pricing, sales and merchandising activities. Monitor customer and competitor activity and industry trends. Protect, grow and diversify the relationship with targeted customers. Support business growth by disseminating favorable information about the organization and its products and services. Independently solve moderately complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff. Other duties as assigned Position Information  The business will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.  Qualifications  Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a related field, or equivalent experience Minimum of two years of related work experience Proficiency with Microsoft Office Preferred Qualifications Previous sales experience Demonstrated negotiation and value-based / consultative sales skills Strong verbal, written, and presentation skills Experience with Customer Relationship Management software Locations: Arizona, Louisiana, New Mexico, Mississippi and Texas.  Preferred location: Texas.  Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet

description: Company Description  Life at Nine.  Nine’s strategy is to create great content, distribute it broadly and engage audiences and advertisers. We are Australia’s largest locally owned media company – the home of Australia’s most trusted and loved brands spanning News, Sport, Lifestyle, and Entertainment.  Nine’s assets include the Nine Network, major mastheads such as The Sydney Morning Herald, The Age and The Australian Financial Review, Nine Radio, digital properties such as nine.com.au, 9Now, 9Honey, Pedestrian.TV, subscription video platform Stan and majority investments in Domain Group and Drive.  Nine is an equal opportunity employer that strives to create an inclusive and diverse workplace that encourages everyone to bring their own unique capabilities, experiences and characteristics to work.  We are committed to working in partnership with and support Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.  Company Description  Our company is a leading IT services, consulting and outsourcing company delivering exceptional business solutions and customer value to its customers worldwide.  We offers end-to-end innovative and leading edge solutions to help corporations leverage technologies, outperform their competition and acquire sustainable growth. We have proven capabilities in new and emerging technologies and extensive experience across a broad range of industries and domains which enable us to deliver world-class, secure, scalable and reliable business systems.  We have achieved many distinctions and milestones of outstanding success during the course of its evolutionary journey.  Job Description  Your New Opportunity at Nine  As the Sales Executive you are responsible for delivering market leading solutions whilst ensuring superior service and results for your designated agency and client group.  You will be a leader on the sales floor and have strong internal relationships, while constantly developing and maintaining strong relationships with key agencies and clients alike.  Day to day you will:. Clear understanding of all of Nine’s wider products spanning Broadcast, Publishing, Digital and Radio. Maintain a strong knowledge of online video and display, native content, performance media and programmatic buying Internal Relationships: Strong relationships with key stakeholders internally. Ability to navigate and work with several departments and stakeholders to deliver leading solutions for your partners External Relationships: Build and nurture relationships with key stakeholders of all levels within agencies. Ability to represent the Nine brand in market Market Knowledge: Have a current and thorough understanding of the media industry, its buying models, trends, the competitive landscape, the changing landscape and what this means for Nine Responses: Creating market leading responses and solutions for clients. Deliver solutions to your clients that are strategically and creatively led showcasing your deep knowledge of your client’s business Proactivity: Proactively identify opportunities for revenue growth. Ability to identify opportunities for new business growth from lapsed or new clients. Job Description  Qualifications Bachelor's degree, preferably in Computer Science, Information Technology, Computer Engineering, or related IT discipline; or equivalent experience. 1+ years of experience developing with RPA tools Automation Anywhere Demonstrate strong communication skills to translate technical software solutions to non-technical clients 1+ years of IT experience in software development in developing robust web applications and client/server applications One or more of the following Experience in developing RPA solutions using Automation Anywhere Experience in developing Chatbot solutions using Kore.AI, Amelia, One Reach, or any equivalent tool Qualifications  Enough about us, lets talk about you! Media experience Excellent communication, relationship and account management skills Proven ability of delivering revenue success and forecasting Strong analytical skills, ability to understand revenue trends and use data to influence sales strategy Highly organised with exceptional attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines Ability to efficiently prioritise and manage several tasks at once Strong Excel and PowerPoint skills Additional Information  What you'll get in return at Nine. Career development and quality training Up to 16 weeks paid primary carer’s parental leave Discounts on lifestyle, entertainment, and leisure memberships, including health insurance, dental and gym Access to Future Women – a movement to help women connect, learn and lead through unique content and events. Hybrid Working/Flexible working Discounts on products and services with corporate partners including Samsung, Apple, JB HI-FI, HP, Hertz Car Hire and TFE Hotels Nine Cares Our Commitment To Diversity And Inclusion  At Nine, we are committed to fostering a workforce that embraces all aspects of diversity and inclusion and where practices are equitable to ensure our people experience a sense of belonging. From day one, you'll be encouraged to bring your whole self to work and will be supported to perform at your best. Should you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application.  We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disabilities, and of all ages, nationalities, backgrounds and cultures.  Disclaimer: We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes and are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes  Additional Information  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Staffing and Recruiting

description: Photocure is looking for a driven, motivated sales professional for our growing business in our Phoenix territory, which includes Arizona, Colorado, Utah, Wyoming and a part of Nebraska.   You will be responsible for achieving and growing Cysview® sales through activities which include acquiring new accounts (by profiling, targeting, needs analysis) and maintaining/growing current customers consisting of Healthcare Professionals (Urologist, OR staff, Value Analysis & Formulary committee members, C -Suite, Pharmacists and other Allied Health Professionals).  Hospital sales, OR experience and medical device experience preferred.  Accounts will consist of hospitals, clinics, ambulatory surgical centers, pharmacies and other major medical centers within the Urology/Oncology therapeutic area.  Main Task and Responsibilities • Develop and maintain strong relationships with key Urology decision makers (bladder cancer) and other healthcare providers within assigned accounts. • Must have ability to sell both medical devise and an optical imaging drug. • Should ideally possess an understanding of payer reimbursement process. • Will need the ability to consistently exhibit a high level of proficiency and expertise in discussing and demonstrating company’s product-Cysview®, along with partner medical device product. • Facilitates and conducts all required customer training programs. • Routinely contacts and manages sales promotion related to assigned territory. • Completes all administrative duties in a timely fashion and works within the specified budget. • Consistently executes all field sales activities with a high degree of professionalism. • Performs job functions with a strict adherence to promotional guidelines and corporate code of conduct policies.  Required Skills & Experience • BA/BS or MBA/MS Degree • Computer proficiency related to operation of territory • Frequent business travel (up to 75%) • Valid Driver’s license with a clean driving record • Must reside within the geographic area of assignment  Preferred/Desired Skills & Experience • Device / Hospital Sales experience • Drug/Device combination experience • Therapeutic area: Urology/Oncology experience • Successful sales track record, excellent communication skills, ability to execute sales and marketing plan, ability to manage territory budget, ability to function in a fast-paced start-up environment  Other skills • Strong interpersonal skills; ability to handle "cold calls" as well as interactions with specialist physicians and opinion leaders • Exceptional communication skills that include verbal, written and public presentations • Ability to comprehend and interpret clinical data • Collaboration and teamwork with external business partners and internal team • Sound decision-making ability, proactive problem-solving and takes accountability.  http://www.cysview.com  Photocure is an equal opportunity employer. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote without regard to race, religion, creed, national origin, age, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, military or veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local law. Photocure conducts background screening, reference checks, and drug testing as part of its pre-employment screening process. This description is not intended to be constructed as an exhaustive list of duties, responsibilities, or requirements for the position. This position may change or assume additional duties at any time. The employee may be requested to perform different or additional duties as assigned.

Launched in 2000, Eight Eleven Group committed to 100% organic growth, exclusively promoting from within, while always keeping culture and growth opportunity at the forefront of the business model. What began as a two-person Indianapolis startup, Eight Eleven Group has rapidly expanded to become a market-leading organization within one of the fastest growing industries today: Consulting and Professional Services.   In 2012, Medasource was established to provide niche services exclusively in the Healthcare industry, including these practice areas: Providers, Payers, Government, and Life Sciences (pharma, device, diagnostic, clinical research, commercial labs, consumer goods, food sciences, chemicals, agriculture, and environmental sciences). Our team takes a consultative, solution-driven approach with Fortune 500 and enterprise non-profit clients to help them deliver and execute complex capital and operational projects. We are not just in the business of professional services - we are in the business of making a meaningful and authentic impact both internally with our high-performing team and externally with our clients and consultants.   RESPONSIBILITIES  Associate Account Executives are enrolled in a comprehensive outside B2B Sales Training Program focused on learning how to take a solution-driven, approach to selling consulting and professional services. Once you complete training, 80% of your time will be spent in front of customer decision makers to build partnerships, pipeline opportunities, and secure win-win engagements with our clients. Here are the primary drivers for success in this role:  Strategically identify opportunities and pursuits in 3-5 designated target accounts  Build and sustain long-lasting relationships with new and existing clients within your assigned accounts through onsite client meetings, presentations, and outings such as ball games, dinners, golf, etc.  Consult with clients to create solutions that help drive change and successful projects within their organization that deliver positive outcomes  Act as a client advocate with a focus on improving the experience of our Fortune 500 target accounts  Presenting to C-suite executives and championing solutions for their project roadmap  Continue to meet and exceed target sales goals  Set personal and team goals through frequent sprint sessions with your manager and sales support team   SALES TRAINING  Takes place at our Corporate Headquarters in Indianapolis  Led by Medasource’s President and top sales leaders  Formalized training geared toward our practice areas and core competencies in the healthcare industry  Role playing situational selling exercises and ride-alongs with senior account executives  Establishing your client portfolio  Fostering executive-level relationships    BENEFITS & PERKS  Base salary + uncapped commissions  Monthly smartphone stipend and car allowance  401k match program   Full health benefits (medical, dental, vision, and HSA)  All-expenses-paid Reward Trip each year for top producers and a guest  Expense budget for client entertainment  Eight Eleven’s BeGiving Program: 1 PTO day per quarter for service work/volunteering   Access to Eight Eleven University (internal personal and professional development program)   Top-notch training at every step in your career  Access to a personal financial concierge  Genuine, passionate, family-oriented culture   WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED  Competitive, motivated spirit and desire to succeed  Outstanding communication skills and innate ability to connect with people  Entrepreneurial spirit with desire to learn and grow   Results-driven and forward-thinking  Thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative, and positive work environment   Bachelor’s Degree
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Management Consulting, and Information Technology and Services

description: Sales Development Representative / Business Development Representative  Want to empower digital business through real-time analytics delivered as a service? Passionate about putting the power of machine data analytics in the hands of everyone by unifying all data types, enabling universal access and leveraging cloud economics – all this from a single, unified platform delivered and consumed as a service? Come talk with us!  Our Business Development Representatives are a key part of a Regional Sales team consisting of a Sales Manager and Mid-Market or Enterprise Account Executives. You will support all levels of the sales organization by finding new revenue opportunities that add to the total pipeline. You will foster relationships with Account Executives, Regional Sales Managers, and potential future customers.  What makes a Sales Development / Business Development Representative successful? We are a team of intuitive, passionate hunters looking for green-field opportunities within potential customers. And we like to have fun.  We have a demonstrated track record of providing growth opportunities to our SDR team members to transition down the AE track, Customer Success or Marketing.  What You'll Be Working On Prospect and generate leads with companies within a defined territory Leverage a modern lead generation tool stack, including Discover.org, Linkedin, ZoomInfo and Outreach Collaborate closely with Sales Managers and Account Executives to establish a territory "plan-of-attack", including target companies, target prospects, and messaging/talk-tracks Set up new meetings to hand off to our Account Executive teams Learn, leverage, and help evolve our demand generation process Qualify opportunities and handle objections Participate in regular training & informational sessions Achieve or exceed monthly quotas of Qualified Opportunities and Closed Business Conduct high-level conversations with Senior Executives in Target and Prospect Accounts Create, prioritize, and qualify strategic target account lists within a defined territory Research and build new and existing accounts (i.e. adding contacts, sending regular emails, coordinating strategic discovery meetings) Your Experience And Skills Should Include History of quota over-achievement Thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth, rapidly changing environment Bachelor’s degree These additional skills would be highly desirable: Previous experience in a lead generation role a plus SaaS experience a plus This role is for talent looking to continue their career in sales. If you are naturally curious, a strong communicator, and have a hunger to learn, Sumo Logic is the place for you to launch your sales career! We offer our BDRs multiple career paths/opportunities in various lines of business at Sumo Logic.  Still interested? We’d love to hear from you! Apply now and learn more about our purpose !  ___________________________________________________________________________  About Us: https://app.box.com/v/SLGeneralDossier What we do: We are a cloud-native SaaS machine data analytics platform, solving complex monitoring problems for DevOps, SecOps and ITOps teams. Customers love our product because it allows them to easily monitor and optimize their mission critical, large scale applications. Mission: Democratize machine data analytics through the Sumo Logic platform, bringing real-time data insights securely through the cloud. Massive Scale: Our microservices architecture in AWS ingests hundreds of terabytes daily across many geographic regions. Millions of queries a day analyze hundreds of petabytes of data.
