Do you get a kick out of helping businesses succeed? Then you just might be our next Rooketeer! Join our highly-talented dynamic team as we pursue our vision of helping developers deliver better software. With Rookout, developers can review parts of their live code on demand, even while it is running. We simplify and accelerate the data collection process and save hours (or days, or even weeks) of dev and devops work. As our Sales Development Rep, you'll get to choose who will be the company's next clients. You will run the entire top of the funnel from choosing the strategic accounts thru speaking with C level decision makers and delivering those meetings to the sales reps. This role gives you an opportunity to join a sales team in an early stage company and grow your career. What Youll Do? The Sales Development Rep (SDR) works with outbound and inbound demand generation to uncover and craft new opportunities that result in closed business. Connecting with prospects in a variety of ways Procuring quality opportunities on a weekly and monthly basis Documenting daily activities in Salesforce CRM Collaborate with our Sales and Marketing teams to strategize on named accounts. Working closely with Sales to accelerate the sales cycle Representing Rookout with integrity and professionalism at all times in all written and oral communications What You Should Have? Minimum 2 years of outbound and inbound sales experience in the SaaS/software industry is preferred Selling to R&D, Engineering executives and professionals Experience developing leads in virtual-events - an advantage Clear and polished written communication skills Excellent speaking/ listening skills and ability to engage prospects Fearless attitude and hunter mentality - willing to take intelligent risks Strategic planning abilities B2B sales experience Methodological and organizedby Jobble

Who We Are:  Bluemark Inc is revolutionizing the marketing industry by connecting businesses and people with meaningful tactile messaging. Founded as a simple promotional products company, Bluemark scaled rapidly to solidify its place as the single solution for gig-economy companies like Postmates and Shipt sending welcome kits at scale. Today, Bluemark provides solutions for the full customer journey, helping enterprise-level businesses acquire, onboard, and retain customers through bespoke physical products.    Bluemark simplifies the complexity of onboarding at scale, while delivering clients a best in-class service experience through our end-to-end tailored solutions.  Our all-in-one platform ensures full transparency as we help you develop a memorable brand experience. We are one of the Fastest-Growing companies in America (Inc5000 2020). If you’re entrepreneurial and driven to make a difference, we want to hear from you!  About you:  We are looking for a Sales Coordinator to come work for our highly collaborative startup. As our next Sales Coordinator, you will ensure the smooth running of the Sales Department by providing full support for Account Executives and Business Development Representatives daily. Providing high levels of internal and external client satisfaction will be your aim, helping to maximize revenue through designing and preparing client proposals, entering booking information, generating a range of reports and managing our client database. You are motivated, enthusiastic, and a collaborative individual with a strong desire to learn.   Day to Day:  Run and format weekly/monthly selling reports. Vendor portal management and order/forecasting Manage account requests for completion of new item setup templates, product attributes, image requests, inventory updates, etc.  Responsible for all seasonal updates to ensure product line sheets are loaded accurately with all relevant information for accounts to place orders. Deal with internal constituents (i.e. Legal, Servicing, Administration, etc.), as it pertains to contract preparation and product fulfillment. Manage as first point of contact for clients on any additional issues and ensure timely response to external and internal clients Stay in contact with clients and ensure all their needs are met and that there is no miscommunication. Work cross-functionally to complete paperwork and other supporting tasks needed by the sales team from other teams Tracks due dates and stays on top of all parties to ensure timely completion Updates and checks for accuracy of all contracts that are given to clients Works with Account Executive as a cohesive team providing the best client service  Skills & Qualifications: 1+ years of experience selling something or working in sales development 1+ years of project management experience 2+ years of administrative experience  Knowledge of Salesforce & G-Suite Knowledge of Shopify, Shipstation, & Odoo (would be a plus) Ability to problem solve and have an upper eye on all the different projects that are happening Great communication & organizational skills  Ability to work with deadlines Demonstrated history of persistence Intellectually curious and ambitious

Reports To: VP of Sales and Marketing Pay Status: Salary plus Commission Work Schedule: Monday – Friday (occasional weekends) Must be flexible to accommodate company, and customer needs and objectives Fontaine Spray Suppression is a Marmon Group/Berkshire Hathaway Company. We are the industry leader with the three strongest brands in the business: Fleetline, Nu-Line and Hogebuilt. Fleetline is focused on the Class 8 OEM market as well as OES private label, Nu-Line serves the Canadian aftermarket along with the Tanker market and Hogebuilt serves the Class 8 premium markets. Fleetline is a tier-one supplier in the production of all major Class 8 original equipment manufacturers (OEM) including PACCAR, Daimler, Volvo, and Navistar. We also supply all OEM dealers in the trucking industry through OES aftermarket programs. we sell our products through 3000+ dealer locations. Hogebuilt manufactures mid-grade and premium products for Peterbilt, Kenworth and aftermarket customers. Summary: The Sales and Marketing Representative is responsible for driving sales and marketing for all 3 brands for the organization. They are responsible for utilizing the strategic sales plans provided that will promote sales growth and customer satisfaction for the organization. Specific responsibilities include business and market development, customer management, sales growth, and customer satisfaction. Roles and Responsibilities include: The ideal candidate will be a natural leader with an interest in the automotive, trucking, or transportation industry. A strong work ethic, communication skills, and the ability to be part of a fast-paced team are a must. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: include the following. Other duties may be assigned. - Manage existing dealer network to provide exceptional service, and identity new sales opportunities. - Utilize sales reports provided to identify and grow sales. - Works to increase market share. - Social Media, Print, and various marketing requirements. - Advises on new product introductions with the management team - Works with customers to help them improve their familiarity with products. - Analyzes ways to obtain new customers through following inside and outside leads. - Works with internal employees to work with customers on collection of past due accounts. - Focuses on new product promotions by getting the information to customer accounts. - Attends trade shows to ultimately increase customer base & market share. - Follows-up on calls and dealer visits to keep customer informed and satisfied. - Compiling lists of prospective customers for use as sales leads, based on information from ad inquiries, trade shows, direct mail responses, business directories, Internet Web sites, and other sources. - Making outbound lead follow up calls to potential and existing customers by telephone and e-mail to qualify leads. - Overcome technical and business objections of prospective customers. - Estimate date of delivery to customer, based on knowledge of own firm's production and delivery schedules. - Build and maintain customer relationships. - Prepare reports of business transactions. - Enter new customer data and other sales data for current customers into computer database. - Investigate and resolve customer problems with deliveries with assistance from Customer Service. - Mail correspondence and promotions to current and prospective customers. -Manages database for prospects to maximize reach to the market. Education and/or Experience: Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent combination of education and experience. Language Skills: Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to write routine reports and correspondence. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization. Mathematical Skills: Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry. Reasoning Ability: Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists. Ability to interpret a variety of instructions furnished in written, oral, diagram, or schedule form. Computer Skills: To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of CRM Files, Spreadsheet software and Word Processing software. Other Skills and Abilities: Ability to deal effectively with disgruntled customers concerning account issues that may arise. Physical Demands: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to stand, walk, and sit. The employee is occasionally required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel, reach with hands and arms, and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 40 pounds. The employee must drive safely and maintain all legal driving requirements. Work Environment: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Launched in 2000, Eight Eleven Group committed to 100% organic growth, exclusively promoting from within, while always keeping culture and growth opportunity at the forefront of the business model. What began as a two-person Indianapolis startup, Eight Eleven Group has rapidly expanded to become a market-leading organization within one of the fastest growing industries today: Consulting and Professional Services.   In 2012, Medasource was established to provide niche services exclusively in the Healthcare industry, including these practice areas: Providers, Payers, Government, and Life Sciences (pharma, device, diagnostic, clinical research, commercial labs, consumer goods, food sciences, chemicals, agriculture, and environmental sciences). Our team takes a consultative, solution-driven approach with Fortune 500 and enterprise non-profit clients to help them deliver and execute complex capital and operational projects. We are not just in the business of professional services - we are in the business of making a meaningful and authentic impact both internally with our high-performing team and externally with our clients and consultants.   RESPONSIBILITIES  Associate Account Executives are enrolled in a comprehensive outside B2B Sales Training Program focused on learning how to take a solution-driven, approach to selling consulting and professional services. Once you complete training, 80% of your time will be spent in front of customer decision makers to build partnerships, pipeline opportunities, and secure win-win engagements with our clients. Here are the primary drivers for success in this role:  Strategically identify opportunities and pursuits in 3-5 designated target accounts  Build and sustain long-lasting relationships with new and existing clients within your assigned accounts through onsite client meetings, presentations, and outings such as ball games, dinners, golf, etc.  Consult with clients to create solutions that help drive change and successful projects within their organization that deliver positive outcomes  Act as a client advocate with a focus on improving the experience of our Fortune 500 target accounts  Presenting to C-suite executives and championing solutions for their project roadmap  Continue to meet and exceed target sales goals  Set personal and team goals through frequent sprint sessions with your manager and sales support team   SALES TRAINING  Takes place at our Corporate Headquarters in Indianapolis  Led by Medasource’s President and top sales leaders  Formalized training geared toward our practice areas and core competencies in the healthcare industry  Role playing situational selling exercises and ride-alongs with senior account executives  Establishing your client portfolio  Fostering executive-level relationships    BENEFITS & PERKS  Base salary + uncapped commissions  Monthly smartphone stipend and car allowance  401k match program   Full health benefits (medical, dental, vision, and HSA)  All-expenses-paid Reward Trip each year for top producers and a guest  Expense budget for client entertainment  Eight Eleven’s BeGiving Program: 1 PTO day per quarter for service work/volunteering   Access to Eight Eleven University (internal personal and professional development program)   Top-notch training at every step in your career  Access to a personal financial concierge  Genuine, passionate, family-oriented culture   WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED  Competitive, motivated spirit and desire to succeed  Outstanding communication skills and innate ability to connect with people  Entrepreneurial spirit with desire to learn and grow   Results-driven and forward-thinking  Thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative, and positive work environment   Bachelor’s Degree
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Management Consulting, and Information Technology and Services

The company has pioneered a horizontally-integrated cardiovascular monitoring and management solution that takes the patient from symptoms onset, to diagnosis, to condition management.  The position requires 5+ years of experience in cardiology sales.  Your Key Responsibilities:  • Identify, build and develop professional relationships with cardiologists, electrophysiologists, hospital and clinic staff and administrators. • Train and support customers on using company products and services. • Drive appropriate utilization of products. • Apply expertise and knowledge of heart monitoring, the marketplace, applicable competitors, industry, and cross-functional activities/plans to anticipate and optimally manage business opportunities and challenges. • Provide relevant, thoughtful input to other commercial colleagues regarding strategic and tactical planning for territory, area, and region. • Develop and implement effective customer specific territory plans. Communicate insights to internal stakeholders. • Ensure optimal coverage of appropriate physician specialists based on opportunity and potential. • Understand fully the assigned customers’ product and business needs and work to meet those needs while adhering to company ethics and compliance standards.

AmpliSource is a regional leader in helping drive circular economics in the food manufacturing supply chain. We are boldly tackling new market space and are looking for a Regional Sales Manager to support the development of the inbound by-product volume on the East Coast. In this role you will have the opportunity to be part of a company that cares about both employees and customers and where your daily contribution has deep and lasting impact. Assist in developing the bid strategy for new opportunities  ●       Work with existing account locations and opportunities to determine potential expansion projects  ●       Understand territory planning, including outlining current situation, accounts, prospects, competitors and vendors  ●       Have an entrepreneurial approach to revenue growth, customer service and profitability  ●       Be a data-driven and detail-oriented analytical thinker that continuously evaluates and methodically and creatively optimizes strategy based on metrics and results  ●       Develop a deep understanding of the product & marketplace with the ability to translate that into highly effective sales strategy and consistent revenue growth while continually working to stabilize margins  ●       Communicate with operations management staff to understand waste streams and challenges with certain products/vendors to communicate with vendors about issues and also make informed decisions about new incoming product streams.  ●       Call on prospective opportunities and maintain call log activity  ●       Proactively manage sales pipeline and maintain clean, current data in the CRM system with weekly reporting  ●       Perform additional responsibilities as needed.  Qualifications: ●      Bachelor’s degree and/or 1 year of demonstrated success in delivering sales results ●      Self-motivated, energetic and tenacious, creative thinker ●       Excellent communication and client engagement skills   AmpliSource has built a collaborative working environment where employees are empowered and rewarded in proportion to the company’s success.   ●     An opportunity to make a deep impact to the growth of our organization, sales strategy and long-term success  ●       A nimble, energizing environment where your daily contribution has deep and lasting impact

description: Machine Health is the key to Global Productivity. We are on a mission to build a world where people can always rely on the machines that matter. We are all surrounded by machines and rely on them in everything we do - from the buildings in which we live and work, the goods that we consume, to the power and running water that we use. There is a significant cost and effort that goes into designing, manufacturing, installing and maintaining the machines that enable and support our daily lives.  Augury is making machines more reliable by combining two key shifts in the industry: artificial intelligence and the Internet of Things. The intersection of these trends allows Augury to provide machines with a mechanical nervous system and the awareness to optimize their own health, thereby accelerating human productivity and safety.  Augury is looking for a proactive, well-spoken and results driven Sales Development Representative (SDR) for a full time position located in New York City. This position will be remote until we open the office back up later this year. We’re looking for a hunter who has exceeded their previous quotas and possesses exceptional communication skills.  In this role, you’ll be the engine that powers our sales team by prospecting and generating opportunities. The SDR is often our customers’ first experience with Augury, so you need to be a people person who makes a great first impression.  This is a phenomenal opportunity to join our growing team as we rapidly grow our business internationally.  A Day In Your Life  You will be - above all else - an Augury expert, working in a dynamic start-up environment Develop your business acumen through exposure to various stages of enterprise sales cycles with Fortune 500 companies Have high impact engagements, develop new relationships and generate opportunities with key corporate level decision makers and influencers Understand specific product applications, recognize prospect pain points, and how Augury can solve them This key role is strategic in nature - it’s not about jumping online and contacting everyone you come across. Rather, it’s about considered, focused interactions that are unearthed through a high volume of personalized outbound activity (emails, cold calls, social touches) Perform thorough and accurate account research and stakeholder mapping to uncover key thought leaders and corporate initiatives Consistently achieve and/or exceed qualified opportunity quotas to ensure sales objectives  What You Bring  Undergraduate Degree 1-2 years experience in a customer facing role Remote working experience a plus Exceptional communication skills (verbal and written) Exceptional research skills Ability to work autonomously within a team Familiarity with sales processes Thirst for learning Motivation to Succeed  Perks  Comprehensive Medical Coverage 401k plan with matching Stock options Paid parental leave Commuter Benefits Phone Reimbursement  Augury is a people-first organization. We believe in fostering an inclusive environment in which employees feel encouraged to share their unique perspectives, leverage their strengths, and act authentically. We know that diverse teams are strong teams, and we welcome those from all backgrounds and varying experiences. We are committed to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. We believe that diversity is more than just good intentions, and we are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  Augury is a proud equal opportunity employer, we strive to create a work environment in which everyone, all applicants, employees, customers, guests, and vendors feel safe and comfortable. We commit to maintain a workplace that is free of any type of harassment and does not tolerate anyone intimidating, humiliating, or hurting others. We prohibit willful discrimination based on age, gender, ethnicity, race, color, religion, political opinions, sexual orientation, sexual identity or expression, military or veteran status, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.

Senior Sales Lead Join our team! This is a year of growth at Allovance and we're looking for a Closer to lead our sales team. We are scaling rapidly, and it is important for us to find a candidate who embraces challenge, is eager to learn, and is passionate about succeeding. This leadership role requires high social intelligence and a natural inclination for selling to grow the company from a founder-led sales stage to a serious sales powerhouse selling into government, education, healthcare, and utility sectors. Primary users of the product are Facilities Managers, Capital Planning Directors, City Engineers, Economic Development Officers, and Portfolio Management professionals. Target customer organizations range from small cities to mid-size businesses and large enterprises.  The Sales Lead will be the first dedicated sales hire at Allovance and will be responsible for following up on leads, developing relationships, and closing sales opportunities. The Sales Lead will act as the final point of contact while making business connections and landing new clients and contracts. This role will supervise a Lead Generation Associate whose job will be to work the top end of the funnel.  Who we are: Allovance is an independent company that spun off of the founder’s well-established management consulting firm, Pyramid Consulting International. Pyramid Consulting has been in business for 15+ years and has 50+ employees. Clients include Fortune 500 companies across different industries.  Allovance is built around the idea that there is a better way to make decisions.  Our company is built on research in decision sciences, psychology, business, change management, and learning behaviors.  This research led to the development of two unique product offerings: 1.      A cloud-based capital allocation and strategic prioritization software designed to add transparency and reliability to any organizational prioritization practices. 2.      Decision Coach certification in partnership with The University of Michigan.  As a self-contained decision hub, Allovance allows you to create priorities, input projects, score projects against priorities, and plan your projects all from one platform. Critical business decisions shouldn't happen in isolation. Instead, they should be viewed in light of the bigger picture and aligned to your priorities.   We certainly dream big at Allovance; however, we believe that good decision-making starts with small changes, and it starts…with people. People are at the center of everything we do. Our 5-step process understands the human elements of decision-making, like biases and subjectivity, and accounts for them in decision-making using our patented software platform.    You’ll Love This Role If You: Want to build the initial sales operations of a start-up and have a passion for sharing Allovance’s story with prospective clients Are High-Energy and Persuasive - you love building relationships and influencing people Are Fearless and Confident – you have the drive to succeed and you’re not afraid to fail Are Self-Motivated – you’re results-driven and can work with minimal supervision Are Curious - you enjoy uncovering new info you can use to make connections Embrace Change and Initiate Opportunity - you stay positive through change Have a Passion for Growth - you love feedback and focus on continuous improvement Believe in Spirited Teamwork - you believe in sharing knowledge with team members. Believe in the need for more inclusive and equitable decision making that recognizes and balances diverse perspectives  You demonstrate trust in your colleagues and share a responsibility to succeed.   Here’s What We Are Looking For: Someone with experience in go-to-market strategy (ex. suggest new target markets, define the prospect space/profile, etc.) You have a solid network of peers and lasting relationships across different industries. (i.e. facilities, government, public sector, education…) 5 years of B2B sales experience Comfort and experience in B2B sales High interest in building a career in sales Ability to clearly communicate complicated topics. You can speak in simple terms people can understand and expand when required. Innovative and creative team members that can connect dots others don’t see An overachiever and natural problem solver. You believe barriers present an opportunity Excellent written and verbal communication skills You never quit and ultimately succeed in everything you do!  Responsibilities: Build Allovance Sales strategy and go-to-market strategy with collaboration from team Conversion - Turn leads into sales Identify and build relationships with key decision-makers and influencers Leverage relevant business information and market intelligence Educate potential customers about Allovance and its services Handle objections and align our solutions to customer’s needs Collaborate and innovate with team on how best to connect with potential customers Engage with potential clients and customers and promote brand on social media  Compensation:  Competitive base salary plus uncapped commission.  Quality health care options and benefits Location: Ann Arbor, MI. (May work in Hybrid or Remotely as situations/needs dictate)

INTRODUCTION  Founded in 1856 by Thomas Burberry, Burberry is a global luxury brand with a distinctly British attitude. We are a global business with an extensive network of both owned and franchised stores across EMEIA, Asia Pacific and Americas. We are digital pioneers, and innovative technology underpins every aspect of our business, from product design to distribution and marketing. We believe that modern luxury means being socially and environmentally responsible; this mindset is core to our business and key to our long-term success.  JOB PURPOSE  Through your passion for the brand and professionalism you will be responsible for effectively and efficiently supporting the store back of house operations.  Responsibilities Receiving and handling stock orders receiving from hub or warehouse Ensuring accuracy of products received and reporting any discrepancy Supporting the sales team with retrieving stock in a timely manner including Omnichannel and stock pullback. Keeping back of house in a tidy manner compliant with Retail Operations and Standards. Quality control on all products at all times and reporting any issues to store lead Adhoc administration including answering telephone calls, responding and liaising with customer service, stationary and supermarket orders, general administrative tasks Adhoc requests by store management to support with events, visual merchandising, stock taking and other such duties PERSONAL PROFILE Excellent organisational skills and meticulous attention to detail Excellent communication skills both verbal and in writing Basic computer skills in core Microsoft software Ability to work well in a team Ability to work in a busy team environment

jobTitle: New Business Development Sales Specialist - San Jose, CA
description: Auto req ID: 248996BR  Job Description  We are PepsiCo Sales. We are game changers, mountain movers and history makers. We are a diverse group, spread among 200 countries and united by a shared set of values and goals.  That’s why we Win with Purpose. Together, we blaze new trails, succeed, celebrate and never settle for second best. At PepsiCo, we’re committed to performing well as individuals and in teams, to strengthen the company as a whole.  Are you hungry to be a part of the World’s largest portfolio of billion dollar food and beverage brands? Then now is the time to explore the opportunities of PepsiCo: what makes you unique makes us better.  PepsiCo Food service is a division of PepsiCo that brings the company’s entire portfolio of food and beverage brands to market in out-of-home consumption channels to meet consumer needs at work, at play, and on the go. This role will cover the territory between San Jose and Milpitas** Food service, also known on premise selling, will service existing accounts and use superior cold-calling selling skills to generate new business for Restaurants and Bars. Build and maintain strategic partnerships with customers and drive customer satisfaction through superior service and execution Acquire new Food Service accounts via leads, cold-calling and other strategic selling solutions Analyze Customer information using Datassential to identify and expand business opportunities Coordinate placement of new equipment and ensure flawless execution of logistics Successful candidates will drive volume, revenue and paint the town Pepsi Blue Qualifications/Requirements Previous fact-based selling experience Food Service or consumer packaged goods experience Spanish fluency is strongly preferred Must be willing and able to lift 40 lbs. periodically This position is limited to persons with indefinite right to work in the United States Must have a valid driver's license Safe driving record strongly preferred Relocation Eligible: Not Eligible for Relocation  Job Type: Regular  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status. Job description Position Overview: The ParaPRO pharmaceutical organization represents NATROBA (spinosad) Topical Suspension 0.9% w/w, currently the number #1 prescribed branded topical antiparasitic product in the market. Our Pharmaceutical Sales Representatives (PSR’s) are responsible for sales results and all sales activity within their individual assigned territories. This includes (but is not limited to) sales calls to Health Care Providers, (physicians, NP’s, PA’s, School Nurses, pharmacies), primary wholesaler inquiries and any medical professional (or organization), which may influence ParaPRO promoted product sales. The target audience for Natroba is dermatologist, general practitioners, and pediatricians. ParaPRO PSR’s are expected to make 40-65 unique office visits per week on prescribing health care professionals resulting in multiple calls within each group practice. General boundaries of the territory would encompass Atlanta. Candidate must live within 30 miles of the head quarter city. Major Duties and Responsibilities: A PSR is responsible for achieving assigned company sales goals and performing the following duties: Represent ParaPRO professionally, delivering sales presentations to HCP’s per ParaPRO’s SOPs and sales model training Develop and execute a business plan to maximum sales potential for assigned territory Successfully complete rigorous sales training program Build and maintain quality relations with assigned accounts Participation in national and regional Plan of Action Meetings/Product launches Vet and establish relationships with regional KOL’s Participation in tradeshow management as required by sales leadership (AAP, Etc.) Evaluate, modify and drive performance to increase prescription sales. Maintain updated, organized account files in assigned territory through contact management Complete and maintain sales report activity as defined by policy. Comply with all legal and regulatory requirements governing the sale and promotion of pharmaceutical products. Perform other related duties as assigned Qualifications/Skills/Requirements: College Degree (BS or higher) Candidates should possess a minimum of 2 years sales experience with a proven track record (pharmaceutical preferred) Must have valid state driver’s license & meet company insurability requirements Clearance company security and background check Must have a personal credit card to utilize for reimbursable expenses ParaPRO is a drug-free environment, company does pre-employment and annual random drug testing  Good problem identification, analysis and solving skills Strong computer and e-skills Must live within 30 miles of head quarter city, assigned territory Some overnight travel may be required Physician sales experience is a plus Able to lift packages of 25 pounds on a regular basis Knowledge of pharmaceutical terminology a plus Benefits Include Competitive annual compensation (base salary & target bonus) Expense account Comprehensive product and sales training Use of company iPad Company vehicle Cell phone allowance Internet allowance Health Insurance Life Insurance Dental/Vision Insurance 401(K) with 25% company matching Additional Profit sharing opportunity through 401(K) corporate contribution Access to medical/daycare pre-tax savings Access to short-term and long-term disability insurance Paid Vacation and Holidays

Clear Path to Growth and Promotion within ~12+ Months! Supportive Culture with Strong Leadership! Full Benefits! Expensed Travel! Car Allowance! description: Director – Strategic Accounts Position Description  Overview MaxOne, the leading digital coaching platform ("DCP") in amateur and youth sports is shifting its sales focus to target College Athletics’ departments and specifically strength & conditioning coaching staff members.  We are specifically seeking candidates with previous strength & conditioning background and experience for consultative selling positions that will become available between September to December this year. NOTE: Academic background and experience as a strength & conditioning or performance coach (preferably at the college level) are sought after qualifications for this role.  The ideal candidate for this position will be someone with a passion for data science and performance improvement of college athletes and understand the critical juncture between retrieving an athlete’s bio-metric data, interpreting the data and providing customized training solutions so as to improve an athlete’s readiness to perform, but also improve one’s general health & wellness for their entire lives.  If you have a passion for sports technology, data science, performance enhancement and how participation in sports is meaningful in developing champions for life, then this may be a position for you. If you have these characteristics along with an enthusiastic drive to succeed we would love to talk to you about our Director – Strategic Accounts position.  This position will be a remote work position and will report to the Company’s Sales Manager.  Each day, hundreds of thousands of coaches, directors, and managers positively impact the lives of millions of athletes through Sports. In addition to coaching skills & drills, these coaches mentor and inspire youth athletes to become young adults with the life skills to excel as they move beyond their time in youth sports.  At MaxOne, our mission is to make coaching available for all athletes EVERYWHERE and to make the lives of every coach volunteer easier by offering the youth sports industry’s best Digital Coaching Platform (‘DCP’) solution to help coaches build and distribute custom training, workouts and coaching directly to player phones, supplementing and enhancing in-person practice & play coaching activities. See more at MaxOne.ai We're looking for people who not only agree with our mission, but have a passion for excellence, building something meaningful and bringing their A-Game EVERYDAY. Become a pro and join a team like us!  Director – Strategic Accounts Role and Responsibilities: The primary function of this role is to secure new business for the company working directly with College Athletics’ departments, and specifically strength & conditioning coaches. Execute discovery calls with target personas guiding them to reveal problems and challenges they’re experiencing related to performance improvement, and applications for technology-enabled sophisticated coaching recommendations based on an athlete’s bio-metrics data. Execute demo presentations by keying in on customer problem(s) and showing those aspects of the product’s features and user experiences that address customer opportunities. Do so, in a manner that guides the customer to conclude that their ideal future state (after problem resolution) is achieved by selecting MaxOne’s DCP offerings. Throughout a thoughtful selling process guide potential new customers to self-define the ‘impact’ on their organization for addressing and resolving the problems they have revealed and are committed to solving. Be a ‘Problem Solver’ for the customer. Inspire trust and durable relationships, by proposing innovative solutions for the problems the customer has shared they’re experiencing. Understand and thoughtfully execute a sales process, leveraging sales automation tools and proven value messaging to achieve a high touch, high quality activity cadence resulting in 50+ customer interactions daily. Support customers directly via telephone, email and social platforms to efficiently secure new business for the company. Own your results. Unwavering personal daily effort standards such that managerial oversight and mentoring is focused on quantifiable daily and weekly goals, sales skills & career growth. Continue to gain advanced product and market knowledge to differentiate yourself and MaxOne as both a technical and business fit for each customer you interact with. Build trusting relationships with the company’s Business Development Representatives to develop seamless hand-offs and synergy to achieve optimal sales outcomes. Collaborate with the entire sales team to support and facilitate overall success of the sales team. Maintain an accurate daily record of sales activity using HubSpot CRM. Other duties as assigned.  Director – Strategic Accounts Qualifications and Skills: College degree or equivalent (Strongly Preferred). Masters degree in Performance Science (Desired) Previous experience as a Strength & Conditioning coach and a desire to interact and support hundreds of strength, wellness, nutrition and performance coaches (Desired) Understand the utilization and importance of data application to the performance and development of athletes (Desired) Have worked and applied athlete development models in the past (Desired) Experience with HubSpot CRM or similar CRM (Strongly Preferred). Being a problem-centric seller (Note: Read Gap Selling by Keenan prior to interviewing with MaxOne). Ability to relate to and understand sport administrators' problems and desired outcomes. Ability to engage with customers and thrive while operating within a hyper-growth fast-paced start-up company environment where change happens at a torrid pace. Curiosity and enthusiasm. Professional integrity. Amazing multi-tasking abilities with consistent and timely follow-through. Growth mindset - view challenges as opportunities and approach every day as an opportunity to improve and grow. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Deliver compelling demos and proposals to effectively and efficiently win sales opportunities Continuously strive to improve and learn from your manager, peers, and colleagues  People Who Fit Our Culture Naturally curious, passionate and have a “whatever it takes” attitude Fast learners with the ability to grasp new concepts quickly Persuasive, amiable, self-motivated and goal-oriented Enjoy working in a team environment Ability to quickly adapt to changing priorities as required in a high-growth start-up environment Possesses a strong willingness to work hard and put in the extra effort to get the job done A desire to win!!  Why MaxOne? Total Rewards: Competitive salary, stock options and health benefits  Self-Managed Time Off: Awesome people need time off to maintain balance in their lives and to deliver exceptional results. You should take time as you need, when you need it. We offer unlimited time off to empower team members to take paid time off for a variety of reasons, such as, but not limited to vacation, personal, sick and bereavement.  Flexibility: We believe that giving team members a high degree of ownership creates a high performing culture. We trust you to do your work. We don’t have a set time for you to show up or leave. We have the technology and teamwork to allow you to do what’s needed, from wherever you need to do it.  Equal Employment Opportunity MaxOne is committed to equal employment and advancement opportunity for all employees and candidates for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religious creed, gender, physical or mental disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, age or marital status in accordance with the applicable laws and regulations. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.  About MaxOne MaxOne’s Digital Coaching Platform (‘DCP’) empowers organizations, coaches, and athletes with a digital solution to train, connect and grow together, anywhere. With an increasing list of demands, directors and coaches need to be smarter in the development of their training programs and in the use of their time and resources. MaxOne’s DCP features cutting edge training tools, creating the most sophisticated and engaging on-demand digital training experience available.  Job Type: Full-time Pay: $50,000.00 - $80,000.00 per year Benefits: Flexible schedule Health insurance stipend Work from home  Schedule: Monday to Friday  Education: Bachelor's (Preferred)  Work Location: Remote

SALES REPRESENTATIVE OVERVIEW:  No cold calling! Uncapped Commission! Remote position!  Are you ready to jump-start your career by joining an innovative, growing company? Cali Bamboo is looking for someone like you to join us as an Inside Sales Consultant! Honored as a Fastest Growing Private Company 7 years in a row by both the San Diego Business Journal and the Inc 5000, Cali Bamboo strives to set the standard for sustainable businesses everywhere by promoting bamboo and recycled materials! This is a business that believes in supporting, encouraging, motivating, and listening to our staff. We will help you grow quickly in your sales career by training you on our products and our proven sales approach!  Responsibilities: Exhibit a positive and professional attitude on a daily basis with customers and team members Track and maintain a high volume of incoming calls, leads and clients (no cold calls!) Manage and process full cycle sale with each of your customers through phone and email as needed Proactively and aggressively pursue both monthly sales and daily activity goals for big bonus opportunities Keep up with and react to rapid changes in product offerings, operations, and duty assignments Bring a willingness to offer innovative ideas and participate in a dynamic work environment  Requirements Bachelor’s Degree preferred Problem-solving skills, quick thinking and the desire to constantly improve and learn Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written Self-motivated, proactive, high energy, positive and outgoing personality Driven to achieve results Ability to quickly build rapport with prospective customers Basic familiarity with lead management systems (preferred but not required) Prior sales experience is a plus, but not required. We will train you!  Compensation:  We offer a Base + Uncapped Commission structure for this position.  Powered by JazzHR  jjygffYXT4

description: MW Company is an engineering, design, manufacturing and marketing company with a portfolio of leading brands in the automotive and lifestyle industry, including WELD, MOMO, Forgestar, ADV.1, CCW, Driven Motorsports, Reds, HiPer Technology, and Tikore. It is headquartered in Kansas City, MO, with main offices in Orange County, CA, and Milan, Italy. MW Company employs more than 200 people worldwide.  MW Company is part of the Cisneros Corporation, a third-generation global family enterprise with experience in numerous industries across media, telecommunications, consumer goods and automotive brands.  Territory Sales Representatives are responsible to maximize market penetration for MW Company’s portfolio Street Performance products that include WELD OFF ROAD, WELD Performance, MOMO Road Wheels, Forgestar, ADV.1 and CCW brand wheels, in assigned territory. Directly prospecting for potential dealers in assigned territory, including cold calling and qualifying valid dealer accounts. Will be responsible to maintain regular and consistent customer contact to develop and increase share of accounts wheel business. Record and monitor customer contacts initiate minimum of semi-annual contact with every lead and dealer in assigned territory. Continue to learn and stay abreast of technical details of brands, market trends and customer preferences. The territory area is Spokane WA and Idaho area.  Under the supervision of Regional Sales Director, you will: Assume responsibility for the effective and professional completion of sales function Creates great business relations customers Handles problems and complaints in a prompt and professional manner Accomplishes all weekly reporting as it relates to Sales Assist with inventory accuracy, warehouse, shipping and receiving functions as needed Demonstrate strong interpersonal and communication skills Assists in verifying accounts, checking product availability, and mailing correspondence Keeps management informed of area activities and significant problems Works with and ensure functions are effectively and accurately performed in accordance with established policies, standards, and security procedures  REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS -      High school diploma or equivalent.  PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS 5 years of experience in sales, marketing or customer service Experience with ERP systems preferred, experience with PLEX a plus Understanding of automotive, performance and motorsports preferred

Job Description  This candidate must drive new business sales and exceed sales targets sold through producer channels and direct opportunities in assigned territory. The territory will include the Mid-Atlantic and Southeast Regions in the United States. The role provides an opportunity to a professional who is eager to join a large healthcare company and exceed goals by finding and developing new business opportunities, cultivating winning relationships, and driving strong results in the global expatriate market.  Fundamental Components & Physical Requirements include but are not limited to: Develop new business opportunities to ensure profitable customers and help grow the business through consultative selling and market research Ensures product, pricing and services meet client's needs while meeting Aetna revenue growth and profit objectives. Manages and builds producer relations as needed depending on book of business or market segment(s) being supported. Identifies various ways to partner with the client by drawing from entire spectrum of product line illustrating a keen understanding of client's multifaceted needs and benefits of Aetna International's full product portfolio. Collaborates with internal partners and/or external constituents to uncover profitable growth and cross-sell opportunities within new or existing customers and to support post-sale activities. Coordinates sales materials, testimonials and subject matter expert involvement in support of the successful delivery of constituent presentations. May participate in constituent meetings including finals presentations. Develops/maintains and communicates expertise on products, industry and emerging marketplace trends. Required Qualifications 3-5 years of health insurance experience Strong presentation skills Organizational skills managing producer activity and quote volume Preferred Qualifications Licensure as required by state (must obtain within 90 days) Education  Bachelor's Degree or higher is preferred  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

companyName: Medimaps Group - creators of TBS Osteo powered by TBS iNsight ™ - medical AI technology.
description: Home base can be location; Relocation is not required  Company description: Medimaps Group (MG) is the world’s leading company designing and providing medical imaging software for bone health assessment for improved fracture risk assessment. We are a rapidly growing company developing and commercializing medical imaging software powered by AI. Our flagship product, TBS - Trabecular Bone Score, has just received medical reimbursement in the US and we are looking for individuals with an entrepreneur spirit to join our team and help us grow the US market!  MG Headquarters are based in Geneva, Switzerland, and the R&D and Production subsidiary is situated in Bordeaux, France, and a Sales Office in the USA, currently totaling 25+ people and we are now primed for growth. MG was founded in 2012 and has expanded commercializtion through EMEA, US, Asia, and Latin American markets. In the context of its increasing activity, MG is now looking for a Sales Executive to join its US based team.   Roles & Responsibilities Responsible for sales in a defined territory As a goal-driven Sales Executive you will be the prime person responsible for generating sales volume by prospecting leads for new customers and developing credible long-term relationships with our re-sellers and customers Actively build the sales pipeline and drive sales of MG AI imaging software products for install base bone densitometry units and radiology Achieve sales targets on dedicated territories. Implement a state by state sales plan Implement a sales marketing plan and manage to budget; ensure coordination and follow-up of sales and marketing actions efficiently and effectivelyt Organize and execute sales and marketing strategy on dedicated territories to ensure proper execution of the sales plan Report on sales activity Including, but not limited to: Issue quotes, coordinate orders with Administrative and Technical Depts and ensure proper delivery using our internal tools and in line with company processes and quality chart Take an active role in sales and marketing strategy development and execution, in line with global company strategy defined by management Coordinate sales within our medical regulatory constraints Promote the product and image of the company; ensure product notoriety expansion in line with global marketing strategy Participate in conferences, seminars, and tradeshows to generate sales leads and promote Medimaps Communicate with local key opinion leaders   Required Qualifications:  Education: Bachelor’s degree preferably in Sales and/or Marketing Experience: +3 years experience in B-to-B sales; experience in medical environment (Medical Devices, pharmaceutical industry) Languages: Fluent English; Spanish a plus  Skills: Ability to plan, work, and execute autonomously. Demonstrate dedication and adaptability as well as reliability and persistency.  Interpersonal qualifications: sales driven, customer-oriented, entrepreneurial-spirit and excellent communication skills  Medical software sales a plus Travel: 30 to 50% Pay based on experience

About Us: Foodsmart is eating well made simple. We are the world’s largest telenutrition and foodcare solution, backed by a national network of Registered Dietitians and designed to yield consistently healthier food choices, lasting behavior change and long-term results. Foodsmart’s highly personalized, digital platform guides members through a personalized journey to eating well while saving them time and money. Foodsmart seamlessly integrates dietary assessments and nutrition counseling with online food ordering and cost-effective meal planning for the whole family that makes the most of ingredients at home and on the go. With national and regional retail partners across the US now accepting SNAP/EBT, Foodsmart helps bring healthier food within reach to eligible members and can also assist with SNAP enrollment.   About The Role: The SDR's role is to find and connect with key decision makers and stakeholders in the commercial and health insurance spaces and to qualify and set meetings for Account Executives. Additionally, your job is to set the account executive up for success on the call and to make sure to research the company and participants once a meeting is set. This job will require a mix of innovative and diverse outreach methods including cold calling, emailing, LinkedIn, and direct mail in order to reach our prospective customers. We are looking for people with creative and entrepreneurial spirits combined with focus and determination who can fill a pipeline and are ultimately interested in learning how to complete a sale from end to end.  Requirements: Excellent verbal, written, and listening skills and executive presence.  A history of demonstrated tenacity and creativity. The ability to map accounts and understand complex organization structures. The desire to learn healthcare and health insurance vocabulary. College degree or 4+ years relative experience. 1+ years of experience as a SDR/BDR  Desired Skills: Prior cold calling and prospecting experience. Familiarity with the health insurance and healthcare spaces. Experience and knowledge of healthy eating practices or experience working with registered dietitians. Prior experience using CRMs like Hubspot. Experience using email cadence software or sales acceleration tools like outreach.io, salesloft, or Hubspot  Benefits, Perks, & Other Details: Unlimited PTO Flexible working hours Location flexible Monthly wellness stipend (fitness equipment, gym reimbursements, etc.) Medical, vision, & dental insurance Stock options & 401K Salary- $80,000 OTE ($50K Base + $30K Incentive)  Why Foodsmart? Foodsmart is a mission-driven organization that creates fulfillment at the end of each day, knowing you are working towards helping people live healthier lives through nutrition. As a fast growing startup, there are significant opportunities for growth early on in your tenure. Besides competitive compensation, we offer many unique benefits, including unlimited PTO, flexible working hours, flexible working location, paid health insurance, monthly gym subsidies, and daily lunch allowances.  Foodsmart is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our firm policy to extend equal employment and advancement opportunity to all applicants and employees without regard to race, color, national origin, citizenship status, religious creed, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth and/or breastfeeding), gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, marital status, disability (physical or mental) and/or a medical condition, genetic information, ancestry, veteran status or service in the uniformed services, and any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local law.

description: Do you love technology, finance, building customer relationships and a purpose driven Startup mentality? Look no further than the TH! We are looking for motivated, results-driven Sales Professionals seeking an exciting career opportunity to actively seek out and engage customer prospects on behalf of a pioneering FinTech company leading financial institutions to the next analytics frontier. Join us on our journey!  Responsibilities Present, promote and sell products / services using persuasive arguments to existing and prospective customers (THC SaaS Analytics) Perform cost-­benefit and needs analysis of existing / potential customers to meet their needs Establish, develop and maintain positive business and customer relationships Reach out to customer leads through introductory and cold calling Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within schedule Maintain and provide regular sales and status reports to company executives Maintain positive business relationships to ensure future sales Keep abreast of best practices and promotional trends Continuously improve through feedback  Requirements High energy and / or proven work experience as a Sales Professional Interest in and / or basic understanding of bank balance sheets Excellent knowledge of MS Office Ability to build productive business professional relationships Ability to travel frequently to develop relationships with existing clients and prospects Highly motivated and target driven with a proven interest and / or track record in Sales Excellent selling (marketing), communication and negotiation skills Prioritizing, time management and organizational skills Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to audience needs Relationship management skills and openness to feedback

Base Salary $40K - $45K, total comp at plan first year $80K - $120K. Uncapped commissions which makes your total comp the investment you put in the position.  Leading medical/surgical products distributor is seeking a full-time field sales representative for the West Virginia, West Pennsylvania, West Maryland and surrounding territory. This position requires an experienced sales person who can not only sell products but also recognize new opportunities with both new and existing customers. Preferred candidate would have a documented success history selling in the following areas: Operating room, inpatient pharmacy and/or compounding pharmacies, ambulatory surgery centers, and/or IV Therapy. The ideal candidate must be self-motivated and have a strong proven sales record with solid relationship skills.  The Company offers a Base salary, an uncapped commission program, defined and protected territories, approved expenses, mileage reimbursement, insurance benefits package and 401(k) matching. Your success will be measured by your ability to meet sales quotas, attract new accounts and build relationships. This is a phenomenal opportunity in the medical sales industry with an innovative and dynamic leading company. If you meet the above criteria and are looking for a new position with an outstanding organization, please apply as directed. Only qualified candidates meeting the above criteria will be notified.  The top reasons why the best reps want to work for Progressive Medical, Inc: A National Sales Team that is clinically prepared to support the needs of our clinical customers in any clinical environment. A National Account & Contract Team that understands the needs of Group Purchasing Organizations (GPOs) and Integrated Delivery Networks (IDNs) and how they play a significant role in the healthcare supply chain industry. A Customer Service Team that is second to none, fully staffed by Customers Service Specialists who personally answer every call, every time. Our Operations and Distribution Teams ensure our customers receive their product professionally and expediently. A Clinical Affairs Team that is available to answer questions and provide peer to peer training and support to our customers. Sales Education in collaboration with the Marketing Team provide extensive and continuous educational programs for not only our sales force, but the entire PMI organization. Our Marketing Team of professionals works in all aspects of both upstream and downstream marketing, from implementation to analysis, we understand how to take your product to market. Progressive Medical, Inc. is a leading distributor of specialty medical products throughout the United States. Our focus on innovative products helps clinicians to practice the highest quality care and increase safety, while also controlling overall costs in the areas of: surgery/anesthesia, interventional radiology, critical care and IV specialties.

Villa creates housing that empowers homeowners and helps communities flourish. We believe that families shouldn’t be broken up because they can’t afford to live in the same city. We believe that safe and comfortable housing shouldn’t be just for the wealthy. And we believe that the housing shortage can be solved through a visionary plan and hard work.  We build high-quality prefab accessory dwelling units in the most efficient and cost-effective way possible, and make the process easy for everyone. Every member of our team is dedicated to our mission of building housing that matters. And we always put our customers first.  We believe that everyone deserves a place to call home and invite you to join us.  Role Overview  We are seeking a high energy and organized Sales Development Representative to educate customers on our product. SDRs will focus their energy on effectively communicating our value props and building relationships with customers, with the ultimate goal of collecting a deposit to begin their project.  As one of our SDRs you will not only have the ability to create value through immediate increase in our deal flow but will have the opportunity to structure our sales systems, work directly with our executive team and shape our culture. This is a career path role with significant opportunities.  What You'll Do Qualify inbound leads and educate them on our services. Schedule digital-home visits to evaluate project feasibility and cost. Work closely with project managers to ensure meeting hand-off successfully occurs. Have full knowledge of target prospect base and manage an ongoing prospect pipeline. Act as the subject matter expert on our product, providing prospects with peace of mind that we are unlike any company in the industry. Present our value props in a clear and concise manner. Diligently update Salesforce, ensuring our CRM system stays up-to-date with correct information. Have full knowledge of target prospect base and manage an ongoing prospect pipeline. Report to KPI’s to sales leadership on numbers including outreach, connects, meetings scheduled, etc. What You Are Excellent verbal and written communication skills and enjoy interacting with people via phone, email and social media to articulate ideas and gain their trust, and have experience drafting clear communications that demonstrate attention to detail. Proven success in lead generation and lead qualification. Experience and comfort prospecting via phone, email, and other new account development activities. A track record of personal accountability, and a high standard of integrity and professionalism. You’ve demonstrated resilience and a desire to succeed in the face of new and/or unforeseen challenges. Team-player with a strong desire to help enforce and improve internal processes. A desire to learn, grow and get in on the ground floor of a company that is changing housing. Receptive to feedback, with the willingness to learn and embrace continuous improvement. Ability to work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing business environment. Excellent organizational skills. Basic skills in Microsoft Office and Google Suite, Salesforce is a plus! Bachelor's Degree with 1-2+ years of experience in a sales-related role. Background in homebuilding, real estate or construction sales is a bonus! We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you’re excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.  Villa is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law. Villa considers all qualified applicants in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.  Please review our CCPA policies here.

Description Hello! Interested in a unique opportunity to join a team in a 100% remote company, and help build the next generation of an Enterprise Data Collection platform used by some of the largest and most well known organizations in the world that rely on FormAssembly to help take their web forms and data collection to the next level.  You don’t wait for others to break a trail — you blaze it yourself. You’ll prospect and develop new leads via email, social media, LinkedIn, calling, and other resourceful "smart selling" lead generation practices. You’ll qualify prospects to determine if FormAssembly is a good fit for their needs, and ultimately provide Account Executives with high quality closing opportunities. Ideally, you've been successful meeting and exceeding a lead generation quota. You may travel periodically to represent the FormAssembly brand at industry events.  About Us: FormAssembly is a leading enterprise data collection platform, built to help organizations streamline processes and drive quality form conversions. At our core, our mission is to help organizations collect, use, and be good stewards of the personal data entrusted to them. We work across multiple industries with well-known customers, including Amazon, Aetna, Lenovo, Volvo and others. We have been recognized in the 2018 and 2019 Inc. 5000 lists of fastest growing private companies, and we are a G2 Crowd Winter 2019 Leader. Here are some links to give you a peek into what it's like to work at FormAssembly: Meet our awesome team. Learn how and why we work remotely. If you’re a genuinely nice person who is great to work with, respectful, and who will put the team and our customers first, we’d be thrilled to have you apply for this position. FormAssembly is an equal opportunity employer. If you belong to an under-represented group in tech, you’ll find a welcoming culture that thrives on diversity. This is a full-time position, open to all locations (working remotely from home) working in Mountain Standard/Daylight time hours.  Responsibilities: Schedule qualified meetings for our Account Executive team, from marketing-generated, inbound leads.   Prospect and develop inbound leads with phone calls, email cadences, LinkedIn, and other resourceful “smart selling” lead generation practices.  Perform pre-call prospect research on inbound leads and contacts.  Learn prospects’ current challenges and desired future state to offer a solution.  Proactively provide feedback to the manager and other teams with the goal of continuous improvement for all.  Actively collaborate cross-departmentally with a growth mindset and an eye on the big picture.   Maintain proper CRM data integrity and hygiene.   About you: College Degree or equivalent experience. Coachable and hungry to learn. Proficient in using and learning new technology and systems. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Strong organizational and time management skills.  Bonus Points: Sales Experience. SaaS Experience. Salesforce Experience. Remote work Experience.  Benefits FormAssembly offers several benefits that help to facilitate a healthy team, personal growth, and a work-life balance, all of which contribute to creating a more engaged and passionate workforce. Health benefits (health, dental, vision) for team members based in the United States 401(k) with 4% company match (US based team) 4 weeks paid vacation and 9 company holidays Flexible work schedule Paid parental leave Charitable contribution match Budget for professional development Company provided Mac laptop You'll be joining a talented and fun team, working together to build something great! Apply for this job

Job Title: Business Development Representative Reporting to: Director of Global Marketing Location: East Coast, USA (Remote based) Basic Salary: $55,000 + Comms + Benefits Immediate Start  Minimum of 2 years of sales development or telemarketing/teleprospecting experience, within Reg Tech, SaaS, B2B, AML, Fintech.  About our client Our client is a multi-award winning, global Fintech and Regtech disruptor with an almost vertical trajectory of growth. Heavily-backed financially, as part of their continued scaling operations, they are now seeking a smart, hard-working and diligent business development executive to help drive them onto the next phase of growth.  The ideal candidate As a member of our clients' Marketing team, you will play a meaningful role in the Marketing department. You will be a representative of our brand by being the first point of contact with potential customers. You will be also responsible for outbound prospecting into potential customers and also potentially growing our footprint within existing accounts where required. You will support the marketing and sales teams in building pipeline.  This is a phenomenal opportunity for a high-energy, motivated, and organized team member. This role will allow you to gain exposure to all aspects of a marketing and sales cycle and the ability to have a hand in some of the hottest opportunities we work on, in a fast-paced, high-volume environment.  Responsibilities Articulate the business value proposition to assess buying interest Research accounts, identify key players and generate interest to stimulate opportunity Conduct high level conversations with senior level executives Manage and nurture leads and territory in HubSpot through to SQL, collaborating with Sales on key lead stages. Consistently over-achieve quotas  Must-have Skillsets Minimum of 2 years of sales development or telemarketing/teleprospecting experience, within Anti-money Laundering knowledge is preferred. Preferred qualification – ACAMS certified Tech Savvy Endlessly curious - you love asking questions and learning Fearless attitude - proven track record at achieving measurable goals Ability to work in a time-sensitive and high-volume environment Experience using Hubspot or Salesforce, or similar preferred Team player - working with the Marketing team to develop a territory plan  Job Perks Opportunity to work on market leading AI and Analytics products for Global Markets Opportunity to innovate, Learn and Grow Attractive variable compensation package Flexible working hours - everything is results-oriented Opportunity to work with an award-winning organization in the hottest space in tech - artificial intelligence and advanced machine learning

This role will be responsible for identifying sales opportunities, introducing the brand to his/her accounts, and/or managing them.  Expectations: Identify and generate leads via cold calling, email, LinkedIn and more Introduce BAD ACE brand and its products to his/her existing accounts - Online / offline retail and distributors Work closely with BAD ACE internal team to fulfill orders and track payment Report to VP of sales on a weekly call  Requirements: 2+ years experience in sales / account management / business development Strong communication skills – written, verbal, presentation Team player who can quickly understand the team dynamic  Compensation: 100% sales commission only (industry standard)

Account Executive WORLDWIDE EXPRESS  The largest non-retail authorized UPS® partner and No. 1 largest privately held LTL broker in the country!  The Account Executive position at Worldwide Express is a unique and rewarding outside business-to-business(B2B) sales opportunity for the salesperson looking for unlimited growth potential and uncapped residual commission coupled with a healthy base salary and monthly allowances. This unique compensation plan allows top performers to earn an annual six-figure income within 18 to 24 months. PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILITIES: Consult, educate and simplify supply chain practices through an innovative, web-based platform. Streamline in and outbound processes, providing customized solutions. ·      Lead presentations with executives/owners of businesses with frequent shipping volume ·      Partner with the operations and account management teams for optimal customer satisfaction ·      Solution selling; effectively present solutions through cost-benefit analysis ·      Present a streamlined technology solution developing a detailed analysis of customized needs in challenging areas and lanes ·      Take the lead in coordinating/developing/managing all aspects of the proposal process ·      Close, activate and train decision-makers on our exclusive shipping platform  WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU: A competitive and motivated mindset and a passion for new business development. ·      Bachelor's Degree preferred ·      Proven success in generating/qualifying leads through prospecting new business with a ‘hunter’ mentality ·      High energy, with a passion for your personal brand and the ability to carry yourself like an executive ·      Comfortable in a fast-paced, quota-driven, results-oriented environment ·      Effective communicator with strong business acumen and intuition ·      Self-starter with strong organization & presentation skills ·      Attention to detail to drive profitability ·      Ability to think strategically about the personal impact to the client's long-term business strategy ·      Team-oriented peer, with a thirst to compete to be the most valuable player  WHAT WE COMMIT TO YOU: Industry-leading compensation with aggressive residual, uncapped commissions. Unsurpassed training, nationally ranked growth opportunities and our insanely awesome culture. ·      Territory development with Targeted Company opportunities ·      Strategic, pre-screened lead generation supported by multiple internal/external parties ·      A competitive starting BASE SALARY with performance-based increases ·      Residual, uncapped monthly commission ·      Monthly/Quarterly/Regional contest with great reward$$$ ·      Fast track bonuses for quality deals your first year while ramping up ·      The compensation plan allows top performers to earn an annual six-figure income within 18 - 24 months ·      Nationally recognized sales training ·      Ongoing sales & management support ·      Progressive Advancement opportunity and national career mobility ·      Monthly auto & cell phone allowances ·      A comprehensive benefits package with medical, dental, vision coverage and a 401(k) program  WHY WORLDWIDE EXPRESS? ·      No. 1 largest privately held LTL broker in the country! ·      The largest non-retail authorized UPS® partner ·      More than 90,000 customers nationwide ·      Ranked a Top 10 Freight Brokerage Firm by Transport Topics for the past 5 years ·      Ranked a Top 50 Logistics firm globally by Transport Topics for the past 5 years ·      Nationally ranked/known for culture, training and career growth
