description: ADP is hiring an Account Executive - Outside Sales. In this position, you'll identify and cultivate new prospects from relationships built with Bankers, Accountants, existing clients, as well as direct prospecting efforts. In addition you will cross-sell solutions to existing clients, and effectively close sales, with the support of exceptional sales training and the rewards of advancement opportunities and industry-leading compensation, benefits, incentive trips and awards.  Unlock Your Career Potential: Sales at ADP. It takes a relentless team to lead an industry. ADP's world-class sales team is driving our global growth as a worldwide leader of workforce solutions. If you believe in the power of relationships, we'll give you the tools, training and support you need to connect with new and current customers, ranging from Fortune 100 corporations to small start-ups. And as you achieve success, you'll enjoy the rewards, support and recognition you deserve.  At ADP we are driven by your success. We engage your unique talents and perspectives. We welcome your ideas on how to do things differently and better. In your efforts to achieve, learn and grow, we support you all the way. If success motivates you, you belong at ADP. We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility. RESPONSIBILITIES: Develop and execute a cold calling strategy to target prospects Mine existing clients for referral business Build mutually beneficial relationships with Bankers and Accountants Reach or exceed assigned sales goals Implement sales strategies Connect customers' business needs with ADP products and services Cross-sell other ADP solutions to existing clients Build network in person and via phone with key decision makers in a designated territory  QUALIFICATIONS PREFERRED: Bachelor's degree  At ADP, we believe that diversity fuels innovation. Our diversity benefits our associates, clients, and our communities. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, non-job related physical or mental disability, or protected veteran status. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.  ADP is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer; M/F/D/V. ADP believes that diversity leads to strength.

Launched in 2000, Eight Eleven Group committed to 100% organic growth, exclusively promoting from within, while always keeping culture and growth opportunity at the forefront of the business model. What began as a two-person Indianapolis startup, Eight Eleven Group has rapidly expanded to become a market-leading organization within one of the fastest growing industries today: Consulting and Professional Services.   In 2012, Medasource was established to provide niche services exclusively in the Healthcare industry, including these practice areas: Providers, Payers, Government, and Life Sciences (pharma, device, diagnostic, clinical research, commercial labs, consumer goods, food sciences, chemicals, agriculture, and environmental sciences). Our team takes a consultative, solution-driven approach with Fortune 500 and enterprise non-profit clients to help them deliver and execute complex capital and operational projects. We are not just in the business of professional services - we are in the business of making a meaningful and authentic impact both internally with our high-performing team and externally with our clients and consultants.   RESPONSIBILITIES  Associate Account Executives are enrolled in a comprehensive outside B2B Sales Training Program focused on learning how to take a solution-driven, approach to selling consulting and professional services. Once you complete training, 80% of your time will be spent in front of customer decision makers to build partnerships, pipeline opportunities, and secure win-win engagements with our clients. Here are the primary drivers for success in this role:  Strategically identify opportunities and pursuits in 3-5 designated target accounts  Build and sustain long-lasting relationships with new and existing clients within your assigned accounts through onsite client meetings, presentations, and outings such as ball games, dinners, golf, etc.  Consult with clients to create solutions that help drive change and successful projects within their organization that deliver positive outcomes  Act as a client advocate with a focus on improving the experience of our Fortune 500 target accounts  Presenting to C-suite executives and championing solutions for their project roadmap  Continue to meet and exceed target sales goals  Set personal and team goals through frequent sprint sessions with your manager and sales support team   SALES TRAINING  Takes place at our Corporate Headquarters in Indianapolis  Led by Medasource’s President and top sales leaders  Formalized training geared toward our practice areas and core competencies in the healthcare industry  Role playing situational selling exercises and ride-alongs with senior account executives  Establishing your client portfolio  Fostering executive-level relationships    BENEFITS & PERKS  Base salary + uncapped commissions  Monthly smartphone stipend and car allowance  401k match program   Full health benefits (medical, dental, vision, and HSA)  All-expenses-paid Reward Trip each year for top producers and a guest  Expense budget for client entertainment  Eight Eleven’s BeGiving Program: 1 PTO day per quarter for service work/volunteering   Access to Eight Eleven University (internal personal and professional development program)   Top-notch training at every step in your career  Access to a personal financial concierge  Genuine, passionate, family-oriented culture   WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED  Competitive, motivated spirit and desire to succeed  Outstanding communication skills and innate ability to connect with people  Entrepreneurial spirit with desire to learn and grow   Results-driven and forward-thinking  Thrives in a fast-paced, collaborative, and positive work environment   Bachelor’s Degree
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Management Consulting, and Information Technology and Services

description: Bryer is seeking a highly motivated and talented individual with excellent communication skills to immediately fill a regional sales manager position.  Bryer’s Oregon territory covers SW Washington, all of Oregon as well as Hawaii. Ideally this position would be filled by a Portland/Salem/Vancouver based individual travelling within the territory promoting Bryer to contractor accounts, architects, and related customers. The primary focus is on support and relationship development with existing customers and high potential new contractor accounts.

Woven is looking for a Sales Development Representative to be part of our energetic and competitive sales team!  We’re a VC-backed, remote-first SaaS startup founded by 3 engineers in the Midwest. We’re growing quickly because of our effective outbound strategy, high close rates, and high net revenue retention. We aim to continue this success by onboarding a Sales Development Representative who has the ability to prospect into new accounts and maximize our sales opportunities.  On a give day, you will: Run cold call blocks using the best tools to maximize your effectiveness Connect with new prospects to share how other Customers have gained value from Woven Develop a plan to hit your meetings booked and qualified meetings goals Connect with your peers to role play and learn how to get 1% better Develop relationships with other Woven team members  To help you succeed, you will be supported by a great leadership team who is invested in your success and high-performing peers. We have a "win together" culture at Woven, and we are all here to see you win. The team is 100% committed to helping you be successful in your career. Your success is our success.  We’d be especially excited about meeting you if: You are passionate about starting your career in sales Joining an early stage start-up and helping develop their sales playbook excites you You are a lifelong learner and love to be coached  Bonus points if you have: 1+ years sales and or prospecting experience Sold SaaS Experience working remotely  Compensation: $75k On Target Earnings (OTE), including a $37.5k base salary. There's no cap on your commissions and there are multiple reps pacing for $100k this year.  What makes Woven different: Remote-first environment with flexible hours Equity in a high-growth startup Unlimited PTO with 38 days off minimum 8 weeks paid parental leave at 1 year Radical transparency: company financials, strategy, etc Health, dental, vision insurance  We love remote, but don’t love timezones. We build our team cadences around ~Eastern time zones, so West coast early birds are very welcome. Post-COVID, the whole company gets together annually.  Learn more about Woven at www.woventeams.com

The Regional Sales Director, reporting to the Vice President of Sales and Marketing, has the role of management and direction of the sales team to achieve revenue and profit goals. Evaluates and implements appropriate new sales techniques to increase the region's sales volume. May recommend product or service enhancements to improve customer satisfaction and sales potential. Subject matter expert leading and coordinating the commercial processes across the region footprint. This individual is responsible for workflows including proposals/bids, contract negotiation, and compliance with contract commitments and commercial risk assessment. This individual will work closely with regional Operations leaders, regional sales teams, and corporate administrative functions to ensure the overall team's function meets Thompson Industrial Services' strategy and criteria for quotation execution while meeting/exceeding customer's needs and expectations.  Primary Duties And Responsibilities Personal Conduct Conduct himself/herself at all times in a way that is professional and is aligned with Thompson Industrial Service, LLC values. Consistently ensure that business is always conducted with honesty and integrity. People Development Sales Competency Assess and improve the skill of the sales team with regards to communication, time management, strategic thinking, presentation and proposal development and delivery, and other criteria critical to driving improved Revenue, Net Contribution, and EBITDA Business Acumen Assess and improve sales team's understanding of the critical parameters that impact Job Profitability as measured by Net Contribution to EBITDA. Utilize Net Contribution principles to accurately estimate the margin generation of each Job proposal allowing for more precise pricing relative to the highest possible market price at which a Job can be won. Personnel Career Development Develop technical competency matrix and work with Regional/Corporate Leadership to implement training & development plans. Remain actively engaged with sales team to ensure understanding of each person's personal career aspirations and assist each team member to develop a Personal Development Plan to facilitate their own growth. Strategy Development Understand and contribute to the strategic plan of the company Work closely with the VP of Sales & Marketing to develop and execute a commercial sales strategy to drive increased Revenue and Net Contribution $ within his/her Region. Strategy Implementation/Execution Customer relationship development Proactively visit existing and future customers to assess and gain selling opportunities. Build sustainable relationships with both customers and operations. Manage and evaluate customer concerns by meeting with the customer and communicating with operations to rectify as needed. Manage the execution of contractual agreements with customers to ensure compliance. Proposal process ownership Oversee Job proposal development to ensure all significant risks (T&Cs, Safety, Execution, etc.) are identified, communicated, and mitigated prior to customer submission. Responsible for understanding services offered by Thompson Industrial Services and its competitors, and developing proposals focused on winning business at the highest possible market price with acceptable Net Contribution $. Results Communication Proactively engage with Operations to ensure seamless transition and execution of awarded work. Complete sales forecasts and sales activity reports, including TIS CRM tools in a timely manner. Report any quality issues to the appropriate leadership. Deliver proposal metrics dashboards to measure KPI's. Primary Performance Metrics Revenue $ and Net Contribution $ generation and growth Personnel development and retention Safety Education and Experience Bachelor's degree required Master's degree preferred and/or equivalent work experience required 10 years or more of commercial and technical experience related to services in an industrial setting.

Permascand’s continued growth in North America has created an exciting opportunity for a Senior Sales Manager with a background in the electrochemical industry specifically in the Chlor/Alkali and Electrowinning industry. Are you ready to join a fast-growing company that has just been listed on their continued journey?  Company Permascand is a technology-driven manufacturer of world-leading electrochemical solutions – based on proprietary catalytic coatings – for clean tech applications. With a customer-centric focus, the recently listed company has supplied electrodes and aftermarket services for a variety of industries for nearly 50 years.  Permascand works with the major global players in this market space to serve customers all over the world. Their headquarters are situated in Ljungaverk, Sweden. More than 95 percent of the products are delivered to markets outside Sweden, mainly Europe, North and South America.   Role and Responsibilities As a Sales Manager you will be working in a small group in the USA or Canada with frequent travel to Permascand’s manufacturing facility in Ljungaverk, Sweden. You are responsible for exploration and cultivation of new customers, markets and businesses. You will develop strong customer relationship with both new- and existing customers. Furthermore, you are responsible for drawing up action plans for increased sales.  You will work independently but also be a part of a sales team spread across different geographical areas of the world. You will also stay connected with operations in Sweden in your daily work and will report directly to the Chief Commercial Officer in Sweden.  Qualifications and characteristics  MSc in Chemical or Mechanical Engineering or equivalent commercial background Long experience in technical sales or long production experience in the process industry Experience from Chlor Alkali and Electrowinning industry is meritorious Fluent in English  To succeed in the role, we believe that you are used to working in a structured way and pursuing your own agenda. You have documented experience of and an interest in building strong customer relationships. Furthermore, we see that you are a solution-oriented, flexible professional.  We accept applicants residing in both the southern United States and Canada.  Employment Type: Full time Salary and benefits: Upon agreement Start date: Upon agreement

The Vice President of Global Sales leads the combined Hayward Tyler/Energy Steel geographically dispersed sales team (Regional Account Managers). Through effective team leadership, relationship development and commercial and market acumen this role ensures we achieve order intake goals in accordance with our fiscal budget, develop key markets and identify and win prospective customers that enable immediate and sustained growth. As the primary commercial advocate for the combined businesses, this role is also responsible for the identification and development of strategic customers and prospects that result in increased order intake and market share growth.  Job Description and Duties  This position is responsible for driving sales for two operations:  1. Hayward Tyler, Inc (Colchester, VT) 2. Energy Steel & Supply Company (Rochester Hills, MI)  In addition to sales team leadership, the main functional areas of responsibility for the Vice President of Global Sales are delivering on established sales goals, achieving revenue growth with new and established customers and collaborating with the Chief Growth Officer in the development of new strategic growth opportunities. The role also ensures Salesforce CRM adoption and usage across the entire sales team.  1. Responsible for sales team leadership and all sales activities for aftermarket parts and shop service, new and replacement units and field service for HTI’s and ESSC’s territories and markets. Develops strategies for pipeline growth and manages tactical plans for pricing & selling channels. Effectively drives the execution of pipeline activity that results in new order revenue that meets or exceeds plan.    - Directly responsible for recruiting, training, supervising, mentoring and advocating for territory sales managers and sales agents/reps to achieve site specific and territory sales goals. Develops strong relationships with decision makers at key customers and prospects that result in a robust network of sales coverage. Will have direct key account responsibility for those accounts deemed as house accounts and other strategic accounts as defined.  - Defines sales goals for territory sales managers and sales agents/reps.  - Collaborate with the other site Sales Directors to ensure global territory coverage, implementation of divisional sales policies (e.g. travel, commission), coordinated key account management and travel.   - Provides feedback, results, and action plans to the team for KPIs, sales metrics, sales activities, and others as may be defined.    - Collaborate with the Commercial Growth Officer for developing, managing and communication of promotional & product launch goals through outside ad agencies. Promotional and product launch responsibilities include advertising, trade shows, conferences, press releases, collateral, sales   tools, marketing guides, customer and company presentations, direct mail, email campaigns, web content, and media plan (print & digital).  - Work with the Site Presidents to establish customer-related strategic priorities for pipeline growth and order intake.    - Work closely with site-specific leadership team to establish and execute clear customer communication protocols. Ensure that any customer facing communiques are vetted and approved before publication.  - Assign account/territory responsibilities and establish and maintain communications between Sales, Application Engineering, Inside Sales, Design Engineering, Operations as well as customers and agents/reps.  - Oversees that customer’s expectations are clearly defined regarding performance, value add, communications & reporting, major milestones, critical path items, schedule of deliverables, and payment schedules.   2. Manage and own global territory and site-specific forecast budget for order intake and revenue including all revisions. Develop and employ action plans to ensure any gaps between periodic forecasts and budget are recovered within the shortest possible interval. Manage and own their department budgets to ensure costs are maintained within the budget, all expenses and travel are approved, and expenses are reconciled to the correct GL codes.  3. Participates in strategic travel with the territory sales managers, business development managers, sales agents and sales representatives. Also participates in strategic visits related to OEMs, EPCs, end users, tradeshows and conferences to obtain customer specific information on products, applications, trends, and expectations.  4. Work with the Commercial Growth Officer and Technical Marketing Specialist to coordinate the gathering, processing, analyzing, and communication of information and trends on customers, markets, products, and competitors. Provide direction on areas of desired focus. Disseminate information and outputs to the sales & business development teams with specific action plans.    5. Supports Continuous improvement efforts across the division.  6. Other related duties as required Minimum qualifications:  • BS in Engineering, Business or equivalent job experience.  • 10-15 years of work experience in marketing at a manufacturing site (Rotating equipment and/or Power Markets preferred), which should include 5-7 years of Sales or Marketing management and strategic planning.  • Exceptional sales leadership and mentorship skills with the keen ability to drive a successful team of sales hunters. Strong interpersonal communication and negotiation skills. • A high sense of urgency with success in the development of customers and markets. • Highly accountable with a track record of meeting and exceeding sales and business development growth goals. Dynamic and highly motivated. • Ability to read & interpret engineering drawings, standards and specifications. • Ability to work with and manage outside agents and reps. • Expected travel globally is 50% yearly or as necessary to exceed plan & activities. • Proficient in Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and Salesforce CRM.

Quantela is the first of its kind Outcomes-as-a-Service (OaaS) company and the leader in the space of urban infrastructure digitization that makes cities more inhabitable, operationally efficient, resilient, and environmentally sustainable for its citizens.  We do so by helping city administrators with our citizen centric AI-powered products delivering quantifiable outcomes with social, economic, and environmental impact. Along with technology, we will also be using our unique financing model that is Outcomes-based to help city governments in financing priority projects through cost savings and improved revenues from urban infrastructure digitization.  As conveyed by part of our logo, "Technologies for societies", Quantela as a brand stands for technologies with a human touch and focuses on enhancing the lives of citizens in societies  The role:  The Sales Executive works under SVP -Global Sales, and with the sales team to develop, drive, and grow a revenue stream with Cities within North America. She/he understands the core value of Quantela and can assist leads to realize the economic, and social outcomes that each of Quantela’s products offer. Each member of Quantela acts as its spokesperson and represents the company in a way that keeps its reputation, and distinct identity in the industry.  Responsibilities:   Achieve Quarterly and Yearly sales targets   Articulate and position Quantela products, solutions, and outcomes to key decision-makers, and city officials to sell Quantela Products Produce and present sales proposals (with the business department) to city officials demonstrating Quantela’s s ability to fund the priority projects based on its Outcome-based Financing model. Manage the entire sales cycle, and coordinate all the steps across accounts; include other departments to meetings, schedule demo sessions, follow up with quote request, and more as needed Nurtures the business accounts by distinguishing, building, and maintaining relationships with clients  Keep apprised of changes in technology, and up to date with the latest trends, and solutions, and follow the governments, and smart cities publications to identify new approaches and potential leads Active presence in the smart city communities by attending educational workshops, benchmark state-of-the-art practices, and establish personal networks   Qualifications & Skills :   10+ years of overall experience in selling solutions to the local government market  Expert in sales activities: appointments, demonstrations, proposals, cold calls, dials, and database updates Prior experience in Lighting control space will be preferable  Outstanding communication, presentation, and negotiation skills both verbal and written Analytical set mind, and prospecting skills to determine business opportunities by identifying prospects and evaluating the needs of the city/municipality  Professional network of contacts across the government, and Smart city market  Experience with SalesForce, and be able to log all activity in CRM and ensure sales pipeline is accurate Knowledge of the industry, solutions, and technologies in the smart city markets; IOT, digital transformation, digital tween, blockchain, SaaS, and more  Self-starter, and agility to build new and existing accounts across multiple functions Team player; Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results  Self-motivated and focused.

Your Role Sales Engineers function as Solution Consultants and a core part of Innovaccers Growth Strategy team. You will work closely with the Growth Strategy Directors and the front end sales team to decide on the deal strategy and ensure we are putting our best foot forward in every customer interaction. The primary focus of the Sales Engineer will be demonstrating Innovaccer’s end to end offerings to our customers including providing deep dives on our technology.  The candidate should possess exceptional knowledge of healthcare data, a nuanced understanding of different data sources (including EHRs, patient management systems, payer data, ancillary data, etc), common value-based care workflows for quality, risk and reporting, possess exemplary presentation skills, and embody strong team values. The role is varied and will include leading technical discussions, configuring demos, handling security/compliance requests and driving expert-style conversations to a successful conclusion. In addition, the candidate will assess, document and monitor sales requests into the Product Management and Engineering functions at Innovaccer. The candidate will develop exceptional knowledge of the capability of the Innovaccer product suite and will be capable of communicating the details to potential prospects and existing clients. Sales Engineers will also be engaged in strategic projects (e.g. entering a new market) and building pitch packs for client meetings. A successful candidate will love working with cutting edge technology, and a wide variety of healthcare organizations. Sales Engineers are among the most hotly demanded members of the Innovaccer team, asked to jump in on everything from sales to marketing to product design to investor discussions. Confidence and executive presence are essential since our Sales Engineers are often presenting in front of the CXO of customers and Innovaccer.  A Day in the Life at Innovaccer There’s no such thing as a typical day for sales engineers at Innovaccer-- and that’s part of the fun! Sales engineers have varied responsibilities in the company and are always in demand. Subject matter expertise: support our sales teams in on-site and remote meetings with your industry and Innovaccer product knowledge, including qualification, discovery, demonstration, and solution design. Prioritize opportunities and coordinate regional sales team to drive opportunities to a successful conclusion Share your knowledge and expertise with the team by leading occasional internal training sessions Spearhead the creation and delivery of critical sales artifacts to support our fast-paced sales cycle, including statements of work, RFPs, solution designs, pitch decks and solution strategy documents. Collect and manage product and engineering requests from the Sales Team and liaise with our Product and Engineering teams to improve the platform including compiling key features that are being requested or are in demand based on sales calls or proposals. Learn the details of existing clients to understand how they use the platform and benefits they have received from the platform for reference stories or anecdotes in prospect conversations. Present solutions to executive-level clients and engage in problem-solving discussions in meetings Embrace ambiguity and Problem-solving. Be prepared to drive structure in ambiguous situations and problem-solve to drive impact.  What You Need 5+ years of experience in healthcare or healthcare IT 50% travel availability High comfort level with presenting to senior executives, via video call and in-person Experience with cloud platforms Experience working with sales and marketing teams Bachelor’s degree in a related field or technical certifications are preferred A desire to work in a fast-paced environment where rapid execution and agility to meet changing customer needs

description: Blue Wheel is one of Inc. Magazines 2020 fastest-growing private companies in the US. We can attribute much of that growth to our digital marketing and advertising capabilities, and our amazing track record of success for our clients.   Your Role:  As an Account Executive at Blue Wheel, you will lead targeted sales efforts with high-value prospects to attract, acquire, and grow ideal client segments. This is a pure new business development role that will require creative prospecting and well-coordinated, eloquent, and intuitive sales efforts. Each sales cycle will require you to execute with urgency by establishing strong relationships and client trust, and consist of complex, technical variables and multiple stakeholder involvement that can range in high dollar value. While we prefer to have this role stationed in Detroit, NYC or San Diego, we will consider remote candidates.  In the 1st month, you will… · Immerse yourself in BW’s culture, team and product.  · Open to Change - Learn different customer acquisition techniques as well as how companies leverage advertising+content into their digital strategies. · Participate in sales and product training to understand the leverage points we use on our clients and differentiators we have over our competitors.  Sharpen your skills in Month 2 by… · Becoming an expert at the digital solutions Blue Wheel provides, how we provide them, and who we are best suited to work with. · Organize and Conquer - owning the sales funnel and work with leadership in order to establish, meet and/or exceed monthly sales goals. · Having built your own pipeline and managed multiple opportunities through a complete sales cycle.  Execute in Month 3 by... · Start winning new clients and contributing revenue for the company. · Becoming an expert in a variety of use cases. · Gaining self-reliance when closing deals without substantial oversight from management.  Desired Skills & Experience · Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Communications, Business, or related field. · 5+ years of relevant agency or marketplace (SaaS) sales experience. · Excellent communicator and relationship builder. You thrive on the phone. Proficient in Google & Microsoft Office Suite. · Self-driven with the ability to work independently. · Must be able to understand complex environments and projects, pay attention to details and maintain an organized workflow. · Excellent planning, time management, and decision-making skills with the ability to self-manage numerous projects simultaneously. · Strong interpersonal skills with a focus on teamwork and the ability to foster/maintain relationships across multiple businesses and organizations. · Exceptional writing, copy, editing and proofreading skills preferred. · You work hard and smart. You know when to ask questions and admit to weaknesses. · Worked in a startup or fast-growing organization.  Blue Wheel Perks and Benefits: · PTO, Exclusive company holidays, Summer Fridays & Mental Health Days · 401K Matching · Parental Leave · Healthcare · Dental · Vision · Voluntary Life Insurance

Abbott is a global healthcare leader that helps people live more fully at all stages of life. Our portfolio of life-changing technologies spans the spectrum of healthcare, with leading businesses and products in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals, and branded generic medicines. Our 109,000 colleagues serve people in more than 160 countries.  Our business purpose is to restore health and improve quality of life through the design and provision of device and management solutions for the treatment of Structural Heart disease. We aim to lead the markets we serve by requiring the solutions we offer customers provide an improved benefit/risk profile as compared to existing standards of care; a performance threshold that by definition, guides and ensures the productive output of our engineering, business development, and clinical research efforts result in outcomes that advance the standard of care.  The Clinical Sales Specialist provides clinical and sales support through education of current and potential customers, and procedure coverage with a defined region. In this role, the CSS will train interventional cardiologists, catheter lab staff and ancillary personnel on the use of Structural Heart products and provide technical support to physicians during procedures. The role is responsible for communicating product, clinical and market data to appropriate personnel and will support the company’s efforts to develop and implement product marketing strategies.  This position may be hired at different level, depending on the experience of the candidate. This position may travel in excess of 50%.  What You’ll Do Collaborate with Regional Account Managers to provide good case coverage and clinical outcomes for patients Serve as primary resource for clinical support in the areas of surgical coverage, troubleshooting and in-service education for company products Educate customer on the merits and proper clinical usage of company products. Inform customers of the latest product, therapy and technology developments in the industry. Actively engage in clinical, procedural and technical discussions and link data outcome to key messaging. Meet with existing and potential clients (health care providers) to identify their clinical needs, goals and constraints related to patient care and provide creative and feasible solutions. This role requires a strong clinical orientation with the ability to influence a variety of clinician personality types. Required  EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE YOU’LL BRING BS/BA or equivalent experience. 0-2+ years of related work experience within cardiovascular space. Preferred Degree in life sciences or medical training (RN, EMT, Perfusion, etc.) preferred. Strong clinical orientation, experience with products for use in interventional cardiology and cardiac surgery, familiarity with echo cardiology and other indirect imaging, also strongly preferred. Strong consideration will be given to candidates with EP (Electrophysiology) and SH (Structural Heart) sales experience. What We Offer  At Abbott, you can have a good job that can grow into a great career. We offer: Training and career development, with onboarding programs for new employees and tuition assistance Financial security through competitive compensation, incentives and retirement plans Health care and well-being programs including medical, dental, vision, wellness and occupational health programs Paid time off 401(k) retirement savings with a generous company match The stability of a company with a record of strong financial performance and history of being actively involved in local communities Learn more about our benefits that add real value to your life to help you live fully:  www.abbottbenefits.com  Follow your career aspirations to Abbott for diverse opportunities with a company that provides the growth and strength to build your future. Abbott is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to employee diversity.  Connect with us at www.abbott.com, on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Abbott and on Twitter @AbbottNews and @AbbottGlobal.

The Regional Sales Director, reporting to the Vice President of Sales and Marketing, has the role of management and direction of the sales team to achieve revenue and profit goals. Evaluates and implements appropriate new sales techniques to increase the region's sales volume. May recommend product or service enhancements to improve customer satisfaction and sales potential. Subject matter expert leading and coordinating the commercial processes across the region footprint. This individual is responsible for workflows including proposals/bids, contract negotiation, and compliance with contract commitments and commercial risk assessment. This individual will work closely with regional Operations leaders, regional sales teams, and corporate administrative functions to ensure the overall team's function meets Thompson Industrial Services' strategy and criteria for quotation execution while meeting/exceeding customer's needs and expectations.  Primary Duties And Responsibilities Personal Conduct Conduct himself/herself at all times in a way that is professional and is aligned with Thompson Industrial Service, LLC values. Consistently ensure that business is always conducted with honesty and integrity. People Development Sales Competency Assess and improve the skill of the sales team with regards to communication, time management, strategic thinking, presentation and proposal development and delivery, and other criteria critical to driving improved Revenue, Net Contribution, and EBITDA Business Acumen Assess and improve sales team's understanding of the critical parameters that impact Job Profitability as measured by Net Contribution to EBITDA. Utilize Net Contribution principles to accurately estimate the margin generation of each Job proposal allowing for more precise pricing relative to the highest possible market price at which a Job can be won. Personnel Career Development Develop technical competency matrix and work with Regional/Corporate Leadership to implement training & development plans. Remain actively engaged with sales team to ensure understanding of each person's personal career aspirations and assist each team member to develop a Personal Development Plan to facilitate their own growth. Strategy Development Understand and contribute to the strategic plan of the company Work closely with the VP of Sales & Marketing to develop and execute a commercial sales strategy to drive increased Revenue and Net Contribution $ within his/her Region. Strategy Implementation/Execution Customer relationship development Proactively visit existing and future customers to assess and gain selling opportunities. Build sustainable relationships with both customers and operations. Manage and evaluate customer concerns by meeting with the customer and communicating with operations to rectify as needed. Manage the execution of contractual agreements with customers to ensure compliance. Proposal process ownership Oversee Job proposal development to ensure all significant risks (T&Cs, Safety, Execution, etc.) are identified, communicated, and mitigated prior to customer submission. Responsible for understanding services offered by Thompson Industrial Services and its competitors, and developing proposals focused on winning business at the highest possible market price with acceptable Net Contribution $. Results Communication Proactively engage with Operations to ensure seamless transition and execution of awarded work. Complete sales forecasts and sales activity reports, including TIS CRM tools in a timely manner. Report any quality issues to the appropriate leadership. Deliver proposal metrics dashboards to measure KPI's. Primary Performance Metrics Revenue $ and Net Contribution $ generation and growth Personnel development and retention Safety Education and Experience Bachelor's degree required Master's degree preferred and/or equivalent work experience required 10 years or more of commercial and technical experience related to services in an industrial setting.

Who We Are:  Aviatrix is a well-funded, pre-IPO, hyper-growth enterprise-software company based in the heart of Silicon Valley (Santa Clara, CA). Aviatrix technology has proven solid at scale with nearly 600 enterprise customers, over 40 of the Global Fortune 500. We have a top-tier, experienced leadership team, combined with a collaborative culture built on proven success, trust, execution, and respect. We’re focused on getting things done!  Read recent article published in Bloomberg on Aviatrix’s incredible rise in value  What We Do:  Aviatrix is networking for the cloud era , delivering a superset of features and capabilities that leverage and control native cloud constructs and add advance network, security and operational visibility features that cloud providers lack, while maintaining the simplicity and automation enterprises expect in cloud. Aviatrix offers the industry’s first and only multi-cloud networking certification ( ACE ), empowering IT to lead and accelerate the transformation to the cloud.  About the role:  We are looking for a highly motivated Regional Sales Manager to join our rapidly growing Go-to-Market (GTM) sales team. The Regional Sales Manager will be responsible for driving sales of Aviatrix products and solutions within a specific geographic territory. The RSM must be quota-driven and will represent Aviatrix and its product suite within the region. S/HE will work with Inside Sales, Systems Engineers, Solution Architects, and Aviatrix Partners to exceed sales objectives. This position will manage all aspects of the sales process including securing net-new business, lead management, qualification, evaluation, close and subsequent account care. The RMS will act as the lead of their territory.  Position Responsibilities:  Define and execute sales plans for the assigned territory  Meet and exceed quotas through prospecting, qualifying, managing, and closing opportunities  Develop and manage sales pipeline, prospect, and assess sales and move a large number of transactions through the sales pipeline  Manage and track customer and transactional information in the Aviatrix CRM system  Provide activity forecasts and regular pipeline reporting through the CRM system  Own and collaborate on all aspects of the sales cycle, including product support and sales engineering  Execute product demonstrations to prospective clients  Develop accounts of various sizes and grow client relationships  Understand the competitive market, be familiar with competing companies and their product suite  Collaborate within the Aviatrix team on strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts, and customer care  Meet with customers daily, both remote and in-person once climate allows  Requirements  8+ years of enterprise software sales experience with a track record of closing complex sales to Fortune 500 companies or 8+ years managing and growing a large geographical territory with YoY growth/success in net-new logo’s  Cloud experience  A Closer – consistent overachievement of sales goals in a large geographic territory  Drive to expand client base and close sales  Excellent communication skills verbal and written, team player  Entrepreneurial – willing to go the extra mile, competitive mindset, great work ethic, resourceful, “get it done” attitude  Must be willing to travel to clients to support sales relationships  Bachelor’s Degree  Aviatrix, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and does not make hiring decisions based on race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

jobTitle: Business Development Associate (BDA) / New-Grad Sales Role
description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  About Futureforce University Recruiting  Our Futureforce University Recruiting program is dedicated to attracting, retaining and cultivating talent. Our interns and new graduates work on real projects that affect how our business runs, giving them the opportunity to make a tangible impact on the future of our company. With offices all over the world, our recruits have the chance to collaborate and connect with fellow employees on a global scale. We offer job shadowing, mentorship programs, talent development courses, and much more.  Job CategorySales  Job Details  JOB TITLE: Business Development Associate (BDA) / New-Grad Sales Role  JOB CATEGORY: Sales  START DATE(S)*: August-October 2021 Our headcount demand is always changing as we grow; start dates listed here may or may not have an immediate opening at the time of your application. LOCATION(S)*: Atlanta, GA Our headcount demand is always changing as we grow; some of the locations listed here may or may not have an immediate opening at the time of your application. Please note that we do not offer relocation assistance. Role Overview And Impact  Are you looking for a fulfilling career empowering companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way? In this Business Development Associate New-Grad Program, you will join our elite sales team and do just that! You will learn how to evangelize Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and World’s #1 CRM, by researching and identifying net-new business opportunities — you will have a direct impact in our revenue generation goals. This role is an exciting opportunity for you to begin developing your core sales skills and business acumen as you work alongside industry sales leaders by directly supporting an outbound sales team.  We hire driven individuals who thrive in a challenging and ambiguous environment, who know that they can succeed in a fast-paced, client-facing sales career, and are comfortable with achieving/exceeding metrics, key performance indicators (KPIs), and sales quotas.  Job Description  The Business Development Associate (BDA) role serves as the entry-level role into a client-facing sales career at Salesforce and is designed to be your first look into how we sell Salesforce products. In this role, you will not be client-facing but will support a team of client-facing, outbound Business Development Representatives (BDR). You will simultaneously be trained in core sales skills to become a client-facing, inbound Sales Development Representative (SDR). Successful BDAs critically think and learn through coaching from their mentors, build upon, and improve their skills throughout their tenure in this program. After mastering the BDA role, you may be eligible to continue into the SDR role based upon your success in this program.  There are six core goals and responsibilities in this role to help train, equip, and prepare you for advancement: Align with and directly support a team of BDRs in: Lead generation/Prospecting - Conducting research on, modifying and identifying net-new prospective clients and accounts Determining key decision makers within the leadership team of those accounts and creating new contacts in our CRM Gathering other strategic insights using market data and industry intelligence to improve the quality of accounts Develop foundational knowledge of Salesforce products and business acumen Understand and apply the Salesforce value proposition in mock cold calls Learn and utilize our selling methodologies in role playing exercises Demonstrate ability to navigate challenging sales call scenarios and business cases Learn inbound sales processes and prepare for evaluation to become an SDR Minimum Qualifications Must be within less than 1-year of having completed a Bachelor’s Degree or Advanced Degree from the start date of this role Long-term interest in a client-facing sales career Competitive spirit and the drive for results Exemplary problem-solving skills and the resourceful ability to take initiative Coachable and enjoys learning in a fast-paced sales environment Superior organizational skills and attention to detail Preferred Qualifications Previous internship or full-time corporate sales experience B2B software sales experience is a plus Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” six years in a row and one of Fortune’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” nine years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. jobTitle: Business Development Associate (BDA) / New-Grad Sales Role
description: To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.  About Futureforce University Recruiting  Our Futureforce University Recruiting program is dedicated to attracting, retaining and cultivating talent. Our interns and new graduates work on real projects that affect how our business runs, giving them the opportunity to make a tangible impact on the future of our company. With offices all over the world, our recruits have the chance to collaborate and connect with fellow employees on a global scale. We offer job shadowing, mentorship programs, talent development courses, and much more.  Job CategorySales  Job Details  JOB TITLE: Business Development Associate (BDA) / New-Grad Sales Role  JOB CATEGORY: Sales  START DATE(S)*: August-October 2021 Our headcount demand is always changing as we grow; start dates listed here may or may not have an immediate opening at the time of your application. LOCATION(S)*: Atlanta, GA Our headcount demand is always changing as we grow; some of the locations listed here may or may not have an immediate opening at the time of your application. Please note that we do not offer relocation assistance. Role Overview And Impact  Are you looking for a fulfilling career empowering companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way? In this Business Development Associate New-Grad Program, you will join our elite sales team and do just that! You will learn how to evangelize Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and World’s #1 CRM, by researching and identifying net-new business opportunities — you will have a direct impact in our revenue generation goals. This role is an exciting opportunity for you to begin developing your core sales skills and business acumen as you work alongside industry sales leaders by directly supporting an outbound sales team.  We hire driven individuals who thrive in a challenging and ambiguous environment, who know that they can succeed in a fast-paced, client-facing sales career, and are comfortable with achieving/exceeding metrics, key performance indicators (KPIs), and sales quotas.  Job Description  The Business Development Associate (BDA) role serves as the entry-level role into a client-facing sales career at Salesforce and is designed to be your first look into how we sell Salesforce products. In this role, you will not be client-facing but will support a team of client-facing, outbound Business Development Representatives (BDR). You will simultaneously be trained in core sales skills to become a client-facing, inbound Sales Development Representative (SDR). Successful BDAs critically think and learn through coaching from their mentors, build upon, and improve their skills throughout their tenure in this program. After mastering the BDA role, you may be eligible to continue into the SDR role based upon your success in this program.  There are six core goals and responsibilities in this role to help train, equip, and prepare you for advancement: Align with and directly support a team of BDRs in: Lead generation/Prospecting - Conducting research on, modifying and identifying net-new prospective clients and accounts Determining key decision makers within the leadership team of those accounts and creating new contacts in our CRM Gathering other strategic insights using market data and industry intelligence to improve the quality of accounts Develop foundational knowledge of Salesforce products and business acumen Understand and apply the Salesforce value proposition in mock cold calls Learn and utilize our selling methodologies in role playing exercises Demonstrate ability to navigate challenging sales call scenarios and business cases Learn inbound sales processes and prepare for evaluation to become an SDR Minimum Qualifications Must be within less than 1-year of having completed a Bachelor’s Degree or Advanced Degree from the start date of this role Long-term interest in a client-facing sales career Competitive spirit and the drive for results Exemplary problem-solving skills and the resourceful ability to take initiative Coachable and enjoys learning in a fast-paced sales environment Superior organizational skills and attention to detail Preferred Qualifications Previous internship or full-time corporate sales experience B2B software sales experience is a plus Salesforce, the Customer Success Platform and world's #1 CRM, empowers companies to connect with their customers in a whole new way. The company was founded on three disruptive ideas: a new technology model in cloud computing, a pay-as-you-go business model, and a new integrated corporate philanthropy model. These founding principles have taken our company to great heights, including being named one of Forbes’s “World’s Most Innovative Company” six years in a row and one of Fortune’s “100 Best Companies to Work For” nine years in a row. We are the fastest growing of the top 10 enterprise software companies, and this level of growth equals incredible opportunities to grow a career at Salesforce. Together, with our whole Ohana (Hawaiian for "family") made up of our employees, customers, partners and communities, we are working to improve the state of the world.  Salesforce.com and Salesforce.org are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this Web site or directly to managers.
