description: Company Description  LinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to help members of all backgrounds and experiences achieve more in their careers. Our vision is to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Every day our members use our products to make connections, discover opportunities, build skills and gain insights. We believe amazing things happen when we work together in an environment where everyone feels a true sense of belonging, and that what matters most in a candidate is having the skills needed to succeed. It inspires us to invest in our talent and support career growth. Join us to challenge yourself with work that matters.  Job Description  At LinkedIn, our vision is to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. We have an exciting opportunity to join our global Employee Communications team, which is part of the Marketing & Communications organization at LinkedIn. The Employee Communications Manager will support our sales organization and work with leaders and cross-functional partners to deliver information needed to inform, prepare and engage our sales people. This is a newly created position that will report to the Senior Manager of Sales Communications.  Our ideal candidate will have strong commercial acumen, experience working with go-to-market teams and tenacity to develop, drive, and deliver high impact communications that help our customer facing teams. They’ll be laser focused on how to deliver the right information to the right people at the right time. They’ll thrive working with colleagues in many teams around the world and will be energized by being a part of a fast-moving, innovative organization. They’ll have an insatiable curiosity for the business and be passionate about using their communications skills to amplify our culture and drive business results. Candidates will be required to reside in the U.S. (specific location or remote work flexible and will be decided based on where the candidate chosen for the role resides)  Responsibilities  Establish governance and and manage content management strategy for field employees as a holistic system. Develop and deliver segmented messaging to inform, prepare, and engage our global sales organization, using written communications, video, events, internal blog posts, and more. Provide communications counsel to leaders, cross-functional partners and teams on messaging, channel, and tone. Partner with employee communications colleagues and leaders to co-produce employee events across our Global Business and Marketing & Communications organization Assess organizational needs and feedback to drive continual improvement in our communication approach. Work closely with the Global Business Organization Employee Communications and the broader Employee Communications teams to align on overall strategy. Partner with cross-functional teams including sales readiness, sales enablement, product marketing, operations, HR, etc.  Basic Qualifications  Qualifications 5+ years of employee communications or related experience  Preferred Qualifications  Experience communicating to a global sales and marketing organization Ability to effectively influence and collaborate effectively with leaders, teammates, and stakeholders Global experience and mindset Strong interpersonal, written, and creative communication skills Understanding of the sales cycle and its impact on various company initiatives Executive presence and ability to lead through influence Demonstrated ability working cross-functionally with multi-region teams Ability to prioritize and move fast and thrive in a dynamic environment  Additional Information  Equal Opportunity Statement  LinkedIn is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. LinkedIn considers qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class. LinkedIn is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer as described in our equal opportunity statement here: https://lnkd.in/equalemploymentopportunity2017. Please reference the following information for more information: https://legal.linkedin.com/content/dam/legal/LinkedIn_EEO_Statement_2020.pdf. Please reference the following information for more information: https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/migrated_files/employers/poster_screen_reader_optimized.pdf and https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf for more information.  LinkedIn is committed to offering an inclusive and accessible experience for all job seekers, including individuals with disabilities. Our goal is to foster an inclusive and accessible workplace where everyone has the opportunity to be successful.  If you need a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening, apply for a position, or participate in the interview process, connect with us at accommodations@linkedin.com and describe the specific accommodation requested for a disability-related limitation.  Examples Of Reasonable Accommodations Include But Are Not Limited To  Reasonable accommodations are modifications or adjustments to the application or hiring process that would enable you to fully participate in that process. Documents in alternate formats or read aloud to you Having interviews in an accessible location Being accompanied by a service dog Having a sign language interpreter present for the interview  A request for an accommodation will be responded to within three business days. However, non-disability related requests, such as following up on an application, will not receive a response.  LinkedIn will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by LinkedIn, or (c) consistent with LinkedIn's legal duty to furnish information.  San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance  Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, LinkedIn will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.  Pay Transparency Policy Statement  As a federal contractor, LinkedIn follows the Pay Transparency and non-discrimination provisions described at this link: https://lnkd.in/paytransparency.  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  Please follow this link to access the document that provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://legal.linkedin.com/candidate-portal.  Equal Opportunity Statement  LinkedIn is committed to diversity in its workforce and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. LinkedIn considers qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, pregnancy, sex, gender expression or identity, sexual orientation, citizenship, or any other legally protected class. LinkedIn is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer as described in our equal opportunity statement here: https://legal.linkedin.com/content/dam/legal/LinkedIn_EEO_Statement_2020.pdf. Please reference https://www.eeoc.gov/sites/default/files/migrated_files/employers/poster_screen_reader_optimized.pdf and https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf for more information.  LinkedIn is an equal employment opportunity employer offering opportunities to all job seekers, including individuals with disabilities. If you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to apply for a position, please contact us by sending an email to accommodations@linkedin.com. This email box is designed to assist disabled job seekers who seek a reasonable accommodation to the application process. Emails sent for non-disability related issues, such as following up on an application, will not receive a response.  In your email, please include the following: (1) confirm you have a disability; (2) identify the disability-related limitation that needs to be accommodated, and (3) if known, describe the specific accommodation requested for the disability-related limitation. A response to your request may take up to three business days.  LinkedIn will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by LinkedIn, or (c) consistent with LinkedIn's legal duty to furnish information.  Pay Transparency Policy Statement  As a federal contractor, LinkedIn follows the Pay Transparency and non-discrimination provisions described at this link: https://lnkd.in/paytransparency.  Global Data Privacy Notice for Job Candidates  This document provides transparency around the way in which LinkedIn handles personal data of employees and job applicants: https://lnkd.in/GlobalDataPrivacyNotice

Vector Remote Care’s vision is to connect every patient to their doctor through remote monitoring technology, improving health and driving down the cost of care.    We help cardiac clinics & hospitals improve patient safety and reduce staff burden.  We’re looking for ambitious high-energy Sales Development Representatives to help support growth in 2020  This position involves researching organizations/clinics and prospects sourced through outbound campaigns, effectively communicating the Vector Remote Care value proposition to engage and qualify, working in lock-step with our Account Executives to build a sales pipeline.  Sales Development is a dynamic role where success is dependent upon curiosity and competitive drive paired with excellent time management and interpersonal skills.  Ideal candidates for this position possess:  Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field, 1+ year experience in sales development, B2B sales, or account management Strong desire to pursue a career in technology sales Solid understanding of tactical sales skills and progressing customers through the buying cycle. Strong motivation to gain expertise and articulate the features and benefits of our software platform Strong work ethic; strong attention to detail; ability to work well with others Experience working in a CRM system (Salesforce is a plus) Strong organizational and time management skills  Specific Duties:  Enrich existing accounts and contact information through discovery Develop and qualify accounts through outbound calls and emails Contact and qualify inbound marketing leads and demo requests Log activity and discoveries in CRM system Generate qualified meetings and quality pipeline for the Account Executive team Reach out to each regional account on a consistent basis to ensure mindshare Executive administrative tasks around data collection, process improvement, and bowler maintenance Recommend tactical and process improvements to help us continually refine efforts Represent Vector Remote Care with precision, integrity, and professionalism in all communications  Benefits  Experience working in a dynamic, fast-paced, innovative, and growing company  A position where you will have an immediate and direct impact on company success Internal career paths available to high performing individuals   Competitive salary with opportunity for uncapped commission   Three weeks vacation, two personal days, and nine public holidays Health insurance & 401k with 3% employer match  Creative, casual office environment

About the job  Sales Specialists are integral to the success of the store environment. The ideal candidate possesses a skillset that allows them to anticipate the needs of both their clients and team in order to drive sales and create a consistent and high-quality in-store experience.  Key Roles And Responsibilities Support a best in class level of customer service through extensive product knowledge, strong selling skills, and authentic clienteling Consistently meet sales and Key Performance metrics as established by Store Management Take ownership for the customer experience in your store by providing customized and personal relationships with each customer/client Understand and exemplify the rag and bone brand philosophy and lifestyle Emulate the brand aesthetic and embody and strong sense of fashion Maintain a one company/one experience perspective in all customer service interactions Provide assistance with floor sets, window changes and other merchandising expectations where necessary Maintain Operational Excellence Policy and Procedure Maintain a knowledge and understanding of all Policy and Procedure Adhere to all policies and procedures as outlines by the organization Stock/Inventory Management Contribute to the achievement of low inventory shrink and high inventory accuracy by ensuring consistent execution at all inventory touchpoints IT Systems Accurately process Point of Sale transactions Personal Excellence Consistently act within the core values of rag & bone Appropriately manage conflict with all members of the team and take ownership of your contribution to the overall team Contribute to a positive, fun, professional, productive, and team oriented store atmosphere Contribute to and support company and management initiatives as needed Identify opportunities to support the team in delivering best in class customer service Ability to receive feedback from management and peers  Experience/Capabilities Previous experience in contemporary or luxury fashion sales/clienteling preferred Ability to lift at least 30lbs, carry, push, pull, squat, kneel, twist, turn, climb, crawl, reach, and bend Availability to work per the needs of the business

The Sales Specialist is responsible for creating, building, and nurturing relationships with key partners across the nation as well as international markets with a primary focus on developed engine markets, building mutually beneficial opportunities, driving revenue, lead generation, and enabling innovative ways to go to market together. In addition, the Sales Specialist will develop and execute joint business plans, and ensure partner leadership alignment. With a strong background in SaaS, Software Sales, Demand Generation, Partner Channel Ecosystem, and people collaboration, this role will serve as an evangelist of the Cube10.io value proposition.  Key Responsibilities & Activities Help set a strategic business development plan Execute the strategic sales and business development plan while working with key internal stakeholders (e.g. service teams, legal, support, etc.) Responsible for helping to drive top-line revenue growth and overall end customer adoption through Cube10 engagement with organizational clients. Work with Cube10 management, and account teams in a highly collaborative operating model to help develop a flowing pipeline Serve as a key member of the Business Development team in helping to define and deliver the joint solution set and supporting collateral Liaise with Cube10’s sales organization, channels, and end customers to help create and drive revenue opportunities for CoachingLoft.com when needed. Deliver the desired Cube10 growth targets for a number of partners per territory and effective Cube10.io

The Sales Executive role will be responsible for driving sales growth by aggressively promoting and selling our solutions to the asset owner space. You will uncover, qualify and close new opportunities with new logos and upsell existing clients. You are results-driven, continually refining your sales process and skills, and thrive in an entrepreneurial culture. The ideal candidate also plays well in the sandbox working with cross-functional team members across the organization in order to achieve goals and objectives. Responsibilities:  Generate and follow up on leads whether sourced from marketing, events, networking or cold calls Build rapport with prospects to understand/uncover their business needs and challenges, clearly communicate our value proposition, and guide them through service evaluation milestones, including providing online product demonstrations Produce follow up materials and custom proposals for interested prospects Assist with contract request and execution and appropriate hand off to onboarding team Build sustainable pipeline momentum that delivers consistent sales results quarter over quarter Ruthlessly qualify prospects in order to assign proper sales stage and build accurate forecast Provide full transparency into sales pipeline through detailed and timely documentation of sales activities and deal progression in CRM (Salesforce.com) ABOUT YOU  Requirements:  Demonstrated closer with an outstanding work ethic Self-starter and capable multi-tasker taking the initiative to identify new opportunities while executing a sound sales process for opportunities in progress Comfortable with client interaction and exhibit strong customer service skills, displaying the highest levels of professionalism Outstanding communicator excellent verbal and written communication skills, ability to effectively communicate value proposition to stakeholders at various levels, including senior management/C Suite, and create a compelling case for eVestment solutions. Superior presentation skills, comfortable leading client demonstrations; and comfortable with presentation technologies. Demonstrate ability to influence outcomes and present to all levels of an organization. Outstanding qualifier capable of demonstrating critical thinking and skepticism to discern why a prospect will or wont be worth pursuing or prioritizing over others Highly organized with a strong attention to detail Thrive in a fast-paced environment An acute sense of diplomacy and judgment Strong collaborator you should make the world better for your co-workers Experience:  Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Finance, or related field 3+ years of sales experience, preferably in an institutional investment technology and/or SaaS sales setting Working knowledge of financial and investing concepts along with a willingness to devour information and best practices that will help you succeed Experience in the investment management or banking industry with a consulting / financial advisory firm, investment manager or banking institution a strong plus Come as You Are  Nasdaq is an equal opportunity employer. We positively encourage applications from suitably qualified and eligible candidates regardless of age, color, disability, national origin, ancestry, race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.  We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request an accommodation.

CryoConcepts LP is a leader in the development, manufacture and sale of cryosurgical and cryo-therapeutic products world-wide (www.cryoconcepts.com). The company has a diverse group of products sold to Physicians, Veterinarians and Aestheticians. We are seeking a candidate for the position of Regional Sales Director (Midwest) for our physician’s office products. CryoConcepts is committed to working with Distributors in this market and the ideal candidate must have a proven record working with and managing Distribution Reps. Travel and field work with Distribution Reps as well as customers is required. As a key person to help the CryoConcepts team achieve its corporate goals, the candidate must also be able to provide routine reports to senior management. The candidate must develop a good understanding of CryoConcepts products and possess strong analytical, verbal and written skills with the proven ability to work with cross functional teams.  Desired skills or experience: · 5+ years in sales management preferably within the physician's office market · Proven track record working with large and small US medical products distributors · Experience launching and managing new products within the physician’s office market -Demonstrated strong organizational and management skills Responsibilities include: · Building and maintaining Distributor Based sales network · Reporting Business Activities and Forecasting Sales · Reporting to Senior Management on all issues regarding ongoing business · Working with Marketing to support lead generation and follow up in the territory

The Sales Support Coordinator supports the Sales and Distribution departments by performing multiple administrative tasks related to customer orders and projects. Must have the ability to meet tight deadlines, have strong interpersonal and communication skills, be detail oriented, and have the ability to work independently. They must establish and maintain a professional working relationship within the Sales department, as their job duties are predominantly cross-departmental in nature.  Job Responsibilities Sales Support Coordinator supports the Sales and Distribution departments by performing multiple administrative tasks related to customer orders and projects Commit sales orders for Sales and Distributions departments Send order confirmations, POD’s and logistics info for shipments to customers daily Sends bookings reports, quote logs and 2nd time buy reports to reps Complete open order reports for Sales and Distributions departments Add detailed project information to spreadsheets Coordinate and complete customer surveys and supplier forms as needed Review and forward incoming quote requests to Sales associates based on territories  Additional Skills & Qualifications Education and Experience High School Diploma or equivalent SAP software experience preferred  Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Attributes (KSAAs): Language/Communication Skills: Excellent skills with written and verbal communication; ability to comprehend and explain processes to coworkers, customers, and other stakeholders. Organizational Skills: Must possess extremely strong organizational and time management skills. Reasoning Ability: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed written or oral instructions. Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations. Computer Skills: Proficiency in Microsoft Suite, Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel and Internet research. Knowledge of Database software; Inventory software; Order processing systems. Physical Ability: This position is mostly sedentary in nature, requiring mostly seated work in front of a computer terminal.

Overview  Directs and coordinates activities of one or more divisions and participates in formulating and developing long range goals and objectives.  Responsibilities Responsible for the realization of division objectives for sales and revenues. Will create and utilize comprehensive sales plans that analyze competitive trends, gains and other activities in order to devise effective counter strategies and tactics. â€¢ Responsible for appropriate staffing, maintenance, and development of the sales organization in order to accomplish the division's goals and objectives. â€¢ Will organize the structure of management to ensure that the sales organization is appropriately staffed for the achievement of division and supplier sales objectives. â€¢ Responsible for communicating to all sales management personnel the sales goals of the organization to be established in a sales plan incorporating supplier objectives. â€¢ Obtains and monitors feedback regarding customers & suppliers needs and attitudes in order to update sales strategies, forecasts and projections. â€¢ Will make monthly sales forecasts in the last week of each month for the following month to be communicated for inclusion in the product calculations for timely procurement activities. Qualifications  Master's college degree, preferred; four to ten years of management experience in adult beverage industry; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Have knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite software and order processing systems or the aptitude to learn. Requires a current, valid state driver's license, ability to meet vehicle insurance requirements as defined by the Company and Alcohol Beverage Commission (ABC) License, as required by the state. The employee must regularly lift up to 50 pounds and will occasionally lift up to 100 pounds. We are an Equal Opportunity employer.

BISNOW OVERVIEW BISNOW is an industry leading, vertically integrated B2B platform serving the trillion dollar commercial real estate industry across North America, Canada, the UK and Ireland.    Our mission is to inform, connect and advance the commercial real estate community to do more business. From events and news to marketing services, talent solutions and now DaaS, BISNOW reaches millions of all-digital readers as well as thousands of event attendees, speakers, sponsors, advertisers and businesses looking to do more deals within CRE.  Operating in almost 50 MSA’s across North America, the UK and Europe, we tend to think globally, but strive to connect people hyper-locally.    Key Responsibilities Establish and maintain relationships with marketing decision makers within all asset classes and sectors of our targeted markets. Drive event sponsorship sales (both digital and in person when they return) by conducting in-depth prospecting research to source and confirm participation of sponsors for our events. Consistently prospect new business to build a strong pipeline for our senior-level sales team and become an expert at specificity prospecting. Connect with sponsorship prospects using phone and email strategies; responding to all inbound leads. Assist event production department in an effort to build sponsor-friendly programs that ultimately align with the interest of Bisnow’s client base. Constantly brainstorm fresh and relevant topic ideas to adapt to trends within the industry. Understand both individual and larger team KPIs and position yourself to hit, if not exceed said KPIs on a daily, weekly and monthly basis. Document daily activities in Salesforce CRM. Work closely with the sales team to accelerate our sales cycle and to extend reach into target accounts. Work with a positive, cross functional team on an everyday basis to make certain of successful sponsorship, marketing and financial performance of these events.  What are we looking for? 0 - 2 years of sales experience. Innate hustle, raw intelligence and infectious enthusiasm. Ability to demonstrate an entrepreneurial yet disciplined mindset, creative yet organized work-ethic and an ambitious yet humble attitude. Ability to learn fast. We’re constantly bringing new digital and event products to market and you need to be able to understand their purpose, how our clients use them and learn to sell them yourself. Demonstrated experience excelling in a group or team environment of any sort. A strong interest in growing into an externally facing sales role or similar position working closely with clients. A strong interest in the commercial real estate industry. A strong interest in media and digital marketing solutions. Ability to remain receptive to feedback and open, constructive criticism. Capability to work in a high-energy, fast-paced, frequently-changing sales environment.  What's in it for you? Competitive compensation structure! Unlimited vacation. Health, dental, vision, commuter, short term disability and 401k benefits. You’ll get to work with incredibly smart, passionate, driven, ambitious, kind, caring and mindful people and will rarely experience an overload of policies, bureaucracy or toxicity (the latter, we do not tolerate).    Our values demand that we be curious, self-aware, fearless, consistent. We say yes to seemingly insurmountable challenges because we dare ourselves to push further. And we go the distance because we are individually and collectively entrepreneurial, always asking: Why can’t it be done? We find a way because we care more than the competition. We embrace team and disown ego. We are ruthlessly disciplined and unabashedly kind. We unreservedly challenge the status quo and vigorously fight for new levels of excellence. We believe the difference between good and great is exceptional communication. We obsess over creating value for our team and our customers. We push ourselves and our industry to be more inclusive, to champion diversity and to fight racism, gender bias and all forms of inequality. We never peak. We never quit. We never have excuses. We own our failures and we commit to being smarter and stronger because of them. We give our best today and even better tomorrow. We are here to win.

Job Description for Remote Position Sales Coordinator: Sales Coordinator will be responsible for consolidating quoting requirements for service sales and on-demand service repair requests. Provide phone and e-mail coverage/assistance; enter data; generate and process Service Quotes, Demand Service Quotes and Contracts; assist with ODS to Contract conversions; track these and other related activities to aid in analysis and strategic execution of initiatives; and assist with IMR/Dealer and Direct team’s service needs. Perform contract sales analytics by monitoring monthly orders and revenue, contract sales mix (equipment type, contract level, and contract conversion), funnel conversion, and installation orders and revenue. Create Standard Work documentation for daily operations and revise when necessary. Use standard work documentation for training purposes Ensure database integrity in SAP and SFDC. Create or modify SAP equipment records as necessary Center of Excellence (COE) data management and execution of those contracts . Create reporting and trend analysis data, as well as dashboards for daily management of LMS Service activities Suggest, develop, test, implement and support process changes in the effort of continual improvement. Education:  HS Diploma or GED  Experience:  Experience with ERP (enterprise resource planning) systems (ex. SAP) Highly Preferred  Experience with CRM (customer relationship management) systems (ex. Salesforce.com) Highly Preferred  Business management software or complex tools  Data Management  Ability to execute contracts  Create reporting and trend analysis data, as well as dashboards for daily management of Leica Microsystems Service activities  Hours: 8:00 AM 5:00 PM CT  Check out our benefits here: www.danaherbenefits.com  This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by this employee. description: Outside Sales Representative - New Jersey $60 - $80K First Year (Base plus Commission) Guaranteed $55k Year 1& 2  Good things come to those who wait, like earning over $100,000 a YEAR. And look, you’re in sales, so you understand that patience is a virtue.  The first year will see you lay the foundations. By year two, you’re getting there - with a structure in place for your income to build up on top. But it’s that third year when you’ve established your client base and cemented those key relationships where the rewards will truly flourish. In the case of this Trade Sales Rep role, you can expect to start hitting 6 figures.  Because let’s face it. Making a huge splash right off the bat means you’re either having serious beginner’s luck, or you’re working for Jordan Belfort. And we all know how that ended.  There are no wolves here, so you won’t need to pick up the phone and start dialing. You’re going to be mostly out in the field - meeting with builders, architects, designers, and contractors. In time, you’ll become their go-to contact for high-end building supplies and installations.  To help you succeed, our brand-new showroom and experience center will place your products center stage, allowing your prospects to see them in the best possible light. You’ll get support from management, ownership and autonomy, and the power of an industry-leading brand behind you. Anything is possible here if you’ve got the right skills and attitude.  You will be challenged. But then, you chose sales... Would you have it any other way?  It’s important that you’re energized by the hunt (showing the type of enthusiasm for your work that can’t be faked). You’re from a B2B sales background and you’ll be willing to put in the work and be motivated by the potential returns. Otherwise, what’s the point?  You’ll get a $55k guarantee for 2 years. You’ll likely earn between $60-80k in years 1 & 2, but after that, you’d be expected to earn 6 figures. Ideally, you’ll be based somewhere near Paramus, NJ.  So. If you’re ready to start building up to a level of income that could change the entire trajectory of your life, then hit the apply now button or call 877.860.6767 and ask for Andy Schmad (or email him at aschmad@persevus.com). And don’t worry if your resume isn’t up to date; we’ll suss out the details later.    And we don’t ghost people, so expect a response in the not-so-distant future.  Andy Schmad, Talent Scout (877)860-6767 - Ask for me aschmad@persevus.com https://www.linkedin.com/in/andyschmad/

Change the future with us! Discover Echo is a revolutionary company that has redesigned microscopy for the life sciences landscape. Our unique hybrid microscopes are used around the world by educators, scientists, and researchers for cutting-edge applications. Our growth potential is enormous.  We are an award-winning, fast-growing company dedicated to improving microscopy. Our unique product allows us to sell on value and need rather than solely on price. Our simplified sales process means we can spend more time doing what we love (selling), and less time on administrative tasks and support. Our unique marketing approach gives us a significant advantage. Top candidates will have familiarity with fluorescence microscopy and live-cell imaging.  Discover-Echo offers an early employment opportunity at a rapidly growing company. You will have the opportunity to make an impact on the community and make your performance matter. We are seeking top-performing life science sales professionals based in the greater Ohio/Michigan area. We are looking for an energetic top-tier fast learner with a good sales track record.  As an equal opportunity employer, we do more than accept difference. We celebrate diversity, we support employees from a wide range of backgrounds, and we benefit from the added creativity and richness that these differences bring to our offices and community. We pride ourselves on being a collaborative environment where everyone’s talents and opinions contribute to the greater good and are always recognized.  Responsibilities: Execute successful product demonstrations Work with our large distribution network to effectively target customers and close deals quickly Build effective relationships with distribution reps and key customers Get our products in the hands of researchers and scientists Grow our presence at government accounts, universities, biotechs, hospitals and pharmaceutical companies  Qualifications Exceptional at delivering results on target Have previous microscopy experience Possess exceptional presentation and verbal communication skills to explain and demonstrate sophisticated technical products Familiarity with key academic research and biotech accounts within the region A fast learner (and a good listener) who understands the needs of today’s life science researchers Have an affinity for life sciences and closing deals -- it’s about passion as much as the job Experience in research, biotech, and pharmaceutical is a plus Experience in selling through large distribution partners is a plus Overnight travel is expected to be roughly 25-50% depending on home base location Ability to lift between 50-60lbs

Reporting to the Chief Executive Officer, the Director of Sales and Marketing will be responsible for the direction, control, and administration of NewAge Industries’ sales and marketing processes. This position will assist in developing strategic solutions and marketing strategies, motivating others to excel and building a high-performance team focused on solution selling and relationship building. As a member of the NewAge Leadership team, you will guide the company in achieving its mission and continue the strong focus on NewAge’s growth potential.  Key Job Responsibilities Develop and manage key sales infrastructure, including implementing efficient processes, sales forecasting/strategies, and staff training to drive pipeline build, opportunity qualification, close rate, and support revenue growth. Lead the marketing strategy for NewAge which includes the establishment of successful channel and partner programs. Inspire, coach, train, and teach sales team and others. Build strong relationships with customers/vendors, peers, and team members/leaders. Provide input to all other departments as to requirements of sales to meet company sales objectives. Develop department budgetary requirements. Provide sales forecast as required for the ESOP 5-year planning process - and update/communicate the forecast on a quarterly basis Recommend sales strategies for improvement based on market research and competitor analyses. Partner with Product Management, Product Engineering and R&D to expand current products and develop new products and services for current and future markets. Monitor customer, market and competitor activity and provide feedback to company leadership team and other company departments Partner with the Director of Manufacturing Development to grow NewAge’s “close to the customer” strategy Compile information and data related to customer and prospect interactions. Manage key customer relationships and participate in closing strategic opportunities. Work collaboratively with all team leaders and their respective departments in particular Manufacturing and Supply Chain ______________________________________________________________________  Education, Skills And Experience Requirements Bachelor’s degree (B.S.) from four-year college or university in Business Administration, Sales and Marketing or related field preferred. Minimum 10+ years of senior sales management experience, preferably within a manufacturing environment. Experience working with distributors from various countries and cultures. Experience managing a domestic and international distribution network. Experience with the Sandler sales system a plus Demonstrated ability to sell solutions, identify and solve complex customer solutions. Knowledge of marketing processes, systems, and tactics Interact and build relationships with Team Leaders and other NewAge departments. Work, support and share with others to succeed as a team. Set self-ambitious and demanding targets while enjoying the thrill of successfully overcoming difficult challenges. Possess the ability to understand and analyze complex issues and problems and come up with solutions. Technical understanding and ability to understand drawings and expectations. Strong project management skills (managing projects and teams from start to finish). In business since 1954, NewAge Industries is a manufacturer and fabricator of thermoplastic and thermoset tubing and hose, and a supplier of fittings and clamps. The company offers one of the broadest product lines of tubing, hose, and fittings in the U.S., and its custom extrusion and fabrication services are unrivaled. The company is a family and employee owned business, with its corporate offices and state-of-the-art manufacturing center located in Warrington, PA.

As a SDR, you'll be responsible for creating interest and developing conversations with contacts at enterprise corporations. Team members are passionate about the ongoing transformation of inside sales to something that is personal, value-filled, and representative of social disruption. Who You Are & What Makes You Qualified Four-year college degree (preferably in Marketing, Humanities, Communications or Business) Desire to be in a software sales (full cycle) position as a career progression Have a verifiable track record of success and goal attainment in a sales-oriented role Have a passion for technology and disruptive technology Have a deep understanding of the role social media plays in business Have 1-2 years in an SDR/BDR role You have a run-through-a-brick-wall level of drive, passion, and desire for results For Colorado based roles: The minimum salary for this position is $50,000. For full-time employees, we offer flexible paid time off and paid parental leave, medical plans, dental and vision plans, life insurance, 401(k) savings plans, employee stock options, gym and wellness discounts, Plum benefits, Lifemart discounts, and paid time off to invest in learning and career development.  We focus on our mission: We founded Sprinklr with one mission: to enable every organization on the planet to make their customers happier. Our vision is to be the world’s most loved enterprise software company, ever.  We believe in our product: Sprinklr was built from the ground up to enable a brand’s digital transformation. Its platform provides every customer-facing team with the ability to reach, engage and listen to customers around the world. At Sprinklr, we have many of the world's largest brands as our clients, and our employees have the opportunity to work closely alongside them.  We invest in our people: At Sprinklr, we believe every human has the potential to be amazing. We empower each Sprinklrite in the journey toward achieving their personal and professional best. For wellbeing, this includes daily meditation breaks, virtual fitness, and access to Headspace. We have continuous learning opportunities available with LinkedIn Learning and more.  EEO - Our philosophy: Our goal is to ensure every employee feels like they belong and are operating in a judgement-free zone regardless of gender, race, ethnicity, age, and lifestyle preference, among others. We value and celebrate diversity and fervently believe every employee matters and should be respected and heard. We offer great benefits and a generous vacation package of 20 days per year. Looking forward to hearing from you!

The Opportunity   H-Wave is seeking a Regional Sales Director covering the Southeast (GA, TN, NC,AL ) territory. This person must understand and articulate what it takes to lead a high-performing team of medical device sales representatives as they will be tasked with developing a dynamic and driven team. We are looking for an enthusiastic leader to motivate their team to exceed sales goals and do the best work of their life!    Who we are :   H-Wave is a company that is “All-In”. We are “All-In” for our patient outcomes, family, and are passionate about what we do and our fight towards ending the Opioid Crisis. H-Wave believes in the value of the lives of our patients as we manufacture a multi-functional electrical stimulation device intended to speed recovery, restore function, and manage chronic, acute, or post-operative pain. It is a non-invasive drug-free alternative treatment option without harmful side effects. We are a family-owned business providing life changing pain relief for 40 years and we treat our patients and employees like family. In addition to patient outcome, employee satisfaction is a top priority, and we strive to keep our work culture fun, rewarding, and motivating. Because we are “All-In” in everything that we get to do, and we are looking for people who will be as passionate about our product, service, and work environment as we are!   Duties and responsibilities  • Develop, forecast, and execute upon monthly, quarterly, and annual sales production, growth and profit goals.  • Support and encourage a strategic coaching relationship with Sales Consultants. • Review Quarterly Achievements, Goals and Strategy with EVP of Sales. • Perform Quarterly and Annual Reviews with every member of your Regional Sales Team.   • Identify and present opportunities for professional growth and self-development.  • Build and maintain strong relationships with every member of your Regional Sales Team. • Identify business challenges and develop appropriate action plans with Sales Consultants. • Provide business systems and technical support to Sales Consultants and customers. • Work from and actively engage the use of the H-Wave Sales Playbook. • Identify skills gaps and support sales team efforts to execute on revenue generating sales activities. • Active engagement in ongoing employee recruitment, retention and mentorship of current team members.  • Accountable for region-wide Strategic Partnership engagement, referencing Regional Sales Consultants’ Strategic Partnership Grids. • Formal Annual Quality Assessment of all Regional PCAs with ongoing quality monitoring. • Resolve customer challenges when escalation is necessary.  • Look for, record and report trends, challenges and issues within the region immediately to the EVP of Sales. • Attend regional and national industry specific conventions, symposia, conferences and other events as necessary.  Qualifications  • Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent professional experience • Must have experience leading a high-performance sales team  • Must have valid Driver’s License and clean motor vehicle record  • History of working in a position that requires significant autonomy and self- motivation • Highly driven and exhibits strong work ethic  • Exemplary written and oral communication skills with any audience • Demonstrate strong problem-solving abilities • Strong proficiency of Microsoft Office applications  • Ability to travel, up to 50% (overnight) on a regular basis   Physical requirements  • The physical demands described within the Responsibilities section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions • Frequent required travel to customer clinics, hospitals and offsite meetings. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to be independently mobile  Benefits  • Base Salary + Commission • Vehicle Allowance • Matching 401k • Health/Life Insurance • Optional Dental/Vision • Company Issued iPhone • Paid Vacation      Job Type: Full-time    Pay: From $120,000.00 per year

Role: Medical Sales Representative (Contract) Location: Orange County, CA Type: Contracts role for 6 months, then could shift to full-time with salary and benefits  Else Nutrition USA is part of a global company with a mission to create real, plant-based alternatives for parents who want a cleaner, more sustainable way to nourish their babies (than dairy or soy-based options). We are Else. We are a globally patented, plant-based alternative to dairy and soy-based formulas and nutrition products. Else is made with WHOLE plant ingredients, using the cleanest production process and 3 core ingredients – ones you can actually pronounce: almonds, buckwheat, tapioca.  Else is endorsed by Pediatricians, Nutritionists and Parents! That’s because we’re different than anything else out there, meeting the highest standard for nutrition and parent expectations for a clean label product. Most other plant-based products are for adults or contain only ‘some’ plant nutrition or just don’t taste good.   But why flip the script on everything we’ve come to expect from baby nutrition? Because we’ve stood where today’s parents are standing. And we demanded something different too. It’s more than nutrition. It’s truly something Else.  We are actively searching for a Medical Sales Representative for the Orange County, CA area who can join us in a contract role. If successful in this role, we will convert it to a full-time position. Corporate is based in Tel-Aviv, Israel, but all operations for the US and Canada will be based out of our Columbus office.     Responsibilities: Generating leads: Leverage our current database and work to add to it by generating new leads for target Pediatricians/offices in the Columbus area. Influencing Pediatrician Offices: Focus on total office selling to work with front desk, nurses, and doctors to get to the key decision makers and share our products and science. Driving Brand Recommendations: Drive recommendations and samples for Else products among Pediatrician offices, as measured by increase in sales for zip codes in the territory (Online, Sprouts, and others).  Requirements: College degree 2+ years in medical sales, calling on, visiting, and influencing medical offices Experience in infant/pediatric area is preferred Experience in and/or the right attitude to work in a start-up environment (curious, hard-working, can wear many hats, bounces back from mistakes, etc.) Strong verbal and written communication Analytical with ability to track calls and pull out insights from database (Hubspot) Passionate about nutrition Able to meet tight deadlines and multi-task well Outgoing, positive, friendly, and collaborative personality Expert in Microsoft Office and Outlook programs  Great benefits if position converts to full-time! FREE Medical/Dental/Vision insurance for employee Stock Options for everyone 401K with up to 5% dollar for dollar company match Life Insurance (employer covered) Short-term Disability (employer covered) Generous PTO  Join a small, scrappy team focused on bettering the world around us through nutrition! If interested, please apply now

description: Who We Are  We are a team of 150+ diverse insights experts who are passionate about solving UX challenges and creating experiences people love.  AnswerLab is the leading UX Research firm in the US. We help powerful brands such as Amazon, Google, Facebook, FedEx, Wells Fargo, and Walmart bring a human-centered design process to every product launched. We focus on user experience research to understand what people see, do, think, and feel when using websites, mobile applications, voice interfaces, AR/VR, wearables, and other digital products. Our research studies are tailored to our clients' unique needs to provide clear, actionable recommendations that generate strategic business results.  The secret to our success is no secret: It is the people who work here! We recruit only the most skilled and client-focused professionals to join our team. All are devoted to being at the forefront of the user experience industry. Our team is made up of smart, down-to-earth people who value a "get it done" attitude as well as a good dose of humor during our workday. We empower them to do what they do best; lead impactful research studies from planning to analysis for the world's most innovative brands.  Who You Are  You are a driven, ambitious and results-oriented individual who is deeply curious about UX Research. You want to partner and collaborate with internal teams, vendors and technology to ensure quality data for our research studies, all while designing and developing effective analytical methodologies and you want to become a part of a team whose mission is to improve the digital world by creating experiences people love. You thrive in a home-based work environment, and you are comfortable conducting research remotely.  Click here to learn more about the AnswerLab culture and why people choose to join our team.  Job Purpose & Impact  AnswerLab is looking for a Conversion Copywriter, or a Senior Copywriter interested in learning conversion copywriting, to join our team full-time remotely.  The Conversion Copywriter is responsible for increasing AnswerLab's subscriptions by understanding the client's journey and using that knowledge to craft compelling communications.  We would love to hear from you if you're a creative problem solver who's skilled in thinking strategically and writes with exceptional quality and amazing speed. You combine the art and science of conversion copywriting masterfully. You're the one everyone goes to when it's time to simplify complex concepts into ideas, email sequences, pages and, ultimately, phrases that move. And you always know the Why behind every word you write.  Job Responsibilities  And Here's How You'll Do That Here  Your job isn't to write. Your job is to move people to say yes. Envision and help develop strategies, messaging and copy for integrated digital, direct and social projects Take a project from A to Z, writing emails, pages and more Work with our Strategy and Business Development team to craft compelling emails, reach out to clients and engage them in conversations Analyze the results of outreach campaigns and continuously tweak the method and writing Apply your knowledge of UX and persuasion to every task Participate fully in account plans and team meetings to help identify strategies and tactics that will be compelling for email campaigns Run the quarterly account planning program to ensure that the company has a forum to identify themes for campaigns Follow and champion a data-first approach to crafting copy, with data and data-driven insights Collaborate fully with our Strategy and Research teams to translate client desires into innovative, viable and conversion-focused strategies, concepts and copy Write persuasively and on-brand for a variety of brands and audiences Present concepts and copy in a compelling, persuasive manner, with confidence Offer constructive criticism swiftly and thoughtfully Organize and execute on monthly lead generation webinar programs run by the marketing team Knowledge, Skills, And Experience  We understand that outstanding candidates can come from a variety of backgrounds. While specific experience is important, we are ultimately looking for candidates who have the personal characteristics to thrive in a growing client-focused business. The ideal candidate will likely meet many or most of the job criteria listed below. 2-5 years' agency or in-house experience in copywriting A degree in English, Marketing or Science A portfolio demonstrating the skills required to get the yes (leads, trial starts, sales, referrals) Proven experience developing progressive digital projects Demonstrated ability to rationalize, judge and organize ideas Incredible attention to detail, organizational skills and time management A strong passion for the work If you're a qualified, passionate Senior Copywriter or Senior Conversion Copywriter, we would love to hear from you!  In addition to expertly meeting the requirements outlined above, your success will be measured on our eight Core Values.  AnswerLab Core Values Build trust Provide amazing service Support and encourage inclusivity Jump in to help others Handle change with flexibility Innovate our products and processes Explore creative solutions to challenges Make AnswerLab a great place to work Physical Requirements Overtime may be required to meet project deadlines Sitting for extended periods of time Dexterity of hands and fingers to operate a computer keyboard, mouse, and other devices and objects Note: This job description is subject to change at any time.  At AnswerLab, our mission is to create experiences people love. This means we strive to make our company a great place to work for people from all walks of life. Hiring people from a wide variety of backgrounds makes our company stronger and helps us achieve our mission.  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.

The Regional Sales Director, reporting to the Vice President of Sales and Marketing, has the role of management and direction of the sales team to achieve revenue and profit goals. Evaluates and implements appropriate new sales techniques to increase the region's sales volume. May recommend product or service enhancements to improve customer satisfaction and sales potential. Subject matter expert leading and coordinating the commercial processes across the region footprint. This individual is responsible for workflows including proposals/bids, contract negotiation, and compliance with contract commitments and commercial risk assessment. This individual will work closely with regional Operations leaders, regional sales teams, and corporate administrative functions to ensure the overall team's function meets Thompson Industrial Services' strategy and criteria for quotation execution while meeting/exceeding customer's needs and expectations.  Primary Duties And Responsibilities Personal Conduct Conduct himself/herself at all times in a way that is professional and is aligned with Thompson Industrial Service, LLC values. Consistently ensure that business is always conducted with honesty and integrity. People Development Sales Competency Assess and improve the skill of the sales team with regards to communication, time management, strategic thinking, presentation and proposal development and delivery, and other criteria critical to driving improved Revenue, Net Contribution, and EBITDA Business Acumen Assess and improve sales team's understanding of the critical parameters that impact Job Profitability as measured by Net Contribution to EBITDA. Utilize Net Contribution principles to accurately estimate the margin generation of each Job proposal allowing for more precise pricing relative to the highest possible market price at which a Job can be won. Personnel Career Development Develop technical competency matrix and work with Regional/Corporate Leadership to implement training & development plans. Remain actively engaged with sales team to ensure understanding of each person's personal career aspirations and assist each team member to develop a Personal Development Plan to facilitate their own growth. Strategy Development Understand and contribute to the strategic plan of the company Work closely with the VP of Sales & Marketing to develop and execute a commercial sales strategy to drive increased Revenue and Net Contribution $ within his/her Region. Strategy Implementation/Execution Customer relationship development Proactively visit existing and future customers to assess and gain selling opportunities. Build sustainable relationships with both customers and operations. Manage and evaluate customer concerns by meeting with the customer and communicating with operations to rectify as needed. Manage the execution of contractual agreements with customers to ensure compliance. Proposal process ownership Oversee Job proposal development to ensure all significant risks (T&Cs, Safety, Execution, etc.) are identified, communicated, and mitigated prior to customer submission. Responsible for understanding services offered by Thompson Industrial Services and its competitors, and developing proposals focused on winning business at the highest possible market price with acceptable Net Contribution $. Results Communication Proactively engage with Operations to ensure seamless transition and execution of awarded work. Complete sales forecasts and sales activity reports, including TIS CRM tools in a timely manner. Report any quality issues to the appropriate leadership. Deliver proposal metrics dashboards to measure KPI's. Primary Performance Metrics Revenue $ and Net Contribution $ generation and growth Personnel development and retention Safety Education and Experience Bachelor's degree required Master's degree preferred and/or equivalent work experience required 10 years or more of commercial and technical experience related to services in an industrial setting.

Medical Device Sales Representative/Agent Full-time or part-time Contract Commission-based Fully Remote Qualifications: Prior sales experience required, medical sales helpful Bachelor’s degree preferred, technical expertise in medical devices, health care welcome Ambitious sales-minded with strong interpersonal skills to build rapport with customers Highly self-motivated and self-disciplined with ability to work effectively in a sales environment Organizational skills and effective time management Analytical skills to understand key performance metrics Full Job Description: EndeXs Health Solutions is building a team of seasoned medical device sales reps to help distribute our line of high quality state-of-the-art PCR Covid-19 test kits and PPE. This is an exceptional opportunity for self-motivated & highly driven candidates with well established medical relationships. The job offer is also applicable to sales pros from other industries who are great at what they do but new to the medical sector and would like to take on a new challenge. This is solely a commission-based, remote independent contractor position. You dictate your own schedule, you set your own hours, and you decide how much you will make, with the potential income being substantial and uncapped. Our product offerings are disposable, therefore there will be considerable residual income from frequent reorders once a relationship is firmly established and carefully maintained.. Job Description & Responsibilities: • Build and maintain relationships with facilities and organizations conducting COVID-19 PCR tests to include medical facilities, labs, hospitals, civilian and military, government agencies, cruise lines, entertainment & sports orgs, schools, large manufacturing, etc. • Manage and grow an existing customer pipeline while also developing new business opportunities. • Account management. Compliance with all applicable COVID-19 regulations and recommendations.

ADP is hiring a Sales Manager to lead a team of outside sales representatives. Are you ready to grow your career and lead a team at an established, respected, global company? Are you ready for your next best job where you can elevate your financial future? Are you looking to join a dynamic, inclusive team environment with a culture of collaboration and belonging?  Yes? This could be the role for you. Don't just take our word for it... read on and see for yourself! As a Sales Manager, you'll lead a team of field-based Sales Representatives who sell ADP solutions, including payroll, tax, human resources, and benefits to new and existing clients. In this role, you will guide your team towards achieving sales objectives through coordination and communication between ADP's clients & prospects, internal support partners, and your team. Additionally, you will recruit, hire, train, and develop sales associates, providing performance feedback and coaching. Multitasking and prioritization are essential to helping your team win. If you're able to juggle different work activities and shift attention from one task to another with ease depending on urgency, then this job is for you! As you continue to meet the needs of multiple different stakeholders (your team, your clients, your partners, your leaders, and more), you will have an opportunity to reach your goals and make a name for yourself at ADP. Once you do, doors will open for advancement opportunities and industry-leading compensation, benefits, and even luxurious incentive trips.  A little about ADP: We are a global leader in human resources technology, offering the latest AI and machine learning-enhanced payroll, tax, human resources, benefits, and much more. We believe our people make all the difference in cultivating an inclusive, down-to-earth culture that welcomes ideas, encourages innovation, and values belonging. We've received recognition as a global Best Places to Work and a recipient of many prestigious awards for diversity, equity, and inclusion, including a DiversityInc® Top 50 Company, Best CEO and company for women, LGBTQ+, multicultural talent, and more. As part of our deep DEI commitment, our CEO has joined the OneTen coalition to create one million jobs for Black Americans over the next ten years. Learn more about DEI at ADP on our YouTube channel: http://adp.careers/DEI_Videos Ready to #MakeYourMark? Apply now! To learn more about Sales at ADP, watch here: http://adp.careers/Sales_Videos  What you'll do: Responsibilities Grow Our Business While Growing Your Team's. You will work with your team within your assigned geography to close sales, win business, and reach sales goals through the effective use of planned resources. Lead Your Team. You will provide overall direction, motivation, and support to your sales team in a designated territory. (You'll also need to ensure that all Sales Associates utilize the Salesforce Automation System and implement an audit procedure to ensure compliance.) Recruit, hire, and train sales associates. You will interview, identify, and motivate Sales Associates while providing continuous feedback on performance and coaching. Also, you will help to develop the careers of your team members. Represent ADP. You will represent ADP to customers, prospects, and the public by spending time in the field, at trade shows, demonstrations, and seminars. You will stay current on ADP product technology. TO SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE: Required Qualifications Sales Role Model. You have a successful track record of business-to-business sales experience (2+ years). You excel at client interactions and showcase stellar presentation skills. People Person and Coach. You're a relationship builder who can connect and motivate people. You will not shy away from delivering performance feedback and coaching to make your team members the best that they can be. Trusted Advisor. You live and breathe integrity and deliver on promises...every time. Expert Planner. You manage your time well, prioritize deliverables, and are an expert at multitasking. You possess excellent planning skills, which will help you to implement successful sales strategies. A college degree is great but not required. What's more important is having the skills to do the job. If you don't have a college degree, other acceptable experience could include: Two or more years of business-to-business sales or sales management experience with an impressive track record of closing sales, winning clients, and managing a territory, OR Military experience -- skills including teamwork, resilience, negotiation, trust-building, and a "never lose" mentality will help you build team and client relationships, identify solutions, and achieve success.  Bonus points for these: Preferred Qualifications Prior experience leading teams YOU'LL LOVE WORKING HERE BECAUSE YOU CAN: Be yourself in a culture that values equity, inclusion, and belonging and creates a safe space for diverse perspectives and insights. Belong by joining one of nine Business Resource Groups where you can connect globally with networks and allies who share common interests and experiences. Grow your career in an agile, fast-paced environment with plenty of opportunities to progress. Continuously learn. Ongoing training, development, and mentorship opportunities for even the most insatiable learner. Be your healthiest. Best-in-class benefits start on Day 1 because healthy associates are happy ones. Balance work and life. Resources and flexibility to more easily integrate your work and your life. Focus on your mental health and well-being. We're here to provide exceptional service to our clients, and none of that happens without each of us taking care of ourselves and being there for one another. Join a company committed to giving back and generating a lasting, positive impactupon the communities in which we work and live. Get paid to pay it forward. Company-paid time off for volunteering for causes you care about. What are you waiting for? Apply today!  Salaried and hourly workers who work on average 32 or more standard hours per week: Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, 401(k), Charitable Contribution Match, Holidays, Personal Days & Vacation, Student Loan Repayment Program and Paid Volunteer Time Off

description: Trace is a ground-breaking technology that automatically films and edits video into highlights for every player on the field. Our mission is to help players and families to be able to review their athletic performance, moments and memories that are important to them. We create a customized experience that is tailored to each athlete. Our apps have become integral to the lives of hundreds of thousands of passionate athletes all over the world, from National teams to kids just starting out their athletic journey. This is a once in a lifetime opportunity for you to be an early, integral member of the team that will triple in size over the next 18 months.   At Trace we look for individuals who are passionate about sports, have played sports and understand how to work hard to achieve goals. We’re a collaborative team of top performers that thrive on healthy competition, we push each other individually so we can succeed collectively. We will challenge you to develop personally and professionally if you’re willing to learn, commit to our mission and be coachable. All of this while focusing on the sports market!  As a Sales Development Rep (SDR), you will be responsible for building our pipeline and qualifying leads. This is a great place to start for someone looking to enter the tech world and learn sales. We’re looking for drive and a fun demeanor as we work towards removing friction from youth sports video.   How you will contribute: Find new opportunities to target for outreach Set meetings and demos for our AE team Organize and build the sale pipeline Regular reporting (weekly) on key performance metrics Facilitate introductions to clubs, teams, and tournaments  Skills that will help you be successful in this role: 1+ year of prior professional experience (sales or online marketing is ideal) Background in sports (coaching or playing) or a former athlete in club sports Strong ability to take initiative and confidentially direct customer interactions Excellent organizational and time management skills Demonstrated ability to work in a self-directed way in a fast moving environment Strong communication skills on technical topics and/or a willingness to learn  About you: You’re passionate about being part of a successful high growth tech company You want to make an impact and aren’t looking for a cookie cutter 9-5pm You're a builder, problem solver and have a growth mindset You seek a company that allows you to drive your own success and development You’re hungry to learn, crave opportunity and ownership  Trace is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications from all qualified individuals without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age, national origin, marital status, citizenship, disability, or veteran status.

What makes ThoughtSpot a great place to work?  To make our dent in the universe, we seek employees with unique identities, backgrounds, and perspectives that want to build an inclusive, respectful company culture and truly challenge the status quo. We are very deliberate about building a culture focused on #selfless-excellence, continuous learning and improvement (#2%done) achieved through #diversity (#balanceforbetter) and #inclusion.  What is the role?  Vice President, Commercial Sales - REMOTE, USA  Reporting directly to our WW SVP of Global Sales, the VP Commercial Sales will lead the fastest growing segment of ThoughtSpot's sales business. Under a year old, the Commercial Sales team's mission is to win new business within "digital native," and <500 employee companies. ThoughtSpot's move to the cloud and excellent partnerships in the CDW (cloud data warehouse) ecosystem has accelerated our success in these categories; making this a high potential, high priority, and high velocity opportunity. Your charter as VP will be to drive success across the "3 Rs:" Recruit, Retain, Revenue. Pipeline generation is the lifeblood for the Commercial team, so our VP will embrace and motivate teams to ensure prospecting is at the core. The VP will be a ThoughtSpot evangelist and recruiter of talent, as this team has plans to grow by 3x in the next 18 months.  What You'll Do A 2nd line leader, you'll grow and manage ThoughtSpot's Commercial Sales team Ensure the team builds a balanced business with healthy pipeline and new logo wins, driving YoY growth Define and implement plans for the team to exceed sales objectives Drive revenue growth through a combination of outbound prospecting, inbound calls, and AE sourced pipeline, with an extreme focus on new logo acquisition, skilled at both velocity and strategic sales cycles, strategic account planning, cross selling new products/use cases to existing customers Recruit top talent and work with Talent Acquisition to build Commercial sales candidate pipeline Coach and develop sales talent, executing with discipline and cadence Participate in critical decisions as a member of the sales leadership team Build a strong cross-functional operating cadence with teams around pipeline, forecasting, deal review, execution, deployment and revenue realization Accurate reporting on sales activity and forecasting to senior sales management Actively foster an environment of teamwork, transparency, creativity, and continuous improvement. Create and execute strategic and creative demand generation activities Engage at C-level in enterprise customer organizations What You Bring Experience managing managers 10+ years of experience in B2B Enterprise Sales, with a track record of attainment 5+ years of building and leading high-performance SaaS B2B sales team A consistent track record of leading teams to exceed quotas and objectives Ability to work well individually and across functional teams, including geographically dispersed teams Outstanding management and reporting on track sales metrics, CRM hygiene, and forecasting Superb communication and presentation skills; able to communicate at the C-level A reputation as a great leader, and someone people love working for Willingness to travel as needed throughout the region What Will Set You Apart Bachelors degree, MBA a plus Domain experience within Analytics, Business Intelligence, or Data Warehousing About ThoughtSpot:  ThoughtSpot is on a mission to make the world more fact-driven. ThoughtSpot is the Modern Analytics Cloud company, revolutionizing how the world uses data. Our platform makes it 1000x times easier for anyone to analyze data, find insights, and take actions through the power of search and AI. With experienced leadership like CEO Sudheesh Nair, who took Nutanix public in the largest tech IPO of 2016, and backed by more than $550M in funding, we’re well on our way to transforming what’s possible in the world of data. Come join us!  To all recruitment agencies: ThoughtSpot does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias, ThoughtSpot employees, or any other organization location. ThoughtSpot nor its employees are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.
