description: Senior Vice President Sales  Location: Chicago  Salary: $280K basic with full executive package and 100% bonus.  CSG Global Talent have partnered with a private equity backed food group who manufacture and supply a range of Branded meat free / Alternative protein products for a variety of markets in North America.  Due to major planned growth, they have restructured the E/SLT and are looking to appoint a Senior Vice President Sales.  The Role:  Reporting directly to the Chief Executive Officer you will design and deliver the sales strategy to increase profitable revenue streams across all North American food channels, working closely alongside ELT peers and customers/ 3rd parties to ensure group growth and joint business plans are achieved. You will have full responsibility for commercial performance, revenue & category management and be expected to input your knowledge/ experience across all areas of the business during a period of major transformation and growth. Will lead and mentor a national team with initially 7 direct reports, however, will have wider responsibility over building and shaping the team/ function for future growth. Will represent the business across various platforms including directly managing key product launch initiatives with customers.  The Person:  Degree educated with extensive experience leading a successful sales function in a relevant branded food category and the ability to prove you can increase commercial performance in the United States. Experience in branded/ private label protein/ chilled foods would be highly advantageous. Commercially astute with the ability to take on broader functional leadership roles where required; you will be keen to use your broad branded food industry & customer expertise to advise on best practice across all areas of business. A solid understanding of and experience leading joint business initiatives and ideally, experience setting and exceeding goals through collaborative/ long term agreements.  Should you wish further detail or to arrange a time to discuss this role please feel free to contact us.

Harris Tea is looking for a Regional Sales Manager to join the Food Service Business. This position will call on national, regional, and independent broadline foodservice distributors as well as regional chain operators in the western US market. The position will be based in southern California, preferably in the Los Angeles area.  The Regional Sales Manager will report to Trevor McSwain - Distribution Sales Manager.  Responsibilities and Duties ·        Bring new distributor and regional chain business on board. ·        Increase business with existing distribution customers. ·        Develop product and support solutions for new and existing customers. ·        Leverage Harris Tea Foodservice capabilities to develop private label product lines for qualified customers. ·        Manage the regional broker team to support existing customers and open new sales opportunities.  Qualifications ·        Education level – Bachelor’s Degree (business, marketing, foodservice management or communications preferred) ·        Foodservice and/or beverage sales experience preferred. ·        Specific skills: ·        Ability to work new opportunities through the sales cycle, including identifying new opportunities, presenting products and solutions, overcoming objections, and closing sales. ·        Proficient in MS Office applications ·        Experience utilizing a CRM system ·        Outstanding communication skills both verbal and written ·        Excellent presentation skills ·        Self-Starter ·        Ability to adjust quickly to changing a changing business environment ·        Team Player  Diversity & Inclusion We believe that different perspectives and backgrounds are what make a company flourish. All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, economic status, disability, age, or any other legally protected characteristics. Charlton Morris is delighted to be working with a family owned & operated senior living provider in the West on their search for a Vice President Sales & Marketing.  This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization who are dedicated to growing their portfolio through new developments & intelligent acquisition opportunities.  The ideal applicant will have extensive experience in leading the sales & marketing of senior living portfolios across multiple states, the expectation is to hit the ground running, therefore requires a driven individual who can work autonomously when needed.  The overall culture of the organization leadership revolves around collaboration, integrity & excellence, the role will work directly with the CEO & COO with an emphasis on driving census, developing local marketing campaigns, and designing best sales practice for brand new developments.  There is no relocation requirement, however you will be ideally located in AZ/CA as the role will involve extensive travel across the western states, flexibility in travel will be a key element to the success of the position.  The role comes with a competitive base salary and significant bonus potential, across the company there is a merit philosophy which drives an incentive driven culture.   Please reach out to me directly for further information on the position and next steps // nathan.riley@medical-cm.com

At AURA Devices, we're building products that help amateur and professional athletes to push their limits and go beyond. We're a team of professionals that make new instruments to track, analyze, and improve your fitness performance. Our state-of-the-art core technology of bioimpedance analysis provides information about hydration levels and body composition changes.  We're looking for an experienced leader who’ll drive our Sales department to a new level. An ideal candidate has experience in building a sales team, working in various channels and ability to achieve extraordinary results.   Key Responsibilities: Responsible for Sales Department; Grow AURA's sales program with a focus on empowering AURA Devices' brand at the retail partners; Identify potential Retail partners that will support our sales growth; Set-up and manage sales strategy along with Marketing and Sales teams; Create and implement an efficient bonus program for the entire Sales team; Close communication with Manufacturing team to utilize sales strategy and optimize stock levels;  Align the sales organization's objectives with business strategy through strategic planning, sales strategy development, forecasting, sales resource planning, and budgeting; Partner with the Support team to assist in chargeback investigations; Oversee trade show operations as needed; Occasional travel required.  Requirements: You have more than 5 years of significant experience in Retail, DTC, or Digital sales. Experience in young consumer electronics brands would be an advantage;  Experience in working with Big-box (BestBuy, Target, etc.) and Speciality (Apple Store, APR, etc.) retailers; Strong business management skills; Knowledge of current trends in high-tech fitness; Brilliant communication skills; Exceptional executive leadership, coaching, and motivational skills;   Benefits: Competitive salary, bonuses, and equity; Health insurance; Flexible working hours; Work from home option; Mac or PC for doing your job; All AURA products of your own.

Make your mark  At Clorox, we build big brands that make everyday life better, every day. We value our differences, and challenge each other to think and act boldly. We try new things, succeed, fail and keep learning. We work hard, and have busy personal lives. And we’re all able to make a positive impact – at Clorox, in our communities, and in the lives of millions of people who invite us into their homes. Make your mark and help us drive Good Growth – growth that is profitable, sustainable and responsible.  Job Overview/Summary  Area Sales Manager in the Ahold/Delhaize USA Team. We're open to candidates located in the Southern US States and East Coast US States  Key Responsibilities  This is an Area Sales Manager position within the Ahold/Delhaize USA Team with a focus on selling Burt's Bees, VMS, and Brita products.  In this role, you will:  Drive product volume for the Ahold/Delhaize USA Team.  Develop innovative selling strategies.  Partner with our broker, Crossmark to accelerate market impact and drive winning results.  Key Skills, Abilities, Experience And Education Required  Analytical skills  Sales background  Brand, Category, and retail customer knowledge is also a plus.  More About Sales  Our high-performance team is responsible for the merchandising, assortment, pricing and shelving of our products. We use our extensive understanding of consumers, product categories and markets to help grow our retail customers’ businesses, drive profits and increase our consumer base.  More About Clorox  The Clorox Company (NYSE: CLX) is a leading multinational manufacturer and marketer of consumer and professional products with approximately 8,800 employees worldwide and fiscal year 2020 sales of $6.7 billion. Clorox markets some of the most trusted and recognized consumer brand names, including its namesake bleach and cleaning products; Pine-Sol® cleaners Liquid-Plumr® clog removers Poett® home care products Fresh Step® cat litter Glad® bags, wraps and containers Kingsford® charcoal Hidden Valley® dressings and sauces Brita® water-filtration products; Burt's Bees® natural personal care products RenewLife® digestive health products Rainbow Light®, Natural Vitality™ and NeoCell® dietary supplements. The company also markets industry-leading products and technologies for professional customers, including those sold under the CloroxPro™ and Clorox Healthcare® brand names. Nearly 80% of the company's sales are generated from brands that hold the No. 1 or No. 2 market share positions in their categories.  Please apply directly to our job postings and do not submit your resume to any person via text message. Clorox does not conduct text-based interviews and encourages you to be cautious of anyone posing as Clorox recruiters via unsolicited texts during these uncertain times.

jobTitle: Primary Care Sales Specialist / Senior – CRM – Austin – Remote
description: Job Description  Over 200 new sales positions are being added to our Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolism team. At Novartis we are committed to reducing the global burden of cardiovascular, renal, and metabolic diseases on patients, families, and their communities. We are focused on developing solutions targeting heart failure (acute and chronic), atherosclerosis, metabolic and renal diseases with the aim of improving quality of life for patients all over the world.  We are Novartis.  Join us and help reimagine medicine!  Job Purpose:  The Primary Care Specialist / Senior will build and execute business plans to meet sales goals for territory, and drive territory sales performance, market share and optimal resource utilization. The Primary Care Specialist / Senior will develop effective professional business relationships with customers that support delivery of business results across a range of therapeutic areas and differentiate Novartis as a leader in therapeutic areas.  This is a remote opportunity.  Your Key Responsibilities: Executes business plans and drives achievement of sales targets for assigned territory, customers or therapeutic area. Develops and applies understanding of customer organizations and networks and of diverse influences that affect customer decisions (e.g. peer relationships). Executes call plans for customers, including medical experts from customer or academic communities; calls on the right person to deliver the right message with the right frequency. Ensures that Novartis products and supporting services are broadly understood and available to more patients and customers. Deploys and uses approved Marketing and Sales promotional materials and programs; runs direct promotion programs and facilitates pull-through activities. Uses expert knowledge of Novartis products and of a range of therapy areas to build professional customer relationships and to support sound clinical discussions. Serve as a resource to assist with providing both proactive and reactive education and support regarding NPC CRM access programs as needed for community practices, medical groups and facilities, and their staff. Triage to franchise counterparts as appropriate. Proactively provide education and support on NPC CRM access programs for community practices, medical groups and facilities, and their staff Serve as a resource and/or assist with providing support for resolving customer/account questions regarding coverage, access, and reimbursement, where appropriate. Triage appropriate inquiries, including patient-specific inquiries, to FRM and/or other franchise counterparts as directed by NPC policy and procedure. Develop compliant customer-centric support strategies and proactively communicate payer policy criteria related to NPC CRM products   Integrity & Compliance: Adherence and accountability to NPC policies including policies regarding appropriate Medical / Commercial interactions, Code of Ethics, and all applicable laws and regulations. Works to ensure a diverse and inclusive environment free from all forms of discrimination and harassment. Ethical achievement of sales and revenue targets.   EEO Statement  The Novartis Group of Companies are Equal Opportunity Employers and take pride in maintaining a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.  Minimum Requirements  What You’ll Bring to the Role: Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in Life Sciences, Pharmacy, or business-related field). Minimum two years of successful sales experience (preferably business to business sales experience). Demonstrated outstanding discernment and business planning skills. Effective problem solving and decision-making skills. Exceptional ability to develop and sustain customer relationships. Proven track-record to collaborate and work cross functionally with internal and external partners. This is a remote position that will cover Key Accounts in the assigned region. Candidate must be based within that region or within a reasonable daily commuting distance. Ability to travel 60-80% over a broad geography is required, with the ability to drive and/or fly within the territory. No relocation available.   Preferred Qualifications: Experience across therapeutic groups, disease states and new product launches. Understanding of managed care environments and account management strategy. Knowledge of buy-and-bill, access, reimbursement resources, and product acquisition. Experience working with established injection networks.   Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:  Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity, and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.  Division  PHARMA  Business Unit  US PHARMA  Country  USA  Work Location  Austin, TX  Company/Legal Entity  Novartis Pharmaceuticals  Functional Area  Sales  Job Type  Full Time  Employment Type  Regular  Shift Work  No  Early Talent  No

At Intuitive, we believe that minimally invasive care is life-enhancing care. Through ingenuity and intelligent technology, we expand the potential of physicians to heal without constraints. Our mission is our guiding force; our culture is the DNA that makes us unique.  As a pioneer in robotic-assisted surgery (RAS), we have been expanding our innovations through technology to help make a difference in the world. For 25 years, human ingenuity has guided our journey to help solve some of healthcare’s complex challenges.  We believe a great idea can come from anywhere—inclusion and mutual respect are vital to our culture. We value character grounded in integrity, a strong capacity to learn, the energy to get things done, and diverse experiences to help us think in new ways. We actively invest in our team members to support their long-term growth so they can continue to advance our mission and strive to achieve their highest potential.  Join a team committed to taking big leaps forward for a global community of healthcare professionals and their patients.  Together, let’s help to advance the world of minimally invasive care.  Primary Function Of Position Work with the Clinical Sales Manager to develop a strategy to drive utilization of the da Vinci® Surgical System Become a da Vinci® Surgery expert across all primary surgical specialties in order to support the development of surgical robotics programs in the assigned territory Support field efforts to achieve quarterly sales goals Support regional Sales and Marketing development events that create system awareness and procedure adoption Train and develop OR staff to be facile in pre, intra and postoperative system management  Develop a da Vinci® Surgery plan for each surgical team to insure they are capable of using the system independently within a reasonable time frame Drive utilization of the da Vinci® system by working with surgical teams to select appropriate procedure applications Drive continuous expansion of the user base by working with key hospital staff and surgeon thought leaders to develop a qualified lead funnel Drive sales of instruments and accessories  Responsibly manage administrative tasks; reporting of sales/procedures, outcomes of sales activities, submission of expense reports, etc. Lead surgical teams through training sessions, helping them understand system operations, OR integration and da Vinci® Surgery applications Be a resource to the surgical team, providing guidance and insight on the use of the da Vinci® Surgical System Skills, Experience, Education, & Training Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required Minimum of two years prior sales experience Proven record of achievement and leadership Ambition and strong work ethic Ability to excel in a high-energy, fast-paced environment Excellent interpersonal skills and persuasive communication skills Proven ability to work effectively as part of a team Ability to travel up to 25%, and work nights and weekends as needed Due to the nature of our business and the role, please note that Intuitive and/or your customer(s) may require that you show current proof of vaccination against certain diseases including COVID-19. Details can vary by role.  Intuitive is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. We provide equal employment opportunities to all qualified applicants and employees, and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type, without regard to race, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, color, age, religion, protected veteran or disability status, genetic information or any other status protected under federal, state, or local applicable laws.  We will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accordance with fair chance laws.  Shift : Shift 1 - Day  Travel : Yes, 25 % of the Time  214379

Local Candidates only, no remote options  JOB SUMMARY: As the Director of Store Sales Operations, you will lead the overall internal store sales and client delivery operations for VinFast US in Northern California, managing multiple teams to ensure that client orders are managed, as well as successfully delivered. The Sales Operations function is made of several teams responsible for developing and executing processes that enable the sale and delivery of VinFast US vehicles to consumers.   RESPONSIBILITIES & KEY ACTIVITIES: Vehicle Fleet and Delivery – develop and manage car flows in a direct to consumer model to ensure production orders are placed and vehicles are moving through the supply chain to meet delivery schedules Purchase verification and vehicle registration – processing of purchase documentation and registration of vehicles in compliance with local DMV policies Sales systems administration – operational support and expertise of core sales systems, supporting headquarters and VinFast store locations in conjunction with IT Sales Planning and Analysis – creating custom analyses to understand performance against KPIs, evaluation of competitiveness versus the market, and development of standard reporting of sales activities Collaborate with other functions and areas of the business to ensure a seamless client sales experience and remove friction points (Inside Sales, Regional Sales, B2B Sales) Monitor employee productivity against targets for KPIs tied to overall sales and company performance Develop performance summaries and action plans for presentations to executives as necessary Support requests from VinFast Vietnam and other functional areas as required Train and mentor new team members Explore opportunities for continuous improvement of the sales and purchase experience for VinFast US clients  MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS: Bachelor’s Degree preferred 8+ years of progressive work experience in automotive OEM operations Experience managing teams as part of larger functional role in automotive Proven track record of success in achieving operational targets Automotive electric vehicle (EV) experience a plus Experience in a start-up environment or with new product launches a plus Excellent communication, writing and presentation skills Strong relationship, team building and leadership skills with ability to communicate and manage well at all levels of the organization High levels of attention to detail and organization Proficiency in business productivity tools and software (MS Office Suite, Salesforce, CRM applications) Strong analytical skills Demonstrated ability to build strong relationships with US executive leadership, internal stakeholders, peers, and external partners   Vinfast is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy and gender identity), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, genetic information, age, membership in an employee organization, retaliation, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor. All employment is decided based on qualifications, merit and business need.

The Regional Sales Director, reporting to the Vice President of Sales and Marketing, has the role of management and direction of the sales team to achieve revenue and profit goals. Evaluates and implements appropriate new sales techniques to increase the region's sales volume. May recommend product or service enhancements to improve customer satisfaction and sales potential. Subject matter expert leading and coordinating the commercial processes across the region footprint. This individual is responsible for workflows including proposals/bids, contract negotiation, and compliance with contract commitments and commercial risk assessment. This individual will work closely with regional Operations leaders, regional sales teams, and corporate administrative functions to ensure the overall team's function meets Thompson Industrial Services' strategy and criteria for quotation execution while meeting/exceeding customer's needs and expectations.  Primary Duties And Responsibilities Personal Conduct Conduct himself/herself at all times in a way that is professional and is aligned with Thompson Industrial Service, LLC values. Consistently ensure that business is always conducted with honesty and integrity. People Development Sales Competency Assess and improve the skill of the sales team with regards to communication, time management, strategic thinking, presentation and proposal development and delivery, and other criteria critical to driving improved Revenue, Net Contribution, and EBITDA Business Acumen Assess and improve sales team's understanding of the critical parameters that impact Job Profitability as measured by Net Contribution to EBITDA. Utilize Net Contribution principles to accurately estimate the margin generation of each Job proposal allowing for more precise pricing relative to the highest possible market price at which a Job can be won. Personnel Career Development Develop technical competency matrix and work with Regional/Corporate Leadership to implement training & development plans. Remain actively engaged with sales team to ensure understanding of each person's personal career aspirations and assist each team member to develop a Personal Development Plan to facilitate their own growth. Strategy Development Understand and contribute to the strategic plan of the company Work closely with the VP of Sales & Marketing to develop and execute a commercial sales strategy to drive increased Revenue and Net Contribution $ within his/her Region. Strategy Implementation/Execution Customer relationship development Proactively visit existing and future customers to assess and gain selling opportunities. Build sustainable relationships with both customers and operations. Manage and evaluate customer concerns by meeting with the customer and communicating with operations to rectify as needed. Manage the execution of contractual agreements with customers to ensure compliance. Proposal process ownership Oversee Job proposal development to ensure all significant risks (T&Cs, Safety, Execution, etc.) are identified, communicated, and mitigated prior to customer submission. Responsible for understanding services offered by Thompson Industrial Services and its competitors, and developing proposals focused on winning business at the highest possible market price with acceptable Net Contribution $. Results Communication Proactively engage with Operations to ensure seamless transition and execution of awarded work. Complete sales forecasts and sales activity reports, including TIS CRM tools in a timely manner. Report any quality issues to the appropriate leadership. Deliver proposal metrics dashboards to measure KPI's. Primary Performance Metrics Revenue $ and Net Contribution $ generation and growth Personnel development and retention Safety Education and Experience Bachelor's degree required Master's degree preferred and/or equivalent work experience required 10 years or more of commercial and technical experience related to services in an industrial setting.

Sales Support Representative  Position Summary: Sirius Federal, LLC, a subsidiary of Sirius Computer Solutions, Inc., is looking for an ENTRY level Sales Support Representative. You will be responsible for growing underdeveloped accounts buy quoting a high volume of RFQs, and developing relationships with manufacturers, distributors, and government procurement personnel.   Primary Duties and Responsibilities: ·      Efficiently and accurately respond to government quote requests ·      Receive and process orders in the system ·      Support teammates with quoting and processing orders ·      Identify and research new vendor relationships and customer opportunities ·      Utilize all internal and external resources, take initiative to drive sales results ·      Collaborate with internal departments such as Order Processing, Contracts and Partner Alliances ·      Align with vendor partners for opportunities to increase margin and chance of win on specific RFQs ·      Develop customer relationships through prospecting, email and market intelligence ·      Perform customer service duties as needed to properly support your customer ·      Research products and pricing from multiple vendors to increase margins. ·      Utilize vendor partner portals and registration rules of engagement to facilitate quote activity.  Basic Qualifications: ·      Bachelor’s degree (preferred) or equivalent related experience ·      Driven and energetic professional with strong desire to work in a fast-paced sales organization ·      Self-motivated with desire to win and be successful  Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills  Other Position Requirements: ·      Yearly quota and weekly metric attainment Detailed oriented and can work independently Understand basic sales motions Scheduled hours Monday – Friday 8:30AM-5:30PM EST   Data Privacy and Security ·      All Sirius Federal employees are responsible to safeguard the information and information systems that they use or handle in the execution of their duties. Employees are obligated to know and perform their duties in accordance with Sirius Federal policies, standards, and procedures related to security and report security violations to the appropriate Sirius Federal authority. ·      Participate at hire and annually in the Information Security Awareness training as well as other required training identified by the Human Resources department. Other data privacy and data security related regulatory training may be required based on your role or assignment. The above primary duties, responsibilities, and position requirements are not all inclusive. Serving federal agencies since 1991, Sirius Federal has a wealth of knowledge and resources to offer best practice solutions that achieve optimal outcomes and meet compliance guidelines. Together with our parent company Sirius Computer Solutions, Inc., we offer a comprehensive range of solutions backed by an expert team of engineers and the highest levels of partnership with leading manufacturers. From design to deployment, support, and maintenance, our technology solutions and services are designed with a constant focus on supporting our customers’ missions. We prioritize your success – and we don’t succeed unless you do. Sirius Federal is a Cisco Gold Partner, Dell Technologies GSA Authorized Partner, F5 Platinum Partner, IBM Platinum Business Partner, NetApp Star Partner, Nutanix Master Partner, Palo Alto Networks Diamond Partner, Splunk Elite Partner, Tenable Platinum Partner, and VMware Premier Partner. Sirius Federal is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. As a government contractor, Sirius Federal takes affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans; maintains a drug-free workplace; and participates in E-Verify.  Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

description: B2B Sales Manager  Full-time Sales Position  This position is ideal for someone looking to join a young, fast growing consumer brand with the ability to work remotely and bring innovative and amazing products to business customers.    The B2B Sales Manager will be responsible for leading business sales efforts by generating leads, closing sales opportunities and managing ongoing business relationships. This position requires an aggressive sales mentality and is ideal for someone who enjoys the “chase” and closing deals.  This individual must be an enthusiastic and energetic team player who thrives in a self-motivated environment.    Responsibilities include:  Generating leads for new business customers and securing an audience with key purchasing decision makers.   Create strategies for business sales that complement our consumer segment. Managing segment P&L to maximize B2B sales in a profitable way. Drives forecasting and inventory planning with operations. Collaborate and contribute to product development to continue to deliver innovation. Consistent communication with management regarding strategy, progress, and opportunities.  Requirements:   2+ years experience in sales  (Consumer products industry is ideal) B2B sales experience preferred with an established network of business contacts Self-starter with limited daily oversight and ability to proactively generate sales opportunities Strong formal and informal communication, presentation, and sales skills Exceptional organization and prioritization skills Proficient in Google/Microsoft Office Apps Travel will be necessary  This will be a salaried position with substantial performance bonus opportunity, plus fully paid health insurance.   Please reply directly to this ad or email resume to todd@workylife.com.

VP of Sales We are a national, innovative, high-growth software company devoted to K12 education administration. Our products beat the competition by focusing on all business operations of K12 schools, including both financial and school nutrition management. We have a deep understanding of K12 school systems and regulations, with a focus on providing creative, integrated and user-friendly solutions supported by excellent customer service. Our workforce is talented, loyal, dedicated and highly enthusiastic. This is a fantastic career opportunity for the right individual. Where else can you play beach volleyball and work for a leading tech company? CULTUREWe offer challenging work in a team environment. We respect each other and collaborate for continuous improvement. We are the experts in our product lines and we anticipate the needs of our customers. Our customers say we work efficiently and always strive to provide the proper solution. We have achieved this by building relationships based upon: expertise, patience, attentiveness, clear positive communication, tenacity, and a calm presence. BASIC FUNCTIONWe are seeking a VP of Sales who has experience managing B2B SaaS and leading experienced Sales teams in driving growth and profitability across the Nutrition portfolio! This person will oversee and direct the sales function for our Nutrition Sales team, while tracking and managing given client relationships. This person must be capable of quickly learning new business domains as well as working in a team environment. You must be passionate about delivering high quality, maintainable software to the our schools! KEY TRAITSTechnical Excellence: A passion for creating cutting edge software through application of best engineering practicesA successful candidate must bring a track record of success in launching, growing and scaling SaaS products with hands-on experience in data driven funnel, LCV and retention tuning, as well as SaaS product pricing and tieringContinuous Improvement: A self-driven desire to find better ways to accomplish thingsTeamwork: A commitment to working as part of a team to achieve optimal results The Vice-President, Nutrition Sales leads LINQ's nutrition sales teams, including field sales representatives, inside sales representatives, solution engineers, and sales associates. Responsible for more than $10M in SaaS bookings, this position is critical to the success of the company and requires a leader that can recruit and retain top talent, manage to metrics, and most importantly, deliver results.The position reports to the Chief Revenue Officer and has six managers as direct reports. Understanding, aligning, communicating, and training on key differentiators is critically important and requires the leader to roll up their sleeves and get deep into the value of the solutions. RESPONSIBILITIES:Align the team on key value drivers and ensure all members of the team understand and can communicate those differentiatorsEstablish and enhance metrics for measuring the performance of various groups within the team as well as the performance of the team as a whole, including leading indicators such as activities, pipeline generation (with lead source), pipeline velocity, and close rateIdentify competitors in the market using data from salesforce (loss reason and loss competitor) and develop strategies to beat themAnalyze performance data to drive improvements through methods, procedures, and trainingActively and consistently support all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer experienceManage deal desk requests, big deal review, RFP analysis, and the QBR process for the nutrition sales teamResponsible for the budget process, including managing team expenditures and remaining within budget guidelines.REQUIREMENTS AND QUALIFICATIONS:Proven track record in leading SaaS sales teams, as measured by performance against quotaStrong business planning and forecasting skillsStrong analytic, organizational, and problem-solving skillsBachelor's or Master's degreeSaaS experience requiredSalesforce report knowledge preferredK-12 education experience preferred, but not requiredLINQ is committed to finding overlooked or underappreciated candidates that are ready to exceed expectations EOE STATEMENT: We are an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

About Us We are The Search Monitor (www.thesearchmonitor.com), and since 2007 we have been providing competitive market research data to advertisers running online search campaigns, affiliate marketing programs, and online shopping campaigns worldwide. We are beloved by some of the world’s largest brands and agencies, who rely on our insights to power their global marketing campaigns. Headquartered in Orlando Florida, we seek a remote-working US-based sales superstar to join our ranks and take our message to targeted audiences in North America.  The Role As part of exciting growth in 2021 we are searching for a high-energy, driven sales professional with an understanding of the digital marketing landscape to be our next Sales Development Representative (SDR). As a remote-working employee within the Sales team, you’ll find a team of dynamic and adaptable individuals who are passionate in hunting new business and introducing our product with the intention of helping companies to grow and drive revenue. You’ll be a natural fit, helping us drive meetings with prospective clients, qualifying opportunities, and hunting for the next opportunity.  As an SDR you will Book outbound meetings through a combination of calls, emails, social outreach, networking and independent research Engage with prospects and articulate the product in an effective manner Deliver highly relevant marketing content to prospects Lead efforts in building sustainable processes, and procedures Managed and qualify assigned inbound leads, using correct practices Maintain a positive mind-set irrespective of any challenging situations Provide accurate product information and solutions based upon prospect use cases Schedule meetings between the qualified prospects and an Account Executive Updating our CRM to ensure the team is working with consistent and accurate information  The requirements for this role are Bachelor’s degree or above Evidence of overachievement 1-2 years of sales experience Ability to articulate with strong written and verbal communication skills Self-motivated, proactive, flexible Uses initiative when challenged Willingness to learn core technology tools Good time-management A passion for sales  The benefits we offer are Remote Working Competitive Salary  Profit sharing Disability & Health Insurance  If this role and opportunity sounds like one that is perfect for you please apply with a copy of your resume and a covering letter.

Graduate Hotels®, is seeking a Director of Sales to join Graduate Fayetteville and its wonderful team of hospitality enthusiasts.      Graduate Hotels creates authentic, playful spaces that connect a community’s travelers, students, and locals. Through thoughtfully curated design, creative F&B and community-focused events, we create hotels worthy of their hometown.    We are a diverse team of experience makers and storytellers. As a Graduate Hotels team member, you are the local insider shaping guest experiences. Our goal is to make every guest feel like a local even if it's their first time in town. In order to help you deliver on that goal, we encourage our team members to embody the same mindset as our guests through Graduate experiences and encouraged community exploration.     JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES   Maintain and promote a teamwork environment with effective and clear communication amongst co-workers through positive leadership   Provide pricing and guidance recommendations to sales staff, review and approve any special corporate negotiated rates   Develop a working knowledge of the operations of the hotel, including food and beverage, guest services, reservations   Develop a complete knowledge and ensure adherence to company sales policies and SOPs   Drive customer loyalty to grow share of the account by delivering service excellence throughout each customer experience   Provide guidance for RFP Season Annually to National Sales with the help from GM and/or Regional DOS & National Sales   Ensure all pertinent aspects of solicitation, closing, and customer communications are complete and documented for the team   Identify and pursue new and repeat business through prospecting calls, visits, site tours, lunches, and networking events   Develop and maintain market awareness to ensure ability to predict revenue opportunities and set proactive strategies   Analyze sales and revenue management reports to identify trends and future demand opportunities Monitor pricing, MAR and other minimums to ensure pricing is within an acceptable range based on available inventory, current sales/revenue strategies and market demand   Participates in forecasting for revenue and expenses   Conduct ongoing competitor price and product analysis to ensure proper rate positioning and product offering relative to competition   Conducts weekly and monthly share analysis for measurement of hotels market performance versus competition and implements strategies accordingly in conjunction with the Regional Director of Sales, Regional Director of Revenue Management, GM   Recommend and implement new sales programs at the hotel and accurately track ROI   Initiates collateral and online marketing efforts to include all printed sales collateral, direct mail, discount promotions, e-mail marketing, website presence and tracks ROI on all advertising and marketing spend   Prepares annual marketing/business and budget plans   Set and monitor team member goals including weekly sales activities, room night and revenue goals monthly, quarterly, yearly   Abides by Prime Time Selling hours   Perform any other job-related duties as assigned    EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE  Minimum of Bachelor's Degree in Hotel Administration, Business, or Marketing   Minimum of 5 years in progressive hotel sales with leadership responsibilities    KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES  Strong analytical skills relative to impact on hotel revenues   Ability to communicate effectively verbally and in writing   Strong interpersonal skills   Strong understanding of revenue management principles   Proficient in Microsoft Office Products, focus on Excel, Word and Outlook  Ability to travel as needed   Must have flexible work hours that may include evenings, weekends, and holidays    About Graduate Hotels®  Graduate Hotels is a hand-crafted collection of hotels that reside in dynamic university-anchored towns across the country. Each hotel pays homage to the heritage of its unique town through cultural nods to the local community. Launched in 2014, there are currently 28 hotels across the U.S. and an additional seven hotels set to open by the end of 2021. Graduate Hotels is owned by Adventurous Journeys (AJ) Capital Partners, a vertically integrated real estate developer, owner and operator. For more information on Graduate Hotels, please visit www.graduatehotels.com.   *Graduate Hotels is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

Who we are... AvantStay delivers exceptional, unique stays for group travelers. The company has built a tech-enabled millennial hospitality brand to be the new standard for group experience. We are venture funded and growing rapidly in the explosive $100+ billion dollar STR industry.  What we are looking for… A high energy Sales Development Representative (SDR) who will discover and qualify opportunities and be instrumental in driving strategic partnerships to source opportunities and rapidly grow our presence across the country. You will also develop content relevant to potential clients, support go-to-market activities, promote targeted campaigns and cultivate in-person trade show lead acquisitions.  What you’ll do… Drive outbound calls through the development of our CRM Work with the team to research, identify and analyze potential properties across the country Drive initiatives to grow our team’s pipeline, identifying both new verticals that support growth Work closely with internal departments in order to understand internal processes, business parameters, and what makes a property perform; use this information to continuously improve strategy, roadmap, and prioritization Establish and foster excellent working relationships with all property owners, AvantStay staff, and key vendors in key markets  Manage a complex pipeline with exceptional time management and calendaring skills  What you’ll bring... 2+ years experience in a related role or within the real estate industry A proven track record of working with high-performing teams that consistently deliver and exceed revenue goals Bachelor’s degree in a related field. Knowledge of the real estate sector, travel trends or the short-term/vacation rental market Licensed Real Estate salesperson a plus An innate desire to excel: speaking to people, building relationships, setting and exceeding targets, and a general hunger for more The ability to handle rejection and keep going, nothing gets in the way of the person we’re looking for, for every problem there’s a solution Exceptional communication skills with the ability to quickly demonstrate value and build strong relationships, both outside and within the organization, with a clear bias for action  Perks and Benefits... Compensation: $70,000+, (base + uncapped commission) Benefits and Unlimited Paid Time Off Team bonding and off-site events Complimentary and discount stays at AvantStay properties  When you join AvantStay…  You’ll be doing work that matters alongside an experienced and dynamic team, transforming the way people travel and vacation. Your place within the colossal travel and real estate industries will leave you with a wealth of opportunities to feel both challenged to innovate and rewarded for your efforts. Of course, we will offer you pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. AvantStay is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at AvantStay.   Equal Employment Opportunity... We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.

Coffey Medical, a manufacturer’s rep firm for Philips Healthcare, is hiring a Territory Sales Representative to be based in Texas.  OPPORTUNITY: As our Territory Sales Rep, you will cover the Texas, Oklahoma, Arkansas, Louisiana and Mississippi markets. Develop new business for Philips Healthcare's cardiograph and stress test product line by using your professional sales talents to call on leads provided and an extensive database of prospects and established customers.  Based in the Texas territory, you will use traditional inside and outside sales strategies to close new business with viable prospects (Department Managers in hospitals and Business Managers in hospital owned physician practices.) Using advanced technology sales tools, build a robust sales pipeline through your disciplined sales activity.  Reporting to the President/Sales Manager, you will receive coaching, mentoring, and product training along with world-class sales skill training. This is an existing territory with established customers and a funnel of opportunities already established achieving $2 million in sales this year. Two thirds of the sales in this territory are derived from servicing existing accounts. This is a highly technical position requiring the ability to understand medical terminology as well as how our equipment interacts with hospital software solutions.  KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES: Meet and exceed all sales goals. Develop new business by regularly calling on hospitals in your multi-state territory. Develop leads from other Philips reps and Philips marketing efforts. Deliver sales presentations to key prospects and convert prospects to customers by moving opportunities to closure. Maintain CRM database of existing, new, and potential customers using SalesForce and recording sales activity daily. Participate in weekly sales meetings.  SUCCESS FACTORS: 3 years of outside sales experience with at least 2 years selling to hospitals practices. Ability to work well in a team environment. Ability to work well with a Fortune 500 size company and its reporting requirements Bachelor’s Degree required, preferably in sales, business, or similar field. Prefer experience selling medical devices software or diagnostic devices. Experience working and traveling a multi-state territory. 20-30% travel. Proven track record of success in generating your own leads, negotiating, and closing sales. Ability to work in a fast-paced, self-directed entrepreneurial environment. Highly proficient computer skills including Excel, Word, and Outlook. Avid user of CRM software solutions; experience with Salesforce is a plus! Excellent communication, organizational, time management, and follow up skills. Highly energetic, driven self-starter. Burning desire to earn $100k+ and willing to do what it takes to make it happen!  COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS: Coffey Medical will reward your talents with an attractive base salary of $40-60k, plus a lucrative quarterly and annual incentive commission/bonus plan. First year total compensation expected to be $100K+. Second year income expected to be $120K -150K+. There is no limit to compensation for star performers.   APPLY NOW: If you are a proven healthcare sales professional, we encourage you to apply online now.   COMPANY: Coffey Medical is a 30-year-old manufacturer representative and distributor of specialty medical device and software technology.  We market and sell to US hospitals and the out-of-hospital market. We handle sales for Philips Healthcare to all hospitals in 16 states for cardiograph and stress testing systems.   To learn more about Coffey Medical, please visit www.coffeymedical.com  Tammy Prehoda, HR Consultant Safari Solutions Search3@safarisolutions.com   Territory Sales / Sales Manager / Outside Sales / Inside Sales / Sales Professional / diagnostic / medical devices / business development / territory manager / sales representative / account executive / account manager / channel sales / EKG / cardiograph / medical device distributor / district manager / VP of sales / Director of Sales / healthcare / regional sales
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Machinery

description: BASIC FUNCTION:   Responsible for sales activities with assigned accounts in the Western Region focusing on the Food ingredients market segment. Manage business related activities with providing and supplying product offering to assigned customers.   RESPONSIBILITIES:  Present and sell Company products as well as represented distribution ingredients to current and potential clients.  Prepare action plans and schedules to identify specific targets and to project the number of contacts to be made.  Follow up on new leads and referrals resulting from field activity.  Identify sales prospects and develop new business with them. Prepare presentations, proposals and sales contracts.  Develop and maintain sales materials and current product knowledge.  Maintain and grow current and new business with clientele.    Prepare paperwork to activate and maintain contract services.  Manage account services through quality checks and other follow-up.  Identify and resolve client concerns.  Input business activities into Salesforce  Participate in marketing events such as trade shows.  Follow-up for collection of payment.  May provide on-the-job training to new sales employees. Other duties as assigned. Must possess the abilities to persuade and influence others, develop and deliver presentations, as well as compose and edit written materials. description: Dispatch Goods Restaurant Account Manager Full-Time  Dispatch Goods is looking to expand their sales team! If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, are passionate about sustainability and the circular economy, and love to close new business, we’d love to hear from you!  Dispatch Goods is a fast-growing Seed stage start-up that’s building the infrastructure for reusable packaging, starting with food delivery and take-out! With leadership from Berkeley Haas, Stanford, Doordash, Caviar, Apple, and Google, the team at Dispatch Goods is creating the market for reusable packaging. Early customers, which include MIXT, Google, Imperfect Foods, Good Eggs, and 40+ other Bay Area restaurants, have replaced over 200,000 items from the waste stream in less than a year.  The objective of the role is to assist in accelerating the strategic growth across restaurant partnerships to help Dispatch Goods reach its sales and partnerships goals.  This role will manage their own pipeline, targets and growth goals, reporting to the Head of Sales & Partnerships.   You're excited about this opportunity because you will… Shift restaurants to a more sustainable, more delightful packaging system Create a great first impression with merchants and build a pathway of qualified leads Lead the full sales cycle while closing transactions to attain new business from small to mid-size merchants Master email marketing automation tools to creatively engage prospects Make a high volume of cold calls (80+) and emails to prospects daily Closing is your favorite part of the sales process We're excited about you because… You have 2+ years of experience working in a high volume inside sales environment You are competitive --- our waste system is in crisis mode, and we need to accelerate solutions You have experience in Small - Medium (SMB) business to business sales You have managed a full sales cycle and have been in a closing or lead generation sales role You are genuinely curious about people, local businesses, and technology You have a dynamic personality with a customer-focused mindset You are creative, persistent and passionate about sales You can navigate sales and internal tools quickly (Hubspot, Asana, Dubb, Google) Why You'll Love Working at Dispatch Goods... We are defining an industry - Dispatch Goods is an early mover in an explosive space We <3 the Planet. So. Dang. Much. We all left careers in other sectors to specifically tackle this enormous challenge. We inspire each other. We are learning - We're not afraid to dig in and uncover the truth, even if it's scary or inconvenient. Everyone here is continually learning on the job, no matter if we've been in a role for one year or one minute. We are customer-obsessed. We are committed to our clients and connected through our vision of making reusables easy and delightful. We make mistakes, and encourage you to make mistakes as well - We are building something that doesn’t currently exist, so we are all learning in our roles. Taking risks is encouraged. Making mistakes is also encouraged.  Compensation:  Negotiable, a mix of salary & commission  Dispatch Goods Inc. (dispatchgoods.com) provides customers a simple and delightful circular system of reusable containers, helping to eliminate single-use foodware packaging, starting in San Francisco, with expansion plans nationally and worldwide.  This is an exciting opportunity to grow with an early stage start-up that is both disruptive and 100% sustainability/impact-driven. In August 2020, we graduated from UC Berkeley’s premier accelerator program, Skydeck followed by Techstars’ Food Tech program. In the past year, we have had strong market growth and adoption, both from the supply side (restaurant partners, catering companies, grocery providers & b2b strategic partnership) and the demand side (end consumers).  Press coverage has included Musings Mag, the San Francisco Chronicle and Fast Company.

Fluid Energy Group Ltd® along with its subsidiaries Fluid Norge™, Fluid USA™, Fluid Holland™, Fluid Luxembourg™, ScienePak™, SixRing™ and brand Triton Cleaning Products™ is a global chemical company specializing in the development and manufacture of environmentally responsible, low-hazard, technically advanced chemical systems focused in particular on the Oil & Gas, Life Sciences, Concrete and other industries with Modified Acid™ & Synthetic Acid™, Sanitizer & Disinfectant Systems and associated chemistries. Our goal is to promote the knowledge and application of safer, far more effective and technically advanced chemical systems to various interests, including all industry and regulators / governments worldwide.  Fluid has exciting plans for further growth including investing heavily in its intellectual property, as well as geographic and product / industry diversification. It promotes a culture of transparency, communication, and collaboration to ensure that continued growth does not hamper the high quality of service delivered to clients.  Summary The Field Sales Representative is a highly motivated self-starter that looks to achieve maximum sales profitability, growth and account penetration within an assigned territory and/or market segment, by effectively promoting and selling the company’s product lines and services.  Key Responsibilities Sell and promote products to both existing and potential clients. Perform needs analysis and cost-benefit analysis for clients. Establish and maintain positive business relationships with clients and customers. Assist with marketing strategies and expand the company to new markets. Cold calling potential clients. Coordinate sales efforts with other departments. Keep management informed by submitting activity and results reports, such as daily call reports, weekly work plans, and monthly and annual territory analysis. Monitor competition by gathering current marketplace information on pricing, products, new products, delivery schedules, branding techniques. Service existing accounts, obtain orders and establish new accounts by planning and organizing a daily work schedule to call on existing or potential sales outlets and other trade factors. Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational training; establishing personal networks. Develop and grow the commercial relationships of assigned leading industry customers while prospecting for new accounts to increase market penetration. Manage sales pipeline to drive new business opportunities to commercial success. Forecast sales to enable operations planning, introduce product innovations and maintain active memberships. Promotes/sells/secures orders from existing and prospective customers through a relationship-based approach. Demonstrates products and services to existing/potential customers and assists them in selecting those best suited to their needs.  Knowledge, Skills & Abilities A self-starter who takes an initiative approach, moves quickly and is capable of working within a continuously changing environment. Strong work ethic with a high energy level and can manage multiple tasks in a time-sensitive environment. Strong presentation and interpersonal skills; confident with the ability to deal persuasively with individuals both within and outside the company, via video conference call and phone. A driven, solutions-oriented individual who sets the standard and achieves results. Strong technical knowledge of product lines. Someone who believes in participation and collaboration, and whose passion and energy are infectious to others; have fun and believe your wins are the team’s wins. Superior communication skills. Ability to listen, engage and create buy-in, and effectively communicate initiatives to the organization. Ability to prioritize and run multi-projects/tasks effectively. Reputation for honesty and integrity. Solid negotiation, conflict resolution, and people management skills. Able to build and maintain lasting relationships with corporate departments, key business partners, and customers. Knowledge of cost analysis, fiscal management, and budgeting techniques. High level of proficiency with Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint).  Experience/Education Must possess field sales experience. A post-secondary degree in Chemical Engineering, Chemistry, Business, Marketing or a related field is considered an asset. Must possess 5 years’ experience in technical services and/or chemicals sales. Knowledge of raw materials, base fluids, and finished products. Valid driver’s license. Experience in all aspects of sales, including growth strategies, distribution channel management, account development, and business planning.  We are an equal opportunity employer committed to equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, religion, national origin, disability, status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, or any other basis protected by law.   We would like to thank all of those who apply; however, only those selected for an interview will be notified.

The Regional Sales Director, reporting to the Vice President of Sales and Marketing, has the role of management and direction of the sales team to achieve revenue and profit goals. Evaluates and implements appropriate new sales techniques to increase the region's sales volume. May recommend product or service enhancements to improve customer satisfaction and sales potential. Subject matter expert leading and coordinating the commercial processes across the region footprint. This individual is responsible for workflows including proposals/bids, contract negotiation, and compliance with contract commitments and commercial risk assessment. This individual will work closely with regional Operations leaders, regional sales teams, and corporate administrative functions to ensure the overall team's function meets Thompson Industrial Services' strategy and criteria for quotation execution while meeting/exceeding customer's needs and expectations.  Primary Duties And Responsibilities Personal Conduct Conduct himself/herself at all times in a way that is professional and is aligned with Thompson Industrial Service, LLC values. Consistently ensure that business is always conducted with honesty and integrity. People Development Sales Competency Assess and improve the skill of the sales team with regards to communication, time management, strategic thinking, presentation and proposal development and delivery, and other criteria critical to driving improved Revenue, Net Contribution, and EBITDA Business Acumen Assess and improve sales team's understanding of the critical parameters that impact Job Profitability as measured by Net Contribution to EBITDA. Utilize Net Contribution principles to accurately estimate the margin generation of each Job proposal allowing for more precise pricing relative to the highest possible market price at which a Job can be won. Personnel Career Development Develop technical competency matrix and work with Regional/Corporate Leadership to implement training & development plans. Remain actively engaged with sales team to ensure understanding of each person's personal career aspirations and assist each team member to develop a Personal Development Plan to facilitate their own growth. Strategy Development Understand and contribute to the strategic plan of the company Work closely with the VP of Sales & Marketing to develop and execute a commercial sales strategy to drive increased Revenue and Net Contribution $ within his/her Region. Strategy Implementation/Execution Customer relationship development Proactively visit existing and future customers to assess and gain selling opportunities. Build sustainable relationships with both customers and operations. Manage and evaluate customer concerns by meeting with the customer and communicating with operations to rectify as needed. Manage the execution of contractual agreements with customers to ensure compliance. Proposal process ownership Oversee Job proposal development to ensure all significant risks (T&Cs, Safety, Execution, etc.) are identified, communicated, and mitigated prior to customer submission. Responsible for understanding services offered by Thompson Industrial Services and its competitors, and developing proposals focused on winning business at the highest possible market price with acceptable Net Contribution $. Results Communication Proactively engage with Operations to ensure seamless transition and execution of awarded work. Complete sales forecasts and sales activity reports, including TIS CRM tools in a timely manner. Report any quality issues to the appropriate leadership. Deliver proposal metrics dashboards to measure KPI's. Primary Performance Metrics Revenue $ and Net Contribution $ generation and growth Personnel development and retention Safety Education and Experience Bachelor's degree required Master's degree preferred and/or equivalent work experience required 10 years or more of commercial and technical experience related to services in an industrial setting.

jobTitle: Sales Representative - San Francisco - Patient Handling
description: Patient Handling Sales Representative  Who We Want Hard-working winners. Confident, competitive and results-oriented salespeople who create a track record of success. Persuasive influencers. People who understand market positioning and can use their relationship skills and depth of knowledge to secure buy-in, cooperation, and loyalty. Teammates. Partners who listen to ideas, share thoughts and work together to move the business forward. Mission-driven salespeople. Fiercely intense representatives who work whatever hours necessary to live out their purpose of changing people’s lives and making healthcare better. What You Will Do As a Patient Handling Sales Representative, you work strategically to promote and sell Stryker Patient Handing products to meet our customers’ needs. You are responsible for becoming the resident Patient Handling expert as you work with a sophisticated audience of surgeons, nurses, and hospital administrators. Your knowledge not only of your own products, but of competitors’ offerings, builds credibility with your customers. You focus on customer satisfaction by demonstrating teamwork and empowerment, solving problems through a consultative approach, operating with honesty and integrity and providing a highly responsive and unsurpassed level of customer service. You contribute to leading in product innovation by listening and working with others and contributing new ideas. You strive for operational excellence by promoting a team based, product-focused organization, contributing to continuous improvement, participating in preventative maintenance and safety programs. You take great pride in cost reduction, and commit to on time, complete, and error free shipments. As a Patient Handling Sales Representative, you love driving in the fast lane and live out your mission to change lives by selling Stryker products that are making healthcare better. What You Need Bachelor’s degree required. 2+ years demonstrated successful sales experience (medical device or capital equipment sales preferred). Strong inter-personal communication skills specifically relating to stress management, people management and conflict management. Excellent time management, project management, experience with reports and budget, and customer service skills. Knowledge of marketing, market research, new product development, new product introduction, P/L management, and field testing. What We Offer A winning team driven to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results. Quality products that improve the lives of customers and patients. Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your own career. About Stryker  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including reconstructive, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology and spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.  Learn More About The Patient Handling Products Stretchers & transport chairs– https://www.stryker.com/us/en/portfolios/medical-surgical-equipment/stretchers.html Stretcher support surfaces– https://www.stryker.com/us/en/portfolios/medical-surgical-equipment/support-surfaces/stretcher-support-surfaces.html Mistral-Air- https://www.stryker.com/us/en/acute-care/products/mistral-air.html

jobTitle: Vice President, New Business Sales - Public & Labor
description: Job Description  We are seeking strong sales leaders with an emphasis on Public & Labor work in the Atlanta, GA area for this opportunity  The Vice President Client Management provides strategic sales leadership to expand and maintain business relationships with existing Public & Labor accounts.  Required Qualifications  Meets public & labor growth sales production, retention and profitability objectives for assigned book of business.  Develops and executes a comprehensive strategic plan which results in increased sales and maximized profitability by maintaining and expanding penetration of existing products and cross-selling other Aetna products.  Updates external constituents on Aetna capabilities to create business opportunities and/or enhance the perception and understanding of Aetna capabilities. Delivers organized, polished presentations of solutions, with benefits tied to the constituent's business needs.  Identifies and capitalizes on emerging trends in the marketplace by participating in community and industry events as an Aetna representative.  Builds and maintains productive relationships with plan sponsors and brokers/consultants.  Reaches senior levels within a customer/consultant organization and tailors message to effectively engage senior executives.  Shares relevant industry and competitive data within and across business units and segments to support the development of new product initiatives.  Mentors and supports service team, peers, and sales team.  7-9 years industry experience with complex public & labor sales and client management.  Licensure as required.  Preferred Qualifications  Meets public & labor growth sales production, retention and profitability objectives for assigned book of business.  Develops and executes a comprehensive strategic plan which results in increased sales and maximized profitability by maintaining and expanding penetration of existing products and cross-selling other Aetna products.  Updates external constituents on Aetna capabilities to create business opportunities and/or enhance the perception and understanding of Aetna capabilities. Delivers organized, polished presentations of solutions, with benefits tied to the constituent's business needs.  Identifies and capitalizes on emerging trends in the marketplace by participating in community and industry events as an Aetna representative.  Builds and maintains productive relationships with plan sponsors and brokers/consultants.  Reaches senior levels within a customer/consultant organization and tailors message to effectively engage senior executives.  Shares relevant industry and competitive data within and across business units and segments to support the development of new product initiatives.  Mentors and supports service team, peers, and sales team.  7-9 years industry experience with complex public & labor sales and client management.  Licensure as required.  Education  College degree or equivalent experience.  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

The Sales Development Program develops future sales talent of Inmar. It is an ideal program if you want to fast-track your career in sales for a rapidly growing, tech-enabled solutions company that is changing the world for consumers. Through in-person and web-based training along with the ability to engage with customers in the sales process, you’ll be provided the tools and knowledge to sell to some of the largest CPG brands, retailers, pharmacies or hospitals in the MarTech, FinTech or SupplyTech industries.  What You’ll Be Doing Formal Sales Training and Development Product training in one of the following Inmar Platforms during a 12-month program: Retail Cloud Healthcare Cloud FinTech Cloud Product Lifecycle Cloud Coaching and in-the-field training with Client Development Managers Achieve set goals and milestones Complete assessments in a timely manner Upon successful completion of the Sales Development Program, participants will be placed in a full-time client development role within the Inmar Sales Organization. Required Qualifications A Bachelor’s Degree in Business or Marketing 6 months - 1 year relevant work or internship experience in sales or customer service Excellent communication, writing, problem-solving skills Collaborating with others to solve problems Strong drive for results Highly motivated, self-starter Required Individual Competencies Curious: A desire to inquire and learn, to seek new knowledge and wisdom, and to listen to the contributions of others with a genuine interest to better self, the team, and the organization. Analytical & Critical Thinking: Ability to tackle a problem by using a logical, systematic, sequential approach. Adaptable: Responds to change with a willingness to learn new ways to accomplish work objectives with a positive attitudes. Problem Solving: Gathers and analyzes information to generate and evaluate potential solutions to problems, issues and challenges while weighing the accuracy and relevance of the facts, data and information. Effective Execution: Translates broad conceptual understanding of the company's strategy into a tactical plan of how it will happen including who will take on which tasks in what sequence, how long those tasks will take, how much the tasks cost, and how each task affects subsequent activities. Urgency: Transfers mission to action by acting clearly and decisively to analyze and implement solutions regardless of pressure or uncertainty and maintains a sense of urgency to complete tasks, accomplish goals, and act in ambiguous and complex situations. Communication: Giving and receiving messages and information in written, oral, and visual formats in a clear and concise way for a complete understanding of meaning and intent. Integrity: Gains the trust of others by taking responsibility for own actions and telling the truth. Business Acumen: Understands and is aware of how to think about and successfully make the right business decisions through the utilization of industry-specific knowledge and skills and strategic thinking tools and skills. The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an associate to successfully perform the major job responsibilities (essential functions) of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the major job responsibilities. This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties, responsibilities, or qualifications associated with the job.  While performing the duties of this job, the associate is: Regularly required to use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools or controls, and reach with hands or arms. Regularly required to talk or hear and read instructions on a computer monitor and/or printed on paper. Occasionally required to stand, kneel or stoop, and lift and/or move up to 15 pounds. Regularly required to view items at an extremely close range and must be able to adjust and readjust focus. Safety Support a safe work environment by following safety rules and regulations and reporting all safety hazards. As An Inmar Associate, You Put clients first and consistently display a positive attitude and behaviors that demonstrate an awareness and willingness to listen and respond to clients in order to meet their short-term and long-term needs, requirements and exceed their expectations. Treat clients and teammates with courtesy, consideration and tact; you also have the ability to perceive the needs of internal and external clients and communicate effectively with the objective of delighting and retaining the client. Build collaborative relationships and work cooperatively with others, inside and outside the organization, to accomplish objectives, develop and maintain mutually-beneficial partnerships, leverage information and achieve results.
