jobTitle: Associate Sales Representative, Pain Therapies - Napa / East Bay , CA
description: Careers that Change Lives  Bring your talents to an industry leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions – we’re a market leader and growing every day. You can be proud to sell medical technologies that are rooted in our long history of mission-driven innovation. Our expanding portfolio delivers measurable clinical and economic value – and opens doors. You will be empowered to shape your own career. We support your growth with the training, mentorship, and guidance you need to own your future success. Together, we can transform healthcare.  Join us for a career in sales that changes lives.  Business Description:  Our vision is to become the undisputed world leader in Neuromodulation, improving patient lives through innovative solutions. Our therapies span the care continuum; from early interventional procedures to implantable surgical technologies that relieve pain, restore function and improve lives for our patients.  We're committed to applying clinical and economic evidence and integrated technologies to our unmatched portfolio of therapies to develop healthcare solutions that increase patient access, improve the efficiency of procedures and deliver successful patient outcomes.  The Neuromodulation Operating Unit offers solutions — from early interventional procedures to implantable surgical technologies — that treat chronic pain as well as pain from spinal fractures, cancer, and severe spasticity.  Our key Pain Therapies include: Spinal Cord Stimulation , Drug infusion for chronic pain , and Drug infusion for severe Spasticity.  A Day in the Life:  At Medtronic, the Associate Sales Representative, Pain Therapies is responsible for soliciting orders, selling Medtronic Pain products assigned and representing the company in accordance with its policies and in the area assigned; for maintaining awareness of local competitive conditions and for reporting back promptly to the district manager. This position will work in tandem with a Pain Sales Representative 2 and will have territory coverage responsibility and sales responsibility.  This is a field based role.  Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned: Generate new sales: Develop leads, recruit new surgeons, qualify prospects, and make sales calls. Grow existing Pain business and develop new opportunities. Work with minimal supervision utilizing corporate resources to generate revenue and meet/exceed quota. Manage accounts in assigned territory. Implement approved marketing strategies. Aggressively seeks new customers and formulates and follow plans for such action as directed by the District Sales Manager. Respond to customer complaints in accordance with Medtronic policy and advise District Sales Manager and Medtronic promptly of any situation beyond scope of authority. Stay attentive to competitor’s product and merchandising practices and to keep the District Sales Manager informed concerning them. Maintain up-to-date customer record books and other records in accordance with District Sales Manager instructions. Identify selling opportunities and work closely with the sales representatives to increase sales in their respective accounts. Successfully complete all required product and sales related training curriculum. Prepare and submit call reports as required by District Sales Manager. Attend and participate in sales meetings, training programs, conventions, and trade shows as directed. Cooperate with all personnel on the execution of Company programs. Create and implement an annual business plan with quarterly updates. Provide service to customers per their individual needs. Respond in a timely manner to all reporting requirements and requests. Adhere to company policies and conducts all business in an ethical manner. We seek out and hire a diverse workforce at every level: We need fresh ideas and inclusive insights to continue to be an innovative industry leader —that’s why we make it a point to seek out, attract and develop employees who are patient-centric, passionate, and who represent the same wide variety of life experiences as our patients.  To learn more about Inclusion & Diversity at Medtronic Click Here  Must Have: Minimum Requirements  To be considered for this role, please ensure the minimum requirements are evident on your resume. Bachelor's Degree Nice to Have Ortho, Spine or O.R. experience Ability to sell in an environment where partnering with a surgeon is critical and ability to sell a new device or procedure Thrive in an environment of variety and rapid growth & change Excellent communication and presentation skills Accustomed to working independently with a high degree of accountability Fluency in Spanish, speaking and writing About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  Physical Job Requirements  The physical demands described within the Day in the Life section of this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand; walk; and use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 30 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and distance vision Must be able to travel Work Environment The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet to moderate. Position involves some travel & possible spur of the moment travel. Position involves potential radiation exposure. Must have a valid driver's license and active vehicle insurance policy. In addition, your driving record will be reviewed and will be considered as part of your application. DISCLAIMER:  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position.  Additional Information Posting Date: Oct 8, 2021 Travel: Yes, < 50 % of the Time

Mission: To develop, market and sell Anaheim to benefit the economic vitality of our neighborhoods. The Meetings Manager's primary objective includes selling, promoting and securing meetings opportunities for Anaheim/Orange County and increasing Anaheim's market share of meetings, conventions and events business generating occupancy and tourism tax revenues for the city of Anaheim and Garden Grove. Responsibilities also include understanding the strategic needs of customers, offering business solutions and securing business opportunities for Visit Anaheim partners and a detailed knowledge of destination and Partners. To work in cooperation with Partners and Visit Anaheim staff to solicit, qualify and secure meetings/events and enhance the brand of Anaheim/Orange County.Primary Duties and Responsibilities Under the direction of the Vice President, Meeting & Partnership Sales, responsibilities will include but will not be limited to: Essential Functions:Responsible for developing sales plans to create awareness of destination and aggressively pursue all meeting opportunities and exceed goals based on assigned accounts and territories.Responsibilities include: selling to specific accounts/territories, create and deliver sales presentations/proposals, site visits, generate qualified leads and securing definite bookings.Strive to understand the strategic needs/objective of each customer to offer strategic business solutions and quantify the value of the business to Visit Anaheim.Nurture relationships with current clients and secure new accounts that have not utilized Anaheim/Orange County. This scope covers all sizes of meetings as assigned, as to meet the needs of all members of Visit Anaheim, inclusive of member partners.Responsible for maintenance and coordination of existing files/accounts and ensuring all accounts, customer information and sales activities are entered in to Visit Anaheim sales database. Responsible for data entry of all pertinent information of the account status by logging activity reports and trace dates to continuously update progress and contact with each account.Create new accounts as a result of qualifying and solicitation of businesses throughout targeted region/ account base.Must be able to travel, when necessary, to any US destination for business development purposes. Coordinate and execute tradeshows and client events as assigned.Coordinate sales trips and events with Sales Director(s) in same region to maximize customer penetration and budget/time investments.Maintain visibility in the marketplace through membership and participation chapter meetings of industry associations (MPI, PCMA, IAEE, ASAE, ESPA, etc.), as appropriate and approved, to increase business opportunities by enhancing knowledge and relationships to the meetings/events industry.Responsible for producing monthly reports, participation in conference calls, review of leads and bookings as assigned by supervisor. Management of assigned budgets and submission of expense reports accurately and timely.Performs other duties as assigned. Must live within 25 miles of the Washington DC area. The physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must be able to travel. Work week will regularly exceed 37 1/2 hours and not be limited to traditional work days Monday- Friday. Occasional evenings and weekends are required. The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while perform essential functions of this job. A consistent and reliable presence at work is necessary. Please submit resumes to: Debbie Taylor at careers@visitanaheim.org.Subject line to read: Manager, Meeting Sales Eastern Region

About The Role  Aurora Solar is a fast-growing Series C company on a mission to create a future of solar energy for all. Aurora makes the software that is enabling society to transition to a world powered by solar power. It’s our goal to have every solar installation in the world pass through our software, which has already been used to design millions of solar projects. Named one of “The Best Places To Work in 2021” by BuiltInSF.com and awarded #1 Solar Software platform by Solar Power World, Aurora is disrupting the energy industry and changing the course of history.  In this role, you will manage a team of account executives to encourage their quantitative activities and qualitative skillsets. You will be accountable for coaching, mentoring, and managing your team to meet and exceed quarterly revenue targets. Reporting to the Director of Corporate Sales you’ll work closely with other inside sales managers as well as cross-functional teams like customer success, marketing, and client success. You will join customer calls with your team as needed and meet 1-1 on a regular basis with your account executives.  We are a passionate and diverse team that aspires to be the best place for the best people and we’re looking for talented individuals to accelerate our exponential growth as we continue to scale. If you are looking for a stimulating and fulfilling role, come join us!  What You'll Do Meet and exceed team sales quota Manage, mentor, and coach Corporate Account Executives in defined geographic territories Interview and hire new team members to grow your team according to headcount goals Forecast revenue for your team each week to monitor monthly and quarterly performance to date for VP Sales and Board of Directors Employ detailed reporting dashboards to monitor and improve the sales activity of your team Develop inside sales strategy for new opportunities within the residential and commercial solar industry segments Refine and improve the sales playbooks and training guides Partner with revenue operations, marketing, customer success, and sales enablement teams to develop strategies to increase sales and improve customer onboarding  What We Value Motivated - you should have a demonstrated track record of success Leadership - you should enjoy steering teams and working with people 3+ years of B2B SaaS sales experience, including both sales management/team leadership and IC roles Expertise with Salesforce and other best in class sales enablement technologies like Chorus, Outreach, Slack, Atrium, and more Communication - you’re a natural communicator in all directions Coaching - you’re consistently looking for ways to improve and support your team members by listening to their needs and helping them succeed Aurora is dedicated to building a diverse and inclusive workforce of people who believe in and are passionate about creating a future of solar energy for all. We are an equal opportunity employer, we welcome and consider qualified applicants regardless of gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion, age, national origin, citizenship, pregnancy status, veteran status, or any other differences. We encourage you to apply even if you believe that you do not meet all of the above criteria!  For San Francisco applicants: Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records for employment.

description: Who We Are:  Aviatrix is a well-funded, pre-IPO, hyper-growth enterprise-software company based in the heart of Silicon Valley (Santa Clara, CA). Aviatrix technology has proven solid at scale with nearly 600 enterprise customers, over 40 of the Global Fortune 500. We have a top-tier, experienced leadership team, combined with a collaborative culture built on proven success, trust, execution, and respect. We’re focused on getting things done!  Read recent article published in Bloomberg on Aviatrix’s incredible rise in value  What We Do:  Aviatrix is networking for the cloud era , delivering a superset of features and capabilities that leverage and control native cloud constructs and add advance network, security and operational visibility features that cloud providers lack, while maintaining the simplicity and automation enterprises expect in cloud. Aviatrix offers the industry’s first and only multi-cloud networking certification ( ACE ), empowering IT to lead and accelerate the transformation to the cloud.  About the role:  We are looking for a highly motivated Regional Sales Manager to join our rapidly growing Go-to-Market (GTM) sales team. The Regional Sales Manager will be responsible for driving sales of Aviatrix products and solutions within a specific geographic territory. The RSM must be quota-driven and will represent Aviatrix and its product suite within the region. S/HE will work with Inside Sales, Systems Engineers, Solution Architects, and Aviatrix Partners to exceed sales objectives. This position will manage all aspects of the sales process including securing net-new business, lead management, qualification, evaluation, close and subsequent account care. The RMS will act as the lead of their territory.  Position Responsibilities:  Define and execute sales plans for the assigned territory  Meet and exceed quotas through prospecting, qualifying, managing, and closing opportunities  Develop and manage sales pipeline, prospect, and assess sales and move a large number of transactions through the sales pipeline  Manage and track customer and transactional information in the Aviatrix CRM system  Provide activity forecasts and regular pipeline reporting through the CRM system  Own and collaborate on all aspects of the sales cycle, including product support and sales engineering  Execute product demonstrations to prospective clients  Develop accounts of various sizes and grow client relationships  Understand the competitive market, be familiar with competing companies and their product suite  Collaborate within the Aviatrix team on strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts, and customer care  Meet with customers daily, both remote and in-person once climate allows  Requirements  8+ years of enterprise software sales experience with a track record of closing complex sales to Fortune 500 companies or 8+ years managing and growing a large geographical territory with YoY growth/success in net-new logo’s  Cloud experience  A Closer – consistent overachievement of sales goals in a large geographic territory  Drive to expand client base and close sales  Excellent communication skills verbal and written, team player  Entrepreneurial – willing to go the extra mile, competitive mindset, great work ethic, resourceful, “get it done” attitude  Must be willing to travel to clients to support sales relationships  Bachelor’s Degree  Aviatrix, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and does not make hiring decisions based on race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

jobTitle: Strategic Inside Sales Representative - Uber for Business
description: About The Role  We're looking for an experienced and driven Strategic Inside Sales Representative to support our Uber for Business Strategic sales team. This high-impact position will provide sales support to Strategic Account Executives through the development of qualified leads that result in achieving our business goals. You will be calling upon our largest, and most strategic client accounts. This role will serve as a training ground for a pathway into an Account Executive position with demonstrated success.  You'll be responsible for conducting outbound prospecting campaigns (both call and email). Develop rapport with contacts in an effort to understand where the prospect is in the buying cycle. Work with Strategic Account Executives, to ensure that the leads provided accurately qualified and will progress through the sales funnel. This involves gathering key information to update our Salesforce system and identifying next steps for Strategic Account Executives to connect with these prospects and overall Account Global expansion.  What You'll Do Generate new business opportunities in an assigned vertical or territory and partner with assigned Strategic Account Executives Develop our largest Strategic accounts Outbound prospecting via targeted calling, email, and marketing campaigns Build and execute on strategic and measurable demand generation campaigns Uncover a prospect's business challenges and identify new business opportunities, while highlighting the Uber for Business value proposition Conduct high-level conversations with senior executives Manage, track, and report on all sales activities and results using Salesforce Work closely with sales management to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities for new business Collaborate with the sales team to share best practices and make recommendations to more effectively close sales and ensure customer loyalty Work effectively with internal departments to deliver the best solution for the client and ensure an excellent experience Travel to attend trade shows or other client meetings when requested or necessary Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree required Preferred Qualifications 3+ years of experience cold-calling and sales/business development experience Experience with prospecting and closing transactional deals Experience using a CRM (ex: Salesforce) to manage daily activities Experience with email campaigns and Salesforce preferred Ability to build extraordinary customer relationships Salesforce, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Zoom Info and Groove experience preferred Excellent communication skills Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently Have a positive, self-driven team-first mentality with a desire to learn

description: Description  Reporting into the regional sales manager the successful candidate will be tasked with optimising business intelligence subscription sales through proactively identifying, targeting and closing relevant prospects. This includes understanding the market, competition, developing leads, booking appointments with and presenting to decision makers and closing deals over the phone.  Requirements  Requirements Proactively call and engage with all incoming leads. This involves following up on pay wall hits on our websites, first month registrants and email clicks from marketing campaigns. Seek out new opportunities and build a strong pipeline of potential customers and business via existing client base, networking and other means. Research and understand the market whilst working closely with the Sales Team Leader to identify and target key sectors, through intelligent use of the information and data PEI produces. Book multiple virtual meetings daily with decision makers in relevant organisations. Ensure colleagues within the company fully informed of your activities and of all developments within the marketplace, both informally and through formal reporting Assess sales literature used by the team and take a view as to whether it can be improved. If so, co-ordinate this work and ensure each team member uses this in an effective way Contribute to ad hoc projects, reporting & data analysis and attend PEI events to network with prospects and subsequently contact to pitch relevant services as required. Ensure all sales support tasks are completed accurately and to specified deadlines Deliver confident, well-researched and tailored sales presentations to prospective customers. This includes (a) researching the prospective customer (b) identifying relevant profiles/articles in advance of meetings to best demonstrate how the service will suit them. Proactively engage with PEI Client Executive and trialists to ensure that the prospective customer is convinced of the product(s) value to their work. Define decision making process and persuade them to purchase PEI’s services over the phone. Create and maintain accurate up-to-date records in our Microsoft CRM, ensuring best practise on internal processes. Ensure all exchanges with prospective customers including issues, opportunities and competitive information are fully recorded and evaluated. Have a thorough understanding of the market and products. Liaise with colleagues within the business in order to keep up to date with the latest product developments and through your own research. jobTitle: Sales Representative - San Francisco - Patient Handling
description: Patient Handling Sales Representative  Who We Want Hard-working winners. Confident, competitive and results-oriented salespeople who create a track record of success. Persuasive influencers. People who understand market positioning and can use their relationship skills and depth of knowledge to secure buy-in, cooperation, and loyalty. Teammates. Partners who listen to ideas, share thoughts and work together to move the business forward. Mission-driven salespeople. Fiercely intense representatives who work whatever hours necessary to live out their purpose of changing people’s lives and making healthcare better. What You Will Do As a Patient Handling Sales Representative, you work strategically to promote and sell Stryker Patient Handing products to meet our customers’ needs. You are responsible for becoming the resident Patient Handling expert as you work with a sophisticated audience of surgeons, nurses, and hospital administrators. Your knowledge not only of your own products, but of competitors’ offerings, builds credibility with your customers. You focus on customer satisfaction by demonstrating teamwork and empowerment, solving problems through a consultative approach, operating with honesty and integrity and providing a highly responsive and unsurpassed level of customer service. You contribute to leading in product innovation by listening and working with others and contributing new ideas. You strive for operational excellence by promoting a team based, product-focused organization, contributing to continuous improvement, participating in preventative maintenance and safety programs. You take great pride in cost reduction, and commit to on time, complete, and error free shipments. As a Patient Handling Sales Representative, you love driving in the fast lane and live out your mission to change lives by selling Stryker products that are making healthcare better. What You Need Bachelor’s degree required. 2+ years demonstrated successful sales experience (medical device or capital equipment sales preferred). Strong inter-personal communication skills specifically relating to stress management, people management and conflict management. Excellent time management, project management, experience with reports and budget, and customer service skills. Knowledge of marketing, market research, new product development, new product introduction, P/L management, and field testing. What We Offer A winning team driven to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results. Quality products that improve the lives of customers and patients. Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your own career. About Stryker  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including reconstructive, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology and spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.  Learn More About The Patient Handling Products Stretchers & transport chairs– https://www.stryker.com/us/en/portfolios/medical-surgical-equipment/stretchers.html Stretcher support surfaces– https://www.stryker.com/us/en/portfolios/medical-surgical-equipment/support-surfaces/stretcher-support-surfaces.html Mistral-Air- https://www.stryker.com/us/en/acute-care/products/mistral-air.html

jobTitle: Director of Sales and Customer Care
description: Are you an energetic Sales and Customer Care Director with a strong desire to make a real lasting impact in your career? Come help us shape the future at Mayzo! We are a 35-year-old thriving chemical distribution business renowned for specialty chemical additive expertise and product innovation. We are seeking a proven consultative sales leader to drive the Sales and Customer Care functions within our vibrant and collaborative team culture. This position is part of our Management Team and reports directly to the President.  In this role, you will lead the Company's Sales and Customer Care teams in attracting and retaining customers and expanding sales of our product offerings. You will guide your teams to reach the highest levels of customer satisfaction, while accurately forecasting our customer’s needs and working with other departments to ensure on-time delivery of orders.  As the Director of Sales and Customer Care, you will lead a team of 4 Sales Team members and 2 Customer Care Team members, and oversee independent consultants and international distributors. This is a full-time position based out of our North Atlanta Headquarters in Suwanee, GA, with work hours of 8 am - 5 pm. Up to 40% travel may be required. Relocation (Domestic only) assistance is available. Primary Responsibilities for the role are:  Sales Management  Train sales associates on Mayzo’s value proposition, business model, company products, services, and policies and procedures.  Determine the most effective deployment of sales personnel. Set goals for sales calls including contact frequency and mobilize the sales force.  Ensure that sales personnel continuously learn from each other’s experiences using a knowledge transfer process.  Establish, monitor and administer sales incentive plans.  Customer Relationship-Building  Develop and maintain an intimate knowledge of key customers, including their product needs, manufacturing processes, technical challenges, personnel, and decision-makers.  Work with sales team to develop sustainable long-term relationships with customers to sell new business or defend existing business.  Lead or participate in sales presentations as needed.  Develop, manage, and commercialize profitable opportunities with current new and customer accounts.  Recommend and execute plans to address any anticipated problems.  Represent Mayzo at business/trade events as required.  Analysis, Planning and Special Projects  Create and administer the expense budget for Sales and Customer Care.  Oversee the sales forecasting process and monitor results.  Continually gather and monitor intelligence on competition, new technical and commercial developments, and market trends; educate sales associates and others as needed. Propose new products, sales campaigns or market expansion to take advantage of emerging opportunities.  Study data on sales results and orders by product, customer, and sales territory. Interpret data to identify changes or trends and diagnose issues. Be aware continuously of key metrics and sales indicators.  Coordinate with Corporate Communications to schedule and execute marketing programs, including trade shows, events, articles, publications and email campaigns.  Coordinate with Technology to resolve technical service requests and assign sales resources to product enhancement or R&D projects.  Distribution  Develop and oversee Mayzo’s Distribution partners worldwide.  Customer Care Management  Oversee personnel to ensure customer orders and inquiries are handled in a timely, accurate and courteous manner.  Monitor Daily Report comments related to Customer orders in order to anticipate or help resolve problems.  Analyze root causes of customer complaints, make or propose process changes to prevent future issues, and make decisions to solve problems and satisfy customers.  Coordinate with the Customer Care Manager on the annual customer satisfaction survey from the planning to the execution and results.  Coordinate the distribution of Web leads to the sales team with the Customer Care manager. Monitor and report on the conversion rate of leads to actual sales.  Oversee the maintenance of complete and accurate customer information in our systems.  Coach Customer Care personnel on interpersonal techniques such as handling conflict, cross-selling Mayzo products, gaining testimonials, etc.  Required Qualifications  Bachelor's degree in Chemistry, Chemical Engineering, or a related technical field such as Industrial Engineering or Materials Science.  A Master of Business Administration degree is preferred.  At least 15 years of experience in selling specialty chemical additives, preferably also in adhesives and plastics.  At least 10 years of experience managing distributors, preferably including distributors in other countries.

description: SnugZ USA is an innovative and thriving Top 40 promotional products supplier based out of Salt Lake City, Utah. Founded in 1989, SnugZ is the leading provider of branded lanyards, personal care, mints, leather goods and aromatherapy in the promotional products industry.  SnugZ core values are: Work Like Crazy, Care Passionately, Think Big and Do What's Right.  We have a talented executive team that leads with integrity and vision to take us where we need to be. We aim to create the best possible work environment with benefits that include Medical, Dental, Vision & Life Insurance, 401(k) Matching, Paid Time Off, Holiday Pay, Company Events, Free Swag, as well as Paid Maternity & Paternity Leave. We are also offering a $250.00 sign-on bonus after 90 days.. Our vision is to build opportunities for our co-workers, customers, and communities; and it all starts with you!  Purpose and Scope of Position  SnugZ USA is seeking a dynamic sales person to work in a fast paced, growing and fun environment. We are looking for someone who is self-motivated, hardworking, persistent and dependable to join our growing team in the promotional products industry.  The Sales Executive will be responsible for managing their existing territory by building and managing relationships, growing our customer base both organically within existing accounts and identifying potential customers. The ideal candidate for this position will have established sales and/or marketing experience and a commitment to delivering the highest level of professional dedication and performance. This position requires an individual who is a highly motivated self-starter.  Key Responsibilities Develop action plans to set and help achieve territory goals. Manage and analyze reports and data. This position requires travel to our National Show in Las Vegas and possible sale calls throughout the year to top accounts. Work with the Inside Sales manager to create sales strategy, implement and measure strategy. Required to exhibit and represent SnugZ at relevant promotional products trade shows within the territory. Partner with Inside Sales Support in assigned region to maximize territory coverage and revenue potential on all assigned accounts. Give formal presentations to inform accounts of SnugZ USA products, decoration capabilities, marketing programs and business solutions with a focus on sales. Navigate, qualify & research B2B partnerships; engage via email/phone/social media/virtual office visits and physical office visits. Achieve monthly sales quota; work with sales team to achieve organizational sales goals. Achieve expected volume of proactive customer calls while managing inbound requests. Practice knowledge of consultative selling approach. Develop creative presentations, programs, specials and flyers for new opportunities. Effectively manage multiple projects and assignments through to completion. Participate in continuous improvement activities to include idea generation. Manage quoting projects and proactive ideation. Additional duties as assigned. Required Experience/ Education And Training Requirements Associates/ Bachelor's Degree Sales, Marketing, Communications or Business preferred. 2+ years of experience in sales and/or marketing. Communicate clearly and professionally with exceptional written and verbal skills. High interest in consumer products for marketing events and advertising. Strong ability to sell products with an "on trend" component understanding trends and how to bring the trend to market. High level of competitiveness, positive attitude, enthusiasm and an eagerness to learn. Ability to generate original solutions to business opportunities and challenges. Ability to utilize continuous improvement concepts and philosophies on a regular basis. Ability to navigate through systems such as CRM, Syteline, Outlook, Excel. Ability to reach decision-makers and quickly determine potential opportunity. Must be customer focused, confident and goal driven. High adaptability to change. High level of integrity. Ability to lead by example, motivate a team, delegate, communicate clearly, negotiate, manage change well, improve processes, organize and build relationships. Must be detail oriented and have strong decision making skills. Language Requirements Must be able to read and write fluently in English. Physical Demands Ability to alternate between sitting, standing, and walking. Ability to perform fine manipulation such as typing for 8 hours. Ability of near visual acuity, clear vision of small printed items, and use of computer. Work Environment Open concept office setting with moderate noise levels. Snugzusa LLC is an equal opportunity employer and is a supporter of diversity and inclusion. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

As a result, we know how to manage distributed development comfortably and efficiently. There are offices for work and meetings in San Francisco, Berlin, and Moscow.  About You – have high-speed internet access and a quiet environment to work in – a technology-savvy person with a history of generating new sales – a history of exceeding sales targets and a high close rate – prior experience of working from home for at least 1 whole year in the last 5 years – native English  Responsibilities – Maintaining the full sales cycle: prospecting, identifying, & closing new business deals – Planning and execution of outbound campaigns to potential prospects – Quickly qualify sales opportunities and work to reach the decision-makers within the company – Give online presentations tailored to each business individual needs – Make efficient use of business-to-business referrals, leverage existing relationships to cement new opportunities  Requirements – Customer-driven with an adaptable and versatile approach to finding solutions – Excellent communication and presentation skills – Detail-oriented with a strong commitment to accuracy and quality – Experience in building a contact database – Demonstrate exceptional integrity, care, compassion, empathy, and commitment to customers – 3+ years of experience in software outsourcing – Bachelor’s or Master’s degree, preferably in business, communication, or information technology – Good understanding of software development processes and technologies – A well-developed network of personal contacts  This is a 100% Commission role as an Independent Contractor working from your home, using your own laptop/PC. High-speed internet and a quiet environment are required.  Because our customers are our priority, we seek candidates who demonstrate exceptional integrity, care, compassion, empathy, and commitment in their work.

Background  About Rollick, Inc.  Rollick connects manufacturers, dealers, and finance and insurance providers with in-market consumers in the Powersports, RV, and Marine industries to deliver a seamless customer journey. Rollick’s solutions include new customer acquisition, enterprise lead management, customer experience/loyalty, and marketing automation. In addition, the company has rapidly built its GoRollick.com outdoor recreational vehicle buying marketplace to include a nationwide network of dealers, over 100 manufacturers, and an affinity partner network with access to over 250 million high-quality customers including policyholders of major insurance providers, employees at more than 2,000 top U.S. companies, members of the military, veterans and first responders. For more information, visit Rollick.  Position Summary  The Marketplace Team is responsible for the growth of the GoRollick.com Recreational Vehicle Marketplace and the corresponding revenue partnerships. The Senior Manager of Strategic Partnerships reports directly to the Senior Vice President of Marketplace.  Your job will be to manage and grow our most important partnerships, such as partnerships with lenders, insurance providers, OEMs, accessory providers, and other strategic partners that can grow Rollick’s revenue. You will project manage these initiatives cross-functionally and will be responsible for hitting revenue targets. You will be instrumental in shaping the partnership strategy for Rollick and will be on the ground floor as we build the most dynamic company in the recreational vehicle space. The ideal candidate enjoys working in an entrepreneurial environment, is curious-minded and willing to wear many hats, is highly analytical, has strong sales and relationship skills, and is excited about the opportunity to have revenue responsibility.  Rollick is the fastest growing B2C marketplace in the recreational vehicle space, plus has dozens of partnerships which large affinity organizations including AAA, Sam’s Club, Progressive, Allstate, top employee benefit platforms and more.  Responsibilities Proactively grow Rollick’s strategic partnerships Own day-to-day relationship management of Rollick’s strategic partnerships Own project management of the various growth initiatives and develop new growth strategies to drive revenue Communicate project requirements to product, technology, dealer, finance, accounting and legal teams Create mechanisms/dashboards/metrics to forecast revenue, costs, overall performance of partnership and related marketing initiatives Develop and communicate internal and external reporting, forecasts, analysis, and presentations. Onboard and launch new strategic partnerships  Qualifications Strong background in the following: Business Development, Strategy, and Project Management Self-starter with ability to multi-task, remain organized, adapt to shifting priorities, and complete work consistently by or before agreed upon deadlines This candidate must be strong analytically and have experience using data to make informed decisions, with a proven ability to present analysis and results to senior management Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, economics, finance, or any other analytical discipline 5 - 7 years’ work experience in a similar business development or strategic partnership role. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, with a proven ability to present analysis and results to senior management Experience in building strong relationships with key Internal and Partner stakeholders across organizational and departmental boundaries Strong proficiency with Excel and PowerPoint  Nice to Have Ability to analyze and dissect data through google analytics (or similar tool) and develop accompanying strategies Technical aptitude: you speak the language and can interface with our product and engineering teams Experience in automotive, powersports, RV, marine or technology is a plus.

description: About innRoad innRoad is a rapidly growing Traveltech SaaS company offering best-in-class Property Management, Rate Management, Channel Management and Guest Conversion Solutions to lodging clients focused on growing their business. Named one of New York City’s “Hottest Startups”, innRoad serves thousands of properties in multiple geographies and is poised to increase market share while continuing to help existing clients streamline workflows, increase revenue and reduce costs.   The Opportunity Our Sales Operations Manager will work directly with the V.P. of Sales and provide assistance to the Sales team while enhancing our programs and systems. As a Sales Operations Manager, your mission is to connect people, processes, and data. The ideal candidate is an individual who thinks two-steps ahead; a true team player who enjoys supporting deals to closure and can work in a fast-paced environment without losing sight of the details and guidelines.   Responsibilities -Sales Systems & Reporting: ensure the effective administration of HubSpot/Salesforce to support clarity and accountability of sales activity and progress Provide accurate, real time visibility into team performance from MQL to Closed deals Ensure that Salesforce CRM data is collected accurately and efficiently Develop insightful Salesforce Dashboards and Reports to monitor inbound lead volume/source tracking ·       Manage sales operations process to enable team productivity Proactively identify bottlenecks and opportunities in sales process Includes lead prioritization, scoring and distribution / territory management -Help in selecting, implementing, and maintaining Salesforce and other sales automation/enablement tools Responsible for roll out, on-going training, adoption and optimization of tools Increase sales team productivity and effectiveness by simplifying processes Own vendor relationship including renewal dates, pricing, etc -Work with marketing to create sales enablement and training tools as needed based on feedback from Sales Manager and Sales VP -Assist with recruiting and on-boarding of new sales reps   Qualifications Experience in a selling or sales operations role utilizing multiple technologies Comfortable analyzing raw data in excel and coming up with actionable recommendations Proficiency in Salesforce and Microsoft Excel Program management skills Detail oriented Strong analytical and problem solving skills Ability to understand the bigger picture of the business and translate to system and process requirements to ensure objectives are met Ability to own the end to end process of sales process and conversion rates throughout the funnel   Perks & Benefits innRoad offers a comprehensive benefits package including health, vision, dental, healthcare FSA, dependent care FSA, 401K Match, generous PTO, and observed holidays. We have a culture built on collaborative teamwork, respect, transparency, can-do attitudes and professional growth. ** This is a Remote Work Opportunity**

jobTitle: Regional Sales Representative - Western NY Territory
description: WHO WE ARE: Douglas Dynamics is North Americas premier manufacturer and up-fitter of work truck attachments and equipment. Our belief is that our employees and culture are just as important to the company as serving our customers. We place a high value on building a team and working environment where individuals can succeed professionally and personally. As a team member at Douglas Dynamics, you can expect to make a difference through your work, to have a direct impact on the achievement of a very meaningful mission to serve our customers, to advance your career, and to have room for fun and fulfillment in your daily life.  We would love to have you join our team, where we offer top notch benefits, multiple avenues for advancement and a great working environment.  HOW WE DO IT: Grow, Improve, and Engage is our focus as an organization to ensure we succeed by executing the right things. These are our Core Values and are How We Win in the marketplace. The Winning Behaviors are what each Douglas Dynamics employee does to support the success of our company. They are the expectations of all of us to help ensure we focus on winning as an organization the right way! Our Winning Behaviors are: Be Customer & Results Driven Anticipate the Possibilities Collaborate & Care Communicate Responsibly Develop Self & Others Get Better Every Day HOW YOU WILL CONTRIBUTE: We are looking for a Regional Sales Representative responsible for the direct sales growth, account management, and marketing activities within the appointed region. The Regional Sales Representatives leadership is key to maintaining the companys image to end users (local municipalities and truck dealers) for quality products and services. You will be able to accomplish this by: Forecasting, development, and effective implementation of sales and marketing plans to achieve territory sales forecasts and goals. Effective territory management, including establishment of buying cycles, customer needs and relations, is critical to success. Recommendations for advertising programs, regional trade shows, and other market specific activities to cost effectively promote Henderson Products. Identify revenue opportunities and monitor competitive activity and trends, informing management as appropriate Maintain sales programs by keeping customers informed directly about available services, equipment, prices, and new products. Assist customers in selection of equipment for specific applications Assist with product trouble diagnoses and resolution Regular travel schedule to effectively manage assigned territory Knowledgeable of features, benefits and use of products, with complete knowledge of selling techniques and ability to close sales within the municipal sector. Manage municipal bid process when required. What We Offer You A fulfilling career with the ability to contribute to an Industry leader A comprehensive suite of benefits Competitive salary commensurate with experience A generous 401k match What This Role Needs Bachelors Degree in Marketing, Business, or Related field required 3-5 years experience in direct sales or account management. Truck equipment industry and municipal sales experience preferred, but not required. Aptitude to gain extensive truck equipment industry knowledge, with an emphasis on snow and ice products. Mechanical aptitude and problem analysis and resolution ability; ability to work with equipment specifications Technological skills required with knowledge of Microsoft products, including Excel and Word in Windows environment Organizational, detail, and follow-up skills Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, and a strong team player Our focus on integrity, teamwork, and high performance creates an ideal work environment for every one of our employees.  We offer competitive salaries, benefits, and opportunities for personal and professional growth. Discover our opportunities and come see all the ways you can do more at Douglas Dynamics.  As an Equal Opportunity Employer, Douglas Dynamics, LLC does not discriminate against qualified applicants in hiring based on race, color, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.

jobTitle: Product Marketing and Sales Enablement Lead, Go-To-Market
description: Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Mountain View, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA; Chicago, IL, USA.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience 5 years of experience in marketing, sales, product management, or sales operations  Preferred qualifications: MBA degree or an advanced degree in Marketing Experience leading cross-functional projects, executing on project management, managing multiple priorities, and operating in ambiguous environments Experience working with sales teams and interacting with/influencing executives Ability to take initiative and identify/solve complex problems Excellent written and verbal communication and organizational skills  About The Job  The Global Ads Product Go-to-Market team partners with Global Product Leads (GPLs) and regional/channel go-to-market teams to influence Google’s ad product strategies and ensure successful activation by Google’s sales teams globally. The team works with executives across Google Ads Product Operations, Global Product Leads (GPL), Go-to-Market (GTM), and Sales functions, providing strategic intel, operations, and communications support. Our team partners with executive leadership to set up functions across the Google Ads product and delivers impact projects focused on product adoption and business growth opportunities.  In this role, you will lead our sales marketing, education, and enablement efforts to drive awareness, consideration, and adoption of business growth opportunities. You'll work with executive leadership across regions, partnering with Sales, GPL, and GTM to develop narratives, collateral, and resources to market and promote the value of programs.  You will work across a range of stakeholders, understanding and incorporating differing needs. You'll balance measurement of outcomes and partner to promote programs to our Sales organizations.  The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) team ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy, and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done.  Responsibilities  Lead branding and change management initiatives to improve the perception of business growth programs. Help sales teams understand how programs are evolving. Develop storylines, narratives, and resources. Leverage different approaches to drive adoption of opportunities across sales teams. Lead regular discussions with stakeholders in Sales to understand challenges, identify patterns and trends across the industry, and evolve strategies and approaches accordingly. Educate Global Product Leads and Go-to-Market executive stakeholders about the needs of sales teams, driving adoption and traction. Identify scaled ways to drive adoption by sharing best practices and success stories.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

edX seeks a Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our Online Campus team. We accept applications from remote employees in the following US states: MA, CO, CT, ME, NH, NJ, NY, RI, VT.  Your Impact  edX Online Campus provides universities with access to more flexible and accessible resources to drive digital transformation and blended learning at these institutions. Given recent global developments related to COVID-19, many institutions have rapidly shifted to offer online options. edX Online Campus offers top-notch consulting and support to universities that need help during a time when many have had trouble seeking alternative ways to reach remote students and faculty; we extend the reach of education beyond the classroom, enabling flexible solutions for remote learners and augmenting existing on-campus offerings.  You will be part of one of the most exciting things we have built in years, so -- if you’re looking for a sales position that’s a little different than the others -- this is it! This is a multi-billion dollar industry that is ripe for disruption, and edX has the ideal product.  Your Team  The driven, collaborative SDR team comprises sales professionals just starting their careers but delivering high-performing impact across the team along the way. Our SDRs are responsible for qualifying inbound and outbound leads. Their outreach and prospecting efforts enable edX to meet our quarterly revenue goals. Whomever fills this position will join a high-performing team of five reps.  You Will Initiate the sales process with the world’s finest academic institutions and leaders (deans, provosts, etc.) seeking to ensure online success and equitable outcomes for all learners Conduct email, phone, and video outreach to hunt new and expand current accounts Attain (and eventually exceed) your monthly quota for meetings set and qualified leads converted into sales opportunities Continuously further professional education by researching and implementing best practices related to sales prospecting and the e-learning industry Expertly represent edX’s products, vision, value proposition, and solutions to innovative universities in the US and across the world Actively contact prospects - both outbound and inbound - to build a pipeline of large business opportunities for your team Independently uncover and understand prospects' learning needs at a granular level - establishing budget, authority, need, and timeline Consistently nurture a hybrid pipeline of both qualified leads that could become sales opportunities and potential deals that have yet to close Evolve and implement targets and measurement KPIs for both operational effectiveness and financial results Be able to clearly promote and evangelize edX in a highly professional manner Continuously further professional education by researching and implementing best practices related to sales prospecting and the e-learning industry You Have Demonstrated ability to write compelling personalized emails and professionally communicate our solution to the highest levels of academic leadership The ability to generate a high-quality pipeline, manage a large volume of opportunities through a sales process, and accurately forecast sales Deep enthusiasm for higher education and what we’re building here Hunger to succeed in a startup or hyper-growth business environment Experience as a high achiever Solution selling approach and willingness to partner with internal colleagues to meet the business requirements of your prospects A goals-driven and self-motivated dynamic A willingness to work with seasoned, experienced, industry professionals; you’re capable of and willing to take input from others to learn, adapt, and apply Preferred Skills Experience in a Business Development role (SaaS or EdTech/content sales experience a plus) Experience using Salesforce or similar CRM Experience working in a SaaS environment edX is the education movement for restless learners. Together with our founding partners Harvard and MIT, we’ve brought together more than 38 million learners, the majority of top-ranked universities in the world, and industry-leading companies onto one online learning platform that supports learners at every stage. And we’re not stopping there—as a global nonprofit, we’re relentlessly pursuing our vision of a world where every learner can access education to unlock their potential, without the barriers of cost or location.

description: Sales Development Representative Free Training + Certification + Paid Apprenticeship + Job  Company Details: We are an award-winning automated marketing and communication software located in Austin. Our fully integrated approach combines leading web solutions for businesses with media websites for consumers. As an SDR, you’re on the promotional fast-track within our sales organization.  Responsibilities: Prospecting and qualifying for new leads Inbound / Outbound cold calling and emailing Booking meetings with prospects and achieving quota-based on-ramp requirements Developing sales strategies and generate new opportunities  Requirements: Some experience in Sales Development, Lead Generation or Sales is preferred Bachelor's degree is preferred Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively Solid verbal and written communication skills Full-time availability   Apprenticeship Description: During your first three months as an SDR, candidates will also be able to participate in live instructor-led training and receive mentorship from current industry-leading account executives and sales leaders. description: The N2 Company is looking for an experienced sales leader to join our team as our new Director of Corporate Sales.  Our ideal candidate will also have experience with both print advertising and selling digital tactics and strategies.   N2 is a growing company based in Wilmington, North Carolina, though most of our team members are currently working from the comfort and safety of their homes and many will continue to have the opportunity to do so indefinitely. Our team designs, prints, and ships more than 800 monthly publications across the country. Our mission is to help small businesses win every day. The Director of Corporate Sales will be responsible for driving sales for N2’s corporate-owned publications – that is, those run by W-2 team members instead of our franchisees.  Interviews for this opening will be conducted over the phone and via video calls. This role has the option to be fully remote or be located at our headquarters in Wilmington once our Home Office safely reopens.    Think you’ve got the attitude AND the aptitude to join our team for this exciting full-time role? Keep reading and then apply today via the link below!  In a Typical Day, You Would:  Work with company leadership in a metrics-driven environment to help reach monthly, quarterly, and annual sales goals.   Devise long-term strategic plans focused on how to drive sales moving forward.  Help develop and cultivate a newly formed W-2 corporate sales team.  Guide the W-2 corporate sales team in their duties and help team members hone their skills and improve their performance.   To Land This Gig, You Need To:  Have 5+ years experience managing a sales team of at least 50-100 salespeople in a large corporate environment.   Have experience managing sales of $40 million to $60+ million.   Have experience working with Small to Mid Sized Businesses.  Have experience with Print Advertising.  Have experience selling Digital Tactics and Strategies.  Have experience building a sales team from the ground up.  Demonstrate leadership skills to oversee teams in multiple markets and different time zones.   Demonstrate skills in media sales.  Be well-versed in recruitment marketing.   Have a proven track record in driving revenue growth.   Have strong, demonstrated experience in a metrics-driven environment.  Be a results-driven individual with exceptional analytical skills.   Some Things We Bring to the Table Are:  Full health care package.   401(k) with company match.   Generous paid time off, including Holiday Break.   Access to a licensed nutritionist.   $7K toward purchase of first home.    Financial planning services.  Employee Assistance Program services.    And while your skill set is important to us, your attitude is just as significant. Our team is made up of emotionally healthy people who genuinely enjoy working together in positions they are passionate about. We do this in a drama-free work culture based on trust, respect, and humility. We promote based on consistent, quality performance and we intentionally nurture our team members’ professional development because we promote from within every chance we get. Our culture is more important to us than our product, though we take a tremendous amount of pride in both. As we like to say, brilliant jerks need not apply!  Think you’d like to interview for this opportunity? Apply now at n2co.com/opportunities !  Salary Range is between $125,000.00 - $145,000.00 plus competitive bonus structure. N2 is proud to provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all team members and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws. N2 complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.   #N2-G-LI    #W2N2

description: The Vice President of Microsoft Consulting and Sales oversees daily sales activity and the sales team, meets with major clients, draws up sales proposals and reports, designs new and more effective sales strategies, and works to market and promote company products and services. The Company specializes in Microsoft 365, Power Platform and Azure cloud services with broad professional services capabilities to include content management, front-end development, architecture, the building of platform services, security, analytics, and user experience. The ideal candidate must be growth focused with a prior history of closing $10 - $20 million plus in professional services annually.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities: · Drives lead generation and conversion using sales automation · Meets with existing clients to discuss a company’s products and services. · Expands all our existing clients and revenue from clients by 2-3x. · Acquires Net New logos for the Company and aggressively hits quotas · Works to foster lasting relationships with client base. · Locates opportunities to expand client base with new business/new logos. · Networks with prospective clients to persuade them to bring their business to the company. · Sets specific quarterly or annual sales goals and aggressively attains those goals. · Oversees the activity of sales associates. · Draws up sales activity reports. · Experience and diligent at tracking ALL sales activities in CRM tool, Hubspot. · Works to ensure sales and productivity goals are met. · Presents information regarding clients and sales at company meetings. · Devises new and innovative ways to market products and services. · Assists in designing marketing and promotional materials both in print and online. · Conducts independent research into target client base. · Leads in-house seminars and workshops to help improve the effectiveness and productivity of the sales team. · Willingness to travel 30-50% as needed once USA reopens. Required Knowledge, Skills and Abilities · Demonstrates detailed knowledge of the company’s products and services. · Possesses knowledge of competitive products and markets. · Exhibits strong interpersonal and customer service skills. · Demonstrates ability to think creatively. · Exhibits awareness of best sales practices and methods. · Works well with a team. · Demonstrates patience with reluctant or frustrated clients. · Exhibits familiarity with Microsoft Word, Excel, Power Point, and Outlook. · Communicates clearly and effectively. · Possesses strong persuasive abilities. · Demonstrates solid motivational and leadership skills. · Maintains a professional but confident and outgoing demeanor. · Can conduct independent research. · Demonstrates strong organizational skills.  Education: Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Marketing or Business a plus, however credit will be given for commensurate years of experience in these fields.  Experience: · Experience consulting on Microsoft cloud-based solutions · Certifications for all Microsoft cloud-solutions being represented · 7+ years of experience leading a professional services sales organization. · Must have managed a sales team of 10+ · Documented successful track record

Daytona Beach, Florida Phoenix Raceway Kansas Speedway Charlotte, North Carolina Watkins Glen International Talladega Superspeedway  At NASCAR, you will find a community of passionate individuals who care about our sport and are united in seeing it grow.  NASCAR is currently seeking a highly motivated, coachable, and passionate individual to join the best team in Motorsports as a Group Sales Account Executive.  Duties: Generate new sales revenue through prospecting, cold calling and in-person appointments Maintain a 60-80 call per day volume as well as an aggressive meetings schedule Responsible for the growth of existing relationships in order for the client to maximize spend and generate repeat business Assist with the creation, development and implementation of new concepts designed to generate new sales revenue streams Renew and up-sell existing group sales customers year-over-year Meet and exceed weekly, monthly, and yearly sales goals Set appointments with key decision makers in the community to assess the opportunity to develop and grow opportunities Proactively seek new leads through referrals, networking, and prospecting businesses and organizations Maintain accurate and detailed records of all current clients and prospects within our CRM system Provide superior customer service to clients and prospects both in-person and over the phone Execute group sales assets on race day Requires some nights/weekends and limited amounts of travel for conferences or trade shows Assist with additional duties and tasks as assigned Qualifications: Four year college degree – Bachelor of Arts or Bachelor of Science preferably in Sports Management, Business and/or Marketing and Communications Minimum one (1) year of sales experience, preferably in a sports sales environment Strong verbal, written and presentation skills Strong organizational, time management, and problem-solving skills Comfortable making cold calls on the phone Ability to function in a fast-paced environment, handle multiple projects simultaneously and adhere to deadlines Comfortable making face to face sales presentations Proficient computer skills including Microsoft Office Experience with Ticket.com ProVenue and Microsoft Dynamics 365 a plus Valid drivers license Additional Requirements:  The desired candidate must have a strong work ethic and be highly motivated to achieve sales goals. A successful candidate should also showcase excellent communications skills with the ability to have effective and frequent dialogue with prospects, clients, account managers and colleagues.  Apply Now!  Learn more about this role and our team by applying at www.careers.nascar.com for consideration.  We are a company unlike any other. We want you to bring your experience, skills and passion to our close-knit, high-energy environment in which our employees thrive and where you can prosper. We know the key to our success is our employees and we offer highly competitive salaries, a solid benefits package focused on wellness, and opportunities for you to grow and develop both personally and professionally. It won’t take you long to find out that you are on the right track here at NASCAR!  NASCAR is committed to fostering a diverse work environment where all employees feel valued and empowered. NASCAR is an Equal Opportunity Employer (EEO). We seek to attract and retain the best qualified people available. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, gender identity and expression, age, national origin, disability, religion, sexual orientation, genetic information, pregnancy, veteran status or any basis that is protected by applicable law except where a bona fide occupational qualification exists.  Follow us on Twitter @NASCARJobs to stay current on all of our openings.  Posted 30+ Days Ago Full time JR10617  The National Association for Stock Car Auto Racing (NASCAR) is the sanctioning body for the No. 1 form of motorsports in the United States and owner of 16 of the nation’s major motorsports entertainment facilities. NASCAR consists of three national series (NASCAR Cup Series™, NASCAR Xfinity Series™, and NASCAR Gander RV & Outdoors Truck Series™), four regional series (ARCA Menards Series, ARCA Menards Series East & West and the NASCAR Whelen Modified Tour), one local grassroots series and three international series. The International Motor Sports Association™ (IMSA®) governs the IMSA WeatherTech SportsCar Championship™, the premier U.S. sports car series. NASCAR also owns Motor Racing Network, Racing Electronics, Americrown Service and ONE DAYTONA. Based in Daytona Beach, Florida, with offices in eight cities across North America, NASCAR sanctions more than 1,200 races in more than 30 U.S. states, Canada, Mexico and Europe.  For more information visit www.NASCAR.com and www.IMSA.com , and follow NASCAR on Facebook , Twitter , Instagram , and Snapchat (‘NASCAR’).

Who we are:  SilverIP is fast-growth, Chicago-based Internet Service Provider (ISP), consistently ranked as one of the top independent networks in the region. We provide Gigabit Internet to multi-family buildings, businesses and to large events such as Lollapalooza.   Our unique service offering enables us to offer carrier-grade, high bandwidth Internet access service at highly competitive prices. We back our service with superior customer support and reliability through end-to-end control of our service delivery and proactive 24/7 network monitoring.    The Position:  As a Business Development Manager for SilverIP, you will play an important role in helping us build our commercial Internet and Events business in the greater Chicago region. This will involve building relationships with existing and prospective commercial clients within our on-net building network as well as further developing opportunities to provide Internet service to large indoor and outdoor events. Hands-on sales and technical training, a generous base salary, and a commission plan offers you significant earnings potential. A full benefits package takes effect within 30 days of employment.    This involves:  Create long-term, trusting relationships with our customers. The role is to oversee a portfolio of assigned customers, develop new business from existing clients and actively seek new sales opportunities. Develop a strategic plan to market Internet access services to prospective business customers located in our on-net commercial buildings. Compliment prospecting and selling efforts through field work such as building walkthroughs, lobby events, property management relationships, and customer face to face meetings. Develop our event portfolio business, which involves providing Internet access to indoor and outdoor event venues. Current customers include – Second City, Lollapalooza, Summerfest, among many others. Understand and effectively communicate SilverIP’s value proposition and our technology Oversee customer account management including negotiating contracts. Serve as the lead point of contact for all customer account management matters. Will report directly to the VP of Business Development  What you will need to bring:  Strong work ethic, self-motivation, and sales drive Effective communication Confident decision-making skills Strong ability to negotiate 3-5 years of business development, marketing or sales experience A college degree is preferred Hybrid work schedule – office and remote

Location: Seattle, WA Type: Full Time Department: Sales Status: Open  Job Description We are looking for a motivated sales development professional to join our Seattle team here at Panopto. If you want to join a dynamic, high-growth company and make a visible difference for our business, please read on.   About the role As a Sales Development Representative, you own everything to do with generating new qualified leads for our sales pipeline: strategy, planning, and making it happen. You own specific activity targets for qualifying potential customers from both inbound (they contact us) or outbound (we contact them) initiatives. In addition to these and other activity targets, you explore and recommend new creative outbound sales initiatives to drive qualified sales leads.   Our sales development team is accountable for meeting monthly and quarterly targets and is responsible for two things. First, speaking with and qualifying inbound sales leads. Second, developing new sales opportunities through outbound prospecting. This involves the responsibilities to: Source new sales opportunities through inbound lead follow-up, outbound cold calls, and emails. Collaborate on and develop your own demand generation through the creation of campaigns, sales leads and initiation of prospect calls. Understand how the Panopto platform is used by our customers to effectively qualify prospects based on their needs and requirements. Route qualified opportunities to the appropriate sales executives for further development and closure. Research accounts, identify key players and generate interest to maintain and expand your database of prospects within your assigned territory. Perform effective online demos to prospects and attend in-person trade shows and exhibitions to meet prospects. Assist sales people with other activities to help them bring new customers on board.   More about you We’d love to hear from you if you have great communication and listening skills, a genuine interest in what we do at Panopto and a fantastic attitude when faced with business challenges. Ideally you have: No fear when picking up the phones to cold call.  Proven inside sales or sales development experience converting prospects. Solid experience in opportunity qualification, pre-call planning and call control.  Track record of over-achieving quotas, targets or goals. Strong phone presence and experience dialing dozens of calls per day. Proficiency with corporate productivity and web presentation tools.        Ability to stay organized, multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively. Experience with technology and/or B2B sales.   Previous success qualifying opportunities involving multiple key decision makers. An interest in continuous learning and love trying new things.  Passion for working in a collaborative environment.  Experience working with Salesforce.com or similar CRM, Outreach, or ZoomInfo.  About Panopto At Panopto, we believe that video can have a transformative effect on learning. So we built a video platform that helps businesses and universities improve the way that they train, teach, and share knowledge. Since 2007, we have been a pioneer in video capture software, video management, and inside-video-search technology. Panopto has been adopted by more than 1,300 companies and universities worldwide with over eight million end users. Today, Panopto’s video management system is the largest repository of expert learning videos in the world. Headquartered in Seattle, with offices in Pittsburgh, London, Hong Kong, and Sydney, Panopto has received industry recognition for its innovation, rapid growth, and company culture  We expect a lot and so should you: Opportunity to learn and stretch your capabilities Market-competitive total compensation Employee stock options Paid time-off and holidays An award-winning work environment  Panopto’s mission is to help anyone share knowledge using video. Our user base is as diverse as the world’s universities and businesses. To fulfill our mission with the best products and services, we eagerly seek individuals who bring diversity of background, experience, and thought to create an engaging work environment, foster innovation and better understand and meet the needs of our users. We encourage people from underrepresented and/or marginalized backgrounds, including BIPOC, LatinX, LGBTQ+, women, and people with disabilities, to apply.  Panopto is an Equal Opportunity Employer.
