description: Job Summary  The Sales Development Team is a fast-growing group of sales professionals and core to the success of our Sales Teams. As a part of the Outbound SDR team, you will play a crucial role in identifying future customers, creating interest in OnSolve’s solutions, and booking meetings and demos with the potential of creating revenue.  The right person for this role will have a minimum of one year of experience cold prospecting for a technology-based company via telephone, email, and social media. A strong candidate must demonstrate behaviors associated with a high-performance sales culture to deliver consistent results against a sales quota. If you work hard and produce results in this role, the opportunity for growth is unparalleled! A successful candidate will have experience using Salesforce CRM and either SalesLoft or Outreach. This candidate should also hold a bachelor’s degree or have specialized and verifiable SDR training.   Responsibilities Strategically identify, prospect, and qualify sales leads for the Account Executive teams. Utilize intelligent, direct questions to speak knowledgeably with decision makers such as C-level Executives. Conduct preliminary needs analysis to determine the best approach for a potential client. Leverage resources effectively to create targeted messaging and educate prospective clients, highlight key features and benefits, overcomes objections, and gains buy in for solutions. Secure qualified meetings with decision makers. Accept feedback and coaching to continue to improve and develop skills. Making a minimum of 50 outbound phone calls per day. Executing a minimum of 100 prospecting activities per day. Meeting monthly or quarterly quota for executed demos and meetings for the sales team. Other duties as assigned.   Qualifications Bachelor’s degree OR candidates with one to three years’ related sales experience OR specialized SDR training Minimum of 1 year as an Outbound Sales Development Rep Interact professionally with prospects via email and telephone Outstanding communication skills, both oral and written Energetic and positive phone skills with a professional speaking voice Strong analytical and active listening skills Proficient in MS Office products Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment Highest level of integrity Experience with Salesforce.com CRM system advantageous A can-do attitude and a competitive spirit  The desire for a long-term career in sales  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

REMOTE ROLE: We're looking for a motivated, enthusiastic Inside Sales Representative who will be responsible for owning the sales cycle on new inbound sales enquiries at Blue Prism.    Duties & Responsibilities    Own sales cycle from discover, demo to close on all new inbound sales enquiries with companies under $1 Billion in revenue Develop new sales opportunities in existing customers with 3 or less digital workers through outbound prospecting. Conduct technical / consultative selling via phone. Actively ‘hunt' new logo sales in whitespace accounts with under $1Billion in revenue Close sales and achieve quotas. Develop territory business plan and frequently update according to key industries, markets, and customers with ability to adapt to changing market conditions. Present new solutions or benefits of increasing current license amount to customers in a way that addresses their needs; use selling techniques to advance the sales cycle; leverages points of agreement to gain buy-in and commitment for moving forward. Prioritize daily activities, meet goals and timelines, and utilize exceptional time management skills. Utilize Salesforce.com to track activity and update lead, account, and opportunity information, as well as sales pipeline accurately and effectively with a focus on winning business. Assist in the development of best practices within the lead generation sales process. Understand and communicate the value of doing business with Blue Prism. Help train recently promoted ADRs to the ISR methodology.  Dimensions of the Role    Organizational interlocks: Business Development, Channel Sales, Pre-Sales, Field Marketing, Marketing Operations, Sales Operations, Product Marketing, Product Marketing Technologies Supporting the role: SalesForce, SalesLoft, LeadIQ, Lusha, Linkedin Sales Navigator, full Microsoft Office suite Success Metrics: Hitting sales quota KPIs: Speaking to a certain % of your assigned customers over a quarter and a year, booking a certain amount of meetings for yourself every month, completing a certain number of demos per quarter, reaching your quarterly sales quota  Requirements:  Competencies   Two to three years of prospecting experience (BDR/SDR/ISR) in enterprise software (automation experience a plus) B2B experience a must. Familiarity with Salesforce, Salesloft (or Outreach)  Additional Skills   Strong verbal & written communication skills Active listening to assess prospect needs & opportunities Ability to articulate a high-quality value proposition on every call Ability to perform prospect & account research to prepare for calls Ability to use existing and emerging social media tools to monitor targeted accounts and buying groups, and identify trigger events for follow-up Discipline and energy to maintain high activity volumes A desire for a career in tech sales and ambition to progress Speaking another language other than English would be brilliant, but not essential  No one candidate will be a 100% perfect match to our description, so if you thrive in an intellectually-charged environment and have similar experience to what we are looking for, we encourage you to apply.   Benefits:  Flexible Vacation: We're a team of innovators who work hard, and with hard work comes much needed time off. We all need time off! We offer a flexible vacation plan for all our employees that offers great work/life balance 401K Match Parental Leave: Blue Prism fully supports all types of families as they welcome a new child into their home Employee Share Plan: Our employees are our biggest advocates! We offer the incentive to be included in our growth via RSUs  Blue Prism is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, alienage or national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, arrest record or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at Blue Prism via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of Blue Prism. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by Blue Prism as a result of the referral or through other means.

With over 160 years of innovation, we are moving faster than ever by introducing new products, services, and strategies to bring greater value to our business customers. If you have proven ability to establish new business relationships, advance your sales career with American Express, one of the world’s most respected and recognized brands.  The Manager of Business Development's key responsibility is to solicit merchants in southern New Jersey & Delaware to accept the American Express Card as a form of payment from their customers focusing on B2B sales. This position will identify key merchant prospects with up to $300M in annual revenue and implement effective sales strategies and solutions. Managers of Business Development utilize their in-depth knowledge of American Express, the industry and their prospects to provide solutions. Additional responsibilities include: gathering and disseminating marketplace and competitive information, coordinating all internal resources necessary to facilitate each sale, and executing proper account set-up and merchant training.  Successful Mangers of Business Development use their prospecting and cold calling skills to identify, filter and qualify leads to effectively manage a pipeline of prospects. They plan strategically, research and are knowledgeable about the industries and markets they call on. They possess strong analytical, organizational, decision-making, negotiation, oral, written and interpersonal skills. Strong financial acumen is also necessary in order to effectively explain the financial and marketing value of product solutions to close sales. Managers of Business Development must also possess the ability to prepare and present formal presentations and use their excellent consultative solution selling skills to ensure long-term relationship building and meet business goals. A University Degree and 5 years of successful outside sales experience is strongly preferred. Proficiency with PC applications (MS Office, Outlook, Excel, Power Point). Proficiency with Salesforce.com an asset. Working knowledge of related American Express products and services is considered an asset. Knowledge of the territory. Residence in the territory is required with up to 5% overnight travel within territory. Strong financial and business acumen. Self-disciplined and self-motivated to work on own in a home office environment. Experienced in prospecting for leads. Must reside in Southern New Jerey Applicant must have a valid driver's license. A motor vehicle records check will be conducted for all successful candidates at the time of offer. Disclosure of all moving violations within the last 3 years (Including, but not limited to: speeding tickets, refusal to submit to blood alcohol content, reckless driving, leaving scene of accident, and driver’s license suspension for moving violations) is required during the application process.  American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.  Employment eligibility to work with American Express in the U.S. is required as the company will not pursue visa sponsorship for these positions.

Position overview Honor My Decisions (HMD) is seeking a Sales Executive (Healthcare Market-Remote) – Contract to sell a software-as-a-service advance care planning solution to hospitals, health systems, academic medical centers, and large independent physician practices in the United States.  There is no cap on commissions for this position.  What will be my duties and responsibilities in this job? Meets and/or exceeds all assigned sales quotas and performance goals; effectively manages assigned market independently, develops a pipeline of qualified prospects, engages in a consultative sales process, and closes them. Develops full understanding of product value proposition, features, and differentiating traits vs. competitive landscape; speaks comfortably and confidently about HMD’s offering and accurately identifies how solution will meet and surpass client needs and performance goals. Provides timely and complete reporting on the status of the sales plan, pipeline growth, and sales progress using tools determined by executive management. Maintains industry and product knowledge, adapting to changes in the market/competition, participating in regional/national meetings/forums, and driving brand/deliverable awareness within the target healthcare market.  What are the requirements for this position? 5+ years of new account consultative sales experience for healthcare technology products or services.  What critical skills are needed in this position? Capable of executing the full sales cycle, understanding the competition, effectively collaborate with HMD colleagues, and be a trusted advisor to clients. Excellent cold-calling and prospecting skills – must have a “hunter” drive and be self-reliant to identify opportunities. Ability to sell value over price by providing deep insight about how the service will impact the client’s business. Very strong internal and external communication skills, with the ability to listen comprehensively and deliver clear recommendations and guidance. Excellent selling and sales strategy skills, including the ability to close opportunities. Strong sales technology capabilities including proficiency and comfort using Microsoft Office Suite (especially Excel and PowerPoint), Zoom, and Pipedrive sales CRM. Demonstrated consultative sales experience where sales are dependent on persuading multiple stakeholders and influencers within complex healthcare organizations. Knowledge of healthcare operations and how to overcome perceived constraints in getting doctors and clinical staff to successfully adopt new processes in the office environment.  How much should I expect to travel? Up to 40% of the time (sometimes on short notice) for meetings with prospects and clients (when we are not in the midst of a public health emergency).  Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Statement Honor My Decisions is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

Founded in 2010, New Tradition is one of the fastest-growing Out-Of-Home media companies in the United States as well as one of the largest independent operators of large format digital and static signage. With a focus on urban core environments, New Tradition provides advertising platforms for national brands and advertising agencies throughout the country. This includes signage in: New York, Los Angeles, Boston, Nashville, Miami, San Antonio, San Francisco, Seattle, Portland, Las Vegas, Baltimore, and Washington, D.C.  Position: Sales Coordinator  Location: Los Angeles, CA (Marina Del Rey)  Overview: We're looking for a highly motivated, determined, detail oriented Sales Coordinator to help with day-to-day business operations of a rapidly growing media company. The ideal candidate will be an entrepreneurial self-starter, who is comfortable working in a fast paced, process driven environment and possess the ability to think strategically when faced with changing conditions and demands. The purpose of the Sales Coordinator is to perform all administrative functions throughout the sales process, occurring both before and after the contract phase. This includes but is not limited to prospecting new customers leads for the sales team, preparing sales presentations and proposals, and coordinating the execution of advertising campaigns sold by the sales team. In addition, there may be other tasks assigned by Account Executives, Sales Manager, and/or Management.  The right mindset is more crucial than years of experience. We are seeking someone who is motivated with a desire to develop and with a no excuses mentality.  Essential functions and responsibilities are included below, but are not limited to: Prepares sales presentations and proposals for Account Executives. Coordinates, requests and manage client inventory holds through operations. Maintain customer database or CRM by inputting customer requests and updates. Prospect new customers leads. Coordinate and monitor the ongoing activities and internal communications related to advertising campaigns. Continually update marketing materials to ensure most current and accurate information is portrayed.  Knowledge, Skills, and Ability Requirements: Must be organized, detail-oriented and computer literate in databases, spreadsheets (i.e. Microsoft Office applications) Must be able to multi-task in a fast pace environment Passionate, self-starter with a friendly personality who can work as part of a team with the ability to receive and provide feedback Can do and will do attitude with and without direction and specific instruction Must have high level of interpersonal skills to handle sensitive and confidential situations Ability to timely and accurately enter and compile data Energy, enthusiasm, and the ability to meet deadlines High level of organizational skills, and excellent attention to detail Creativity, initiative combined with commercial awareness Knowledge of common public relations practices Strong written (Email) and verbal communication skills Highly organized with a systematic approach to detail-oriented work Comfortable working in a deadline driven environment Ability to work independently and act on own initiative  Full Time Job

Regional Sales Consultant – Central Region Remote-Home Office (available CT and for periodic travel to customer visits once restrictions lifted) If you are an inside salesperson, account manager, business development manager or account executive this role is for you!  The Myers-Briggs Company, the worlds most recognized name in supporting talent development, is looking for another A player for its US Enterprise Sales team. We are looking for someone who understands that attitude, emotional intelligence, urgency and a strong commitment to accountability are the cornerstones of success in their roles.  This position would be ideal for someone who has a proven record as a player coach or for that very special person who has been overachieving as an individual contributor and thinks they are ready to take this to the next level  The Regional Sales Consultant, SE is a true player/coach role who will be responsible for initiating, developing, and establishing new business within the region, to increase and grow revenue streams, while sustaining existing business in states within the assigned territory of the South East region. Leverage sales methodology (i.e. Sandler) to ensure sales processes are used methodically to drive successful outcomes in a B2B market. Use industry expertise to coach, manage and develop regional Customer Success Representatives to develop their capabilities to identify, develop and close new opportunities. Maintain current and accurate customer contact database (Salesforce) and manage customer accounts engagement with The Myers- Briggs Company product and services.  Your responsibilities will include: Attainment of Identified Accounts Revenue Goal - Work in tandem with Customer Success Reps within the territory to complete daily tasks and strategy. Initiate conduct and follow-up on sales calls designed to grow MB strategic market(s). Conduct regular schedule of meetings (in-person and remote) with region’s Top 150 customers, F1000 customers & to prospective customers in MB’s strategic market(s), conduct regional business development strategy to develop and expand portfolio of customers within region. Daily use of Salesforce.com tasks, leads module and Opportunity pipeline is required. Lead Regional Account Revenue Strategy Meetings on a weekly basis. When required, provide appropriate client participants for MBC product review panels, focus groups, testimonials, case studies and other customer-based input requirements. Collect and add customer needs/trends information in MBC strategic market(s) to Salesforce.com CRM to keep it current. Respond to the Senior Vice President, Global Sales with accurate and well-researched data to requests for customer/market-based information. Manage Regional Customer Success Representatives by working closely to consistently hit or exceed individual quarterly sales quotas and KPIs, while executing on the key strategies for their region. Partner with and support the SVP of Global Sales to finalize, rollout and monitor the achievement of KPIs within team thru coaching and development opportunities. Provide ongoing performance coaching to ensure team success that includes developing and delivering performance evaluations and goals for each Representative. Proactively identify and partner HR to effectively address and manage performance or employee relations issues to resolution. Lead regional progress meetings to identify trends across the regional sales team, identifying barriers (and steps to remove along with timeline) as well as key learnings. Report out regularly on progress and status to SVP of Global Sales. Gathering and leveraging actionable insights from the market in order to drive performance  Your Professional Experience Includes: 3+ years of Consultative Sales experience at the enterprise level. Proven closer who fully understands pipeline dynamics, enterprise selling methodology 3+ years experience managing employees Personality that exhibits and understands the performance value of urgency, transparency, accountability and goal based time management Strong EQ, Learning Agility and Critical Thinking skills Training and high-level execution skills in sourcing new business in a timely, stage driven methodology Experience with ERP systems, Salesforce.com and any outreach Basic math competency; strong analytical skills; excellent communication skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills. B.A. or B.S. degree required   Our corporate culture is mission driven. We are a certified B Corp and a California benefit corporation, taking all stakeholders (including our employees, community, customers, and the environment) into account to make a positive difference. We have a culture that is emotionally intelligent, aligned, results-focused, cross-functional and committed to the professional development of all employees.  While we’re best known for our products like the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator® assessment (MBTI®), our reach extends well beyond a single instrument. We are a group of professionals who provide expertise in the talent development industry, as well as to career counselor and educators and individual consumers. We offer solutions to help improve individual and organizational performance and address whatever people development challenges businesses and professionals face – from team building, leadership, coaching, and conflict management to career development, selection, and retention. Perhaps this is why millions of individuals in more than 170 countries use our products and services each year. Our customers include the majority of the Fortune 500 companies, as well as businesses of all sizes, educators, government agencies, training and development consultants and consumers looking to understand themselves better.  Working at The Myers-Briggs Company gives you the opportunity to make a positive difference, be accountable, experience genuine respect from your colleagues and peers, and feel valued and supported. We work to create an environment that fosters excellence and encourages employees to contribute, learn, and grow throughout their career.  Our company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

description: Company Profile: Pelican Brewing Company is among the Northwest's most award winning and fastest growing craft beer brands.  Born at the beach in Pacific City in 1996, Pelican Brewing Company has been crafting beers with passion, purpose & integrity for over 20 years. Our sales team works individually and collaboratively to sell craft beer in an assigned territory and represent Pelican Brewing Company at numerous events.  Job Profile: The Pelican Brewery Sales Team is seeking a detail-oriented and self-motivated individual to join our beer sales team to pursue an engaging & purposeful career opportunity. This position will represent our brand with great pride, serving as an ambassador for the Pelican brand, building and maintaining strong relationships with our distributors and wholesalers.   As the Brewery Sales Rep for Portland, Oregon you will show off your passion and knowledge about craft beer and have fun planning and participating in various promotional events   Qualifications: ·       3+ years sales experience in craft beer or similar industry ·       Excellent communication and presentation skills - Ability to talk to others to convey information effectively; ·       Strong problem solving skills - Independent, reliable, and self-motivated with a solid work ethic. ·       Active listening – Ability to understand your retailer by listening to their needs and filling those needs ·       Inner drive - You like pursuing new accounts while maintaining strong customer service with current accounts. ·       Experience meeting and exceeding sales goals.  ·       Highly social. You enjoy working with and meeting new people. ·       Must be available to work nights and weekend and lift and/or move up to 50 pounds ·       MUST CURRENTLY RESIDE IN OR BE WILLING TO RELOCATE TO DESIGNATED TERRRITORY  Job Responsibilities & Duties: Deliver exceptional customer service with both distributors and accounts Show off your passion and knowledge about craft beer and have fun planning and participating in various promotional events such as tap takeovers and brewfests. Attend networking events, socialize with clients, frequently visit clients at their business to check in, etc. ·       Enjoy building strong relationships and taking care of each individual customer. Partner with wholesalers and distributors. ·       Meet or exceed monthly sales goals and tap into your earning potential. ·       Analyze current accounts and potential new accounts in your market. Create and implement your sales strategy. ·       Maintain a sales budget, track inventory and orders of wholesale partners ·       Understand and embrace the Pelican Brewery company philosophy and core values  What Pelican Brewery Sales Has To Offer: We care deeply about the wellbeing of our team members. Our full-time team members are eligible to receive our robust benefits package, including, but not limited to, medical (company pays 90% of premiums for employees and 25% for dependents), dental, vision, 401(k) with a match up to 4%, paid time off, and employee discounts.  Humility | Agility | Tenacity | Empathy | Entrepreneurial Spirit | Generosity | Optimism

description: Würth Baer Supply Company is one of the nation's leading specialty wholesale distributors to the woodworking industry, offering an extensive inventory of decorative and functional hardware and fittings, tools, shop supplies, surfacing materials, and board and panel products.  We are currently seeking a results-driven Territory Manager to help us with our new and existing customers in the Cincinnati market. As a sales representative, you will work independently and decide how to best grow your market.  You will look for top solutions for both the company and our customers and deliver quality service and reliability to your customers. Your responsibilities include handling current customer accounts, growing sales and growing your accounts overall. Treat your territory as if it is your own business, use your follow up skills and help us become the company of choice for our customers.  Note: Because the territory is mainly within the Cincinnati area, someone who is familiar with this geography will have an advantage. With hundreds of established accounts already in the book of business and with the expected major growth, success is highly attainable.  Requirements: · Two (2) years of demonstrated success in outside sales experience, preferably in the woodworking or industrial/distribution arena · Bachelor's degree is preferred · Advanced Excel skills · Excellent communication skills  Role Characteristics: · Strong follow-up skills · Highly organized · Multitasking · Ability, skills and knowledge to effectively work from home · Professional · Polished · A strong desire to succeed and grow financially  To help you succeed, we offer hands-on training and professional development, this includes visits to our headquarters, product training, shadowing experienced Territory Managers, and personalized one-on-one training with the high performing Sales Managers.  We offer the following employee benefits: · Competitive Wages · Monthly automobile allowance · A variety of excellent health insurance choices · Company matched 401(k)  Equal Opportunity Employer'

This position provides sales support for a focused team selling Penguin Random House children's book to new and existing accounts in the Premium Literacy channel within Special Markets. This position will also report to the VP, Director of the department.  Responsibilities Responds to all general inquiries received via general phone line/email inbox, from Customer Service and .biz website, and from publishing divisions; opens new accounts; directs customer iteraction, supports new and existing customers with pricing, ordering details, and tracking; submits orders internally with all required follow up. Generally, supports sales reps with literacy-focused accounts on the following: customer sampling needs; PO and customer-specific print order internal routing process; order tracking through various internal teams; customer presentations; generating presentations docs and needed materials; sales pitches; contact sourcing; runs ad-hoc reports as needed. Specifically, supports team (using a project management focus) with department's highest-billing account as well as other key accounts. Researches and builds P&L's for supervisor's accounts for use in assessing potential printing deals Curates and maintains title lists and/or create grids to meet ad-hoc title needs for accounts and new business opportunities Attends regular in-house sales presentations; occasional on/off-site customer sale meetings Work across multiple departments within PRH including Publishing Offices, Inventory Management, Production, Marketing, Supply Chain, Sales Operations, Customer Service, and Credit. Meeting prep ranges from creating presentations and PowerPoint decks to gathering materials (digital & physical); generating Edelweiss collections; etc. Requirements Excellent organizational skills and the ability to prioritize multiple assignments Ability to work under pressure and maintain attention to detail Strengths in problem-solving, customer relationship building, negotiating, and other account management related skills Excellent communication skills layered with ability to work within a team Interest in children's publishing, children's books, coupled with interest in sales are all plusses Strong follow up skills PC proficiency (Microsoft Office 365) Previous publishing experience or bookstore experience very helpful Full-time employees are eligible for our comprehensive benefits program. Our range of benefits include, but are not limited to, Medical/Prescription drug insurance, Dental, Vision, Health Care/Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, Health Savings Account, Pre-Tax and Roth 401(k), Short and Long-Term Disability Insurance, Life/AD&D Insurance, Commuter Benefits, Student Loan Repayment Program, Educational Assistance & generous paid time off.  Penguin Random House is the leading adult and children's publishing house in North America, the United Kingdom and many other regions around the world. In publishing the best books in every genre and subject for all ages, we are committed to quality, excellence in execution, and innovation throughout the entire publishing process: editorial, design, marketing, publicity, sales, production, and distribution. Our vibrant and diverse international community of nearly 250 publishing brands and imprints include Ballantine Bantam Dell, Berkley, Clarkson Potter, Crown, DK, Doubleday, Dutton, Grosset & Dunlap, Little Golden Books, Knopf, Modern Library, Pantheon, Penguin Books, Penguin Press, Penguin Random House Audio, Penguin Young Readers, Portfolio, Puffin, Putnam, Random House, Random House Children's Books, Riverhead, Ten Speed Press, Viking, and Vintage, among others. More information can be found at http://www.penguinrandomhouse.com/.  Penguin Random House values the array of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status. description: Altec specializes in the manufacture, sale and service of aerial devices, digger derricks, cranes and specialty equipment for the electric utility, telecommunications, tree care, construction, and light and sign maintenance industries in more than 120 countries throughout the world.  Altec Supply is currently looking for an Outside Sales Representative / Account Manager located in Austin, TX; San Antonio, TX; Houston, TX; and surrounding areas. Altec Supply provides aftermarket parts, accessories and service needs for our customer's equipment. Primary responsibilities include the following:  Produce sales of products in a designated area or designated account(s) to meet pre-established quotas. Manage and support the designated area of responsibility consistent with Altec values. Utilize skills in territory management, account management, and time management. Perform sales calls, presentations, and product demonstrations. Assist in establishing quotas, pricing, forecasting, and receivables collections. Attend product/sales meetings. Develop external and internal personal customer relationships. Complete all sales related paperwork such as sales call logs and expense reports. Maintain a high level of customer service. Produce product sales to meet or exceed established quota. Build and maintain customer profiles and market data. Ensure that sales strategic plan and critical issues are met.  Please apply directly on our website https://jobs.altec.com/  U.S. Military Veterans and Spouses are Encouraged to Apply See https://altecveteranrecruiting.com   Education, Experience, and Skills Required Four-year Bachelor's Degree required. Current valid driver’s license required. At least two years of applicable experience preferred.  Product and/or industry knowledge preferred. Must be available for moderate overnight travel. Total communication and information processing skills are required. PC skills using spreadsheets, word processing, and other office management applications required.  The job level is able to be adjusted at time of hire, if the candidate meets the qualifications for jobs of a more experienced level in the career path.   Customer First - Enjoyment of Work - Family - Financial Stability - Integrity - People are our Greatest Strength - Quality - Spiritual Development – Teamwork  Competitive pay which rewards performance  Comprehensive benefits including Medical, Dental and Prescription Drug Program - Retirement 401(k) Program - Vacation and Holidays - Flexible Spending Accounts - Tuition Assistance Program - Employee Assistance and Mental Health/Substance Abuse Program - Life Insurance, Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance Altec Industries, Inc. and its affiliates are equal opportunity employers and maintain affirmative action plans to recruit, retain, develop, and promote qualified individuals without unlawful consideration of race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Altec strives to maintain a work environment free from unlawful discrimination and harassment, where associates are treated with respect and dignity.

Company Description  As the world’s leader in digital payments technology, Visa’s mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network - enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive. Our advanced global processing network, VisaNet, provides secure and reliable payments around the world, and is capable of handling more than 65,000 transaction messages a second. The company’s dedication to innovation drives the rapid growth of connected commerce on any device, and fuels the dream of a cashless future for everyone, everywhere. As the world moves from analog to digital, Visa is applying our brand, products, people, network and scale to reshape the future of commerce.  At Visa, your individuality fits right in. Working here gives you an opportunity to impact the world, invest in your career growth, and be part of an inclusive and diverse workplace. We are a global team of disruptors, trailblazers, innovators and risk-takers who are helping drive economic growth in even the most remote parts of the world, creatively moving the industry forward, and doing meaningful work that brings financial literacy and digital commerce to millions of unbanked and underserved consumers.  You’re an Individual. We’re the team for you. Together, let’s transform the way the world pays.  Job Description  By joining one of our teams at Visa Payments Limited, a division of Visa Inc since 2019, you’ll have an opportunity to shape the payments experience globally. Being part of Visa, the world’s leader in digital payments technology, our mission is to connect the world through the most creative, reliable and secure payment network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive.  Visa Payments Limited (VPL) is a financial technology business that provides cross-border payment processing services to banks and payments businesses across six continents through its global network.  Individuality fuels our brand and our global team – we are proud that we are a talented team of 18,000 individuals with unique backgrounds, perspectives and experiences. Therefore, we understand that you are much more than your day job. We encourage quality of life both within and outside of the office, and whether it is taking advantage of agile work schedules or our wellness programs, Visa Payments Limited and Visa Inc. respects and encourages meaningful work/life balance for everyone.  If you think you could support the Visa family by joining Visa Payments Limited as a Sales Executive, LAC Director, we want to hear from you.  Bank and cross border business development Lead for Visa Direct Payouts sits within Visa Payments Limited, an integral part of Visa Direct, with the objective to unleash the power of Visa to ‘beyond the card’. This enables Visa clients to send and/or receive money through bank accounts around the world. The Partner Management & Acquisition (PM&A) team is responsible for the sales, acquisition, management and oversight of external payment bank/non-bank service providers. You will work within a dynamic team that acts as key point of contact for numerous internal stakeholders; businesses, project management, technology and operational division. The team is regularly called upon as the subject matter expert for discussion around new client opportunities to ensure that we source and deliver for the best client solution.  RESPONSIBILITES Bank and cross border specialized sales in Latin America and Caribbean (LAC). Regional business development expanding the Visa Direct Pay-outs network focused on bringing new business opportunities to the product group by broadcasting externally that Visa is the best way to pay and be paid. Identify and develop cutting edge go-to-market opportunities and bank client partnerships for VISA. The Sales Executive works as part of the regional Visa Direct regional LAC team, and is responsible for working with the regional Account Executives in LAC to expand key Visa relationships for the cross-border payments access. This will entail finding and acquiring new business sales prospects into clients in accordance to the client acquisition process and Visa Payments Limited network connectivity requirements. The focus is to execute sales activity in a defined market segment and or geographic territory to drive cross border payments solutions via the Visa Direct Payouts network. Offer bi-lateral solutions to banks in LAC for inbound and outbound cross-border payments. Expand delivery channels to global and intra-regional remittances, B2C and B2SB corridors. Oversee and monitor the end-to-end process of selection to successful on-boarding of new clients, working with technical, operational, and commercial teams to resolve any issues and manage the successful completion in accordance with agreed timetable. Work with VPL on-boarding team to address and deliver route demand from current and new clients. Work in partnership with VPL network team to provide compelling value proposition relating to routes, local capabilities, pricing linked to volume, FX etc. Develop and maintain senior relationships with relevant management personnel in banking and non-banking partner businesses. Through structured, professional, informed and professional dialogue demonstrate Visa Payments Limited as a highly experienced, credible and compelling payment banking partner worthy of relationships at senior levels of its partner companies Work with wider team (locally and regionally) and sales and marketing, to identify, plan and deliver effective marketing and brand building events and engagements with clients and partners. WHY THIS IS IMPORTANT TO VISA  Visa’s mission is to connect the word through the most innovative, reliable and secure payment network, enabling individuals, businesses and economies to thrive; while Visa’s vision is to be the best way to pay and be paid for everyone, everywhere. The role offers unique and exciting opportunity to support Visa’s mission and vision in enabling Visa clients to send and/or receive money through bank accounts around the world which can only be achieved through robust partner network building. As a Business Developer for Visa Direct Pay-outs for Latin America & the Caribbean, your role is critical in building the strong partner network foundation and pillars to support Visa’s business expansion in these key markets.  Qualifications  Basic Qualifications 10 years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or at least 8 years of work experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters/ MBA/JD/MD) or at least 3 years of work experience with a PhD Preferred Qualifications 12+ years of work experience with a Bachelor’s Degree or 8-10 years of experience with an Advanced Degree (e.g. Masters, MBA, JD, MD) or 6+ years of work experience with a PhD At least 12 years of relevant experience in a global bank or payment company Experience in dealing with banks in Latin America & the Caribbean Knowledge of Global Payments and transaction banking Spanish essential, Portuguese preferred Experience in Sales and Business Development Additional Information  Work Hours  Incumbent must make themselves available during core business hours.  Physical Requirements  This position, in future, may be performed in an office setting. The position will require the incumbent to sit and stand at a desk, communicate in person and by telephone, frequently operate standard office equipment, such as telephones and computers, and reach with hands and arms.  Travel Requirements  This position requires the incumbent to travel for work about 30% of the time  Universal acceptance for everyone, everywhere, is not only our brand promise, it’s the foundation of our company culture. We foster a feeling of connectedness in the workplace, support diversity of thought, culture and background, fight for important initiatives like Equal Pay and actively work to eliminate unconscious biases that hold us all back.  By leveraging the diverse backgrounds and perspectives of our worldwide teams, Visa is a better place to work and a better business partner to our clients.  All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  Job Number: REF002279W

description: Overview  Directs and coordinates activities of one or more divisions and participates in formulating and developing long range goals and objectives.  Responsibilities Responsible for the realization of division objectives for sales and revenues. Will create and utilize comprehensive sales plans that analyze competitive trends, gains and other activities in order to devise effective counter strategies and tactics. â€¢ Responsible for appropriate staffing, maintenance, and development of the sales organization in order to accomplish the division's goals and objectives. â€¢ Will organize the structure of management to ensure that the sales organization is appropriately staffed for the achievement of division and supplier sales objectives. â€¢ Responsible for communicating to all sales management personnel the sales goals of the organization to be established in a sales plan incorporating supplier objectives. â€¢ Obtains and monitors feedback regarding customers & suppliers needs and attitudes in order to update sales strategies, forecasts and projections. â€¢ Will make monthly sales forecasts in the last week of each month for the following month to be communicated for inclusion in the product calculations for timely procurement activities. Qualifications  Master's college degree, preferred; four to ten years of management experience in adult beverage industry; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Have knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite software and order processing systems or the aptitude to learn. Requires a current, valid state driver's license, ability to meet vehicle insurance requirements as defined by the Company and Alcohol Beverage Commission (ABC) License, as required by the state. The employee must regularly lift up to 50 pounds and will occasionally lift up to 100 pounds. We are an Equal Opportunity employer.

About The Role  ALICE is looking for a full-time remote Sales Coordinator to help with the organization and coordination of our growing sales team. This role will be responsible for performing daily tasks that assist our Sales Team including scheduling meetings, prospect outreach, and acting as a liaison between our Sales Managers and prospective customers. This role will work primarily on Eastern Standard Time with some work during Central and West Coast Time Zones.  Responsibilities Provide excellent customer service to our customers through strong written and verbal communication Assist in managing and progressing towards KPI and key metrics set out by the Sales and Marketing team Work closely with the Sales Development Representative in managing leads and scheduling Sales Managers for demos Develop a trusting and long term relationship with our accounts Support Sales Managers in managing prospects and customers in SalesForce Assist in preparation for travel and trade shows Experience Profile: relevant past experience Bachelor’s Degree preferred 1-2 years of experience in either a SaaS environment or hospitality industry. Experience with CRMs, particularly Salesforce Experience assisting a team of individuals in managing schedules and tasks Previous experience editing legal documents Excellent written and verbal skills Excellent organization, presentation, and communication skills Proficiency in working with Google Drive and Microsoft Office, particularly in Excel Ability to travel 10-15% of the time You will be successful here if you have: Eagerness to learn and grow at a fast-paced company Interest in learning technical skills and data analysis work Multi-tasking down to a science Self-sufficiency in time management and prioritization Experience in hospitality tech About ALICE:  ALICE is the leading all-in-one hospitality operations platform that enables hotel staff to do their most impactful work without all the guesswork. Task management, real-time communication, and operational analytics reduce the complexity and chaos of hotel operations providing the transparency and flexibility needed to run efficiently. Founded in 2013, ALICE works with more than 2,500 hotels and tens of thousands of hotel staff across many of the world’s leading brands, including Marriott International, Hilton Hotels & Resorts, Graduate Hotels, and Grupo Posadas. ALICE is a Top 10 Best Places to Work in Hotel Tech by Hotel Tech Report in 2021, winner of Best Concierge Software, a Top 10 People's Choice Software and Finalist for its Preventative Maintenance Software, Housekeeping, and Staff Collaboration Tools, at the 2021 HotelTechAwards. https://www.aliceplatform.com/  Compensation and Benefits: Competitive Salary Flexible Time Off Wonderful Remote Environment & Team Culture Virtual Team Events You will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. description: Job Introduction To drive our future wholesale growth within the USA, we are seeking a Senior Account Executive to sell our menswear, womenswear, footwear, accessories, and specialist ranges to our chain store accounts across the country. We are looking for an experienced and successful sales professional from within the wholesale sector of the fashion industry, with a strong feel for product and established relationships and networks within our potential customer base. This position will report into the Wholesale Manager. This is a fast growing and increasingly important part of our business and will deliver a significant proportion of our growth in the coming years. Main Responsibilities Develop and maintain strong client relationships with our chain stores across the country Generate new business and increase sales volumes through existing customers Identify new opportunities for growth, product development, and new channels of distribution Travel to prospective new accounts and visit current clients Present product overview information to relevant new potential clients ensuring they have an understanding of the brand and the company direction Collaborate with sales team on seasonal strategies and present the seasonal plans to leadership Provide detailed sales reporting on territory by month and season Schedule all market appointments and perform sales in showroom and tradeshows Collaborate with brands to optimize marketing and attract a wider customer base Ensure that the sales model and supporting processes are embedded and continuously improved, that customer service and satisfaction are placed at the forefront of the sales process, and that appropriate metrics and measures are put in place to monitor performance Work with the team to both receive orders and manage the accounts to ensure efficient and effective communication and delivery of orders Provide comprehensive feedback at the end of the selling season to enhance the design process Perform other related duties as assigned or requested The Ideal Candidate Experienced with 5+ years in a sales role within the Wholesale industry Experienced with the customer base of major fashion retail chains stores Skilled with advanced knowledge of MS Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook) Able to establish and maintain excellent relationships with colleagues at all levels and external clients Able to plan ahead, work with high level of integrity and confidentiality and work and multi-task in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment Extremely organized and very detail-oriented; self-motivated and capable of working independently on multiple projects Package Description Excellent basic salary Bonus structure Medical insurance, Life insurance, 401k 50% staff discount At Superdry, everyone has a voice and we want to hear it. We create environments where individuality can flourish and is celebrated as part of who we are as a brand. We’re incredibly proud that over 90% of our people feel strongly that they can be themselves at work. We want to meet people with varied backgrounds because we understand that diversity of thought encourages new ideas to thrive, fueling creativity and enabling us to do better work. We want to build a team which represents a variety of backgrounds, styles, perspectives, and skills; we hire people based on their merit and potential. We also welcome conversations about flexible working for all roles at Superdry and will always accommodate it where possible.  Applicants for employment in the U.S. must possess unrestricted work authorization which does not require sponsorship by the employer.

jobTitle: Manager Key Accounts - Global Corporate Sales
description: About The Role  We are hiring a talented individual with skills to establish, own, manage, grow and retain a portfolio of key B2B customers, focusing on driving revenue and best practice adoption through deep understanding of customers’ needs, challenges and opportunities within their business. Developing a strategic tailored account plan and to drive customer success & achieve revenue targets. Responsible for the identification, acquisition, implementation, development, and retention of a line of business that that Qatar Airways manages and develops globally.  Other Key Strategic & Operational Duties Would Include Develop strong customer relationships that deliver impactful results on ambitious annual targets. Responsible for account management across the full sales cycle (identification, acquisition, implementation, development, and retention) for the identified line of business using data as a key reference point. For all accounts in the portfolio, account management applies for all points-of-sale and points-of-origin. Based on the knowledge gained from managing the line of business, provide recommendations to management on: Development of the commercial strategy; Introduction of new product/routes and service offerings; and Business opportunities and risks for Qatar Airways. Achieve and exceed the assigned revenue target and personal revenue target for each financial year. Initiate and drive negotiations by conducting regular reviews with clients, to understand their requirements and provide them with competitive options to derive maximum revenue Be part of an extraordinary story  Your skills. Your imagination. Your ambition. Here, there are no boundaries to your potential and the impact you can make. You’ll find infinite opportunities to grow and work on the biggest, most rewarding challenges that will build your skills and experience. You have the chance to be a part of our future, and build the life you want while being part of an international community.  Our best is here and still to come. To us, impossible is only a challenge. Join us as we dare to achieve what’s never been done before.  Together, everything is possible.  Qualifications  About You  We are looking for a passionate and experienced professional to join the Global Sales team. Minimum Bachelor’s degree or equivalent is essential 8+ years of experience managing B2B portfolio of clients. Possess skills in analysis and interpreting analysis for business decisions. Exceptional communication & presentation skills Possess the ability to work under pressure & independently. Manage & develop internal & external stakeholder relationships. You MUST also have the right to live and work in the US to be considered for this role.  About Qatar Airways Group  Our story started with four aircraft. Today, we deliver excellence across 12 different businesses coming together as one. We’ve grown fast, broken records and set trends that others follow. We don’t slow down by the fear of failure. Instead, we dare to achieve what’s never been done before.  So whether you’re creating a unique experience for our customers or innovating behind the scenes, every person contributes to our proud story. A story of spectacular growth and determination. Now is the time to bring your best ideas and passion to a place where your ambition will know no boundaries, and be part of a truly global community.  How To Apply  If you are interested to submit your application and feel you are a good fit for this role, please complete our application form and upload your CV for our review and consideration

description: The Sales Development Manager is responsible for driving the results of the SDR team by coaching, coordinating, measuring, problem-solving, and leading. The Sales Development Manager contributes to the strategies and executes plans while upholding the standards to ensure that opportunity creation and pipeline goals are met or exceeded. This role requires a self-starting, proactive, results-oriented sales management professional. As the Sales Development Manager, you will help create and implement a strategy to support all global sales efforts as well as coach prospecting methods, using a combination of phone, email, social media, and direct mail to help build our sales pipeline by connecting with prospective customers. The ideal candidate will have a mindset of ‘raising the bar and will be able to digest and analyze data, and know-how to energize, motivate, and grow a team.   We’re looking to add an experienced SDR Manager (12+ months) with a background in payments and SaaS that focuses on coaching based on individual needs. You must have proven your ability to inspire, encourage, and collaborate with your team. You must be efficient in working with a sophisticated technology stack (Salesforce, Outreach or SalesLoft, ZoomInfo, HubSpot, LinkedIn Navigator). You must be able to work in a fast-paced environment and handle change management well. As a part of the SDR Leadership team, you must take extreme ownership of your work, continuously strive for improvement, and can succeed without all the answers.  This position is located in Waltham, MA.  Timeline of Position:   Month 3: Conduct weekly 1:1 meetings with your direct reports Coach and mentor Sales Development Representatives to optimum performance Understand reporting in Salesforce and all other systems, use data to coach SDRs on specific behaviors Report team performance metrics to the Director of Sales  Month 6: Bring your thinking, strategy, and ideas to the team to advance our unique culture and vision for the future Present ideas to maximize workflow in the SDR org Contribute to ideas, content, and delivery of onboarding and ongoing training for SDR org  1 year: Identify problems and proactively create comprehensive plans of action to present to senior management Ensure company and department policies and procedures are adhered to and recommend updates when needed Organize and deploy team resources in accordance with department and company strategies Work with the Director of Sales to identify a plan of continued career growth   Responsibilities: Hire, train, manage, and mentor a small team of global sales development representatives with the intent to grow the team 2-3X over the next 12 months. Meet or exceed quota! You’ll be implementing creative strategy, providing ad hoc training sessions, and will lead by example to make sure you and your team hit goals Manage performance metrics for team members and work with them to hone their sales skillset Work closely with Sales, Marketing, and Product to design competitive training sessions to ensure the team is fully prepared to meet goals Build prospecting sequences, write email copy, and create call scripts Ensure optimum sales processes and tools are in place to achieve goals Provide management with appropriate sales activity reports in a timely manner  Requirements: You’ve managed a team of successful sales development representatives in the past and are looking for your next big challenge! Experience in Sales Development management in the payment technology space is preferred 2+ years of experience in technology sales – Payment Experience is Required Strong motivator creating fun team-building exercises and experiences to develop a team culture and drive performance Results-oriented professional with self-confidence, perseverance, a sense of urgency, and exceptional attention to detail Strong written and verbal communication skills Strategic thinker, organized, adept problem solver, and detail-oriented Strong project management skills are required Innovative with an ability to sell ideas internally to improve processes throughout the organization Experience with Salesforce, Salesforce High-Velocity Sales, Outreach.io, SalesLoft, and ZoomInfo or similar technologies required Bachelor’s Degree or comparable experience

description: Who We Are:  Aviatrix is a well-funded, pre-IPO, hyper-growth enterprise-software company based in the heart of Silicon Valley (Santa Clara, CA). Aviatrix technology has proven solid at scale with nearly 600 enterprise customers, over 40 of the Global Fortune 500. We have a top-tier, experienced leadership team, combined with a collaborative culture built on proven success, trust, execution, and respect. We’re focused on getting things done!  Read recent article published in Bloomberg on Aviatrix’s incredible rise in value  What We Do:  Aviatrix is networking for the cloud era , delivering a superset of features and capabilities that leverage and control native cloud constructs and add advance network, security and operational visibility features that cloud providers lack, while maintaining the simplicity and automation enterprises expect in cloud. Aviatrix offers the industry’s first and only multi-cloud networking certification ( ACE ), empowering IT to lead and accelerate the transformation to the cloud.  About the role:  We are looking for a highly motivated Regional Sales Manager to join our rapidly growing Go-to-Market (GTM) sales team. The Regional Sales Manager will be responsible for driving sales of Aviatrix products and solutions within a specific geographic territory. The RSM must be quota-driven and will represent Aviatrix and its product suite within the region. S/HE will work with Inside Sales, Systems Engineers, Solution Architects, and Aviatrix Partners to exceed sales objectives. This position will manage all aspects of the sales process including securing net-new business, lead management, qualification, evaluation, close and subsequent account care. The RMS will act as the lead of their territory.  Position Responsibilities:  Define and execute sales plans for the assigned territory  Meet and exceed quotas through prospecting, qualifying, managing, and closing opportunities  Develop and manage sales pipeline, prospect, and assess sales and move a large number of transactions through the sales pipeline  Manage and track customer and transactional information in the Aviatrix CRM system  Provide activity forecasts and regular pipeline reporting through the CRM system  Own and collaborate on all aspects of the sales cycle, including product support and sales engineering  Execute product demonstrations to prospective clients  Develop accounts of various sizes and grow client relationships  Understand the competitive market, be familiar with competing companies and their product suite  Collaborate within the Aviatrix team on strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts, and customer care  Meet with customers daily, both remote and in-person once climate allows  Requirements  8+ years of enterprise software sales experience with a track record of closing complex sales to Fortune 500 companies or 8+ years managing and growing a large geographical territory with YoY growth/success in net-new logo’s  Cloud experience  A Closer – consistent overachievement of sales goals in a large geographic territory  Drive to expand client base and close sales  Excellent communication skills verbal and written, team player  Entrepreneurial – willing to go the extra mile, competitive mindset, great work ethic, resourceful, “get it done” attitude  Must be willing to travel to clients to support sales relationships  Bachelor’s Degree  Aviatrix, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and does not make hiring decisions based on race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Overview Expect high-5 figures to start and progress into 6-figures based upon current sales team’s incomes. Salary plus monthly commission, Quarterly profit bonuses, Company Car/Allowance, excellent Benefits Package with unbeatable Health Insurance ($1,500 deductible), Tech Package, and more... Essential Business, Recession-Proof, Effectively No Competition. Cover 20 – 30 counties in Greater Memphis and surrounding area. Help property loss victims gain on average 30% - 70% more money from their insurance companies to rebuild their lives.  About FirstCall As the oldest and most-established public adjusting firm in Tennessee, FirstCall is now into its 4th decade of helping families and businesses fully recover after they’ve had a property loss. As our Sales Representative you’ll meet with homeowners and businesses that have been devastated by a loss and provide resources that they didn’t know existed to make sure they don’t get shortchanged by the insurance company. As their professional advocate, we help ease their load, even the playing field, give them hope and ensure a better outcome. It’s incredibly gratifying to make such a significant difference in the lives of our clients.  Requirements Superior sales skills and solid track record that includes selling intangibles. Experience with Salesforce or similar CRM platform is highly preferred. While we provide the majority of leads, we expect you to be skilled in networking and prospecting to enhance those leads and identify additional losses to pursue. The ability to strategize and manage your day to maximize success while working from your home office – we don’t micromanage. Skilled communicator that can talk with anyone, connect at a deep level quickly, and wants to stick up for the little guy against the large insurance companies. While you’ll meet most insured parties between 8 am and 6 pm, you must be willing and able to accommodate them by meeting in the evening or weekends as needed. Valid driver’s license and clean driving record.  Key Functions We’ll thoroughly train and prepare you to pass the public adjuster licensing exam which our founder helped establish for the state of Tennessee. You’ll cover 20 – 30 counties in Greater Memphis and surrounding area with a minimum of 4 – 5 visits per day to site losses to gain intelligence and connect with the insured. Employ a mix of sales and marketing strategies to gain an audience with the insured to present a solution that they won’t know exists. Manage all activity and reporting through Salesforce. Transition the signed client to operations team that will professionally manage the claim to a significantly better settlement for the client. Participate in weekly sales meetings, ongoing training opportunities and other activities to accelerate your success.  Perks and Benefits Excellent training and mentoring to equip you to be highly successful by the organization that founded public adjusting in Tennessee. Solid salary coupled with a transparent, monthly commission plan that should earn you a minimum of high 5-figure income and then progress into the 6-figure range based upon our sales team’s historical performance. Company Car or Car Allowance, unbeatable Health Insurance ($1,500 deductible), Matching 401K, Employer-paid Life Insurance, Short-Term and Long-Term Disability, Dental/Vision options, Technology Package (iPhone, iPad, laptop etc.), Family/Team-Oriented Culture, Quarterly profit bonuses, Company Potlucks and more… Great for someone that wants to earn an exceptional income and know your efforts are making a difference in the lives of others -- one claim at a time.  *Please apply through LinkedIn. Please DO NOT call, email, or drop by to share your resume. *No recruiter inquiries will be accepted.

Job Summary Zeal Concept is a fast-growing supplier of Home, Gift and Stationery products selling under multiple brands.  We develop our products and designs here in Charlotte, NC, and sell them on Amazon and other Ecommerce sites as well as to major US retail chains. We are looking for a career minded individual interested in getting a start in sales operations. The right candidate will learn how to help with the smooth processing of customer PO’s and other required support.   Essential Functions  Order Management Read and interpret vendor guides and create procedures that comply with customer requirements Receive and enter customer purchase orders into operating system Create picklists and Instruct warehouse to pick and pack order according to customer requirements Create bill of lading and book orders to ship, according to customer routing guides Monitor order pick-ups to ensure on time delivery and customer compliance Trouble shoot problems with warehouse Follow invoicing process according to customer requirements and internal accounting procedures  Sales Support Check customer purchase orders for accuracy, identifying required corrections Check inventory availability and maintain customer inventory lists with accurate data Pack and ship samples to customers Additional sales support as required to meet customer demands  Essential Requirements Bachelor’s degree or equivalent a plus One year of professional work experience High level of attention to detail and accuracy Excellent verbal and written communication skills High level proficiency with Excel and other Microsoft applications Willingness to learn

Female-founded and female-led, Knack Collective is a strategic consultancy and creative studio with diversity at our core. We use proven resourcing models to build an agile team of expert talent for each project, leveraging our expertise in MarTech enablement and activation, channel marketing and sales programs, and award-winning creative. We understand today’s consumer, who is increasingly diverse, so that we can help our clients authentically engage and connect with their audience—and transform their business. At our core, we see diversity as our strength and a key strategic asset for our clients. We embrace individuality. We are fiercely inclusive, from ideas to identities. We ask, “Why not?” Because at Knack we believe that when you look at a problem differently, brilliant solutions arise.  Knack Collective is in search of a skilled Sales Engagement Coordinator (known internally as a Client Engagement Coordinator) that will support the Client Engagement and Business Development team with management of Salesforce, updating opportunities, scheduling and attending meetings for new opportunities and managing follow-up, coordinating execution of SOWs, sending out proposals, build decks, get case studies, write proposal drafts, and more. The Client Engagement Coordinator will have the ability to both think strategically and execute operationally. We’re looking for candidates that can solve ambiguous problems and have the initiative to propose new ideas and recommend solutions while providing excellent customer service.  Who You Are: Fearlessly Bold – You consistently seek new challenges and bring a creative and growth mindset to the work that you do. You are curious. You ask, “why not” and recognize that failure is an integral part of our growth.  Fiercely Inclusive – You contribute to our safe workplace where people of all identities are welcome. You seek and embrace diversity of thought and encourage all voices to be heard. You remain open to different possibilities and are comfortable being wrong.  Radically Transparent – You recognize that great ideas can come from anywhere. You engage in discourse and debate founded on data not emotion. You evaluate ideas without ego and move only the best solutions forward. You do this, and all things, with respect and kindness.  Courageously Authentic – We deploy high levels of integrity to everything we do. We express honestly about how we feel, providing direct and timely feedback to move forward, together. We are compassionate to ourselves and others, recognizing the humor and humanity in all of us. We are all a little weird (and we like it that way).  Responsibilities: Support Client Engagement and Business Development team with daily operations Assist in management of the new business intake process, including scheduling and attending new opportunity meetings with clients, executing timely follow-up, opportunity management within CRM tools, development of SOWs and contracting, etc.  Drive opportunity management processes in Salesforce to ensure visibility and engagement on opportunities, supporting regular leadership reporting Execute creation of new business proposals, including building sales decks and case studies Assist in meetings with clients to discuss and close new opportunities Deliver consistent and exceptional support to our sales organization Act as liaison between cross-functional departments, as needed Efficient and goal-oriented with a growth mindset   Job Requirements: 3+ years’ experience as Sales Coordinator or similar (Client Success Manager, Business Development, Project Management, etc.) Experience managing multiple projects and customer onboarding processes Experience working within Salesforce is a must Experience in a client facing role with excellent customer relationship management skills is a must Understanding of the B2B digital marketing space and experience working with enterprise cloud technology clients is a plus Marketing agency and/or start-up environment experience a plus Experience with Excel, Outlook, Slack, Teams, etc.  Knack Collective is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Sales Representative  Bring your incredible sales skills to our team and help add to our growth. Your future is bright on our team. We provide our team members with outstanding hands-on sales and marketing training that will teach you the techniques necessary to succeed and achieve sales goals.  This job involves one on one sales interactions with retail customers, so outgoing, competitive personalities with charisma and integrity are encouraged to Apply Today!  Responsibilities For a Sales Representative Use our proven sales methods to achieve sales goals Welcome customers with a friendly face Speak with customers and help identify their needs Be informed of all our clients' products and services Help fit customers with the best products and services Gain new customers by providing an excellent service Requirements, traits, and skills that we look for in a Sales Representative: Active learner Enjoys learning Unmatched work ethic Loyal and honest High levels of integrity Acts with grace Like constructive criticism A team player Benefits Of Joining Our Team As a Sales Representative Go on incredible trips No two days are alike Meet new people every day Work in a fun, positive, encouraging office environment You determine your own success No glass ceiling or micromanaging We offer Virtual Care - prescription drug benefits and 24-hour access to doctors via video TCG is an outsourced sales, marketing, and consulting firm.
