description: Is Tender for you? Are you ready to make your mark by applying your energy, creativity, and charisma by joining the supportive and driven Tender Home Health team? At Tender, we embrace those with the drive to live a fulfilled life and have the resiliency to make every moment count. If you are interested in a competitive salary ($55K-$75K), career growth and working with a fun/dynamic team, apply now. Tender Home Health is a young, energetic company with potential for upward mobility and career development. The Sales Representative is responsible for developing referral business within the territory for a growing home health agency in an effort to increase company sales. Other perks include medical benefits, bonuses and mileage reimbursement. Your Day to Day Activities The sales representative is responsible for building relationships with referring physicians, facilities and hospitals. They are also expected to provide further growth and success by fulfilling the following tasks: • Meet quarterly revenue targets by developing business with healthcare providers • Call and visit referral sources to generate sales for Home Health • Execute sales process and rigorously document outcomes • Establish working rapport with health care professionals Qualifications Required: • Valid driver's license, dependable transportation, and valid automobile insurance • Proficient with Google and Microsoft Office products (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint) Desired: • Home Health or medical sales experience • Self-directed with the ability to work with little supervision • Flexible - responds well to changing priorities and conditions within an ever-evolving environment • Bachelor’s degree Our Dynamic Culture We know that our staff is the life blood of our agency. We are dedicated to ensuring that our staff has the opportunities for the career path they desire. To support our staff, we have a rigorous people development process to ensure the candidate achieves the appropriate training and experience to advance in their career. We develop specific annual goals and meet monthly to ensure the candidate is progressing as they desire. We also developed a culture of gratitude and teamwork. Examples include: · Fun, innovative ways to highlight the teams’ successes · Team oriented bonuses · Familial atmosphere where we support your life outside of Tender · Numerous social activities to celebrate team milestones We also do not shy away from hard work and grit. We are very upfront with critical feedback, as we want all of our team members to grow in their careers. We constantly mentor our staff to develop key skills that can be utilized beyond our company. Whether it be for 1 year or 20 years, during your stay at Tender, we will ensure you learn behaviors that you will utilize in any other endeavors. Life is short, strive for excellence. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $55,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year  Locations: Los Angeles, CA Orange County, CA

About Us  With electric vehicles (EVs) expected to be nearly 30% of new vehicle sales by 2025 and more than 50% by 2040, electric mobility is becoming a reality. ChargePoint is at the center of this revolution, powering one of the world’s leading EV charging networks and a comprehensive set of hardware, software and mobile solutions for every charging need. We bring together drivers, businesses, automakers, policymakers, utilities and other stakeholders to make e-mobility a global reality.  Since our founding in 2007, ChargePoint has focused solely on EV charging and established a business model that's been validated by more than a decade in business and thousands of customers. As now a public company, we remain focused on broadening our market leadership and building on years of innovation. ChargePoint offers a once-in-a-lifetime chance to build our all-electric future and dominate a trillion-dollar market.  Join the team that is building the EV charging industry and make your mark on how people and goods will get everywhere they need to go, in any context, for generations to come.  Discover what it’s like to help build the fueling network of the future - check out our Engineering Blog.  Reports To  Manager, Inside Sales  What You Will Be Doing  The Sales Development Representative (SDR) is responsible for developing marketing generated sales opportunities for the ChargePoint field sales and channel partners. The primary focus will be innovatively generating leads, identified through an educated variety of inbound and outbound approaches, including printed and electronic medium coupled with strong customer interaction.  This is a pre-IPO position in the dynamic, rapidly-growing EV industry, with a market leader backed by top-tier VC investors.  What You Will Bring to ChargePoint Generate, qualify, cultivate and close sales leads within a prescribed geographic territory and designated accounts Convert incoming leads into qualified customer engagements for channel partners and/or the field sales team to work to closure Create clear documentation of interactions/activities to-date and recommendations for next stage Assist with the scheduling of client visits, sales meetings and product demonstrations for Field Sales and Channel Account Managers Assist with the continual improvement and delivery of strong day- to-day processes and systems for lead generation Help develop efficient use of salesforce.com and the appropriate automation of process Provide marketing materials on company products and services to qualified prospects Work with the Sales and Marketing teams to assist in the follow-up activities related to specific marketing campaigns and webinars Requirements Previous sales experience preferred, but not required. Those interested in a careers in sales should apply The position holder must be a self-starter and able to work hard, independently Capacity to interact and communicate effectively with internal and external clients A proven ability to multi-task and a willingness to work to the benefit of others Demonstrated ability to work in a fast paced environment and deliver on commitments The candidate should possess excellent grammar and writing skills Desire to grow beyond current role, regardless of function. A passion to disrupt the traditional automotive industry by helping promote the EV industry Minimal travel expected for this role (less than four trips per year) Bachelor’s degree or equivalent required Location  Scottsdale, AZ  We are committed to an inclusive and diverse team. ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate based on race, color, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status or any legally protected status.  If there is a match between your experiences/skills and the Company needs, we will contact you directly.  ChargePoint is an equal opportunity employer.  Applicants only - Recruiting agencies do not contact.

description: Sales Executive, Medical Payer Would you like the opportunity to take ownership for delivering growth? Do you enjoy building successful relationships with customers to develop opportunities?  About our Team Our Clinical Solutions Team uses our industry-leading intellectual property and content to create products for healthcare professionals. Our products and tools aid in disease management, medication error reductions, workflow improvements, effective patient management and economic analysis and cost control. Our flagship platform for clinically focused searches and deep reference information products serves as the best combined solution for Payers.  About the Role As a Sales Executive, you will be responsible for new and existing sales of our ClinicalKey product for the Medical Payer market. You will be a trusted advisor to our customers through building relationships with key stakeholders and individuals. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to assess opportunities and execute successful strategies for sales growth.  Responsibilities Building and maintaining a pipeline of qualified opportunities to effectively move through the selling process to achieve growth targets Developing accurate forecasts and reports of new business opportunities and sales by updating and managing data in our Salesforce system Establishing intelligence about our competitors products, strategy and sales approach to understand the market direction and needs of current and new customers Owning the opportunity development process by collaborating with internal stakeholders and cross-functional teams to develop potential revenue opportunities within accounts Developing effective, collaborative relationships with key contacts and decision makers to ensure a successful sales outcome Performing engaging product demonstrations remotely through Zoom or other technology-based applications to build customer interest and gain feedback  Requirements Have a proven background in successful healthcare sales or technology solution selling and expertise with the Payer domain Demonstrate experience in complex solution-sales approach with a “consultative selling” to the C-Suite and decision makers Demonstrate excellent written and verbal, communication and presentation skills including communicating complex technical content to a range of audiences Have impressive organizational skills to be able to identify develop and manage opportunities in a large territory Show knowledge of regional or national Health Plan groups, collaboration networks and key opinion leaders Be able to travel overnight when required (post-Covid)  Work in a way that works for you We promote a healthy work/life balance across the organization. With an average length of service of 9 years, we are confident that we offer an appealing working prospect for our people. With numerous wellbeing initiatives, family leave and tuition reimbursement, we will help you meet your immediate responsibilities and long-term goals.  Working remotely from home or any other work location Working flexible hours - flexing the times you work in the day  Working with us We are an equal opportunity employer with a commitment to help you succeed. Here, you will find an inclusive, agile, collaborative, innovative and fun environment, where everyone has a part to play. Regardless of the team you join, we promote a diverse environment with co-workers who are passionate about what they do, and how they do it.  Working for you At Elsevier, we know that your wellbeing and happiness are key to a long and successful career. These are some of the benefits we are delighted to offer:  Competitive Salary and generous commission plan based on performance, which is uncapped Comprehensive, multi-carrier health plan benefits Disability insurance Dependent Care and Commuter Spending Accounts Life and Accident Insurance Retirement Benefits (Salary Investment Plan/Employer Stock Purchase Plan) Modern Family Benefits, including adoption and surrogacy  About Us A global leader in information and analytics, we help researchers and healthcare professionals advance science and improve health outcomes for the benefit of society. Building on our publishing heritage, we combine quality information and vast data sets with analytics to support visionary science and research, health education and interactive learning, as well as exceptional healthcare and clinical practice. At Elsevier, your work contributes to the world’s grand challenges and a more sustainable future. We harness innovative technologies to support science and healthcare to partner for a better world.  Join Us Are you ready to help us progress science and health? Our technology leads to innovation, so join a forward-thinking digital business that is tackling world-scale challenges and align your ambitions with our passion for driving global knowledge-sharing.
industries: Hospital & Health Care, Information Technology and Services, and Information Services

description: Beposta provides internet infrastructure services such as domain names, web hosting, ecommerce solutions, search engine optimisation and custom software development. We are a new company and have a strong partnership network with global companies that serve thousands of customers and that work with global brands. – Remote Role.  Job Description  We’re looking for results-driven and highly motivated Sales Executives with excellent interpersonal skills to actively seek out and engage customer prospects  What Will You Be Doing?  You will provide complete and appropriate solutions for every customer in order to boost top-line revenue growth, customer acquisition levels and profitability for Beposta. Full training and support is provided for this role.  Responsibilities  Present, promote and sell products/services using solid arguments to existing and prospective customers Perform cost-benefit and needs analysis of existing/potential customers to meet their needs Establish, develop, and maintain positive business and customer relationships Reach out to customer leads through cold emailing campaigns using organic keywords. Expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within schedule Coordinate sales effort with team members and other departments Analyze the territory and the market’s potential, track sales and status reports Supply Business Development Director with reports on customer needs, problems, interests, competitive activities, and potential for new products and services. Keep abreast of best practices and promotional trends Continuously improve through feedback Assume other responsibilities to ensure success in this role  Job Requirements  Proven work experience as a Sales Representative, preferably in a technological, SEO and/or software ecosystem. Willingness to succeed Proven ability to take responsibility for own work, be able to work without supervision and able to contribute productively in a remote-first team sales environment Excellent knowledge of Microsoft Office 365, particularly Excel Familiarity with BRM and/or CRM practices, such as HubSpot along with ability to build productive business professional relationships Highly motivated and target driven with a proven track record in sales Excellent selling, negotiation, and communication skills Prioritizing, time management and organizational skills Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience needs Relationship management skills and openness to feedback and learning. Bachelor’s degree in business or a related field an advantage, but not a requirement.  Compensation is 100% commission uncapped with an attractive OTE commission structure ($108,300) including a monthly bonus of $250+ for achieving monthly sales targets with no qualifying period. Option to move to employment contract after 90 days.  If your interested in this role and are a motivated sales professional please consider applying.

The candidate for this position will excel at creating and closing new opportunities. By using a consultative approach to selling, this person will use their expertise to identify and qualify leads, leading to sales opportunities with both new and existing customers.   Responsibilities Meet and exceed sales targets Successfully create business from new and existing customer accounts Manage complex negotiations with senior-level executives Build rapport and establish long term relationships with customers  Qualifications Desire to train and collaborate daily with our team on your sales acumen 1-3 years' quota carrying sales experience Experience and working knowledge of CRM systems Willingness to be uncomfortable learning new skills Demonstrable track record of over-achieving quota Strong written and verbal communication skills Property & Casualty License

jobTitle: Primary Care Sales Specialist / Senior – CRM – Houston, S – Remote
description: Job Description  Over 200 new sales positions are being added to our Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolism team. At Novartis we are committed to reducing the global burden of cardiovascular, renal, and metabolic diseases on patients, families, and their communities. We are focused on developing solutions targeting heart failure (acute and chronic), atherosclerosis, metabolic and renal diseases with the aim of improving quality of life for patients all over the world.  We are Novartis.  Join us and help reimagine medicine!  Job Purpose:  The Primary Care Specialist / Senior will build and execute business plans to meet sales goals for territory, and drive territory sales performance, market share and optimal resource utilization. The Primary Care Specialist / Senior will develop effective professional business relationships with customers that support delivery of business results across a range of therapeutic areas and differentiate Novartis as a leader in therapeutic areas.  This is a remote opportunity.  Your Key Responsibilities: Executes business plans and drives achievement of sales targets for assigned territory, customers or therapeutic area. Develops and applies understanding of customer organizations and networks and of diverse influences that affect customer decisions (e.g. peer relationships). Executes call plans for customers, including medical experts from customer or academic communities; calls on the right person to deliver the right message with the right frequency. Ensures that Novartis products and supporting services are broadly understood and available to more patients and customers. Deploys and uses approved Marketing and Sales promotional materials and programs; runs direct promotion programs and facilitates pull-through activities. Uses expert knowledge of Novartis products and of a range of therapy areas to build professional customer relationships and to support sound clinical discussions. Serve as a resource to assist with providing both proactive and reactive education and support regarding NPC CRM access programs as needed for community practices, medical groups and facilities, and their staff. Triage to franchise counterparts as appropriate. Proactively provide education and support on NPC CRM access programs for community practices, medical groups and facilities, and their staff Serve as a resource and/or assist with providing support for resolving customer/account questions regarding coverage, access, and reimbursement, where appropriate. Triage appropriate inquiries, including patient-specific inquiries, to FRM and/or other franchise counterparts as directed by NPC policy and procedure. Develop compliant customer-centric support strategies and proactively communicate payer policy criteria related to NPC CRM products   Integrity & Compliance: Adherence and accountability to NPC policies including policies regarding appropriate Medical / Commercial interactions, Code of Ethics, and all applicable laws and regulations. Works to ensure a diverse and inclusive environment free from all forms of discrimination and harassment. Ethical achievement of sales and revenue targets.   EEO Statement  The Novartis Group of Companies are Equal Opportunity Employers and take pride in maintaining a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.  Minimum Requirements  What You’ll Bring to the Role: Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in Life Sciences, Pharmacy, or business-related field). Minimum two years of successful sales experience (preferably business to business sales experience). Demonstrated outstanding discernment and business planning skills. Effective problem solving and decision-making skills. Exceptional ability to develop and sustain customer relationships. Proven track-record to collaborate and work cross functionally with internal and external partners. This is a remote position that will cover Key Accounts in the assigned region. Candidate must be based within that region or within a reasonable daily commuting distance. Ability to travel 60-80% over a broad geography is required, with the ability to drive and/or fly within the territory. No relocation available.   Preferred Qualifications: Experience across therapeutic groups, disease states and new product launches. Understanding of managed care environments and account management strategy. Knowledge of buy-and-bill, access, reimbursement resources, and product acquisition. Experience working with established injection networks.   Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:  Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity, and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.  Division  PHARMA  Business Unit  US PHARMA  Country  USA  Work Location  Houston, TX  Company/Legal Entity  Novartis Pharmaceuticals  Functional Area  Sales  Job Type  Full Time  Employment Type  Regular  Shift Work  No  Early Talent  No

COMPANY OVERVIEW:  FRONTLINE Selling is a progressive tech-enabled service company offering sales development services to B2B organizations. The fact is, when you join FRONTLINE Selling, the opportunities for professional and personal development have very few boundaries. We’re looking for individuals that are ready for a challenge, willing to jump in and be a team player, and able to make a difference.  JOB DESCRIPTION:  The Vice President of Sales and Marketing charts the course supports the vision and implements the plan that will propel the company towards increased market share and greater brand recognition. The candidate will be a strategic thinker with proven leadership experience. Accountable for delivering measurable results that achieve and exceed revenue and margin targets, this position will be capable of contributing meaningful insight to the sales and marketing functions and play an integral role in the overall development of the organization.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILL SET & QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:  Experienced Sales & Marketing Executive and Member of the Leadership Team Develop a strong team. Coach, mentor, and develop existing professionals Provide leadership, direction, and management to the marketing and sales team in a manner that ensures exceptional service to all stakeholders and that produces market differentiation and competitive advantage Track record of hiring, developing, and growing sales and marketing teams. Develop and implement annual business plans and manage monthly, quarterly, and annual sales, expense, and revenue budgets Develop strategies and tactics for increasing market share within existing accounts and markets, while expanding into new selected regions and verticals Establish clear sales metrics and benchmarks for measuring progress and maintaining focus; support marketing reporting function that can track, measure, and analyze the performance Collaborate with strategic partners and clients to research market needs and identify possible new product solutions Establish and maintain a strong network of relationships within the industry Serves as key Marketing Officer of the company, providing support around marketing strategy and management; develop the annual marketing plan and the strategies, tactics, and resources necessary to achieve goals Proficient in financial analysis and establishing sales and marketing budget and action plan Bachelor’s Degree required A minimum of 15 years of marketing and sales experience with a demonstrated track record of accomplishments Strong leadership skills, able to lead change, mentor and motivate individuals Hands-on experience strategizing and negotiating complex sales deals Ability to operate at both a strategic/conceptual level and at a detailed, operational level Metrics-driven; highly disciplined Must have strong interpersonal skills, communication skills, business maturity, and sound judgment

We are currently assisting our client, a leader in their industry, with a Sales/Account Manager search located near Cleveland, OH. Reporting to a Director of Sales, this position is the primary liaison with multiple customers. The Sales/Account Manager will also concentrate on maintaining current commercial business relationships, while also focusing on growing new business. This position is a great opportunity for a high-energy, hardworking professional to join a growing organization.  Responsibilities: Manage sales relationships and product agreements, renewals, and expansions with current and new customers Provide detailed quotes, pricing, and cost breakdowns to customers in a timely manner Submit new business quotations and associated cost breakdown information as required Manage all quotations on new commercial business Address and manage customer concerns on business development projects  Requirements: BA degree required – engineering degree preferred Minimum of 5+ years of technical sales experience Experience managing OEM customer relationships  Total Compensation: $110,000 - $140,000   Additional Information: All information will be kept strictly confidential Applications will not be considered without a Resume/Curriculum Vitae which includes contact information

Job Description  Position can be based anywhere in the U.S.  bswift is currently seeking an experienced Account Manager to join our direct Client Services Team.  The Account Manager (AM) is directly responsible for helping bswift meet and exceed client expectations by supporting consumers on our best-in-class HR software and services.  Located in downtown Chicago, bswift offers software and services that streamline benefits, HR and payroll administration for employers and public and private exchanges nationwide. bswift’s state-of-the-art cloud-based technology and outsourcing solutions significantly reduce administrative costs and time-consuming paperwork, making life easier for administrators and millions of consumers who enroll in benefits with bswift.  Responsibilities  The Account Manager (AM) will serve as the primary point of contact to our direct clients, internal team members and partners by helping implement and maintain client web sites. This individual will:  Help manage and provide technical guidance through the implementation of new client Web sites  Continually update sites as requirements change each year or as often as needed (this includes benefit class matrix, requirements document, rates, permissions, field options, site text and any open items on questions log)  Test client sites for quality assurance; track and monitor the resolution of issues  Prepare and conduct technical/product presentations, demonstrations and trainings (such as an open enrollment demo for new/changing plans, site text, and release functionality changes, etc.)  Provide resolution of client issues by responding to questions and concerns about the use of bswift products; ability to leverage research to find resolution  Maintain thorough understanding of all internal systems to respond to general and specialized client requests  Triage client tickets and/or questions (email and voicemail) within 24 hours; maintaining ownership from initial customer contact to call resolution which includes supporting escalations if appropriate and providing customer updates  Look for and help drive continuous process improvements/efficiencies by maintaining a thorough understanding of all internal systems  Develop and implement fulfillment procedures  Lead and create agendas for client meetings (when CRM is not available)  Coach and mentor other team members; share new ideas and customer needs with bswift teams throughout all phases of product life cycle  Manage workflow in the setup and maintenance of carrier and payroll feeds  Assist in sales and marketing activities as needed  Provide open communication to bswift customers in a pleasant, professional manner with a can-do attitude  Responsible for special projects as assigned  (NOTE: NIGHT AND WEEKEND WORK MAY BE NECESSARY)  Required Qualifications  Bachelor’s Degree from a four-Year College or university; or equivalent combination of education and experience.  3+ Years of direct client and/or analyst experience preferred  Solid Technical background  Must be proficient in Excel (VLOOKUP, Pivot Tables, Basic Functionality)  Good written/verbal communication skills and the ability to communicate with both technical and non-technical personnel; ability to listen, clarify and respond well to questions  Ability to operate and make timely decisions in an ambiguous, fast-paced atmosphere  Must be able to quickly sort through complex subject material  Strong analytical skill set and ability to effectively use data for strategy  High level of productivity, reliability, responsibility, attendance, dependability, organization and accuracy/thoroughness  Ability to take initiative to meet challenges with resourcefulness and new innovative approaches while maintaining a high level of quality  Must possess a passion for teamwork, client service and reaching business results through problem solving  COVID Requirements  COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement  CVS Health requires its Colleagues in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated. If you are vaccinated, you are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status within the first 30 days of your employment. For the two COVID-19 shot regimen, you will be required to provide proof of your second COVID-19 shot within the first 60 days of your employment. Failure to provide timely proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status will result in the termination of your employment with CVS Health. If you are unable to be fully vaccinated due to disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief, you will be required to apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 30 days of your employment in order to remain employed with CVS Health. As a part of this process, you will be required to provide information or documentation about the reason you cannot be vaccinated. If your request for an accommodation is not approved, then your employment may be terminated. Preferred Qualifications  Experience with benefits administration / open enrollment process  Education  A Bachelor’s Degree from a four-Year College or university; or equivalent combination of education and experience  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

description: Company Profile  Koupon provides c-store retailers and brands with the easiest way to connect and engage with shoppers to grow sales. Koupon works with brands to easily deploy personalized, channel-wide promotions, and helps retailers to secure additional brand trade spending and grow shopper engagement. Members of the Koupon Network - the leading c-store collaborative with 30 of the top 50 c-store retailers and over 70 brands – realize the benefit from Koupon’s unmatched channel reach, proprietary technology and data, and campaign management services. Since its founding in 2011, Koupon has delivered over 4 billion offers. To learn more, please visit www.koupon.com   The Opportunity Due to our tremendous growth, and substantial marketplace opportunity, Koupon is expanding its Retail Partnerships (Sales) Team. The individual that fills this role will be responsible for enhancing Koupon’s standing with existing and prospective retail clients. Retail partnerships will be built and enhanced by driving tremendous results for our clients via Koupon’s dynamic suite of solutions including, but not limited to: Koupon Platform, Koupon Network, Koupon Insights and Koupon Services.  Position Description Position Title: National Director, Retail Partnerships Location: Addison, TX (or remote) Reports to: Head of Sales  Position Charter The National Director, Retail Partnerships will have responsibility for selling Koupon’s solutions to Retailers, with a focus on the small-format market segment.  Specific responsibilities include: Growing the retail network- sign-up small format retailers to participate as members of the Koupon Offer Network. Grow business with existing clients- Convert outstanding results into expanded client partnerships based on their needs and opportunities. Retailer Purchase Data / Integrations- Establish deep connections with small format retailers in order to secure consistent purchase data in order to build stronger and more effective offer campaigns. Revenue generation- Create and drive the entire small format retailer SaaS sales cycle from needs analysis, presentation, sale, and renewal. Pipeline management- Continually fill the pipeline with qualified opportunities and execute winning sales campaigns to meet growth expectations. Key relationships- Maintain key client relationships and develop / implement strategies for expanding the products used. Competitive Landscape- Monitor competitive landscape and market conditions to identify opportunities, issues, and risks in order to recommend tactical strategies. CRM Usage- Maintain accurate records of all sales and prospecting activities including sales calls, emails, and follow-up activities using.  Experience/Skills Desired The ideal candidate will have retail technology sales experience, preferably in the small format vertical. Strong candidates will have proven experience consistently meeting goals during a period of rapid growth. Experience in selling marketing technology and/or promotions are a plus. BA/BS degree, MBA a plus.  Personal Profile The National Director, Retail Partnerships will be ready to “roll up his/her sleeves” and dive into the Koupon Platform in order to help accelerate the development and growth of the retail business. Individuals must demonstrate thought leadership and exhibit strong curiosity and passion for the evolving digital, promotion and mobile landscape with a focus on understanding the client’s business requirements and the metrics that drive their success. This is an individual contributor role. Travel of up to 20% required.  Compensation Package Salary, bonus based on performance and an equity stakeholder position. Benefits: Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance, generous paid time-off, life insurance, vibrant company culture.

description: Job Description Outside Sales Representative – A-Laser, a division of FCT Assembly Inc.  A-Laser is currently looking for an experienced Sales Representative to join our fast-growing team. Must be highly motivated, hardworking, and a team player to fill the position of Outside Sale Representative in California and Pacific Northwest. 50% travel requirement. If you’re interested in being a part of a great company, we encourage you to apply today. We’re passionate about our people, our customers, our values and our market, which is a variety of markets and services including printed circuit board assembly and the electronic manufacturing segment. We are looking for a person with a growth mindset and the pragmatic insight to solve our customer’s issues today while building a strong relationship for a successful future. The Sales Representative will have direct interface with customer engineers to provide solutions for process manufacturing improvement. While managing existing customers the Sales Rep must be able to generate new business opportunities for the sale of specialty materials, machine parts and services that our company provides, with a goal of growing sales within the California and Northwest markets. Sales Representative will make sales calls to manufacturer's in the electronics manufacturing, medical, defense, aerospace, and general industrial markets working with customers to improve manufacturing processes, working with authorized distributors of lines represented, developing a pipeline of opportunities (both direct and through distribution) and expanding the customer base within the territory. Candidate will be required to manage sales calls and opportunity records in CRM database. Only career minded individuals need apply: Sales Representative to service the following territory: CA (75%) , OR-WA-ID-UT (25%) Responsibilities Develop new business prospects and qualify new sales leads Schedule meetings and presentations with prospects Create, plan, and deliver presentations on company services Preparing proposals, negotiating contracts with customers Track all sales activities and keep current by updating account information regularly Maintain a well-developed pipeline of prospects Develop strong, ongoing relationships with prospects and customers Meet and/or exceed sales quotas Coordinate with other team members and departments to optimize the sales effort Ability to multitask and manage more than one client account Other duties as assigned by management Qualifications Associate degree or higher in Business, Sales, Marketing, Communications, Engineering or related field Knowledge of PCB / SMT assembly or related field a huge plus 1-4 years of sales and/or engineering experience in related field a huge plus Highly self-motivated work with minimal supervision Proven ability to meet and exceed sales quotas Proven track record of successfully managing customer relationships Excellent interpersonal skills Strong verbal and written communication skills Proficient in Microsoft Office Have experience working with customers in a pre-sales or post-sales technical role Have outstanding skills presenting to both technical and executive audiences, whether impromptu on a whiteboard or using presentations and demos Be able to consult with clients, understand their needs, and assist in sales cycle/closing new business opportunities. Represent the company at industry conferences and trade show events Benefits Salary Base + Bonus Health, Dental, Vision, Supplementary Insurance 401k Car or Car Stipend

This is your chance to work for the world-famous Durham Bulls Baseball Club located in one of the fastest growing areas in the country. We are looking for an up-and-coming superstar or a seasoned vet who can help shape our ticket sales department as sports return to large capacities. The position is directly responsible for overseeing all new business initiatives, upselling and renewals focused on Durham Bulls Season Tickets, Partial Plans, and Group Ticket Sales.  Essential Functions/Responsibilities Develops the business strategy for all new and renewal business efforts surrounding Full Season Tickets, Partial Season Tickets, and Group Tickets. Oversees all executable action items related to this plan and the managers and employees in the Ticket Package sales, Group Sales, and Inside Sales Departments. Execute, track, and adjust new and renewal sales strategies in FSE, group ticket and inside sales departments to ensure yearly ticket sales and revenue goals are met. Develop the full season ticket and partial plan sales strategy and timeline. Set revenue and daily/weekly activity goals for all new business ticket sales employees and managing progress and efforts toward achieving these goals. Coach and guide Ticket Sales and Inside Sales teams to create a strong sales culture and environment focused on hard work and accountability, achieving budget goals, and delivery of a positive client experience. Assist sales staff in their effort to generate new sales in all ticket product lines. This may include attending meetings, visiting prospects at events, and calling potential clients. Provide general customer service to major prospects and clients during home games and other team events during the season. Regularly develop and implement sales training related to all ticket sales product lines. Establish and develop long-term client relationships. Responsible for hiring, promoting, training, and measuring performance of department staff.  Performance Requirements/Skills Ideal candidate has a proven track record of selling corporate clientele. Ideal candidate has experience in selling group tickets and managing group events. History of managing a sales team and exceeding organizational sales goals. History of strong working relationships with peers and support departments. Ability to manage multiple tasks, attend to detail and meet short deadlines. Strong computer skills and experience related to CRM and ticketing software. Ability to work a varied schedule to include evenings, weekends, and holidays.  Education/Experience Bachelor’s degree required Minimum 2+ years professional experience within management field. Minimum of 5 years of experience in a sales capacity  A pre-employment drug screening is required. EOE, M/F. All Capitol Broadcasting Company properties are tobacco free. Capitol Broadcasting Company participates in E-Verify.

Company Profile Southstar JCB is a highly successful, fast growing business We pride ourselves on customer service. We invest on our workforce and offer a highly competitive compensation and benefit program.  Position Summary  Southstar JCB currently has an opening for a Territory Sales Representative to support our sales coverage. This position is responsible for providing exemplary customer satisfaction to assigned accounts through the sale or rental of products and services offered by Southstar JCB. The Territory Sales Representative will serve as the primary liaison between Southstar JCB and the customer.  Major Tasks, Responsibilities & Key Accountabilities  Develop sales opportunities by researching and identifying potential accounts, soliciting new accounts; building rapport, providing technical information and explanations preparing quotes. Build relationships with customers quickly and in a mutually beneficial manner. Listen to and engage every customer to obtain sufficient information to correctly determine or confirm his/her requests. Answer customer questions regarding products, prices, availability, product uses and rental policies. Fulfill requests promptly and accurately, in line with company procedures. Obtain customer information such as name, address and payment method. Enter orders into Point Of Rental database. Create quotations and maintain records of contacts, accounts and orders. Consult with clients after contract signings to resolve issues and provide ongoing support. Knowledge of products to troubleshoot machine issues over the phone. Ensure showroom, equipment, displays, counters, and signs clean, well-stocked, orderly and attractive. Ensure price tags are in place, updated and accurate. Schedule and dispatch deliveries. Work with team members to ensure high quality work and the best possible customer experience Maintain CRM database, knowledge of Sales Force a plus  Requirements Specific industry experienced desired or an equivalent college degree. Qualified candidate MUST have prior service, parts or sales experience in a dealership or renal company environment to include heavy customer contact and negotiation.  Prior territory management experience preferred. High energy, excellent communication skills, and a strong work ethic required. Leadership Skills a strong plus for future growth opportunities Self-Improvement skills and set high standards for personal performance Excellent customer service skills Ability to perform at a high capacity in fast paced environment Must pass any drug screens and background checks   JCB is an equal employment opportunities (EEO) employer in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. JCB complies with applicable state and local laws governing non-discrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.

jobTitle: National Accounts Sales Mgr On Premise
description: A National Account Sales Manager ONP is responsible building a trusted advisor relationship, adopting best-in-industry practices, and aligning key On Premise National Account needs with Andrews' strategic priorities. The On Premise National Account Sales Manager will drive results by ensuring resources are optimized and focused on profit driven activities while supporting company goals and strategies. This position is part of the On Premise Sales team.  WORK TASKS  Role  A National Account Sales Manager ONP can be expected to perform the following tasks in this role as a routine part of their job Directs the implementation activities of the On Premise National Account/Chain Managers to ensure chain programming is efficiently and effectively executed. Inspects the accounts to make sure standards are met and provides real time coaching in the market to the Andrews team. Develops sales and marketing plans that meet the Retailer's and Andrews' strategic initiative priorities. Documents and communicates On Premise National Account mandates and operations to ensure compliance and understanding. Negotiates with On Premise National Accounts' buyers to sell in new products and increase distribution of Andrews' brands and new packages. Develops and delivers detailed, professional sales presentations to assigned On Premise National Accounts' buyers and leadership and to the sales teams during weekly sales meetings as requested by the sales leaders. Acts as liaison between Andrews and On Premise National Accounts' management to troubleshoot and problem solve as needed; develops and implements solutions to prevent reoccurrence. Collaborates with Marketing Services to develop and administer a mobile communication plan for On Premise National Accounts' programs to sales teams. This list is not all inclusive of other tasks and subtasks that may be necessary in performing this role, but rather an overview of the role's primary work tasks.  Capabilities  A National Account Sales Manager ONP has a greater opportunity to succeed if they can develop and master the following job related capabilities and KSAs:  KNOWLEDGE Andrews Portfolio and DISC Beer and Distribution Industry Brewing Process Category Management/Space Management Competitive Portfolios DFW Market Insight Merchandising Literacy Model Market Concepts National Accounts Business and Data P2EP process Pricing Management Quality Standards Selling Principles Supplier Expertise TABC Guidelines Skills & Abilities Ability to Build Trust Ability to Influence Others Ability to Solve Problems and Develop Potential Solutions Analytical Thinking and Problem Solving Skills Coaching, Training and Mentoring Skills Communication and Interpersonal Skills Negotiation Skills Presentation and Facilitation Skills Strategic Thinking Skills Technical Aptitude/Computer/iPad Skills Time Management and Prioritization Skills Qualifications  The National Account Sales Manager ONP is to produce a deliverable or outcomes measured by a specific metric in order to achieve success:  Required One to Three Years On Premise National Account/Chain Management Experience Previous Beer/Beverage Industry and Distribution Business Experience Strong Relationship Building and Communication Skills Strong Financial and Business Acumen Preferred Bachelor's Degree in Sales, Marketing, Business or Other Related Field Previous Coaching/Team Management Experience Physical Requirements & Essential Skills Ability to maintain a sustained posture in a seated position for prolonged periods of time and operate computer equipment. Ability to bend, stoop, and twist is required for filing and general office duties. Requires intermittent periods during which continuous physical exertion is required, such as standing, walking, stooping, climbing, lifting material or equipment, some of which maybe heavy or awkward. Exerts up to 55 lbs of force occasionally and/or negligible amount frequently to move office-related items or materials. Ability to use a personal computer for tasks such as communicating via email, preparing reports and other forms of documentation using company and industry software. Ability to speak, hear, and see is required to communicate with employees, and to operate computers and office machinery. Hand-eye coordination and fine manipulation skills are necessary to operate computers and various office equipment. Continual hand/wrist motion is required to operate computers and office machinery. Driving may be required during the workday. Must tolerate working in an environment with inside/outside ambient/extreme temperatures. Ability to perform job functions in compliance with company policies and procedures, including safety policies and best practices. Must be able to maintain a current/valid Texas driver's license. Must maintain regular and punctual attendance. Please note -we ask all candidates to create an account in order to apply for a position with us. Please click "Apply" then "Create Account" to create a new account, or sign in if you are a returning applicant.

Founded in 1920, Eastman is a global specialty materials company that produces a broad range of products found in items people use every day. With the purpose of enhancing the quality of life in a material way, Eastman works with customers to deliver innovative products and solutions while maintaining a commitment to safety and sustainability. The company's innovation-driven growth model takes advantage of world-class technology platforms, deep customer engagement, and differentiated application development to grow its leading positions in attractive end-markets such as transportation, building and construction, and consumables. As a globally inclusive and diverse company, Eastman employs approximately 14,500 people around the world and serves customers in more than 100 countries. The company had 2020 revenues of approximately $8.5 billion and is headquartered in Kingsport, Tennessee, USA. For more information, visit

jobTitle: Product Marketing and Sales Enablement Lead, Go-To-Market
description: Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Mountain View, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA; Chicago, IL, USA.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience 5 years of experience in marketing, sales, product management, or sales operations  Preferred qualifications: MBA degree or an advanced degree in Marketing Experience leading cross-functional projects, executing on project management, managing multiple priorities, and operating in ambiguous environments Experience working with sales teams and interacting with/influencing executives Ability to take initiative and identify/solve complex problems Excellent written and verbal communication and organizational skills  About The Job  The Global Ads Product Go-to-Market team partners with Global Product Leads (GPLs) and regional/channel go-to-market teams to influence Google’s ad product strategies and ensure successful activation by Google’s sales teams globally. The team works with executives across Google Ads Product Operations, Global Product Leads (GPL), Go-to-Market (GTM), and Sales functions, providing strategic intel, operations, and communications support. Our team partners with executive leadership to set up functions across the Google Ads product and delivers impact projects focused on product adoption and business growth opportunities.  In this role, you will lead our sales marketing, education, and enablement efforts to drive awareness, consideration, and adoption of business growth opportunities. You'll work with executive leadership across regions, partnering with Sales, GPL, and GTM to develop narratives, collateral, and resources to market and promote the value of programs.  You will work across a range of stakeholders, understanding and incorporating differing needs. You'll balance measurement of outcomes and partner to promote programs to our Sales organizations.  The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) team ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy, and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done.  Responsibilities  Lead branding and change management initiatives to improve the perception of business growth programs. Help sales teams understand how programs are evolving. Develop storylines, narratives, and resources. Leverage different approaches to drive adoption of opportunities across sales teams. Lead regular discussions with stakeholders in Sales to understand challenges, identify patterns and trends across the industry, and evolve strategies and approaches accordingly. Educate Global Product Leads and Go-to-Market executive stakeholders about the needs of sales teams, driving adoption and traction. Identify scaled ways to drive adoption by sharing best practices and success stories.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

We are looking to expand our sales presence by adding an Inside Sales team. The Inside Sales Representative will be responsible for prospecting, qualifying and generating new sales leads. This individual will be a highly motivated, self-starter able to identify and develop new business prospects from multiple sources including inbound marketing leads, prospect lists, discovery and individual research. The ideal candidate will possess both a sales and technical background that enables them to successfully manage a high volume of activity. This is an outstanding opportunity to join a fast growing company leading the third wave of energy information. Core Responsibilities: · Achieve sales revenue targets · Conduct daily discovery calls, hitting daily minimum of call activity · Develop new business via telephone and mass communication such as email and social media to introduce the suite of Oseberg products. · Determine customer requirements and expectations in order to recommend specific products and solutions · Prepare and conduct virtual presentations, while maintaining effective communication with customer decision makers and influencers. · Provide Customer quotes, proposals, order forms, and product information as required · Respond to internal and external customers in a timely manner · Use Salesforce to document all customer opportunities and customer activities · Maintain basic knowledge of Oseberg products, competition and industry trends · Accurately forecast on monthly and quarterly basis to management. Qualifications: •Bachelor’s degree preferred •Proven Inside Sales Experience •Track record of over-achieving quota •Experience working with Salesforce or similar CRM •Excellent verbal and written communication skills •Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively •High level of accountability and ownership of goals and performance targets •Previous experience within Oil & Gas preferred but not required

description: Executive sales AND leadership position for a top producing salesperson. Top executive leading the DC market, face of the company with the opportunity to build strong relationships with CEO’s across all DC based B2B industries.  Job Description  Accelerent is a national, premiere business development company that uses a proprietary platform to help its clients grow their sales, gain market exposure, improve the effectiveness of their sales teams, improve their client retention and build strong ties with other companies in the local marketplace. We are practicing sales and business development professionals who have a passion for helping our clients succeed. In other words, if you enjoy building long-term relationships with DC Metro Area business owners and executives to help them succeed this may be the right career move for you!  Our Regional Presidents are top producing SALES professionals first and foremost. What makes Accelerent’s business development platform different from any other program in the world is that it is an exclusive platform that brings like-minded business leaders together with a common purpose of growing their business and helping their fellow Partners (we call our clients Partners because they all work together). For more than 15 years, Accelerent has provided the leadership, strategy, and support to help our Partners reach their goals. We currently have over 275 clients across 60+ industries, operate in Washington DC, Baltimore, Kansas City, Phoenix, Denver and Indianapolis and have significant growth opportunities still ahead.  If this sounds like you, then you should contact us to learn more: We sell, we build strong relationships, we connect, we generate our own leads, we are responsible for our own success, we present, we educate and continue our self-education at all times. We are individuals and we are a team.  The Right Candidate Will Have The Following Qualities Someone who is a top producing salesperson and loves the art of selling. Someone who is self-motivated, can self-manage, and is driven to be successful. Somebody who sets a goal and then takes action to conquer it Somebody who is always learning, growing, and improving their skills. Somebody who is looking for a dynamic team that believes that building trusting relationships leads to long-term success Necessary Skills/Experience 10-15 yrs of proven sales excellence 2+ yrs of proven success in sales leadership and management Active in the Washington DC metro business community for at least 5 years with numerous existing business relationships Strong presentation and closing skills and techniques Desires to be a part of something larger than themselves Ability to self-generate leads through new and existing relationships Ability to understand businesses from multiple industries and to identify and address their needs Strong communication and public speaking skills Work independently on a day-to-day basis while also communicating and providing leadership to your local team Organized and focused individual who values open and constant communication with their teammates. Total compensation will be in the $250k-$300k+ range. We are practicing sales and business development professionals who have a passion for helping our clients succeed. In other words, if you enjoy building long-term relationships with Denver Metro Area business owners and executives to help them succeed this may be the right career move for you! description: Title: Regional Sales Manager  Location: Texas or Oklahoma  Department: Sales  Report To: Bill Holaday  Our Company  Trimble Transportation is in business for optimizing the movement of freight by providing shippers and carriers both mobility, enterprise and visibility software tools they need to run their businesses more efficiently. As the leading provider of Transportation Management Software (TMS - Enterprise), Asset Management Software (AMS), and Fleet Mobility Solutions we are devoted to propelling companies in the trucking industry toward increased efficiency, lower costs and optimize operations.  Position Overview  If you are looking for an exciting opportunity and challenge to grow a region's sales, then this may be your chance. Reporting to the Regional Vice President of Sales, the Regional Sales Manager is responsible for achieving the target sales revenue and sustainable growth results for his/her territory. This position relies on in depth sales experience to plan and accomplish goals.  Primary Responsibilities Responsible for new name customer sales of Trimble products to transportation companies. Responsible for building and maintaining relationships with 10-15 key accounts in the territory Perform other duties as assigned by supervisor Required Skills Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience Minimum 8 years software and or mobility sales experience Experience in selling into the transportation market - experience may include TMS, Mobility, Asset Maintenance and Routing / Optimization. Knowledge of financial statements including income statements, P&L balance sheets, etc. Excellent Oral and Written Communications skills Excellent people skills Travel: Up to 50%  Trimble Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, gender, age, color, religion, national origin, marital status, disability, sexual orientation, status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws, or any other protected factor. description: Sterisil is a rapidly growing company and market leader in infection control products designed to treat and maintain dental unit waterlines. Our territory sales representatives are responsible for working with dental distribution representatives to educate, promote and advise customers on Sterisil product selection and implementation. The majority of your time is devoted to establishing and maintaining relationships with our industry partners, but significant time is also spent working with special market accounts like military clinics, dental schools, and corporate clients.Successful candidates will be self-motivated, results driven, and capable of working in an independent environment. You will need strong communication skills to work collaboratively with key personnel across the dental industry, to include dentists, staff, technicians, equipment specialists, sales personnel, and other industry partners. The ability to identify problems, troubleshoot and work proactively to resolve issues is essential to achieving results.Specific Duties Include:* Actively collaborate with management to create territory sales plans and goals.* Engage dealer representatives to demonstrate the value of our product line.* Be prepared to identify each dental office's unique needs and recommend the appropriate solution including demonstrating the installation of our products.* Identify and adjust to emerging market trends in your territory.* Increase business base by finding, developing, educating and equipping dealer territory representatives to demonstrate and sell our products.* Visit established specialty customers on a quarterly basis to maintain and improve customer relationships and satisfaction.* Actively participate in company sales meetings and training to enhance sales and personal professionalism.* Follow all company policies and procedures including required reporting of expenses and activities.* Practice honesty and integrity in all business relations.* Present a professional image to customers and vendors.Desired Skills and Experience:* Proven success in meeting sales goals.* Ability to adapt to new selling strategies and techniques as needed.* Capable of delivering superior customer service.* Effective communicator.* Success driven individual capable of analyzing, adapting and thriving in a rapidly growing environment.* Consistent integrity and ethical standards.* Efficient project and time management skills.* Ability to pass a thorough background check including drug testing.* Current passport preferred* Education - Bachelor's Degree in Business or Science preferred.* Minimum 2 years experience in a sales position.Salary for this position is a $40,000 base plus commission

Account Executive WORLDWIDE EXPRESS  The largest non-retail authorized UPS® partner and No. 1 largest privately held LTL broker in the country!  The Account Executive position at Worldwide Express is a unique and rewarding outside business-to-business(B2B) sales opportunity for the salesperson looking for unlimited growth potential and uncapped residual commission coupled with a healthy base salary and monthly allowances. This unique compensation plan allows top performers to earn an annual six-figure income within 18 to 24 months. PERFORMANCE RESPONSIBILITIES: Consult, educate and simplify supply chain practices through an innovative, web-based platform. Streamline in and outbound processes, providing customized solutions. ·      Lead presentations with executives/owners of businesses with frequent shipping volume ·      Partner with the operations and account management teams for optimal customer satisfaction ·      Solution selling; effectively present solutions through cost-benefit analysis ·      Present a streamlined technology solution developing a detailed analysis of customized needs in challenging areas and lanes ·      Take the lead in coordinating/developing/managing all aspects of the proposal process ·      Close, activate and train decision-makers on our exclusive shipping platform  WHAT WE EXPECT FROM YOU: A competitive and motivated mindset and a passion for new business development. ·      Bachelor's Degree preferred ·      Proven success in generating/qualifying leads through prospecting new business with a ‘hunter’ mentality ·      High energy, with a passion for your personal brand and the ability to carry yourself like an executive ·      Comfortable in a fast-paced, quota-driven, results-oriented environment ·      Effective communicator with strong business acumen and intuition ·      Self-starter with strong organization & presentation skills ·      Attention to detail to drive profitability ·      Ability to think strategically about the personal impact to the client's long-term business strategy ·      Team-oriented peer, with a thirst to compete to be the most valuable player  WHAT WE COMMIT TO YOU: Industry-leading compensation with aggressive residual, uncapped commissions. Unsurpassed training, nationally ranked growth opportunities and our insanely awesome culture. ·      Territory development with Targeted Company opportunities ·      Strategic, pre-screened lead generation supported by multiple internal/external parties ·      A competitive starting BASE SALARY with performance-based increases ·      Residual, uncapped monthly commission ·      Monthly/Quarterly/Regional contest with great reward$$$ ·      Fast track bonuses for quality deals your first year while ramping up ·      The compensation plan allows top performers to earn an annual six-figure income within 18 - 24 months ·      Nationally recognized sales training ·      Ongoing sales & management support ·      Progressive Advancement opportunity and national career mobility ·      Monthly auto & cell phone allowances ·      A comprehensive benefits package with medical, dental, vision coverage and a 401(k) program  WHY WORLDWIDE EXPRESS? ·      No. 1 largest privately held LTL broker in the country! ·      The largest non-retail authorized UPS® partner ·      More than 90,000 customers nationwide ·      Ranked a Top 10 Freight Brokerage Firm by Transport Topics for the past 5 years ·      Ranked a Top 50 Logistics firm globally by Transport Topics for the past 5 years ·      Nationally ranked/known for culture, training and career growth  WHO ARE WE? Quite simply, we make shipping simple. Worldwide Express offers customers a comprehensive solution for their shipping needs, whether it be small package, less-than-truckload or full truckload. We are a local partner for your global supply chain, providing consultative service from more than 125 offices across the nation. Through our relationship with UPS® and a highly selective carrier portfolio, we provide our customers with a breadth of shipping options unmatched in the 3PL field.  Worldwide Express has a strategic partnership with UPS for light package, domestic and international shipping to penetrate the small to medium size business sector. As UPS's largest business partner in North America our sales teams do what they do best, which is providing solutions to a C-Level executive while letting UPS do what they do best, deliver more packages on time than anyone else. In addition to our relationship with ups WWE has alliances with over 65 LTL, Domestic Air Freight, and International Air Freight carriers. WWE provides tailored services and individualized shipping solutions to fit the need of any small to medium sized business customers.  Worldwide Express is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Worldwide Express Operations, LLC and WWEX Franchise Holdings, LLC (collectively “Worldwide Express”) strives to make employment decisions on the basis of merit, seeking the most qualified individuals in every job.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin or ancestry, genetics, disability, age, veteran status, or other status protected by law.  All employment decisions will be based on valid job requirements or other legitimate, non-discriminatory reasons.  Worldwide Express offers reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in the job application and hiring process.  If you would like to request such an accommodation, please contact the Human Resources Director of Worldwide Express.

description: Snap-on Tools Factory Sales Representative - Selling Direct to Industrial Corporations  Snap-on Inc. is more than the premiere global tool and equipment manufacturer; we are a leading global innovator, manufacturer and marketer of complex equipment and systems solutions. We operate in critical industries like; Aerospace, Energy and Natural Resources, Defense, Transportation, and Manufacturing.  At Snap-on Industrial, our team of sales Solutioneers prides themselves on our ability to offer our customer “Business Partners”, unique solutions. We actively listen to their requirements and develop specific solutions tailored to meet their needs. As a solutioneer you will use your superior sales and problem solving skills to help our business partners become more productive. In return, you will receive a generous benefits package and a future of career opportunities.  As a Snap-on Sales Solutioneer You Will Work intently with our business partners to thoroughly understand their business needs, and leverage the broad range of Snap-on product offerings to develop solutions unique to the situation. Build and enhance relationships with key business partner decision-makers. Present at all levels of the organization; from C suite sales presentations, to lunch and learns on the shop floor or in the field. Develop and maintain a Customer Contact and Activity Database for assigned accounts. Monitor Sales Activity Reports, projecting annual sales goals, preparing territorial sales forecasts and verifying that sales activity supports the forecast and projected sales. Reviewing customer activities at least quarterly with Team Leader or Sales Manager and strategizing ways to maximize sales volumes or grow territory. 3-5 years of outside sales experience is required Proven track record of prior goal achievement showing increase in sales and customer growth Bachelor or Associate degree preferred Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite products including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook Strong organizational and communication skills are required and comfort working with and presenting to all levels within an organization Must hold and maintain a valid driver license with an impeccable driving record Join the industry leader!  We Offer a Substantial Compensation And Benefits Package That Includes  As part of the Snap-on team, you'll be joining an extraordinary company that has been the industry standard for over 100 years. As part of our team, you will not only provide superb service and innovative solutions to our business partners, but enjoy the benefits of working for an extraordinary company. Competitive compensation with incentive opportunities Generous Paid Time Off (PTO) Health, Dental, and Vision coverage Defined Retirement Savings Plan 401K And more! You and Snap-on - let’s get started, NOW!  Snap-on is a drug free work environment and welcomes all qualified candidates to apply. Local candidates are strongly encouraged to apply since we are not offering relocation assistance at this time.  Snap-on is an Equal Opportunity Employer, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran  Job Type Full-time

It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing! We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.  Kyriba is seeking an energetic, self-starting, entrepreneurial Strategic Sales Executive. The Kyriba Strategic Sales Executive will be responsible for generating Kyriba’s most strategic accounts. Through a strategic approach, this individual will establish sales priorities, action plans and deliver/exceed on sales goals. This person will be assigned accounts to target and market Kyriba’s solutions in order to secure new subscription business in our Software-as-a-Service(SAAS) business model. They will develop high value relationships with key stakeholders and will be responsible for negotiating and managing large contracts. They will work on bringing in new large strategic accounts (Fortune 500).  Duties And Responsibilities: Utilize networking and prospecting skills to generate leads and identify strategic solution based sales opportunities. Develop and manage high-value relationships with key stakeholders. Provide leadership and guidance to other team members on enterprise accounts and participate in providing input on sales and marketing collateral. Own entire sales process from prospecting to closing business. Coordinate and lead responses to RFIs/RFPs/RFQs. Present Kyriba’s proposals in a professional manner to prospects. Provide feedback to management and Marketing teams on prospects reactions and questions about Kyriba’s solutions. Collaborate with other Kyriba teams including pre-sales, product, value engineering, operations, finance, marketing, and legal. Travel throughout sales territory to cultivate relationships with customers, partners, and related associations. Ensures opportunities are accurately reflected and maintained in Salesforce, providing weekly updates, monthly projections and quarterly committed forecasts of sales activity and volume to Kyriba NA Sales management team.  Requirements: 10+ years of experience selling complex enterprise cloud solutions, working with large high-profile accounts (This is a core requirement) Exhibits “hunter” mentality and possesses outstanding ability to close sales. Proven record and strong capability to generate leads, pursue opportunities and sell. Experience selling business applications to business users - ERP, CRM, HCM solutions Strong background in Treasury or experience selling to the CFO buying center is a big plus. Experience with comprehensive account planning, relationship mapping, and business strategy mapping following sales methodologies like Target Account Selling or similar Possesses strong sensibility for technology. Ability to solve customer-related problems in a positive manner. Strong in consultative and insight-based selling. Experience articulating complex solutions to decision makers and executives. Proven ability to grow revenue and manage accounts Knowledge of Cloud SaaS industry Experience analyzing data trends Bachelor Degree required  Kyriba Culture and Values: At Kyriba, we value a strong work culture and sense of community and ownership among our global team. We live by our “iCare” value system to demonstrate our care and commitment to our clients and to each other. In hiring, we look for candidates that are a strong fit with our culture and values, as well as bring the talent and experience required by the position.  Innovation: We foster innovation and entrepreneurial thinking across our team by rewarding employees for their achievements and encouraging efficiency and continual process improvement. Client Success: Our passion is to enable our clients’ success. We do this by understanding their needs, and developing and managing solutions that provide them the insight to effectively drive decision making within their organizations. Accountability: We each take personal responsibility for our actions. We are committed to our own continuous improvement and we go the extra mile to meet our clients' needs. Respect: We respect each other’s ideas, efforts and commitments, and embrace our diverse cultures and points of view. We achieve our goals through teamwork, responsiveness, open communication and a positive attitude. Excellence: We strive for excellence in all that we do and bring the passion and commitment to deliver on our promises. We achieve excellence through leadership, teamwork, transparency and integrity, and we are committed to recognizing employee achievements.  Kyriba believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.
