description: The Company  COMPANY DESCRIPTION  30 + years ago, Charlotte Products started with a shared vision: to bring effective, healthy and environmentally responsible cleaning solutions to the market. Since then Charlotte Products has grown into a global leader for sustainable cleaning innovation.  We are a performance formulator and manufacturer of a broad range of cleaning chemical products for the consumer and institutional markets. We strive to lead the industry by providing innovative technology, quality cleaning products, and service excellence to our customers.  We deliver proven innovative cleaning solutions that help make work and living environments healthier and more environmentally responsible, while supporting business sustainability.  This Means That We Are Continuously developing and sourcing products to meet environmental needs of our customers Assisting customers in establishing and maintaining green cleaning programs Implementing measures to reduce energy, materials and waste in our operations Providing learning opportunities for our customers and employees Supporting health, education and environmental initiatives to strengthen the communities in which we live and do business As industry experts, we combine sustainable, green certified and innovative products with simplified programs, product training and resources by market segment, to inspire our customers to join us as industry experts creating safe healthy spaces. Charlotte Products Ltd. brands include Enviro-Solutions®, ServClean®, Custom Solutions® and ALLORGANIC®  Why Work For Us? We are passionate about helping people everywhere live safer and healthier lives. Our vision is bold: to be the global leader in creating effective, healthy, and environmentally responsible cleaning solutions. Our core values drive everything we do. We truly believe in investing in our people. We focus on our employee’s individual growth by providing proper training and professional development plans. Our employees are our future and the pillars supporting our growth and success. Our company is committed to supporting our communities with numerous outreach opportunities and initiatives. We focus on helping those in need by donating our time/expertise with our products to clean spaces to promote safe and healthy living. Opportunity Overview  We are currently seeking a Regional Sales Manager in the Chicago/Midwest area who will report directly to the Director of Sales – U.S. We are looking for someone who comes to work each day with our shared purpose: to create safe and healthy spaces for people everywhere.  POSITION PROFILE  Reporting Structure  Reports to: Director of Sales – U.S.  LOCATION  Chicago / Midwest United States  General Job Description Summary  The Regional Sales Manager maintains and expands relationships with strategically large customers as well as managing a regular book of business. Assigned to a group of named customers and working with their sales representatives, this position is responsible for achieving a defined sales quota while executing on assigned strategic account objectives.  The Regional Sales Manager represents the entire range of company products and services to assigned customers, while leading the customer account planning cycle and ensuring assigned customers’ needs and expectations are met by the company. This individual is directly involved in bid/RFP strategy, overseeing key account renewals and negotiations, strategic price increases and maintaining top level relationships with strategic customers.  KEY Responsibilities Establishes productive, professional relationships with key personnel in assigned customer accounts. Coordinates the involvement of company personnel, including AM’s, Sales Operations group, Operations, Customer Service and management resources, in order to meet account performance objectives and customers’ expectations. Meets assigned targets for profitable sales and gross margin volumes and strategic objectives in assigned accounts. Proactively leads a joint company-strategic account planning process that develops mutual performance objectives, financial targets, and critical milestones for a one and three-year period. Proactively assesses, clarifies, and validates customer needs on an ongoing basis. Leads solution development efforts that best address customer needs, while coordinating the involvement of all necessary company personnel. Works closely with a Charlotte subsidiary to grow sales in technology/innovation solutions across territory. Responsible for proper care/usage of personal computers/cell phones (company property) Achieves assigned sales quota in designated strategic accounts. Meets assigned expectations for profitability. Achieves strategic customer objectives defined by company management. Completes strategic customer account plans that meet company standards. Maintains high customer satisfaction ratings that meet company exemplary objectives. Acts as an advocate for sales training by ensuring proficiency, implementation, and continuous improvement. Promotes, enforces and utilizes the company CRM tool for the active management of customer activities, customer opportunities, and funnel management. Manages his/her sales funnel, tracks and manages win roll-outs in conjunction with the Sales Operations Group. Enlists the support of sales specialists, service personnel, implementation resources, and other company resources to ensure complete account penetration across all lines of business Closely coordinates company executive involvement with customer management. Develops, implements, and executes strategies to accelerate account acquisition and line of business penetration. Overseeing account renewals and negotiations. Other duties as assigned. CANDIDATE PROFILE  Experience Strong leadership ability to negotiate, execute and generate outstanding sales results. Minimum three years BSB selling. Experience selling to and servicing Distribution is a plus. Ability to set targets and design growth plans. Excellent communication, interpersonal and presentation skills Ability to interface at the most senior levels at a customer site. Tech savvy, with the ability to sell new and innovative technology products. Strong analytical skills with the ability to multi-task. Strong interpersonal and customer relation skills. Strong business, financial, operations, and technical acumen. Demonstrates consultative selling skills. Demonstrate strong teambuilding attributes. Ability to develop various market, sales, and customer growth strategies along with plans. Computer literacy, including competency related to MS Windows-based applications. Decision making ability and exercise good judgment. Education Bachelor’s Degree in Business/Sales/Marketing or related discipline. Travel Requirements Regular and unrestricted availability to travel within the U.S. and Canada as needed. Compensation  An attractive compensation package, including a competitive salary and performance-based bonus and commission plan is available for this role.

description: The ideal candidate will be responsible for supporting our sales team. You will be a key contributor to our sales team's success. You will primarily be in charge of scheduling and preparing our sales team for important meetings and trade shows. You will provide outstanding customer service by liasoning between the sales team and the customer.   Responsibilities Assist in creating sales material for sales preparation and success Coordinate scheduling with clients and sales team members Lead client correspondence Coordinate shipping and delivery Handle customer inquiries and issues  Qualifications equivalent experience Customer-service oriented Proficient in Microsoft Office

BlueWhale’s Lead Generation solutions are used by Fortune 500 marketers and leading agencies to engage the right buyer at the right time, accelerating the sales cycle and increasing deal size. We have delivered over 2 million qualified prospects to the biggest names in B2B technology. With team members located in London, Boston, New York, and San Francisco, we are singularly focused on delivering marketing services that drive revenue for our customers.  We have a company culture and workplace community based upon the following values: Be honorable Be authentic Be humble Be innovative  We welcome and expect everyone to make these values their own, add their unique contribution to our culture and community, and share the benefits of our ongoing success.  Job Summary The Sales Development Representative (SDR) will identify, qualify, and nurture sales prospects through email and outbound calling activities for both BlueWhale Research and its clients.  The ideal candidate is highly self-motivated and will chase after aggressive goals. They must understand how to assess a company’s needs and organizational structure to cater specific outreach to each prospect, easily initiating relaxed yet informative phone conversations.  What you’ll do: Leverage an account based marketing approach to research high-value accounts Find, contact, and qualify prospects on the selection committee Manage a multi-step follow-up process using lead nurturing software Use complex phone scripts and personalized emails to engage, educate and qualify prospects over time Demonstrate the ability to understand and articulate the campaign’s value proposition Schedule qualified appointments and demos for account executives that convert to opportunities Achieve high-volume outreach goals consistently Maintain accurate records of activity and lead qualification information Utilize critical thinking to solve problems, evaluate data, establish significance, and reach a conclusion Provide constructive and data-driven feedback on lead quality and conversion rates  What you’ll need: This position requires an ambitious self-starter who can effectively produce qualified appointments and meetings. Gain attention and speak confidently with executives in a cold calling environment Showcase professional verbal and written communication skills Understand and document prospect’s pain points and requirements while conveying value Have grit and be resilient in handling objections Show a strong sense of urgency for reaching goals and meeting deliverables Possess an entrepreneurial mind set and proactively provide feedback to improve campaigns Be willing to accept and act on change quickly Take action on coaching recommendations Be self directed and take ownership for your professional development An understanding of IT software and technology (CRM, ERP, HR, communications, security, etc) preferred Familiarity with core sales tools (Salesforce, Salesloft, Google Suite, Linkedin, Microsoft Office) preferred Outbound or cold calling experience required Bachelor’s degree or equivalent  What you’ll get: Unlimited time off Aggressive 401(K) savings plan Competitive health insurance reimbursement plan Office Perks including unlimited snacks and company lunches  BlueWhale Research is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran, or disability status.  Job Type: Full-time Pay: Up to $70,000.00 per year COVID-19 considerations: regular sanitation Vaccination Required

We are seeking a passionate sales analyst who is motivated by our mission at Revol Greens. The sales and production analyst will be responsible for collecting, cleansing, and analyzing sales data from our internal systems and customers, creating forecasts for future sales trends and projecting future product and packaging needs, and making informed suggestions to the leadership team.  Role and Responsibilities Collects data from sales reports for analysis Develops methods and strategies for assessing large amounts of data Closely studies past sales data to determine trends in productivity Understands company budget and evaluates cost components against budgeted goals Conducts research into competitive companies and the surrounding market Studies shopping and purchase trends of consumer base and target demographic Creates sales evaluation reports and trend reports based on collected data Presents sales reports to Revol Greens sales leadership team Suggests adjustments and revisions to promotional strategies to improve sales and profitability Leads customer sustainability reporting campaigns with our customers Manages internal and external item databases and new customer item set-up  Preferred Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Demonstrates proficiency in the use of sales forecasting software Possesses knowledge of the fresh produce and transportation industry Exhibits proficiency in leveraging Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and PowerPoint Speaks confidently and articulately in front of a group Demonstrate the ability to think both analytically and creatively Possesses strong problem-solving skills Pays close attention to detail Manages time efficiently Works well with a team Can translate financial and mathematical jargon into layman’s terms for explanatory purposes Possesses strong written communication skills Can conduct independent research  Education and Experience: Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Business Administration, Finance, Accounting or Marketing Analytics. Prior work experience in the sales, finance, or marketing are a bonus. Work Environment: Role would be full-time 40 hours per week with part-time on site and virtual.  Technology allows for us to work remotely at times but their will be an on site presence required to build relationships with coworkers and customers as well as to become familiar with our production at the Greenhouses.  Hours-Benefits Monday – Friday (weekends if necessary) 401k plan with 4% company match after 6 months of employment Health and Dental Insurance benefits Potential bonus and/or a mix of options

Benefitfocus Inc.  Benefitfocus (NASDAQ: BNFT) is a growing national software company, founded and headquartered in Charleston, South Carolina. We provide industry-leading cloud-based benefits management solutions that simplify how organizations and individuals shop for, enroll in, manage and exchange benefits. At Benefitfocus we are driven by the impact we make in the lives of our customers, and we value our Associates as our #1 asset to our success.  Benefitfocus is looking to add a Sales Development Representative to our Charleston, SC based team. This is a remote opportunity. The Sales Development Representative is responsible for generating interest in our Benefitfocus solutions and for cultivating new sales opportunities for our Employer Account Executives. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills, customer facing experience, and a solution oriented mindset.  Generate New Sales Opportunities Source new sales opportunities through inbound campaign follow up and outbound cold calls, emails, and LinkedIn messages Drive conversion of suspect to prospect through account research, identifying key players and generating interest in Benefitfocus solutions Route qualified prospects to appropriate Account Executive with validated account information Develop sales team relationships and processes to ensure efficient lead passing and timely follow up to develop prospects Collaborate with area sales teams to manage the suspect / prospect pipeline for additional activity Effectively Supporting Marketing Initiatives Re-qualify incoming leads from trade shows, events, Web and other sales/marketing activities Follow up on direct AE sales activities to include - drops, targeted letters/ email, local events Collaborate with AEs to source valuable account information in Salesforce Partner with local AE to build targeted strategic campaigns Drive cross selling activities in customer base - media sales, portal, communications Demonstrate Technical, Product & Industry Expertise Be proficient in our CRM, Salesforce.com and Salesforce Engage. Dedicated to data quality and meticulous population of key sales information Have the ability to provide an overview of Benefitfocus Portfolio of Products & Services in written form and verbally. Must know how to answer basic questions about our service offerings. Demonstrate ability to articulate Benefitfocus value messaging. Devote to continuous learning of industry - trends, competitors, market Experience in Microsoft Excel, Hoovers, Zoominfo, and MiEdge Experience And Skills High energy level: make large number of calls and targeted emails daily Self motivated: set personal goals (activities, results, income) and track success Dedication to quality Team player: share best practices, contribute to team success, build internal partnerships Time management: ability to multi task and manage time effectively to achieve weekly and monthly goals Results oriented: understand where you are against all established goals, make corrections and adjustments accordingly Creative: use tools, campaigns, events to deliver successful results across a variety of accounts and industries. Demonstrate ability to tailor messaging and approach. Strong interpersonal skills: must be able to build positive relationships both internally and externally to achieve success Bachelor's Degree. SaaS/HCM industry knowledge is preferred. Experience working with Account Executives Excellent knowledge and utilization of Salesforce for accurate pipeline and account management. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and interpersonal skills Solution oriented mindset; overcome sales objections

We are looking for a unique breed — a natural closer with a head for managing projects, client relationships and support. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, can learn quickly, maintain focus and work collaboratively while being responsible for their own results in an autonomous environment. If you think of yourself as a super-utility Swiss army knife — someone who can think strategically and act tactically on multiple fronts — we want you to join our growing team of talented, smart superstars and help us build a national brand.  About Us: Biller Genie is an innovative invoicing and accounts receivable automation software that helps companies get their invoices paid faster and eliminate busy work. Our free technology is disrupting the payments and accounting industries and helps our clients advance, automate, and optimize their entire Accounts Receivable process. We are based in Miami, FL and growing rapidly, with clients all over the United States. Visit www.billergenie.com to learn more about our company.  In this role, you will be expected to: Establish a trusted advisor relationship to achieve and expand customer goals resulting in upsells, cross-sells, and consistent renewals. Be the primary point of contact and build long-term relationships with customers. Assist customers through email, phone, screen-share, and chat with general software enquiries. Increase sales by driving product adoption, managing escalations, and thereby ensuring retention and long-term satisfaction. Grow our subscription business by conducting sales meetings, customizing marketing presentations and proposals to meet prospective client needs. Conduct evaluations and consult clients based on unique needs Recognize and relay feedback from the market and clients for product success. You will use that same skill to implement personal feedback from managers for your development Provide mentorship and guidance to the team members to achieve highest levels of quality and productivity Be adaptive and strike a good balance between speed and efficiency Qualifications: Minimum 1 years of experience in Software as a Service (SaaS) sales or customer service preferred. Driven, passionate about sales and customer service Strong experience in a metrics driven, fast-paced environments A motivated, coachable, and competitive go-getter, a resilient achiever driven to win and excel An energetic team player with exceptional organizational, interpersonal, and communication skills Exposure to CRM applications (HubSpot) to successfully manage leads, opportunities, and accounts Benefits: Base Salary + Commission Medical, dental, vision and life benefits available This is a fantastic opportunity for a driven individual who wants to be a part of a great team and be rewarded for overachievement. We provide on the job training and the latest technology to help you be successful, but expectations for you to perform are high and we are growing quickly. This role is critical to the growth and success of our business, and you will be an integral part to our success. As such, we are looking for an entrepreneurial minded individual that believes in our vision and growth strategies and is looking for a long-term partnership.  Powered by JazzHR  KjsaZB8rcw

description: The Sales Representative is responsible for identifying, creating, and working on new qualified sales opportunities through the point of close. This role will manage both inbound warm leads as well as outbound campaigns for their sales vertical by identifying new prospects, qualifying buying interest, and working with critical decision-makers through a sales process. From proven sales systems and sales training to lucrative compensation structures and career growth, the Sales Representative will be equipped with everything they will need to be successful. This is a remote position, so you'll be able to work from home if desired. About Us: We are a full-service digital marketing agency based in North County San Diego that specializes in website design, SEO, and PPC. Founded in 2008, our results-driven marketing strategies enable B2B and B2C organizations to compete at the highest level regionally and nationally. We specialize in three main verticals: Law Firm Marketing Multi-Office Practices Family Law Personal Injury Health & Wellness Marketing Multi-Office Practices Dental Oral Surgery Physical Therapy Mental Health Couples Therapy EMDR Therapy Hospitality - Wine & Craft Marketing Wineries Craft Breweries Craft Distilleries B2B suppliers to Wineries and Craft Beverage Producers Your Day-to-Day: Quick and strategic follow-up via phone, email, and social media for all inbound leads Making 50+ outbound phone calls each day Creating creative outbound prospecting strategy and executing on that strategy within your vertical focus: cold call, email, social selling, direct mail, etc. Achieving and exceeding weekly/monthly performance metrics (appointments set, qualified leads worked, deals closed, etc) Educating yourself on your market and its nuances to gain business knowledge through research and intelligence gathering Identifying pain points and challenges within your industry You will receive regular sales training and report to management who values investing in their people both personally and professionally. This will entail weekly 1-on-1 meetings, weekly sales team meetings, and monthly alignment meetings. Opportunity to “sharpen the ax” and receive continued education and career growth Organize data, clean up pipeline, and produce weekly reporting Opportunity to be assigned a sales administrator to take non-revenue generating work off of your plate Basic Qualifications 2-5 years of sales experience in B2B/SaaS Digital Marketing Sales is a HUGE plus Experience in one of the following is preferred Law Firm Sales Health & Wellness Sales Hospitality - Wine and Craft Marketing sales California, Oregon or Washington You embody our Core Values: Do the Right Thing: We act with honesty and integrity. There is no alternative. Be Helpful: We share knowledge. If you know the best way to do something, you will do good work. If you share that knowledge with others, you will become a leader. Move Fast: We tackle challenges without delay. We believe that it’s better to move fast and make mistakes than to move slowly and miss opportunities. Embrace Change: We seek out and embrace transformation. If we are not continuously changing, evolving, and improving, then we are falling behind. Never Stop Learning: Our quest for knowledge is driven by relentless curiosity. We seek to improve and innovate continually. Give Joy: Be grateful, positive, and convivial. Make people feel good. You are simultaneously able to follow a proven process while also being able to think “on the fly” and be nimble You are curious… this means you are never content with where you’re currently at because you always realize that there is more to learn and become Can demonstrate empathy towards potential customers and even be willing to walk away from a deal if the fit isn’t there Display resilience when facing rejection. Desire to work in a fast-paced environment with high growth You can own up to failure and not point fingers when things aren’t going smoothly Highly organized Don’t need external motivation to get you up in the morning You are confident using a CRM, sales tools, and LinkedIn. Team player Why You’ll Love Working with us: Compensation: $50k-$65k base 1st year OTE $110k+ 2nd year OTE $150k+ Flexible time off. Upward career growth opportunities Belief in the service - Our growth framework solves a huge pain-point in the marketplace and we’re considered world-class at what we do Culture is one of our top priorities. You will find a community at Nimbletoad Streamlined, modern sales tools and efficient sales process We are incredible at what we do and have the proof to back it up, so you’ll believe in what you sell

The ideal candidate will possess strong sales, interpersonal and organizational skills. They should be comfortable with multitasking and meet the assigned quotas for their role.  Responsibilities: Build and maintain client relationships Track and record metrics throughout sales process Meet and exceed financial goals Understand and keep up-to-date with industry and competitive landscape knowledge  Requirements: Past experience working in a 100% commission-based role Knowledge of Tech Stack: SalesForce, SalesLoft, ZoomInfo, LinkedIn, Gong Experience working inbound opportunities and the ability to source self-generated business, as well Has experience closing a minimum of $100k a month in revenue via inbound and outbound efforts if background is B2C Has worked in business development Strong communication skills Strong organizational skills  Please review WeShield's website and products before applying* Please note: This job offers a base of $500/week, but please be comfortable with "closing", high-ticket sales and relying on commission for salary.

Your Role:  Prospect small and large business Conduct direct sales strategies Promote our clients Professionally represent our firm Interact with customers Initiate the sales cycle Assist with product purchases Track and report sales Coordinate territories Participate in classroom training  Qualifications:  0 - 3 years of experience in sales, restaurants, customer acquisition, or a related field Superior communication skills Professional and personable Ruthlessly determined to succeed Team oriented Ability to build quick relationships              Candidates with the following experience are encouraged to apply today: General Labor, Construction, Home Improvement, Labor, Labor and Development Operations, Field Construction, Telecom Construction, Construction Management or Construction Experience

description: Description  What Makes Verbit Unique?  Verbit’s 200+ individuals share a vision of making all video and audio content accessible to everyone. Verbit’s in-house, AI-based solutions take live and recorded audio and video to the next level with the support of 22,000 human professional transcribers. Our captioning, transcription, translation, and audio description are trusted by leading universities, corporations, legal agencies, and media entities to make their content accessible, engaging, and interactive!  Verbitizers are actively making the world more equitable for individuals with disabilities every day. After achieving the milestone of becoming a “unicorn company” and showcasing 6x revenue growth year over year, we are humbled and still fascinated by this ride. You too can join our journey toward accessibility and the reinvention of industry practices. Join our offices in New York, San Francisco, Tel Aviv, and Kyiv to take advantage of flexible remote work opportunities and work with amazing people.  Do You Have Verbitzer DNA?  Verbitizers have the initiative to bring goals and dreams to fruition with a can-do attitude and the motivation of true go-getters.  We’re a Group Of Tech-savvy individuals who are always open to more growth and learning opportunities Adaptable and flexible people who thrive in a fast-paced, startup environment Creative minds who rethink and question how to outperform past results Effective communicators who can promote and represent Verbit’s tech and brand If this sounds like you, keep reading.  Responsibilities Conduct analysis of complex data and translate the results into actionable deliverables, business insights, and reports. Work cross-functionally with sales teams, marketing & CS to optimize sales results and implement processes. Manage the booking forecast process including close work with Sales management. Help build the systems, reports, and processes to measure metrics and KPIs. Remain knowledgeable of key processes, business initiatives, and internal resources to assist the sales team in accomplishing company goals. Collaborate with internal resources to ensure reports are translated to actions and results are monitored. Provide maintenance and support to internal stakeholders. Assist sales teams with crafting Quotes, Rate Cards, and Enterprise Licensing Agreements Assist with developing, deploying, and managing tools that are needed to increase productivity. Sales Focal point for any Salesforce question or help Responsible for technical training to the sales team (Salesforce, Dealhub CPQ) Requirements  The Ideal Candidate: Bachelor's degree in business, finance, or related field/ experience 2+ years of successful sales operations experience (SaaS experience preferred) Strong analytical, data mining, and modeling skills Able to drive execution, initiate projects, and manage them start to end Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment Be creative and solutions-oriented Process-oriented, well-organized, and autonomous learner High proficiency with Excel Experience with configuration and administration of Salesforce, and comfortable working with Salesforce flows, formulas, custom views, reports, and dashboards Curious, proactive, loves to help others, and is excited about getting things done Ability to leverage numbers and insights to influence & drive sound decision making
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: Andrew Davidson & Co., Inc. is one of the leading providers of sophisticated financial analytics and consulting. We are thought leaders in policy and modeling, as well as leading providers of financial software products that solve complex investment risk and valuation problems for mortgages and other assets. Our culture is based on intellectual curiosity, mutual respect, and, above all else, integrity. We strive to offer all employees the chance to grow. As our company continues to grow, we are looking to fill several positions.  Our analytics are used by some of the world’s largest and leading institutional, fixed income investors. These include banks, guarantors, credit unions, insurance companies, reinsurers, regulators, broker-dealers, hedge funds and money management firms  You are experienced and entrepreneurial. Your mission is to grow and expand the distribution of our models, applications and advisory services. Working within our consulting-based sales approach, you’ll leverage market and product knowledge with a creative approach to finding solutions. As the Business Development Associate, you’ll identify growth opportunities within our core market sectors: Depository Institutions, Mortgage Banking, Insurance Companies and Asset Management. More specifically, you will: Develop and foster new relationships with potential clients in our core market sectors, while also leveraging and building on existing ones. Provide market intelligence to product managers, senior management, and the rest of the firmregarding market developments, regulatory and accounting initiatives, and analytical trends that can be used to help drive the product development queue and raise the overall level of market knowledge at the firm. Effectively manage the sales cycle including initial contact and presentations, utilization of internal product and market experts, trial management and contract negotiation. Work with Product Managers to determine the distribution channels for the core market sectors that will maximize revenue to the firm. Identify and secure speaking opportunities for the firm at key industry conferences and events that target core market sectors. Effectively plan and devise strategies to grow revenue and increase awareness of the firm’s products and services.  QUALIFICATIONS You’ve earned a bachelor’s degree in finance, economics or marketing. You have 3-5 years selling financial based software or analytics targeted to one or more of our core market segments. You have excellent written, communication and presentation skills, with an eye for details. Time management and organization are among the keys to your success. You are a self-starter who is internally and personally motivated to succeed, but are also a team player.   At AD&Co, we have a flat organization (no managers) and a generous and fun corporate culture. Every employee is equal and everyone has a voice.We are an equal opportunity employer.We are committed to diversity in all its forms. We offer a generous vacation policy, excellent health benefits, profit sharing, 401K, and ESOP that gives you ownership in the company, plus much more. (Other perks include beautiful, spacious offices, a well-stocked café, lunch meetings, social outings and seminars, and a commitment to learning. For more information on what it’s like to work at AD&Co, visit our website at Join Our Team | Andrew Davidson & Co., Inc. (ad-co.com)

Magstim is a global medical device organization with a focus on TMS (Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation), a non-invasive neuromodulation technology pioneered by Magstim over 30 years ago. TMS therapy requires medical device (capital equipment) to treat patients struggling with depression. TMS therapy systems are primarily sold to psychiatrists, hospitals, and behavioral health clinics.  We are looking for an enthusiastic and experienced Inside Sales Specialist who can generate sales leads, set appointments for our Outside Sales Reps and increase awareness of Magstim TMS Therapy. In this position, you will play a key role in ensuring a superior customer journey throughout the entire customer experience – from lead qualification to the post-sales phase. The Inside Sales Rep will work closely with the Outside Sales Team as well as interface with other departments in the organization such as marketing, sales operations, training, and service.  This position reports to the VP TMS Clinical Sales and is based at our Headquarters in Plymouth, MN.  The preferred candidate has Inside Sales experience and is looking for a broader entrepreneurial role with growth opportunities.  Job Responsibilities: • Proactively call hospital/facility outpatient clinics, private practice physicians and groups to generate sales leads for outside sales team; • Identify decision makers and develop a rapport to obtain key information regarding emails, current treatments offered, etc.; • Input all findings, calls, leads, etc. into CRM system; • Follow-up with emails to provide additional information, and to introduce and transition to appropriate sales representatives; • Schedule sales appointments for outside sales reps; • Develop proficiency on Magstim TMS Therapy and related products; • Assist in managing sales cycles from identifying customers through scheduling delivery and routine follow-up with customers; • Provide required pre- and post-sale documentation; • Work with sales operations to manage service contracts and warranty programs.  Experience & Background: • Prior Inside Sales experience preferred; • Experience working in the medical device industry preferred; • Experience calling on psychiatrists and behavioral health providers preferred; • Ability to work in fast-paced, dynamic environment with minimal supervision; • Ability to effectively set priorities and manage time; • Team player with experience working collaboratively in a cross-functional environment; • Working knowledge of relevant computer programs such as Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint; • Excellent communication and presentation skills; • Resourceful and results-oriented; • Resilient and able to handle rejection and keep on working with positive attitude.  Fulfilling Work with Opportunities for Advancement: Magstim offers a challenging and fulfilling work environment with good career prospects in a fast-growing international company. We offer a competitive compensation package which consists of salary plus commissions.  Organization Information: Magstim is a private global medical device company that is part of Welcony Inc. with more than 330 employees world-wide. Welcony Inc. technologies have supported thousands of research labs, clinics, hospitals and universities that focus on mental health, brain disorders, cognitive neuroscience and neuromonitoring. Key brands include Magstim Magnetic Stimulation capital equipment, MagstimEGI high-density EEG software and capital equipment, Technomed Clinical Neurophysiology consumables and Neurosign Intraoperative Nerve Safety Monitoring capital equipment and consumables  How to apply for this career opportunity? We appreciate hearing from all qualified candidates by submitting your application by going to www.careersatmagstim.com

Job Description As a Clinical Sales Representative (CSR)for the East Area, this individual will serve as the point person for all program development and clinical success, including procedural disposable sales and driving utilization for all Aquyre Biosciences Inc. technologies and applications.  The CSR will be primarily responsible for developing and executing business plans for assigned territories by managing any post sales installation of the CelTivity™ System and will support adoption and utilization of the technology intra-procedurally, including educating physicians and staff on the use of the products.  The CSR will be tasked with leading clinical and technical product discussions and demonstrations as part of the sales process, conducting customer business reviews, and expanding customer usage.    Primary Responsibilities •Develop and execute quarterly business objectives which achieve procedural and disposable sales revenue targets within the assigned geographical territory. •Initiate post CelTivity™ System sales installation, implementation, and adoption in collaboration with the health system and Aquyre internal support team to achieve the desired business objective.  •Maintain a detailed, frequently updated business plan with accurate sales forecasting for the territory. • Work with the Capital Sales Team to execute key strategic sales activities that maximize all CelTivity™ system capital and disposable sales. •Lead product technical and clinical demonstrations to ensure proper utilization of the CelTivity™ technology. • Partner with customers to ensure they can achieve the best possible clinical and economic outcome of implementing the CelTivity™ System in their programs, improving overall satisfaction and utilization.  •Ability to develop and demonstrate an expert level knowledge of all Aquyre Biosciences Inc. products and services and a complete understanding of industry and market trends.  Qualifications •A minimum of a bachelor's degree and 3-5 years of Medical Device or related sales experience is required. Start-up experienced is preferred. •2+ years experience working in a procedurally focused sales position attending live patient cases as when required as part of the job. •Demonstrated ability to learn and communicate technical product as well as clinical knowledge of disease states to physicians and economic buyers. •The ability to travel extensively up to 50-75%, including overnight travel within Eastern U.S. is a must for the role. Ideal candidate will be based out of Boston, Philadelphia or Baltimore / DC markets. •Entrepreneurial self-starter who performs well with autonomy and problem solver who can think critically in high pressure environments.  •Receptive to constructive feedback and collaborates well within a team environment.  •Must be highly organized with the ability to manage and execute multiple projects/tasks simultaneously and effectively prioritize action steps. •Ability to communicate at a high level and frequency daily with their peers, sales leadership, and the broader organization.  Work Environment and Travel Requirements This position operates in a field-based sales territory environment. Candidate must be able to work autonomously with a detailed plan of action.  This role requires a personal vehicle for field travel with a valid driver's license.  Business mileage re-imbursement will be provided for the personal vehicle.  A company issued computer will be issued as well as monthly re-imbursement for mobile device plans. The physical demands of the role are as follows; stand for long periods of time in the procedure room sometimes while wearing lead aprons and PPE equipment, ability to lift and move demonstration equipment sometimes in excess of 40 lbs.  This position requires travel within the assigned geographical sales territory up to 75% of the time with potential frequent overnight hotel stays.  Company Description At Aquyre Biosciences Inc. (Cambridge, MA) our mission is to become the standard of care for tissue adequacy assessment.  What Makes Aquyre Biosciences Different? Our technology combines two unique and proprietary technologies in one exam, offering a non-invasive, non-destructive, intra-procedural tissue adequacy assessment, in freshly excised tissue, within 2 minutes. Our technologies include Full-Field Optical Coherence Tomography (FFOCT) which offers an en-face (transverse), high resolution, 3D image of biopsy tissue micro-architecture, at a resolution of 1μm. FFOCT also allows for depth exploration at different focal planes, without compromising 1μm resolution. The second technology, Dynamic Cell Imaging™ (DCI) is used to enhance the cellular contrast by capturing the residual microscopic intracellular activity and behaviors in freshly excised tissue, without staining or destroying the tissue.   Aquyre Biosciences Inc. is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Who We Are:  Aviatrix is a well-funded, pre-IPO, hyper-growth enterprise-software company based in the heart of Silicon Valley (Santa Clara, CA). Aviatrix technology has proven solid at scale with nearly 600 enterprise customers, over 40 of the Global Fortune 500. We have a top-tier, experienced leadership team, combined with a collaborative culture built on proven success, trust, execution, and respect. We’re focused on getting things done!  Read recent article published in Bloomberg on Aviatrix’s incredible rise in value  What We Do:  Aviatrix is networking for the cloud era , delivering a superset of features and capabilities that leverage and control native cloud constructs and add advance network, security and operational visibility features that cloud providers lack, while maintaining the simplicity and automation enterprises expect in cloud. Aviatrix offers the industry’s first and only multi-cloud networking certification ( ACE ), empowering IT to lead and accelerate the transformation to the cloud.  ABOUT THE ROLE:  We are looking for an ambitious Sales Development Representative to join our cutting-edge Sales team! We have immediate openings for Sales Development Representative(s) that are eager to drive revenue growth for the company and be part of our Marketing and Sales teams. Your role will be to seek new Aviatrix business opportunities by contacting and developing relationships with potential customers.  To be successful in this role, you should have previous experience developing leads from marketing campaigns and meeting sales quotas. You understand that in this role relentless activity is what drives results, and you’ll use your communication skills to cultivate strong relationships with customers.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Qualify leads from marketing campaigns as sales opportunities Execute the required prospecting activity to meet lead goals Contact potential clients through cold calls and emails Present Aviatrix to potential clients Identify client needs and suggest appropriate products/services Partner with sales to prospect key targets, follow up and adhere to sales processes Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market Set up meetings or calls between (prospective) clients and Aviatrix’s Account Executives. Document activity in Salesforce.com; communicate qualitative information as needed Report to the VP of Marketing on (weekly/monthly/quarterly) sales results  KEY REQUIREMENTS: 1-5 years proven work experience as a SDR, Inside Sales or similar role Hands-on experience with multiple sales techniques (including cold calls) Track record of achieving sales quotas through executing activity Experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce) Familiarity with MS Excel (analyzing spreadsheets and charts) Understanding of sales performance metrics Excellent communication and negotiation skills Ability to deliver engaging presentations Fundamental understanding of network technology concepts desired, not mandatory BS or BA degree in Marketing, Business Administration or relevant field  Aviatrix, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and does not make hiring decisions based on race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Description  The Amazon Web Services (AWS) Marketplace team is looking for an Sales Operations Specialist to join our fast-paced team. The AWS Marketplace is an online store that helps customers find, buy, and immediately start using software and services that run on the AWS Cloud. This is an exciting opportunity to help deliver on our mission to bring Amazon’s e-commerce expertise to cloud software and fundamentally change how software is discovered, purchased, and deployed by AWS customers.  The Sales Operations Specialist role will own and execute the sales operations for Marketplace sellers and partners. The role requires someone who can learn concepts quickly, and apply them to problem solve and come up with creative solutions. S/he will drive operational improvements to add value, eliminate waste, and improve the CX. There is opportunity to drive change and improvement, and to join a growing team. The ideal candidate has strong attention to detail, can execute well to deliver results, interact with external customers to resolve escalated issues, strong customer obsession, high level of ownership, and a drive to improve current processes.  The Responsibilities Include Perform the operations to drive business performance, meeting quality and service level goals. Perform the seller and customer escalation and support process. Contribute to the creation of new processes. Perform quality control functions to ensure high quality output. Collaborate with multiple stakeholder to maintain successful operations. Life/work balance  Our team is focused on balancing life with work, and does this via work autonomy and by prioritizing solutions and processes that enable us to scale faster than the business. There will be opportunities to work from home some days. Work hours are flexible and typically self-defined.  Mentorship and Career Growth  One of the keys to AWS’s success is its top-tier product management culture. You will have the opportunity to work with multiple AWS business lines that can help you accelerate your career and bring ideas to market. You will be working closely with key internal stakeholders (e.g. Marketplace Product Management & Engineering, AWS field teams, AWS Services (e.g. S3, EC2), migration teams, services, legal, operations and support).  Inclusive and Diverse Culture  Working with a team that welcomes, celebrates, and leverages a diverse set of backgrounds and skillsets to deliver results is exciting. Partnering with others in the organization is key to our long term success and is what helps frame our inclusive culture.   Basic Qualifications Bachelor's degree 3+ years of program or operations experience, preferably within sales or technical organizations Experience working with technical features and products Experience working with external customers Preferred Qualifications Experience building new programs and initiatives. Experience working with Product Management and Engineering teams to deliver new technical features of a Product. Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status. For individuals with disabilities who would like to request an accommodation, please visit https://www.amazon.jobs/en/disability/us   Company - Amazon Web Services, Inc.  Job ID: A1750491

description: Build the solution that transforms the real estate industry!  Want to infuse a $25B sector of the insurance and real estate industry with predictive analytics and a tech-forward customer experience? Yearning for a startup culture within a profitable nationwide company? Join Doma and send an entirely new type of real estate model into the wild.  About Us  Doma and its family of brands - States Title, North American Title Company (NATC) and North American Title Insurance Company (NATIC) - offer solutions for lenders, real estate professionals, title agents, and homeowners that make closings vastly more simple and efficient, reducing cost and increasing customer satisfaction.  Our Values Customer Obsessed – We always put our customers first. Solution Driven – We solve problems that other people are afraid to. People leaders – We grow all of our people into leaders. One Team – We believe inclusion and teamwork produce the best results. Direct with Respect – We communicate with honesty and respect to our colleagues, customers, and partners. Doma is seeking a high-energy, execution-oriented Sales Executive to support our tremendous growth and our transformative solution.  Doma’s Sales Executives are hardworking and driven with high energy, passion, and the initiative to drive new business relationships. Doma is making title and escrow a simpler, seamless process for lenders, agents, and homebuyers across the country. We are building transformative technology driven by our passion to improve the customer experience.  The Sales team focuses exclusively on formulating and executing a pipeline generation strategy within assigned territories, resulting in aggressive pipeline growth and new customer acquisition.  With an inclusive and collaborative culture, Doma is changing and innovating the title industry.  Our sales leadership is committed to hiring, mentoring, and growing the best salesforce by inspiring and enabling success for everyone on the team.  Principal Duties And Responsibilities Take ownership of revenue generation, develop new opportunities, manage pipeline, create, and execute account strategies, and close deals! Understand prospects & customers business needs and effectively communicate how Doma can solve them mastering the ability to communicate our value propositions to prospective clients. Foster long-term relationships with customers and prospective buyers, own the sales process, and strive to achieve individual and team revenue goals. Build an intimate understanding of Doma’s solution and products and their place in the industry Plan and execute a sales strategy which meets regular activity and business development goals Identify opportunities using various techniques such as networking, email marketing, phone, and face-to-face appointments. Overcome objections and use investigative questioning techniques to qualify prospects and determine if they have a business challenge or need, we can address through our offerings. What you should bring to the table as our Ideal Sales Representative: Hunter mentality with solid Sales DNA and willingness to learn and be a part of something great! Meaningful (4+ years) experience in a closing role; preferably in B2B in SaaS or similar marketplace industry with a confident and consultative approach to selling and a record of top performance. Highly professional in your communication style. You earn and instill trust, encouraging prospects to share business goals, strategies, deficiencies, and priorities. Comfort with ambiguity: experience adapting in rapidly changing environments and contributing to an evolving sales process. Experience interfacing with both internal team members and external prospects as a part of a collaborative, solution-based sales process. The mentality of an entrepreneur/owner and a strong bias to action Strong interest in real estate preferred Bachelor’s degree highly preferred Bi-lingual highly preferred We want the work you do here to be the best work of your life.  We believe the most valuable investment we can make - and the greatest boost we can give to your career - is to build an outstanding team of colleagues who are passionate about our mission.  We currently offer the following benefits and will continually evolve them with the goal of efficiently attracting, retaining, and leveraging the very highest quality talent. Our passionate, capable team will always be our #1 benefit We are proud of the team we have built so far, and we are excited about the team we have yet to add Learn something new every day Get more done than you would anywhere else Competitive salaries Top-of-the-line computer equipment Multiple Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits options to allow you to customize to your and your Family’s needs Paid Time Off Health & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) Short Term & Long-Term Disability Commuter Flexible Spending Account (i.e., Transit or Parking) Supplemental Life and AD&D Insurance Auto & Home Insurance Group Life Insurance Pet Insurance We believe in Equal Opportunity  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  #CB  #ZIP

Attention to detail is essential - all communications and contact must be recorded and tracked with accounts throughout the day. This customer- facing role is essential in developing strong relationships with clients and displaying a professional image of AIV.  Don't know anything about medical equipment? That's okay! All training on the equipment and devices we service/sell is provided. One year experience in sales is preferred but not required. COMPANY BACKGROUND  Based in Boulder, CO, Purely Elizabeth is a high-growth natural foods company focused on creating products using elevated, nutrient-rich ingredients. Their award-winning products include granola, oatmeal and baking mixes. Founded in 2009 by Elizabeth Stein, a certified holistic nutrition counselor, the company is dedicated to helping consumers thrive on their wellness journey.   SUMMARY Purely Elizabeth is seeking a self- motivated and detail-oriented Sales Support Admin to join our sales team. This person will be responsible for submitting retailer promotional contracts, managing retailer portals, and assisting in the entry and maintenance of our trade management system. This person should have experience with completing trade contracts, calculating rates and margin, data entry, and Microsoft office. You will be working alongside our broker and sales teams to ensure our promotions are submitted and executed. This person will report to the Sales Assistant Manager. KEY ROLES + RESPONSIBILITIES  Manage and submit accurate retailer promotional contracts Communicate with broker partners and internal team to get information and proof of performance Enter promotional deals into our Trade Management Tool to ensure reporting accuracy Assist in the creation of sales materials for meetings Organize and deliver on all internal and external deadlines Seek solutions to problems and try to create efficiencies when possible Help organize and deliver on retailer category reviews  REQUIREMENTS Education: Bachelor’s Degree required Minimum 3 years outside or inside sales experience Minimum 1-2 years’ experience at a food CPG Entrepreneurial mindset and ability to work independently while also being a part of a team Exceptional team player, able to manage cross-departmental communication with positive mindset Must be very detail-oriented and enjoy fast-paced, dynamic environment Must have strong organizational and communication skills Must be solution oriented Must be comfortable using mac and excel to analyze data   COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS ·      Competitive salary ·      Flexible Paid Time Off ·      Benefits include, health and dental insurance, 401k plan ·      Summer hours, social office gatherings (post-COVID), and more ·      An extremely strong, driven, ambitious, fun, startup work environment  TO APPLY: Please email resume and cover letter to info@purelyelizabeth.com  .

description: Company And Opportunity  Legacy.com is the place where life stories live on. We are the global leader in online memorial tributes; a top-50 website in the United States, and a destination for over 40 million unique visitors each month. Founded in 1998, Legacy.com is honored to help consumers express condolences, share direct support for families, and celebrate the people who have touched their lives. Uniquely open to profound messaging at this focused moment, users respond by sharing memories, purchasing gifts, finding event information, and making plans. Legacy delivers its community-targeted content daily via 1,500 local news media partners. We continue to broaden our offerings in our mission to help people seeking information and guidance on all aspects of end-of-life. Our vision is to become a full-service end-of-life and memorialization resource.  We have a diverse and talented team of employees who come to us from many kinds of backgrounds. We have an immediate need for a talented, experienced Marketing & Sales Operations Associate for our new Downtown Chicago office that will report to our Director of Operations.  See our new Chicago HQ:  Overview  Work with Ecommerce, Marketing, and Partners teams to help grow revenue across various customer groups. This role requires handling inbound and outbound phone calls on a daily basis, regular email correspondence with customers, flexibility in your day-to-day responsibilities, learning and adaptation of operational workflows, and confidence to improvise as needed.  Responsibilities Service phone order requests for consumers shopping sympathy gifts directly on Legacy. Service phone order requests for consumers shopping sympathy gifts on partner websites. Assist in fulfilling orders when no delivery address is available for the obituary. Manage your workstream, follow ups, and cases in Salesforce. Contribute directly to team performance targets monthly. Provide empathetic, top-tier service to every customer and contact you engage with.  Requirements Confidence and willingness to develop exceptional phone conversation skills. Excellent communications skills, both written and verbal. Excellent problem solving and time management skills. Ability to work independently or collaboratively as needed. Proficient in MS Office products (Word, PowerPoint, Excel) and Google tools (Google Docs). Familiarity with e-commerce operations preferred. Experience with Salesforces is a plus.  Benefits  Legacy.com offers a very generous and comprehensive benefits package, including: Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance Generous Paid Time Off 401k plan with discretionary employer match Parking/Transit Flex Spending RTA and CTA pre-tax payroll deductions Catered lunch provided 2x per week, breakfast 1x a week Employee Assistance Program Casual dress every day Daily, company-provided coffee, tea, soda, and snacks Friendly, team-oriented, open environment Located within a few blocks of CTA, Ogilvie, and Union Station  Powered by JazzHR  xKrmsUuxjd

description: My client is the leading global Employee Engagement, rewards, and Customer Loyalty solutions provider, specializing in Employee Recognition, Global Rewards, Leadership Training, and Customer Loyalty strategies. Their solutions are designed to engage and inspire while delivering results.  The focus of this role is on strategic selling to new prospects as well as strategically managing and growing the relationships. The selling philosophy is aligned with individuals that have a strong track record of selling complex solutions to senior executives. Successful candidates understand the need to build a broad understanding of their client’s needs through relationships at the executive level. An ability to offer actionable insights and to tailor their message to a client’s needs before advancing the sales conversation is key to success in this role.  Position Requirements: -10+ years of consultative, solution sales experience is required. -Selling to large (5K+) employee size customers is highly preferred. -Experience with long (6-18+mos) sales cycles and larger ($250K+) deals is preferred. -A history of career progression and stability (No more than 3 Jobs/10 years) -Impeccable presentation skills -BA/BS required -Experience in Marketing Services, Software or Med Device/ Pharma is preferred.  Compensation is not capped and is based on your performance. Base salary, plus ramp$ and commission tied to fiscal year revenue production and profitability. OTE 1st-year income is $160K+. Additional Benefits: Outstanding medical and dental benefits, generous PTO and 401k plan.

jobTitle: Field Sales Representative Southeast US Region
description: **This is a home-based position, that requires travel (50%). We welcome candidates living in the southeastern region.**  A.C. Lighting Inc., based in Toronto, is a member of the worldwide “AC Group of Companies”, one of the world’s largest suppliers of professional lighting and associated equipment to the entertainment industry. We supply world-class lighting and associated rigging technologies for the theater, film, television, worship, exhibition, and commercial markets. Our vast choice and stockholding of products, accessories, and consumables, coupled with in-house cable manufacturing facilities, provide a complete ‘one-stop’ service to meet all your lighting needs.  A.C. Lighting Inc. is the North American distributor for world-class technology brands including;  Chroma-Q® LED Lighting Vista by Chroma-Q Lighting and Media Control Surfaces PROLIGHTS high value and high-performance range of lighting, video and effects products Luminex Network Intelligence manufacturer of Data Distribution Equipment LumenRadio Wireless Lighting Control Follow-Me Remote Follow Spot Control Systems Manfrotto and Avenger Professional Lighting Stands and Accessories Prolyte Staging and Trussing; and Jands StageCL.  We have an opportunity for a driven, customer focused Field Sales Representative to join our growing team and support the Southeast US region. The territory includes Virginia, West Virginia, Maryland, North Carolina, South Carolina, Georgia, Florida, Alabama, Mississippi, Tennessee.  Position Summary  The Field Sales Representative is responsible for building A.C. Lighting’s market and driving the sales of Premium Lighting products in the Theatrical, Production Rental, Houses of Worship and Corporate A/V markets.  Reporting to the Vice President of Sales, the scope of work includes growing and driving new sales including lead qualification, quota management, funnel management, budget management, sales planning, dealer recruitment and product training.  Primary Responsibilities and Duties: ·       Work from a home office (ideally in an area that is within the region of your customers and a major airport) with the target of spending 50%+ of the time in front of customers on the road. ·       Grow the A.C. Lighting’s business and achieve/ exceed annual sales targets with existing and new accounts. ·       Develop strategies in generating and developing business growth opportunities within defined market while developing relationships with dealers, rental companies, lighting designers, theatrical lighting consultants and key influencers. ·       Arrange travel schedule to visit existing and new potential clients, attend dealer open houses and trade shows, including product training with the target of spending 50%+ of the time in front of customers on the road. ·      Learns all exclusive product lines and develops the skill set to effectively demonstrate and showcase each product line. ·       Attend all required Trade Shows. ·       Organizes, promotes and assists in coordinating product, dealer and staff training sessions.  Qualifications: · Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills, and effective strategic and analytical thinking skills, with the ability to plan, present, and execute a territory sales strategy. ·       Demonstrated success in effectively negotiate with clients ·       Entrepreneurial mindset with the ability to work independently or with a team        ·       Demonstrated awareness of the market and strong technical knowledge, with the ability to deliver business value to the account and build on customer relationships. ·       Ability to build, maintain, and develop relationships with dealers, rental companies, lighting designers, theatrical lighting consultants and key influencers. ·       Proficient with MS Word, Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint ·       Ability to stoop, kneel or climb and on occasion lift up to 50 lbs.   AC Lighting is a respectful, caring and inclusive workplace. We are committed to championing accessibility, diversity and equal opportunity. Requests for accommodation can be made at any stage of the recruitment process providing the applicant has met the bona-fide requirements for the open position. Applicants need to make their requirements known when contacted or alternatively you may contact Human Resources.

Are you a budtender looking for an additional stream of revenue? Are you a brand representative looking to expand your portfolio with new brands?  Job Requirements: Must be over 21. Valid CA driver's license. Must be able to work legally in the US. Must pass a full background check. Technology proficiency (CRM, ERP, Excel, etc.) is a huge plus. Must have existing cannabis relationship(s).  Main Attributes Required: Sales or customer service experience Detail-oriented Driven and persistent Professional and ethical Presentable Problem solver Reliable Positive attitude

How Will You Make An Impact  Management of business development, key commercial accounts and commercial liaison within the LPD OEM business portfolio. Key tasks and responsibilities for this position include but not limited to: building a ‘partner’ relationship with all business users within assigned areas, defining customer requirements & scoping of new opportunities for Business Team review, developing capabilities presentations, managing key contracts, management of overall communications with customer and conducting business reviews (QBR). The candidate shall lead internal cross functional team meetings to accomplish goals and commitments made to the strategic customers and communicate status and issues to customers regularly. This role is considered a key member of the respective business and OEM Commercial team(s) and must have the vision, drive, and interpersonal skills to succeed in a growth environment. The candidate will be a “hands on” account management professional operating with a sense of ownership.  What Will You Do Build strong customer allegiance and partnership, Key Accounts as assigned Manage estimated 3-5 Key Accounts Evaluate and lead all new business development opportunities for LPD OEM Manage contract renewals, price strategies and commercial initiatives to drive growth target of 3% per annum Expand LSG portfolio breadth within account, where possible Evaluate and lead all new business opportunities for LPD OEM projects Lead QBR reviews internal and with customers Provide strategic inputs for product and technology roadmap Commercial and Technical lead for customer interaction prior to full NPD project team assignment BU, Division or corporate leadership approval on all proposals and quotations Drive quotation teams from all LPD manufacturing sites as needed to prepare proposals and quotations for LPD OEM solutions Global travel to support regional commercial teams on presenting capabilities and driving opportunity for new projects (with approval). How Will You Get There 5 plus years of sales experience managing large complex accounts strongly preferred Experience within the Biotech industry strongly preferred BS degree in Science, Business, Engineering strongly preferred Minimum required education: Bachelor degree or Associate degree with 2 years of experience or high school diploma/GED with 4 years of relevant experience Position may require Covid-19 vaccination and/or routing testing, per client discretion Experience Qualifications Demonstrated success and experience working within matrix organizations Demonstrated ability to operate independently with initiative, objective attainment intensity, and solid business judgment Proven ability to sell creative solutions to high level customer personnel Demonstrated excellence in oral and written communications skills Strong organizational and time management skills with good orientation to detail Strong technical, business, and financial acumen Highly effective negotiation skills Sophisticated level of computer proficiency Benefits A choice of national medical and dental plans, and a national vision plan Diversity & Inclusion council and Employee Resource Groups including Women’s Group, LGBTQA, African Heritage, Veteran's, and Working Parents Tax-advantaged savings and spending accounts and commuter benefits Fleet vehicle At least 120 hours paid time off (PTO), 10 paid holidays annually, paid parental leave (3 weeks for bonding and 8 weeks for caregiver leave), accident and life insurance, short- and long-term disability, and volunteer time off in accordance with company policy Retirement and savings programs, such as our competitive 401(k) U.S. retirement savings plan Employees’ Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) offers eligible colleagues the opportunity to purchase company stock at a discount At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 80,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

Our client, an international manufacturer and distributor of consumer and office electronics, seeks a Sales Coordinator responsible for the timely and accurate processing of branch sales order requests and contracts.  This is a FULL TIME DIRECT HIRE position. In this role, you will:  Responsibilities: Submit and review credit applications for pre-approval of all deals, Obtain buy-out and trade-up quotes as needed Coordinate new customer file setup and existing customer profile maintenance with Master Data Ensure completeness and accuracy of order documents including leasing requirements and maintenance contract Enter orders and maintenance contracts in SAP  Coordinate out-of-territory deliveries and ongoing service with proper dealers Acts as liaison with Corporate National Accounts as orders warrant Tracking and timely reporting of order status  Coordinate with leasing companies to ensure timely funding of lease transactions Responsible for ensuring complete and timely scanning of all customer documents. Oversight of timely receipt of return authorizations for lease returns Lease Portfolio Management and Reporting Coordinate with Customer Service Reps regarding issues related to billing, customer inquiries as well as assisting with Accounts Receivable issue resolution Internal and external questions from Service, Sales & Mgmt Document management  Equipment creation  General contract and equipment maintenance Contract Renewal Report & Contract MIF Review to assist reps with Quarterly Business Reviews  Qualifications: 1-3 years experience as an assistant in a sales organization or similar capacity in an administrative financing role Highly detail oriented with exceptional organizational skills Proficiency in Microsoft Office, with an emphasis on Excel Experience with SAP preferred

Job Description  Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to small-and-medium sized accounts. The role is a combination of a Field Sales Rep and Inside Sales Rep.  Works to achieve maximum sales profitability, growth, and account penetration within an assigned territory. Territory may be combination of geographic, product, industry and other customer / market dimensions. Sells to the territory directly or via partners. The territory that this rep covers does not have an Inside Sales Rep or Field Rep. Utilizes inbound and/or outbound techniques to identify, qualify and close new opportunities. Manages accounts throughout the entire sales process, and collaborates with team members in business development, consulting and support to uncover all customer needs. Responsible for understanding Oracle's product offerings and competitive issues to develop solution proposals encompassing all aspects of the application. Travels to customer sites to identify / develop sales opportunities. Participates in the development, presentation, and sales of a value proposition. Onsite customer presentation with C-levels to negotiate and close strategic and complex deals. Liaises with customer contacts for the purpose of managing the customer relationship, identifying new opportunities and maximizing sales.  Work involves some problem solving. Duties and tasks are standard with some variation. Completes own role largely independently within defined policies and procedures. Ability to communicate effectively over the phone with high level decision makers. Successful sales track record. Oracle knowledge and/or knowledge of Oracle's competitors. Interaction with C level players. Team player. Ability to penetrate accounts and meet with stakeholders within accounts. Strong communication, negotiation and closing skills. Strong marketing skills. Travels to customer as needed. Typically graduate or equivalent with up to 2 years relevant sales experience. Travels to customer as needed. Typically graduate or equivalent with up to 2 years relevant sales experience.  About Us  Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
