jobTitle: Regional Sales Manager - Away From Home
description: Who We Are  batches, packaging, and delivering direct to more than 15,000 stores and partners to ensure freshness, and perfecting the craft of drink making in our 250+ coffee bars, we continuously build on our deep expertise and heritage to deliver great coffee. Now, in the midst of an exciting period of growth, Peet’s is focused on sharing our passion – in offices, on campus, in grocery or specialty stores - anywhere coffee lovers live, work, or play.  The Regional Sales Manager reports to Sr. Director Sales , Away from Home  By leveraging relationships with existing specialty distributors, securing new accounts, and through collaboration with wholesale team members, the Regional Sales Manageris responsible to grow revenue and volume in the assigned territory each year. We anticipate this territory to cover the East Coast and so the ideal candidate would live in this geographic territory.  Revenue growth activities include: calling directly on end-user clients, developing relationships with operators and distributors, sales proposals and presentations, and through promotion of Peet’s and Mighty Leaf Tea at trade shows. Other activities include creating and executing relevant customer marketing and distributor programs which support growth strategies. The Regional Sales Manager works closely with Finance and Operations to deliver new business goals. Accounts can include: Business Offices, College & University Campuses, Healthcare Facilities, Foodservice Operators and Hospitality clients.  What You Will Do Delivering on new business goals each month by winning new end user business in key sectors including Business Offices, College & University Campuses, Healthcare Facilities and Hospitality clients Develop consistent and continuous new business pipeline through relationship building, prospecting tools, research and sharing the Peet’s programs to relevant audiences Own select key account relationships with existing accounts with large growth potential Develop customer specific sales presentations, respond to requests for proposals (RFPs) and work cross functionally with finance and operations and marketing to support strategic new business opportunities. Maintain detailed files in Salesforce for each account including sales data, rebate data, contact person(s), pricing, and profitability objectives. Display an excellent knowledge of all products, pricing, services, and sales aids: including promotions and availability. Know where and how to access additional information as requested and be able to explain the reason behind company procedures, programs, and services. Develop creative account specific strategies in collaboration with other Sales Managers to deliver growth Attend and exhibit at industry and distributor trade shows. Work collaboratively with other Peet’s channels and functions (e.g., Foodservice, Marketing, Grocery and others) to help achieve the company’s cross-channel initiatives. Communicate with Customer Service and roasting plant personnel to ensure efficient fulfillment of orders. Ensure on-going communication with Home Office/Operations about account activity. Implement and contribute to promotional programs and tactical sales plans to exceed growth goals. Stay abreast of competitive climate and industry trends through applicable trade organizations and industry journals. 80% of time divided between sales calls, meetings, and developing new business 20% of the time home office paperwork, phone calls, and follow-up communication. Ability to lead virtual sales presentations but also to travel to accounts via car, train, subway, taxi and air. Who You Are Five+ years related outside sales experience selling to Wholesale and Foodservice channels Consultative sales skills Strong initiative, motivation, and self-management skills Excellent written and oral communication skills Superb customer service skills Strong Word, Excel and PowerPoint computer skills Strong negotiation skills with customer-oriented attitude Willingness to travel regularly throughout territory and occasionally nationally as necessary Specialty coffee and tea experience, and coffee operations experience a plus
industries: Consumer Goods, Food & Beverages, and Retail

description: In this role you will have a set territory and build national accounts. Since your clients will be located throughout the country, you will be speaking with them via email and phone. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone looking to work from home and maintain work/life balance.  -This is a B2B sales position -No holidays , evenings or weekends -Work from the comfort of your home -Repeat sales to clients -Small company that welcomes your imput -Leads provided -Unlimited income potential!! (Commission Only)- Don't let that stop you! -Training provided   -1099 role  If you are a self-motivated individual who wants flexability and the ability to manage your own schedule, this is the opportunity for YOU!  Requirements: B2B sales experience( Inside Sales Experience) Phone sales experience required Must reside in Kansas City Area (Salesforce experience preferred)   https://www.salesjobsconnect.com

ABOUT KEET Were a team of passionate, fun-having, taco-loving people on a mission to make healthcare experiences feel better.  At Keet, we help put humanity back into healthcare. It feels good to know that what we do ultimately contributes to a patients well-being. We know our clients, and our clients patients want to get back to doing more of what they love, so that is the core of our culture merging talented people doing what they love, to create products that help others do the same. Keet is part of the Clinicient family of companies.  SALES DEVELOPMENT REPRESENTATIVE  The Sales Development Representative (SDR) is responsible for identifying and creating new qualified sales opportunities in Target Accounts for the Strategic Sales Executives. As part of the lead generation team, the SDR manages the inbound lead activity, qualifying active buying interest and developing opportunity in prospect accounts. The SDR will also coordinate with the sales team to determine the accounts that require research and conduct outbound prospecting activities to secure a sufficient flow of additional qualified opportunities. An implicit responsibility of the SDR is to conduct business dealings in a way that creates a superior prospect experience that will set the stage for effective sales follow-up, as well as future product sales.  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Coordinate with marketing team to conduct rapid follow up on inbound leads, performing necessary research and qualification in advance. Use ICPS, buyer personas, market and sales intelligence to inform outbound prospecting within target markets and accounts, generating new, quality leads. Perform a minimum number of sales activities per day to generate interest with prospects and reach a predetermined monthly meeting goal. Develop and orchestrate outreach cadences in partnership with marketing and sales enablement, ensuring optimal conversion of MQLs to SQLs. Customize communications to prospects using creative approaches, including Vidyard embedded videos, to capture attention and start conversations. Maintain a high-quality professional social media presence on LinkedIn, using Sales Navigator and Keet marketing materials to engage in social selling efforts. Hold first meetings with prospects, preparing in advance for productive conversations that qualify fit and BANT, before scheduling follow-up meetings with senior reps. Uncover pain points, explain the Keet solution, overcome objections, identify opportunities and generate interest, taking detailed notes to inform future follow-up. Utilize consultative approach to evaluate and understand customers business and needs, becoming an expert on target markets and key selling points for our personas. Disseminate opportunities to appropriate sales representative, educating rep as necessary about the opportunity and recommend appropriate follow-up action items. Work in conjunction with sales representatives to develop superior relationships with prospects, building trust and affinity. Partner tightly with the Senior Manager of Growth & Automation on lead generation opportunities to drive funnel performance. Work with sales and marketing, providing closed-loop feedback to ensure continuous process optimization and alignment between teams.  Be internal expert on resources available to sales team (ex. Case studies, white papers, etc.) and use them to accelerate sales conversations. Work within Keets technology stack, including Outreach.io, Drift, Gong.io, SFDC, etc. to align with processes and maintain accurate records.  SECONDARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Projects ad hoc  EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION  Bachelors degree or equivalent  1-2 years of experience in an SDR role Experience interacting with prospects via telephone and email. Training in solution selling or similar consultative selling models a plus. Experience and understanding of healthcare, EMR, Practice Management, Revenue cycle and/or SaaS-based BPO a plus.    KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES  Must be a role model of Keets Core Values:  Collaboration, Heart, Innovation, Service, and Humility. Exceptional written and verbal communication skills. Experience with sales technologies, and strong technical aptitude. Team-player, adept at working with cross-functional teams. High-energy, strong work ethic, and commitment to delivering results. Ability to work independently, prioritize responsibilities, and manage time efficiently.  Ability to develop relationships easily and be viewed as a trusted resource. Sales DNA with a contagious attitude that is eager to learn and win.  Proactive attitude and quick learner of new methods, strategies, and technologies.   Willingness to roll-up sleeves and do what it takes to deliver for clients.  Innovative thinker who is constantly looking for a better way to do things and is willing to take measured risks to achieve the desired result.      PERKS  (We've got them).  Keet offers a competitive benefits package with medical benefits, unlimited PTO, company hosted lunches, happy hours, and special events.   We have a flexible work from home policy dependent upon productivity and ability to communicate effectively. Oh, and we have snacks. Our office is located in the hip south river district of Austin, TX in the heart of Austin weirdness, but this role can be located in any location. OUR CORE VALUES* Collaboration: We're continuously learning how to work together, better. Heart: We've got it, and we're not afraid to show it. Innovation: We are lifelong learners. Service: Were here to serve. Humility: We're humans, and we come from dirt.  *We love and strive to embody our core values daily, and well expect you to do the same.   Keet is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
industries: Computer Software and Hospital & Health Care

description: [ ] Are you an assertive and self-motivated person who likes to set and achieve goals? [ ] Are you analytical, discerning, focused and strategic? [ ] Do you have no hesitations about talking to new customers every day? [ ] Do you love dogs?  If you said YES! to these questions you could be an ideal person to join our sales team for Natural Dog Company. Read more about our Ideal Candidate, the Role and How to Apply.  ABOUT YOU - THE IDEAL CANDIDATE You are confident ,assertive, independent, resourceful, resilient and entrepreneurial. You are a natural conversationalist, an active listener and an effective communicator. You are goal-oriented and focused on getting results and exceeding your quota. You are self-motivated and also thrive as part of a winning team. You are a growth-minded, avid learner who enjoys learning about new products, customers and sales techniques. You are reasonably organized and can prioritize your effort and time. You are coachable, adaptable and accountable. You have grit, determination and work with maximum effort and a positive attitude. You are proficient with Microsoft Office suite, and have the aptitude to learn our systems. You are an experienced sales professional - You will fit right in with our established sales team and hit the ground running quickly. You have the traits listed above and limited or no sales experience -You will dive into our hands-on sales training program, be mentored, learn quickly and develop into a pro in no time.  THE ROLE Customer Planning: Using proprietary data, research methods and tools, set productive and targeted new business plans. Work Your Plan with Outbound Prospecting: Contact businesses owners by phone and email to establish rapport, uncover opportunities and needs, and provide solutions. New business prospecting is a priority. Keep Track of Your Plan & Follow Through: If it doesn’t appear in the CRM, did it even happen? Do a Little Math: Not a lot, just a little. Perform basic calculations to provide prospects and customers with accurate prices and quotes. Oh, and calculate your commissions. Close, Close, Close: Closing the sale becomes a repeatable event with your deep understanding of your customer base, your persistent and persuasive communication skills, our well loved products, and your positive attitude,  REWARDS: Competitive salary plus uncapped commission Medical, dental, and vision insurance - fully paid employee premiums, family plans available 401k with 4% company match, no vesting required Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays Paid Parental Leave Fitness Stipend Flexible Work Environment  ABOUT NATURAL DOG COMPANY & ELEMENTS BRANDS: Natural Dog Company caters to those who cater to their dogs. We create safe, natural, effective healing solutions and products for dogs of all sizes and ages. We believe our furry friends, and yours, deserve the best products using the highest quality and most natural ingredients around. We use organic, all-natural, vegan ingredients that are never tested on animals, but rather are thoroughly researched to be confident that they are safe from the very start. From healing balms, grooming products and healthy treats, we strive to provide healthy, holistic options for dog owners everywhere.  Elements Brands owns a variety of consumer products companies (including Natural Dog Company) that started as hidden gems with loyal followings. Our team amplifies the awesome attributes and untapped potential of each brand while retaining the original name and soul. We are growing our Wholesale Inside Sales Channel. We have a startup feel, and a focus on collaboration, results, and learning fast. Recently named one of Charlotte’s Best Places to Work and Fast 50, we are growing quickly (doubling revenue each of the past 5 years) and aim to accelerate that pace even further – Inside Sales Representatives are critical to this plan. We are very excited to meet you!  Read the Following Carefully to Apply: Complete the job application on our careers site. Please answer all questions. After submitting your application, you must then separately complete our short survey - you must answer all the questions at the following link: https://portal.cultureindex.com/public/survey/general/64tghVjUal (this will also be emailed to you upon application completion).  “Elements Brands is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.”

jobTitle: VP, Sales and Client Management (West Zone)
description: When you’re the best, we’re the best. We instill an environment where employees feel engaged, satisfied and able to contribute their unique skills and talents. We provide extensive opportunities for personal and professional development, building both employee competence and organizational capability to fuel exceptional performance now and in the future.  Summary  In this role, you will be accountable for a team of client executives who serve our partnership and key membership accounts. You will maintain the current company revenue and growth in existing members, while achieving superior member satisfaction as assigned within a region of the zone. Prefer candidates residing in Southern California.  Responsibilities Serve as one of the primary strategic advisors for members at the leadership and C-suite level. Maintain and grow gross admin fees, net admin fees and expand our footprint by selling new business focused in the spend management area. Manage pipeline for sales activity within assigned zone for assigned products. Responsible for the performance and development of a team of client executives. Develop and execute business plans and member strategies that ensures attainment of Vizient goals and individual sales goals. Work closely with Recruitment / Retention for the closing and managing of new business in addition to member renewals. Achieve a higher level of member satisfaction by becoming a trusted advisor. Assist in the onboarding of new members. Serve as a key feedback mechanism from customers to the business team to provide input into the development of new products and services that are developed for members. Qualifications Relevant degree desired; advanced degree preferred. 10 or more years of relevant experience required. Deep sales/negotiating experience with proven experience in building and leading highly effective sales teams required. Ability to understand member needs and objectives from a programmatic, financial, technical, organizational perspective. Consultative solution-selling experience, providing solutions to complex client issues preferred. Ability to interact with executives, and the ability to influence decisions the C-suite level. Ability to make effective, persuasive presentations to current and potential customers. Trusted advisor, strong executive presence and complex business problem solving skills. Excellent teamwork, problem-solving skills, and organization skills. Ability to travel regularly and expeditiously throughout the year to meet clients’ needs and timetables. #IDS  Estimated Hiring Range  $182,200.00 - $284,800.00  This position is also incentive eligible.  Vizient has a comprehensive benefits plan! Please view our benefits here:  http://www.vizientinc.com/about-us/careers  Equal Opportunity Employer: Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities  The Company is committed to equal employment opportunity to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religion, color, gender identity, ethnicity, age, national origin, sexual orientation, disability status, veteran status or any other category protected by applicable law.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Easy Ice combines top-quality ice-making machines with top-level support. With our preventive ice machine maintenance, cleanings, and breakdown ice, customers will have a dependable supply of ice seven days a week, 365 days a year.  Easy Ice continues to grow and seeks a bright, highly motivated Sales Coordinator to join their team in the Denver, Co market. This candidate must be an energetic and enthusiastic individual, who is able to assist the Sales Representatives in establishing new accounts. This position requires a person that strives to assist in the growth of a rapidly expanding company.  Responsibilities Support the Sales Representatives to ensure prompt communication with customers and proper documentation to maximize sales potentials. Assist in several local marketing initiatives, working closely with the Sales Managers. Work closely with Sales reps to secure the first order while building a lasting business relationship with our customers. Proactively manage customers’ expectations regarding timing, and quality service during the sales and installation processes. Setting up new accounts and coordinate with operations on all necessary documentation Positively impact the customer retention efforts and reputation of the company. Position Qualifications Associates/Bachelor’s Degree or 2+ years of related experience 3-5 years of experience in customer service role Demonstrated track record of delivering highest level of customer satisfaction. Demonstrated track record of working effectively with employees in various departments of the company. Working knowledge of computer programs and multi-line phone systems. Benefits Include Medical (Company/Employee) Dental and Group Life (Company Paid) Vision (Employee Paid) Employee Referral Bonus Fitness Membership Reimbursement (per company policy) The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all job duties performed by the personnel so classified.  Easy Ice was founded in 2009 in Marquette, MI, with the goal of providing no-hassle ice machine subscriptions to businesses that require ice for their customers and employees. Over the last decade, our company has grown beyond its humble roots in Marquette, to becoming the only nationally-located ice machine leasing service in the country with over 20,000 ice machines currently under management. In the last few years, we have established additional offices in Chicago, Phoenix, Denver, Florida, Texas and Kansas City, and our company still grows by leaps and bounds year-after-year.
industries: Construction, Marketing and Advertising, and Consumer Services

description: Job Description  This role will focus on developing and cultivating strong relationships with key constituents (producers, plan sponsors and/or consumers depending on business) to maximize sales opportunities and achieve profitable growth.  Required Qualifications  Oversees a block of business or may develop new business opportunities to ensure profitable customers and help grow the business through consultative selling, issue resolution and superior service.  Ensures product, pricing and services meet client's needs while meeting Aetna revenue growth and profit objectives. Manages and builds producer relations as needed depending on book of business or market segment  being supported.  Identifies various ways to partner with the client by drawing from entire spectrum of product line illustrating a keen understanding of client's multifaceted needs and benefits of Aetna's full product array.  Collaborates with internal partners and/or external constituents to uncover profitable growth and cross-sell opportunities within new or existing customers and to support post-sale activities.  Coordinates sales materials, testimonials and subject matter expert involvement in support of the successful delivery of constituent presentations.  May participate in constituent meetings including finals presentations.  Develops/maintains and communicates expertise on products, industry and emerging marketplace trends.  Licensure as required by state.  COVID Requirements  COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement  CVS Health requires its Colleagues in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated. If you are vaccinated, you are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status within the first 30 days of your employment. For the two COVID-19 shot regimen, you will be required to provide proof of your second COVID-19 shot within the first 60 days of your employment. Failure to provide timely proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status will result in the termination of your employment with CVS Health. If you are unable to be fully vaccinated due to disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief, you will be required to apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 30 days of your employment in order to remain employed with CVS Health. As a part of this process, you will be required to provide information or documentation about the reason you cannot be vaccinated. If your request for an accommodation is not approved, then your employment may be terminated. Preferred Qualifications  5-10+ years in the medical insurance industry and sales experience working directly with brokers, producers and plan sponsors.  Education  College degree or equivalent work experience.  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

Newt Studios produces leading-edge 3D animations to communicate the innovative science of therapeutics, medical devices, and biotech platforms. Our studio combines the latest visual effects techniques and biomedical expertise to create stunning medical animations for the life sciences industry.  www.newtstudios.com  We are searching for a driven team member to help elevate our business to the next level.  Your Role — develop new business opportunities by connecting with prospective clients and generating definitive interest in our digital products. You will suggest appropriate solutions tailored to the prospect and negotiate fair pricing. You will cultivate strong, ongoing relationships with clients to sustain our animation production pipeline.  High-level commission on deals closed, commensurate with medical sales. Potential for a salaried role after 3 months.  If this opportunity fires up your heart and neurons, we would love to hear from you.  Responsibilities: Build our robust sales funnel and expand the pipeline. Utilize existing lead lists and generate deeper lists of clients in pharma, biotech, and medical device companies. Qualify leads and prioritize account targets in our CRM. Outreach to prospects in layered channels – including cold call, email, and LinkedIn. Iterate on messaging and pitches to achieve higher success rates. Develop quotes and proposals for clients Schedule appointments for qualified leads with Directors. Communicate closely with leadership to align strategy, targeting, and messaging. Follow emerging trends in new media and visual communication. Represent Newt Studios at scientific meetings and medical conferences.  What the Role offers: Deep exposure to scientific animation production for biopharma, medical device, and commercial industries. Creative and passionate company culture with multidisciplinary backgrounds. Exciting and meaningful projects at the interface of animation, education, and emerging technologies. Early-stage, mid-sized company with potential for rocket growth. Potential for leadership role. Remote position. Flexible schedule.  Your Experience and Skills: 2+ years building sales funnels and pipelines for B2B. Strong communicator and skilled negotiator – verbal and written. Tenacious and results-driven. Independent self-starter. Positive and solution-oriented. Demonstrated integrity in output. Evidence of sales achievements requested. Medical sales or healthcare agency background preferred. Bachelor’s degree.  About Newt Studios: Newt is a creative collective of 3D animators, trained medical illustrators, and science communicators based out of the Hudson Valley, New York. We are on a mission to deliver the highest fidelity scientific animations that distill complex technologies into instructive visualizations to engage audiences across video, VR, and AR platforms.  Our services include: MOA and MOD Medical Animations Scientific Visuals for Campaigns and Conferences 3D Demos for Device and Product VR and AR Instructive Experiences Full-service agency from script to storyboard to final approval.

POSITION SUMMARY:  This position is responsible for all sales activities in assigned accounts or regions. Individuals must manage quality and consistency of products and service delivery. They must be able to persuade and influence others, develop and deliver presentations. They must be able to create, compose, and edit written materials. Visibility requires maintaining a professional appearance and providing a positive company image to the public. Work requires willingness to work a flexible schedule.  KEY FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES: Achieve individual annual operating plan as assigned. Present and sell company products and services to current and potential clients. Prepare action plans and schedules to identify specific targets and to project the number of contacts to be made. Follow up on new leads and referrals resulting from field activity. Identify sales prospects and contact these and other accounts as assigned. Develop and maintain sales materials and current product knowledge. Establish and maintain current client and potential client relationships. Prepare paperwork to activate and maintain contract services. Manage account services through quality checks and other follow-up. Identify and resolve client concerns. Prepare a variety of status reports, including activity, closings, follow-up, and adherence to goals. Communicate new product and service opportunities, special developments, information, or feedback gathered through field activity to appropriate company staff. Coordinate company staff to accomplish the work required to close sales. Develop and implement special sales activities to reduce stock. Participate in marketing events such as seminars and trade shows. Follow-up for collection of payment. Coordinate shipping schedules and delivery of merchandise and services. Conduct monthly customer visits as needed, individually or with Branch Manager. Other duties as assigned.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES:  Required: High School diploma / GED or equivalent work experience. Ability to work independently and in a fast-paced environment Self-starter – ability to initiate and execute with limited assistance. Effective writing, communication and interpersonal skills. Assertive, analytical problem solver with a can do attitude is required. Strong problem solving and troubleshooting skills. Ability to exercise mature judgment. Proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel  Desired: Bachelor’s degree from an accredited institution in a business related discipline. JD Edwards software experience desired 5+ years of related work experience Must be able to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization Knowledge of the automotive industry / drivetrain components.

Job Description  Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to small-and-medium sized accounts. The role is a combination of a Field Sales Rep and Inside Sales Rep.  Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.  Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to small-and-medium sized accounts. The role is a combination of a Field Sales Rep and Inside Sales Rep.  Works to achieve maximum sales profitability, growth, and account penetration within an assigned territory. Territory may be combination of geographic, product, industry and other customer / market dimensions. Sells to the territory directly or via partners. The territory that this rep covers does not have an Inside Sales Rep or Field Rep. Utilizes inbound and/or outbound techniques to identify, qualify and close new opportunities. Manages accounts throughout the entire sales process, and collaborates with team members in business development, consulting and support to uncover all customer needs. Responsible for understanding Oracle's product offerings and competitive issues to develop solution proposals encompassing all aspects of the application. Travels to customer sites to identify / develop sales opportunities. Participates in the development, presentation, and sales of a value proposition. Onsite customer presentation with C-levels to negotiate and close strategic and complex deals. Liaises with customer contacts for the purpose of managing the customer relationship, identifying new opportunities and maximizing sales.  Duties and tasks are standard with some variation. Completes own role largely independently within defined policies and procedures. Successful sales track record. Oracle knowledge and/or knowledge of Oracle's competitors. Interaction with C level players. Team player. Ability to penetrate accounts and meet with stakeholders within accounts. Excellent communication, negotiating, and closing skills. Strong marketing skills. Travels to customer as needed. 2 or more years of relevant sales experience. BA/BS degree or equivalent preferred.  About Us  Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

jobTitle: Medical Device Sales – Surgical Sales – Tissue
description: Medical Device Sales – Surgical Sales Specialist – Tissue Reconstruction  Seeking Top Ranked, Well Documented Medical Sales Reps Background in Medical Device: Biologics, Regenerative Medicine, Plastic Surgery.  My client assists patients with biologically active regenerative therapies for wound and tissue repair. As the current leader in the science and clinical application of regenerative medicine, their products are some of the only advanced wound care therapy of its type indicated for tissue reconstruction, trauma wounds and burns. This position involves presentations to surgeons as well as being in the OR/surgical settings for abdominal reconstruction and hernia tissue repair.  Profile:  Medical Device Sales / Sales Reps selling Biologics, Regenerative Medicine or Plastic Surgery OR experience required Seeking reps with longevity in positions, with most recent role 2-4 years+  Requirements:  College Degree (Required) Minimum 3+ years of medical device or medical sales in an OR setting required Selling surgical products in hernia / abdominal, plastic surgery experience required Experience selling to surgeons (plastic, wound, trauma and/or colorectal) Documented sales success (stats, rankings, quota achievements) Consistent years of over 100% to plan with Awards, Trips, etc.  Offering:  Year 1 earnings based on performance $125,000- $150,000+ Base Salary $75,000 Growth oriented accounts Expense Account / Car Allowance Laptop, Mobile, Home Office Full Benefit Package Recognition   Direct Sales Recruiting, LLC, (DSR) and DirectHR are National Recruitment organizations partnering with National, Regional and Local Clients to bring qualified candidates a career and a future. DSR offers over 50 years combined Recruitment, Sales and Management experience. We are, along with our clients, an Equal Opportunity Employer and are committed to hiring and supporting a diverse workforce. A M/F/D/V

description: Company Profile: Treeline, Inc. was founded in 2001 with an exclusive focus on helping companies build world-class, high-output, sales teams. Treeline has worked with hundreds of respected companies in the United States and thousands of top-tier sales professionals.  At Treeline, Inc. we have worked hard to create a company and culture that people love being part of. We are a team of innovators, trailblazing to set the path for sales recruiting solutions. We are strong believers in sales karma and work hard to add value to both our clients and our candidates.  We continue to build a culture that differs from other companies. We respect one another and work collaboratively to grow a one-of-a-kind organization. We are proud of our achievements and approach each day with a set of core values (Grit, Do What’s Right, Empowering People, Compete to Win Every day).  Job Description: We recruit for all levels of sales positions from Sales Development Representatives to Chief Revenue Officers across the United States. We are looking for a dynamic and enthusiastic Permanent Sales Recruiter with a positive attitude and strong work ethic. You will be responsible for sourcing, screening, interviewing, submitting, scheduling client interviews, making offers, checking references and more. As a virtual company both activity and support are required to be successful. We want our team to succeed, enjoy their job and build great friendships with their teammates. We encourage creativity and require strong written and communication skills.  Requirements: 1+ years of perm recruiting, sales preferred experience Candidates must have experience working in a remote environment Must be knowledgeable and comfortable using social technologies ATS experience (Bullhorn) Experience with Google Drive, 8x8, Zoom and Google Meet Articulate, intelligent and confident Must be comfortable in a very fast-paced environment Highly driven and passionate individual  Benefits: Base Salary + Uncapped commissions. Average first year compensation between $80,000-$120,000 Health, Vision and Dental Insurance 401K with company match Company Laptop & Monitor  100% Virtual Work Environment    Recent Accolades and Accomplishments: FORBES America’s Best Executive Recruiting Firms - 2021 INC Magazine Best Workplaces - 2021, 2019, 2018, 2017 INC 5000 - Fastest Growing Private Companies - 2018, 2016 Boston Business Journal - Best Places to Work in Boston 2020 - #12 2019 - #3 2018 - #1 2017 - #2 2016 - #1

description: Sales Specialist – Pacific Northwest  Company Description Personalized immunotherapies are the future of the fight against cancer, and IsoPlexis (www.isoplexis.com) is Making the Difference in enabling the lofty goal of employing immunotherapies to combat our toughest diseases. Our integrated systems, named #1 Innovation by Scientist Magazine & World-Leading Design by Red Dot, are changing cancer research by connecting biological readouts to what is actually happening in patients. Our game changing hardware technologies, originally from Cal Tech and Yale, combined with our next generation software and data visualizations, are powered by our amazing R&D team and used throughout the world. We work with a growing list of leading researchers who are publishing findings that connect our readouts to what is truly happening in patients, and that excites & drives all of us to do more! If you like working at the intersection of biological sciences and healthcare, and you enjoy intellectually challenging yet fulfilling projects, give us a call. Our fast growing, 400+ person team has a sense of integrity, energy, and urgency to ‘make things happen’ in our collective careers and in the broader world, and we look forward to talking.  IsoPlexis is welcoming self-motivated, high energy individuals who are looking for career growth working with cutting edge technology, to apply today!   Responsibilities Pitch IsoPlexis to our customer base on our new and exciting products and publications that have been released.  Define game plan for your territory’s customers, identify key influencers and purchasing PIs for each opportunity. Responsible for selling IsoPlexis instruments and consumables in translational institutions and biopharma; Achieve annual sales quota, and close key accounts Partner with customers, focus on opportunities, key influencers and decision makers to ensure swift revenue generation and deals closing. ·       Manage time and resources efficiently to perform all responsibilities associated with customers, while maintaining salesforce.com and other internal processes (training, weekly reviews, etc.). Collect data and assist Isoplexis Marketing/Communication team with the development of marketing materials.  Communicate all relevant customer information including product and/or customer experience or opportunities to Field Sales, Marketing, Internal Consulting Group and Technical Support. Including keeping CRM up to date with customer information and interactions Actively pursues tasks/projects, and ways to enhance their team and the business beyond their day to day responsibilities Travel 50% of the time Desire to thrive in a light-speed start-up environment  *Candidates local to the Pacific Northwest region strongly preferred*  Skills/Experience ·  Bachelor’s degree biology, or related field ·  2 yrs biological lab experience in a small lab is preferred, including experience with most basic laboratory techniques ·  Biomedical or biotechnology industry background is preferred ·  Immunology/ flow cytometry a plus ·  Ability to handle multiple tasks and meeting short-notice deadlines, with daily reprioritization of work  Traits ·  Coachable ·  Collaborative / Team Player ·  Commitment to quality ·  Self-motivated ·  High energy ·  Sense of humor  ISOPLEXIS is only considering applicants who have valid authorization to work in the U.S., in this position, for the Company. ISOPLEXIS does not sponsor employment-based visas for this position.

Do you wish there were more innovative options in real estate investing?  At HomeRoom, we have pioneered one of the most innovative real estate investment vehicles in real estate which enable private investors to achieve returns that were previous unreachable for out of state investors.  It’s an exciting product that so far has sold itself through word of mouth and consistent referrals.   We’re now ready to bring in some incredible sales talent to accelerate our businesses growth.   The right person for this role will be an excellent prospector and lead qualifier. You’re mentally curious and who feels equally comfortable selling real estate investment products to sharp and high network individuals and real estate investment neophytes.   The candidate for this position will excel at creating and closing new opportunities. By using a consultative approach to selling, this person will use their expertise to identify and qualify leads, leading to sales opportunities with both new and existing customers.   Role  As a Sales Executive, you are a tenacious, hard-working problem solver with an optimistic attitude that can compellingly present HomeRoom's investor offering and rapidly qualify new business.  As a member of our Sales team, you will be responsible for reaching out to taking the initial call with validated sales leads (property investors) and deliver a tailored value pitch on how the HomeRoom model and technology consistently drives superior rental income compared to traditional single-family rentals.   Responsibilities  Qualify inbound leads, and present initial HomeRoom pitch deck  Score leads in our CRM and communicate hot and high-quality leads to our Sr Sales Executive  Follow up with qualified leads regarding their pre-approval letters  Set up 2nd meeting with Sr. Sales Executive once lead is fully qualified and their pre-approval letter has been received  In addition to excellent work with inbound leads – this role will actively prospect with a mixture of cold calling, emailing, and social selling to supplement the lead flow provided by the Marketing team  Achieve and exceed quarterly assigned sales quota within your targeted prospect accounts and sales territory.  Synthesize customer feedback for input into product development  Share and leverage your talents, and provide information and feedback to improve strategies, solutions and execution of the sales process  Maintain timely and detailed pipeline management, keeping sales pipeline up to date and accurate in our CRM  Minimum Qualifications  1+ years of experience in a consultative, B2B inside sales role  Polished presenter who can simply and collaboratively help a lead overcome objections  Demonstrated experience consistently exceeding target goals, hunting for deals, navigating organizational hierarchies and building long-term relationships  Comfortable making "the ask" and hearing "no"  Unsatisfied with successes, undaunted by failures  Eager to learn, get better all the time (you are coachable)  Desire to be a part of fast-paced, high energy, start-up experience  Interested in real estate and real estate investing   Preferred Qualifications  Real Estate investment experience  Early-stage startup sales experience

Drive Profitable Business Results Analyze the needs of the territory and formulate a strategy to create a Dealer and Rental network to maximize representation of the Pettibone brand and products. Prioritize sales prospects in regard to volume, profitability and time to convert or establish business. Develop sales plans that detail strategy, tactics, required support and timetable for attainment of sales objectives to include revenue targets. Advise on Pettibone Traverse Lift products’ performance advantages and/or competitive technical innovations or shortcomings. Provide competitor information as it becomes known and make practical recommendations for increasing market share in the assigned territory. Communicate territory issues to include competitive activity, pricing, and follow up on lost sales. Develop effective customer programs and negotiate key commercial terms with the customers and Dealers. Develop plans by customer with Dealers to gain enterprise alignment to drive profitable sales. Support the service department by responding to all field service requests in region. Relationship Management Develop deep working relationships with Pettibone Traverse Lift customers. Market all Pettibone Traverse Lift products to all Dealers (within scope) and customers. Set and manage expectations that Dealers will represent all available Pettibone Traverse Lift products. Parts Revenue Work with Dealers to determine the appropriate stocking levels of recommended spare parts list (RSPL); set expectations for appropriate spare parts inventory to service machine inventory and territory population. During each Dealer visit and during periodic conversations, review and verify parts inventory and stocking levels. Product Knowledge Develop and demonstrate proficient knowledge regarding machine features, benefits, operations, warranty and general machine operation of each Pettibone Traverse Lift model to answer customer inquiries in an accurate and timely manner. Product knowledge will be gained through company product training, machine walk around training, study of specification sheets and working through issues with customers on a day-to-day basis. Training  Provide product training to customers and assist Dealer training of customers on new products or changes, basic machine operations, cab/system operations and walk around training.  Inventory Take physical inventory of all machines (sale and rental fleet) in Dealer inventory on a quarterly basis. Provide inventory reports to the Director of Sales and Marketing within five days of quarter end. Promotional Items Check Dealer stock of specification sheets to ensure all specification sheets are current editions. Assist Dealer in maintaining and ordering stock of specification sheets. Discuss with Dealer the need for trade show items such as banners and flags. Review Pettibone Traverse Lift Co-op funds program and usage with Dealers. Job Requirements  Experience and Education: Experience: Minimum of 3+ years of experience in Dealer management and account management (Rental companies and direct customers), with demonstrated sales acumen and sales results. Education: B.A. or B.S. Degree; MBA preferred. Communication: Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal communication. Technology: Strong working knowledge of MS Office, Adobe Acrobat, and CRM/ERP software. Other Requirements Strong attention to detail and ability to work both collaboratively and independently. Exceptional organizational, interpersonal, and project management skills. Knowledge of material handling equipment and applications, and construction industry. Strong mechanical skills and hydraulic system skills. Position requires that incumbent reside in or very near assigned territory of Central/Western U.S. Relocation not required. Supervisory Responsibility - This position has no supervisory responsibilities.  Position Type and Expected Hours of Work - This is a full-time position. Work hours are Monday thru Friday, 8:00 AM to 4:30 PM or as the job requires.  Travel – This position requires frequent overnight and/or extended travel within North America.  Work Environment - The position operates in a professional office environment using standard office equipment such as computers, iPads, phones, copiers and filing cabinets. The employee is occasionally exposed to fumes or airborne particles and moving mechanical parts.  Primary Location- This position will be responsible for the Western United States and must reside within that territory.  Physical Requirements - The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and ability to adjust focus. This would require the ability to lift files, open filing cabinets and bend or stand on a stool as necessary.

At Bazaarvoice, we create smart shopping experiences. Through our expansive global network, product-passionate community & enterprise technology, we connect thousands of brands and retailers with billions of consumers. Our solutions enable brands to connect with consumers and collect valuable user-generated content, at an unprecedented scale. This content achieves global reach by leveraging our extensive and ever-expanding retail, social & search syndication network. And we make it easy for brands & retailers to gain valuable business insights from real-time consumer feedback with intuitive tools and dashboards. The result is smarter shopping: loyal customers, increased sales, and improved products.  The problem we are trying to solve : Brands and retailers struggle to make real connections with consumers. It's a challenge to deliver trustworthy and inspiring content in the moments that matter most during the discovery and purchase cycle. The result? Time and money spent on content that doesn't attract new consumers, convert them, or earn their long-term loyalty.  Our brand promise : closing the gap between brands and consumers.  Founded in 2005, Bazaarvoice is headquartered in Austin, Texas with offices in North America, Europe, Asia and Australia.  It’s official: Bazaarvoice is a Great Place to Work in the US , Australia and the UK!  Are you interested in jump-starting your career in sales, but need hands-on training to set you up for success? As a Sales Development Representative at Bazaarvoice, you will be part of a team whose mission is to spearhead the sales process with market-data driven prospecting, creative problem solving, and leveraging product knowledge. We provide world-class training to get you confidently up to speed. Driving pipeline, shadowing complex sales cycles and collaborating with experienced Account Executives are all part of day’s work.   Responsibilities and Duties Building and maintaining a pipeline of business through email, phone and LinkedIn prospecting Uncovering a company’s needs and catering Bazaarvoice’s value according to those specific needs Demonstrating the value propositions of our products and services via webinars, emails, phone calls, etc. Positioning a high-ROI solution to some of the most well-known brands and retailers in the world Partnering with an Account Executive to cultivate new business opportunities Learning the Sales cycle from beginning to end Learning a range of best in class Sales Development tools and processes  Requirements Strong work ethic: Self-motivated with an ability to learn quickly. Ownership of role as if it was your own business Resilience: Must be comfortable handling objections, rejection, and hearing “No”, shaking it off, and continuing forward Energy: You have a high level of enthusiasm and energy that can be felt on the other end of the line Coachability: You must be able to listen and take training/feedback with a positive approach Communication: Clearly and concisely communicate, as well as effectively listen with both clients and internal business partners Curiosity: Desire to learn about both Bazaarvoice and the clients we are reaching out to  Nice to have Experience with Salesforce, Salesloft, Powerpoint and Excel Public speaking and presentation skills  Why join Bazaarvoice?  Customer is key We see our own success through our customers’ outcomes.   We approach every situation with a customer first mindset.  Transparency & Integrity Builds Trust We believe in the power of authentic feedback because it’s in our DNA.  We do the right thing when faced with hard choices. Transparency and trust accelerate our collective performance.  Passionate Pursuit of Performance Our energy is contagious, because we hire for passion, drive & curiosity.  We love what we do, and because we’re laser focused on our mission.  Innovation over Imitation We seek to innovate as we are not content with the status quo.  We embrace agility and experimentation as an advantage.  Stronger Together We bring our whole selves to the mission and find value in diverse perspectives.  We champion what’s best for Bazaarvoice before individuals or teams.   As a stronger company we build a stronger community.  Commitment to diversity and inclusion Bazaarvoice provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all team members and applicants according to their experience, talent, and qualifications for the job without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, sex (including pregnancy, gender stereotyping, and marital status), sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military/veteran status, or any other category protected by federal, state, or local law in every location in which the company has facilities. Bazaarvoice believes that diversity and an inclusive company culture are key drivers of creativity, innovation and performance. Furthermore, a diverse workforce and the maintenance of an atmosphere that welcomes versatile perspectives will enhance our ability to fulfill our vision of creating the world’s smartest network of consumers, brands, and retailers.
industries: Computer Software, Consumer Services, and Information Technology and Services

description: Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s protein and salt business, where we provide wholesome, high-quality food products to a wide range of customers, from foodservice operators and grocery stores to manufacturers and exporters.  Job Purpose and Impact  The Water Quality Senior Account Manager (Sales) will focus on our large or very complex customers within the Northeastern US market. We seek a seasoned professional who will handle our critical or complex products that require excellent client relationship skills to maintain competitive positioning.  Key Accountabilities Develop a plan to establish and maintain account relationships and meet personal sales targets. Build a business plan for each account. Coordinate use of resources (e. g., technical, advertising) to provide value-added services to accounts. Develop strong client relationships that provide significant input to planning product, price and service strategies. Uncover new customer opportunities in the designated market. Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision and results driven. External Applicant Information This position is posted both internally and externally. This is a remote position within New York, Connecticut, Rhode Island, Massachusetts, Vermont, New Hampshire, and Maine only Relocation assistance is provided for this role Travel is required to cover the area of responsibility Qualifications  Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree Minimum of four years of related work experience Able and willing to travel 50% of the time within the area of responsibility Proficiency with Microsoft Office Preferred Qualifications Previous sales experience in Retail / Grocery Salt Industry experience Demonstrated negotiation and value-based / consultative sales skills Strong verbal, written, and presentation skills Experience with Salesforce or Customer Relationship Management software Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet
industries: Chemicals, Food & Beverages, and Food Production
