Job Overview  As an Outside Sales Professional, the role is responsible for driving revenue growth and bringing in net new business from prospects. This role is to set appointments with business owners to sell Heartland’s payment processing solution(s) through various methods, including prospecting face-to-face and over the phone and through the business owner’s network by building referral partnerships. The position is compensated with one time commission, monthly residuals and portfolio ownership. The compensation is highly leveraged with the opportunity for creating passive income while working flexible hours.   Essential Duties  Prospect and close new merchant accounts consistently month after month.  Practice the Heartland mantra of Entrepreneurs Respectfully Serving Entrepreneurs by listening and gauging the customer’s needs to offer appropriate solutions and products to elevate the customer’s business.  Market additional products and services when introduced under company guidelines.  Travel to and from client sites to ensure appropriate level of service.  Respond to all sales leads within the required response time and work to solidify and close the sale.  Report the results on a regular basis as required.  Overcome customer objections, issues or concerns as necessary to solidify the sale.  Possess the ability to obtain a higher value from merchants based on the value-added benefits offered by the product/service.  Assess customers’ needs and identify the product/service that best meets the customer’s needs.  Gain a full understanding of all hardware, software, and reporting offered by Heartland, and effectively communicate this information to prospects, clients and internal parties.  Continually learn all aspects of all of the products and services offered by Heartland.  Work with the reporting manager to assist in developing association, value-added reseller, accounting and vertical market channels targeted by Heartland.  Provide all required documentation to the manager.  Required Qualifications  B2B Sales experience  Outside Sales/ Territory management experience  Proven track record of success in an Outside Sales role Ability to be at full production within first four months  Compensation - Benefits Full-time W2 position Up-front commission, monthly residuals, and portfolio equity 401K with company match Benefits: Medical, Dental, Life, & Disability Apply to learn more
industries: Financial Services and Information Technology and Services

description: Regional Sales Consultant – Central Region Remote-Home Office (available CT and for periodic travel to customer visits once restrictions lifted) If you are an inside salesperson, account manager, business development manager or account executive this role is for you!  The Myers-Briggs Company, the worlds most recognized name in supporting talent development, is looking for another A player for its US Enterprise Sales team. We are looking for someone who understands that attitude, emotional intelligence, urgency and a strong commitment to accountability are the cornerstones of success in their roles.  This position would be ideal for someone who has a proven record as a player coach or for that very special person who has been overachieving as an individual contributor and thinks they are ready to take this to the next level  The Regional Sales Consultant, SE is a true player/coach role who will be responsible for initiating, developing, and establishing new business within the region, to increase and grow revenue streams, while sustaining existing business in states within the assigned territory of the South East region. Leverage sales methodology (i.e. Sandler) to ensure sales processes are used methodically to drive successful outcomes in a B2B market. Use industry expertise to coach, manage and develop regional Customer Success Representatives to develop their capabilities to identify, develop and close new opportunities. Maintain current and accurate customer contact database (Salesforce) and manage customer accounts engagement with The Myers- Briggs Company product and services.  Your responsibilities will include: Attainment of Identified Accounts Revenue Goal - Work in tandem with Customer Success Reps within the territory to complete daily tasks and strategy. Initiate conduct and follow-up on sales calls designed to grow MB strategic market(s). Conduct regular schedule of meetings (in-person and remote) with region’s Top 150 customers, F1000 customers & to prospective customers in MB’s strategic market(s), conduct regional business development strategy to develop and expand portfolio of customers within region. Daily use of Salesforce.com tasks, leads module and Opportunity pipeline is required. Lead Regional Account Revenue Strategy Meetings on a weekly basis. When required, provide appropriate client participants for MBC product review panels, focus groups, testimonials, case studies and other customer-based input requirements. Collect and add customer needs/trends information in MBC strategic market(s) to Salesforce.com CRM to keep it current. Respond to the Senior Vice President, Global Sales with accurate and well-researched data to requests for customer/market-based information. Manage Regional Customer Success Representatives by working closely to consistently hit or exceed individual quarterly sales quotas and KPIs, while executing on the key strategies for their region. Partner with and support the SVP of Global Sales to finalize, rollout and monitor the achievement of KPIs within team thru coaching and development opportunities. Provide ongoing performance coaching to ensure team success that includes developing and delivering performance evaluations and goals for each Representative. Proactively identify and partner HR to effectively address and manage performance or employee relations issues to resolution. Lead regional progress meetings to identify trends across the regional sales team, identifying barriers (and steps to remove along with timeline) as well as key learnings. Report out regularly on progress and status to SVP of Global Sales. Gathering and leveraging actionable insights from the market in order to drive performance  Your Professional Experience Includes: 3+ years of Consultative Sales experience at the enterprise level. Proven closer who fully understands pipeline dynamics, enterprise selling methodology 3+ years experience managing employees Personality that exhibits and understands the performance value of urgency, transparency, accountability and goal based time management Strong EQ, Learning Agility and Critical Thinking skills Training and high-level execution skills in sourcing new business in a timely, stage driven methodology Experience with ERP systems, Salesforce.com and any outreach Basic math competency; strong analytical skills; excellent communication skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills. B.A. or B.S. degree required   Our corporate culture is mission driven. We are a certified B Corp and a California benefit corporation, taking all stakeholders (including our employees, community, customers, and the environment) into account to make a positive difference. We have a culture that is emotionally intelligent, aligned, results-focused, cross-functional and committed to the professional development of all employees.  While we’re best known for our products like the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator® assessment (MBTI®), our reach extends well beyond a single instrument. We are a group of professionals who provide expertise in the talent development industry, as well as to career counselor and educators and individual consumers. We offer solutions to help improve individual and organizational performance and address whatever people development challenges businesses and professionals face – from team building, leadership, coaching, and conflict management to career development, selection, and retention. Perhaps this is why millions of individuals in more than 170 countries use our products and services each year. Our customers include the majority of the Fortune 500 companies, as well as businesses of all sizes, educators, government agencies, training and development consultants and consumers looking to understand themselves better.  Working at The Myers-Briggs Company gives you the opportunity to make a positive difference, be accountable, experience genuine respect from your colleagues and peers, and feel valued and supported. We work to create an environment that fosters excellence and encourages employees to contribute, learn, and grow throughout their career.  Our company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.
jobFunction: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service

description: LeaseQuery makes accountants’ lives easier by simplifying the complex with our innovative FinTech SaaS technology. Our products, used by more than 2000+ organizations in 87 countries, are rated #1 for user satisfaction and ease of use by G2, and our company has been named #26 on Deloitte Technology’s Fast 500 list and #4 on Georgia’s Fast 40 list among many other recent accolades.  In the past decade, our CEO, George Azih, grew LeaseQuery from a one-person company to a workforce of 200+ representing one of the fastest-growing FinTech companies today. As we move into our next phase of growth, we're looking for passionate and dedicated people who want to invest their energy to align with our company's long-term goals.  As a Sales Development Representative, you will engage prospects through cold outreach to communicate how LeaseQuery can solve lease accounting challenges. You will be responsible for cold-calling prospects and educating the market about the power of LeaseQuery and generating opportunities with net-new customers to support and enable sales Account Executives (AEs) to close revenue-generating deals.  Why you're important to us:  At LeaseQuery, our Sales Development Representatives are pivotal to our company’s success. You will be a key member of our fast-growing and high-performing sales team and will be our specialists in researching prospects, discovering pain points, getting access to and setting meetings with decision-makers. Specifically, you will leverage your past cold calling and/or lead generation experience to communicate with potential clients via phone, emails, and Linkedin to develop an interest in LeaseQuery’s software. We believe that the most successful sellers have a passionate and supportive team behind them. As future Account Executives, our SDRs allow the current closing team to focus on conducting meetings with prospects and increasing the overall productivity of the sales organization.  How you will contribute:  Our Sales Development team consists of seasoned and up-and-coming sales professionals with a strong hunter mentality and a desire to win. LeaseQuery SDRs share a few common traits: they are self-motivated, ambitious, and passionate about evangelizing LeaseQuery. They are also the epitome of our core values - Sense of urgency. Integrity. Teamwork. Customer Commitment. Accountability. Empathy. Passion.  You’ll have the opportunity to follow an established and successful sales process combined with weekly coaching and armed with the latest technology. By setting quality meetings, you'll play an integral role in building our sales pipeline and our business! In the SDR training program at LeaseQuery, you will participate in a mix of virtual classroom-style learning as well as role-plays and practice. You will learn to generate sales-qualified leads, prospect via cold calls, email, LinkedIn, and establish the value of our solutions. Once you’ve engaged with a prospect, you will build rapport and find your prospects’ needs. You will receive 40% of your leads from marketing programs and will be 100% responsible for generating your own prospects.  Your success will be measured on proven key performance indicators including daily activity metrics as well as monthly quota attainment. As you demonstrate mastery of skills, we have a clearly defined career path with our SDR organization that will set you up for promotion to sales, channel partner, or anywhere else you want to grow within the organization.  You will stand out with: 6 mos-2 years of relevant sales experience required; internship experience will be considered Previous cold calling experience required Positivity is a MUST! You are solutions-oriented and not afraid of challenges in a fast-paced environment Collaborative mentality by prioritizing ‘we’ and not focusing on ‘me’ Results-driven and competitive nature Superb writing, communication, and listening skills; you must understand objections and overcome them by turning skeptics into believers Outstanding time management skills High level of empathy - it’s important for our SDR’s to be a good person to peers and prospects Proven ability to make strong connections and overcome rejection to achieve results Desire to move up the ranks and become an Account Executive or Channel Partner Manager in the future required Solid project management and business development skills Excellent presentation and communication skills Grit, strong work ethic, coachable, confidence, curiosity, self-awareness, and a focus on self-development Success working remotely and a strong home setup Knowledge of our sales tools such as Salesforce, SalesLoft, and Zoominfo is a plus Four-Year BA/BS Degree SaaS and/or FinTech experience definitely gives you a leg up!  Perks & Benefits Medical, dental, and vision plans, designed to fit you and your family’s needs Flexible PTO to promote a healthy work-life blend 11 corporate holidays, including your birthday 401(k) plan to help you invest in your future Weekly catered lunch at our office Casual dress environment Free gym membership at our office$2,000 stipend annually for personal growth and development 10 weeks paid parental leave for ALL new parents Fertility/adoption assistance Annual tutoring stipend for your children Work from home stipend to help you succeed in a remote environment Corporate mentorship program Regular team outings and team building events Advancement opportunities based on results, not politics Culture that emphasizes inclusiveness driven by our REDI Committee  About Us  LeaseQuery is an innovative, FinTech SaaS company focused on meeting accountants’ complex needs with the next generation of cloud-based accounting technology solutions. Our top-rated products are used by more than 2000+ organizations in 87 countries, and we are incredibly proud of our 99%+ customer retention rate.  We have recently been named #29 among Inc. 5000’s Fastest Growing Companies, #26 on Deloitte Technology’s Fast 500 list, #4 on Georgia’s Fast 40 list, among many other accolades. We also made history with a two-time #1 rating on the Bulldog 100 list, an award that recognizes thriving businesses owned or operated by University of Georgia alumni.  LeaseQuery is an equal opportunity employer to all persons, free from restrictions and prejudice based upon race, color, creed, religion, sex, domestic relationship status, parental status, family status, sexual orientation, national origin, gender identity, age, and disability status. LeaseQuery maintains a drug-free workplace.

WE CONNECT PEOPLE TO THEIR PASSIONS THROUGH GREAT CONTENT  Blue Ant Media is a privately held content producer, distributor and TV channel operator. We own and operate numerous production companies in North America and Asia-Pacific under the Blue Ant Studios banner, creating content for broadcasters and streaming platforms in multiple genres including factual entertainment, natural history, documentary, adult animation and drama. Our distribution business, Blue Ant International, offers a substantial catalogue of content, including one of the world's largest 4K natural history offerings. Blue Ant Media operates channels under nine brands including Love Nature, Smithsonian Channel Canada, BBC Earth (Canada) and more. Blue Ant Media is headquartered in Toronto, with seven international offices in Los Angeles, New York, Singapore, Tokyo, London, Washington DC, and Beijing.  Our productions and media brands are a product of our employees who are passionate experts in all of these areas. They are fanatical about creating outstanding content and experiences; and enthusiastic about delivering it on new and evolving platforms.  We actively seek out people who embody our core values: optimism, creativity, entrepreneurism, agility and integrity. We attract creative talents who are optimistic about the evolving future of content and who take pride in seeing opportunity where others see challenges. We encourage employees to think like small business owners by taking ownership on projects and giving them the flexibility to take risks and embrace an evolving media landscape. Our team members excel at collaborating with internal and external partners and our culture fosters sharing ideas and treating all people with respect.  Are you one of us?  Sales and Marketing Manager (California, Maryland, or New York)  We are currently looking for a Sales and Marketing Manager, to support U.S. and International Channels Distribution. This position is part of the Affiliate Distribution team and is based in the Blue Ant Media office in Los Angeles. The Manager will report to the SVP, Latin America & U.S. Channel Distribution and work across the U.S., Latin America and other international territories as required. The role could be located in either of our offices located in California, Maryland or New York.  If you know the term “FAST Channel” and you get how it differs from an AVOD channel, but you also understand that cable TV still has a very strong heartbeat, this could be the job for you! Blue Ant Media Global Networks is looking for a Sales and Marketing Manager to develop and execute partnership opportunities for the distribution for our Linear TV and Digital channels in the U.S. and international markets.   This person will collaborate with our key partners to select which initiatives are worth doing and then ensure they are done on time and on budget while also meeting key business growth objectives. You must be a self-starter, a strong communicator and work well interdepartmentally (aka be as good with your peers as you are with your clients). If you have a good sense of when the juice is worth the squeeze when it comes to strategic decisions, then please, come forth.   Core Responsibilities & Duties  Develop sales materials and plan pitches to platforms and affiliates utilizing a working knowledge of the Television Channels in the Blue Ant portfolio available for Distribution. Key account management and new account development. Present carriage and distribution opportunities to clients and negotiate deals under the supervision of the SVP, Latin America & U.S. Channel Distribution. Create strong relationships with Pay, Cable, SVOD, OTT, FAST and AVOD clients; Understand their needs and advise on affiliate marketing campaigns to support audience and platform growth. Collaborate with senior management, teammates and partners in sales support (e.g., sales planning, business affairs, marketing and research) to develop general and customized solutions for clients. Work directly with U.S. & International FAST/AVOD platforms to manage marketing initiatives for launching campaigns, monthly highlights and marketing priorities. Develop strong relationships with our U.S. platforms and strategize organic and paid marketing opportunities to boost channel awareness and increased viewership time that drives revenue. Evaluating customer research, market conditions and competitor data. Monitor marketing industry news and submit reports on emerging trends to management each month.  Key Qualifications & Experience High TV IQ -- the candidate must know the pay TV/SVOD/FAST/AVOD & OTT landscape. Strong understanding of all the different OTT and streaming platforms and the effectiveness of the opportunities to our business.  Minimum of 3-5 years of sales and marketing experience. Proven experience in leading the channel distribution life cycle of a deal from pitch to execution in all media (Basic and Premium Pay TV, SVOD, AVOD, FAST, Basic, VOD and EST). Ability to explore new business models/develop term sheets in quick turnaround. Experience working on multiple, prospective deals with the ability to prioritize appropriately. Solid experience in cold calling/effective presentations. Experience in marketing, advertising, digital marketing, and data analytics. Strategic thinker with advanced marketing, sales, negotiation and problem-solving skills. Results-driven, self-starter with strong customer focus and relationship management. Demonstrated history of project accountability. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills. Experience working with both start-up and established businesses. Strong attention to details and excellent interpersonal skills. BA degree, MBA strongly preferred.   Blue Ant Media celebrates diversity in both its programming and workforce. We encourage applications from individuals of all backgrounds who are eligible to work in Canada.  We thank all candidates for their interest in Blue Ant Media and we will reach out to those candidates that are under consideration. If you are contacted for an interview and require an accommodation during the recruitment process, please advise Human Resources.

jobTitle: District Sales Manager - Grand Rapids, MI
description: Are you an experienced sales manager? Were you born to win? Does watching the success of the people you've coached make your day? Come lead a team of Account Managers as they out-hustle the competition by helping local bars, grocery stores and restaurants with their beverage choices.  Eat. Sleep. Sell Spirits. Repeat: Our District Sales Managers lead, manage and hold their teams accountable while hitting goals. They stay organized and motivated to do what's needed to impact sales, hire talent and help their team grow professionally. This full-time position requires previous sales and leadership experience, availability Monday-Friday and you must currently reside or be willing to relocate to the Grand Rapids, MI area.  Like a fine wine, Imperial Beverage has been getting better with age since 1933. We are a Michigan family-owned beverage distributor and we are passionate about helping others succeed at work and in the community. We only hire those with passion, hard work, integrity, and a strong customer focus. Once all the work is done at our fast-paced company, we also like to have fun and lots of it!  Will work for beer? Great! Working for a beverage distributor has its perks. Not only will you get to learn about and sample our products, but we also include health, dental and vision insurance (and a free health insurance option is available!), a generous PTO policy, a 401K match, awesome company events like tickets to baseball games and weekend camping trips, and a leadership development program for all managers.  A Day in the Life Check the schedule you put together for the week to see what accounts and employees you will be visiting for the day Create a plan for each stop, which can include product samples, reviewing sales numbers, and ensuring we are helping the account succeed Grab an energy drink, jump in your car, and start driving to your first stop Check in with your team throughout the day to answer questions and see if they need anything Depending on the day, when you visit an account, you may be training a new employee, resolving issues, sampling products with the purchaser, merchandising, job shadowing an employee, providing coverage for a sales route, or ensuring we are meeting account standards Run sales reports for your team to track goals and identify sales opportunities Prepare and present information at weekly sales meetings Lead and coach your team Requirements Bachelor's Degree (or equivalent education and experience) in Sales and Business Marketing Management and sales experience required 21 years of age or older Must live in assigned market Self-motivated with strong organizational skills Flexibility to work varying hours to accommodate customer needs and special events Ability to establish and maintain strong relationships with various types of people Desire to stay up-to-date on industry trends and product knowledge Ability to attain a Michigan Liquor Control Commission license

Job Description: The Sales Executive plays a key role in driving revenue at CIC Plus. In this position, you will be a trusted advisor to prospective clients and partners using your CIC Plus service expertise and consulting skills to solve their business challenges. You will increase sales performance by working to identify opportunities, develop relationships, present solutions, and establish partnerships with the Fortune 1000 marketplace. The Sales Executive will ensure client expectations are aligned with the CIC Plus offering through close collaboration with CIC Plus internal stakeholders. The Sales Executive also will help represent CIC Plus at trade shows and partner events. The successful candidate must have proven success in a sales capacity within the HCM marketplace. They must have proven strategic, analytical, and consultative sales skills. The candidate should also be a broad-based business thinker who can collaborate effectively with peers as well as all levels of functional and business leadership.   Key Responsibilities: Increase sales performance by partnering with Sales, Business Development and Alliances to present CIC Plus strategies and business solutions. Strong functional and technical knowledge of the HCM marketplace. Strong functional and technical knowledge of the employee life cycle. Build trust and rapport with multiple stakeholders within a complex selling environment. Communicate effectively with a sharp focus on the client and their objectives. Highly organized with the ability to work independently. Highly adept in presentation and demonstration skills. Facilitate business and functional discussions with user groups and senior functional directors. Participate in conferences events and other marketing activities to promote awareness of CIC Plus and our products. Lead discovery sessions to understand client’s business/functional requirements. Collaborate with CIC Plus stakeholders to configure and align solution to client needs. Support RFP response process. Strategic use of competitive knowledge and intelligence. Ability to work and perform under pressure. Develop technical competence and functional expertise across CIC Plus offerings. Ability to learn technology quickly through instruction and self-training. Manage and maintain CIC Plus demonstration environment.  Requirements: 3 years’ B2B sales experience including business equipment, services, or software. 3 years’ experience selling to Fortune 1000 3 years’ experience selling to the HR, payroll, and benefits community. Proven track record exceeding sales quotas Goal oriented and ambitious with capacity and drive to reach and exceed quotas. Demonstrated cold calling sales ability with assertive, positive, and persistent style. Experience working with and leveraging partner networks. Proven client service and relationship building skills. Ability to effectively communicate through all mediums (verbal, listening, written) Aptitude for acquiring sales skills and product knowledge. Organized, with effective time management skills. Ability to work independently and with a team. General business acumen Mature and self-confident Capacity to work under pressure Strong work ethic Committed to building a career path.

Our sales team effectively promotes and sells Kognitiv services and products. The team works closely with marketing efforts to facilitate adoption of Kognitiv products and services while providing valuable feedback to the business. Since Kognitiv is known for its unique business model and innovation in the Workday® space, the team has the creative freedom to approach the market in unique ways.  The Head of Sales leads all the business development team efforts for Kognitiv. It is a highly visible role with responsibility for representing Kognitiv to senior (CXO and VP) leadership to prospects, and partners, and at industry events & conferences. The individual will be responsible for developing, leading and managing commercial activities of the business while implementing an innovative, growth focused commercial strategy. The emphasis will be ensuring that Kognitiv attracts new logo customers for its Workday Services and Rooster software product. This position will be responsible for managing an Outside Sales, Channel Sales, and Inside Sales team Together the team will be accountable for driving top line bookings and revenue.  Key responsibilities  The selected candidate will:  Develop, execute and track the sales plan; meeting or exceeding monthly, quarterly and annual Sales performance targets. Develop and implement a sales plan to acquire new customers for Kognitiv. This will include Workday services and the Rooster software product subscribers. Be responsible for setting the business development strategy and driving alignment of the strategy and execution with service delivery and software development teams. Own the effective implementation of the sales process from lead generation to closed business. Develop tactical plans that clearly define objectives, goals, schedules, and assignments to implement targeted opportunities. Actively remove any barriers to create an environment that promotes and encourages team work and client success across the business. When securing new accounts, coach the sales team and when needed (e.g., for key prospects and large opportunities), act as Kognitiv ’s leading salesperson, leading the team ‘from the front’. Lead complex contract negotiations. Develop executive level presentations that succinctly and persuasively communicate our performance and strategy to employees, the leadership team and executives. Work closely with Marketing and Inside Sales teams to develop sales leads into existing and new clients. Participate in prospect/partner presentations and build visibility throughout Kognitiv ’s target industries. Develop and maintain systems and processes that provide genuine visibility and accurately forecast sales results. Provide quantitative and qualitative input for strategic decisions. Partner closely with Marketing to implement the sales strategy (verticals, multi-channel) and provide feedback on customer needs that can be used to enhance new product and service offerings. Influence market positioning, commercialization, pricing, strategic direction, and go-to- market strategy with a strong focus on larger company and tier 1 customers. Direct all sales support activities, including pre-sales technical support, service delivery and sales planning/administration. Collaborate with Executive Leadership to assess, propose and implement new ideas and strategies for growth. Represent Kognitiv on digital and social ecosystems, trade shows, and exhibitions including speaking engagements at industry conferences.  Location  Available and willing to frequently travel for opportunities, company training, or partner events  Qualifications & experience  Essential 10+ years relevant sales leadership and sales experience or equivalent in corporate sales of software and services in the Enterprise market segment. Able to work in a fast-paced, self-directed entrepreneurial environment. Exceptional enterprise IT product and services sales skills and sales mentoring skills. Experienced in the sales in various industries including healthcare, financial services, manufacturing, communications, resources, retail, and public sector. Knowledge of and coaching capability of Miller Heiman, The Challenger Sale, SPIN, Helping Clients Succeed, and/or Sandler sales skills for complex sales and selling solutions. Extensive experience engaging with senior executives (CXO and VP) within large enterprise customers is required. Highly proficient computer skills including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Outlook, Slack. Exceptional in-person presentation skills to small and large groups. Advanced with CRM software process and systems such as SalesForce.com & Zoom Info. Strong leadership skills and the ability to attract, develop, and motivate high performing sales professionals.  Preferred  Candidates will have a demonstrable record of increasing management responsibility and have led sales for companies selling both technology services and subscription software. Successful contribution to scaling a company/region over a period of significant revenue growth. Familiarity with Workday software and the associated ‘eco-system’.  Leadership & Management  A detailed and systematic approach to targeting, monitoring and appraising team members. An entrepreneurial mind-set and a roll-up-your-sleeves work ethic are essential. He/she must be comfortable with ambiguity and rapid rates of change.  Intellect  First-rate strategic skills must be combined with the ability to drive the implementation process at the ‘sharp-end’ of the business. Excellent technical knowledge is important, but the ability to understand and influence how technology can be harnessed to drive the business to best effect is critical.  Communication  Excellent interpersonal skills will be needed in order to build the strong relationships that will be critical to the success of this role. Will have the gravitas, executive presence, charisma and knowledge to be credible in complex discussions and negotiations both internally and externally. Comfortable working and communicating in a virtual environment with staff utilizing Slack / Zoom as the primary communication tools. Comfortable being the voice of Sales and regularly providing news, events, and updates on internal social channels to keep the rest of the company updated.  Motivation/Culture Fit  Lead by example and develop a culture that embraces company values. Ensure that together the team is focused on achieving results using all resources available from prospecting through to closure and feels comfortable to challenge and be challenged. Build a high-performance culture and working environment within business development across the organization that attracts and retains the very best talent from both inside and outside the Company. Ensure the team thrives on change and inspires colleagues to embrace, innovate and engage in new ways of working. Work with the leadership team to manage the Performance and Development Review process appropriately ensuring consistency, fairness and a diligent approach. Business minded, comfortable driving for consistent growth and margin. A pragmatic approach and the ability to thrive under the pressure of constant change and moving targets. Near real-time responsiveness (email, voicemail, Slack) for escalations, challenges and requests that may surface.  All of our sales professionals receive comprehensive training in our services and product offerings. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online, in the classroom, or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do, and the experience it offers, provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.  Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States and with Kognitiv (i.e., H1-B visa, F-1 visa (OPT), TN visa or any other non-immigrant status).  Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Kognitiv or an affiliated Kognitiv business may not be eligible for consideration.

As a Sales Development Representative, you will be responsible for identifying and creating new qualified opportunities for your VP counterparts. This role manages the outbound campaigns of the sales pod, identifies critical decision-makers, and generates interest in the Paymerang solution. The Jr. Account Executive will serve as an ambassador for Paymerang and will need to articulate and champion the Paymerang value proposition. This position reports to the Sales Director.  Responsibilities: Become an authority at using lead generation tools to discover contacts and craft accurate and targeted lists of prospects Conduct sales development best practices with email, phone, and social selling outreach using set cadences to connect with new prospects Utilize smart, targeted questions to speak intelligently with decisions makers such as VPs, Controllers, Accounting Managers, Directors of Finance, and CFOs Expertly build interest and opportunities with new prospects Oversee consultations on VP’s calendar and log activities in Salesforce CRM Exceed quota of qualified consultations  Basic Qualifications: High degree of persistence, self-confidence, and comfort with cold calling Outgoing, energetic, and personable High impact communication and presentation skills Highly organized with the ability to prioritize and focus on key opportunities Capable of building trusting relationships  Preferred Qualifications: Understanding of complex financial products and the ability to simplify into a coherent story Experience in Software as a Service (SaaS) is a plus  Why You’ll Love It Here Base salary + uncapped commission potential Incredible growth potential 100% employer-paid medical and dental premiums for full-time employees 18 days of PTO (& 10 Paid Holidays) 401k retirement plan -- with a 6% non-elective contribution, so you get the money no matter what! Maternity and Paternity Leave: because both moms and dads are parents. Fun company and team outings because we play just as hard as we work Employee referral bonuses to encourage the addition of great new people to the team Plus, daily catered breakfast and snacks to keep you fueled up throughout the day  Please note: at this time Paymerang is unable to sponsor candidates for this role.  Paymerang is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, marital status, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation.

description: Wake up each day knowing that you are a part of something special. Something real. Something bold. Are you looking for a place where you will have a role in shaping an industry? Then it’s time for you to apply to join the pack.  As a Sales Representative, you are responsible for selling Coyote’s services to Middle Market sized customers. You will create your individual portfolio of accounts through research and prospecting while providing logistics solutions based on individual customer needs. As a Sales Representative, your development focus is on account-specific growth strategies, complex selling, navigating longer sales cycles, and becoming more consultative in your customer relationships. You work with operations teams that handle the day-to-day operations of your accounts so you can focus on further developing your portfolios. Sales Representatives have the professionalism necessary to navigate some of the largest and most complex opportunities while upholding Coyote’s No Excuses® commitment to service.  Daily Tasks & Responsibilities (include, but not limited to): Research leads to identify decision makers and develop background information for sales calls Use creative and persistent methods to prospect and generate new business opportunities Maintain relationships with key stakeholders and continue to develop existing customer accounts Be proactive when dealing with issues & respond with a sense of urgency, escalating when necessary Effectively quote the customer considering all variable factors Be a consultative resource to customers & leads by working with cross departmental subject matter experts and recognizing solutions and services best suited for their individual needs Possess an in-depth understanding of each Coyote service offering Have a thorough understanding of market trends and industry insights and Coyote service offerings to facilitate effective pricing & provide value to customers Collaborate with Operations Team to implement effective solutions for customer needs  Experience, Skills & Characteristics: 3+ years of sales and/or account management experience Experience with formal meeting preparation and face-to-face customer interaction Efficient time management skills with the ability to recognize and prioritize profitable opportunities Strong negotiation skills – persuasiveness, aggressiveness, confidence Effective and professional communication skills and strong customer service skills Confident decision-making skills, issue resolution and problem solving ability  Preferred Experience: Logistics or related experience preferred  Why Coyote? Onsite training and ongoing career development. Competitive pay. Comprehensive benefits package. Internal advancement opportunities for high performers. Global opportunities. Casual dress & many perks. Diverse and Inclusive environment. Opportunities to impact the world around you through our 360 sustainability initiatives.  Important Notice to US Applicants: Coyote is an at-will employer. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Please view Equal Opportunity Posters provided by the OFCCP.   Aleron companies (Broadleaf Results and TalentRISE) are Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetic information, age, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected basis.

Key Account Manager – Pacific Northwest  Reports to: VP of Business Development  Location: Pacific Northwest (ID, MT, UT, CO, NOCAL)  Job Overview:  We are looking for a qualified Key Sales account manager to join our team. You will be responsible for developing long-term relationships with customers and overseeing sales.  As a Key Account Manager, you should work to satisfy customers' needs and requests, respond to their queries in a timely manner and aspire to deliver a positive customer experience. You should have excellent communication and negotiation skills and be customer service oriented.  Ultimately, you should be able to grow our business by building successful, long-term client relationships.  Responsibilities: Manage a portfolio of accounts in the grocery/mass retail channels to achieve long-term success Develop positive relationships with clients Act as the point of contact and handle customers' individual needs Generate new business using existing and potential customer networks Resolve conflicts and provide solutions to customers in a timely manner Supervise account representatives to ensure sales increase Build a sales plan for each account and report on the status of accounts and transactions Set and track sales account targets, aligned with company objectives Monitor sales metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and annual forecasts) Suggest actions to improve sales performance and identify opportunities for Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision and results driven.  Qualifications: Minimum 5 years proven work experience as a Sales account manager or Sales account executive in the grocery and/or mass retail channels. Preferred experience with Albertsons/Safeway, Kroger banners, & Costco. Produce department experience a plus Hands on experience in sales and an ability to deliver excellent customer experience Knowledge of CRM software, MS Office (MS Excel in particular), and IRI/AC Nielsen data Understanding of sales performance metrics with a strong command of business mathematics with strong analytical skills Excellent communication, consultative selling, and negotiation skills An ability to deliver projects and answer inquiries on time Business acumen with a problem-solving attitude Strong verbal, written, and presentation skills BSc degree in Business Administration, Marketing or relevant Ability to travel overnight and work alternative days/hours as needed, and with proper notification. Overnight travel 30%.  About Local Bounti:  Local Bounti is a leading controlled environment agriculture (CEA) company. Our mission is to bring our farm to your kitchen and deliver the freshest, locally grown produce in the fewest food miles possible.  By growing local and minimizing the distance between farm and plate, Local Bounti helps eliminate food waste and provides fresh, high-quality produce to areas of the country over 1,000 miles from their current source. Our sustainable greenhouse technology delivers ideal growing conditions for each of our diverse selection of crops, resulting in 90% less water consumption and 95% less land use than conventional agriculture, no need for herbicides or pesticides, and the lowest carbon footprint in the industry. We provide an interactive, educational, and safe work environment and are dedicated to helping our employees grow within the company. Local Bounti is committed to fully integrating environmental, social, and governance (ESG) objectives in all our business activities.

Regional Sales Consultant – Central Region Remote-Home Office (available CT and for periodic travel to customer visits once restrictions lifted) If you are an inside salesperson, account manager, business development manager or account executive this role is for you!  The Myers-Briggs Company, the worlds most recognized name in supporting talent development, is looking for another A player for its US Enterprise Sales team. We are looking for someone who understands that attitude, emotional intelligence, urgency and a strong commitment to accountability are the cornerstones of success in their roles.  This position would be ideal for someone who has a proven record as a player coach or for that very special person who has been overachieving as an individual contributor and thinks they are ready to take this to the next level  The Regional Sales Consultant, SE is a true player/coach role who will be responsible for initiating, developing, and establishing new business within the region, to increase and grow revenue streams, while sustaining existing business in states within the assigned territory of the South East region. Leverage sales methodology (i.e. Sandler) to ensure sales processes are used methodically to drive successful outcomes in a B2B market. Use industry expertise to coach, manage and develop regional Customer Success Representatives to develop their capabilities to identify, develop and close new opportunities. Maintain current and accurate customer contact database (Salesforce) and manage customer accounts engagement with The Myers- Briggs Company product and services.  Your responsibilities will include: Attainment of Identified Accounts Revenue Goal - Work in tandem with Customer Success Reps within the territory to complete daily tasks and strategy. Initiate conduct and follow-up on sales calls designed to grow MB strategic market(s). Conduct regular schedule of meetings (in-person and remote) with region’s Top 150 customers, F1000 customers & to prospective customers in MB’s strategic market(s), conduct regional business development strategy to develop and expand portfolio of customers within region. Daily use of Salesforce.com tasks, leads module and Opportunity pipeline is required. Lead Regional Account Revenue Strategy Meetings on a weekly basis. When required, provide appropriate client participants for MBC product review panels, focus groups, testimonials, case studies and other customer-based input requirements. Collect and add customer needs/trends information in MBC strategic market(s) to Salesforce.com CRM to keep it current. Respond to the Senior Vice President, Global Sales with accurate and well-researched data to requests for customer/market-based information. Manage Regional Customer Success Representatives by working closely to consistently hit or exceed individual quarterly sales quotas and KPIs, while executing on the key strategies for their region. Partner with and support the SVP of Global Sales to finalize, rollout and monitor the achievement of KPIs within team thru coaching and development opportunities. Provide ongoing performance coaching to ensure team success that includes developing and delivering performance evaluations and goals for each Representative. Proactively identify and partner HR to effectively address and manage performance or employee relations issues to resolution. Lead regional progress meetings to identify trends across the regional sales team, identifying barriers (and steps to remove along with timeline) as well as key learnings. Report out regularly on progress and status to SVP of Global Sales. Gathering and leveraging actionable insights from the market in order to drive performance  Your Professional Experience Includes: 3+ years of Consultative Sales experience at the enterprise level. Proven closer who fully understands pipeline dynamics, enterprise selling methodology 3+ years experience managing employees Personality that exhibits and understands the performance value of urgency, transparency, accountability and goal based time management Strong EQ, Learning Agility and Critical Thinking skills Training and high-level execution skills in sourcing new business in a timely, stage driven methodology Experience with ERP systems, Salesforce.com and any outreach Basic math competency; strong analytical skills; excellent communication skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills. B.A. or B.S. degree required   Our corporate culture is mission driven. We are a certified B Corp and a California benefit corporation, taking all stakeholders (including our employees, community, customers, and the environment) into account to make a positive difference. We have a culture that is emotionally intelligent, aligned, results-focused, cross-functional and committed to the professional development of all employees.  While we’re best known for our products like the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator® assessment (MBTI®), our reach extends well beyond a single instrument. We are a group of professionals who provide expertise in the talent development industry, as well as to career counselor and educators and individual consumers. We offer solutions to help improve individual and organizational performance and address whatever people development challenges businesses and professionals face – from team building, leadership, coaching, and conflict management to career development, selection, and retention. Perhaps this is why millions of individuals in more than 170 countries use our products and services each year. Our customers include the majority of the Fortune 500 companies, as well as businesses of all sizes, educators, government agencies, training and development consultants and consumers looking to understand themselves better.  Working at The Myers-Briggs Company gives you the opportunity to make a positive difference, be accountable, experience genuine respect from your colleagues and peers, and feel valued and supported. We work to create an environment that fosters excellence and encourages employees to contribute, learn, and grow throughout their career.  Our company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.

description: Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s protein and salt business, where we provide wholesome, high-quality food products to a wide range of customers, from foodservice operators and grocery stores to manufacturers and exporters.  Job Purpose and Impact  The Water Quality Senior Account Manager (Sales) will focus on our large or very complex customers within the Northeastern US market. We seek a seasoned professional who will handle our critical or complex products that require excellent client relationship skills to maintain competitive positioning.  Key Accountabilities Develop a plan to establish and maintain account relationships and meet personal sales targets. Build a business plan for each account. Coordinate use of resources (e. g., technical, advertising) to provide value-added services to accounts. Develop strong client relationships that provide significant input to planning product, price and service strategies. Uncover new customer opportunities in the designated market. Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision and results driven. External Applicant Information This position is posted both internally and externally. This is a remote position within New York, Connecticut, Rhode Island, Massachusetts, Vermont, New Hampshire, and Maine only Relocation assistance is provided for this role Travel is required to cover the area of responsibility Qualifications  Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree Minimum of four years of related work experience Able and willing to travel 50% of the time within the area of responsibility Proficiency with Microsoft Office Preferred Qualifications Previous sales experience in Retail / Grocery Salt Industry experience Demonstrated negotiation and value-based / consultative sales skills Strong verbal, written, and presentation skills Experience with Salesforce or Customer Relationship Management software Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet

description: The District Sales Representative - Mechanical Onstream Services (MOS) has a purpose and focus: to drive revenue growth for our groups and district through local relationships. A DSR is responsible for implementing and aligning all industrial/mechanical activities for refinery and plant customers within and around the Sulphur, LA area district to satisfy customer requests for company contract services. A DSR provides solutions, obtains customer orders, administers company approved uniform pricing policies and works as a liaison between the customer and our operations group to assure and enhance complete customer satisfaction.   If you have the sales experience and technical knowledge in these areas: Field Machining, Leak Repair Services, Hot Tapping Services or Bolted Joint Integrity Services we would like to know with you! Let me know of your interest in a conversation today.  Essential Job Functions  Maintains a safe, secure and healthy environment by adhering to Company/Customer safety and quality standards and practices and to legal regulations, alerting others regarding potential hazards or concern. Adheres to and is a champion of TEAM’s Core Values. Developing and deepening relationships with plants by spending 80%+ time in front of clients to develop new opportunities. Serving as the liaison between the resources at TEAM including District and Operations Managers, Account Managers and Technical Sales Specialists to ensure the right support and bring the best solutions to the clients. Communicating proactively and on a regular basis with clients and districts. Identifying opportunities to partner with clients on new service lines and technology. Managing the day to day sales activities by supporting job walks, quotes and the bid process.  Job Qualifications  High school diploma or equivalent. Bachelor’s Degree, a plus. Minimum four plus (4) years equivalent practical experience. Strong preference for knowledge of the industrial respective service line and industry such as: Field Machining, Leak Repair Services, Hot Tapping Services or Bolted Joint Integrity Services. Proficient with Microsoft Office products suite, and ability to learn new software applications and computer programs. Ability to become proficient with customer relationship management (CRM) software; Sales Force experience preferred. Ability to report reliable data by auditing the flow of data, developing check points and controlling credibility of company data. Must possess a valid driver’s license. Professional Sales Training , a plus. Travel requirement 25% - 50%.  TEAM’s Core Values: Safety First / Quality Always – In everything we do Integrity – Uncompromising standards of integrity and ethical conduct Service Leadership – Leading Service Quality, professionalism and responsiveness Innovation – Supports continuous growth and improvement Pride and Respect – For our customers, for each other and for all our stakeholders Teamwork – Global teamwork and collaboration

description: Who We Are:  Aviatrix is a well-funded, pre-IPO, hyper-growth enterprise-software company based in the heart of Silicon Valley (Santa Clara, CA). Aviatrix technology has proven solid at scale with nearly 600 enterprise customers, over 40 of the Global Fortune 500. We have a top-tier, experienced leadership team, combined with a collaborative culture built on proven success, trust, execution, and respect. We’re focused on getting things done!  Read recent article published in Bloomberg on Aviatrix’s incredible rise in value  What We Do:  Aviatrix is networking for the cloud era , delivering a superset of features and capabilities that leverage and control native cloud constructs and add advance network, security and operational visibility features that cloud providers lack, while maintaining the simplicity and automation enterprises expect in cloud. Aviatrix offers the industry’s first and only multi-cloud networking certification ( ACE ), empowering IT to lead and accelerate the transformation to the cloud.  About the role:  We are looking for a highly motivated Regional Sales Manager to join our rapidly growing Go-to-Market (GTM) sales team. The Regional Sales Manager will be responsible for driving sales of Aviatrix products and solutions within a specific geographic territory. The RSM must be quota-driven and will represent Aviatrix and its product suite within the region. S/HE will work with Inside Sales, Systems Engineers, Solution Architects, and Aviatrix Partners to exceed sales objectives. This position will manage all aspects of the sales process including securing net-new business, lead management, qualification, evaluation, close and subsequent account care. The RMS will act as the lead of their territory.  Position Responsibilities:  Define and execute sales plans for the assigned territory  Meet and exceed quotas through prospecting, qualifying, managing, and closing opportunities  Develop and manage sales pipeline, prospect, and assess sales and move a large number of transactions through the sales pipeline  Manage and track customer and transactional information in the Aviatrix CRM system  Provide activity forecasts and regular pipeline reporting through the CRM system  Own and collaborate on all aspects of the sales cycle, including product support and sales engineering  Execute product demonstrations to prospective clients  Develop accounts of various sizes and grow client relationships  Understand the competitive market, be familiar with competing companies and their product suite  Collaborate within the Aviatrix team on strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts, and customer care  Meet with customers daily, both remote and in-person once climate allows  Requirements  8+ years of enterprise software sales experience with a track record of closing complex sales to Fortune 500 companies or 8+ years managing and growing a large geographical territory with YoY growth/success in net-new logo’s  Cloud experience  A Closer – consistent overachievement of sales goals in a large geographic territory  Drive to expand client base and close sales  Excellent communication skills verbal and written, team player  Entrepreneurial – willing to go the extra mile, competitive mindset, great work ethic, resourceful, “get it done” attitude  Must be willing to travel to clients to support sales relationships  Bachelor’s Degree  Aviatrix, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and does not make hiring decisions based on race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

United States, Remote  A superb, wide-ranging Channel Sales Manager role with Flowable, a leading provider of open-source Intelligent Business Automation solutions.  Flowable is a digital platform for business process and case management solutions that – based on our open source engines – connects companies with their customers and automates systems. Our Enterprise and open source products are already being used successfully by many companies around the world. From locations in Europe, North America, Asia and our headquarters in Switzerland, we help global companies with their digital transformation. With over 20 years of experience in the latest technologies and open source development, our strength lies in the permanent further development of our software. Our more than 400 specialists use their digitization expertise to work with our technology partners to implement individual solutions for our customers in the banking, insurance, pharmaceutical and industrial sectors. Learn more about us at http://flowable.com  As a Channel Sales Manager based remotely in the United States, reporting to our Head of Sales & Account Management, you will be responsible for supporting our partners in defining their sales strategy, building successful long-term relationships and achieving your personal sales quota.  What you’ll be doing:  Relationship management – Building business relationships with assigned channel or OEM partners, acting as their first point of contact, providing product training and maintaining high partner satisfaction ratings. Sales support – Preparing business plans together with the assigned partners and supporting them in defining their sales strategy. Assisting with Quarterly Business Reviews (QBRs), joint account mapping and pipeline review. Responsibility for hitting sales quotas for partner business. Collaboration -Working cross-functionally with Sales, Product, Engineering, Support, Marketing and other teams to resolve partner business issues and work towards their stated goals.  What you bring:  Do you have a strong interpersonal skills and enjoy building relationships? Are you ambitious with the ability to multi-task?  In addition to strong time management and organisational skills you’ll also bring:  3+ years experience in Channel Sales or Partner Sales within a Software Product Business. Ability to assess, plan, and actively manage a territory to achieve maximum revenue and efficiency. Excellent time management and communication skills. Professional communication skills and the ability to be diplomatic in difficult or stressful situations. Strong phone and interpersonal communication skills. Experience and knowledge of BPM software would be beneficial.  What you can expect:  You will enjoy flexible working-hours, training, and home-office possibilities. However, we think these are the most interesting advantages of working at Flowable.  Career growth – Flowable is a young company where you will be given the room to develop yourself and learn new things intensively while the company grows. Our company culture – We are a dynamic business with an international culture and flat hierarchy. Contribution to Flowable – You will play a vital part in helping shape the continued growth of of a progressive, future-orientated business.  If this describes you and your aspirations, please click on the APPLY button to embark on a new and successful adventure!

description: At Orascoptic, our brand sits at the intersection of consumer eyewear and medical technology. Our expertise is in stunning innovation and precision custom manufacturing of surgical loupes, coaxial headlights, and associated products. Our mission is to enable healthcare providers around the world to see more and practice longer. We deliver clinical vision. Our innovative product portfolio, direct sales teams, optical expertise, and commitment to leading disruption have created a winning company and a trusted brand. As part of Envista’s portfolio of businesses, we combine the agility of a smaller, focused business with the resources of a large enterprise. We are an ambitious, high energy team intent on creating solutions to help medical professionals improve patient lives. Headquartered in Madison, Wisconsin, our teams and partners are located around the world. For more information about Orascoptic, visit www.orascoptic.com  Job Description  Looking for a medical device sales position in the dental & surgical markets! We provide a cool, unique and premium product to a deserving & grateful customer base. We make a living helping those who help others. And the opportunity is endless. Put your skills to good use and be rewarded for it at Orascoptic.  Position Overview  This is a professional position selling Orascoptic products directly to dentists, dental school students, residents and faculty. Dental hygiene programs and military accounts are included. The majority of the Sales Representative's time is spent calling on dentist group practices, as well as, coordinating and conducting appropriate training sessions, clinics, and trade shows. Responsible, with limited supervision, for the development of new sales opportunities and support of current customer base. Establish contact with key management, decision makers, and influencers in dental schools, medical schools, private practitioner offices, hospitals as well as any outpatient or surgery centers where the use of magnification would be useful. Make presentations and obtain orders from above contacts. Presentations shall include: product specs, marketing information, promotional product information, introduction, and explanation, discussion of application specs and include the use of company provided slides, video, computer, and/or other presentation material. Prepare formal written quotes and/or proposals to present to new customers, in accordance to company policy regarding pricing, terms and level of account activity. Meet Sales Pillars and other KPIs. Develop strategic plans to increase territory-ordering activity. Analytical skills (quantitative and qualitative) are required to effectively manage activity within the assigned territory. Monitor progress and prepare counter measures. Uncover and develop potential sales opportunities with dental private practices, dental schools, dental hygiene schools, government medical/dental facilities to increase business opportunities. Remain in contact with established customer to provide proper information flow from Orascoptic to customer. Support ongoing product training and assist in retraining customer base in proper procedures to use with Orascoptic products. Competency in budgeting and forecasting by account and product for the territory. Staffing national and regional tradeshows as assigned. Facilitate communication and liaison between Orascoptic’s functional departments and customers. Work and leverage relations with sister companies. Preferred Skills 3 + years previous outside sales experience selling a premium product with a proven track record of success. Demonstrated ability to manage a territory of similar size and scope. Completion of formalized sales training course(s) preferred. Ability to work independently and creatively. Strong organizational skills with proven time management skills. Proficient communication skills (both written and verbal) are required. Solid computer skills are a necessary to input orders, navigate reports, and manage territory. Must act in a professional, confidential, and positive manner. Requirements  Job Requirements: Bachelor’s degree (Business /technical background a plus) Or Equivalent work experience in a similar industry. Ability to travel overnight 50%. IND123  Operating Company  Orascoptic  Envista and all Envista Companies are equal opportunity employers that evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. The “EEO is the Law” poster is available at: http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/ compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf.  Envista and its family of companies (Envista) will not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Envista will consider unsolicited referrals and/or resumes submitted by vendors such as search firms, staffing agencies, professional recruiters, fee-based referral services and recruiting agencies (Agency) to have been referred by the Agency free of charge and Envista will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt such unsolicited resumes. An Agency must obtain advance written approval from Envista's internal Talent Acquisition or Human Resources team to submit resumes, and then only in conjunction with a valid fully-executed contract approved by the Global Talent Acquisition leader and in response to a specific job opening. Envista will not pay a fee to any Agency that does not have such agreement and written approval in place.

description: DQLabs.ai is an augmented data quality platform to manage your entire data quality life cycle. With ML and self-learning capabilities, organizations can measure, monitor, remediate and improve data quality across any type of data – all in one agile, innovative self-service platform.  We are looking for an individual that will bring in his/her expertise in solutions engineering to support and work through POV to onboarding using our data quality platform.  Responsibilities  Understand the customer POV requirements and success criteria and align and deliver the solution necessary using the platform Work with both customer and internal product engineering on any roadmap features plus also have an hands on technical skills to easily implement. Prior experience working in the field of data management, data quality, data catalog, data governance will help. Develop and enforce data engineering, security, data quality standards through automation. Participate in supporting the data platforms 24X7.  Qualification Bachelor’s degree in computer science or Similar discipline. 5+ years of experience in software /data engineering and in particular with Apache Spark/Databricks for at least 2+ years experience. Ability to work in fast paced, high pressure, agile environment and willingness to learn any new technologies and apply them at work in order to stay ahead of the curve. Expertise in programming languages Python and/or expertise in Java, Scala or similar will help. Expertise in building and managing large volume data processing (both streaming and batch) platform and performance optimization is a must. Strong team focus with outstanding organizational and interpersonal, management, communication and presentation skills. Who You’ll Work With At Slalom, personal connection meets global scale. Our vision is to enable a world in which everyone loves their work and life. We help organizations of all kinds redefine what’s possible, give shape to the future—and get there. Slalom's focus on local market means that the clients we work with are local to Southeast Michigan. If you currently live out of state and are already in the process of a relocation to Southeast Michigan, please indicate that on your resume so your background can be properly reviewed. Candidates outside of Southeast Michigan should check our website for opportunities in your local market, Slalom is growing and we're hiring in many of our markets. Sales Executive Are you a driven, passionate, and positive Sales Executive who loves to collaborate, identify strategic growth opportunities, foster new client relationships, and deliver on goal-oriented sales objectives? Do you want to be an integral part of helping to continue the growth of our Detroit market into something truly special? Is being a part of an organization that truly cares about you and places a huge emphasis on authenticity, inclusion, and diversity matter? If your answer is yes, we’d love to hear from you! We are seeking a talented Sales Executive to join us! Our Sales team drives business results by producing a well-managed, profitable, and growing book of business opportunities. What You’ll Do Partner with account and practice leaders to strategically pursue new opportunities Work with new and existing clients to build a pipeline and secure new Master Service Agreements (MSA’s) Identify and meet with a broad set of buyers to learn about client initiatives and represent Slalom capabilities Develop and sustain a diverse collection of targeted accounts Leverage Slalom Sales platforms to drive a forecast and collaborate with account and practice leaders Nurture relationships with Alliance partners to drive Slalom growth in key practice areas Work with consultants to leverage their networks and increase new business opportunities Host or facilitate Slalom marketing events Serve as a liaison with client decision makers, Slalom colleagues and Alliance partners Mentor and collaborate with other sellers within and across other Slalom markets Consistently deliver on an annual sales quota; first year expectations are $3M What You’ll Bring Proven success in a sales/business development role with a focus on growth A history of building impactful relationships with c-suite leaders Previous success and comfort with navigating and managing complex pursuits An innovative approach, always thinking about the art of the possible, coming with creative solutions A natural curiosity, seeking to learn from your clients, your partners, your competitors and your colleagues About Us Slalom is a modern consulting firm focused on strategy, technology, and business transformation. In 40 markets around the world, Slalom's teams have autonomy to move fast and do what's right. They are backed by regional innovation hubs, a global culture of collaboration, and partnerships with the world's top technology providers. Founded in 2001 and headquartered in Seattle, Slalom has organically grown to over 9,000 employees. Slalom has been named one of Fortune's 100 Best Companies to Work For five years running and is regularly recognized by employees as a best place to work. Learn more at slalom.com. Slalom prides itself on helping team members thrive in their work and life. As a result, Slalom is proud to invest in benefits that include: meaningful time off and paid holidays, parental leave, 401(k) with a match, a range of choices for highly subsidized health, dental, & vision coverage, adoption and fertility assistance, and short/long-term disability. We also offer additional benefits such as a yearly $350 reimbursement account for any well-being related expenses as well as discounted home, auto, and pet insurance. Slalom is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veterans status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws, and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
