description: Jules and Associates is consistently ranked as one of the top independent Leasing/Financing firms in the nation. We are seeking college seniors or recent graduates who are actively seeking a career in sales.  JOB DESCRIPTION: We are currently looking for highly motivated, outgoing and well-spoken individuals who can successfully engage with key decision makers at some of the top mid-sized privately held firms nationally for an Account Executive (AE) position. As an Account Executive you will have the opportunity to learn about the corporate world and have the opportunity to achieve financial success while receiving extensive training. This is an excellent opportunity for a recent college graduate with less than five years of work experience or a graduating senior who has the qualities we seek. Your initial goal will be to identify financing opportunities through an existing database by utilizing outbound calling and email initiatives to companies throughout the nation. Successful AEs have the ability to gain trust and provide a high level of service to their customers. As an AE you will be driven by daily, weekly and monthly goals while maintaining a weekly pipeline. The position provides you with an opportunity to learn financial analysis as well as work alongside management to analyze financial statements, pricing and structuring proposals for potential clients.  ROLE EXPECTATIONS: Energetic and professional Highly Competitive Self-motivated and results-oriented Seeks financial reward for their hard work Excellent written and oral communication skills Ability to be organized and multi-task Build and maintain client relationships  QUALIFICATIONS: Undergraduate degree or higher Strong written and verbal communication skills Strong organizational skills Proficiency in Microsoft Office Ability to harness financial data to inform decisions Previous sales experience is preferred, but not required  We provide one of the top training programs that will provide you the tools in order to be successful. You will work in a team environment, with the support of mentors that will help you learn how to build relationships with key decision makers in order to identify financing opportunities that will turn into commissions for you. You will have access to one of the leading CRM programs designed to increase your success in selling. The position provides you with an opportunity to learn financial analysis, pricing and structuring proposals for potential clients.  This is an excellent opportunity for a graduating College Senior who is interested in learning about Sales and the Financial Services industry.

Candidate must be located in the Midwest.   Basic Function: Selling properties to group clients to exceed room night/revenue objectives. Acquire and maintain accounts that produce the most profitable business for our properties within assigned market segments/territories as well as work to ensure that external and internal clients are satisfied with the product and service.   Work Performed: Contact businesses / organizations in defined geographic or market areas through direct outside sales efforts for the purpose of securing business for the Hotel / Resort properties to ensure that pre-determined sales expectations are met / exceeded Use sales system at 'expert level' for concentrated market penetration, reporting on specific strategies and effectiveness, utilizing support services as needed. Log all information in sales system and maintain accurate / current files Research, identify, analyze and develop new business opportunities Plan and execute sales trips to feeder cities, trade shows and inbound property FAM trips Conduct site inspections with potential accounts and industry professionals Conduct direct solicitation and in-person sales calls on assigned / established accounts and potential new accounts, selling all property space and services in an accurate fashion Promptly respond to all inquiries and correspondence from customers, prospects, and designated representation firms Develop new / customized promotions or packages and submit recommendations to the Director of Sales / Marketing for review and approval Stay abreast of industry trends and make recommendations of changes which would affect all aspects of company / property profitability Conduct Hotel / Resort tours and entertains qualified potential clients in accordance with the company and property policies Involve active participation in industry and civic organizations representing opportunities for business Maintain flexible schedule including weekends, evening and early morning hours and holidays, modifying hours as needed to ensure best sales efforts  Responsibility & Authority:  Deal effectively with all departments and regular communication with appropriate manager Ensure that group / guests have a positive experience and take necessary steps to correct deficiencies Negotiate room blocks, room rates, function space, food and beverage prices, and Hotel / Resort services within approved departmental booking guidelines  Confirm in writing to the client and all affected Hotel / Resort departments all group requirements via group sales contract, corporate rate agreement, or catering event order  Job Requirements   Requirements: Must be located in the Midwest and must have previous experience working in the Midwest market.   Luxury hotel and resort experience Strong incentive house relationships Bachelor's degree from four-year College or university; or equivalent related work-related experience.  Minimum 2 years Group Sales Manager experience in a high-end full-service hotel/resort.  Ability to problem solve and follow through to ensure client needs/expectations are exceeded and handle conflict.  Must have strong organizational skills, excellent written and verbal communication skills, and be able to perform and prioritize multiple tasks with ease.  Strong computer skills and hospitality systems experience required and advanced knowledge of Delphi.fdc, and IDeaS RMS a plus.  Ability to travel, and project a professional self-image. Must have the ability to work productively with internal sales staff and other operating departments.  Ability to handle obstacles in a positive and professional manner and to effectively communicate these problems, along with suggested solutions to immediate supervisor.  Strong guest and team member relations skills. Strong ability to adapt to change.

Sales Manager Location - Remote North America Base Salary $50,000 to $70,000 plus bonus and benefits  My client is a fast growing, international start up on a mission to change the history of plastic and have a global impact by developing and manufacturing flexible compostable packaging. Their vision is that compostable flexible packaging becomes part of a systemic solution to the global plastic pollution challenge. They offer consumers and brands the durability and shelf life they have come to expect of ordinary plastics, whilst offering a safe and sustainable end‐of‐life solution.  They are looking for a talented, driven, sustainability minded Sales Manager to join their quickly growing and remote‐based North American team. This position will report to our VP, North America.  Primary Responsibilities: Achieve or exceed sales targets by building and effectively managing a healthy sales pipeline Effectively qualify and follow up on incoming leads Identify and follow up on new leads and prospects by leveraging existing relationships as well as cold outreach Regularly report on quarterly sales targets and other KPI Collaborate with internal team to ensure timely delivery of orders and deliverables Build and maintain relationships with internal and external partners Travel as necessary throughout the US for meetings with current and potential clients (following relevant Covid‐19 guidelines) Additional tasks and responsibilities as identified  What skills & expertise are they looking for? 4‐7 years of experience in business development and/or sales, preferably in the flexible packaging, CPG, or retail industries Strong understanding of the CPG, Retail, and/or flexible converting industry The ability to work with an agile organization A proactive personality: we are looking for someone who is energetic, hands‐on, and highly service orientated Excellent interpersonal, presentation and communication skills A degree in Business, Industrial Engineering, or any other related field  Compensation:  Salary commensurate with experience  Company subsidized medical and insurance benefits

FIELD SALES AND MARKETING REPRESENTATIVE – Techtronic Industries, NA (TTI) About Us: TTI is a world-class leader in design, manufacturing and marketing of power tools and accessories, outdoor product equipment and floor care for consumers, professional and industrial users in the home improvement, repair and construction industries. Our unrelenting strategic focus on powerful brands, innovative products, operational excellence and exceptional people drives our culture. This focus and drive provides TTI with a powerful platform for sustainable leadership and strong growth. Our brands and products are recognized worldwide for their deep heritage, superior quality, outstanding performance and compelling innovation. Our products include professional power tools and accessories, outdoor power equipment and floor care. Brands represented include Milwaukee®, AEG®, Ryobi®, Hoover®, Dirt Devil®, HART®, Oreck ® and Vax®. TTI is fast-paced, our team is high energy, and we reward out-of-the-box thinking to foster innovation in order to be the best in our industry. We provide a multi-faceted training program and hands-on field experience that will stimulate, challenge and reward you!  Duties and Responsibilities: • Perform best-in-class sales and service to consumers while demonstrating knowledge and enthusiasm for TTI products. • Maximize sell through of TTI Power Tool brands by properly merchandising point of purchase material. • Support and implement strategic corporate brand marketing initiatives and promotional activities. • Strengthen and maintain positive relationships with customers, Team TTI Management, and our retail partners. • Maintain regular contact with assigned retail partner store associates and management to cultivate strong relationships. • Monitor weekly sales and analyze monthly results to identify additional opportunities and understand the competition. • Participate in the training program and implement all acquired skills to deliver results. • Initiate and provide in-store product training sessions and demonstrations to educate store associates, management and customers. • Professionally communicate with all peers, customers and management. • Plan and execute demo events, stores walks, trade shows, etc. • Develop primary knowledge of the market place (users, applications, products, competition, and channels) to effectively analyze market potential and communicate competitor market data. Note: Employee's duties and responsibilities are not limited by the above. Other duties may be assigned as deemed necessary by employee's supervisor. In addition to the basic requirements of the position, all employees are expected to meet the company's goals of continual improvement in the areas of knowledge, skills, processes and quality.  Education and Experience Requirements • Bachelor degree or equivalent work experience in retail sales, field sales or customer service required. • Valid driver's license required. • Relocation may be required for future promotional opportunities. • Ability to work nights and weekends. • Capable of lifting and transporting heavy tools (up to 50 lbs.) and requesting assistance as needed. Capable of reaching and/or lifting overhead in addition to ascending/descending ladders to move product. Capable of using hands to maneuver small objects, assemble tools and build displays. • Applicant should be self-motivated and a team player with strong organizational, planning and time management skills. • Applicant must be MS Office proficient.

Field Sales Representatives - Hiring across US  Who We Are:  We’re changing how the world practices security. We’re a passionate, diverse group of people working to ensure every organization has access to a trusted adversary, one attack at a time. We’re hacker led and mission-driven, applying our endless curiosity, passion for excellence, and persistence to help the world hack a better, more secure future.  At Randori, everybody hacks. Whether you’re in engineering, sales, or finance, we look for folks who believe in the impossible, question convention and embrace the hacker mindset.  Trust, empathy, and expertise are at the core of everything we do, and we reward those who embrace them. We seek out individuals confident enough to know they’ll succeed, love to take on big challenges, and are excited to do so as a team.  If this sounds like you, come join us!  The Position:  We are looking for experienced, enterprise sales professionals. The ideal candidates will have demonstrated success with large complex sales cycles within the Global Fortune 2000.  Responsibilities of the Role: Drive the full lifecycle of an opportunity - including prospecting, presenting, running product evaluations, quoting, negotiating etc. Align with your sales engineer to establish proper success criteria, run product evaluations to map to that success criteria etc. Exceed booking, revenue and pipeline quota targets Work closely with Product teams to prioritize feature requests, bugs, support requests etc. Work closely with Marketing to analyze messaging and positioning, quantify brand awareness, coordinate marketing campaigns etc.  What is Required: 5+ years of successful enterprise sales experience in Cybersecurity and ideally experience in the vulnerability management and pentesting markets C-level contacts and the ability to articulate an executive message Demonstrated experience in successfully selling large, multi-stakeholder deals Desire to be part of a fast-paced, category creating company with unlimited potential  If you don't meet 100% of the requirements below - that's okay, nobody's perfect! We believe in hiring people, not just a list of skills. We encourage you to apply if you think this is a role that would make you excited about coming to work every day.  Randori is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. We will consider all qualified candidates regardless of race, color, national origin, sex, age, marital status, personal appearance, sexual orientation, gender identity, family responsibilities, disability, education, political affiliation or veteran status  Security Responsibilities:  Every Randori employee has the responsibility to ensure all tasks performed adhere to Randori’s Information Security requirements. This includes understanding and following security policies, participation in information security training, and helping improve the organization's overall security maturity. Each member of our team must understand their role in protecting company assets and the subsequent handling of confidential & customer data.

jobTitle: Strategic Inside Sales Representative - Uber for Business
description: About The Role  We're looking for an experienced and driven Strategic Inside Sales Representative to support our Uber for Business Strategic sales team. This high-impact position will provide sales support to Strategic Account Executives through the development of qualified leads that result in achieving our business goals. You will be calling upon our largest, and most strategic client accounts. This role will serve as a training ground for a pathway into an Account Executive position with demonstrated success.  You'll be responsible for conducting outbound prospecting campaigns (both call and email). Develop rapport with contacts in an effort to understand where the prospect is in the buying cycle. Work with Strategic Account Executives, to ensure that the leads provided accurately qualified and will progress through the sales funnel. This involves gathering key information to update our Salesforce system and identifying next steps for Strategic Account Executives to connect with these prospects and overall Account Global expansion.  What You'll Do Generate new business opportunities in an assigned vertical or territory and partner with assigned Strategic Account Executives Develop our largest Strategic accounts Outbound prospecting via targeted calling, email, and marketing campaigns Build and execute on strategic and measurable demand generation campaigns Uncover a prospect's business challenges and identify new business opportunities, while highlighting the Uber for Business value proposition Conduct high-level conversations with senior executives Manage, track, and report on all sales activities and results using Salesforce Work closely with sales management to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities for new business Collaborate with the sales team to share best practices and make recommendations to more effectively close sales and ensure customer loyalty Work effectively with internal departments to deliver the best solution for the client and ensure an excellent experience Travel to attend trade shows or other client meetings when requested or necessary Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree required Preferred Qualifications 3+ years of experience cold-calling and sales/business development experience Experience with prospecting and closing transactional deals Experience using a CRM (ex: Salesforce) to manage daily activities Experience with email campaigns and Salesforce preferred Ability to build extraordinary customer relationships Salesforce, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Zoom Info and Groove experience preferred Excellent communication skills Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently Have a positive, self-driven team-first mentality with a desire to learn
industries: Computer Software, Consumer Services, and Information Technology and Services

description: Major Duties  Classification: Exempt / Non-Bargaining  Manage Direct and Indirect Sales teams in the Kansas region including the supervision, coordination, direction, evaluation and planning related to all department activities. Coordinate promotional programs with the Marketing and Product Management Organizations.  Responsibilities  Responsible for the supervision, coordination, direction and evaluation of activities in assigned departments. Serve as a resource to department staff by assigning and checking work, providing regular feedback and formal performance reviews, establishing goals, providing necessary training and participating in hiring decisions.  Responsible for all revenues and profit and loss for assigned areas. Monitor and report financial objectives for assigned areas.  Develop and execute business plan to achieve sales targets and expand our customer base.  Proactively identify opportunities for sales process improvements. Work closely with Sales Managers to facilitate the organization of continuous process improvement.  Coordinate training delivery to sales, sales management and sales support personnel within assigned region.  Build peer support and strong internal company relationships with key management personnel (Engineering, Operations, IT, Marketing, Product) to insure highest level of customer experience from sale inception to delivery.  Work with Marketing & Product Management to coordinate promotional programs and activities, including advertisements and trade show participation.  Perform networking to establish the corporation in the marketplace and develop/foster strategic contacts. Develop relationships with key strategic customer identified in markets to build relationships.  Participate in strategic planning and forecasting and assist in the development of a coherent pricing strategy. Provide recommendations for new products and applications. Develop tactical plans to achieve strategic objectives.  Monitor market penetration and financial results of the product and service offerings and adjust accordingly to meet objectives.  Maintain updated knowledge of industry developments.  Perform all other duties as assigned.  Qualifications  4-year degree in business, marketing, sales or the equivalent in experience. MBA preferred.  10 years sales experience.  5 years supervisory experience.  2-3 years of communications industry experience.  Proven sales experience consistently meeting and exceeding sales targets.  Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and interpersonal skills.  Computer proficiency.  Valid driver’s license and a satisfactory driving record.  Equal Opportunity Employer  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, marital status, familial status, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

description: Company Description:  The Spyder® tool brand, owned by SM Products LLC a sister company to Key Companies, is an innovation leader in power tool accessories. Spyder is known for creating and bringing to market functionally innovative tools and designs that are marketed to make the Pro’s job more productive. Headquartered in North Kansas City, MO, SM Products is continuing its push to rapidly grow its innovative product line plus expand its retail distribution.  In business since 2008, Spyder has now reached a critical mass and is positioned to build on its success in the marketplace. All employees of Spyder are technically employees of Key Company but assigned to Spyder.  Job Summary: Spyder is looking for recent college graduates with a competitive fire to fill our entry-level Sales and Marketing position. Knowledge of construction products or power tools is NOT necessary as we provide a world class, hands-on training for all candidates regardless of previous experience. We offer a tremendous career track in sales and marketing focused on growth for our employees.  Responsibilities: • Travel throughout assigned territory to conduct Spyder business, including occasional travel outside of the territory for corporate meetings, including District and National needs. • Display and demonstrate Spyder products including performing Spyder product knowledge sessions for store employees and end-user customers. • Maintain Spyder’s product bays to specific planograms. • Perform business reporting functions, such as, but not limited to, sales reports, account update reports, monthly reports, call reports, expense reports, mileage reports and other reports as needed. • Properly utilize and distribute the Spyder marketing department collateral materials, including, but not limited to, catalogs, lecture, brochures, campaigns, and Point of Purchase materials. • Coordinate, schedule, and execute customer support events, including, but not limited to, product knowledge training, product demonstration, national contractor training, shows and events, and joint sales calls with Lowe’s pro sales associates. • Develop and continually strengthen professional relationships within all entities, internal and external, involved in our business, such as, Store Managers, Pro Service Mangers, MST personnel, etc. • Investigates and resolves customer issues and concerns instore. • Understand and execute a solutions base sales approach. • Maintain and control Spyder’s assets and their records, such as vehicles, demo tools, marketing materials, product samples, etc.  Applicant Qualities Desired: • Sales professional with discipline and solution selling skills. • Ability to build relationships to gain customer loyalty and penetrate accounts within the market. • Simplify to accelerate business results. Anticipate, adapt to and lead changes. Focus on the right things and act. Perform in ways that exceed expectations. • Operate with highest ethical standards. Be who you are, build trusted relationships. Act with transparency and positive intent. Live up to commitments and own the results. Live up to be a CHARACTERED person• Ability to build relationships to gain customer loyalty and penetrate accounts within the market. • Strong customer service skills. • Strong self-motivator, with the ability to work well independently and is driven to succeed. • Excellent communications skills in person, over the phone, and in writing. • Bilingual a plus. (Spanish preferred) Education, Skills and Experience Needed: • Must be at least 21 year of age at the time of employment • Valid driver’s license • Safe driving record • The employee must be able to safely operate a moving vehicle per our company policy. • Must be able to travel extensively by car in the assigned region and by air on occasion.

This position is responsible for generating revenue from prospects and inactive customers through consultative selling, outstanding customer service practices, and for assisting customers with any problems that may occur during the order and delivery process. This position will also assist with growth and expansion revenue for customers.   Essential Job Functions:* Respond to incoming customer calls/interactions/chats.   Make outbounds to prospects (driven by marketing efforts), inactives and current customers. Provide weekly/monthly pipeline and forecasts. Use consultative sales techniques to offer initial solutions; provide upsell suggestions. Utilize effective sales techniques to handle objections and effectively close the sale. Work proficiently with company sales order entry systems. Utilize CRM to maintain prospect/customer notes and opportunities. Prepare proposals and presentations. Assist team members in growing and retaining customers. Demonstrate company core values.  Supportive Job Functions:* Stay current with market developments, competitive offerings, technological advances, and Company products. Perform other miscellaneous duties as assigned by management. These tasks do not meet the Americans with Disabilities Act definition of essential job functions and usually equal 5% or less of time spent. However, these tasks still constitute important performance aspects of the job.  Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Proven technical, analytical and problem-solving skills. Application of sales processes Strong verbal and written communications skills. Quick on feet, efficient, strong time management. Self-initiative and pro-active demeanor. Business, sales, and marketing acumen. Ability to work remote. Knowledge of sales and marketing practices and procedures. Ability to build rapport with prospects and clients. Works well under-pressure and ability to meet tight deadlines. Must be able to prioritize.  Education, Experience, And Certification Bachelor’s Degree, preferred. 1 year Inside Sales or Customer Experience, preferred Proficient in MS Office, Excellent MS Excel skills, CRM software management.  Data Axle is a leading provider of data and data-driven marketing solutions. Data Axle provides data, technology and services that help marketers acquire new customers and maximize the value of existing relationships. The company's data and marketing solutions help clients of all sizes, from local SMBs to FORTUNE 100™ enterprises, increase sales and customer loyalty. Data Axle provides both digital and traditional marketing channel expertise that is enhanced by access to our proprietary data on 280 million individuals and 24 million businesses. For more information, visit www.data-axle.com.  At Data Axle, our employees are directly responsible for our success. We strongly believe in rewarding employees for their initiative, teamwork and leadership. Every day, we expect our employees to ask questions, demand better solutions and challenge one another to succeed. We are constantly looking for candidates who are not only qualified and knowledgeable, but also have the drive to grow professionally. We hire dynamic individuals in variety of fields such as information technology, account management and client services, sales, marketing, administration and human resources.  Affirmative Action/EEO Policy At Data Axle, we are committed to attracting, retaining and engaging employees from all walks of life. Diversity is an important part of our values and business operations. We are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment that promotes professional development for everyone. As part of that commitment, Data Axle does not discriminate on the basis of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, status as a disabled veteran and/or Veteran of the Vietnam Era or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. In addition, Data Axle will provide reasonable accommodation for otherwise qualified disabled individuals.  This position may be performed remotely and will be filled outside the state of Colorado

jobTitle: C&I Sales Manager – South East Region – Remote
description: Work Locations: NC/SC/FL/GA Main Responsibilities:  ·        Continuously establish and develop business relationships with potential and new customers, expanding sales coverage of north region, and providing strong service to new and existing accounts. ·        Contribute to the design, development and implementation of the company’s sales plan. ·        Manage entire selling process from forecasting to actual product delivery for all the key accounts, staying in close contact both with customers and the company’s related internal departments. ·        Analyze and monitor account customer data, and develop reports on a regular basis based on customer information and development trend. ·        Communication directly with customers on issues relating to their orders and shipments. ·        Represent the company in local and national exhibitions and conferences.  Qualifications: ·        Candidate must be authorized to work in the U.S. ·        Minimum 5 years previous experience within C&I solar sales role in solar and renewable energy industry. ·        Proven record of delivering results with solid teamwork and leadership skills ·        Demonstrate the ability to leverage personal and internal resources to manage the growth of sales and customer relationships ·        Strong customer service and interpersonal skills, able to influence peers. ·        Strong negotiation, interpersonal and problem solving skills. ·        Self-motivated, quick thinker, proactive, and passionate for customer satisfaction. ·        Well organized, a planner and creative ·        Collaborative style with internal and external customers.  ·        Effective working communicating with C-level executives, front line sales and back office team ·        Competency in CRM, Microsoft Office applications, especially Power Point and Excel., Experience with SalesForce.com desirable. ·        If you are interested, please send your CV to recruitment.us@trinasolar.com

In this role you will have a set territory and build national accounts. Since your clients will be located throughout the country, you will be speaking with them via email and phone. This is a fantastic opportunity for someone looking to work from home and maintain work/life balance.  -This is a B2B sales position -No holidays , evenings or weekends -Work from the comfort of your home -Repeat sales to clients -Small company that welcomes your imput -Leads provided -Unlimited income potential!! (Commission Only)- Don't let that stop you! -Training provided   -1099 role  If you are a self-motivated individual who wants flexability and the ability to manage your own schedule, this is the opportunity for YOU! The Group  Morningstar`s Business Development & Sales group is responsible for helping our advisor and institutional clients build their businesses and provide better outcomes for investors. The group is structured primarily along the following client segments: advisors, asset management, institutional consultants, academics, pensions and hedge funds.  The Role  In the Sales Development Representative role, you will represent Morningstar`s software, tools, or services to the appropriate individual, advisor, or institutional clients. Our SDRs are the first point of contact for the vast majority of our new business opportunities. As an SDR, you’ll run a high volume of outreach, make connections with decision-makers at companies that fit our ideal customer profile, and generate new business opportunities for our Regional Sales team. A successful Sales Development Representative embraces challenges and change, considers themselves a people person, and has a natural curiosity to learn about others and their needs. This is a role that makes a direct and significant impact in our business, working closely with the product development, marketing, and other sales teams for the solutions you represent.  The SDR role provides boundless opportunities for both personal and professional growth. The SDR team serves as a launchpad to accelerate your sales career at Morningstar. For those dedicated to exceed expectations, career paths at Morningstar are endless. Every department at Morningstar has representation from former Direct to Advisor sales team representatives. This position is based in our Chicago office.  Responsibilities Act as the engine of our sales team, revving up and warming up prospects to be shared with our regional sales team; Work with a strong sense of urgency, which translates into activity with the expectation of making 50 calls per day; Ask thorough and pointed questions, guiding potential clients through needs assessment and discovery sessions to qualify the prospect and drive new opportunities; Act as consultants - our clients appreciate the value of our data and software for their needs, so we take the time to understand those needs and address them head on; Demonstrate extensive product knowledge to our potential client base; Work closely with client service, sales, product, and marketing teams. Qualifications Have terrific prioritization skills - we generate a LOT of prospects for the team to work with every month, and this team knows how to identify and go after the key customers; Are stellar and professional communicators, both verbally and in their written works; Possess strong negotiation skills and can effectively advance prospects through the sales cycle; Are self-motivated and dedicated to succeed; Love to meet and exceed goals on a daily, weekly and monthly basis; Are team players with entrepreneurial spirits - they come up with and are willing to try new ideas to achieve greater levels of success; Are interested in financial markets or services, particularly investing Generally have at least one (1) years of professional work experience, ideally in some sort of sales role; Have positive, focused, goal - oriented attitudes and mentalities and can be motivated both as an individual and as part of a team; Requirements A bachelor’s degree is required.

jobTitle: Sr Coronary Sales Representative, Southern New Jersey
description: Bring your sales talents to a leader in medical technology and healthcare solutions. Rooted in our long history of mission-driven innovation, our medical technologies open doors. We support your growth with the training, mentorship, and guidance you need to own your future success. Join us for a career in sales that changes lives.  POSITION DESCRIPTION: Maximize profit by achieving sales revenue targets and grow market share for a specified territory, by promoting, selling and servicing Medtronic Coronary and/or Peripheral vascular products Practice good, ethical territory management in terms of organization, planning, administration and expense planning and control Increase sales and revenue by aggressively targeting and developing new accounts Train appropriate medical staff on products and procedures Meet expectations as defined by Sales Management POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES: Planning/Results Orientation Ability to develop, implement and deliver on plans to achieve/exceed sales targets. Plans, actions, and results should include: Consistent achievement/overachievement of sales objectives Ability to handle multiple and competing priorities Specific targeted accounts/customers in which to maintain and grow business Identified competitive accounts in which to establish and promote new business Consistent follow through on all objectives and assignments Metrics and timelines to evaluate results Territory Management /Account Development Develop and maintain accurate account and territory records Effectively manage time to ensure maximum coverage of all accounts within description: Biohaven is a commercial-stage biopharmaceutical company with a portfolio of innovative, best-in-class therapies to improve the lives of patients with debilitating neurological and neuropsychiatric diseases, including rare disorders. Biohaven's neuroinnovation portfolio includes FDA-approved NURTEC ODT (rimegepant) for the acute and preventive treatment of migraine and a broad pipeline of late-stage product candidates across three distinct mechanistic platforms: CGRP receptor antagonism for the acute and preventive treatment of migraine; glutamate modulation for obsessive-compulsive disorder, Alzheimer's disease, and spinocerebellar ataxia; and MPO inhibition for neurodegenerative disease, including ALS. More information about Biohaven is available at www.biohavenpharma.com.  Our progress is fueled by an entrepreneurial organizational structure and an impressive range of experience in drug development along with the confident support of top-tier biopharma investors. The Biohaven culture emphasizes passion, teamwork and high-performance to create value for patients, investors, and employees. As a patient centric organization, they are seeking individuals that have a consistent record of performance, are passionate about better patient care, dynamic team players, and proactive problem-solvers. At Biohaven, it’s about high-performing teams doing meaningful work to positively impact patients. We are seeking outstanding candidates who wish to be part of a highly engaged, ground floor, rapid paced, high growth company.   Neuroscience Sales Specialist Responsibilities to include but not limited to: Effectively promote and educate Physicians on the use of Biohaven products through one-on-one meetings and group presentations, company-approved promotional speaker programs, and other company-approved programs Ensure high performance levels of call and field productivity. Meet Call Plan expectations and achieve territory product sales goals; accurately report/submit sales call activities, territory expenses and written reports within deadline as defined by Biohaven policy in full compliance to all laws, regulations and policies Support targeted customers using company-approved resources, sales materials, and promotional activities/programs/initiatives as identified by sales management Analyze local market, develop, execute and monitor performance and results to maximize the appropriate use of the product in defined territory Expected to accurately report/submit sales call activities, territory expenses and written reports within deadline as defined by Biohaven policy in full compliance to all laws, regulations and policies.  Requirements: Coupled with a strong business acumen and a highly motivated drive to succeed, the ideal candidate has: Bachelor’s degree 2+ years of selling experience in the pharmaceutical/biotech industry Migraine sales experience highly preferred Specialty sales experience preferred Selling experience in Neuroscience preferred Customer overlap preferred Consultative selling experience, exposure or skills The ability to show a documented track record of success Valid driver’s license and clean driving record  Biohaven is an equal opportunity employer and complies with all applicable equal employment opportunity legislation in each jurisdiction in which it operates.

Stripe builds the most powerful and flexible tools for running an internet business. We handle billions of dollars in transactions each year and power hundreds of thousands of businesses—from startups to Fortune 100s—in almost every country around the world. From developers and product managers to founders and CFOs, a broad audience interacts with Stripe’s products and uses them to start, run, and scale their companies. Removing the barriers to online commerce helps more new businesses get started, expedites growth for existing companies, and increases economic output and trade globally.  We are looking for a Strategy & Operations Lead to join our Revenue Operations team, specifically supporting the GTM Partner function as a strategic, operations, and analytics partner. We are looking for someone who is not only a builder at heart, but also ready to dig into operational and performance processes, systems, and data to assess current performance, identify improvement opportunities, and improve efficiency. The ideal candidate will have significant experience: (1) scaling a partner sales org, (2) contributing to the growth and development of a sales operations team, (3) dealing with ambiguity and operating in a fast-growing environment, and (4) superior communication skills to drive collaboration with peers and support senior stakeholders.  You Will Collaborate with our Head of GTM Partnerships and GTM Partner Sales Ops to scale the business, while driving alignment with your Sales Ops peers and the rest of the Sales leadership organization to make sure the plans are aligned with regional and functional priorities Conduct and enable regular business reviews and resource planning Develop and execute initiatives designed to optimize sales team efficiency and productivity Create and manage operational processes such as target setting, forecasting, and budgeting Champion the operational and reporting needs of the organization by defining and prioritizing requirements while working closely with cross functional partners to identify solutions Monitor and report key performance indicators (KPIs), trends, and deliver prescriptive recommendations to drive efficiencies and scale across the org Proactively resolve data quality, process, and policy adherence issues Oversee implementation of enabling systems and tools, working closely with internal systems teams We’re Looking For Someone Who Has 8+ years of sales operations experience in a similar industry Familiarity with SFDC Understanding of the sales cycle and previous exposure to a GTM Partner or Alliances & Channels Sales orgs A passion for understanding systems of work, how to build them and how to improve them through both transformative and iterative approaches Strong problem solving and analytical ability, with a track record of “test & learn” demeanor Ability to multi-task and work in cross-functional, fast-paced environments with the pressure of multiple deadlines, multiple partners / vendors, and complexity Experience and desire for working in a start-up environment, developing business infrastructure, and energetically scaling a high-growth business Has strong analytical skills and a structured approach to solving unique business problems Nice To Haves Prior experience at a growth stage Internet or software company Experience description: We are looking for an enthusiastic, motivated individual with sales experience and a background in life sciences or engineering to join our sales team. The ideal candidate for this position possesses excellent technical and communications skills. The candidate will be able to understand the needs of researchers specializing in cardiovascular, neurological, and medical countermeasure research, help them develop customized solutions, and communicate the value of our line of our cutting-edge research instruments. Working as a EMKA Scientific Sales Specialist, you have outstanding people and organizational skills, and a desire to work in a small business environment with a focus on technology.  Candidates will be working out of our office located in Sterling, VA.  Primary responsibilities: Establishing and maintaining customers relations in life sciences laboratories Initiating contact with prospective customers Presenting, demonstrating, and providing written proposals to prospective customers and following up to close sales Understanding customer needs throughout and following the entire sales process Participating in the complete sales cycle Co-coordinating sales and support activities to ensure that clients are receiving the appropriate level of technical training and sales support Providing installing and training on-site or via video conferences Representing and promoting EMKA products at domestic and international conferences Travelling across North America (50%)  We offer: A wide variety of responsibilities and challenges A friendly team environment Exciting growth opportunities Competitive compensation and benefits   You possess: An interdisciplinary education that combines Life Sciences, Engineering or a related field A customer focused mindset with a solid understanding of value proposition selling A desire to foster long term relationships with customers Sales experience with scientific research equipment or related medical field The ability to rapidly learn highly technical information in a dynamic work environment A talent for explaining technical details in comprehensible terms The ability to work efficiently, both independently and in a team Effective networking skills across disciplines and cultures  Education/Qualifications Essential Successful completion of a university degree in the life sciences, engineering or a related degree Familiarity with the scientific research process (grant applications, conferences, publications) Proficient in English (written and spoken) Ability to travel on a regular basis Valid driver’s license  Assets: Master’s Degree in Biomedical Engineering or preclinical Life Sciences Knowledge of cardiovascular physiology or neurophysiology Prior technical sales or after-sales experience Other spoken languages (French or other)  Benefits Dental insurance Vision insurance Health insurance Short Term, Long Term, Disability, Life insurance 401K Paid vacations Flextime Profit Sharing to start in 2022 Sales Commissions  Job Type: Full-time Pay: $55,000.00 - $70,000.00 per year (based on experience)

Job Description Summary  Be part of something bigger!  Liberator Medical Supply™ (LMS) has been serving urology and ostomy customers for more than two decades. LMS is dedicated to providing high-quality, innovative medical supplies combined with exemplary customer service, discreet delivery of supplies and support with insurance paperwork and representation.  We have an immediate need for Purewick Sales Representatives in a virtual call center!  This is a 100% remote, work from home position!  In this role you will facilitate intake of new and reorder Purewick customer product orders from multiple lead/referral sources and enroll customers into Liberator’s supply program.  Job Description  In this role you will be responsible for: Articulate the features and benefits of the Purewick system including knowledge of all aspects of use and maintenance of the equipment. Complete initial and follow-up calls on prospective leads via inbound and outbound calls/dialer to include identifying and resolving customer concerns within the process Maintain departmental call volume requirements to include inbound and outbound calls Maintain a high level of professionalism on every call and provide excellent customer service to all Liberator Customers. Meet or exceed monthly departmental sales goals as established by Sales Ops management. Adhere to phone activity/compliance standards to include Medicare guidelines, HIPAA, ACW, and minimum call volumes. To Be Successful In This Role, You Require 1+ years medical industry, sales, collections or call center/customer service experience Ability to read, analyze, and interpret medical supply publications, technical procedures, and/or training tools. Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, and percentages. Ability to solve practical problems and deal with a variety of variables. Knowledge of Microsoft Office Applications Ability to work some evening shifts, weekends, and overtime as needed Education And Experience Required High School Diploma or general education degree (GED) We Offer a Comprehensive Benefits Package To Include Up to 12 company paid holidays Medical, dental and vision insurance 401(k) Tuition Reimbursement Access to the BD Healthy Lives Program, Employee Assistance Programs, and additional support resources! Why join us?  A career at BD means that you are part of a team that values your opinions and contributions and that empowers you to bring your authentic self to work. Here you can fulfill your life’s purpose through the work that you do every day.  You will learn and work alongside inspirational leaders and colleagues who are equally passionate and committed to fostering an inclusive, growth-centered, and rewarding culture. Our Total Rewards program — which includes competitive pay, benefits, continuous learning, recognition, career growth, and life balance components — is designed to support the varying needs of our diverse and global associates.  To learn more about Liberator Medical visit https://liberatormedical.com  Becton, Dickinson and Company is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. description: Sales Development Representative / Business Development Representative  Want to empower digital business through real-time analytics delivered as a service? Passionate about putting the power of machine data analytics in the hands of everyone by unifying all data types, enabling universal access and leveraging cloud economics – all this from a single, unified platform delivered and consumed as a service? Come talk with us!  Our Business Development Representatives are a key part of a Regional Sales team consisting of a Sales Manager and Mid-Market or Enterprise Account Executives. You will support all levels of the sales organization by finding new revenue opportunities that add to the total pipeline. You will foster relationships with Account Executives, Regional Sales Managers, and potential future customers.  What makes a Sales Development / Business Development Representative successful? We are a team of intuitive, passionate hunters looking for green-field opportunities within potential customers. And we like to have fun.  We have a demonstrated track record of providing growth opportunities to our SDR team members to transition down the AE track, Customer Success or Marketing.  What you'll be working on:  Prospect and generate leads with companies within a defined territory Leverage a modern lead generation tool stack, including Discover.org, Linkedin, ZoomInfo and Outreach Collaborate closely with Sales Managers and Account Executives to establish a territory "plan-of-attack", including target companies, target prospects, and messaging/talk-tracks Set up new meetings to hand off to our Account Executive teams Learn, leverage, and help evolve our demand generation process Qualify opportunities and handle objections Participate in regular training & informational sessions Achieve or exceed monthly quotas of Qualified Opportunities and Closed Business Conduct high-level conversations with Senior Executives in Target and Prospect Accounts Create, prioritize, and qualify strategic target account lists within a defined territory Research and build new and existing accounts (i.e. adding contacts, sending regular emails, coordinating strategic discovery meetings) Your experience and skills should include:  History of quota over-achievement Thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth, rapidly changing environment Bachelor’s degree These additional skills would be highly desirable: Previous experience in a lead generation role a plus SaaS experience a plus  This role is for talent looking to continue their career in sales. If you are naturally curious, a strong communicator, and have a hunger to learn, Sumo Logic is the place for you to launch your sales career! We offer our BDRs multiple career paths/opportunities in various lines of business at Sumo Logic.

jobTitle: Product Marketing and Sales Enablement Lead, Go-To-Market
description: Note: By applying to this position you will have an opportunity to share your preferred working location from the following: Mountain View, CA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; New York, NY, USA; Chicago, IL, USA.  Minimum qualifications: Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience 5 years of experience in marketing, sales, product management, or sales operations  Preferred qualifications: MBA degree or an advanced degree in Marketing Experience leading cross-functional projects, executing on project management, managing multiple priorities, and operating in ambiguous environments Experience working with sales teams and interacting with/influencing executives Ability to take initiative and identify/solve complex problems Excellent written and verbal communication and organizational skills  About The Job  The Global Ads Product Go-to-Market team partners with Global Product Leads (GPLs) and regional/channel go-to-market teams to influence Google’s ad product strategies and ensure successful activation by Google’s sales teams globally. The team works with executives across Google Ads Product Operations, Global Product Leads (GPL), Go-to-Market (GTM), and Sales functions, providing strategic intel, operations, and communications support. Our team partners with executive leadership to set up functions across the Google Ads product and delivers impact projects focused on product adoption and business growth opportunities.  In this role, you will lead our sales marketing, education, and enablement efforts to drive awareness, consideration, and adoption of business growth opportunities. You'll work with executive leadership across regions, partnering with Sales, GPL, and GTM to develop narratives, collateral, and resources to market and promote the value of programs.  You will work across a range of stakeholders, understanding and incorporating differing needs. You'll balance measurement of outcomes and partner to promote programs to our Sales organizations.  The Go-to-Market Operations (GtM) team ensures Google's complex and ever-evolving Ads business runs smoothly. We are instrumental in setting go-to-market strategy, and ensuring flawless execution and operations against the strategy. We have teams embedded in each of the major Ads business areas as well as global teams that work across the business areas. Team members are analytical and strategic, with a pragmatic sense of how to get things done.  Responsibilities  Lead branding and change management initiatives to improve the perception of business growth programs. Help sales teams understand how programs are evolving. Develop storylines, narratives, and resources. Leverage different approaches to drive adoption of opportunities across sales teams. Lead regular discussions with stakeholders in Sales to understand challenges, identify patterns and trends across the industry, and evolve strategies and approaches accordingly. Educate Global Product Leads and Go-to-Market executive stakeholders about the needs of sales teams, driving adoption and traction. Identify scaled ways to drive adoption by sharing best practices and success stories.  Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. See also Google's EEO Policy and EEO is the Law. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing our Accommodations for Applicants form .

NextEra Energy Resources is one of the largest wholesale generators of electric power and renewable energy from the wind and sun in North America.  Position Specific Description  EverBright is seeking a well-qualified candidate who is passionate about driving the clean energy revolution by building a best-in-class residential financing program. As an Business Development Representative at you will be responsible for prospecting new accounts, onboarding new prospective channel partners, and owning the sales process for new accounts. You will be asked to: Qualify leads and pitching prospective channel partners on the EverBright Program Perform outbound sales outreach to generate leads and schedule demos Project manage new prospects through the EverBright onboarding process and taking them through activation to become an active partner Work with the account management team to ensure a smooth transition from prospect to active partner Job Overview  This job is responsible for managing a designated territory and identifying and developing opportunities to sell energy products and services to large commercial, industrial, national and public sector customer segments. Employees in this role manage the on-going business relationship with assigned customer base by maintaining regular contact, promoting incremental products and services, resolving customer issues and renewing expiring contracts. This position is also responsible for implementing new plans and managing existing accounts to ensure retention and growth targets are achieved. Qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, age, national origin, religion, marital status, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetics, disability, protected veteran status or any other basis prohibited by law. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace.  If you require special support or accommodation while seeking employment with NextEra Energy, please send an e-mail to recruiting-coordinator.sharedmailbox@nexteraenergy.com , providing your name, telephone number and the best time for us to reach you. Alternatively, you may call 844-694-4748. Please do not use this line to inquire about your application status.  NextEra Energy will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. In a world increasingly focused on how humans can responsibly live within our environment, OTT is on the frontlines, creating the critical water and weather solutions that ensure a safer future for us all. By partnering with our customers around the world, we help detect floods, make solar power more efficient, protect the environment, and ultimately save lives.  Our collaborative, diverse team is made up of engineers and scientists, marketers and researchers; people who’ve been in the industry for decades or have just arrived with fresh ideas. We’re driven by a love of problem-solving and inventive thinking, and by the unique impact our customers make on people’s everyday lives. Bringing our global team together within our renowned brands affords us unsurpassed strength and expertise in meteorology and hydrology—and gives you the chance to build a meaningful career.  OTT HydroMet is proud to be one of Danaher's Water Quality companies. Motivated by the highest possible stakes of climate change and global health, we’re working together within a rapidly digitizing industry to find innovative technologies that guarantee the safety of our water and our environment.  About the Territory Sales Manager role:  The Territory Manager is responsible for the growth and expansion of direct sales and profit margins within the defined territory/region on products and/or services. Establishes professional relationships with key personnel in customer accounts. Meets assigned targets for profitable sales volume and margin dollars.  Territory Sales Manager will cover all of Florida. Qualified candidates may live anywhere in this territory Promotion and sales OTT HydroMet product lines to core customers and new accounts Participates in sales activities including customer site visits, telephone contacts, trade seminars and shows, product demonstrations/evaluations, customer seminars, and channel management. Ability to develop and execute a business plan and manage territory as one’s own business Demonstrate time & territory balance by executing planned activities to maximize time in the field with customers and prospects Engages stakeholders and internal resources to best serve customers Collects and reports information on all competitive activity, business opportunities, the voice of the customer, sales trends, and results within the assigned market providing input during monthly business review Uses metrics, KPI, and forecasting to self-manage productivity Develops, nurtures, and understands health of customer opportunity funnel and openly works with leadership and sales operations to ensure best results Ability to develop creative and strategic solutions. Report and manage all sales activities through our CRM (SalesForce.com) Prepares and presents a monthly funnel review utilizing SalesForce.com to demonstrate the quality of the funnel, activity plans, and command of the account base. 50% Travel activity Are you qualified? 5-10 years of direct B2B sales experience, preferably selling water quality, flow, discharge, telemetry, and data management software solutions to urban hydrologists/meteorologists, Federal Government Agencies, State agencies, and local/muni flood and storm water agencies A degree in a science-related field such as Biology, Environmental Science, Hydrological and Meteorological Studies, Engineering, or equivalent is an asset Must have a valid driver's license and acceptable driving record When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 69,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization. jobTitle: Entry Level Account Executive Sales Representative
description: ADP is hiring an Account Executive - Outside Sales. In this position, you'll identify and cultivate new prospects from relationships built with Bankers, Accountants, existing clients, as well as direct prospecting efforts. In addition you will cross-sell solutions to existing clients, and effectively close sales, with the support of exceptional sales training and the rewards of advancement opportunities and industry-leading compensation, benefits, incentive trips and awards. Unlock Your Career Potential: Sales at ADP. It takes a relentless team to lead an industry. ADP's world-class sales team is driving our global growth as a worldwide leader of workforce solutions. If you believe in the power of relationships, we'll give you the tools, training and support you need to connect with new and current customers, ranging from Fortune 100 corporations to small start-ups. And as you achieve success, you'll enjoy the rewards, support and recognition you deserve. At ADP we are driven by your success. We engage your unique talents and perspectives. We welcome your ideas on how to do things differently and better. In your efforts to achieve, learn and grow, we support you all the way. If success motivates you, you belong at ADP. We strive for every interaction to be driven by our CORE values: Insightful Expertise, Integrity is Everything, Service Excellence, Inspiring Innovation, Each Person Counts, Results-Driven, & Social Responsibility.  RESPONSIBILITIES:  Develop and execute a cold calling strategy to target prospects Mine existing clients for referral business Build mutually beneficial relationships with Bankers and Accountants Reach or exceed assigned sales goals Implement sales strategies Connect customers' business needs with ADP products and services Cross-sell other ADP solutions to existing clients Build network in person and via phone with key decision makers in a designated territory QUALIFICATIONS REQUIRED:  Bachelor's degree At ADP, we believe that diversity fuels innovation. Our diversity benefits our associates, clients, and our communities. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, non-job related physical or mental disability, or protected veteran status. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.  ADP is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer; M/F/D/V. ADP believes that diversity leads to strength.

If you are a Colorado resident and this role is a field-based or remote role, you may be eligible to receive additional information about the compensation and benefits for this role, which we will provide upon request.  You may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.  ** Anaplan experience highly-desired ** Sponsorship and/or relocation benefits are not available for this role.    In this role, you have the opportunity to:  Be part of a dynamic team that is driving the transformation around end-to-end sales planning and incentive compensation via Anaplan. Provide planning leadership for key projects, business integrations, and new capabilities through engagement with cross functional stakeholders to ensure alignment around future state requirements and internal resources to enable build, test, transformation and implementation activities. You will look for opportunities to optimize the platform structure based on the current state and future state roadmap. You will play a critical role in the development of key quality measures related to Compensation Plan modeling and Comp Expense analytics.  Additionally, you will build out processes of engagement to maintain model integrity and support decentralized functional user development and integration into the platform. You will play a key role in documenting platform architecture, maintaining work instructions and supporting training and knowledge transfer to platform users.  You are responsible for: Manage all aspects of aligned projects including requirements development, project plans, POC’s, development, delivery and training Assess risk points and drive mitigation Manage relationships with sales, operations, finance, HR, IT and other key stakeholders to maximize data integration and quality through Anaplan Maintain engagement with key stakeholders participating in relevant forums, share progress around planning and development and identify opportunities to leverage best practices Represent NA requirements and interests in broader forums to maximize capabilities and support development milestones Provide leadership for development resources to deliver on time and maintain model integrity and manage size limitations Assess expansion opportunities and initiatives and develop the business case for review and approval with appropriate stakeholders (sales and operations leadership, IT, HR, Finance) Participate in deep dive planning / kaizen forums where necessary to solution / optimize key areas Provide oversight for daily management of the platform Engage partners as needed to deliver solutions / fixes Develop and deliver platform quality metrics Support compliance efforts and management practices as appropriate  You are a part of You will be a key member of the Sales Operations Organization and laying the groundwork for future state planning excellence.  To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience Experience with Anaplan or development in other similar platforms Highly analytical with a passion and curiosity for solving complex problems through data analysis Experience defining and building out Comp expense modeling and forecasting capabilities Strong planning skills Experience with sales operations activities – territory management, quota deployment, resource optimization, forecasting, compensation Track record of delivering effective complex planning and project management execution Strong communication / presentation skills Ability to operate and succeed in a highly matrixed organization    Why should you join Philips?  Working at Philips is more than a job, it is a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video. To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.  It is the policy of Philips to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, pregnancy/childbirth, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran or military status or a person’s relationship or association with a protected veteran, including spouses and other family members, marital or domestic partner status, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws. As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants that require accommodation in the job application process may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.  Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran

If you have ever wanted to get in early and play a critical client-facing role for a rapidly growing new product partnership, this is the opportunity you have been looking for! Control Risks - a trusted team of the best political and security analysts, has teamed up with Geospark Analytics - a SaaS platform powered by AI. Together we are creating the most exciting technology and tools for predictive security analytics on the market. Our partnership is already growing fast, and we need motivated and determined sales professionals to reach our goals. Control Risks and Geospark Analytics are looking for an exceptional person to join our Sales team and work directly with leading commercial organizations to help them achieve success. You will be responsible for feeding the sales pipeline by identifying and developing new sales leads for Online Solutions Team.    Location: Preferably in Houston, New York, Los Angeles or Washington DC where there are Control Risks / Geospark Analytics offices, but alternative options accommodated due to remote working Requirements: The ideal candidate will quickly become an expert in generating, prospecting and qualifying leads, arguably the most important components of the sales process. This role is an excellent opportunity to prove yourself in a fast-paced sales environment in a growing SaaS environment with an enormous opportunity for career growth. We are looking for a candidate that is a fast learner, has an intense passion for creating lasting relationships, and an ability to learn, excel and adapt with our growing company. If that sounds exciting and rewarding keep reading.    Tasks and Responsibilities  Research target leads utilizing ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and other prospecting tools Qualify and engage sales leads, supplying leads with information that is relevant to succeeding in their role Effectively communicate with prospective customers by telephone, email, and online social networking tools to better identify opportunities Coordinate and participate in video conference calls and demos with potential clients and partners. Work collaboratively with the Sales and Marketing teams to develop and strengthen the pipeline. Consistently hit and exceed goals by identifying opportunities, developing prospecting techniques, and qualifying leads at an exceptional pace and quality. Engage in ongoing training programs to strengthen sales methodology, skills set, and product pitch. Consistently and reliably maintain all relevant sales activity data and results within client management systems. Strive for and achieve growth milestones to advance career    Knowledge and Experience  Passionate about technology and changing the world Self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit and ability to work independently Flexible and adaptive to change with the ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment A proven track record delivering results and increasing pipeline 1-3 years' experience in prospecting and development role (SaaS preferred Excellent listening, written and verbal communication skills with great attention to detail Experience working with CRM platforms (Microsoft Dynamics and/or HubSpot CRM experience preferred)

Want to help the world’s biggest companies solve their biggest technology challenges? At CDM Media, that’s what we do, by bringing the brightest minds in technology together to discuss, create, and problem-solve the next wave of innovations and incredible technologies that will change the way companies do business.  Technology is rapidly changing not only the tech sector but every industry globally. Light bulbs are now “smart”. Banking is done on phones and watches. Your laundry detergent can reorder itself. Seem like magic? It’s not. It’s technology, and the world’s biggest companies are all reimaging themselves as technology companies to keep pace. CDM Media sits at the intersection of the technology executives and the technology solution providers who work together to make “magic” into reality.  Our live events/summits, virtual gatherings, digital marketing services, VIP dinners, and other custom marketing services let C-Level executives cut through the noise and get down to business. If you want to be a part of the fastest-growing sector of the global economy, on the cutting edge of the next wave of game-changing technologies, and spend your days speaking to the most successful and brilliant executives in their fields, you've come to the right place.  The Role  You will be working directly with our Sales Director and SVP Sales to drive the direction and growth of your portfolio of clients. You’ll spend your time creating sponsorship opportunities and growing relationships with the movers and shakers of some of the biggest companies in the world such as IBM, Oracle, Salesforce, Google, Amazon.  We need people that are fired-up about creating high-end qualified sales opportunities, and constantly on the hunt for ways to improve themselves and the team around them. If you’re ready to get after it, we want to talk to you ASAP.  Responsibilities  Drive sales growth by finding and engaging qualified prospects via LinkedIn, phone, email and an array of technology tools  Connect with and quickly develop relationships with key Senior Management contacts and prospects within the technology vendor space  Collaborate with marketing and sales on lead quality and conversion  Perfect and articulate CDM’s Value Proposition  Build a pipeline and execute on early stages of the sales process  Create and prioritize strategic target account lists  Use various sales tools and methods to identify decision makers within the target account lists  Achieve and dominate your quotas  Outbound ZOOM demo calls along with running targeted email campaigns  Requirements  You have business development, account management, professional sales development experience  You have real determination and grit to make opportunities a reality  You have or want experience with prospecting and cold calling  You have clear written/verbal communication skills  You have strong presentation skills and are confident, both on the phone and in person  You are motivated and goal oriented with a self-starting attitude  You can work in a fast paced, team environment  You have good time management with strong organizational skills  You want to build a successful sales career  You know and understand that failure is a part of every success  SalesForce experience is a plus  CDM Media Offers You  Competitive salary + Commission  Health/dental insurance  Up to 25 days paid personal vacation each year  401(k) plan  Summer holiday hours  Life and disability insurance for all staff  We welcome you to learn more about CDM Media at the following links:  About: http://www.cdmmedia.com/about.php  CDM Media in three words: https://youtu.be/z5Bs5iLo_ig  Summits & client testimonials: http://www.youtube.com/user/ciosummits  Travel with CDM Media: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hLjPvfgK2TE  CDM Media culture: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wtsEAkp_noQ&feature=youtu.be  CDM Media is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. CDM Media is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.
