It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing! We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.  The Mid-Market Sales Executive is a dynamic role that is responsible for leading the end to end sales cycle for clients in the Southeast Region. This individual is responsible for identifying, qualifying and nurturing prospects; building trust, uncovering compelling events and presenting Kyriba’s unique business value with the goal of securing new subscription business in our Software-as-a-Service business model.  Prospects are identified through marketing campaigns as well as direct prospecting efforts from the Sales Executive. Interaction with the prospect involves comprehensive discussions surrounding their current Treasury operations to identify their current situation, problems and pain all while positioning Kyriba’s unique business value and solution for the mid-market sector.  Essential Duties and Responsibilities:  Educate contacts through comprehensive discussions surrounding their current Treasury operations and Kyriba’s product offerings applicable to the mid-market space Become fluent with value proposition messaging and be able to articulate our unique business value in a consultative sale Understand where the prospect is in the buying process and qualify accordingly Nurture non-qualified prospects by offering resources and educational materials Follow-up on inquiries from marketing campaigns, online ads, events and webinars Perform high volume outbound calling activities combined with e-mail marketing Gather key information to update SalesForce.com in order to effectively prospect specified territory Enhance product knowledge through regularly scheduled training sessions and self-education Become part of a very collaborative team in terms of training and sharing education, and best practices Manage and deliver quarterly revenues with accurate forecasting of the pipeline and full transparency through the status of opportunities Curate and build your own book of business based off of defined territory, with the goal of exceeding quarterly targets and owning the sales process Recommend product or service enhancements to improve customer satisfaction and sales potential    Education, Experience and Skills:           Bachelors Degree required 5 years of Software Sales or Business Development experience preferred Experience selling into back office finance preferred Highly successful track record in prospecting Ability to handle high outbound call volume with corresponding high talk time Must be articulate, organized, detail-oriented, and have the ability to multitask in a dynamic, fast-changing entrepreneurial environment Ability to learn complex Treasury concepts and incorporate into daily interactions and conversations Ability to build rapport with prospects and transition inquiries over time to the sales force Strong phone, customer service, and interpersonal skills Understand the customer’s environment and introduces new concepts to solve the customer’s problems Effective listener to understand prospect needs Ability to effectively communicate and advocate with internal stakeholders Ability to travel 20% of the time  Kyriba Culture and Values: At Kyriba, we value a strong work culture and sense of community and ownership among our global team. We live by our “iCare” value system to demonstrate our care and commitment to our clients and to each other. In hiring, we look for candidates that are a strong fit with our culture and values, as well as bring the talent and experience required by the position.  Innovation: We foster innovation and entrepreneurial thinking across our team by rewarding employees for their achievements and encouraging efficiency and continual process improvement. Client Success: Our passion is to enable our clients’ success. We do this by understanding their needs, and developing and managing solutions that provide them the insight to effectively drive decision making within their organizations. Accountability: We each take personal responsibility for our actions. We are committed to our own continuous improvement and we go the extra mile to meet our clients' needs. Respect: We respect each other’s ideas, efforts and commitments, and embrace our diverse cultures and points of view. We achieve our goals through teamwork, responsiveness, open communication and a positive attitude. Excellence: We strive for excellence in all that we do and bring the passion and commitment to deliver on our promises. We achieve excellence through leadership, teamwork, transparency and integrity, and we are committed to recognizing employee achievements.  Kyriba believes that everyone has the ability to make an impact, and we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to providing employment opportunity regardless of sex, race, creed, color, gender, religion, marital status, domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, pregnancy, military or veteran status, citizenship status, and genetic information.

jobTitle: RVP of Sales and Brand Partnerships - Central
description: InMobi Mission:  We help brands understand, identify, engage and acquire consumers.   Title: RVP of Sales and Brand Partnerships - Central Location:   Chicago   Position Summary:   Reporting to the VP of North America (NA) Sales, this role is responsible for developing and growing InMobi’s agency and brand relationships in North America in the Midwest Region. This senior role will work collaboratively across disciplines to craft our go-to-market strategy and execution plan that amplifies InMobi’s brand while developing deeper strategic engagement and partnerships across key HC’s and agencies, clients, and DSP account teams in support of InMobi’s product and revenue objectives.   As the VP of Agency & Brand Partnerships Midwest you will lead a team of 8-10 sales professionals You will be comfortable selling both media and technology solutions as well as data, insights, research and creative. This role will require senior level relationships at clients and brands and the ability to sell through at the most senior levels.   What will you bring?  Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience   Minimum of 10+ years’ experience in digital media space, preferably with a focus on creating partnerships with Ad Age Top 200 advertisers and their agencies and DSPs  Experience in digital advertising, enterprise solutions, online media buying and advertising technologies  Experience in senior-level technical stakeholder relationship management, translating their business needs into innovative technology solutions   Experience working with cross-functional teams and building relationships across internal teams   Demonstrated strategic and analytical sales and account management approach   Strong organizational and negotiation skills, with the ability to multi-task   Passionate team player with a sense of humor and desire to win with, and for, the team  Proven People Manager with ability to hire and train rock star sellers   How will you lead?  Manage a team of sellers in the Midwest focused on hunting large customers and growing revenue from our large partnerships.  Build and foster long term senior relationships with global /regional agency leaders and decision makers that includes the end-to-end customer relationship for their revenue, tech and data needs.  Build and foster long term relationships with brands directly  Lead efforts in structuring, drafting, and negotiating agency and brand incentive plans focused to win and grow share of spend  Drive thought leadership/strategic thinking by partnering with key internal stakeholders e.g. product, marketing, DSP, and Exchange leaders   Partner with Vertical Strategy leads to develop pitch and win business across all target categories- CPG, Pharma, QSR, Entertainment, Auto, Telco, Finance, Insurance  Lead best in class sales practices and trainings to enable teams with the best tools and solutions in the market   What does InMobi do?       InMobi is one the largest Independent Adtech players globally with a record of accomplishment for innovation, customer-centricity and a privacy-first approach.  We have been recognized on both 2018 and 2019 CNBC disruptor 50 list and as one of Fast Company’s 2018 Most Innovative Companies.    We have diversified revenue across several different B2B and B2C lines of business on a global scale. The North America market is our largest global market, and where our largest clients and publisher partners are based.        What is the InMobi family like?  Our culture is our true north, enabling us to think big, solve complex challenges and grow with new opportunities. InMobians are passionate and driven, creative and fun-loving, take ownership and are results focused. Your work is visible, and you have an opportunity to make a real impact on a large organization.   You will work with a very capable and ambitious peer group, who will welcome you with open heart and will go the extra mile to make you successful. We believe that learning is a lifelong commitment, so we invest significantly in your development using internal and external resources.           Award-winning culture, best-in-class benefits      Competitive salary, bonus, and stocks      Quality medical, vision, dental      401(k)      Flexible working hours      Wellness stipend      Healthy time off through a combination of PTO, sick days, and company-wide holidays      A friendly, supportive working family to call your team.      $400 to set up your own home office to thrive in a post COVID world  Post-covid hybrid work model for employees close to our offices in New York, San Francisco, Irvine, and Kansas City       InMobi is an equal opportunity employer      InMobi is a place where everyone can grow. So however you identify and whatever background you bring with you, we invite you to apply if this sounds like a role that would make you excited to get to work every day.  InMobi provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

We currently have an opportunity for a Sales Associate for the Barracuda Championship, the PGA TOUR event in Reno, NV. This position will directly contribute to the sales efforts of the tournament by generating revenue via hospitality, pro-am and sponsorship sales.  QUALIFICATIONS Bachelors degree in Business, Communications, Sales, Marketing or other related field preferred. Minimum of two years of corporate business experience required. Prior experience in the sports industry with exposure to event management or event sales preferred. Experience in team sales or hospitality sales a plus. Exposure to ticketing computer system is also preferred. Must possess strong Microsoft Office skills to include mail merges and intermediate level Excel and PowerPoint skills. Extremely coachable and eager to learn every day. Disciplined self-starter. Highly motivated individuals with a strong desire to build a career in the sports business. Flexible schedule to include evenings and weekends as needed. Able to safely operate a utility vehicle such as, but not limited to, golf carts, utility carts, and shuttle carts.  RESPONSIBILITIES/DUTIES Enter all current and prospective clients contact information into CRM and update daily with progress. Builds sponsorship and hospitality proposals for sales team as needed. Generate the internal revenue and inventory reports and validate the data to ensure that all sales are captured accurately. Assist with the post-sale process to include: invoicing, client relations, merchandising/inventory control, etc. This position will be responsible for a heavy volume of sales calls and meetings with a focus on new business. Management of tournament membership group, including annual renewals and new memberships. Assist the Marketing department with the development and execution of the tournament marketing plan. Act as the primary point of contact on-site to execute components of the marketing and promotions programs. Assist with the development of sales collateral for the tournament.   During tournament week, interact with clients to ensure all of their needs are met, prospect new clients, assist to secure repeat purchases, and conduct fan surveys as requested. Works with various internal departments to assist in managing lead generation and referrals between groups. Generates Marketing and Hospitality Agreements and coordinates such efforts between client, sales lead and respective legal contracts (internal and external). Liaises with Ticketing group on steps related to processing and fulfillment of completed hospitality deals. Assists sales team in A/R process. Supports sales team and TSM’s in coordinating sponsorship deliverables. Executes small package sales and Group Sales on an as-needed basis. Special Projects and other duties as assigned.

JBS Marketing & Sales is looking for a full-time sales rep based in Dallas to independently manage several accounts in our territory which covers primarily Texas and Oklahoma. The qualified candidate will be expected to travel to customers several times throughout the year, meet with buyers and vendors, and successfully manage relationships between the customer and vendors we represent. Offices are located in Dallas, TX.  Managing the relationship entails: Detailed knowledge of the vendor catalog and specific items carried with each customer Troubleshooting customer concerns and problems that may arise as it pertains to shipping, pricing, new item set ups, etc. Become knowledgeable about customer stores and ecommerce strategies (merchandising, layout, review schedules, etc..) Understand the competitive landscape within our sales channels – Military, Craft & Hobby, and Grocery Taking buyer meetings to review and discuss new products as well as optimize the current catalog of items Work closely with your vendor sales manager to ensure each customer’s needs are being met in a timely fashion  Salaried position + Annual Bonus  Health Insurance  Flexible work schedule

Be part of our Sales Incubator company that helps brands sell to the world's largest retailers. The ideal candidate will be responsible for overseeing the success of all sales and marketing strategies. This candidate will be knowledgeable about the market and our competitive advantages in order to best recommend new sales strategies for success.   Responsibilities Foster new business relationships and manage existing relationships Recommend sales strategies for improvement based on market research and competitor analyses Conduct budget reviews to ensure sales and marketing activities are within budget Attend industry trade events along with networking opportunities and other relevant meetings  Qualifications Bachelor's degree or equivalent 5+ years' relevant experience Experience working with Salesforce.com or similar CRM

At Cranial Technologies we're not just reshaping heads, we're reshaping lives. Our number one priority is our patients and their families. Families choose us because of the different kind of experience we offer through exceptional customer service, superior outcomes using the DOC BandÂ® and a passion for the babies we treat.  This position is responsible for generating referrals from the medical community to our local clinics by calling on pediatric practices and promoting the use of the DOC BandÂ® for the treatment of plagiocephaly.  Responsibilities Call on pediatric practices to provide education to the pediatrician and staff in the diagnosis, management, and treatment of plagiocephaly. Promote the use of Cranial Technologies and the DOC Band for the treatment of plagiocephaly, brachycephaly and scaphocephaly. Provide up to date medical research and patient literature to pediatric practices. Conduct in-service presentations within the pediatric practice to educate all levels of staff, including: pediatricians, nurse practitioners, personal assistants, referral coordinators and front office staff. Represent Cranial Technologies and the DOC Band at medical conferences and exhibitions. Manage the assigned physicians in your territory efficiently and effectively. Maintain a current and accurate database of physicians within your territory. Complete all reports by the time/date specified. Represent Cranial Technologies professionally and ethically. Establish the need for the DOC Band and Cranial Technologies services within the physical therapy community, State and private hospitals and other medical related areas. Function as part of the Clinical Representative team. Function as part of the team within the clinic. Requirements Bachelor's Degree Minimum of 2 years successful business-to-business outside sales experience. Prefer 1 year of medical/healthcare or referral-based sales. Strong initiative and drive to build your own territory. Ability to learn quickly and apply concepts in different situations. Ability to work well without daily supervision. Benefits Package For Cranial Technologies Medical and Dental Insurance 401k Retirement Plan 3.5 Weeks Paid Time Off Life Insurance Short/Long Term Disability Insurance NOTE: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as negotiated to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.  You will receive a confirmation email stating your application has been submitted. Once your application has been reviewed, you should receive an update on your status via email. Please keep an eye on your spam and junk mail. Please no phone calls regarding the position.  If you are unable to submit your application, please email the recruiting department at careers@cranialtech.com for assistance.

jobTitle: Director of Sales for Distribution Company
description: Director of Sales for Distribution Company  Company Overview: At GMI Trading, we strive to meet the highest standards for procurement and distribution of groceries. With broad expertise in import and distribution of Russian and European products, in the last 5 years we are expending the offerings to cover imports form Middle East, Asia as well as include many domestic products to create a more diverse product portfolio.   Job Duties and Responsibilities: Director of Sales in the Distribution Company is responsible for defining and executing on growth strategies focused on expansion of territories and growth of customer base across all sales channels (B2B & Wholesale, Local and Key Accounts, E-Com). This position works closely with executive team to grow the business, build new vendor and customer relationships, expand territories and service areas, and increase number of accounts and their net margins.  Director of Sales is expected to: Assist in development and implement growth strategy for our distribution business Create sales team and implement best practices to efficiently grow sales across all trade channel. Participate in definition and execution of a competitive sale strategy to win business against competition. Foster new and expand existing relationships with vendors. Build sales team capability and improve efficiency. Implement KPI and goal-driven remuneration structure Cultivate hunters and gatherers to bring new and improve existing accounts Structure work and reporting following the sales funnel Create the integration with supporting functions to better meet the demand Streamline product offerings to balance capacity, demand, diversity and margin ratios. Become spokesperson for GMI Trading brand and work closely with Marketing team to promote it. Develop and implement strategy to maximize revenue growth. Establish and nurture relationships with the executive team and buyers. Understand key objectives, challenges and opportunities for NetCost Market. Implement marketing and sales initiatives. Formulate campaign plans that will maximize profits; negotiate campaign terms with affiliate decision makers that result in favorable return of investment outcomes. Ensure that all Distribution Center employees understand key features of NetCost Market products and how to present them during a customer interaction. Conduct in-person and remote product training for employees. Work with internal departments to develop customized training tools and support training plans. Develop and implement NetCost Market product sales incentives. Create materials and training presentations to drive performance. Troubleshoot affiliate environment, market conditions, and competitive situations to meet or exceed goals. Track revenue results and forecasts of each assigned business unit to ensure revenue growth goals are achieved and exceeded. Maintain customer databases and orders for marketing materials distribution. Consistently demonstrate leadership and teamwork. Provide clear and concise updates to team, sharing findings, best practices and information that the team may find helpful. Continually develop new ideas to improve business performance. Utilize and understand information of the marketplace, affiliate business initiatives, competitive activities, and available resources to derive business plans. Create and execute business plans as part of the overall company and division growth strategies.  Minimum Qualifications: Deal Closer Minimum 6 years in a lead role in Distribution and Distributor Development; Sales & Management is a plus Exceptional communication and organizational skills; Russian language is a plus Computer savvy, knowledge of MSFT Office (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint , etc.); SAP / SAP-B1 is a plus Ability to travel 75% Bachelor’s degree; Master’s degree is a plus

Avant-garde Health enables hospitals and physicians to understand and improve their care processes, costs, and outcomes by utilizing technology and data analytics. We are a mission-driven business that grows out of the value-based health care research at Harvard Business School. We are backed by General Catalyst, Founder Collective, and Tectonic Ventures. We are working with 60% of the top hospitals in the country. Our solution is offered on a subscription basis (SaaS) and our customer net promoter score is +92.  We want you to join us in transforming health care delivery for decades to come. We’re excited to hire a person who wants to drive sales for a health tech venture-backed startup. This person will work closely with the CEO and executive leaders on our go-to-market efforts. As we scale the business, this role would involve building out a team.  In this role, you will be responsible for connecting with physicians and C-Suite executives. This is primarily a hunter role, which involves building new relationships and working through a highly consultative sales process. As you add clients, a portion of your time would be further cultivating these relationships to expand within these organizations.  Key Responsibilities Generate sales opportunities entrepreneurially with hospitals, surgery centers, and health systems. Lead client engagements from prospecting to qualification and deal closure through our high-touch, consultative sales process involving physicians and administrative leaders. Help us refine and further flesh out our go-to-market playbook. Utilize your knowledge to provide input on our business and product strategy, and direction.  Skills & Qualifications Bachelors Degree is required. A relevant advanced degree is preferred.  Success leading highly consultative complex sales to hospitals and health systems, preferably as a mix of software and services, and ideally involving analytics. Very entrepreneurial and excited to be self-reliant working in a fast-moving startup. The ideal person will have a broad network of relationships with senior hospital/health system executives and/or surgical department chairs. Creative, adaptable, and a committed learner--we are not looking for someone who feels like they already have all the answers.
industries: Hospital & Health Care and Information Technology and Services

description: Who Are We?  Here at Arrow we have built an all-in-one platform that makes it easier and smoother for the salesperson to get their job done and allows them to have the option to close deals over their phone.  There is a shift in the mindset of the heavy equipment industry (an  acceptance and intrigue) around technology and how it should be helping them to close deals more efficiently, whilst also being an enjoyable process and we are confident that Arrow is the new way to close deals!  Arrow is seeking an ambitious Sales Development Representative (SDR) to join our growing team!  As an SDR at Arrow, you will build your sales experience through B2B prospecting and continuous hands-on training with our management team!   Responsibilities:  Research customers, identify decision makers, and educate prospects. Create clear communication through prospecting via phone, networking, e-mail. Create a high quantity of qualified sales opportunities. Qualify leads through research and analysis, and schedule partnership opportunities for our Business Development Managers. Contribute directly to the rapid growth of Arrow and our sales team  Highlights:  Work from anywhere in the world (not exaggerating). Great medical benefits. Unlimited PTO. Competitive Base Salary On Day 1 (we are investing in you).  The "Best Fit" Person Will:  Embrace the opportunity to work for a startup.  Look forward to taking direct responsibility for your work and having an impact in a fast-growth organization. Be flexible and dedicated to get the job done. Have high energy, passionate and competitive. Be inquisitive, innovative and coachable.   Purpose & People of Arrow  Core Purpose To build an essential and sustainable living, breathing organization. We build tools to help people live more impactfully by unlocking their potential. We thrive on challenges that start with: “I’m not sure if this is possible, but I wish I could…” We are uniquely positioned to design and build user-focused products, we seek direct feedback from clients, and we deliver data-driven improvements to solve complex problems in a repeatable and scalable way. We believe that getting more done with less effort allows you to invest more time doing more of what you enjoy in life.  The People of Arrow... Want our products to have a meaningful impact. Believe all activities should deliver an optimal return on our collective efforts. Are ruthlessly efficient and constantly reprioritized. Assume good intentions. We will be kind and painfully honest. Write out ideas, strategies and plans to be read by and debated on their merit. Always reverse engineer the clearly defined definition of success. Identify the “right long-term path” but ride momentum. Expect best in the world outcomes. Only play where we have a comparative advantage to win. Have autonomy and control over your calendar. Believe that design and an intuitive customer experience are a competitive advantage. Are ok making mistakes, just not the same mistake twice. Work smart...then hard. Understand that the workload will be uneven. Question leadership until you understand and clarify priorities. Understand small groups are better at solving hard problems than large groups. Understand this business will change, the goal of value creation will not. Don’t borrow from tomorrow, as it will always leave you broke today. Understand what you do is your brand, if your name is on it, be proud of the work you have done or the work isn’t done yet. Don't pre-solve future problems (focus on first-order problems). Understand inputs drive outputs…focus on the small steps to create value. Are comfortable being uncomfortable, stretch yourself in the goal of value creation.  We care a lot about “Who” our employees really are.  We want to find people who want to Create value for themselves and our customers, Grow personally, and Enjoy playfully building along the way.   Arrow provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.

About Us  Oblong is delivering the future of work with Mezzanine™ — a groundbreaking collaborative conference room solution that is already changing the way groups of people meet and work, in the same room or across distances. We need top-notch, lifelong learners who are excited to share ideas and solve challenging problems that will help shape the future of collaborative work.  The Mezzanine team at Oblong has an opening for a Sales Development Representative to support Account Managers/Executives to acquire new business by going outbound to generate qualified opportunities. This is an exciting opportunity to be a key contributor in the evolution of the sales organization as we scale our team.  Ideal Candidates: An ideal candidate would be in Austin, TX as we will be opening a local Austin office (we have an additional office in Los Angeles) as part of our effort to both design and implement the office of the future. To be successful at Oblong, you will need a flexible growth mindset that embraces teamwork and collaboration to win. As our product evolves, you will need to be comfortable with visionary selling methods. As a Sales Development Representative, you'll be responsible for owning the top of the sales funnel qualifying inbound leads to prospecting outbound opportunities. You will be the first line of communication to potential customers about how Mezzanine can deliver value above and beyond contemporary meeting services.  Responsibilities  · Drives sales volume via outbound cold calls and emails to generate leads  · Contact and Qualify Marketing Leads for Account Managers/Executives  · Execute on established sales methodology to push beyond gatekeepers to reach the right people at the right time in the right way to provide the right information to create opportunities  · Generate opportunities using our technology stack (Salesforce, SalesLoft)  · Documenting and seamlessly handing off prospects to Account Managers/Executives to create a positive customer experience  · Conduct Prospect research to maintain up-to-date records of contact and account information within the CRM (Salesforce)  · Draw upon your personal experience and knowledge to assess complex business structures and challenges, identify and obtain information that is critical to the sale, and create clear next steps to guide the customer in the sales process  · Contributing to other sales projects on an as-needed basis    · Bachelor's degree and/or equivalent industry experience in sales  · 2+ years of sales or relevant customer-facing experience  · Aptitude to learn and continue to develop and master your sales skills  · Tenacity to keep pushing to achieve or exceed goals  · Excellent communication, organizational, time-management and prioritization skills  · Comfortable with high volume of outbound cold calls (65-80 calls per day)  · Proven ability to work collaboratively and constructively as part of a team  · Great phone and Web conferencing demeanor and professionalism.  · Familiar with CRM and Sales Engagement tools  Additive Qualifications  · Experience with Hardware and SaaS  · Experience working in the AV/IT Industry  · Experience working within partner ecosystems  Additional information Benefits and Perks  · Competitive compensation package  · Amazing insurance with the premium fully paid for you and your dependents on our medical, dental, vision plans. We also provide disability and life insurance.  · Unlimited PTO policy  · Excellent Work/Life balance  · 401K plan with match    All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, disability, national origin, veteran status, marital status, and any other status protected by federal, state, or local law.    PM21    PI147793688

jobTitle: Sales Category Management Analyst - West Division
description: Auto req ID: 247032BR  Job Description  We are PepsiCo Sales. We are game changers, mountain movers and history makers. We are a diverse group, spread among 200 countries and united by a shared set of values and goals. That’s why we Win with Purpose. Together, we blaze new trails, succeed, celebrate and never settle for second best. At PepsiCo, we’re committed to performing well as individuals and in teams, to strengthen the company as a whole.  Are you hungry to be a part of the World’s largest portfolio of billion-dollar food and beverage brands? Then now is the time to explore the opportunities of PepsiCo: what makes you unique makes us better. Location Flexibility: the role can sit anywhere in California. Preferred locations are also other primary, West Division locations as well. This position will be part of the North America Beverage organization.  This position contributes to the success of the Pepsi Beverages Company by Category Management and Space guidance for Large Format and Small Format customers to drive incremental space, volume and share gains. Accountable for providing data to local leadership to help drive Large Format and Small Format store sales Accountable for reset schedule coordination among all vendors for assigned accounts Continual analysis post-in-store reset to evaluate volume trends Ownership of performance reporting and scorecarding Support IRI analytics and analysis for immediate peer group Conduct SKU optimization analyses Lead and develop category insights for regional customers and channels Provide support in the development of insights to the assigned retail customers to support selling initiatives, and gain alignment of major initiatives at multiple levels of the organization Work closely supporting Category and Customer Leadership Teams in creating insightful consumer/shopper customer-specific selling stories leveraging all available selling materials and enablers provided by HQ and available in industry publications Partner with local leadership to develop analysis and insights to maximize sales trends for all assigned customers Collaborate with category/sales team in the areas of category and shopper Insights, assortment optimization, merchandising excellence and clustering initiatives Conduct post-promotion analyses quantifying the impact on brand and category Assess trends, analyze data and identify key opportunities to help build strategic business plans Share account-specific trends & insights with all levels of the organization/sales teams Be an expert on data – Syndicated Data (IRI), Panel Data, Internal Sales Data, etc. Qualifications/Requirements Previous CPG field industry experience High level of analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skills as well as great attention to detail Working knowledge of syndicated data via IRI and/or Nielsen Understanding of Consumer Data via Panel, Spectra, Shopper Sights, etc. Understanding of Planogramming software, JDA/Intactix preferred Organization, communication and follow-up skills Ability to manage multiple priorities, deadlines and deliverables Teamwork skills and motivation to work effectively across functions collaboratively, as well as, independently Proficiency with PowerPoint and Excel, and able to utilize critical formulas and/or macros in Excel Willing to travel up to 10% of the time during peak periods This position is limited to persons with indefinite right to work in the United States Must have a valid driver's license Safe driving record strongly preferred Relocation Eligible: Not Eligible for Relocation  Job Type: Regular  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.  PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity  Our Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, and all other applicable laws, including but not limited to, San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901 - 4919, commonly referred to as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance; and Chapter XVII, Article 9 of the Los Angeles Municipal Code, commonly referred to as the Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.  If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents. jobTitle: Regional Vice President - Sales Meritain Health - Washington, Seattle
description: Job Description  Sales Vice President in Seattle, WA. to drive profitable membership growth in the self-funded market. Develops strategy, distribution, and collaboration with local market Aetna teams to target clients who prefer a TPA value proposition.  The Sales Executive is responsible for new sales growth for Meritain Health, an Aetna Company in their local market.  Meritain targets customers who prefer to self-fund their benefits plan using a customization third-party administrator model. *we are only able to consider candidates with prior insurance (Health - self funded ideally) sales experience at this time.  Lead all Meritain sales efforts to solve complex benefit challenges using customized self-funded solutions.  Works through the external broker community to promote and develop the Meritain brand in the local market.  Establish local market partnerships with Aetna sales teams and sales leaders to maximize the Aetna distribution channel. Identify products, services, and strategies that solve challenges for TPA clients. Assist with strategic planning, budgeting and forecasting process.  Required Qualifications  Sales professional (Independent Contributor) who help build our business in the Middle Market, distribution channel, group insurance and specialty products areas. Sales Executive goal is to meet customer needs and help them make better decisions and about their health care and health care spending.  Develops and cultivates strong relationships with key constituents (producers, plan sponsors and/or consumers depending on business) to maximize sales opportunities and achieve profitable growth.  Oversees a block of business or may develop new business opportunities to ensure profitable customers and help grow the business through consultative selling, issue resolution and superior service.  Ensures product, pricing and services meet client's needs while meeting Aetna revenue growth and profit objectives.  Manages and builds producer relations as needed depending on book of business or market segment  being supported.  Identifies various ways to partner with the client by drawing from entire spectrum of product line illustrating a keen understanding of client's multifaceted needs and benefits of Aetna's full product array.  Collaborates with internal partners and/or external constituents to uncover profitable growth and cross-sell opportunities within new or existing customers and to support post-sale activities.  Coordinates sales materials, testimonials and subject matter expert involvement in support of the successful delivery of constituent presentations.  May participate in constituent meetings including finals presentations.  Develops/maintains and communicates expertise on products, industry and emerging marketplace trends.  COVID Requirements  COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement  CVS Health requires its Colleagues in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated. If you are vaccinated, you are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status within the first 30 days of your employment. For the two COVID-19 shot regimen, you will be required to provide proof of your second COVID-19 shot within the first 60 days of your employment. Failure to provide timely proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status will result in the termination of your employment with CVS Health. If you are unable to be fully vaccinated due to disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief, you will be required to apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 30 days of your employment in order to remain employed with CVS Health. As a part of this process, you will be required to provide information or documentation about the reason you cannot be vaccinated. If your request for an accommodation is not approved, then your employment may be terminated. Preferred Qualifications  Sales/Delivering on the Promise  Service/Demonstrating Service Discipline  Sales/Selling Products and Services  Sales/Cultivating Distribution Channels  Leadership/Collaborating for Results  General Business/Demonstrating Business and Industry Acumen  Education  Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

As a Sales Manager, Strategic Accounts You Will As a Sales Executive, Strategic Accounts - North America you will be responsible for generating new revenue from our top accounts: creating, cultivating and developing accounts. You will be expected to exceed revenue goals by planning and executing successful sales within top-tier companies. You will be responsible for acquiring and possessing expert knowledge of all companies solutions. On a day to day you will: Meet and exceed sales quota through outbound work - strategically selling the company’s various solutions to new prospects in a consultative manner Management of entire sales cycle from prospecting, discovery, presentation, negotiating and closing Working closely with the Sales Development and Marketing teams to target appropriate accounts Build cross functional relationships in order to penetrate the account further by focusing on executive engagement Develop accurate forecasts and manage sales activity in CRM Requirements 5+ years online sales experience in sales and online marketing. You are a high performer with experience of exceeding sales targets with an established network of contacts High integrity, energy and dedication. We are looking for uncommonly good sales professionals with a highly collaborative, value-driven, honest and direct approach Excellent communication and presentation skills. Documented success in high-end SaaS sales. The ideal candidate will have experience client-direct sales and be highly successful at running consultative sales processes in large, complex prospect organizations. Experience in presenting to and interacting with senior management of prospect organizations. Ideally a deep understanding of current digital marketing including display advertising, SEO, SEM, Affiliates and Content marketing Ideally experience of working in a hyper-growth or start-up business Ideally experience of taking a new, disruptive technology to market HireResources recruiters are not generalists; they are specialists in their industries providing quick access to industry top talent in select industry sectors. We speak your language and understand the factors critical to your business. Each HireResources Sector Team has a specialized target recruitment function. In fact, if we do not have expertise in your industry, we will let you know this upfront.  HireResources was established in 2002, in 2015 we began a growth phase by restructuring our core business, today, HireResources is a fast-growing Staffing & Recruitment platform headquartered in Connecticut. HireResources is an open source staffing and recruiting model giving flexibility and support to top executive recruiters across the country. HireResources recruiters are thoroughly vetted and are proven professionals in the recruiting industry.
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Computer Software, and Staffing and Recruiting

description: Job Description  Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to small-and-medium sized accounts. The role is a combination of a Field Sales Rep and Inside Sales Rep.  Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to small-and-medium sized accounts. The role is a combination of a Field Sales Rep and Inside Sales Rep.  Works to achieve maximum sales profitability, growth, and account penetration within an assigned territory. Territory may be combination of geographic, product, industry and other customer / market dimensions. Sells to the territory directly or via partners. The territory that this rep covers does not have an Inside Sales Rep or Field Rep. Utilizes inbound and/or outbound techniques to identify, qualify and close new opportunities. Manages accounts throughout the entire sales process, and collaborates with team members in business development, consulting and support to uncover all customer needs. Responsible for understanding Oracle's product offerings and competitive issues to develop solution proposals encompassing all aspects of the application. Travels to customer sites to identify / develop sales opportunities. Participates in the development, presentation, and sales of a value proposition. Onsite customer presentation with C-levels to negotiate and close strategic and complex deals. Liaises with customer contacts for the purpose of managing the customer relationship, identifying new opportunities and maximizing sales.  Work involves some problem solving. Duties and tasks are standard with some variation. Completes own role largely independently within defined policies and procedures. Ability to communicate effectively over the phone with high level decision makers. Successful sales track record. Oracle knowledge and/or knowledge of Oracle's competitors. Interaction with C level players. Team player. Ability to penetrate accounts and meet with stakeholders within accounts. Strong communication, negotiation and closing skills. Strong marketing skills. Travels to customer as needed. Typically graduate or equivalent with up to 2 years relevant sales experience.  About Us  Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Computer Software, and Financial Services

description: KidPass, a BEGiN Company, is the leading marketplace for parents to discover and book amazing kids activities including in-person classes, online classes, and tutoring. We work with thousands of teachers and kids activity providers, including Gymboree, Kidville, Super Soccer Stars, Music Together, YMCA, JCC, the Museum of Modern Art, and many more! Backed by leading tech investors, KidPass has rapidly grown to become the largest kids activities marketplace.  As an Educational Sales Account Executive at KidPass, you'll be at the front lines of growing KidPass, speaking to parents and helping them find tutoring and activity programs that best match their needs. Our Sales Team is highly motivated, driven, positive, and skilled to help parents and students with their educational goals. The ideal candidate will have a background in and passion for education that they can apply to help drive sales and support parents seeking solutions. Candidates should have a track record of success, and an entrepreneurial approach that allows them to thrive in a dynamic startup environment.  The Sales Account Executive position is a key role in helping parents and their children get the educational support that they need. Role will report into our New York office or may be remote in select US locations*.  You Will: Lead assessment calls with prospective customers to identify learning goals for their children Consulting new customers on education packages that meet their learning goals including tutoring packages, online classes, in-person activities, and other programs offered by KidPass and our partners Ownership of sales process for prospective customers including consultation, closing sales, set up for customer success, and follow-up consultations and support Ensure customers have all of the information at setup and following up to ensure their success with KidPass Work closely with account management and operations team to ensure seamless communication both internally and externally with parents, partners, and tutors Compensation based on experience with benefits. You should be performance driven, and comfortable working with a commission structure Document inbound and outbound inquiries, follow-ups, and other client activity Achieve and consistently exceed monthly sales targets  Must Haves: Excellent verbal and written communication skills - this is a role that requires high-volume calling to speak with parents looking for tutoring and various educational programs Motivated, can-do attitude and ability to get things done while working independently and as part of a team Love talking to people and building relationships Passion for education and helping children Ability to effectively manage a book of customer accounts Ability to think on your feet and thrive in a fast-paced, enterprising environment Skillfully manages multiple responsibilities You must have either prior background in education/teaching OR sales experience Bachelor’s degree (preferred)  We like people who: Are open to suggestions, collaborative, and thrive in team environments Love and are willing to learn new technologies and styles Are scrappy, entrepreneurial with the ability to turnaround high-quality projects quickly without depending on a large team  What you’ll get: HOMER offers competitive compensation including equity and full benefits. Smart, passionate, and engaged co-workers. Excellent top-tier Medical/Dental/Vision benefits 401k with 4% company match The chance to have a big impact, quickly The rare opportunity to make a dent in the universe. We’re bringing a love of reading and learning to children globally!  *Remote Locations: AL, CA, CT, FL, GA, ID, MA, MD, MI, MO, NC, NE, NY, OR, PA, TN, TX, WA, WY. This role is not eligible for CO state.  HOMER is a proud equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.  At HOMER, we are committed to building a diverse team of talented people who are passionate about creating educational content kids love. We believe in fostering a culture where productivity can flourish, one that is empathetic, respectful, and inclusive. At HOMER, we know that diversity, equity, and inclusion aren’t just an idea, a one-time initiative, or phrases to throw into a job post: they’re a daily practice and an ongoing conversation. We survey our team about inclusivity, run trainings on DEI topics, and have a committee to ensure we are all continuing to learn and grow.

Looking for business professionals who fit our values; hard work, honesty, urgency, and a positive attitude to be a successful Rumsey Construction and Restoration Sales Representative, based in Charlotte, NC.   We are looking for someone who may not be actively seeking full-time employment.  Candidates are successful in their current role and may have never even considered looking at other opportunities.  Their work experience may not be in the service industry.  The candidate we are looking for wants to be involved in their community; they enjoy helping people and are interested in overseeing their financial future. This opportunity really sells itself. Here are some of the highlights.  High income potential Brand recognition as a trusted leader in your community Extensive resources to support you throughout your entire RCR career Base salary with bonus potential Benefits Opportunities to inspire, motivate and develop the RCR teammates Affiliation with a company committed to community economic stability Initial training and ongoing training and support from industry leader  Job Qualifications: Track record of long-term employment Two or more years outside B2B sales experience Achievement oriented Persuasive Optimistic outlook Self-starter Strong Prospecting skills Experience with database management Highly effective organizational and planning skills

Who we are: Join a fast-paced, leading technology company with an exciting business and ambitious growth plans. SilverIP is a leading Internet Service Provider (ISP) in Chicago and Milwaukee, consistently ranked as one of the top independent networks in the region. We compete with AT&T and Comcast by providing Gigabit Internet to multi-family properties, businesses and to large events such as Lollapalooza. Our advanced network enables us to offer carrier-grade, high bandwidth Internet access service at highly competitive rates prices. We are continuously growing and are looking for talented and amazing people to join our team in Chicago and Milwaukee!  The Position:  As a Sales Development Representative (“SDR”) for SilverIP, you will play an important role in helping us grow our Residential (apartments and condominiums) Internet business in the Chicago region. You will work closely with our EVP of Business development to contact property managers and real estate developers and introduce them to SilverIP.  The ideal person for this position is self-motivated with an entrepreneurial spirit, is comfortable communicating with customers on the phone, via email and in-person, can develop and manage relationships.  Hands-on sales and technical training, a generous base salary of $55K-$60K, and a commission plan offers you significant earnings potential. A full benefits package takes effect within 30 days of employment.  This involves:  Report to and work closely with the Executive Vice President of Business Development to approach and market to new residential apartments and condominium buildings Identify and qualify new opportunities through market research, direct calling, networking and email campaigns to property managers and real estate developers. Compliment prospecting and selling efforts through field work such as building walks, lobby events, property management relationships, and customer face to face meetings Understand and effectively communicate SilverIP’s value proposition and our technology Work closely with our Marketing Director in the development and implementation of innovative marketing ideas, including media campaigns, events, and marketing collateral Work closely with our account managers in seamlessly onboarding new buildings post-sale Manage and maintain our CRM system with up to date contact and opportunity information   What you will need to bring:  Strong work ethic and self-motivated Excellent communication skills Able to travel 10% of the time 3-5 years of business development, marketing or sales experience A college degree is preferred Flexibility to work remote, hybrid or in person in our south loop office Experience working in the multi-family real estate sector a plus

Copado - #1 Native Salesforce DevOps Solution  Sales Program Manager- US - Remote   Copado is a fast-growing organization that believes in it’s people to enable our business to scale and grow. We provide our people with flexible working environments and benefits for our international organization.  Copado is looking for a talented, hardworking individual with great energy, and initiative to help mature and scale one of the fastest growing applications in the Salesforce ecosystem.  The Program Manager will join the global GTM Strategy & Operations team partnering closely with our Marketing, Enablement and Alliances teams. The role will operationalize programs and plays across vertically aligned sales teams, and will work the Data & Analytics team to define a standard way of tracking results including pipeline volume and conversion analysis. The Program Manager will ensure visibility of upcoming playbooks with stakeholders across the GTM organization to ensure alignment, and provide regular executive level updates of impact.  This is an excellent opportunity for a proven Sales Programs Manager, marketing project manager, or an experienced sales operations professional to play a leadership role in a rapidly growing GTM organization.  Responsibilities: Collaborate with Product Marketing to create and rollout sales plays across the global GTM organization Work with Sales Enablement to build and evolve Copado’s sales methodology  Partner with Marketing to assess and optimize account-based strategies  Build on Copado’s customer success framework to drive upsell plays and conduct strategic account planning with cross-functional sales teams Collaborate with Alliances organization and Partner Marketing to build repeatable partner sales campaigns   This job is for you if you: Have a working knowledge of effective sales strategies (seed, grow, advise) 4-6+ years of experience in sales/marketing operations or sales development Have experience coordinating the rollout of programs across a global GTM team Have experience collaborating with Marketing and Sales Enablement to build sales plays and ensure sale readiness Have used data to quantify and identify opportunities Have worked with stakeholders to turn insights into actionable sales plays adopted by a global sales team Previous experience in the Salesforce.com or Dev Ops ecosystems is a plus  You are a fit for Copado if: You are energetic and enjoy working in a fast-paced global environment You have high adaptability and flexibility, including the ability to manage deadline pressure, ambiguity, and change You love working in an agile environment and continuously strive for improvement Want to be part of the growth of an early stage organization

Auto req ID: 238365BR  Job Description  We are PepsiCo Sales. We are game changers, mountain movers and history makers. We are a diverse group, spread among 200 countries and united by a shared set of values and goals. That’s why we Perform with Purpose. Together, we blaze new trails, succeed, celebrate and never settle for second best. At PepsiCo, we’re committed to performing well as individuals and in teams, to strengthen the company as a whole. Are you hungry to be a part of the World’s largest portfolio of billion-dollar food and beverage brands? Then now is the time to explore the opportunities of PepsiCo: what makes you unique makes us better.  This role will report to the Director of Category Leadership:  The Sr. Category Manager will be responsible for leading the category management with our Small Format Retail customers in PBNA’s West Division. She/He will be distinguished provide recommendations and execute on category management strategies and tactics to accelerate both category growth and maximize the growth potential across the PepsiCo portfolio. She/He possesses excellent customer management skills, will be comfortable navigating ambiguity to define and deliver on strategic initiatives with customers. She/He will have well-developed cross-functional collaboration skills, presentation skills and partner to leverage cross-functional resources to shape and deliver an insights-driven category growth agenda.  The Sr. Category Manager will collaborate closely with sales leadership and cross-functional team members to develop and deliver category management expertise to Small Format Customers. She/he will develop and execute against pro-active insights-driven agenda to identify and commercialize mutual growth opportunities. The leader in this role will work with our sales partners and have an opportunity to build a broad business perspective and network of relationships across the organization while working on a tight-knit and high performing team. This is an ideal role for someone interested in having a significant impact on the business while also elevating the overall capabilities and visibility of the category management team.  The Sr. Manager will have the opportunity to lead how we unlock demand at a more granular level leveraging PepsiCo’s suite of proprietary tools and multiple data sources. Collaboration, customer development skills and thought leadership are at a premium in this role. It will be important for this leader to also be efficiency-oriented, have strong project management skills and process orientation to optimize our resources for the greatest commercial return. The leader in this role will work with our KAMs and field leaders so it is an excellent role for building a broad business perspective and network of relationships across the organization.  The role is located in Irvine, CA but open to our other West Division hubs including Denver, CO and Phoenix, AZ.  Key Accountabilities Sales: Partner with Sales to deliver fact-based selling stories to drive sales growth and profit for our Customers Build and maintain long-term relationships with our customers through a consultative approach focused on objective insight development and presentation Maintain frequent, clear and open communication within and among cross-functional teams regarding projects, strategic insights and/or business opportunities Category Management: Conduct detailed strategic category and channel analyses and reporting, utilizing the appropriate category resources Stay current on trends, opportunity gaps and competitive activities impacting the customer Support the development of our strategic plan and monitor its execution against KPIs within customers Support field sales team by delivering meaningful analysis and insights on product/category reviews and category growth opportunities Lead category management insight and strategic guidance on space/assortment/merchandising initiatives Work across functions with peers in other groups to foster collaboration on shared goals Coach, develop and support analysts on category management fundamentals, insight development and project management Provide guidance to direct reports, ensuring clarity around priorities and goals, communicating financial, goal results and key performance indicators Cultivate high-performance culture with continual training and development of team members to enhance business knowledge, analytical skills and tool usage Qualifications/Requirements Bachelor’s Degree, Advanced Degree preferred 4+ years of category management or syndicated data experience 5+ years’ experience in analyzing and interpreting data and team/project management experience on CPG sales (or equivalent) Strong leadership skills: the ability to direct activities of individual team members towards goals Strong analytical skills: the ability to integrate influential insights and data-driven analytics to drive initiatives Excellent communication skills: ability to send and receive information clearly and concisely Strong planning/organizing skills: capable of managing major projects simultaneously Able to establish and attain high standards for self and team; able to make decisions and solve problems Strong presentation skills, both in the development of compelling stories and in presenting them at all levels within customer and internal organization Critical thinking and strategic acumen – demonstrated thought leadership and ability to leverage the insights, while linking strategies and objectives to develop and execute the plan Need thorough understanding of IRI/Nielsen syndicated data, and understanding other industry data sources outside of POS is a requirement for the role (HH panel, Shopper Sights, loyalty data etc.) and exposure to Space Management and relevant software (e.g. JDA ProSpace) Strong technical acumen preferred Must be willing and able to travel 30-40% of the time This position is limited to persons with indefinite right to work in the United States Relocation Eligible: Eligible for Standard Relocation  Job Type: Regular  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.  PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity  Our Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, and all other applicable laws, including but not limited to, San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901 - 4919, commonly referred to as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance; and Chapter XVII, Article 9 of the Los Angeles Municipal Code, commonly referred to as the Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.  If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents. View PepsiCo EEO Policy  Please view our Pay Transparency Statement

Company Overview  WarnerMedia is a powerful portfolio of iconic entertainment, news, and sports brands. We bring people, technology, and the world’s best storytellers together to drive culture and meaningful connection. We believe the enduring power of stories can open our eyes to the world, to each other, and to new and different perspectives.  Join us. Shape your story here.  The Job  WarnerMedia seeks a Sales Planner for the Turner Sports in Detroit, MI.  The Daily Monitor and manage active on-air and digital media deals for Account Executive. Work within internal systems to prepare, build and propose advertising & sponsorship-based media plans for clients (linear & digital). Organize and gather relevant research insights, marketing materials and various competitive information for Account Executive. Create account profiles and assist team in preparation for client meetings / events. Collaborate with internal marketing and strategic planning teams to create client focused solutions Oversee deal stewardship and performance tracking along with Sales Assistant; and prepare post-campaign analysis, reports and decks for clients. Provide support to Account Executive/Management and complete additional projects as directed Participate in Sales training and other career development sessions Build strong internal and external relationships and provide additional support and projects to the team as directed. The Essentials Bachelor’s Degree and 1+ years of experience in a related field required; previous work on a digital or TV sales team or at an advertising agency is a plus. Interest in Sports Strong written and verbal communication skills. Must be outgoing, organized, efficient and a strategic thinker. Must be a team player with a strong work ethic who is detail oriented. Must have the ability to handle multiple tasks and have a positive attitude. Proficient in various computer software (Microsoft Word, PowerPoint, Excel, MRI). The Perks Exclusive WarnerMedia events and advance screenings Paid time off every year to volunteer for eligible employees Access to well-being tools, resources, and freebies Access to in-house learning and development resources Part of the WarnerMedia family of powerhouse brands Warner Media, LLC and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers. Qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, mental or physical disability, and genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, military status, protected veteran status or any other category protected by law.

At Alfa Laval, we always go that extra mile to overcome the toughest challenges. Our driving force is to accelerate success for our customers, people and planet. You can only achieve that by having dedicated people with a curious mind. Curiosity is the spark behind great ideas. And great ideas drive progress.  Who You Are  You are a self-motivated team player with the ability to easily network in an international and cross-cultural environment, working in line with Alfa Laval drivers; Action, Interaction, and Satisfaction. You are driven and see solutions rather than problems, effectively prioritizing and executing tasks. You build relationships with trust and follow-through.  About The Job  We’re adding to our Field Sales team for the Western region. Make an impact selling our separation technologies and services in municipal and industrial wastewater. Capital & Service Sales Separation technologies business in municipal & industrial wastewater. Remote candidates encouraged to apply, if located within our Western Region.  As a Part Of The Team, You Will  In this role, you will have the opportunity to represent a global manufacturing leader in this space. Grow account base within the Western region, traveling to customer sites as needed Use the CRM tool and other tools in a consistent and qualitative way, to support the sales process Maintain strong working relationship with regional sales and technical services group counterparts Maintain a focus on replacement opportunities in the existing installed base Prioritize market presence of sales opportunities Act as a liaison with central Business Unit counterparts for new applications, products and competitive intelligence Develop key account coverage with current and prospective customers’ technology decision makers What You Know  You have a Bachelor’s Degree, ideally in Engineering, and: 5+ years of experience in water and wastewater markets Ability to travel 50-75% throughout Western region Physical and Environmental Factors: May be required to lift up to 50 pounds. Locations include municipal and industrial wastewater treatment plants.  What’s in it for you?  We offer a challenging position in an open and friendly environment where we help each other to develop and create value. Your work will have a true impact on Alfa Laval’s future success. Our benefits-eligible associates enjoy healthcare, dental and vision plans, a robust wellness program, generous 401(k), paid holidays, paid time off benefits, and more.  EEO/Vet/Disabled Employer
