Company Overview  At Fairfield Inn & Suites, we promise to always make our guests feel welcome and that all starts with you! Our team members are our foundation and they have a passion for customer service. Our guests count on us to deliver the uncomplicated, stress free stay that Fairfield Inn & Suites has delivered since it all began.  We would like to welcome you on a journey to keep our promises to our guests and teammates! We are always looking for great people who are dynamic, resourceful and ready to jump into any situation to give a helping hand. With a variety of positions, we are confident you will find the perfect fit for you within our hotel. If you are a positive person and have a genuine interest in the well-being of others around you, we invite you to apply today!  Job Summary  We are seeking an enthusiastic, results-driven Director of Sales to lead the sales efforts at our Fairfield Inn & Suites - Charlotte University Research Park. Bring your sales, networking, and guest services skills to help build our client base and deliver the guest experience that the Fairfield Inn is known for!  A successful Director of Sales will drive business by sharing our brand of hospitality with potential corporate, group and leisure guests. They will use their warm and professional personality to develop and build long term relationships with our key clients. A Director of Sales is an expert in negotiating and delivering win-win deals for the hotel and the client, as well as leading the team to deliver on those expectations.  Responsibilities  Develop and maintain a marketing plan and sales budget with the General Manager.  Solicit new and existing business accounts to meet and exceed revenue goals predominately through outside sales calls, relationships, telephone solicitation, site tours and written communication/collateral.  Develop/maintain knowledge of market trends, competition and customers.  Attend trade shows, community events and industry meetings.  Prepare correspondence to customers, internal booking reports and file maintenance.  Finalize all books/contracts in a timely manner servicing guests through the process.  Participate in revenue management call, pre-convention meetings, training and other sales-related meetings.  Assist with hotel budget planning, sales and revenue forecasting and actively participate in the hotel’s revenue management process.  Pursue new clients through creative/innovative sales techniques.  Qualify clients, develop proposals, and prepare contracts.  Initiate and implement sales promotional programs with travel partners.  Anticipate guests’ needs, respond promptly, and acknowledge all guests.  Train front desk staff and other applicable staff members on sales call process.  Conduct on-site tours, when needed.  Follow-up on group business (pending, tentative and booked) to ensure client satisfaction and materialization at hotel.  Qualifications  Possess proficient computer skills including knowledge of MS Office products, knowledge of brand operating systems preferred.  Knowledge of sales process, client base, and general market knowledge.  Ability to investigate and analyze current activities or information in the sales field and make logical conclusions and recommendations.  Ability to negotiate, convince, sell and influence professionals and hotel guests.  Knowledge of revenue management and ability to successfully forecast business on both short-term and long-term basis.  Able to develop and maintain rapport with key community contacts to ensure a visible presence in the community.  Able to study, analyze and interpret complex activities and/or information in order to improve new practices or develop new approaches.  Benefits  Associate Hotel Discounts Worldwide!  PTO Accrual from day one!  Health, Dental and Vision Insurance  401(k) with Employer Match  Short Term & Long Term Disability Insurance  Paid Life Insurance  Employee Assistance Program

Paychex is looking for passionate, enthusiastic, and self-motivated individuals to join our fast-paced virtual sales team. These individuals know that what they put into their career is what they are going to get out of it. They want a company that cares about their success, is dedicated to personal growth and professional development, and can deliver on results through demonstrating our core values.  Responsibilities ·        Utilizes the telephone, cold calling, and qualifying leads, overcoming objections, while prospecting new clients and new referral sources. ·        Presents Paychex payroll products and services to final decision-makers and end-users within the prospect universe to educate them on our services with the goal of having them become Paychex Payroll clients. ·        Completes and submits accurate new business paperwork and weekly activity reports by agreed-upon dates set by Sales management to assist with forecasting. ·        Analyzes the customer needs and interests to determine which products are appropriate and refers to the appropriate party when necessary. ·        Schedules phone appointments by cold calling prospects and current referral sources to secure referrals to end-users. ·        Expedites the resolution of customer problems or complaints to the appropriate channels to ensure client satisfaction. ·        Closes sales by asking for the business  Qualifications ·        Bachelor's degree or equivalent experience in Business ·        At least 1 - 2 years of sales experience ·        Excellent written and verbal communication skills ·        Ability to multi-task, organize, and prioritize work

Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who use new technologies, dynamic insights and over 154 years of experience to connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with the food they need to thrive.  Job Purpose and Impact  The Digital Sales Account Executive for Poultry North America is responsible for developing and executing Cargill Digital Solutions’ commercial vision and achieve short- and medium-term goals for the customer accounts that will drive growth for Cargill Animal Nutrition, while providing customers with software and technology solutions to improve customer production and profitability.This role will focus on explaining the value of the Digital portfolio of software and technology in close collaboration with local Cargill nutrition poultry sales teams. As such, we seek a seasoned professional that can work independently, knows the poultry industry well, has excellent customer relationship skills, and is able to become a subject matter expert in applying different technology in poultry production.  Location: This is a remote position within Eastern US only.  Key Accountabilities Develop and execute the sales planning process for complex accounts for multiple value propositions and solutions as part of the account plan. Develop and structure complex sales proposals that represent maximum value optimization to customer and business. Develop strong client relationships that provide significant input to planning product, price, and service strategies. Work with Cargill Animal Nutrition sales teams to align on goals and build actions plans to achieve results. Analyse competitor capabilities to determine gaps and to position offerings against competitive options. Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating only the most complex issues to appropriate staff. Other duties as assigned. External applicant Information This position is posted both internally and externally. This is a remote position within Eastern US only. Minimum travel may be required Qualifications  Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in any relevant business discipline. Minimum of four years of related work experience preferably in poultry nutrition industry. Working experience with presentations and communication using Microsoft tools. Open to create reports and be able to share technical knowledge to non-technical audience. Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in animal nutrition or science. Master`s degree will be a plus. Minimun five years of business experience in value added sales solution in poultry nutrition and / or health industry. Proven performance that demonstrates high accountability, strong initiative, with a sense-of-urgency and an entrepreneurial approach. Solid interpersonal skills; being an effective listener, verbal, and written communication. Experience with go-to-market, including sales Strong entrepreneurial spirit; skilled in market assessment, strategy development and annual business planning. Ability to travel up to 35% within North America (post Covid-19). Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet.

description: Homebound’s mission is to create a better way to build homes, leveraging technology to make homebuilding simpler and more transparent. We’re delivering on that promise in places that have been impacted by natural disasters, and now we’re expanding to help families across the country build the perfect home.   With a better labor model, a more efficient building process, and a delightful homeowner experience, Homebound is transforming the homebuilding market. The Homebound team includes software engineers, product managers, designers, marketers, people operations and legal experts, interior designers and the best construction experts in the world — all of whom have come together to improve homebuilding as a whole.   We are already helping hundreds of homeowners across California, Texas, and The Bahamas, and we are poised to help hundreds more. Join us.  Role Overview: Homebound is seeking high energy and organized Sales Development Representatives to seek and engage individuals that are in the market for new homes, through outbound prospecting methods including phone, email, LinkedIn and traditional outreach. This role will be based out of our Denver office.   Whether prospects need to rebuild their homes due to a natural disaster, are looking to custom build a new home, or have a desire to sell Homebound land, SDRs will focus their energy on effectively communicating Homebound's value props and building relationships with customers, with the ultimate goal of connecting them with our Homeowner Consultant for a meeting on-site or in Homebound's design studios. Ultimately, SDRs are responsible for boosting sales and contributing to Homebound's rapid growth. We hire great people from a wide variety of backgrounds, not just because it’s the right thing to do, but because it makes our company stronger.  You’ll be a key contributor in helping to build the fastest-growing, and soon to be largest, home building company in the industry!  What You'll Do Contact potential clients through phone, email and other methods. Schedule meetings for and work closely with Account Executives to ensure meeting hand-off successfully occurs. Act as the subject matter expert on homebuilding, providing prospects with peace of mind that Homebound is unlike any company in the industry. Qualify inbound leads from marketing campaigns, demo requests, emails/calls, etc. Present Homebound's value props in a clear and concise manner. Diligently update Salesforce, ensuring our CRM system stays up-to-date with correct information. Have full knowledge of target prospect base and manage an ongoing prospect pipeline. Report to sales leadership on numbers including outreach, connects, meetings scheduled, etc.  What You'll Bring You have excellent verbal and written communication skills and enjoy interacting with people via phone, email and social media to articulate ideas and gain their trust, and have experience drafting clear communications that demonstrate attention to detail. You have experience as an outbound prospector, including making cold calls. You have a track record of personal accountability, and a high standard of integrity and professionalism. You've demonstrated resilience and a desire to succeed in the face of new and/or unforeseen challenges. You are a team-player with a strong desire to help enforce and improve internal processes. A desire to learn, grow and get in on the ground floor of a company that is changing how homeowners build homes. You are receptive to feedback, with the willingness to learn and embrace continuous improvement. Bachelor's Degree or relevant experience. Background in homebuilding, real estate or construction sales is a bonus!  Compensation + Benefits At Homebound, we care for our teammates by supporting their physical, mental, and financial wellbeing through a comprehensive benefits program. Industry competitive pay, including equity in the company for all Homebounders. Robust health, dental and eye insurance package options for both you and your dependents.  Flexible PTO policy Paid Parental Leave Base Pay: $50,000 / Annual On-Target Earnings: $75,000 (uncapped commissions)  We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. Job Title: Inside Sales Representative Job Location: Ann Arbor, MI Anticipated Start Date: As soon as possible  Akadeum is seeking an Inside Sales Representative that will drive revenue for Akadeum by selling products and services through inbound and outbound lead development, identifying high volume lead sources, and building a funnel of high-quality opportunities. This role will work closely with Akadeum’s commercial team, which includes field sales, application science and marketing to achieve growth targets. The Inside Sales Representative role is not just about closing, but also cultivating relationships and supporting accounts.  This role is right if you if you: Enjoy working on site with a small and supportive team Are someone who is motivated to establish revenue with new products and grow revenue with existing offerings Enjoy the challenge of cold calling and hunting down solid prospects who would benefit from our disruptive platform technology Are excited about and have a sound grasp of cell separation and immunology technology Enjoy demonstrating products to customers and identifying the right kit to enable their science Working in a fast-paced, growth oriented, and early-stage company at the frontier of life sciences  Responsibilities: Directly responsible for revenue growth to meet quarterly and annual sales targets, by continuously identifying and selling into new accounts, primarily through prospecting (phone and e-mail) but also through informing marketing efforts and email promotions Close on new revenue opportunities while maintaining high close rates and profitability Continuously identify opportunities for customer development and revenue growth; expand database of contacts and prospects for the organization Field phone inquiries and enter sales orders into ERP system; support operations with product shipments as needed Take MQLs and turn into sales opportunities Maintain accurate and complete records in the CRM system and submit accurate and timely forecasts, pipeline, and account activity Conduct virtual product demonstrations that highlight better science with Akadeum microbubbles Provide highest level of customer service and build strong relationships with key decision makers Build strong internal relationships to support customers and with field sales to support quota achievement Help field sales and applications with engagements via the website chat bot Provide feedback to marketing on additional material needed to support sales Other duties as needed to support company growth and objectives  Qualifications: Minimum 1-2 years of on-quota inside or outside sales experience and proven record of consistent top sales performance Entrepreneurial self-starter with ability to influence and win over potential customers Demonstrated knowledge of network prospecting Experience conducting product demonstrations in the life sciences Life science background is a must as sales are often technical in nature High level of attention to detail, in particular with customer engagements, reporting and forecasting Clear communication skills, ability to articulate technical features, understand and identify novel applications Understanding of marketing to provide feedback on materials needed to help drive sales Team player who thrives in helping teammates achieve their goals  Please submit cover letter, resume and salary requirements to careers@akadeum.com

description: Professional Services Sales Executive - Must be in NYC/NJ/Philadelphia Area  CTI helps enterprise clients accelerate digital transformation providing effective strategies and excellence in solution delivery. We collaborate with businesses and our technology partners to enable our clients to leverage Advanced Analytics, Data Engineering, Data Science, and Cloud paradigms to accelerate business value. We seek a Senior Sales Executive, a "hunter," who will lead the charge to grow our client portfolio and professional services revenue.    RESPONSIBILITIES  Business Development  ·      Create, nurture, and manage client relationships at the Director, Vice President, and CXO level in Fortune 1000 enterprises. ·      Initiate thought leadership-based discussions to position oneself and CTI as a premium brand. ·      Be solution-oriented and a problem-solver. ·      Interact strategically with client's vendor relationship organization and maintain a smooth flow of MSA's, SOW's, invoices, and payments. ·      Work closely with CTI Leadership, Practice Leads, Partner Sales organizations, and Client decision-makers across all business units. Account Development  ·      Develop a deep understanding of clients' business objectives and challenges, organizational structure, and key client stakeholders to lead and manage the account strategy and execution plan. ·      Collaborate with all CTI technology partners to expand into new areas and drive growth in existing areas. ·      Assess potential competitive and business risks and develop strategies and mitigation plans for active sales cycles.  ·      Collaborate with CTI employees assigned to the client account and engage them in contributing to account expansion activities.   QUALIFICATIONS ·      7+ years' experience selling and expanding project based professional services that create business value in enterprise accounts. ·      Demonstrable history of professional services revenue generation by acquiring and growing new accounts. ·      Strong business acumen, presentation skills, and the ability to interact, create, and sustain a strategic trusted relationship with Director and C-level executives. ·      Proven ability to develop sales "win themes" and execute the sales strategy through complex pursuits. ·      Experienced at successfully aligning internal teams and technology partners to win business. ·      Strong understanding of Advanced Analytics, Legacy and Cloud Data Platforms, and Modern Data Management. ·      Experience selling value-add services in collaboration with sales teams technology partners such as Informatica, Talend, Qlik, Snowflake, Tableau, Confluent, Snowflake, and Microsoft or similar vendor sales teams is highly desirable.  WHY CHOOSE CTI At CTI, it is our people that make us unique. Our core values are an active part of everything we do. Each one reminds us to stay true to ourselves while driving exceptional outcomes for our clients. ·       Develop your career and ride the wave of innovation in advanced analytics, data science, data engineering, and modern data management. ·       Enhance your skills by working collaboratively with our elite team of consultants. ·       Demonstrate your entrepreneurial spirit while working with a team of seasoned, talented professionals. ·       Keep pace with the latest digital transformation technologies selling solutions with our partners applying innovative data science, engineering, and management technologies in various industry domains. ·       Grow professionally by taking advantage of our opportunities to increase your role and responsibilities. ·       Work on a variety of projects and in a variety of industries - you will never be bored - Most importantly, you will be surrounded by respected leaders in the fields of Data Analytics, Data Science, Machine Learning, and Modern Data Management with unmatched energy and drive. Visit www.ctidata.com to learn more about us.

jobTitle: Sr. Manager, B2C Channel Sales – ATT
description: Position Summary  Making the future is everyday life at Samsung. We’re seeking innovators who are called to not just change the world, but build a better one. We enable the best technology hardware on the planet, but our best is always a prototype for something better and our people thrive with a driven mindset – better builds on better. We believe that innovation and growth are driven by an inclusive culture and a diverse workforce. We aim to create a global team where everyone belongs and has equal opportunities, inspiring our talent to be their true selves. Together, we are building a better tomorrow for our customers, partners and communities.At Samsung Electronics America, we take pride in the creativity and diversity of our talented people – they are at the forefront of everything we do. Their skillset and mindset drive our continued success. Only the resilient and resourceful thrive in the daily dose of unexpected at Samsung. We unapologetically push to achieve unforeseen potential in everything we do, both within the workplace and at home. We fearlessly face challenges head-on, conquer the unconquerable, and are comfortable living in the uncomfortable zone. Position Summary: The Sales Manager, B2C Channel Sales AT&T/Cricket is Responsible for growing the business revenue on one of Samsung’s premier partnership accounts. This role implements and maintains the integrity of division’s strategies, reporting of the account’s activities to management, implementation of sales programs, and attaining sales goals.  Role and Responsibilities  Responsible for driving sales revenue of various mobile categories on Samsung’s account. Must possess strong sales acumen and a compelling customer presence, be able to communicate extremely clearly and effectively even in ambiguous circumstances, and ultimately be able to establish and enhance strong relationships with key customer contacts in order to successfully position Samsung's portfolio and drive sales. Manage communications, sales promotion development, and training as required to stimulate and facilitate the sale of Samsung's products. Manage cross-functional teams including account team Leadership, Product, Field Sales, Marketing, Supply Chain, Legal, external Samsung North American teams, Customer teams and others in order to drive the launch and sales of new products and solutions. Responsible for solving moderately complex technical problems and responding to non-standard requests from internal and external customers in a fast paced environment. Responsible for actionable analysis and associated periodic reporting of key account, market and industry trends. Must be very comfortable with both the human and the data insights aspects of executing an effective sales strategy. May be required to apply specialized knowledge to support product innovation, quality control, and overall product issues. May be responsible for development of more junior Sales staff as well as for soliciting and successfully gaining broader team consensus. Leverage Atlanta, GA -or- Plano, TX as base of operations with up to 50% travel.  Qualifications/Skills:  Bachelor's Degree with 12+ years of experience required. Prior experience in enterprise technology sales, business development and/or OEMs and Carrier (specifically AT&T/Cricket) sales preferred. Prior experience selling technical solutions required. Excellent interpersonal skills with strong negotiation and client management skills. Excellence in MS Office products including Excel, PowerPoint and Word. Strong proficiency in navigating dashboards and data to discover actionable insights to drive sales.  Skills and Qualifications    Necessary Skills & Attributes:  Develop and maintain excellent working relationships with all assigned levels within and outside the company. Plan, organize, and prioritize multiple assignments and projects. Review detailed product development, marketing documents and media materials as needed. Demonstrated competency in both oral and written communication modes for both internal and external personnel at various levels. Work independently and in a team environment in order to achieve customer business objectives, personal and team goals and complete assignments within established time frames and specifications.  The ability to develop tasks and work assignments, based on sometime vaguely defined objectives.  Physical/Mental Demands and Working Conditions:  The position requires the ability to perform the essential duties and responsibilities in the following environment: Work is generally performed in an office environment. Operate a computer keyboard and view a video display terminal 50% of work time, including prolonged periods of time.  The movement and transportation of equipment, most of the time under 25 pounds. Performs work under time schedules and stresses which are normally periodic or cyclical, including time sensitive job stress, fatigue, unpaid over-time, intellectual challenge, constant technical data feedback, language barriers, and business management stress. Machines, tools, equipment, and work aids representative and commonly associated with PCs, printers, and office work areas. Frequently works additional hours beyond normal schedule. Under very little direct supervision with a high level of responsibility to apply general policies and guidelines where decisions are seldom monitored and consequences of decisions adversely affect operating results and management decisions.  Complete access to confidential company data where disclosure may jeopardize the company’s competitive position.       * Please visit Samsung membership to see Privacy Policy, which defaults according to your location. You can change Country/Language at the bottom of the page. jobTitle: Sales Support, New Business (Parsippany, NJ or NYC)
description: Job Description  Responsible for managing the start to end RFP process to deliver new business sales. Ensures timely and accurate enrollment, installation, setup, and eligibility for newly sold accounts. Ensures successful problem resolution of early issues with accounts.  Qualify requests, collect and review specs, engage with broker to gather all relevant details, review matching for strategic capabilities leveraging knowledge of products and networks.  Develop plan for quote and proposal delivery. Assist in development of proposal and coordinate resources needed. Leverages knowledge of products, networks, and industry.  Coordinate collection of responses for RPF, data collection, scrubbing data, pricing for all products, work in Salesforce/CPQ, data entry to move the RFP through to completion.  Responsible for ensuring timely and accurate contract installation. This includes interfacing with client and broker, underwriting and operations for all required forms, paperwork, signature documents, files and information for eligibility and transition of care, etc. for all products sold on a case. This is precise work on high volumes of material where accuracy and attention to detail is critical to protect against the high cost of rework.  Prepare presentation materials.  Support enrollment processes and manage case through first 30 days, including network, coverage, and setup needs.  Participate as Salesforce SME and system/process SME, providing input to corporate teams on proposed changes and enhancements and their impact in the field.  Due to the business needs, this role can be located at either Parsippany, NJ or New York, NY.  Required Qualifications 2-5+ yrs relevant experience Strong presentation and communication skills; ability to modify communication delivery based on audience Exceptional project management skills and attention to detail Exceptional relationship-building skills Demonstrated planning/organizational skills; ability to work on many issues at once and to prioritize work Demonstrated ability to develop strong working relationships with matrix partners to drive deliverables Preferred Qualifications Knowledge and experience in managed care and/or sales such as: product/process/systems knowledge, underwriting, sales practices, account management, healthcare RFPs, and knowledge of administrative operations Knowledge of Word, PowerPoint, Excel, Salesforce.com State licensure is a plus Education  HS diploma or equivalent.  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

SALES ACCOUNT MANAGER - JOB DESCRIPTION Position Summary: Title:              Sales Account Manager Reports to:    CEO Location:       San Jose, CA Education:    Bachelor’s degree in Business/Science/Engineering (preferred) Experience:    5+ years Business Management/Engineering/Sales Logistics or Service Operations and/or Semiconductor experience  Pure Wafer is looking for a bubbly, communicative and experienced Semiconductor professional to join the Sales team as a Sales Account Manager. The ideal candidate will play an integral role in managing customer relations, delivering new business pitches and the achievement of defined sales objectives. As a member of the Pure Wafer Sales team, they will be responsible for developing existing business in near term and building the foundation for continued profitable revenue growth over the long term.  Primary Responsibilities: Outbound and inbound account management and sales Develop deep customer knowledge and influence through forging executive relationships, increasing Pure Wafer’s reputation as a proven partner, increasing customer satisfaction and our footprint within the Key Accounts and/or regions. Coordinates sales forecasting, planning, and budgeting processes used within the sales organization. Coordinate all team efforts towards the projects’ success  About the Ideal Candidate: Strategic and target-driven Enjoys working with a team in an energetic and open working environment Results orientated and customer/account focused Engaging, empathetic with ability to challenge at senior level Self-motivated, self-sufficient, and accountable Adapts well to change Highly organized and detail oriented Excellent communication skills both verbal and written Excellent project, planning, change and time management capabilities Driven to be successful Experience in Logistics, sales, or service operations and/or project management

Ronnoco Beverage Solutions, the Midwest's leading supplier of specialty coffees and full service beverage programs, is seeking a Regional Sales Representative to grow our coffee business in the Foodservice channel in the St. Louis area. This is an opportunity for a creative sales professional to identify potential customers, generate and develop new business, and maintain active business relationships with new and existing customers. The Sales Representative will present a mix of products, services, and solutions to meet customers' business needs; develop a complete understanding of Ronnoco's products and equipment in order to provide exceptional customer service; and consistently develop new business and meet sales goals.  Responsibilities Foster existing customer relationships as well as acquire new business through cold calls, emails, and door-to-door visits Evaluate market trends, recommend products, and utilize sampling of product cuttings to meet customers' business goals Provide exceptional customer service - answer questions based on products, availability, pricing, and applications, and provide product information and practical training to customers' personnel Remain informed of market conditions, product innovations, and competitors' products and pricing Prepare and deliver customer contracts, proposals, and presentations, and follow up with key decision makers Exceed customer expectations by acting proactively, professionally, and in a positive manner, and by resolving all customer complaints and issues Contact accounts regularly to maintain relationships and ensure satisfaction Ronnoco's products and services Qualifications 2+ years' professional sales experience, including cold calling experience Previous beverage sales experience preferred Professional appearance and attitude Proficient in MS Office, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook, and the ability to use database management systems or CRM to provide, organize, and track customer information Ability to provide exceptional customer service both internally and externally Excellent oral and written communication skills and interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively communicate cross-functionally with all teams Strong organizational, prioritizing, and multi-tasking skills with the ability to effectively work in a fast-paced environment Team player Ability to maintain confidentiality High school diploma required, college degree preferred Must be able to pass drug test and physical Ability to lift, push, and pull up to 100 pounds and the ability to stand for long periods of time Ronnoco specializes in coffee manufacturing and private label beverage programs. We remain a local, Midwest-owned and operated company that is small enough to pay attention to the details that go into making great coffee, but large enough to service more than 35 states throughout the US. From roasting premium blend coffees to delivering complete beverage solutions, at Ronnoco, our passion is serving those who serve our products. We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package including 401(k) with company match as well as a car allowance.

description: We are currently seeking a self motivated experienced Sales Rep for our Dealer's Choice branch in Nashville, TN.  Beacon Dealers Choice is a vibrant and fast-paced environment where self-motivation, passion and resourcefulness are rewarded. We are one of the largest distributors of residential and non-residential roofing and complementary building products in North America. Beacon currently has over 500 locations throughout the US and 6 Canadian provinces with more than 7,000 employees. We are known throughout the building supply industry for having the best team, integrity, exceptional service and quality building products.  Beacon Building Products is publicly traded on the NASDAQ stock market under the symbol BECN. In June of 2006, Beacon Building Products was named to the NASDAQ Global Select Market.  We are looking for bright minds that share a passion for outside sales and can deliver on expectations. If you are ready for this challenge, please apply today!  Our Ideal Candidate Will Meet or exceed the sales and margin expectations for the assigned territory. Have experience in 2-step selling. Develop new business opportunities through cold calls and lead generation. Use Salesforce, Cognos, and Mincron reports available to help manage a sales territory. Use the necessary phone and field selling skills to sell our products and services to our customers. Build strong customer relationships. Exceed the overall performance and development of assigned and newly assigned accounts. Develop and execute a comprehensive monthly and annual sales plan for the assigned territory to service and expand our business with existing and new customers. Coordinate closely with our inside sales support team and our vendors to plan and execute the promotion of products and services to customers. Organize sales activities so that face to face selling time to the customer is maximized. Demonstrate solid business sales acumen and professionalism to make a positive impact on all prospects and customers. Maintain social, ethical and organization values of Beacon. Conduct business activity, at all times, in a manner consistent with the company's corporate culture. Drive sales growth through consistent daily effort. Minimum Requirements Demonstrated record of year over year sales growth. Proven ability to develop new business while maintaining existing business. 4 year degree preferred but not required. Experience in residential or commercial sales is a plus, but not required. Sales, business management or distribution industries experience preferred. Proficiency in Microsoft Outlook, Internet, Word and Excel. Can gain agreement and acceptance of ideas, plans activities and recommendations. Creates a good first impression, commands attention and respect, and shows an air of confidence. Can demonstrate versatility. Is a self-starter. Will take action to achieve goals. Copes well in competitive sales situations with little supervision and possesses strong negotiation skills. Maintains an acceptable driving safety record.

jobTitle: Primary Care Sales Specialist / Senior – CRM – Sarasota – Remote
description: Job Description  Over 200 new sales positions are being added to our Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolism team. At Novartis we are committed to reducing the global burden of cardiovascular, renal, and metabolic diseases on patients, families, and their communities. We are focused on developing solutions targeting heart failure (acute and chronic), atherosclerosis, metabolic and renal diseases with the aim of improving quality of life for patients all over the world.  We are Novartis.  Join us and help reimagine medicine!  Job Purpose:  The Primary Care Specialist / Senior will build and execute business plans to meet sales goals for territory, and drive territory sales performance, market share and optimal resource utilization. The Primary Care Specialist / Senior will develop effective professional business relationships with customers that support delivery of business results across a range of therapeutic areas and differentiate Novartis as a leader in therapeutic areas.  This is a remote opportunity.  Your Key Responsibilities: Executes business plans and drives achievement of sales targets for assigned territory, customers or therapeutic area. Develops and applies understanding of customer organizations and networks and of diverse influences that affect customer decisions (e.g. peer relationships). Executes call plans for customers, including medical experts from customer or academic communities; calls on the right person to deliver the right message with the right frequency. Ensures that Novartis products and supporting services are broadly understood and available to more patients and customers. Deploys and uses approved Marketing and Sales promotional materials and programs; runs direct promotion programs and facilitates pull-through activities. Uses expert knowledge of Novartis products and of a range of therapy areas to build professional customer relationships and to support sound clinical discussions. Serve as a resource to assist with providing both proactive and reactive education and support regarding NPC CRM access programs as needed for community practices, medical groups and facilities, and their staff. Triage to franchise counterparts as appropriate. Proactively provide education and support on NPC CRM access programs for community practices, medical groups and facilities, and their staff Serve as a resource and/or assist with providing support for resolving customer/account questions regarding coverage, access, and reimbursement, where appropriate. Triage appropriate inquiries, including patient-specific inquiries, to FRM and/or other franchise counterparts as directed by NPC policy and procedure. Develop compliant customer-centric support strategies and proactively communicate payer policy criteria related to NPC CRM products   Integrity & Compliance: Adherence and accountability to NPC policies including policies regarding appropriate Medical / Commercial interactions, Code of Ethics, and all applicable laws and regulations. Works to ensure a diverse and inclusive environment free from all forms of discrimination and harassment. Ethical achievement of sales and revenue targets.   EEO Statement  The Novartis Group of Companies are Equal Opportunity Employers and take pride in maintaining a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.  Minimum Requirements  What You’ll Bring to the Role: Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in Life Sciences, Pharmacy, or business-related field). Minimum two years of successful sales experience (preferably business to business sales experience). Demonstrated outstanding discernment and business planning skills. Effective problem solving and decision-making skills. Exceptional ability to develop and sustain customer relationships. Proven track-record to collaborate and work cross functionally with internal and external partners. This is a remote position that will cover Key Accounts in the assigned region. Candidate must be based within that region or within a reasonable daily commuting distance. Ability to travel 60-80% over a broad geography is required, with the ability to drive and/or fly within the territory. No relocation available.   Preferred Qualifications: Experience across therapeutic groups, disease states and new product launches. Understanding of managed care environments and account management strategy. Knowledge of buy-and-bill, access, reimbursement resources, and product acquisition. Experience working with established injection networks.   Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:  Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity, and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.  Division  PHARMA  Business Unit  US PHARMA  Country  USA  Work Location  Sarasota, FL  Company/Legal Entity  Novartis Pharmaceuticals  Functional Area  Sales  Job Type  Full Time  Employment Type  Regular  Shift Work  No  Early Talent  No

Job Description  BlueOptima is NOT where you figure out if a career in sales is for you. As a Business Development Representative, you know what you’re getting into. You love the ups and downs of seeking out the right contact!  Calls, Emails, LinkedIn outreach will be the norm. You’ll bounce back with a new strategy when you don’t get a yes the first time.  A passion for technology is also a big plus! That’s how you’ll thrive as a Business Development Representative (BDR) at BlueOptima.  At BlueOptima, you’ll be immersed in the full sales-cycle - from generating that initial lead, all the way to helping close the deal with major national and international clients.  Our experienced Sales team will give you all the mentoring and support you need, and as much responsibility as you can handle!  With BlueOptima, the exposure you will receive to the cutting edge of software sales (from sales technique training to client relationship management) will put you at the forefront of a growth sector that is the future of the economy.  Additional Information  You can be a part of our next step, working with a group that will coach you, support you, provide step by step training to be successful and cheer you on to your wins!  Oh, and did we mention a generous PTO plan, lots of company outings, snacks, an amazing dog-friendly office and flexible work schedule? Also working with a global company opens up travel opportunities!  Go ahead, apply already.  BlueOptima an equal opportunity employer. We are a welcoming place for everyone, and we do our best to ensure all people feel supported and connected at work.  Renumeration: $40K-45.5K base + 6K bonus + uncapped commission

description: About the role and team Adform is a leader in the ad technology and programmatic media buying space with nearly 700 employees, 30K customers and 29 global offices. We’re in the Gartner “Magic Quadrant” with marquee customers such as Ikea, BMW, Progressive, Tiffany’s, H&M and Kaiser Permanente. We’re growing in the USA and could use your help! This is a key hire at Adform that can have a major impact on our business.  At Adform, we know that the key to growth is in a high-performing sales team. That’s why we’re seeking a qualified sales development representative (SDR) to find and screen potential customers who can benefit from our products and services. As the first line of communication with prospects, ideal SDRs have a strong understanding of the sales process, excelling at researching leads, starting new relationships, and setting our sales closers up for success. You should be a quick learner with strong communication skills, and have the ability to showcase our offerings in a compelling way. Every potential customer is an opportunity for you to boost top-line revenue growth, customer acquisition levels, and profitability.  Your responsibilities Represent our company’s products and services, starting with a comprehensive understanding and leading to consumer research to identify how our solutions meet needs Generate leads and build relationships by nurturing warm prospects and finding new potential sales outlets Manage and maintain a pipeline of interested prospects and engage sales executives for next steps Identify best practices to refine the company’s lead generation playbook Utilize Salesforce, cold calling, and email to generate new sales opportunities Identify prospect's needs and suggest appropriate products/services Build long-term trusting relationships with prospects to qualify leads as sales opportunities Proactively seek new business opportunities in the market Set up meetings or calls between (prospective) customers and sales executives Report to sales manager with weekly, monthly, and quarterly results  We expect you have Bachelor’s degree or at least 5 years of relevant work experience 2-3 years of sales experience, with a history of exceeding lead targets Strong communication skills via phone and email Proven creative problem-solving approach and strong analytical skills Strong desire and ability to move up within a sales organization Proactive personality with excellent organizational and problem-solving skills  It would be an advantage if you: Understanding of the programmatic and/or ad technology space. Proficiency with SalesForce or other CRM software Prior experience as a sales development rep with a track record of achieving sales quotes  Our promise Experienced and professional team Challenging and exciting work environment with collaborative team mates sharing local and global objectives. Dynamic, inspiring and international team-oriented „learning“ environment Informal style of leadership and communication – but with the highest expectations of performance and professionalism Possibilities to learn and work with experts from different countries (offices around the world) Other standard benefits: comprehensive health insurance plan, team buildings efforts, competitive compensation and the opportunity to develop and have an impact in a fast-paced, dynamic and rigorous environment etc.  About us Adform is the only global, independent and fully integrated advertising platform built for modern marketing. Its unique enterprise technology – Adform FLOW – harnesses superior user experience and a scalable, modular and open architecture, to enable seamless management of the whole campaign lifecycle. It provides clients with enhanced control and transparency across their advertising operations, including ownership of all data from their campaigns. Since 2002, Adform has developed technology to enhance human/machine collaboration and deliver augmented intelligence, thereby amplifying business results for its clients around the world.

The ideal candidate will be responsible for driving the company's key performance indicators by delivering an exceptional in-store experience. In order to do this, the candidate will build and train an effective team, and effectively incorporate business trends and customer feedback into the training of employees.    Responsibilities Build effective relationships with associates, peers and supervisor to develop a high performing team Analyze reporting and business trends to make strategic decisions to drive results Directly supervise the business, ensuring, and maintaining high quality standards Consistently assess and provide ongoing performance feedback to all levels of team members  Qualifications Minimum high school education or equivalent 2+ years' of retail or equivalent management experience Strong verbal or written communication skills

Title: Territory Manager  Company: Cutting edge technology-based medical company with exclusive distribution rights to numerous products is building a specialized national team.  Description: Our well-established Company is on the hunt for the best of the best. We specialize in a best-in-class office-based wound care treatment program. We have a strong track record of generating long-term sales due to our industry best products, customer service, and technology-based solutions.  Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in healthcare or related field.  A minimum of 5-years of experience in wound care.  Must have established book of business in wound care clinics (i.e.: private practice, home visits, nursing homes, etc.)  Must complete Company training and follow corporate guidelines.  The right candidate will have a can-do attitude and will exemplify Company integrity and compassion for patients.  Compensation: Base salary $75K, uncapped commissions total at plan compensation is $290K. Top Reps making much more!

Job Summary  COMPANY OVERVIEW  We are seeking an enthusiastic, results-driven Director of Sales to lead the sales efforts at our Lincoln, RI Residence Inn . Bring your sales, networking, and guest services skills to help build our client base prior to opening and deliver the guest experience that the Residence Inn is known for!  A successful Director of Sales will drive business by sharing our brand of hospitality with potential corporate, group and leisure guests. They will use their warm and professional personality to develop and build long term relationships with our key clients. A Director of Sales is an expert in negotiating and delivering win-win deals for the hotel and the client, as well as leading the team to deliver on those expectations.  Responsibilities  Develop and maintain a marketing plan and sales budget with the General Manager.  Solicit new and existing business accounts to meet and exceed revenue goals predominately through outside sales calls, relationships, telephone solicitation, site tours and written communication/collateral.  Develop/maintain knowledge of market trends, competition and customers.  Attend trade shows, community events and industry meetings.  Prepare correspondence to customers, internal booking reports and file maintenance.  Finalize all books/contracts in a timely manner servicing guests through the process.  Participate in revenue management call, pre-convention meetings, training and other sales-related meetings.  Assist with hotel budget planning, sales and revenue forecasting and actively participate in the hotel’s revenue management process.  Pursue new clients through creative/innovative sales techniques.  Qualify clients, develop proposals, and prepare contracts.  Initiate and implement sales promotional programs with travel partners.  Anticipate guests’ needs, respond promptly, and acknowledge all guests.  Train front desk staff and other applicable staff members on sales call process.  Conduct on-site tours, when needed.  Follow-up on group business (pending, tentative and booked) to ensure client satisfaction and materialization at hotel.  Qualifications  Possess proficient computer skills including knowledge of MS Office products, knowledge of brand operating systems preferred.  Knowledge of sales process, client base, and general market knowledge.  Ability to investigate and analyze current activities or information in the sales field and make logical conclusions and recommendations.  Ability to negotiate, convince, sell and influence professionals and hotel guests.  Knowledge of revenue management and ability to successfully forecast business on both short-term and long-term basis.  Able to develop and maintain rapport with key community contacts to ensure a visible presence in the community.  Able to study, analyze and interpret complex activities and/or information in order to improve new practices or develop new approaches.  Benefits  Associate Hotel Discounts Worldwide!  PTO Accrual from day one!  Health, Dental and Vision Insurance  401(k) with Employer Match  Short Term & Long Term Disability Insurance  Paid Life Insurance  Employee Assistance Program

jobTitle: Zone Sales Leader Designate - Atlantic Region
description: Auto req ID: 241929BR  Job Description  We are PepsiCo Sales. We are game changers, mountain movers and history makers. We are a diverse group, spread among 200 countries and united by a shared set of values and goals. That’s why we Perform with Purpose. Together, we blaze new trails, succeed, celebrate and never settle for second best. At PepsiCo, we’re committed to performing well as individuals and in teams, to strengthen the company as a whole.  Are you hungry to be a part of the World’s largest portfolio of billion dollar food and beverage brands? Then now is the time to explore the opportunities at PepsiCo; what makes you unique, makes us better.  Frito Lay is PepsiCo’s snack manufacturing, sales and distribution operating unit. They have the world’s largest portfolio of billion dollar foods and are specifically responsible for the growth of some of America’s favorite snack foods, including Fritos®, Lay's®, Doritos®, Cheetos®, and Tostitos®.  As a Zone Sales Director Designate for Frito Lay you will complete a 6- 9 month training program to assimilate and develop the critical skills to successfully promote into the Zone Sales Director position. Upon successful completion of the training program you’ll receive certification that you have acquired the necessary foundational skills for a future as a Sales Director. Training can take place in Charlotte, NC, Knoxville, TN, Baltimore, MD or Raleigh, NC then relocation would be required based on business need. Relocation benefits will be available for you to then take ownership of your own Zone and begin an accelerated career path as a PepsiCo Sales Leader. Working with dynamic brands, leading large teams, solving complex business challenges, crafting strategic customer solutions, and having the opportunity to win every single day are all possible in this role.  Key Responsibilities For a Zone Sales Director Designate Include Daily sales execution for approximately $90-$120 million in annual sales. Management of over 100 sales associates across 10-15 districts led by frontline Sales Supervisors. Lead and influence day-to-day sales execution of this large sales team including, but not limited to, sales, logistics, inventory, scheduling, training, performance management and people development. Meet or exceed sales objectives while maintaining an assigned selling expense budget Identify, coach, motivate and lead a team of District Sales Leaders to deliver business and people targets Focus on achieving people metrics goals with a long term People Strategy for the Zone Influence internal business partners to support the Zone Recommend improvements and implement new processes and programs where necessary Lead change initiatives effectively ensuring ongoing communication with frontline employees and managers and ensuring ongoing input as the project progresses Qualifications/Requirements Bachelor's Degree; MBA preferred 7+ years sales leadership experience with an established track record of leading and influencing large multi-level teams Compelling interpersonal skills with the ability to craft powerful and persuasive messages Dedication and ability to succeed within a dynamic organization Business & financial acumen Expertise with expense management and/or managing a P&L Mobile (either regionally or nationally) once your designate training is completed This position is limited to persons with indefinite right to work in the United States. Must have a valid driver’s license Safe driving record strongly preferred Department of Transportation physical and/or certification may also be required. Willing to drive a step van during training. Sales strategy, customer marketing, knowledge of DSD system, and retail experience strongly encouraged Expected salary range $100k Relocation Eligible: Not Eligible for Relocation  Job Type: Regular  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or disability status.  PepsiCo is an Equal Opportunity Employer: Female / Minority / Disability / Protected Veteran / Sexual Orientation / Gender Identity  Our Company will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, and all other applicable laws, including but not limited to, San Francisco Police Code Sections 4901 - 4919, commonly referred to as the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance; and Chapter XVII, Article 9 of the Los Angeles Municipal Code, commonly referred to as the Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.  If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please download the available EEO is the Law & EEO is the Law Supplement documents. View PepsiCo EEO Policy  Please view our Pay Transparency Statement

At LegitScript, we are passionate about making the internet and payment ecosystems safer and more transparent. We help companies of all sizes keep their services legal and safe for consumers. To do this, LegitScript combines big data with the world's leading team of experts skilled in highly regulated and complex sectors, including transaction laundering detection, pharmaceuticals, online gambling, and more.  The result? Unmatched accuracy and deep risk analysis that identifies which commercial entities play by the rules, and which do not. Our diverse industry partnerships provide unique insights that keep businesses and governments at the forefront of emerging trends. That's why LegitScript is trusted by the world's largest search engines, internet platforms, payment companies, and regulatory agencies.  We are seeking a Sales Development Rep to join our growing Sales team. The SDR is tasked with identifying and generating sales opportunities and qualifying leads through outbound activities. The right candidate will be one who works well under pressure, thinks out-of-the-box, easily initiates relaxed, but informative conversations with prospects, and is highly self-motivated. The right candidate will also understand how to assess a company's needs and cater the outreach to each prospect specifically.  Candidates will have the option to be fully remote or partially in the office based in Northwest Portland.  What You'll Do Enthusiastically working on outbound activities, representing the company in a highly professional manner. Thoroughly and accurately answering prospect questions and providing appropriate additional information to the Account Executives Capturing accurate and legible documentation for all activity, recording information in LegitScript's customer relationship management solution. Consistently maintaining departmental standards for quality. Achieving defined productivity goals. Meeting all company policies and procedures. Working with weekly schedules relating to activity volume. Working closely with Marketing to build campaigns that ensure lead quality and quantity. What You'll Bring 1+ years in a sales related experience Expert knowledge of Outbound Digital Sales Tools (Linkedin, Outreach, etc) Excellent written and verbal communication skills are essential, as well as effective organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritization skills. Tenacious, hard-working, highly organized and self-motivated. Friendly and enthusiastic. Strong listening skills. Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, other languages are advantageous. Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position.  In addition to competitive salaries, full-time employees enjoy a great benefits package: Multiple Medical plans (one with $0 employee premium option), Dental & Vision plans 401k with company match and immediate vesting Generous paid time off package and 11 paid holidays Volunteer time off And much more! If you got to this point, we hope you're feeling excited about the job description you just read. Even if you don't feel that you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people that believe in LegitScript's mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of ways - not just candidates who check all the boxes.  Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. LegitScript does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with LegitScript.  Candidates must be authorized to work in the US. LegitScript does not offer visa sponsorship at this time. LegitScript is an Equal Opportunity Employer that abides by federal and state laws that prohibit discrimination against all individuals based on their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation or national origin; or their status as protected veterans or individuals with disabilities.

Regional Sales Consultant – Central Region Remote-Home Office (available CT and for periodic travel to customer visits once restrictions lifted) If you are an inside salesperson, account manager, business development manager or account executive this role is for you!  The Myers-Briggs Company, the worlds most recognized name in supporting talent development, is looking for another A player for its US Enterprise Sales team. We are looking for someone who understands that attitude, emotional intelligence, urgency and a strong commitment to accountability are the cornerstones of success in their roles.  This position would be ideal for someone who has a proven record as a player coach or for that very special person who has been overachieving as an individual contributor and thinks they are ready to take this to the next level  The Regional Sales Consultant, SE is a true player/coach role who will be responsible for initiating, developing, and establishing new business within the region, to increase and grow revenue streams, while sustaining existing business in states within the assigned territory of the South East region. Leverage sales methodology (i.e. Sandler) to ensure sales processes are used methodically to drive successful outcomes in a B2B market. Use industry expertise to coach, manage and develop regional Customer Success Representatives to develop their capabilities to identify, develop and close new opportunities. Maintain current and accurate customer contact database (Salesforce) and manage customer accounts engagement with The Myers- Briggs Company product and services.  Your responsibilities will include: Attainment of Identified Accounts Revenue Goal - Work in tandem with Customer Success Reps within the territory to complete daily tasks and strategy. Initiate conduct and follow-up on sales calls designed to grow MB strategic market(s). Conduct regular schedule of meetings (in-person and remote) with region’s Top 150 customers, F1000 customers & to prospective customers in MB’s strategic market(s), conduct regional business development strategy to develop and expand portfolio of customers within region. Daily use of Salesforce.com tasks, leads module and Opportunity pipeline is required. Lead Regional Account Revenue Strategy Meetings on a weekly basis. When required, provide appropriate client participants for MBC product review panels, focus groups, testimonials, case studies and other customer-based input requirements. Collect and add customer needs/trends information in MBC strategic market(s) to Salesforce.com CRM to keep it current. Respond to the Senior Vice President, Global Sales with accurate and well-researched data to requests for customer/market-based information. Manage Regional Customer Success Representatives by working closely to consistently hit or exceed individual quarterly sales quotas and KPIs, while executing on the key strategies for their region. Partner with and support the SVP of Global Sales to finalize, rollout and monitor the achievement of KPIs within team thru coaching and development opportunities. Provide ongoing performance coaching to ensure team success that includes developing and delivering performance evaluations and goals for each Representative. Proactively identify and partner HR to effectively address and manage performance or employee relations issues to resolution. Lead regional progress meetings to identify trends across the regional sales team, identifying barriers (and steps to remove along with timeline) as well as key learnings. Report out regularly on progress and status to SVP of Global Sales. Gathering and leveraging actionable insights from the market in order to drive performance  Your Professional Experience Includes: 3+ years of Consultative Sales experience at the enterprise level. Proven closer who fully understands pipeline dynamics, enterprise selling methodology 3+ years experience managing employees Personality that exhibits and understands the performance value of urgency, transparency, accountability and goal based time management Strong EQ, Learning Agility and Critical Thinking skills Training and high-level execution skills in sourcing new business in a timely, stage driven methodology Experience with ERP systems, Salesforce.com and any outreach Basic math competency; strong analytical skills; excellent communication skills Excellent written and verbal communication skills. B.A. or B.S. degree required   Our corporate culture is mission driven. We are a certified B Corp and a California benefit corporation, taking all stakeholders (including our employees, community, customers, and the environment) into account to make a positive difference. We have a culture that is emotionally intelligent, aligned, results-focused, cross-functional and committed to the professional development of all employees.  While we’re best known for our products like the Myers-Briggs Type Indicator® assessment (MBTI®), our reach extends well beyond a single instrument. We are a group of professionals who provide expertise in the talent development industry, as well as to career counselor and educators and individual consumers. We offer solutions to help improve individual and organizational performance and address whatever people development challenges businesses and professionals face – from team building, leadership, coaching, and conflict management to career development, selection, and retention. Perhaps this is why millions of individuals in more than 170 countries use our products and services each year. Our customers include the majority of the Fortune 500 companies, as well as businesses of all sizes, educators, government agencies, training and development consultants and consumers looking to understand themselves better.  Working at The Myers-Briggs Company gives you the opportunity to make a positive difference, be accountable, experience genuine respect from your colleagues and peers, and feel valued and supported. We work to create an environment that fosters excellence and encourages employees to contribute, learn, and grow throughout their career.  Our company is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, or status as a qualified individual with disability.
jobFunction: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service

description: About Stryker  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and, together with our customers, is driven to make healthcare better. We offer innovative products and services in Orthopaedics, Medical and Surgical, and Neurotechnology and Spine that help improve patient and hospital outcomes. We are proud to be named one of the World’s Best Workplaces and a Best Workplace for Diversity by Fortune Magazine. Learn more about our award-winning organization by visiting stryker.com  Sage Associate Sales Representative  Who We Want Hard-working winners. Confident, competitive and results-oriented salespeople who create a track record of success. Persuasive influencers. People who understand market positioning and can use their relationship skills and depth of knowledge to secure buy-in, cooperation, and loyalty. Teammates. Partners who listen to ideas, share thoughts and work together to move the business forward. Mission-driven salespeople. Fiercely intense representatives with an unparalleled work ethic and drive to live out their purpose of changing people’s lives and making healthcare better. What You Will Do As an Associate Sales Representative you will promote Sage Products to nurses/clinicians and appropriate hospital staff while providing excellent customer service and developing customer relationships. You are responsible for following extensive product training, to be able to tailor promotional messages based upon knowledge of the customer, advice on appropriate product selection, answer customer questions about product functionality and distinguish Sage’s products from competitors. You will assist in hospital surveys as well as post-sale implementation and training including ensuring customer adoption and satisfaction. You focus on customer satisfaction by demonstrating teamwork and empowerment, solving problems through a consultative approach, operating with honesty and integrity and providing a highly responsive and unsurpassed level of customer service. You will assist in preparation and operation of trade shows, conventions and clinical meetings. You understand and adhere to all facility protocols and pertinent OSHA guidelines when conducting product evaluation. As an Associate Sales Representative, you are driven to solve real problems and make healthcare better for our customers and the patients they serve. What You Need Bachelor’s degree required 1+ years of job experience. If no experience, must have business to business experience via an internship. Strong inter-personal communication skills specifically relating to stress management, people management and conflict management. Excellent time management, project management, reports and budget, and customer service skills. Knowledge of marketing, market research, new product development, new product introduction, P/L management, and field testing. What We Offer A winning team driven to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results Quality products that improve the lives of customers and patients Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your own career Learn more about the Sage Infection and Injury Prevention Products:  www.sageproducts.com  About Stryker  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including reconstructive, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology and spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, or protected veteran status.  Know someone at Stryker?  Be sure to have them submit you as a referral prior to applying for this position. Learn more about our employee referral program.

description: What we expect  The first 3 letters in workplace safety are Y-O-U!  TK Elevator is currently seeking an individual to join us in our Sales Development Program in Cleveland, OH. The Sales Development Program will coach individuals to advance into sales and leadership positions to effectively manage our business and interact with internal and external customers, all within a safe environment.  Program Requirements Bachelor’s degree Successful completion of 2 phases of training Be open to relocation based on company needs after successful completion of the program, with expenses paid Phase I – Field Sales Training Gain an understanding of the company’s safety culture and policies by participating in the orientation class and safety training Gain an understanding and experience of operations including new installation, modernization, repair and service of elevator Complete online training modules and attend training events to gain a better understanding of the company and its products and services Develop and deliver weekly presentations as well as a final presentation at the end of phase one training Phase II – Office Sales Training Participate in a number of activities associated with elevator sales, including New Installation Sales, Modernization Sales, Service Sales and Repair Sales Shadow sales representatives in all lines of business to gain an understanding of the area business markets Complete online training modules and attend training events to gain a better understanding of the company and its products and services Gain a strong understanding of TK Elevator, it’s mission and objectives, customer focus, safety, ethical standards, and compliance Who we are looking for Bachelor’s Degree required Strong computer skills and math aptitude Technical aptitude to learn new software (Oracle, SAP, or other ERP systems) Strong organizational, written and oral communications skills This position requires up to 15% travel Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions Additional information  TK Elevator is an equal opportunity employer and committed to diversity. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, gender, race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age and veteran status or any other protected status required by applicable law.  Applicants with disabilities who require reasonable accommodation in connection with the application process are encouraged to contact us directly at 1-844-427-5461.
