description: The ideal candidate will be an experienced sales person who is comfortable generating sales lead with new clients and maintaining relationships with existing ones. This candidate will be able to understand a prospective client's needs and offer an ideal solution. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills and have a positive track record of exceeding outlined goals.   Responsibilities Identify and target sales lead Build and maintain relationships with clients Set and exceed sales quotas Prospect clients and understand their needs  Qualifications Proficient in Microsoft Office suite and customer relationship management software Demonstrated ability to set goals and achieve them Strong communication skills and understanding of sales process Good understanding of technology Good understanding of market rates Solid negotiations skills  Compensation This is a commission based position with no cap on paid out commission.

At Alfa Laval, we always go that extra mile to overcome the toughest challenges. Our driving force is to accelerate success for our customers, people and planet. You can only achieve that by having dedicated people with a curious mind. Curiosity is the spark behind great ideas. And great ideas drive progress.  Who You Are  You are a self-motivated team player with the ability to easily network in an international and cross-cultural environment, working in line with Alfa Laval drivers; Action, Interaction, and Satisfaction. You are driven and see solutions rather than problems, effectively prioritizing and executing tasks. You build relationships with trust and follow-through.  About The Job  We’re adding to our Field Sales team for the Western region. Make an impact selling our separation technologies and services in municipal and industrial wastewater. Capital & Service Sales Separation technologies business in municipal & industrial wastewater. Remote candidates encouraged to apply, if located within our Western Region.  As a Part Of The Team, You Will  In this role, you will have the opportunity to represent a global manufacturing leader in this space. Grow account base within the Western region, traveling to customer sites as needed Use the CRM tool and other tools in a consistent and qualitative way, to support the sales process Maintain strong working relationship with regional sales and technical services group counterparts Maintain a focus on replacement opportunities in the existing installed base Prioritize market presence of sales opportunities Act as a liaison with central Business Unit counterparts for new applications, products and competitive intelligence Develop key account coverage with current and prospective customers’ technology decision makers What You Know  You have a Bachelor’s Degree, ideally in Engineering, and: 5+ years of experience in water and wastewater markets Ability to travel 50-75% throughout Western region Physical and Environmental Factors: May be required to lift up to 50 pounds. Locations include municipal and industrial wastewater treatment plants.  What’s in it for you?  We offer a challenging position in an open and friendly environment where we help each other to develop and create value. Your work will have a true impact on Alfa Laval’s future success. Our benefits-eligible associates enjoy healthcare, dental and vision plans, a robust wellness program, generous 401(k), paid holidays, paid time off benefits, and more.  EEO/Vet/Disabled Employer

Bryan Equipment Sales, Inc., a STIHL outdoor power equipment distributor located in Loveland, Ohio, is seeking a Territory Manager to maintain and grow sales with an existing retailer base, while prospecting new business, in Southeast Michigan.  Responsibilities include analyzing and evaluating opportunities and then developing, maintaining, and executing a business plan for the specific territory above with quarterly update as to the progress. Organize call plan using ABC/123 process and maintain monthly calendar reflecting schedule of call plan. Establish, develop, and maintain qualified STIHL retailers in the marketplace through sales, technical, and business trainings. This requires the ability to use and demonstrate all products. The individual will need to monitor and report market and retail sales conditions regularly as assigned and develop and maintain long-term business relationships with retailers. Required attendance of sales meetings, trainings, trade shows, product demonstrations and other events will make moderate overnight travel mandatory. Position requires a very high degree of interpersonal skills, enthusiasm, and leadership to motivate, persuade, and inspire retailers. The successful candidate must be self-motivated, confident, decisive, and action oriented. Good problem-solving and communication skills are required.  The qualified candidate should have a bachelor’s degree from a four year college or university; or 5 to 10 years industry experience; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Individuals must possess a valid driving license, a good driving record and reside in the greater metropolitan Detroit, Michigan area.  Bryan Equipment Sales Inc. offers a competitive salary with bonus potential, company vehicle, and a comprehensive benefits package.  For over 70 years, Bryan Equipment Sales, Inc. has been distributing outdoor power equipment tools to the full servicing retailer. We are one of the leading distributors in the OPE industry, as well as the number one distributor of STIHL power tools in the USA. We have aggressively marketed this product since 1967 to our six state region, consisting of: Indiana, Kentucky, Michigan, Ohio, middle and western Tennessee, and West Virginia.

Job Title: Sales Representative  Requisition ID: 173458BR  When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, like helping customers in finding cures for cancer, protecting the environment or making sure our food is safe. Your work will have real-world impact, and you’ll be supported in achieving your career goals.  Location/Division Specific Information  Omaha, Nebraska  How will you make an impact?  Our Sales Representatives are responsible for the sales of research products and services within a defined territory. They maintain effective customer relations, develop opportunities for growth within an existing customer base, and assure market penetration and profitability while achieving sales and profit forecasts. This is an excellent opportunity for an energetic professional who is looking to gain experience in Sales with a company that is a world leader in their industry!  What will you do? Develop and maintain effective customer relations with purchasing and end user within assigned territory Manage pricing within territory to control profitability Inform customers of supply and price trends and assist in inventory control, consults with customers. How will you get here?  Education  Bachelor’s degree, required  Prior sales experience, preferably in the research laboratory industry, or lab experience is an asset  Experience Strong industry, pharmaceutical and science background Able and willing to travel to customer locations Maintaining accurate reports, records, and files necessary for proper management of territory Knowledge, Skills, Abilities Researching competitors and industry activity and to keeping up to date on new products/services and other general information, Perform sales calls and vendor relations with all customers and potential customers in the assigned territory. Independently make decisions, but also utilize available resources to meet customers needs and work effectively with cross-functional team of supplier and internal resources; seek out broader relationships within the account to help facilitate networking and prospecting. At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 80,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. StorMagic is looking to fill a foundational position of OEM Sales Representative. Reporting to the CRO, the successful candidate will be a strategic thinker and problem-solver with demonstrated ability to communicate, collaborate and drive business partnerships to revenue outcomes. The goal of OEM sales is to ensure we foster a deep and trusted relationship with other technology providers, while simultaneously creating plans that monetize our partnership in the market. In this "big startup" environment, it is critical that the successful candidate be a hands on, roll up the sleeves, get stuff done person. This is a job for a doer not a delegator.  This is a work from home/remote role with occassional travel required.  Who We Are StorMagic is an international software company, founded in 2006 with ambitious plans for growth. We started as a software-defined storage company but through recent acquisitions in enterprise key management and digital asset management software, we are now focussed on delivering software solutions that meet the growing needs of customers at the edge.  Data generated at the edge is growing exponentially and customers are having issues storing, protecting and using all of this data to help them analyze and grow their business. Industry analysts projected that the amount of data created globally outside the datacenter and cloud to be 10% just 2 years ago and project that it will be 75% by 2025.  Our existing products, SvSAN, SvKMS and ARQvault, simplify storage, security and digital asset management at the edge by enabling simple, robust and flexible solutions for large and small enterprises. We have over 1,600 customers around the world that trust us to deliver.  At StorMagic, we view collaboration as one of our main drivers for success and we are open to all our employees to share their thoughts and ideas to help both to turn our bold vision into a reality and to make StorMagic a great place to work.  Your responsibilities will include: Manage existing and prospect into new tier 1 technology company partners, such as HPE, Lenovo, Supermicro, etc... Develop strategic business plans to grow the adoption of StorMagic solutions as an embedded or add-on solution Work the partner and StorMagic field sales teams to ensure partnerships are monetized, by fostering strong relationships and developing executable go-to-market plans Work with StorMagic internal associates, primarily solutions architects and sales representatives, to support sales and account expansion efforts with key accounts in the field Provide sales support to partner sales teams through training, RFP proposals, technical and administrative information on StorMagic offerings  Create strategic and tactical plans for new business development while guiding the extended sales team in using these plans to maximize revenue and growth. Accurately forecast and close sales that align with company goals  Requirements of the Candidate: 5+ years of Business Development managing and monetizing OEM partnerships with large, multinational technology partners (i.e. HPE, Lenovo or similar) Able to freely travel internationally Extensive rolodex of key players within the industry - preference given to those at HPE, Lenovo, Supermicro, etc... College Degree preferred, but not required. Solid understanding of SalesForce and how to manage daily tasks and reports.  Ability to work as part of a fast-paced team while demonstrating flexibility and initiative. Excellent communication skills and presentations skills.  Salary and benefits We believe that our people’s wellbeing and development are key to our success and we offer benefits to our employees with this in mind including:  Competitive Salary Ample Vacation Days Structured Development and access to a range of Training Materials (StorMagic will provide you with training, tools, and a team of professionals to support your efforts.) Flexible Working Arrangements Fantastic Life and Medical Benefits 401K contributions matched up to 5%

description: Altec specializes in the manufacture, sale and service of aerial devices, digger derricks, cranes and specialty equipment for the electric utility, telecommunications, tree care, construction, and light and sign maintenance industries in more than 120 countries throughout the world.  Altec Supply is currently looking for an Outside Sales Representative / Account Manager located in Houston, TX; Austin, TX; San Antonio, TX; and surrounding areas. Altec Supply provides aftermarket parts, accessories and service needs for our customer's equipment. Primary responsibilities include the following:  Produce sales of products in a designated area or designated account(s) to meet pre-established quotas. Manage and support the designated area of responsibility consistent with Altec values. Utilize skills in territory management, account management, and time management. Perform sales calls, presentations, and product demonstrations. Assist in establishing quotas, pricing, forecasting, and receivables collections. Attend product/sales meetings. Develop external and internal personal customer relationships. Complete all sales related paperwork such as sales call logs and expense reports. Maintain a high level of customer service. Produce product sales to meet or exceed established quota. Build and maintain customer profiles and market data. Ensure that sales strategic plan and critical issues are met.  Please apply directly on our website https://jobs.altec.com/  U.S. Military Veterans and Spouses are Encouraged to Apply See https://altecveteranrecruiting.com   Education, Experience, and Skills Required Four-year Bachelor's Degree required. Current valid driver’s license required. At least two years of applicable experience preferred.  Product and/or industry knowledge preferred. Must be available for moderate overnight travel. Total communication and information processing skills are required. PC skills using spreadsheets, word processing, and other office management applications required.  The job level is able to be adjusted at time of hire, if the candidate meets the qualifications for jobs of a more experienced level in the career path.   Customer First - Enjoyment of Work - Family - Financial Stability - Integrity - People are our Greatest Strength - Quality - Spiritual Development – Teamwork  Competitive pay which rewards performance  Comprehensive benefits including Medical, Dental and Prescription Drug Program - Retirement 401(k) Program - Vacation and Holidays - Flexible Spending Accounts - Tuition Assistance Program - Employee Assistance and Mental Health/Substance Abuse Program - Life Insurance, Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance Altec Industries, Inc. and its affiliates are equal opportunity employers and maintain affirmative action plans to recruit, retain, develop, and promote qualified individuals without unlawful consideration of race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Altec strives to maintain a work environment free from unlawful discrimination and harassment, where associates are treated with respect and dignity.

Welcome to Planet. We believe in using space to help life on Earth.  Planet designs, builds, and operates the largest constellation of imaging satellites in history. This constellation delivers an unprecedented dataset of empirical information via a revolutionary cloud-based platform to authoritative figures in commercial, environmental, and humanitarian sectors. We are both a space company and data company all rolled into one.  Customers and users across the globe use Planet's data to develop new technologies, drive revenue, power research, and solve our world’s toughest obstacles.  As we control every component of hardware design, manufacturing, data processing, and software engineering, our office is a truly inspiring mix of experts from a variety of domains.  We have a people-centric approach toward culture and community and we strive to iterate in a way that puts our team members first and prepares our company for growth. Join Planet and be a part of our mission to change the way people see the world.  Planet is headquartered in San Francisco, California, Earth.  Impact You'll Own  We are seeking a VP of Sales to lead our efforts and our team in the European, Middle Eastern and African Regions. The ideal candidate is a self-starter, independent thinker, and can think laterally to bring our data into new market segments. You will be responsible to understand the nuances of these markets and how to most effectively bring our data into the following sectors: commercial accounts, government accounts, and partners. You will work closely with your team to identify, qualify, negotiate and close large-scale complex deals and drive sales revenue targets. You will have a technical understanding of geo-spatial imagery products, and know the customer segments in the market. Above all else, enjoy our unique value proposition by simplifying complex commercial challenges and explaining why and how our geospatial data can address them.  What You Bring Customer first approach, always keeping customers in mind when driving the business forward A growth mindset and strong people development focus to; build, nurture and support a talented and rapidly evolving Sales organization Highly collaborative and inclusive leadership style, able to work together with adjacent teams, senior leaders and Execs to drive the business forward together as one team A strong history of exceeding revenue to targets, penetrating new markets and building thriving sales teams Ability to inspect, manage and influence the business, with rigour around pipeline management and forecast accuracy Experience selling to enterprise customers with demonstrable understanding of sales life cycles Strong enterprise, SaaS, and PaaS technical sales experience with tangible metrics of success Ability to source, sell, co-sell, and close large deals Business mindset, able to develop and own the strategy for the region Experience working with solution partners and strategic alliances Ability to act as a bridge between the company and its current market and future markets Excellent communication skills, including multiple languages Self-starter, able to work independently under tight deadlines in start-up environment Strong judgment and decision-making skills The ability to interact successfully across cultures Critical thinking and creative problem-solving skills What Makes You Stand Out Vertical specific expertise a strong plus (agriculture, commodities, energy, insurance, forestry, government sales) Product development & product positioning experience Sales Ops experience (CRM, collateral development, pipeline tracking, etc) Benefits While Working At Planet  Global Be part of a vibrant international company of 45+ nationalities with office locations in different countries Sense of belonging in a diverse and inclusive culture Experience a fast-paced spacetech environment Countless opportunities to connect within and outside of work with regular team events Personal development with annual L&D budget Join our regular hack-weeks and meetup events to exchange knowledge Employee Resource Groups that provide safe and empowering spaces for connection and mentorship Give back to the community by using one day per quarter for charitable work as part of our 1% Pledge Health programs and flexible working hours to support work life balance Be part of our growth: we offer RSUs for our employees Daily virtual mindful bodywork sessions to stay healthy We offer equipment and wellbeing support during these challenging times Berlin Enjoy a spacious central office located in U/S-bahn Zoologischer Garten Employees’ well-being is our top priority: on site massages, snacks, fruits, drinks and company lunches Additional contributions to Company Pension schemes Enjoy unique offers and discounts for companies/web shops Additional Company Holidays Offsites and Happy Hours Volunteering Benefits Some Press About Us  Our CEO, Will Marshall featured on TED and featured in a Planet Blog  “Planet: Bringing Space Back Down to Earth”  Tiny, privately owned satellites are changing how we view the Earth features in NBC News  “Planet And Rocket Lab Create Mission Patch To Honor Women In Aerospace” —Planet Blog  Why We Care So Much About Belonging.  We’re dedicated to helping the whole Planet, and to do that we must strive to represent all of it within each of our offices and on all of our teams. That’s why Planet is guided by an ultimate north star of Belonging, dreaming big as we approach our ongoing work with diversity, equity and inclusion. If this job intrigues you, but you’re thinking you might not have all the qualifications, please... do apply! At Planet, we are looking for well-rounded people from around the world who can contribute to more ways than just what is listed in this job description. We don’t just fill positions, we aspire to fulfill people’s careers, most excited about folks who are motivated by our underlying humanitarian efforts. We are a few orbits around the sun before we get to where we want to be, so we hope you’re excited to come along for the ride.

description: GitLab's DevOps platform empowers 100,000+ organizations to deliver software faster and more efficiently. We are one of the world’s largest all-remote companies with 1,400+ team members and values that guide a culture where people embrace the belief that everyone can contribute .  This position is 100% remote, based in North America.  GitLab is looking for an enthusiastic and strategic Sales Development Representative (SDR), to join our growing Revenue Marketing team. As a SDR at GitLab, you get the opportunity to lead the initial outreach to targeted Enterprise accounts working in conjunction with the Field and Digital Marketing teams. In this role you will leverage creative marketing and sales tactics to prospect and engage with multiple buyer personas and roles to introduce GitLab’s value. You will be responsible for generating qualified meetings and pipeline for GitLab's Sales organization.  Don’t have a ton of knowledge about GitLab yet? Don’t worry. We have an extensive onboarding and training program at GitLab and you will be provided with necessary DevOps and GitLab knowledge to fulfill your role.  What you'll do in this role Effectively manage inbound lead flow as well as executing outbound prospecting initiative Conduct high-level discovery conversations in target accounts Meet or exceed SDR sourced Sales Accepted Opportunity (SAO) volume targets Collaborate with and leverage teammates to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities Utilize business and industry knowledge to research accounts, identify key players, generate interest, create/identify compelling events, and develop accounts Work to have a variety of touches (call, email, social, etc.) on all leads in your assigned territory using Outreach.io Manage, track, and report on all activities and results using Salesforce Participate in documenting all processes in the GitLab handbook and update as needed with your Sales Development Manager Work in collaboration with Field and Corporate Marketing to drive attendance at regional marketing events Attend field marketing events to engage with participants identify opportunities, and to schedule meetings Act as a mentor for new SDR hires in helping them navigate their key accounts Work in collaboration with Digital Marketing to develop targeted marketing tactics against your assigned target accounts We’re a diverse team and we’re looking for you to bring your own unique flavor to the SDR role! We're looking for Someone excited by the prospect of working cross-functionally with sales and different marketing departments. You'll have exposure to different departments like Sales, Marketing, Finance, Recruiting, Enablement, Engineering, etc. which will help you determine your career path at GitLab. Positive and energetic phone skills, excellent listening skills, strong writing skills A self-starter with a track record of successful, credible achievements Knowledge of business process, roles, and organizational structure Determined personality with a desire to grow and win Passionate about being a part of GitLab’s journey Proficient in using Salesforce and LinkedIn 2+ years work experience in a professional environment Previous tech industry experience or experience in sales development, marketing and/or sales is a plus Outbound prospecting experience is a plus Globally we require excellent written and spoken English which is our company language Ability to use GitLab A shared interest in our values , and working in accordance with those values Also, we know it’s tough, but please try to avoid the confidence gap . You don’t have to match all the listed requirements exactly to be considered for this role.  Hiring Process  To view the full job description and hiring process, please view our handbook . Additional details about our process can also be found on our hiring page .  Remote-Americas  Country Hiring Guidelines  GitLab hires new team members in countries around the world. All of our roles are remote, however some roles may carry specific location-based eligibility requirements. Our Talent Acquisition team can help answer any questions about location after starting the recruiting process.  Your Privacy  For information about our privacy practices in the recruitment process, please visit our Recruitment Privacy Policy page.

Location: Remote  About Hello Bello:  Hello Bello is so much more than just a baby company – we're on a mission. We believe in 'Premium for All' and are committed to creating the highest quality products at the most reasonable cost, because every child deserves the best. We believe in doing better for babies, parents, and the planet. We believe in doing good and giving back. We believe in exceeding expectations and going above and beyond. And while it's all serious business to us, we also believe in having fun – and we try to with product design, content, and community. And obviously with each other, too. Join us!  Role Summary:  Hello Bello is looking for a Manager, Sales & Operations Planning who will be responsible for managing the S&OP process steps for the company. This role will focus on balancing demand and supply to maximize customer order fulfilment, improve service and optimize costs. You will work with other functions such as Sales, Marketing, Operations, Sourcing, Product Development and Finance, to reconcile top-down financial plans and sales plans with the bottom-up operational plans.  Responsibility: Drive the Sales & Operations Planning process from end to end and to higher levels of maturity Product lifecycle: ensure portfolio changes are communicated and included into the demand plan Demand review: work with sales and finance to ensure statistical forecast is built and multiple market intel signals are collected to generate a consensus forecast that will be analyzed and compared to prior cycles and target plans Supply review: ensure supply constraints are clearly spelled-out with options to make trade-offs Monthly meetings: Prepare and present monthly reporting of key performance indicators in a user friendly format for Sales & Marketing leadership team S&OP executive review: reconcile supply to demand, align with financial plans and present various scenario Frame perspective for decision makers in the organization Communicate decisions made and ensure follow-up Assists the VP Supply Chain with strategy development and execution as well as with supply chain optimization Develop inventory strategies and monitor performance to ensure objectives are met; report on excess inventory Work closely with Sales, Marketing, Finance, and Operations to prepare and present sales operations data for strategic project management initiatives  Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Supply Chain, Operations, Business Management, or related field 5+ years of experience in Supply Chain, specifically in planning roles; fast scaling company experience strongly preferred Solid experience with statistical forecasting, demand and consensus planning, constrained capacity planning, supply planning and detailed production planning High proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, especially Excel and PowerPoint Successful relationship and stakeholder management, with the ability to communicate and influence effectively across all levels of the business Deep understanding of supply chain business processes and challenges Ideal candidate has experience working in CPG retail environment (Walmart and/or large grocery retailers) Good understanding of sales and finance/costing processes that support the supply chain High analytical and data-driven  Benefits & Perks: Medical, dental, and vision insurance 401k and FSA option at your discretion Paid Vacation and Holidays Employee discounts on Hello Bello products

description: Sales Hunters Wanted. Please read carefully.  Note: Once you apply, we will send you a website URL to take a Sales Assessment test. This is required to be considered for the position. Please budget approximately 40 minutes for the test and answer it honestly.  OVERVIEW  We are helping fill this position for a customer of ours.  If you have previously excelled at creating a new customer base from scratch, with minimal guidance, then this position might be for you, so please read on…  You will be working at a well-funded software startup company based in New York City that sells software to restaurants, bars and other such venues. Their established competitors are doing fantastic so there is qualified opportunity in the market.  You will be going up against establish brands, can you handle this challenge?  This company is not just amount money, it’s about helping customers and doing what’s right.  You will be provided with leads and you need build relationships with them to sign them up for the platform.  You have the opportunity to earn up to $60K in income (salary plus commissions). And opportunities for equity in this company.  You need to be in New York City and able to get around Manhattan and Brooklyn to meet with customers.  More details below. If this all sounds like you, then we suggest you apply and let’s discuss further.  Responsibilities  Get to know the product Outbound prospecting and communicating with businesses via in person visits Build relationships with customers Communicate product value, features and benefits clearly Lock-in partnerships with businesses through face-to-face meetings Research possible customers, identify stakeholders/decision-makers, and generate interest about platform Benefits  Equity incentive Guaranteed base, plus commission and bonus plan Healthy and responsible corporate culture Ethical sales standards Daily meal allowance Commuting reimbursements to customers Paid leave and insurance benefits Requirements  1-3 years of B2B sales experience, preferably in a startup environment Strong work ethic Good presentation and interpersonal skills; ability to make a connection with business owners/managers A commitment to professional appearance and attitude; willingness to represent the brand with integrity at all times. Businesses are our partners and therefore trust and goodwill needs to be established. Adept at using technology required for sales presentations (iPad, Email, PowerPoint, Word, etc.) Knowledge and contacts in the food/hospitality industry is a significant advantage but not required Must be able to document meeting outcomes and next steps Must speak excellent English Fluency in Mandarin or Spanish is a significant advantage

description: Job Description  At onsemi, our Global Account Managers are critical to our success and have executive-level visibility within the company. We’re looking for a salesperson who will aggressively pursue opportunities and position us to win at a key automotive account. The successful candidate will be a proven winner who gets results and builds relationships.  It’s a great opportunity to further your career in an international, fast-paced environment with a large amount of responsibility and autonomy.  The Ideal Candidate Will Develop and execute Sales Business Plans and Strategies to maximize revenue growth, increase market share, and position the company as a strategic supplier at a key assigned customer. Present business plans to management and Business Units for alignment and support. Manage and coordinate global support through onsemi's sales and engineering network. Understand customers' global supply-chain and 3rd party partner network. Develop and establish strong cooperative relationships with all levels of the customers' organization and departments. Lead new business demand creation with Field Application Engineers and Business Units to secure successful design win penetrations at customers R&D and design centers. Work closely and support Business Units on competitive analysis, market intelligence and pricing negotiations. Provide timely and accurate demand forecasts and close loop communication to ensure smooth support and responsiveness to customers. BSEE degree required, MBA degree or equivalent experience in addition is preferred. Professional attitude with excellent interpersonal and communication skills to interface directly with different levels of the customers' organization. Strong presentation skills and good written and verbal communication skills. 6+ years of sales experience with a proven track record of winning designs and supporting multi-national customers. onsemi (Nasdaq: ON) is driving energy efficient innovations, empowering customers to reduce global energy use. The company is a leading supplier of semiconductor-based solutions, offering a comprehensive portfolio of energy efficient power and signal management, logic, standard and custom devices. The company’s products help engineers solve their unique design challenges in automotive, communications, computing, consumer, industrial, medical and military/aerospace applications. onsemi operates a responsive, reliable, world-class supply chain and quality program, and a network of manufacturing facilities, sales offices and design centers in key markets throughout North America, Europe and the Asia Pacific regions.  onemi is an equal opportunity employer. The Company maintains policies and practices that are designed to prevent discrimination or harassment against any qualified applicant or employee to the extent prohibited by federal, state and local laws and regulations. By way of example, discrimination on the basis of race, ethnicity, color, religion, ancestry, national origin, citizenship, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), age, marital status, sexual orientation physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information (including test results), status as a Vietnam-era or special disabled veteran, uniform service member status, political affiliation, union membership, gender identity or gender expression, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law is prohibited. jobTitle: IMMEDIATE HIRE: Entry Level Sales & Marketing
description: OVERVIEW: We are hiring extroverted professionals to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for portraying our firm and our clients to the public with professionalism and positivity. Your goal is to connect with customers in the local market and ignite interest in the promotional packages our clients offer.  HOW YOU’LL CONTRIBUTE:  Increase brand awareness through direct sales Persistently pursue opportunities to promote products Creatively adjust product presentations to customer needs Build rapport with potential new customers Track and report sales daily Participate in training sessions Offer feedback and suggestions based on the successes and failures of particular approaches  WHY YOU’LL MAKE AN IMPACT:  You’re hungry to grow in your career You have outstanding communication skills You love being part of a team You’re a goal setter with ambitious dreams You have an entrepreneurial spirit You’re proactive about finding answers You’re tenacious and resilient You have a positive and professional attitude  As a part of our firm, you’ll enjoy unlimited career growth and earning potential. You will have networking opportunities at your fingertips and you’ll enjoy ample bonuses that recognize your performance. Apply today.            Candidates with the following experience are encouraged to apply today: General Labor, Construction, Home Improvement, Labor, Labor and Development Operations, Field Construction, Telecom Construction, Construction Management or Construction Experience

description: Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s protein and salt business, where we provide wholesome, high-quality food products to a wide range of customers, from foodservice operators and grocery stores to manufacturers and exporters.  Job Purpose and Impact  The Sales/Account Manager will, with guidance, sell directly to the consumer or business purchaser or indirectly through various sales channels. We seek a results-oriented professional who is comfortable conducting face-to-face and remote sales with new and existing customers. In this role, you will assist in evaluating customer needs and suggesting appropriate products, services and solutions.  Key Accountabilities Help identify potential customers and handle existing customer relationships. With guidance conduct market research and pricing, sales and merchandising activities. Monitor customer and competitor activity and industry trends. Protect, grow and diversify the relationship with targeted customers. Support business growth by disseminating favorable information about the organization and its products and services. Independently solve moderately complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating more complex issues to appropriate staff. Other duties as assigned Position Information  The business will not sponsor applicants for work visas for this position.  Qualifications  Required Qualifications Bachelor's degree in a related field, or equivalent experience Minimum of two years of related work experience Proficiency with Microsoft Office Preferred Qualifications Previous sales experience Demonstrated negotiation and value-based / consultative sales skills Strong verbal, written, and presentation skills Experience with Customer Relationship Management software Locations: Arizona, Louisiana, New Mexico, Mississippi and Texas.  Preferred location: Texas.  Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet
industries: Chemicals, Food & Beverages, and Food Production

description: ENTRY LEVEL - no experience required - training provided  Vendition is a paid training and certification program designed to transform individuals with little or no technology sales experience into world-class prospectors and revenue generators.  Position Summary: Through our Sales Apprenticeship, candidates will work hands on at a technology company, gaining real world SDR experience in the technology and SaaS space. During your first 3-months in the SDR role, candidates will also receive supplemental coaching, training and mentorship from the Vendition coaching team to help ensure productivity, ramp, full understanding of all platforms used, and overall success.  Vendition has helped thousands of candidates with little to no technology/SaaS sales experience go on to see tremendous success in the SDR role and eventually move into an AE position and beyond. Building a strong foundation is key to long term and overall success and Vendition is here to help!  Responsibilities: Answer inbound company questions via email and phone Outbound prospecting - cold calling, email marketing campaigns, social outreach, etc. Set appointments with your assigned Account Executive Conduct discovery calls with sales managers to learn more about their needs Develop and maintain territory plan from your assigned geography Achieve quota on number of qualified opportunities per month  Requirements: Previous sales or customer-facing experience is a plus Full-time availability Have an interest in working in a sales role in the technology industry
industries: Computer Software and Information Technology and Services

description: Sales Development Representative Hardy Boys Consulting  This is a full-time, seasonal position. Initial agreement includes 3-month term, with promotions to 6-month and then full-time employee status should established sales objectives be met.  Salary (3-Month Term): $1,000 per month Commission Rate: *25%            *Average sales price equals $5,000. Salary to increase with each promotion.  About HBC Consulting is a flawed industry. A fundamental misunderstanding of purpose, where top firms demanding million-dollar payouts tragically neglect small business. Left then by the wayside, those in greatest need of assistance and coaching are sadly ignored.  Let us introduce a time for change. An opportunity for dramatic re-altering of perceived possibility, letting drift focus from greed and profit, towards acts of true service. A new age for innovators, poised to captivate, enrich, and even inspire the world.  Our mission is to serve. To lend a helping hand to those most in need. From the startups, to the nonprofits, to the passion projects. We believe in the power of people, an undeniable conviction that one great idea can change everything. And for us at Hardy Boys Consulting, we’re here to help.  Position Summary The Sales Representative role plays a vital toward the growth of our company, acting as a lead toward our outreach and goal plan. HBC strives to be a creative thought leader in the industry, for which this role will play a critical element.  Primary Responsibilities Actively seek out new sales leads and business opportunities Profile potential prospects based on advantageous criteria Nurture customer relationships to encourage future initiatives  Preferred Qualifications Must be proactive, self-directed, detail-oriented, and organized SaaS or technology-based industry knowledge preferred, but not required Passion for technology and disruptive strategies

jobTitle: Associate Sales Rep, Wound Reconstruction & Care - Connecticut
description: Integra LifeSciences is a global leader in regenerative technologies and neurosurgical solutions dedicated to limiting uncertainty for clinicians, so they can focus on providing the best patient care.  Founded in 1989, Integra develops, manufactures, sells and supplies best-in-class products to regenerate tissue, remove brain tumors, prevent infection and much more. And over the last three decades, we’ve evolved into one of the world’s leading global medical technology companies with more than 4,000 dedicated employees who deliver innovative medical technology solutions.  But that’s just the beginning. Integra is growing at an unprecedented rate. We’re at a moment in time where the experience you’ll gain is more robust than the experience you bring. And we’re out to invest in your future because it’s the best way to maximize ours.  The Associate Sales Representative will be a responsible Integra’s Tissue Technologies product line and solely responsible for supporting these products within for sales of these products for a defined territory within the Hospital OR/Surgery setting. Your primary responsibility will be to support and grow business in order to achieve or exceed sales revenue targets. You will provide case coverage, transport trays, and develop select accounts by building relationships, demonstrating extensive product knowledge and providing exceptional customer service. Your primary call points will be plastic surgeons, podiatric surgeons, orthopedic surgeons, and general surgeons. 50% of your time will be spent in the Operating Room. You will work side by side with an experienced Account Manager for approximately 18 months. If performance qualifications are met, then you may be considered for an Account Manager position for a full territory anywhere in the U.S.  An essential function of this role is making in-person onsite regular visits to hospitals, medical facilities and other customer locations. To be considered for this opportunity you must be able to comply with all customer onsite requirements, including COVID-19 vaccination requirements unless otherwise permitted by law.  Essential Duties And Responsibilities Target and develop new account opportunities while supporting current initiatives in the territory Provide service of existing accounts which may include case coverage in the operating room as well as excellent customer service and product/tray logistics Assist Account Manager in achieving revenue growth and attainment of quota. Submit weekly and monthly reports as defined by sales management Operate within defined budgets and strictly with in accordance with Corporate policies and procedures Strictly adhere to the policies and procedures within the Advamed Code of Conduct and the Sunshine Act The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required for this position. Bachelor’s Degree or an equivalent combination of education and/or experience is required Preferred 0-2 years of outside sales experience, business to business sales experience, any healthcare experience or background, athletic trainer, allied health background (physical therapy, occupational therapy, athletic training, etc.), or other health and fitness background. Excellent analytical, written and verbal skills. Confidence to communicate with established physicians and other surgical personnel. Strong negotiation and selling skills. Physically capable of standing for long hours in the Operating Room during cases. Must be able to lift and carry 50lbs In an effort to minimize the spread of the coronavirus and to protect our employees, all new hires in the US and Puerto Rico will need to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 in order to be considered for employment with Integra LifeSciences, unless eligible for an accommodation as provided by law.
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: The Digital Industries (DI) Sales Development Summer Internship Program gives the opportunity to learn about the Siemens Organization while offering full exposure to the DI organization! The intern will gain an understanding of nearly all departments, business lines and roles within DI, enabling the understanding of where and how you may best fit within our organization. Under the guidance of a designated mentor, the individual will be immersed in Siemens products, technologies and culture, discovering what makes our company a global leader.  Participants who optimally complete the internship program will be considered for full-time opportunities in the Sales Development Program with Siemens Digital Industries upon graduation.  Your responsibilities may include:  Understanding the rich history of Siemens and the Siemens values Learning about the industry/channel/market Training on core selling skills and methodologies Learning key sales processes and tools Establishing internal/external contacts Access to and network with Siemens’ senior decision makers and key leaders  Internship Start Date: Summer 2022  Locations: Houston, TX and Philadelphia, PA  Required Qualifications:  Overall Cumulative GPA: 2.7 preferred but may consider 2.5 and above Education: Current rising junior or senior undergraduate students pursuing a BA/BS from an accredited technical school, college or university Majors: Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Industrial/System Engineering, Industrial Distribution. Other technical degrees will be considered. Relocation and Travel: Must be willing to relocate and travel Work Authorization: Applicants must be legally authorized for employment in the United States without need for current or future employer-sponsored work authorization. Ability to work 40 hours per week from May to August  Preferred Qualifications:  Proven leadership skills Strong analytical, writing and presentation skills Industry knowledge and/or interest  Our Culture: At Siemens, we live and foster an ownership culture, in which every employee takes personal responsibility for our company's success. We trust and empower our leaders to act as owners, direct their teams, and innovate to succeed. We communicate openly and honestly to learn from our failures and celebrate our successes. We recognize individual and team achievements frequently. We invest in our team members, offering a wide variety of internal and external development opportunities.  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.  URDP  Organization: Digital Industries  Company: Siemens Industry, Inc.  Experience Level: Student (Not Yet Graduated)  Job Type: Full-Time temporary  Equal Employment Opportunity Statement  Siemens is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer encouraging diversity in the workplace. Jules and Associates is consistently ranked as one of the top independent Leasing/Financing firms in the nation. We are seeking college seniors who are actively seeking a career in sales.  JOB DESCRIPTION: We are currently looking for highly motivated, outgoing and well-spoken individuals who can successfully engage with key decision makers at some of the top mid-sized privately held firms nationally for an Account Executive (AE) position. As an Account Executive you will have the opportunity to learn about the corporate world and have the opportunity to achieve financial success while receiving extensive training. This is an excellent opportunity for a recent college graduate with less than five years of work experience or a graduating senior who has the qualities we seek. Your initial goal will be to identify financing opportunities through an existing database by utilizing outbound calling and email initiatives to companies throughout the nation. Successful AEs have the ability to gain trust and provide a high level of service to their customers. As an AE you will be driven by daily, weekly and monthly goals while maintaining a weekly pipeline. The position provides you with an opportunity to learn financial analysis as well as work alongside management to analyze financial statements, pricing and structuring proposals for potential clients.  ROLE EXPECTATIONS: Energetic and professional Highly Competitive Self-motivated and results-oriented Seeks financial reward for their hard work Excellent written and oral communication skills Ability to be organized and multi-task Build and maintain client relationships  QUALIFICATIONS: Undergraduate degree or higher Strong written and verbal communication skills Strong organizational skills Proficiency in Microsoft Office Ability to harness financial data to inform decisions Previous sales experience is preferred, but not required  We provide one of the top training programs that will provide you the tools in order to be successful. You will work in a team environment, with the support of mentors that will help you learn how to build relationships with key decision makers in order to identify financing opportunities that will turn into commissions for you. You will have access to one of the leading CRM programs designed to increase your success in selling. The position provides you with an opportunity to learn financial analysis, pricing and structuring proposals for potential clients.  This is an excellent opportunity for a graduating College Senior who is interested in learning about Sales and the Financial Services industry.

jobTitle: Strategic Inside Sales Representative - Uber for Business
description: About The Role  We're looking for an experienced and driven Strategic Inside Sales Representative to support our Uber for Business Strategic sales team. This high-impact position will provide sales support to Strategic Account Executives through the development of qualified leads that result in achieving our business goals. You will be calling upon our largest, and most strategic client accounts. This role will serve as a training ground for a pathway into an Account Executive position with demonstrated success.  You'll be responsible for conducting outbound prospecting campaigns (both call and email). Develop rapport with contacts in an effort to understand where the prospect is in the buying cycle. Work with Strategic Account Executives, to ensure that the leads provided accurately qualified and will progress through the sales funnel. This involves gathering key information to update our Salesforce system and identifying next steps for Strategic Account Executives to connect with these prospects and overall Account Global expansion.  What You'll Do Generate new business opportunities in an assigned vertical or territory and partner with assigned Strategic Account Executives Develop our largest Strategic accounts Outbound prospecting via targeted calling, email, and marketing campaigns Build and execute on strategic and measurable demand generation campaigns Uncover a prospect's business challenges and identify new business opportunities, while highlighting the Uber for Business value proposition Conduct high-level conversations with senior executives Manage, track, and report on all sales activities and results using Salesforce Work closely with sales management to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities for new business Collaborate with the sales team to share best practices and make recommendations to more effectively close sales and ensure customer loyalty Work effectively with internal departments to deliver the best solution for the client and ensure an excellent experience Travel to attend trade shows or other client meetings when requested or necessary Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree required Preferred Qualifications 3+ years of experience cold-calling and sales/business development experience Experience with prospecting and closing transactional deals Experience using a CRM (ex: Salesforce) to manage daily activities Experience with email campaigns and Salesforce preferred Ability to build extraordinary customer relationships Salesforce, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Zoom Info and Groove experience preferred Excellent communication skills Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently Have a positive, self-driven team-first mentality with a desire to learn
industries: Computer Software, Consumer Services, and Information Technology and Services
