description: Are you excited about solving difficult problems? Kizen is for people who want to accelerate their careers, while contributing to something greater than themselves.  Kizen helps businesses grow faster and work smarter by leveraging cutting-edge technologies like intelligent automation, digital assistants, big data, and AI. We’ve built a complete business solution that is ready to compete and win against Salesforce, Microsoft, Oracle, SAP, Hubspot, etc.  Our Kizen with Zoe next-gen technology platform empowers marketing, sales, and experience teams across every organization to supercharge productivity, accelerate profitable growth and perform better than ever before.    We are looking for a Sales Analyst to join our rapidly growing team. This person is responsible for promoting organizational growth through data harvesting and analytics. They will build target lists for outreach by the SDR Team, assess trends, refine the targeting of personas and our Ideal Customer Profile, anticipate issues, diagnose the root cause of problems, generate potential innovative solutions, develop an action plan, and execute.  Key Responsibilities. Utilize tools to target desired personas within our Ideal Customer Profile to build outreach lists for SDR Team Members to execute on. Utilizes analytical skills to produce reporting, interpret data, clearly articulate findings, and provide recommendations for action (A/B testing). Use analytical methods to identify areas for operational improvement and streamlining processes. Participates in strategic and tactical brainstorming sessions to create strong, executable growth plans. Maps and documents standard operating processes. Interacts with stakeholders in resolving problems.  Required Qualifications. Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience required 1 year of experience in a related field Exceptional collaboration, organizational, time management, and communication skills The ability to navigate ambiguity and adapt to a quickly changing environment Driven and self-motivated with a track record of finding and solving difficult problems Must have a demonstrated ability to drive projects from inception through to completion  Preferred Qualifications. 2 years of experience in related fields 2 years of experience working directly with reporting tools and enterprise reporting preferred Experience using common data tools and CRM knowledge preferred  At Kizen we approach challenges creatively and collaboratively, while always trying new things and having fun along the way. You will be able to do your life’s work; and help us build the company of your dreams. If this sounds like a fit, we look forward to speaking with you about unleashing your genius!

PLEASE DO ONLY APPLY IF YOU HAVE BEVERAGE SALES EXPERIENCE  SURFWATER Field Sales Rep position:  Location(s): San Diego & Los Angeles  SURFWATER, the country’s leading aluminum bottled water company, is looking for enthusiastic, equipped and experienced sales professionals to join our San Diego & Los Angeles Teams!  Do you have a “can-do” attitude, passion for sales and in general positive personality? We want to hear from you!  As a SURFWATER Field Sales Rep., you will be responsible for increasing distribution and daily sales of SURFWATER’s Still & Sparkling electrolyte-enhanced yummy water.  Managing your own territory, you will present and sell a fantastic product into surf shops, coffee shops, souvenir and tourist destinations, schools, markets and support with in store marketing execution to build a great brand.  The ideal candidate is a disciplined, goal & result oriented individual who takes her/his job seriously and wants to make a career at a trailblazing, fast-growing lifestyle start up company.  Deliverables of the SURFWATER FIELD SALES REP:  SHE / HE, ·      Visit's and wins new business day in day out, by perfect execution of the job ·      Executes plan to achieve strategic direction of territory ·      Maximizes the POS / Visibility exposure in each SURFWATER listed account ·      Prepares reports on time in a neat, reliable, and professional manner ·      Is THE BOSS of her/his own territory with entrepreneurial eyes to seek out new opportunities and make things happen: 'Only the result counts'  Requirements:  ·      BEVERAGE SALES EXPERIENCE REQUIRED  ·      Minimum of 2 years out in the field sales experience (beverage)  ·      Excellent organizational skills and ability to plan effective sales call daily  ·      Strong understanding of Microsoft Excel, Outlook and PowerPoint  ·      This position requires a valid driver’s license with a clean MVR!  ·      Weekend work required at times   ·      Willing to work hard and deliver results  PREFERRED: BEVERAGE SALES EXPERIENCE   Seniority Level: Associate (2-3 years of experience in Direct Sales)  Industry:  ·      Food & Beverages, Non Alcoholic Sales preferred  Employment Type: Full-time / Sales, Field Sales  Salary: Base compensation + commission  PLEASE DO ONLY APPLY IF YOU HAVE BEVERAGE SALES EXPERIENCE

jobTitle: Sales Account Executive, Entry Level - San Diego, CA
description: Job Title: Sales Account Executive, Entry Level  Location: San Diego, CA  Job Type: Full-time salaried  Reports To: Regional Manager  Bonus: Robust monthly bonus opportunities  MicroGenDX Overview  MicroGenDX is a CAP accredited and CLIA certified laboratory highly-specialized in providing Next Generation DNA Sequencing for infectious disease across multiple specialties, including COVID-19.  MicroGenDX is committed and excited to continue to move this technology to its well-deserved place in diagnostics as the gold standard of care in the diagnosis of infectious disease! MicroGenDX is seeking highly motivated, entry-level sales individuals to join our team who are just as passionate as we are about revolutionizing patient outcomes with microbial diagnostics. Are you self-motivated? Ready to disrupt an industry? Interested in a technological sell resulting in better patient outcomes? If so, MicroGenDX wants to hear from you!  Job Description  As a MicroGenDX Jr. Sales Account Executive you will develop and execute a territory business plan, sell and promote MicroGenDX service lines to meet territory sales targets for an assigned region and accounts while continually identifying and developing new client opportunities. In this role, you will also be responsible for prioritizing project planning, meetings, completing customer requests/deadlines and organized territory management, meeting assigned sales targets and strict adherence to Compliance with Federal law.  Specific Job Functions Manage the entire sales cycle beginning with prospecting through closing retention and further engagement Educates customers on the value of MicroGenDX services, superior diagnostics and better patient outcomes. Continually improve and develop selling skills, technical knowledge, sales forecasting. Monitor competitive services, pricing and other developments impacting our market. Work with marketing and other sales teams to develop, implement and execute sales and marketing plans. Provide prompt resolutions and service to customers. Qualifications Team oriented with a winning attitude and highly adaptable Demonstrate ability and desire to learn Strong passion for customer service and ability to understand client needs and increase customer engagement Interest and ability to actively engage and present scientific data to Physicians and staff Understanding and application of sales performance metrics Ability to close sales in a highly-competitive market selling new and disruptive technology Demonstrated knowledge and success in Infectious Diseases and multiple specialties, is a plus Knowledge related to PCR, Next Generation DNA Sequencing, Infectious Diseases, antimicrobials and anti-fungal, microbiology is a plus. Experience selling molecular diagnostics in the outpatient physician market, is a plus. What MicroGen DX Offers Competitive salary and bonus plan Opportunity for growth Monthly car allowance Medical coverage (all or in part paid by the company based on plan selection) Dental and Vision Insurance 401k with a 100% company match up to 4% Voluntary Short-Term Disability Company Paid Life Insurance & AD&D Voluntary Life Insurance & AD&D Expense budget Paid vacation and holiday Figo Pet Insurance MicroGen DX Values Innovation – We understand the healthcare industry advances quickly and so should we. We remain on the forefront of molecular diagnostics in order to continually ensure we are providing physicians and their patients with the very best and most reliable data with 99.9% precision. Passion – We seek to inspire the medical community and patients to believe again in accurate diagnostics and better treatment outcomes; with a laser focus on changing diagnostic medicine when it comes to infectious disease. Partnership – We are a reliable partner in the medical field for physicians, patients and within the research community. Through attention to quality and knowledge we are a proud diagnostic partner throughout the field and strive to be a sought-out partner in molecular diagnostics and infectious disease well into the future. Trust – We strive to exceed expectations while delivering highly-specialized diagnostic services. Through quality ethics and a focus on compliance we are dedicated to be a trusted guide within the field of molecular diagnostics. The above statements reflect the general duties and responsibilities necessary to describe the principal functions of the job, as identified, and shall not be considered an exhaustive list of job responsibilities which may be inherent in the job. Responsibilities are subject to change.
industries: Information Technology and Services, Medical Devices, and Hospital & Health Care

description: Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who are committed to safe, responsible and sustainable ways to nourish the world. This position is in Cargill’s protein and salt business, where we provide wholesome, high-quality food products to a wide range of customers, from foodservice operators and grocery stores to manufacturers and exporters.  Job Purpose and Impact  The Water Quality Senior Account Manager (Sales) will focus on our large or very complex customers within the Northeastern US market. We seek a seasoned professional who will handle our critical or complex products that require excellent client relationship skills to maintain competitive positioning.  Key Accountabilities Develop a plan to establish and maintain account relationships and meet personal sales targets. Build a business plan for each account. Coordinate use of resources (e. g., technical, advertising) to provide value-added services to accounts. Develop strong client relationships that provide significant input to planning product, price and service strategies. Uncover new customer opportunities in the designated market. Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision and results driven. External Applicant Information This position is posted both internally and externally. This is a remote position within New York, Connecticut, Rhode Island, Massachusetts, Vermont, New Hampshire, and Maine only Relocation assistance is provided for this role Travel is required to cover the area of responsibility Qualifications  Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree Minimum of four years of related work experience Able and willing to travel 50% of the time within the area of responsibility Proficiency with Microsoft Office Preferred Qualifications Previous sales experience in Retail / Grocery Salt Industry experience Demonstrated negotiation and value-based / consultative sales skills Strong verbal, written, and presentation skills Experience with Salesforce or Customer Relationship Management software Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet
industries: Chemicals, Food & Beverages, and Food Production

description: Position: Sales Representative, Territory Manager- Colorado, Denver, Centennial, Parker Department: Sales Location: REMOTE- TRAVEL- Territory:  Denver, CO mostly but may also cover UT, AZ, Vegas - must live in/near the Denver Compensation structure: Base + Commission + Bonus   Experience: This is an OUTSIDE, HUNTER, SALES role with heavy cold calling, prospecting, lead generation, onsite meetings. Please only apply if you are truly ready for serious hard work and understand you will be in the field majority of the time weekly.  We are looking for someone with ideally 2+ years of FIELD sales B2B experience who is driven, willing to travel and put in some seriously hard (and rewarding) work, learn a ton and is excited for an opportunity with a fantastic and quickly growing company in an innovative space--- Do you want a seat on our Rocketship? Next STOP, THE MOON and BEYOND!  Company summary: InMode is a leading global provider of innovative medical technologies which develops, manufactures, and markets devices harnessing novel radiofrequency (RF) technology. The company strives to enable new emerging surgical procedures and improve existing treatments. By leveraging its medically-accepted, minimally-invasive RF technology for simultaneous subdermal adipose remodeling and skin tightening, InMode offers a comprehensive portfolio of products for plastic surgery, gynecology, dermatology, otolaryngology, and ophthalmology.  Position Summary: The Territory Manager is responsible for generating revenue and executing our sales methods in their designated geographical area. TM’s responsibilities include presenting our products to potential clients, identifying specific consumer characteristics, and recommending ways to promote and sell our products. To be successful in this role, you should have excellent communication abilities and be highly motivated to meet sales goals. Ultimately, you will help us grow our customer base and establish our reputation in your assigned region.  The successful candidate enjoys and thrives in an EXTREMELY fast-paced, on the go, work environment, can juggle multiple time sensitive processes at once and possess a can-do, what-more-can-I-learn, how-can-I-help attitude.  Duties and Responsibilities: 1. Generate sales leads principally by cold calling on dermatologists or plastic surgeons (including ASPS, Facial Plastic, Ophthalmic, Plastic and AACS cosmetic surgeons) as well as other physicians in the Territory. 2. Maintain and manage a substantial lead pipeline while meeting or exceeding quarterly sales targets. 3. Present our products and services to prospective customers; Act as a point of contact for all potential customers and identify needs and recommend product solutions. 4. Identify local business opportunities and challenges 5. Develop and utilize all assets, reference sites, Company' clinical specialists and partner personnel within the Territory to achieve short-term and long-term objectives. 6. Answer customer questions about features, pricing, and additional services 7. Cross-sell products, when appropriate 8. Collaborate with sales representatives in and out of assigned territory to share best practices, support a cohesive sales approach to meet individual and group sales quotas. 9. Achieve minimum sales quota requirements as established by the Company 10. Satisfy all the Company’s Customer Care and Finance requirements as established; responsible for learning (training provided) set processes and updating the CRM system (SFDC) in a timely and accurate manner. 11. Provide timely reports (weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annually to the Regional Sales Director regarding status of each lead and sales opportunity in pipeline through the CRM database. 12. Attend and promote workshops and support programs for the Territory in conjunction with the other sales managers, marketing, and clinical departments of the Company; Provide needed sales support at all sales events. 13. Maintain a high level of understanding of the applications and performance of the Company's products.  Frequent travel within your territory, and occasionally outside of, is a requirement of this role.   Minimum Qualifications: ·      Bachelor’s degree or greater- required ·      Minimum of 2+ year’s work experience in a field sales role; Resilient with a proven track record ·      Exceptional organization skills ·      Excellent written and verbal communication skills including phone and e-mail etiquette ·      Ability to adapt quickly ·      Ability to prioritize, multi-task, and meet deadlines and work well under pressure ·      Excellent inter-personal relationship skills and the ability to work with individuals of all levels ·      Intermediate knowledge of MS Office Suite; Word, Excel, PowerPoint ·      Strong team player a must ·      Ability to work extended hours, evenings and weekends occasionally as needed. ·      Experience with CRM tools; SalesForce- highly preferred ·      Medical device or laser experience- a plus

We offer an excellent opportunity for not only a job, but a career with growth potential. At Transtar, we seek applicants who roll up their sleeves, enjoy hard work, thrive in a team environment, and who embody our core values of Safety, Honesty, Action, Relationship, and Product.  Transtar Autobody Technologies, a business unit of Transtar Industries, is a coatings manufacturing company in the automotive refinish business headquartered in Brighton, Michigan. At Transtar Autobody Technologies, we are dedicated to developing, producing, and marketing quality refinish products for the automotive aftermarket. TAT is prideful of our history of creative and innovative research, which enables us to bring products to the marketplace in a manner highly beneficial to our customers, the industry and our environment.  We have an immediate opportunity for a Territory Manager in our San Antonio, TX market and surrounding areas. This position will primarily service customers located in the metro San Antonio area, but may also include customers in the surrounding areas.  WHY TRANSTAR AUTOBODY TECHNOLOGIES?  The Territory Manager is responsible for managing a territory by selling products through our established distribution channels. As a Territory Manager, you help developing and established customers leverage our various products and programs, optimize their product, and maximize their utilization.  WHAT YOU WILL DO WITH YOUR TALENTS: Execute the TAT sales plan, work within company policies & programs, and meet annual sales performance goals expectations. Plan Pre-call sales, establish customer relationships, identify sales opportunities, present & demonstrate product /programs, and close sales. Develop annual Business Plan, submit annual territory review, monitor customer inventory levels, partner with customers to improve metrics, identify & capitalize on opportunities, and complete post-call activities & follow-up. Manage accounts – key, existing, and new, supervise distributor activities, evaluate distributor performance, and train distribution personnel. Control sales expense, manage time efficiently, develop monthly sales forecast, and address & resolve problems. Improve product knowledge, selling skills, and business acumen.  WHAT YOU WILL BRING: Three + years of outside sales experience (automotive aftermarket preferred). Excellent oral and written communication skills, as well as presentation abilities to people at all levels of management Prior PBE experience Product Knowledge & Confidence Business Acumen which includes financial literacy, market orientation, and strategic perspective Territory Planning & Management Proficient computer skills; MS Office products  EDUCATION:  Bachelor's degree (B. A.) from four-year college or university preferred; or a combination of education and experience / training. Management experience or desire/ability to lead a sales team is desired but not necessary.

Our Why We are torches that illuminate our client's dreams. Every product in the world is created by someone passionate about solving a problem and marketing is the only thing that will determine its success - or failure. A customer must know it is there to buy it and benefit from it. A bright and intelligently targeted beacon on a sturdy boat is required to bring attention to great ideas; without it will float away, untethered and into the weeds. We are that boat and beacon who carry ideas where they need to go and deliver them in ways that make customers salivate for more. We are on the hunt for a full-time A-player sales pro who has specifically worked in the PR, marketing, or news industry. This is an extremely specific peer-to-peer sale of a PR industry service that is used by account executives and account supervisors within PR agencies and by CMO’s and in-house marketers inside CPG brands.  Specifically, we seek a team member to convert a list of 18000 PR agency representatives to double our revenues by 2023. This person is being hired to grow our business, will work with our "pull approach" and daily in a trackable CRM system to measure success.  This is a position for a go-getter who will relentlessly make a minimum of 80 calls/touches a week and close 5 sales every month, at a minimum.  If you have worked for PRNewsWire, MarketWire, BusinessWire, Vocus, Cision, Distinctive Assets, any celebrity gifting suites, or related companies, this will a natural, fun and very lucrative job for you.  Part of an extremely focused 5-year growth opportunity, this is a key position to grow this segment beyond our already 26,000 strong list of CPG companies in our database.  This position requires 4 things:  1. A sales pro 2. Someone who can articulate the difference between PR and advertising and why it is valuable. 3. Is tech and social media savvy (extra points if you know Infusionsoft) 4. Has worked with, or for, some of the PR agencies listed above  We seek a sales professional who has equal abilities to: 1. open 2. overcome objections 3. and close  It is important this person actively uses social media for selling, has an online presence and knows their way around LinkedIn, Facebook and Instagram.  This team member must use, daily, a powerful database / autoresponder that serves as the backbone of our business. This is a robust CRM system with pre-templated sales materials, more than 26K leads, follow up sequences, lead tracking and more. We use Infusionsoft, which is not required for you to know in advance, but easy to learn. This person must be extremely comfortable using a technology day in and day out for all activities and reporting.  We provide leads, training on the product and our approach, as well as ongoing Sandler Sales Training and all sales materials.  Last, but not least, this person must be comfortable on the phone. Though we use email marketing as our primary outreach and social selling produces an exceedingly high hit rate, the old-fashioned telephone is a necessary business tool for success in this position.  CPE products range in price from $849 to $13,000. Spots at our virtual events sell for $3297, physical ones, $4250 and other services from $995 to $2000. We offer a salary of $40,000 - $50,000 + an extremely generous tiered 15-25% commission (that resets every 30 days), plus health insurance after a 6-month vesting period.  We prefer someone in Los Angeles who can work from our office 1x a week and from a home office the rest of the week but are open to a professional who is elsewhere in the U.S. Training emanates from our office in Malibu and can be done remotely.  If you are interested, please email a resume and cover letter. In your letter, we want to hear specifically about:  1. sales experience, specifically in PR, 2. your experience or ability to learn and use an online CRM system and 3. a paragraph on the difference between PR and advertising.  RESUMES THAT DO NOT INCLUDE A COVER LETTER WILL AUTOMATICALLY BE DELETED.

jobTitle: Senior Client Account Manager, Large Customer Sales (Automotive)
description: "The front page of the internet,” Reddit brings over 430 million people together each month through their common interests, inviting them to share, vote, comment, and create across thousands of communities. Come for the cats, stay for the empathy.  Averaging 21B screen views per month, Reddit is the 5th most-trafficked site on the internet - and we're just getting started. If you’re excited about the online community space and strengthening brand partnerships, we’d love to hear from you.  Responsibilities Collaborate closely with Client Partners to meet and exceed clients’ marketing goals. Proactively manage and deepen relationships with existing advertising partners, both with agencies and directly with Fortune 500 clients to drive year-on-year Reddit revenue growth. Lead and execute campaign launches from start to finish and deliver insightful optimizations to agency and client partners Ongoing management of internal account operations (revenue delivery and troubleshooting issues) Educate brands and media agencies, effectively communicate value proposition and best practices Consult clients on their awareness and direct response objectives, and partner closely with Client Partners to craft thoughtful and creative media plans Collaborate with Ad Ops to ensure effective campaign delivery and resolve any technical hurdles Proactively seek and represent client needs and asks to cross-functional stakeholders Shape Reddit’s native ads product roadmap, for mobile and in general, by aggregating and sharing client feedback and campaign metrics with cross-functional stakeholders Proactively and continually identify areas of improvement Mentor and train other team members.  Qualifications 6+ years of experience in advertising sales and account management Strong understanding of customer marketing funnel and traditional marketing ecosystem Comfortable with problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Understanding of Digital measurement, tracking fundamentals and mobile measurement partners Tenacious and entrepreneurial approach to working through product, process, and client challenges Experience cultivating strong relationships with external partners Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills Ability to work in a fast-paced and unstructured work environment High attention to detail Proficiency in Excel preferred BA / BS degree or equivalent work experience  Reddit is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please contact us at ApplicationAssistance@Reddit.com.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Computer Software, and Internet

description: In a world increasingly focused on how humans can responsibly live within our environment, OTT is on the frontlines, creating the critical water and weather solutions that ensure a safer future for us all. By partnering with our customers around the world, we help detect floods, make solar power more efficient, protect the environment, and ultimately save lives.  Our collaborative, diverse team is made up of engineers and scientists, marketers and researchers; people who’ve been in the industry for decades or have just arrived with fresh ideas. We’re driven by a love of problem-solving and inventive thinking, and by the unique impact our customers make on people’s everyday lives. Bringing our global team together within our renowned brands affords us unsurpassed strength and expertise in meteorology and hydrology—and gives you the chance to build a meaningful career.  OTT HydroMet is proud to be one of Danaher's Water Quality companies. Motivated by the highest possible stakes of climate change and global health, we’re working together within a rapidly digitizing industry to find innovative technologies that guarantee the safety of our water and our environment.  About the Territory Sales Manager role:  The Territory Manager is responsible for the growth and expansion of direct sales and profit margins within the defined territory/region on products and/or services. Establishes professional relationships with key personnel in customer accounts. Meets assigned targets for profitable sales volume and margin dollars.  Territory Sales Manager will cover all of Florida. Qualified candidates may live anywhere in this territory Promotion and sales OTT HydroMet product lines to core customers and new accounts Participates in sales activities including customer site visits, telephone contacts, trade seminars and shows, product demonstrations/evaluations, customer seminars, and channel management. Ability to develop and execute a business plan and manage territory as one’s own business Demonstrate time & territory balance by executing planned activities to maximize time in the field with customers and prospects Engages stakeholders and internal resources to best serve customers Collects and reports information on all competitive activity, business opportunities, the voice of the customer, sales trends, and results within the assigned market providing input during monthly business review Uses metrics, KPI, and forecasting to self-manage productivity Develops, nurtures, and understands health of customer opportunity funnel and openly works with leadership and sales operations to ensure best results Ability to develop creative and strategic solutions. Report and manage all sales activities through our CRM (SalesForce.com) Prepares and presents a monthly funnel review utilizing SalesForce.com to demonstrate the quality of the funnel, activity plans, and command of the account base. 50% Travel activity Are you qualified? 5-10 years of direct B2B sales experience, preferably selling water quality, flow, discharge, telemetry, and data management software solutions to urban hydrologists/meteorologists, Federal Government Agencies, State agencies, and local/muni flood and storm water agencies A degree in a science-related field such as Biology, Environmental Science, Hydrological and Meteorological Studies, Engineering, or equivalent is an asset Must have a valid driver's license and acceptable driving record When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 69,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.  Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. We value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.  The EEO posters are available here.  We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us at applyassistance@danaher.com to request accommodation.  If you’ve ever wondered what’s within you, there’s no better time to find out.

jobTitle: VP of Marketing & Sales - Rapidly Growing Chocolate Experiences Company
description: We are a rapidly growing and tech savvy experiences startup based in South San Francisco. We seek a partner-level marketing and sales leader to join our amazing team.  We bring people together with Brazilian chocolate in highly engaging in-person, hybrid and virtual experiences.  Imagine you work virtually. You receive a tinyB chocolate making kit in the mail, as do all your co-workers worldwide. You hop on a facilitated video call with your team. And you all have a super fun, engaging chocolate making party together, where you roll chocolate Brigadeiros in yummy toppings, make chocolate art, laugh and eat together!  We serve both companies that want to build their teams and individuals that want to celebrate on special occasions with their families and friends.  We have connected with and served top Fortune 500 & Tech 100 companies and hosted over 1,200+ events with 35,000+ participants worldwide.  We seek a super star sales and marketing maven who can help scale our company from $3m to $30m in revenue, with a goal to exit within 3-5 years.  Compensation Package: $130,000 to $160,000 annual salary plus generous, partner level equity package.  Employment Type: Full-Time & In-House Hybrid  Why Work Here: Renata, one of our co-founders, grew up making chocolate in Brazil. She is the figurehead of the company who creates new recipes, manages production, and is the creative force behind the tinyB brand. See her video here: https://www.tinybchocolate.com/pages/team-building-events?  Andrei, her husband, is the other co-founder, who has had two successful exits from tech startups and is a highly organized systems thinker who has nailed operations and logistics for the company.  People say they love working for a woman-owned and sustainable company, especially one with a vision to bring people together with Brazilian chocolate.

Title: Territory Manager  Company: Cutting edge technology-based medical company with exclusive distribution rights to numerous products is building a specialized national team.  Description: Our well-established Company is on the hunt for the best of the best. We specialize in a best-in-class office-based wound care treatment program. We have a strong track record of generating long-term sales due to our industry best products, customer service, and technology-based solutions.  Requirements: Bachelor's Degree in healthcare or related field.  A minimum of 5-years of experience in wound care.  Must have established book of business in wound care clinics (i.e.: private practice, home visits, nursing homes, etc.)  Must complete Company training and follow corporate guidelines.  The right candidate will have a can-do attitude and will exemplify Company integrity and compassion for patients.  Compensation: Base salary $75K, uncapped commissions total at plan compensation is $290K. Top Reps making much more!

Seeking Oncology Sales Representative to join our Growing Company!  Oncology Sales Representative Summary  The primary responsibility of the Oncology Sales Representative will be to develop and manage a designated regional territory with the goal of maximizing and reaching sales forecasts. Expectations for the Oncology Sales Representative include b eing a self-starter, team player and responsible for identifying, ranking, prospecting and developing key oncology practices. This also includes hospital based business relationships within the targeted regional territory of Connecticut with the targeted customers including oncology physicians, cancer care hospitals and clinics.  Onco360 Offers a Wide Variety Of Benefits Including Medical; Dental; Vision 401k with a match Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays Tuition Reimbursement Company paid benefits – life; and short and long-term disability This position will be mostly territory based with travel as required to execute the following: Achieving quarterly and annual sales goals Identifying key influencers and managing pipeline Achieving designated call expectations with a focus on top targets Delivering product presentations to customers High degree of technical expertise Exceptional probing and consultative communication skills Familiar with oncology providers, drugs, clinic and hospital communities Understanding of oncology drug reimbursement Self motivated and results driven Understanding Managed Care Medical Specialty and PBM drug benefits Oncology Sales Representative Required And Desired Skills  We are seeking local candidates who have current work experience and industry-related contacts statewide. 5 to 10 years or more of Medical and Pharmaceutical Sales experience Oncology sales experience strongly desired Seeking current oncology sales experience and corresponding contacts in this territory Familiar with oncology providers, drugs, clinic and hospital communities Excellent interpersonal work and communication skills Understanding of Managed Care Medical Specialty and PBM drug benefits Team Worker, Team Player, Proven Performer Organizational and prioritizing skills Microsoft Office, CRM Salesforce.com user experienced
industries: Insurance, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Stripe builds the most powerful and flexible tools for running an internet business. We handle billions of dollars in transactions each year and power hundreds of thousands of businesses—from startups to Fortune 100s—in almost every country around the world. From developers and product managers to founders and CFOs, a broad audience interacts with Stripe’s products and uses them to start, run, and scale their companies. Removing the barriers to online commerce helps more new businesses get started, expedites growth for existing companies, and increases economic output and trade globally.  We are looking for a Strategy & Operations Lead to join our Revenue Operations team, specifically supporting the GTM Partner function as a strategic, operations, and analytics partner. We are looking for someone who is not only a builder at heart, but also ready to dig into operational and performance processes, systems, and data to assess current performance, identify improvement opportunities, and improve efficiency. The ideal candidate will have significant experience: (1) scaling a partner sales org, (2) contributing to the growth and development of a sales operations team, (3) dealing with ambiguity and operating in a fast-growing environment, and (4) superior communication skills to drive collaboration with peers and support senior stakeholders.  You Will Collaborate with our Head of GTM Partnerships and GTM Partner Sales Ops to scale the business, while driving alignment with your Sales Ops peers and the rest of the Sales leadership organization to make sure the plans are aligned with regional and functional priorities Conduct and enable regular business reviews and resource planning Develop and execute initiatives designed to optimize sales team efficiency and productivity Create and manage operational processes such as target setting, forecasting, and budgeting Champion the operational and reporting needs of the organization by defining and prioritizing requirements while working closely with cross functional partners to identify solutions Monitor and report key performance indicators (KPIs), trends, and deliver prescriptive recommendations to drive efficiencies and scale across the org Proactively resolve data quality, process, and policy adherence issues Oversee implementation of enabling systems and tools, working closely with internal systems teams We’re Looking For Someone Who Has 8+ years of sales operations experience in a similar industry Familiarity with SFDC Understanding of the sales cycle and previous exposure to a GTM Partner or Alliances & Channels Sales orgs A passion for understanding systems of work, how to build them and how to improve them through both transformative and iterative approaches Strong problem solving and analytical ability, with a track record of “test & learn” demeanor Ability to multi-task and work in cross-functional, fast-paced environments with the pressure of multiple deadlines, multiple partners / vendors, and complexity Experience and desire for working in a start-up environment, developing business infrastructure, and energetically scaling a high-growth business Has strong analytical skills and a structured approach to solving unique business problems Nice To Haves Prior experience at a growth stage Internet or software company Experience working cross-functionally with sales teams and KPIs _SB6
industries: Computer Software, Financial Services, and Internet

description: Curious about AI, social media and innovative technology? Interested in diving deeper into corporate strategy, consumer insights and digital marketing? We’re looking for a scrappy Sales Development Rep looking to grow into a sales role.  Our platform combines more than a decade of development and dozens of patents for a unique offering used by hundreds of the world’s leading brands and agencies. We give customers the ability to discover broad context of a conversation with unsupervised learning while diving deeper with industry-leading NLP and sentiment analysis.  We are looking for the ability to think strategically about our business, product and any technical challenges, as well as the tactical execution to drive sales and business development goals. We want entrepreneurial and ambitious folks that can learn and apply our cutting-edge technology where no official playbook exists.  Responsibilities: Work with Marketing, Sales Directors and Account Managers to maintain a steady rate of conversion on marketing activity while also prospecting an outbound pipeline Ability and willingness to get on the phone and turn qualification discussions into leads Join an established team that knows the industry, has considerable sales experience, and works closely with technical resources to maximize opportunity Support the sales process for enterprise, consulting and agency accounts including sales strategy, lead generation, software validation Use your market knowledge to help develop new ways for companies to leverage NetBase Quid to solve their unique needs  About you: Passionate about sales – competitive nature to reach and exceed quota Previous sales development experience – particularly with outbound prospecting and lead gen Technically curious – wanting to learn new technologies and keep up with a product and market that’s constantly evolving Attention to detail, strong organizational skills, and an absolute focus on quality of work  Strong work ethic and self-starter, able to effectively manage multiple priorities and adapt to change within a fast-paced business environment  Experience with sales enablement or prospecting platforms like Outreach, Salesloft, Apollo, DiscoverOrg, ZoomInfo or LinkedIn Sales Navigator Experience in social media, digital marketing and/or AI tools is a plus  Location This position can be remote, anywhere in the U.S.  ABOUT NETBASE QUID NetBase Quid is the award-winning consumer and market intelligence platform that resulted from a merger between NetBase, the industry leader in social media analytics, and Quid, a leader in AI driven text analytics, on January 28th, 2020.  In today’s age of information overload, NetBase Quid delivers businesses an unprecedented solution that is faster, more accurate and actionable and with access to billions of indexed resources — from social media posts, consumer reviews, product reviews, news articles to business filings, to patent applications, and forums – which can be aggregated, analyzed, and visualized in order to discover consumer and market insights.  The enhanced platform delivers clear, real-time and actionable results so that customers can distinguish between critical and non-essential business issues, ultimately empowering them to make smarter, data driven decisions quickly and efficiently. Learn more at https://netbasequid.com/
jobFunction: Sales, Business Development, and Customer Service
industries: Market Research, Consumer Services, and Marketing and Advertising

description: Date: Jun 30, 2021  Location: Chicago, IL, US  Company: Teleflex  Expected Travel: More than 50%  Requisition ID: 4150  About Teleflex Incorporated  Teleflex is a global provider of clinically effective medical technologies designed to improve the health and quality of people's lives. We apply purpose driven innovation - a relentless pursuit of identifying unmet clinical needs - to benefit patients and healthcare providers. Our portfolio is diverse, with solutions in the fields of vascular and interventional access, interventional cardiology, surgical, anesthesia, cardiac care, interventional urology, urology, emergency medicine and respiratory care. Teleflex employees worldwide are united in the understanding that what we do every day makes a difference. For more information, please visit teleflex.com.  We Equip Clinicians With Some Of The Most Advanced Medical Devices On The Market Today, From Our World-class Brands Including  Anesthesia and Emergency Medicine - At Teleflex, we promote the use of advanced anesthesia and emergency medicine techniques to help improve outcomes and reduce healthcare costs. LMAÂ® and RÃ¼schÂ® airway management devices designed to help reduce the risk of airway-related complications ArrowÂ® pain management products designed to improve patients' post-operative pain experience The ArrowÂ® EZ-IOÂ® System that helps address the time-critical challenge of emergency vascular access, and QuikClotÂ® and QuikClot Control+Â® hemostatic devices, used by hospitals, EMS, and the military for hemorrhage control in a broad range of bleeding situations. Join a dynamic, growing team that offers healthcare providers advanced medical technology solutions that make a difference in patients' lives.  Position Summary  This Chicago based sales position is part of the Teleflex's Pain Management Sales team, and is responsible for driving an overall regional anesthesia and pain management strategy for the Chicago territory. This position will support sales for our pain management products, including spinal, epidural, pain pump, perirpheral nerve block products under the brand of Arrow and Teleflex. This position achieves sales goals through interface with clinicians - particularly chiefs of anesthesia, pain management physicians, nurses, members of the block team and various health care professionals throughout the hospital. Reporting to a Senior Sales and Marketing Manager, this role ensures the maximization of territory sales, profitability, and future business opportunities for our pain management portfolio.  Principal Responsibilities Drive sales revenues by planning and coordinating sales activities in concert with the management team Monitor and report regional sales results and forecast to Regional Anesthesia Sr. Sales Manager Be comfortable in working within a complex matrix environment being able to take the lead and inspire Develop sales strategy and tactics with team members and support/drive execution Communicate internally and externally, motivating people without the necessity of formal management/direct report authority Manage and coordinate intercompany relationships (Director of Sales, RSM's, marketing, clinical education, training) so that targeted sales revenues are achieved monthly/quarterly. Be a key educator for the Regional Anesthesia and Autofuser platform of products, communicating the clinical, patient and hospital benefits to physicians, nurses and members of materials management / value analysis. Manage and support hospital clinical trials Monitor and report regional competitor activity Develop and build Regional Key Opinion Leader (KOL) relationships (to include positions such as chiefs of anesthesiology, pain management and clinical staff members) working directly with Sales Directors and Regional Sales Managers along with marketing teams. Support key trade fairs and congresses as necessary Adhering to and ensuring the compliance of the Company's Code of Ethics, all Company policies which include but are not limited to the North America Contract Administration Policy and Procedures, North America Sales and Marketing Compliance Policy, the Health Care Provider Payment Tracking Policy and the North America Discount and Pricing Policy Education / Experience Requirements A bachelor's degree is required, with 2-6 years' sales experience. Prior sales experience would ideally include medical device sales experience selling to hospital, surgical centers and clinics, with particular emphasis in regional anesthesia and/or pain management products. Clinically knowledgeable - with a history of utilizing basic anatomy and physiology as a major part of driving a sale forward Experience in initiating and managing hospital clinical trials at all levels within the hospital Experienced in supporting/driving sales process bedside and/or within the sterile/clean field Complete computer systems and business software competency, including all current office tools such as Outlook, Excel, PowerPoint and equivalent Prior skills and/or core competencies for this position include: Delighting the customer Sales quota achievement Embodies core values Strategic planning / selling skills Medical industry knowledge / acumen / competitor knowledge Sense of Urgency Territory administration Specialized Skills / Other Requirements Demonstrated knowledge of basic Profit & Loss (P&L) principles Proven communication skills - able to communicate internally and externally, motivating people without the necessity of formal management/direct report authority as this position may not have direct reports Proven and successful experience relative to driving the sales process throughout an entire hospital system Proven experience of selling to Hospital Administration to include the "C Suite" Proven experience in maximizing GPO/IDN related opportunities Managerial experience of indirect teams Able to influence and collaborate teams without direct reporting relationship Teleflex, Inc. is an affirmative action & equal opportunity employer. jobTitle: Enterprise Sales Executive - Midwest, USA (Healthcare Revenue Cycle - Providers)
description: Finvi (previously Ontario Systems) has a new and exciting position as Enterprise Sales Executive in our Sales Department selling our complex Healthcare Revenue Cycle solutions to both providers and outsourcers. This individual will also focus on clients & prospective clients in the Midwestern United States.  Location This position will be remote. Candidate may work where they live anywhere in the United States. Preferably, the candidate will live in or near the sales territory (Midwestern United States).  Visa sponsorship or transfer of an existing visa is not available for this position. Applicants must be authorized to work directly for any employer in the United States without visa sponsorship or transfer.  What You’ll Do Meet or exceed quarterly and annual revenue bookings goals for products and services Demonstrate ability to prospect to create an active pipeline of new revenue opportunities that facilitates success in bookings goals Be a trusted advisor to clients and prospects by demonstrating a competency in the industry, product, and services Manage a robust pipeline to meet revenue bookings goals and proactively move opportunities through the customer journey Forecast with accuracy the potential increase in revenue from assigned prospects in your territory Ensure client satisfaction and client retention. Your customers see you as a partner  What You’ll Need Bachelor’s degree in sales/professional selling, business, marketing, public relations, management or related field 5 to 10+ years of experience in healthcare revenue cycle sales sector recommended Minimum of 5 years proven experience as a successful field sales professional Selling of complex solutions/consultative (not commodity sales) within healthcare and/or patient payment verticals Software sales within a team environment Demonstrate consistent achievement (and exceeding) of revenue bookings goals, quotas and related objectives Knowledge and contacts in the healthcare revenue cycle is highly preferred. Best candidate has not had a sole focus in clinical sales, candidates in healthcare market need experience selling financial systems and services Must have a strong desire to win with a competitive spirit. We are looking for a hunter, not a farmer! Strong intellectual curiosity and demonstrated ability to sell in a competitive environment – solution selling is very important Demonstrated technical and business acumen and ability to persuade and influence Must be able to travel up to 40-50% of the time Knowledge of Salesforce a plus  Important Note: Although we have described above what we are generally looking for, we are very likely missing other attributes and skills that may make you a great fit. We’d hate to miss out! Research has shown that women and other marginalized groups tend to apply if they check 100% of every box, versus men who apply if they are qualified for roughly 60% of the skills/experience illustrated in the job posting. The point we’re getting at…it doesn’t hurt to take a chance and apply! We look forward to getting to know you!  Benefits We believe our values and You-Powered Culture set us apart. We take them very seriously and they’re at the core of everything we do. Beyond our values, we have some other great perks: Best Places to Work award-winning organization since 2015 Career growth and mentorship opportunities You-Powered Culture – We’ll support you in getting what you need, from your first contact during your hiring process throughout your career at Finvi Flexible work environment Competitive pay and 401(k) Health insurance with wellness discounts, medical, dental and vision care Well-deserved time off with Paid Time Off program, personal holiday, plus 8 paid holidays Paid Volunteer Time Off Program – make a difference in your community 24/7 onsite fitness center Education assistance program  About Finvi Finvi is a premier provider of enterprise technologies that streamline and accelerate revenue recovery for clients in the healthcare, government, and accounts receivable management (ARM) markets. Through process automation and modern, compliance-minded communication and payment tools, Finvi helps its client partners generate more revenue at reduced cost and fulfill their organizational mission by effectively engaging patients, constituents, and consumers.  With offices in Indiana, Massachusetts, New Mexico, and Washington state as well as employees across the country, Finvi is building on 40 years of success using a distinctly client-centric approach to innovation and service. A recognized brand in the revenue cycle management (RCM) market, Finvi helps 600+ hospital networks—including 5 of the 15 largest systems in the US—optimize cash collections and provide a single, satisfying patient financial experience. Finvi also serves 8 of the 10 largest ARM companies in addition to a number of state and municipal governments across the United States.  Equal Employment Opportunity & Affirmative Action Policy Finvi and our affiliates are Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employers. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, disability status or other non-merit factor.  Finvi Welcomes All.

Actively develop and manage relationships with wholesaler personnel Ensure the planning and implementation of sales programming in all markets Ensure POS and other marketing assets are utilized in the field with correct programs Participate in the development of program-specific POS Call on and activate Key Accounts Implement creative programs to activate the consumer, including product sampling, etc. Spend time each month surveying the market to ensure that distribution, pricing, POS, displays, programs, menus, and ads are executed to standard Travel when appropriate to observe business conditions and to call on key buyers, distributor personnel, and interact and work with Company sales personnel Participate in Company and wholesaler planning and sales meetings Ensure all Company SKUs are priced properly and within defined standards  Requirements  Strong interpersonal and leadership skills Good knowledge of the art and science of wholesaler programming and pricing Strong interpersonal and leadership skills to direct the Company brands Excellent planning and organizational skills Ability to work independently with little direction or supervision; “self-starter” Willing to be very “hands-on” to get the job accomplished. jobTitle: Senior Sales Strategist (health plan sales) - remote opportunity
description: Description/Responsibilities  This role will focus on sales strategy and overarching efforts focused on increasing revenue and market share. This role will be responsible for understanding market forces and competitive intel, as well as goal setting and strategy development for new sales and current client upsells. The ideal candidate has an analytical mind with the ability to act as an inspirational adviser and business partner while working cross functionally with Sales, Client Relations, Marketing, and Public Relations. Proactively identify, develop, and drive key sales strategies that deliver long term profitable growth based on industry needs and sales process insights. Responsible for the development, and continuous update, of sales strategy frameworks, competitive insights, trend assessments, and market sizing in order to influence strategies to increase market share of Tivity products. Responsible for providing guidance to the organization around areas of opportunity for new clients, payors, and partners. Work closely with the leadership team to ensure Sales and Client Relations are hitting goals and generating sufficient quality pipeline to meet quarterly revenue targets. Provide consultation to the Client Relations and Sales teams around product positioning and sales approach to ensure the team is taking advantage of all opportunities to increase revenue. Collaborate with the B2B marketing team to obtain and advise on content that drives growth, advising on, and executing comprehensive go-to-market plans. Drive the use of Salesforce as a guiding tool, modernizing the way Sales and Client Relations use Salesforce throughout the sales process. Ensure monitoring of key sales performance indicators for senior leadership to review on a monthly basis, including dashboards within Salesforce. Qualifications Bachelor's degree in Business or Marketing preferred, or relevant experience. Experience in Sales Operations Experience in strategy development and execution, resulting in measurable revenue impact Experience selling to Medicare Advantage and Medicare Supplement plans Experience planning and running strategic sales trainings Experience providing sales consulting services, either internally or externally Deep experience using Salesforce as a tool that increases productivity and revenue Product marketing experience, ideally from product conception to launch Deep understanding of the healthcare industry and emerging payor trends Creative ability to identify opportunities for revenue growth and sales expansion Ability to understand and use data to set goals and define strategies Natural ability to collaborate with and inspire others to drive growth for the organization Creative eye, with an intention towards detail and efficiency Natural ability to see opportunities and a love for solving problems Excellent communicator, both verbally and in written form Ability to listen for understanding to determine the why behind the ask Proactive and collaborative, with a sense of urgency in driving to reach business goals 7214  About Tivity Health, Inc.  Tivity Health® Inc. (Nasdaq: TVTY) is a leading provider of healthy life-changing solutions, including SilverSneakers®, Prime® Fitness, WholeHealth Living® and Wisely WellTM. We plan to become the modern destination for healthy living by expanding beyond fitness as a digital engagement platform company. We are continuously developing the SilverSneakers suite of digital offerings and services to provide seniors with everything they need to maintain and improve their health, including physical activity, social connection, community involvement, volunteer opportunities and mental enrichment. Our goal is to partner with payers and service providers to enable a personalized, interactive, and intuitive experience to offer the right solutions to each member. We deliver solutions that help adults feel better, work better and live better, and improve health outcomes while reducing healthcare costs. Learn more at www.tivityhealth.com .  Tivity Health is an equal employment opportunity employer and is committed to a proactive program of diversity development. Tivity Health will continue to recruit, hire, train, and promote into all job levels without regard to race, religion, gender, marital status, familial status, national origin, age, mental or physical disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, source of income, or veteran status.
industries: Health, Wellness and Fitness, Hospital & Health Care, and Insurance

description: SalesScreen was founded in 2011 and has rapidly grown into a profitable product company with more than 40 employees globally developing and operating the best product in our niche. We have the leading motivation software on the market, and we only hire the best. In the course of the last couple of years, we have opened new offices and welcomed new teammates in Scandinavia, USA and Singapore.   SalesScreen is now used by thousands of top-teams all around the world, and our portfolio includes large, well-known brands from all over the world.  Our goal is to become the #1 software for any sales team worldwide. Do you have what it takes to join our team?  As a Sales Development Representative here at SalesScreen, your primary responsibility is to proactively contact outbound leads for the purpose of qualifying them for a more in-depth discussion with our Account Directors. Your overall responsibility is to quickly qualify these opportunities and work with the sales team to bring them to closure. You'll be creating new relationships, find and explore new business opportunities by contacting potential clients via email, phone, social platforms, etc.    What you'll do  Manage the prospect outreach process via emails, phone calls, social media interactions, etc.  Contacting and qualifying leads to set appointments for our Account Executives to close Being the first point of contact and education leads to help generate increased interest and to lead to sales Anticipating needs and concerns of potential clients and maintaining a knowledge of problems and issues that they are facing in their work Collaborate with the Marketing and Sales team on lead quality and conversion  Who you are You have a proven ability to sell with a 2+ years of related experience from similar role You're able to identify and qualify sales opportunities  Clear communication skills/excellent phone etiquette, with the ability to speak with C-Level and Senior Executives and ask thought-provoking questions  Able to work independently in an entrepreneurial environment and adaptive to change Strong interpersonal skills (friendly, outgoing, not afraid to talk to strangers)  You're highly motivated, passionate and able to keep a positive attitude with a passion for growth You thrive in healthy competition but are also a strongly team oriented and focused on the success of your peers as well as yourself  What you'll like about SalesScreen Competitive compensation  Generous commissions Flexible work hours and options for remote work Yearly summer & winter company retreats  Free daily lunch and coffee Medical, vision and dental insurance 401(k) plan A dedicated and playful company culture!  Come work with us At SalesScreen, we are one a mission to help our customers, sales teams around the world to unleash their full potential, and we need your help to do that. Are you talented, brave, dedicated and playful? If so; you might be the person we need. If you are looking for a company that has a strong company culture that is human, inclusive and friendly; we might be the company for you.

description: Director of Sales   Las Vegas/Remote in USA Full Time/Perm    Our client is a leading gaming industry provider of innovative payment technology solutions. They have a proven track record of delivering successful payment solutions for millions of patrons and billions of dollars in completed transactions. The company culture values collaboration, respect, and promotes growth and learning while achieving cutting-edge functionality balanced with very high usability.  The Director of Sales, reporting to the SVP of Mobile, will be working within a defined territory as an outward facing position responsible for delivering new customers contracts. The role will develop and implement successful sales processes to drive new business.    What you will do:  Execute sales strategy in your defined territory Implementation of sales processes Develop new customer, contracts and revenue, meeting new customer/revenue goals Use hands-on strategies for prospecting, cold calling, conducting presentations, negotiating and close new business Create high visibility and interaction with prospective customers via phone, email, and presentations, remotely and in-person Build strong customer relationships at all levels Ensure ongoing customer satisfaction for renewal and upsell opportunities Track and manage all sales pipeline and account activities Participate in industry events/conferences Creation of sales strategies by territory/accounts Work with product development to bring customer requirements into the product   What you will bring:  3 to 5+ years’ of proven success in growing sales, preferably in a start-up environment Sales in gaming industry experience in land-based casinos is required Natural and successful salesperson with a demonstrated track record in driving sales and closing deals You must be a self-starter, entrepreneurial in nature and have hunter mentality to drive results Strong experience with MSWord, Excel, and PowerPoint are required Must be able to listen and be open to directions and guidance Proven experience dealing with uncertainty and rapid change with a sense of ease Sports betting experience is preferred Mobile marketing experience is preferred Travel throughout territory will be required

The Position: Aesthetic Sales Representative – Inside Sales Job       About LaserAway    LaserAway is a medical aesthetics company set in bright, beautiful retail locations across the nation offering patients top of the line services including laser hair removal, skin rejuvenation, CoolSculpting and fillers. From attentive sales representatives to meticulous clinicians, each of our employees are laser-focused on providing results.    LaserAway is a family of passionate, talented and dedicated individuals with a collective goal to work hard and have fun doing it. We thrive off of lifting each other and our patients to be their best selves and push one another toward greater success.    With over 60 locations coast to coast and growing, LaserAway is looking for passionate, talented and dedicated individuals who want to take their career to the next level. We provide exceptional training to give you the tools to be successful and look for talent within our organization to grow with us.       Why LaserAway?   · Generous compensation structure including uncapped commission    · Career growth and advancement    · Flexible schedule and work-life balance    · Cutting edge medical equipment    · Employee discounts on products and services    · Supportive and uplifting office culture       LaserAway is taking all necessary Covid-19 precautions such as in-clinic social distancing, temperate checks and PPE usage.    LaserAway is accepting applications during COVID-19!   LaserAway is open and offering ALL treatments across ALL locations! We are busier than ever and following strict COVID-19 safety protocols to protect our staff and patients. LaserAway provides PPE, including masks and gloves, for all staff. Our enhanced safety protocols also include in-clinic social distancing, pre-shift wellness questionnaires, and temperature checks.    Even though we’re apart, LaserAway’s nationwide team is more connected than ever! We're hosting monthly live DJ sets, virtual happy hours, and other creative initiatives to engage and support our incredible employees.        Aesthetic Sales Representative Job Description    A LaserAway Aesthetic Sales Representative is vital to delivering customer service and driving sales results by selling and promoting LaserAway’s hair removal and non-surgical cosmetic services. We are looking for top performers with a track record of success. The Ideal candidate is confident with high integrity coupled with a customer-centric attitude. This person will be responsible for consultations and generating enthusiasm for our non-invasive procedures.    Our expert marketing team will provide you with warm leads through their social media initiatives. This position does not require any cold calling or telemarketing but does require outbound calls to leads. In addition to new patient sales, this role requires following up with previous potential clients/patients who have not purchased with us in the past. Our successful Aesthetic Sales Representatives are able to renew interest by promoting laser hair removal and non-surgical cosmetic services.       Aesthetic Sales Representative Job Responsibilities    • Initiate sales process by scheduling appointments with warm leads; conduct initial consultation; describe LaserAway’s treatments and skincare line professionally and with an expert knowledge base.    • Close sales by building rapport with potential patients; explain product and service capabilities; overcome objections; prepare financing contracts with lenders such as Care Credit and Loan Hero.    • Expand sales in existing accounts by introducing new products and services.    • Create client retention by upselling additional products and services.    • Recommend new products and services by evaluating current aesthetic treatment processes.    • Manage front desk duties such as checking patients in/out while ensuring a positive and warm experience and maintaining a clean and professional clinic.    • Adhere to LaserAway policies and protocols.      Aesthetic Sales Representative Skills and Qualifications    • Education/ Experience: Previous sales experience required.    • Communication Skills: Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to effectively communicate with patients, peers, and management. Ability to communicate with proper etiquette.    • Reasoning Ability: Ability to multitask, while being attentive to patients and remaining flexible to the needs of the business. Ability to work as part of a team and take initiative independent of direct supervision.    • Other Skills: Enthusiastic, friendly, and energetic with a genuine desire to provide outstanding service.      Aesthetic Sales Representative Compensation    LaserAway offers a generous pay structure with additional earning potential through commissions and bonuses. Additional benefits include (but not limited to)    • Healthcare benefits    • Dental, Vision, and 401(k)    • Paid Time Off    • Generous employee discounts       This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, LaserAway reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. LaserAway is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.
