Flawless oral and written communication skills sufficient to communicate clearly and grammatically both complex and simple messages to a wide audience either within or outside of the organization Strong sales, persuasion, negotiation, and customer service skills Strong knowledge of Microsoft Outlook (Excel, PowerPoint, Word, email, etc.) Role Model: Supports, manages, and acts as role model for the sales team Clearly articulates and embraces the vision, mission, and values of SolarteHealth in all communications Maintains open communication lines with desire to share information and collaborate on business growth initiatives  Preferred Qualifications  Successful sales execution and quota achievement in health insurance Proven ability to engage, nurture and build strong relationships with brokers and consultants  License Certifications  Insurance licenses and any other state-required certifications

jobTitle: Primary Care Sales Specialist / Senior – CRM – Tampa– Remote
description: Job Description  Over 200 new sales positions are being added to our Cardiovascular, Renal & Metabolism team. At Novartis we are committed to reducing the global burden of cardiovascular, renal, and metabolic diseases on patients, families, and their communities. We are focused on developing solutions targeting heart failure (acute and chronic), atherosclerosis, metabolic and renal diseases with the aim of improving quality of life for patients all over the world.  We are Novartis.  Join us and help reimagine medicine!  Job Purpose:  The Primary Care Specialist / Senior will build and execute business plans to meet sales goals for territory, and drive territory sales performance, market share and optimal resource utilization. The Primary Care Specialist / Senior will develop effective professional business relationships with customers that support delivery of business results across a range of therapeutic areas and differentiate Novartis as a leader in therapeutic areas.  This is a remote opportunity.  Your Key Responsibilities: Executes business plans and drives achievement of sales targets for assigned territory, customers or therapeutic area. Develops and applies understanding of customer organizations and networks and of diverse influences that affect customer decisions (e.g. peer relationships). Executes call plans for customers, including medical experts from customer or academic communities; calls on the right person to deliver the right message with the right frequency. Ensures that Novartis products and supporting services are broadly understood and available to more patients and customers. Deploys and uses approved Marketing and Sales promotional materials and programs; runs direct promotion programs and facilitates pull-through activities. Uses expert knowledge of Novartis products and of a range of therapy areas to build professional customer relationships and to support sound clinical discussions. Serve as a resource to assist with providing both proactive and reactive education and support regarding NPC CRM access programs as needed for community practices, medical groups and facilities, and their staff. Triage to franchise counterparts as appropriate. Proactively provide education and support on NPC CRM access programs for community practices, medical groups and facilities, and their staff Serve as a resource and/or assist with providing support for resolving customer/account questions regarding coverage, access, and reimbursement, where appropriate. Triage appropriate inquiries, including patient-specific inquiries, to FRM and/or other franchise counterparts as directed by NPC policy and procedure. Develop compliant customer-centric support strategies and proactively communicate payer policy criteria related to NPC CRM products   Integrity & Compliance: Adherence and accountability to NPC policies including policies regarding appropriate Medical / Commercial interactions, Code of Ethics, and all applicable laws and regulations. Works to ensure a diverse and inclusive environment free from all forms of discrimination and harassment. Ethical achievement of sales and revenue targets.   EEO Statement  The Novartis Group of Companies are Equal Opportunity Employers and take pride in maintaining a diverse environment. We do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.  Minimum Requirements  What You’ll Bring to the Role: Bachelor’s Degree (preferably in Life Sciences, Pharmacy, or business-related field). Minimum two years of successful sales experience (preferably business to business sales experience). Demonstrated outstanding discernment and business planning skills. Effective problem solving and decision-making skills. Exceptional ability to develop and sustain customer relationships. Proven track-record to collaborate and work cross functionally with internal and external partners. This is a remote position that will cover Key Accounts in the assigned region. Candidate must be based within that region or within a reasonable daily commuting distance. Ability to travel 60-80% over a broad geography is required, with the ability to drive and/or fly within the territory. No relocation available.   Preferred Qualifications: Experience across therapeutic groups, disease states and new product launches. Understanding of managed care environments and account management strategy. Knowledge of buy-and-bill, access, reimbursement resources, and product acquisition. Experience working with established injection networks.   Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:  Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity, and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.  Division  PHARMA  Business Unit  US PHARMA  Country  USA  Work Location  Tampa, FL  Company/Legal Entity  Novartis Pharmaceuticals  Functional Area  Sales  Job Type  Full Time  Employment Type  Regular  Shift Work  No  Early Talent  No

Looking for a high energy; sales leader to partner with Rebel Hospitality and lead the sales efforts of an independent lifestyle hotel located in downtown NYC.  The Director of Sales will have direct oversight of planning and managing the overall sales efforts and marketing. The intention is to achieve optimal occupancy growth in existing accounts and generating new business all to maximize total revenue and meet/exceed hotel profit objectives. This role will oversee day-to-day operations of the hotel sales division including but not limited to direct sales efforts follow-up and proper sales administration and training. This role will ultimately recommend the sales forecast marketing advertising sales plans programs and annual budget; manages within approved plans and budgets.  Responsibilities • At least 6 years of progressive hotel sales experience preferred. • Must possess highly developed verbal & written communication skills to frequently negotiate convince sell and influence other managerial personnel hotel guest(s) and/or corporate clients. • Must have thorough experience with professional selling skills: opening probing supporting closing • Shows strong analytical skills and strategic vision in establishing appropriate sales deployment • Must be proficient in general computer knowledge especially Microsoft Office products • Must be able to work independently and simultaneously manage multiple tasks • Strong organization and presentation skills • Requires advanced knowledge of the principles and practices within the sales/marketing/hospitality profession.

PITT OHIO, a $826 million, high service, highly profitable, transportation solutions provider offering SUPPLY CHAIN, GROUND, LTL and TRUCKLOAD services is seeking to fill an Outside Sales Representative for the Richmond, VA transportation market.  We offer competitive wages, hospital/medical insurance with no monthly premiums, vision, discount prescription, dental, 401K, profit sharing, paid vacations, pleasant work environment, and much more!  Essential Duties Identify and deliver new PITT OHIO Customers. Promote and sell all PITT OHIO Enterprise services. Efficiently maintain existing PITT OHIO customer relationships Prospect and develop retention program for new PITT OHIO Customers Effectively negotiate rate increases Support all Company goals and policies Sales territory must meet or exceed scorecard growth goal  OTHER DUTIES Interface with Operations, Pricing, Claims, Collections and Business Development Representatives Able to react to change in response to changes in the Company’s go to market strategy. Proficiently use PITT OHIO Sales applications. Participate in “Huddles” (collaborative sales meetings) to grow business.  MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS Minimum 3-5 years sales experience in the transportation field Previous experience or ability to learn in business to business selling.  Fluent English language skills required to effectively communicate with internal and external customers Must possess excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills Experienced in Microsoft Office programs and the Internet Skillful typing Valid Drivers License and clean driving record required Problem solving, negotiation, and time management skills are essential  WORKING CONDITIONS Travel is required; must be able to energetically travel by car, plane or public transportation Weekend and evening client contact required  To navigate to the PITT OHIO Career Center and apply for this position, please go to pittohio.balancetrak.com .

SaaS Sales Executive Virtual Position Full-time  Company Description The world is communicating at an accelerating rate, especially when it comes to conversations between people across the globe from one another. In multilingual communication, cutting and pasting conversations in and out of Google Translate often causes more confusion than clarity. Context is everything. The context of the organization that is being discussed. The context of the individual, where they live and what they are trying to accomplish. At the forefront of the conversational AI revolution, Language I/O provides that missing context and provides it quickly. Our SaaS technology empowers organizations to use their monolingual customer support agents and chatbots to provide text-based support in any language. Our solution integrates directly into the CRM (client relationship management) platforms such as Salesforce, Zendesk and Oracle  where the support agents already work. Our core translation technology can be trained within 48 hours to provide accurate, real-time translation of conversational chats and emails. The speed with which we can spin up real-time, company-accurate translations is a major differentiator in our space where competitors require six to eight weeks to train a machine translation engine.   We have a dynamic team, consisting of data scientists, software developers, systems administrators, and sales, marketing and support personnel. Our team is headquartered in Cheyenne, Wyoming in the US, though as a virtual company our employees span the globe. Our customers are not limited to a particular industry vertical and include giants in social media, marketing, consumer electronics and even language learning.   Corporate culture is key to the success of Language I/O, and we’re committed to hiring folks who are aligned with our belief in inclusion, diversity, servant leadership and transparency.  If you want to sell market-leading software into a dramatically expanding market and participate in the conversational AI revolution, then you need to be here!   Job Description The Enterprise Sales Executive (SE)  will have the primary responsibility of acquiring and growing our large enterprise customers. You will work with senior executives and the heads of customer success and product organizations to help them solve the messy problem of multilingual customer engagement. The SE will manage all aspects of the sales process including active prospecting, qualification, evaluation, deal closing and account care and will play an integral role in the success of the overall sales team.   Your long term goal: make the Language I/O platform an indispensable part of globalization operations within your target organizations.  Core Responsibilities  Identify, engage and close business within large, cross-vertical enterprises. Meet and exceed sales quotas through prospecting, qualifying, managing and closing sales opportunities within the assigned territory. Position yourself as a domain expert by  understanding customer needs and helping customers drive value through Language I/O. Develop and manage sales pipeline, prospect and assess sales and move multiple transactions simultaneously through the sales pipeline. Manage and track customer interaction and transactional information in a CRM system Coordinate pre-sales resources throughout the sales cycle. Provide presentations, product demonstrations and general support to prospective customers. Execute a land-and-expand sales strategy with well thought out enterprise sales strategies. Provide regular reporting of prospecting, pipeline and forecast through the CRM system. Keep abreast of competition, competitive issues and products. Collaborate with internal partners (e.g. product, customer success, operations) to provide accurate use cases from the field, improve internal processes and champion sustained success.  Qualifications Experienced. Minimum seven years of enterprise sales experience with leading SaaS providers. Technical. Familiarity with Language I/O core technologies such as AI, ML and NLP. Proficient in sales CRM platforms, deal lifecycle tracking and data analysis to improve sales processes. Enterprise-Level Closer. Track record of exceeding quota and closing annual subscriptions in excess of $100K. Self-Motivated. You have a sense of urgency and the ability to multitask and work many sales opportunities simultaneously. Sales Cycle Expert. You have expertise at an enterprise level. You develop and lead prospects by applying analytics to specific business issues. You know how to “drive a deal.” Team Player. You understand early-stage. You understand the need to work as a team for everyone to be successful. You know there are never enough resources and every day presents a challenge. You thrive on “solve it yourself” and the satisfaction it brings. Excellent Communicator. You know what to say and more importantly, how and when to say it.  Benefits Language I/O values a healthy work-life balance and seeks to promote true wellness for each of its employees. We offer a comprehensive benefits package when you join the team that includes:  Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance with a choice of carriers 401(k) Retirement Savings Account Healthcare Savings Account Four weeks of Paid Time Off Health & Wellness Reimbursement program--for gyms, fitness centers, and more Internet & Phone Reimbursement program Parental Leave Program Pet Insurance Continuing Education--LinkedIn Learning membership & reimbursement of book costs Work From Anywhere--all remote, all the time   This is a full-time, salaried, exempt position. Qualified candidates must be authorized to work in the United States of America for any employer. Competitive salary dependent upon experience.

(Remote Position) Qualifications Professional success working in B2C Sales environment Previous experience closing high end sales and experience with both cold and warm traffic leads and a high conversion rate  Full Job Description We are a cutting-edge, somatic, trauma-informed emotional health coaching company for high performance founded by Mastin Kipp.  Our mission is to identify, dissolve  and integrate the root cause of emotional trauma in high performers to unlock our clients unlimited potential and creativity to change the world.  Our company leads in the field of trauma-informed personal development and sales, and we are the only trauma-informed life coaching company in existence today and it's our honor to work with 97% female clients. We work with high-performing and high functioning clients. We are trauma-informed, but er do not serve adverse populations.   We focus on the betterment of well people to help them create optimum emotional health. We take a trauma-informed, neuroscience backed and evidence based approach to coaching clients to live in a state of sustained high performance. We use many bottom up and top down approaches to aid clients to create, find and maintain these optimal states of high performance.   We value safety, play, integration and doing our own deep work so that we can show up in an optimal state for our clients.   We honor the body, love the brain and know that the entire human system is one connected body-mind that cannot be separated into parts, because each part impacts the others.  We are seeking a driven, passionate, hard working Sales Associate to enroll clients into our trauma-informed programs to get this support  and invite you to apply if you feel called to step into the cutting-edge of trauma-informed and therapeutic sales part of this mission.  Did we mention, we value hard work and play?  Here’s who we are looking for… An experienced Sales Associate who will participate in sales efforts and scale our company. This person will participate in the implementation and evaluation of all sales initiatives.  Our ideal Sales Associate will join us with at least 2-3 years of relevant experience in the field of high end sales and be willing and excited to be trained in our culture and trauma informed sales methods. *If you haven’t held a sales position for at least two years or are unable to provide references for recent sales work please do not apply.   An education plus: bachelor’s degree/certification/in high end sales or leadership.   We are looking for our Sales Associate to possess the following qualities/skills: You are passionate, driven, optimistic and love people and building relationships. You are energized by making sales calls, building relationships, and meeting new people every day. You put people above profit but still make your sales goals and work to improve your close rate. You love to not only find a sale but also love to close the sale.  You are hungry and willing to earn your spot on an A level team. You are willing to work long hours to make your numbers, serve our clients and learn about trauma informed sales.  You are a team player who wants the company to succeed.  You thrive in a fast-paced environment and have PLENTY of ideas in proven sales to share with our team.  Sales experience and a track record of cold calling, prospecting, lead with a question-based sales style, strength in acquiring and converting referrals, follow up, asking for the sale, lead conversion, creating and developing sales marketing campaigns. Ability to evaluate email copy, marketing messaging and cold call discussion points. You don’t need a script to make conversation.  Experience in communications with B2C sales and comfort talking with clients who need special care to understand how we can best transform their lives. You must be teachable and willing to try new processes and learn from our team while sharing your skills and knowledge so we can all work together to best serve our clients. This is a role for a seasoned self-starter who can work without a lot of direct supervision and is quick to pivot when needed. Confident and good communicator (via in person, phone, email, text and video) Able to travel to live events (Covid depending) , virtual events and in person team retreats. (Weekends are required from time to time) Experienced computer operations: G-drive, Word, Excel etc. All to be used for creating and storing sales records and reports for the Head of Enrollment and CEO.    You would be an ideal member of our team if you have the above skills AND are… Autonomous/Independent -- enjoys working with little direction Patient and Kind -- you care about clients and they can feel it  Team player with a mindset of; no job is too small Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous People-oriented -- enjoys interacting with teams and future clients  Adaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction Achievement-oriented -- enjoys taking on challenges, even if they might fail Skilled in time management and personal organization  Role & Responsibilities:  On our team, the Sales Associate plays several different roles: cold calling, lead warm up, high end offers, upsells, retention, prospect tracking, client follow through; from sales to onboarding.  Communicating and being highly responsive to our clients through email, text, Zoom and at live/virtual events and retreats where sales are concerned. Work closely with our team to nurture and generate consistently strong leads.   Focused on increasing revenues through creating warm leads and closing them.  Represent part of the team in sales surrounding the core of our programs - from online challenges to high ticket offers.    Make outbound calls and support our marketing emails to prospects. Following through and following up with prospects will be a key to our teams’ success.   Be proactive in your communication with our Head of Enrollment by asking questions and getting assistance if you’re not hitting your numbers.    Day to Day Responsibilities:  Everything Sales: Making outbound sales calls and responding to inbound inquiries. Working day to day with people, persuading them in an extremely professional manner to join our coaching community. Meet daily, weekly, or monthly sales goals for yourself and our team. You will prepare and deliver sales reports to our head of enrollment and CEO daily.  Community: Our Sales Associate; will be the eyes and ears, for our Head of Enrollment on sales initiatives, listening to client objections, feedback and noticing trends so that we can constantly improve our marketing ideas, and how to best serve our warm / cold traffic to further future clients from the initial point of contact, into online programs, Live events and then through sales process and completing the transformation we seek to provide.   Live Events: Sales support for clients and our team at all Live events and on calls.  SOP’s: Document your prospect tracking and keep it up to date and current so that you are always thinking ahead. .   Communications: Communicate with the Head of Enrollment while executing sales plans and delivery.   Hours of Service: Monday-Friday 10am to 6pmEST. ( Work hours can be flexible but must be consistent and work for the times when our clients are free to chat. Occasional weekend work is required).  How we cultivate culture and community… We NURTURE our clients from the moment they are cold leads forward.  We are all about innovation and taking great care of our clients. We have GREAT clients, and we are happy to go the extra mile for them in order to give them the care, action plan, experience and ANSWERS that they have been searching for by offering our programs and services.   We are a team of A players who love to get things done quickly. We pivot, are agile and are great at working together and being responsible for our outcomes as individual team members and as a whole. We are a small team, but we pack a lot in every day.  The most successful team members are able to thrive in a fast-paced environment, be comfortable juggling multiple tasks/projects at once and still be able to help each client in front of you with patience, enthusiasm and zero hard selling.  We listen to our clients’ concerns/questions/objections, respond to them in a timely manner, actively and proactively follow up with them, and maybe even rearrange our schedule to take a few extra minutes to provide the connection and safely they need to make an enrollment decision.    Joining our team you will learn a lot about trauma-informed life sales and coaching!   Start date: ASAP (90 day trial period).  Salary: 100% commission. You must be ready to hustle, warm leads and close them.  If this sounds like the right fit for you, we would LOVE to talk to you.. Only completed applications will be reviewed. Please send us a comprehensive cover letter, resume, short video of yourself telling us why you would like to work with us.   Job Types: Full-time, Contract  Schedule: Day shift Monday to Friday Weekend support is occasionally required.  Full Time Opportunity: Yes  Work Location: Fully Remote  Typical start time: 10AM EST (please see above)   Typical end time: 6PM EST (please see above)  To apply, please send your resume to jenna@mastinkipp.com

How Will You Make An Impact  Management of business development, key commercial accounts and commercial liaison within the LPD OEM business portfolio. Key tasks and responsibilities for this position include but not limited to: building a ‘partner’ relationship with all business users within assigned areas, defining customer requirements & scoping of new opportunities for Business Team review, developing capabilities presentations, managing key contracts, management of overall communications with customer and conducting business reviews (QBR). The candidate shall lead internal cross functional team meetings to accomplish goals and commitments made to the strategic customers and communicate status and issues to customers regularly. This role is considered a key member of the respective business and OEM Commercial team(s) and must have the vision, drive, and interpersonal skills to succeed in a growth environment. The candidate will be a “hands on” account management professional operating with a sense of ownership.  What Will You Do Build strong customer allegiance and partnership, Key Accounts as assigned Manage estimated 3-5 Key Accounts Evaluate and lead all new business development opportunities for LPD OEM Manage contract renewals, price strategies and commercial initiatives to drive growth target of 3% per annum Expand LSG portfolio breadth within account, where possible Evaluate and lead all new business opportunities for LPD OEM projects Lead QBR reviews internal and with customers Provide strategic inputs for product and technology roadmap Commercial and Technical lead for customer interaction prior to full NPD project team assignment BU, Division or corporate leadership approval on all proposals and quotations Drive quotation teams from all LPD manufacturing sites as needed to prepare proposals and quotations for LPD OEM solutions Global travel to support regional commercial teams on presenting capabilities and driving opportunity for new projects (with approval). How Will You Get There 5 plus years of sales experience managing large complex accounts strongly preferred Experience within the Biotech industry strongly preferred BS degree in Science, Business, Engineering strongly preferred Minimum required education: Bachelor degree or Associate degree with 2 years of experience or high school diploma/GED with 4 years of relevant experience Position may require Covid-19 vaccination and/or routing testing, per client discretion Experience Qualifications Demonstrated success and experience working within matrix organizations Demonstrated ability to operate independently with initiative, objective attainment intensity, and solid business judgment Proven ability to sell creative solutions to high level customer personnel Demonstrated excellence in oral and written communications skills Strong organizational and time management skills with good orientation to detail Strong technical, business, and financial acumen Highly effective negotiation skills Sophisticated level of computer proficiency Benefits A choice of national medical and dental plans, and a national vision plan Diversity & Inclusion council and Employee Resource Groups including Women’s Group, LGBTQA, African Heritage, Veteran's, and Working Parents Tax-advantaged savings and spending accounts and commuter benefits Fleet vehicle At least 120 hours paid time off (PTO), 10 paid holidays annually, paid parental leave (3 weeks for bonding and 8 weeks for caregiver leave), accident and life insurance, short- and long-term disability, and volunteer time off in accordance with company policy Retirement and savings programs, such as our competitive 401(k) U.S. retirement savings plan Employees’ Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) offers eligible colleagues the opportunity to purchase company stock at a discount At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 80,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

jobTitle: Associate Sales Representative, Surgical - Chicago, IL
description: Date: Aug 27, 2021  Location: Chicago, IL, US  Company: Teleflex  Expected Travel: More than 50%  Requisition ID: 4569  About Teleflex Incorporated  Teleflex is a global provider of clinically effective medical technologies designed to improve the health and quality of people's lives. We apply purpose driven innovation - a relentless pursuit of identifying unmet clinical needs - to benefit patients and healthcare providers. Our portfolio is diverse, with solutions in the fields of vascular and interventional access, interventional cardiology, surgical, anesthesia, cardiac care, interventional urology, urology, emergency medicine and respiratory care. Teleflex employees worldwide are united in the understanding that what we do every day makes a difference. For more information, please visit teleflex.com.  Surgical - Whatever the latest surgical breakthrough looks like, Teleflex is working to make it happen. From our MiniLapÂ® Percutaneous Surgical System to WeckÂ® Hem-o-lokÂ® Polymer Locking Ligation System, and Weck EFxÂ® Shieldâ„¢ Fascial Closure System, our portfolio of products adds up to a powerful offering of solutions that helps improve patient outcomes. These innovative, minimally invasive surgery products are offered alongside time-tested and trusted PillingÂ® Surgical Instrument and Lightsource solutions to provide a comprehensive set of solutions to meet the challenges of an evolving healthcare environment. Join a dynamic, growing team that offers healthcare providers an array of medical technology solutions that make a difference in patients' lives.  Position Summary  The primary function of the Associate Sales Representative is to provide clinical and sales support to their respective area. Critical roles and responsibilities include effectively educating physicians and support staff on the appropriate setup and use of all Teleflex Surgical products. Associate Sales Representatives are expected to work in concert with Associate Sales Representative Manager, Regional Sales Managers, Market Development Managers, Key Account Managers, and Sales Representatives to support and convert competitive users to Teleflex Surgical products. Additionally, the Associate Sales Representative on occasion will be required to attend trade shows, attend animal and cadaver labs, conduct in-services for staff and participate in sales presentations to prospective customers. Extensive travel will be required throughout the region, area, or nation based on clinical and personnel needs. Associate Sales Representatives will potentially be reassigned to cover vacant territories for an extended period of time due to but not limited to short-term disability, FMLA, or illness.  Principal Responsibilities Exhibit competencies with the Teleflex Surgical product line and competitors. Manage expenses according to Teleflex policy Assist Marketing Department on surveys and gathering customer information Assist with trade shows when requested Actively participate in and contribute to quarterly and national sales meetings Continually prospect for new customers; consistently update customer database (salesforce.com) and communicate those updates to Sales and Marketing counterparts. Fill out customer complaint forms on a timely basis and send to Quality Assurance Share competitive information with home office staff, their RSM counter-part and Area Director Taking proper care of Teleflex Surgical products in their possession Participate in designated conference calls and meetings Follow up on requests made by Sales Leadership Assist in, create and initiate strategies and tactics to increase utilization in the territories supported. Education / Experience Requirements Bachelor's degree (BA/BS) from a four-year college or university. Proven track record of success Able to spend a significant amount of time (50 - 80%) traveling in the U.S. Advanced level proficiency with computer skills (MS Office, Word, Excel and PowerPoint) Outgoing with a positive attitude Specialized Skills / Other Requirements Possess a valid driver's license and operate a motor vehicle with satisfactory driving records Carry detail bag weighing up to 20 lbs. Lift equipment weighing up to 30 lbs. Be standing or walking in numerous hospitals or at meetings for 6 - 10 hours per day, up to five (5) days per week. Interact with others through effective, verbal communication. TRAVEL REQUIRED: 50-80%  Teleflex, Inc. is an affirmative action & equal opportunity employer. D/V/M/F. Applicants will be considered without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, sex, or veteran status. If you require accommodation to apply for a position, please contact us at: 262-439-1894.  Teleflex is the home of ArrowÂ®, DeknatelÂ®, Hudson RCIÂ®, LMAÂ®, PillingÂ®, RÃ¼schÂ®, UroLiftÂ® and WeckÂ® - trusted brands united by a common sense of purpose. Teleflex, the Teleflex logo, Arrow, Deknatel, Hudson RCI, LMA, Pilling, RÃ¼sch, UroLift and Weck are trademarks or registered trademarks of Teleflex Incorporated or its affiliates, in the U.S. and/or other countries.

We are seeking an experienced, self-motivated and organized individual as a field sales representative who will maintain and grow existing accounts and bring in new referral business with Physicians, and healthcare institutions. description: Toray Plastics (America), Inc., is a subsidiary of the Japan-based Toray Group, which manufactures synthetic fibers, carbon fibers, plastics, and chemicals and employs more than 45,000 people in 26 countries. Annual sales exceed US$21 billion.  TPA's films businesses in Rhode Island and foams division in Virginia are global leaders and provide innovative products that are used worldwide for consumer and industrial applications. TPA is committed to environmental, social, and corporate governance. Learn more by visiting www.toraytpa.com.  We currently have an opportunity available for a Sales Representative with our Lumirror Division.  Primary Function: Responsible for managing the sales and marketing of Company products within an assigned territory in an effort to gain market share and grow margin. Expand customer base and product usage while helping to develop new, value-added markets for both existing and new products. Promote and strengthen customer relations through the prompt resolution of customer problems. Monitor business activity to advise Management concerning product acceptance, need for new products, and emerging opportunities and challenges as they develop. Develop and maintain technical competency to partner with assigned customers to help develop sound technical solutions to film-oriented needs.  Essential Duties Manages the day-to-day sales activity within an assigned territory consisting of a select group of customers, geographic area, or specific market to grow market share and enhance margin. Develops and maintains healthy, professional relationships across departmental boundaries within the customer base. Meets and/or exceeds assigned annual sales volume and profitability targets by nurturing relationships with existing customers while expanding our customer base and helping to develop new, value-added markets for both existing and new products. Acts as the primary interface between the customer and the Company to resolve issues in a timely, professional manner. Interfaces directly across appropriate departments internally to resolve issues, while escalating issues when necessary in order to reach acceptable resolutions. Monitors business conditions, market trends, and competitive activity, advising Management to position the Company to take advantage of developing opportunities in a timely manner. Works with product development and marketing personnel to define potentially new, value-added Toray products to meet the needs of emerging market areas. Provides support at trade shows/exhibitions. Develops and maintains a high degree of technical proficiency with regard to Company product offerings and capabilities as they align with customer requirements. Works effectively with existing and potential customers to develop solutions that expand the use of our products while strengthening the business relationship. Solicits involvement of engineering or technical support personnel when necessary Actively promotes open and aged inventory sales through customer networks. Monitors selling expenses and seeks to reduce costs through efficient and advanced scheduling of client visits. Complies with administrative requirements in the areas of sales reporting, forecasting, customer claims, expense reporting, etc. Prepares and presents reports and summaries detailing sales results, opportunities, and challenges. Ensures that sales management is made aware in a timely manner of any developments that impact the company's ability to meet established goals. Skills & Qualifications Technical knowledge and demonstrated sales skills in the plastics, chemical, and/or films arena. Strong communications skills - oral, written, and presentation. Ability to close sales and handle difficult customer relations situations. Time management skills/organizational and the ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously. Strong PC skills to include word processing, Excel, and presentation software. Ability to quickly establish and maintain professional business relationships. Willing and able to travel. Education & Experience Bachelor's degree (required) in an appropriate area. One-to-Four years of experience in the chemical, plastics, or converting industry with demonstrated ability to manage customer relationships while grasping the technical aspects of Company products and how they fit into the Markets we serve. Toray Plastics (America), Inc. is committed to the principles of equal employment opportunity and prohibits discrimination based on any protected status, workplace harassment/bullying and retaliation for filing a complaint or providing information related to a complaint. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and medical-related conditions), age (40 and over), national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information (including testing and characteristics), veteran status or any other consideration protected by federal, state or local laws.  It is the policy of Toray Plastics (America) Inc. to maintain a work environment that is safe for all persons, including the community, and conducive to attaining high work standards. To achieve these objectives, we are committed to maintaining a drug, tobacco and alcohol-free workplace and perform pre-employment testing.

jobTitle: Sales Candidates Attending National NSN Career Event November 3-5, 2021 in Washington, DC
description: THIS POSTING IS INTENDED FOR THOSE REGISTERED TO ATTEND THE NATIONAL SALES NETWORK CAREER EVENT ON NOVEMBER 3-5, 2021 IN WASHINGTON, DC.  Our team is looking forward to meeting you during the National Sales Network (NSN) Career Event taking place on November 3-5, 2021. Our recruiting team will be attending NSN and are actively seeking top talent for opportunities across all operating units and locations.  Applying to this posting gives our recruiting team the opportunity to review your resume and qualifications ahead of the Conference. If we find a match with a current opening, you may be contacted prior to the event.  Please visit our career site at https://jobs.medtronic.com/ to view and apply for current job opportunities.  We appreciate your interest in Careers at Medtronic and look forward to meeting you in person!  For our full-time opportunities in Sales , we are looking for a minimum of a completed Bachelor's Degree , completed by May 2022 with 0+ years of experience. Medical sales experience is preferred, but not required.  For full-time Clinical opportunities, we are looking for a High School Diploma or GED and a minimum of 6 years of clinical or medical sales experience; or an Associate’s Degree and a minimum of 4 years of clinical or medical sales experience; or a Bachelor’s Degree and a minimum of 2 years of clinical or medical sales experience.  We have locations around the country, including (but not limited to):  Boston, MA  Boulder, CO  Fort Worth, TX  Irvine, CA  Jacksonville, FL  Los Angeles (Northridge), CA  North Haven, CT  Memphis, TN  Minneapolis, MN  Santa Ana, CA  Santa Rosa, CA  Tempe, AZ  About Medtronic  Together, we can change healthcare worldwide. At Medtronic, we push the limits of what technology, therapies and services can do to help alleviate pain, restore health and extend life. We challenge ourselves and each other to make tomorrow better than yesterday. It is what makes this an exciting and rewarding place to be.  We want to accelerate and advance our ability to create meaningful innovations - but we will only succeed with the right people on our team. Let’s work together to address universal healthcare needs and improve patients’ lives. Help us shape the future.  DIVERSITY & INCLUSION  Join a diverse team of innovators who bring their worldview, their unique backgrounds, and their individual life experiences to work every day. It’s no accident —we work hard to cultivate a workforce that reflects our patients and partners. We believe it’s the only way to drive healthcare forward and remain a global leader in medical technology and solutions.  EMPLOYEE RESOURCE GROUPS  Our Diversity Networks and Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) are building a sense of community, belonging, and activation for Medtronic employees. Medtronic supports diversity networks and ERGs focused in various areas such as gender, ethnicity, age, faith, sexual orientation, military veteran status, disability status and other shared affinities.  Medtronic Ou & Portfolio Descriptions  Diabetes Operating Unit:  The Diabetes Operating Unit focuses on improving the lives of those within the global diabetes community. As a business, we strive to empower people with diabetes to live life on their terms by delivering innovation that truly matters and providing support in the ways they need it. We’re committed to meeting people with diabetes where they are in their journey, always with an aim to make their lives easier. Our portfolio of innovative solutions are designed to provide customers greater freedom and better health, helping them achieve better glucose control, while spending less time managing their disease.  Cardiovascular Portfolio:  Cardiac Ablation Solutions  Cardiac Rhythm Management: Our Cardiac Rhythm Management Integrated Operating Unit offers devices and therapies that treat patients with abnormal heart rhythms and heart failure. It is comprised o f four key businesses: Cardiac Pacing Therapies, Defibrillation Solutions, Patient Management, and Procedure Innovations. Together, we will transform the lives of people with cardiac arrhythmias and heart failure.  Cardiac Surgery: Cardiac surgery represents end stage treatment in the care continuum for many cardiovascular diseases and this OU provides an intimate relationship with the Cardiac Surgeon and Cardiac OR by offering an unparalleled depth and breadth of portfolio.  Cardiovascular Diagnostics & Services: The Cardiovascular Diagnostics & Services (CDS) Operating Unit (OU) is driving a new era of personalized medicine by empowering care providers and patients with actionable insights to conquer chronic disease. CDS is also delivering on Medtronic’s innovation promises with the 2020 U.S. and European launch of the first commercial wafer-scale implantable device and a pipeline of innovation including Artificial Intelligence to improve on our already market-leading diagnostic accuracy.  Coronary & Renal Denervation: Coronary & Renal Denervation therapies are a vital component of the Medtronic interventional cardiology portfolio. In addition to our core products that treat blocked coronary arteries, we are seeking to solve unmet needs in the rapidly growing field of complex percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI). We also are leading the way with the transformational renal denervation therapy, which has the potential to be a powerful tool in battling the global hypertension epidemic.  Mechanical Circulatory Support: The Mechanical Circulatory Support Operating Unit is responsible for Medtronic’s heart pump program. Called the HeartWare™ HVAD™ System, this business provides a left ventricular assist device (LVAD) that helps patients’ hearts pump and increases the amount of blood that circulates through their bodies. The HVAD System features the world's smallest, commercially available, centrifugal flow pump.  Peripheral & Endovenous: Peripheral and Endovenous therapies are a critical part of the Medtronic vascular portfolio, treating patients with a broad range of conditions, including Peripheral and Carotid Disease, End Stage Renal Disease, Peripheral Embolization, and Superficial and Deep Venous Disease. We lead the way in the Superficial Venous and Drug Coated Balloon markets, caring for hundreds of millions of patients globally with lifesaving and life-enhancing therapies.  Structural Heart and Aortic: The Structural Heart and Aortic integrated operating unit offers minimally-invasive approaches to restore proper structure and function of the heart and the aorta. We focus on the transcatheter replacement or repair of the four heart valves—aortic, pulmonic, mitral, tricuspid—and the placement of stent grafts to treat aneurysms and dissections of the body’s largest artery, the aorta.  Neuroscience Portfolio:  Cranial & Spinal Technologies: Cranial and Spinal Technologies (CST) is redefining cranial and spinal procedures to reduce variability and improve outcomes with the goal of restoring long-term quality of life for more patients. We are the first company to offer an integrated solution that includes artificial intelligence-driven surgical planning, personalized spinal implants, and robotic-assisted surgical delivery to make patient care more customized.  CST is the market leader in spinal implants, robotics, and navigation. Our integrated operating unit is comprised of the following global businesses: Spine and Biologics, offering full procedural solutions for spine surgery and bone grafting solutions for spinal fusion Enabling Technologies, delivering an innovative portfolio that includes advanced imaging, navigation, robotics, customized implants, and pre-operative planning aided by artificial intelligence Ear Nose Throat: The Ear, Nose, and Throat Operating Unit is a global leader and trusted partner for innovative ENT solutions that improve patient access, outcomes, and customer satisfaction. We partner with the ENT community to understand the needs of customers and patients, delivering solutions that improve lives as we embody a culture of accountability and trust.  Over the past 20 years, we have become the global market leader in three key segments – image-guided surgery, intraoperative nerve monitoring, and powered surgical instruments. We continue to launch valuable ENT solutions in these areas as well as tissue health and balloon sinus dilation.  Neuromodulation: Our vision is to become the undisputed world leader in Neuromodulation, improving patient lives through innovative solutions. Our therapies span the care continuum; from early interventional procedures to implantable surgical technologies that relieve pain, restore function and improve lives for our patients.  We're committed to applying clinical and economic evidence and integrated technologies to our unmatched portfolio of therapies to develop healthcare solutions that increase patient access, improve the efficiency of procedures and deliver successful patient outcomes.  Neurovascular: Medtronic Neurovascular develops and markets medical technology, services and solutions to treat patients afflicted with Acute Ischemic and Hemorrhagic Stroke worldwide.  Pelvic Health & Gastric Therapies: Pelvic Health & Gastric Therapies is part of the Neuroscience Portfolio. Our therapies treat patients suffering from incontinence-related conditions with our sacral neuromodulation (SNM) systems InterStim™ II and InterStim™ Micro; and our percutaneous tibial neuromodulation (PTNM) system NURO™.  We also treat patients suffering from gastroparesis with our gastric electrical stimulation system called Enterra™.  Medtronic and physician-partners pioneered SNM therapy more than 25 years ago. More than 400 million people worldwide have incontinence, and many of them limit their lives socially, professionally and personally because of their condition. Our goal is to expand access to our therapies so we can help potentially millions of people get their lives back.  Medical Surgical Portfolio:  Gastrointestinal: The Gastrointestinal Operating Unit has created a business out of disrupting the status quo in the detection, prevention, and treatment of gastrointestinal cancers and chronic diseases. We’ve done this by commercializing transformational technologies that improve patient management and standards of care, while increasing access to our innovations across the globe.  Patient Monitoring: Medtronic is working together with the global healthcare community to solve clinically meaningful problems, with technologies and solutions for blood oxygen management, respiratory compromise, and perioperative complications.  Renal Care Solutions  Respiratory Interventions: While the global crisis develops daily, our purpose remains the same: To prevent the onset and improve the management of respiratory failure. This guiding principle has enabled us to support patients and clinicians, while creating new opportunities for growth.  Surgical Innovations: In Surgical Innovations, we advance minimally invasive surgery to improve outcomes for patients and providers around the globe. From concept to commercialization, we bring meaningful innovation to our robust and growing portfolio of surgical devices and technologies. Through wise investments, thoughtful planning, and world-class partnerships, we help patients get the care they n eed – from diagnosis to treatment – when they need it.  Surgical Robotics: Surgical Robotics employees believe that every patient around the world deserves access to quality care and improved outcomes. Driven by our Mission, we believe that surgical robotics can add value to the healthcare ecosystem, lessen variability, and help more people around the world get better, faster.  We're making that exciting future possible — and disrupting one of the biggest and fastest-growing markets in healthcare — with a game-changing portfolio of robotic and data & analytics technologies, services, and solutions.  Additional Information Posting Date: Oct 7, 2021 Travel: No
industries: Medical Devices, Hospital & Health Care, and Pharmaceuticals

description: Ronnoco Beverage Solutions, the Midwest's leading supplier of specialty coffees & Teas and full service beverage programs, is seeking a Regional Sales Representative to grow our C Store coffee business within our distributor partnerships in the Eastern Pennsylvania area. This is an opportunity for a creative sales professional to identify potential customers, generate and develop new business, and maintain active business relationships with new and existing customers. The Sales Representative will present a mix of products, services, and solutions to meet customers' business needs; develop a complete understanding of Ronnoco's products and equipment in order to provide exceptional customer service; and consistently develop new business and meet sales goals. This is a remote position and will require overnight travel.  Responsibilities Foster existing customer relationships as well as acquire new business through cold calls, emails, and door-to-door visits Evaluate market trends, recommend products, and utilize sampling of product cuttings to meet customers' business goals Provide exceptional customer service - answer questions based on products, availability, pricing, and applications, and provide product information and practical training to customers' personnel Remain informed of market conditions, product innovations, and competitors' products and pricing Prepare and deliver customer contracts, proposals, and presentations, and follow up with key decision makers Exceed customer expectations by acting proactively, professionally, and in a positive manner, and by resolving all customer complaints and issues Contact accounts regularly to maintain relationships and ensure satisfaction Ronnoco's products and services Qualifications 3+ years' professional sales experience, including cold calling experience Professional appearance and attitude Proficient in MS Office, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and Outlook Ability to use database management systems or CRM to provide, organize, and track customer information Ability to provide exceptional customer service both internally and externally Excellent oral and written communication skills and interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively communicate cross-functionally with all teams Strong organizational, prioritizing, and multi-tasking skills with the ability to effectively work in a fast-paced environment Team player Ability to maintain confidentiality High school diploma required, college degree preferred Must be able to pass drug test and physical Ability to lift, push, and pull up to 50 pounds and the ability to stand for long periods of time Ronnoco specializes in coffee manufacturing and private label beverage programs. We remain a local, Midwest-owned and operated company that is small enough to pay attention to the details that go into making great coffee, but large enough to service more than 35 states throughout the US. From roasting premium blend coffees to delivering complete beverage solutions, at Ronnoco, our passion is serving those who serve our products. We offer a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package including 401(k) with company match as well as a car allowance.

jobTitle: Sales Development Representative, ACH and Online Banking
description: The world of payment processing has changed. Technology alone can no longer meet the needs of businesses who are looking for strategic partners to help them grow globally. We are Nuvei. The payment technology partner that merchants can count on to make their business a local marketplace. We deliver unified commerce solutions and expertise to help our partners capture every opportunity that comes their way. As the most valuable tech IPO ever on the Canadian TSX, we are continuing to expand and are seeking individuals that will bring their whole, authentic self to our team.  As a Sales Development Rep, you will be responsible for accelerating the distribution of Nuvei's products with specific focus on the Northern America market by uncovering new opportunities and working with a business development manager to mature those opportunities.  Key Responsibilities Follow a disciplined approach to forecasting and opportunity management via SFDC and our supporting tools and processes. Develop sales leads by using sales tools with outbound sales prospecting efforts.  Preferred Qualifications Special consideration given to candidates who have experience in Business Development/Sales/Account Management within global enterprises with a thorough understanding of the payments industry. Significant track record of achievement and success within the targeted field of expertise. Ability to build internal and external relationships to gain and share information such as industry trends.  Minimum Qualifications Minimum two years' of sales high growth experience. Pipeline management. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Exceptional relationship-building skills. Fluent in English.  Benefits Nuvei offers a wide variety of benefits which include Medical, Dental, Vision, STD, LTD, Paid Vacation, Paid Sick Time, 401(k) and many other great benefits.  Nuvei perks also include: Training, development and career advancement opportunities. Free Virtual yoga, meditation and fitness classes, community involvement, and many social activities. Employee recognition. Flexibility for Hybrid work A challenging job in a fast developing, international company with an open #peoplefirst culture. Friendly work environment where you can thrive and develop your skills. Career advancement possibilities. Competitive remuneration package.  Nuvei does not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, color, religion, age, national origin, marital status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity or any other reason prohibited by law in provision of employment opportunities and benefits.

jobTitle: Medical Device Sales Consultant - Richmond, VA
description: **About US** At Vyaire, we help the world breathe easier.  As a global leader in respiratory care, we know what we do enables, improves and extends lives.  We are a young company with a long history of revolutionary products.  We devise extraordinary solutions that allow patients to lead ordinary lives. We believe the best way to create value for our customers, is to become invaluable. We know a dynamic culture with diversity of thought makes this possible.  Our colleagues are people who specialize in exceeding expectations, building lasting relationships and making it a priority to listen.  Www.vyaire.com Watch Our Video  We are dedicated to anticipating what's next and get it done. We thrive on contributing and making a difference. To learn more, visit our website:  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZDrQoMbMRrI&feature=youtu.be **About this role** Vyaire teams are dedicated to connecting clinicians and patients with the highest quality respiratory healthcare solutions in the market.  At Vyaire, you will find a company that puts the customer at the center of all we do.  Our culture is one that rewards performance and each interaction we have with a customer furthers our mission to be the global leader in respiratory care. The Respiratory Consumables Sales Consultant primary responsibility of selling and implementing respiratory new product innovation and technology.  Main responsibility is to maximize sales revenue and implement product innovation to Vyaire customers. **Essential Functions:** + Sell total respiratory consumables products portfolio to existing and new customers. + Drive sales growth revenue by interfacing with clinician customers and identifying clinical needs and selling clinically product differentiated solutions for Vyaire Respiratory products. + Schedule product demonstrations, educational in-services, support clinical procedures, and value-add services with Doctors, nurses, and operating room staff in order to drive implementations. + Demonstrate effective use of all approved clinical data/studies and key placement guides. + Work with all hospital call points to provide support needed to utilize Vyaire Consumables products. + Conduct follow up on product used in cases as directed and authorized by the prescribing physician while following all hospital and Vyaire Consumables policies and procedures and respecting patient confidentiality. + Complete all sales training assignments by assigned due dates. + Provide vital and timely feedback to Vyaire Consumables internal stakeholders on customer, product, and quality information and works within the Quality and Regulatory critical timelines for response + Track allowed expenses, submit via Concur weekly, remain Sunshine Act compliant + Corporate compliance and expense management compliance. Exercise control and good judgment of operational expenses (gas, office supplies, telephone, shipping, lodging, meals, and entertainment) + Acquire and maintain current knowledge of competitor's position in marketplace + Maintain current, expert knowledge of regulatory environment and its governance of use of Avanos Medical Acute Pain products **Qualifications:** + College degree and 3 years or more business sales experience + Experience or strong familiarity of Respiratory Consumables product space + Proven track record selling clinical medical device products in the acute care market space + Ability to obtain all necessary hospital credentialing that may be required for access + Knowledge and/or experience selling within a medical device consumables market model **Desired Skills:** + Variable Incentive Compensation driven + Medical Device sales acumen, knowledge, and expertise - Respiratory Consumables knowledge preferred + Strong understanding how to sell within a medical device disposable market - ability to successfully maneuver within value analysis decision making processes + Strong collaborator with excellent communication and customer service skills. + Prominent level of integrity and professionalism + Strong collaboration and partnership competency and skills + Team player, strong interaction and partnership skills. Can demonstrate effective collaboration with co-workers + Coachable - ability to understand and participate within communicated policies and procedures. Is open to and participates in constructive criticism conversations. + Strong work ethic and able to adapt quickly to a change in routine Richmond, VA Full time **We aspire to a "higher calling"** , aligning ourselves with healthcare providers to improve the lives of those who are treated with our devices.** Across the Ventilation, Respiratory Diagnostics and Anesthesia Delivery & Patient Monitoring market segments, we represent the largest pure-play company of our kind, with an ambitious and innovative vision for growth. We hold each other mutually accountable for the quality and reliability of our products and work together toward setting a new market standard in these categories. **We are transforming the future of respiratory care; explore how you can be a part of it.** We are a unified "breathing company", with a global team that is unrivaled in the respiratory care continuum. Each of our 5,000 people worldwide is critical to achieving our shared purpose of improving the lives of those who are treated with our devices. Our people are empowered to "do the right thing" every day and always put patients first. Our market presence, breadth of product and technical expertise enable us to impact the lives of patients around the world every day. One of our unique strengths is the diversity of our community. We want to treat each teammate fairly and provide equal employment opportunities regardless of a person's race, color, religion, gender or gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, national origin, veteran or disability status, or any other characteristic. To learn about our terms of use, please review Terms & Conditions (http://www.vyaire.com/terms-of-use) . Also, provided here is a link to our Privacy Policy (http://www.vyaire.com/privacy-policy) One of our unique strengths is the diversity of our community. We want to treat each teammate fairly and provide equal employment opportunities regardless of a person's race, color, religion, gender or gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, national origin, veteran or disability status, or any other characteristic.

jobTitle: Strategic Inside Sales Representative - Uber for Business
description: About The Role  We're looking for an experienced and driven Strategic Inside Sales Representative to support our Uber for Business Strategic sales team. This high-impact position will provide sales support to Strategic Account Executives through the development of qualified leads that result in achieving our business goals. You will be calling upon our largest, and most strategic client accounts. This role will serve as a training ground for a pathway into an Account Executive position with demonstrated success.  You'll be responsible for conducting outbound prospecting campaigns (both call and email). Develop rapport with contacts in an effort to understand where the prospect is in the buying cycle. Work with Strategic Account Executives, to ensure that the leads provided accurately qualified and will progress through the sales funnel. This involves gathering key information to update our Salesforce system and identifying next steps for Strategic Account Executives to connect with these prospects and overall Account Global expansion.  What You'll Do Generate new business opportunities in an assigned vertical or territory and partner with assigned Strategic Account Executives Develop our largest Strategic accounts Outbound prospecting via targeted calling, email, and marketing campaigns Build and execute on strategic and measurable demand generation campaigns Uncover a prospect's business challenges and identify new business opportunities, while highlighting the Uber for Business value proposition Conduct high-level conversations with senior executives Manage, track, and report on all sales activities and results using Salesforce Work closely with sales management to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities for new business Collaborate with the sales team to share best practices and make recommendations to more effectively close sales and ensure customer loyalty Work effectively with internal departments to deliver the best solution for the client and ensure an excellent experience Travel to attend trade shows or other client meetings when requested or necessary Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree required Preferred Qualifications 3+ years of experience cold-calling and sales/business development experience Experience with prospecting and closing transactional deals Experience using a CRM (ex: Salesforce) to manage daily activities Experience with email campaigns and Salesforce preferred Ability to build extraordinary customer relationships Salesforce, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Zoom Info and Groove experience preferred Excellent communication skills Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently Have a positive, self-driven team-first mentality with a desire to learn

description: Job Purpose: TVSquared is seeking energetic, focused and proven Sales Director to play a fundamental role in the execution of an ambitious sales strategy in a fast-paced and fast-growing company. You will work closely with sales and account teams spread across the globe. As a TVSquared Sales Director, you need to be well organized, a strong communicator and have the confidence to regularly interact with C-level executives. You’ll be expected to meet or exceed your sales target by introducing TV advertisers and agencies to TVSquared’s game-changing measurement and optimization technology.   Our US main office is based in New York City, but a remote position will be considered for the right candidate. The position is permanent, with full-time hours starting as soon as possible.   Responsibilities: Articulate and present TVSquared’s value proposition to prospects, including C-level executives Delve into product use cases and highlight successful client case studies Manage complex sales cycles and cultivate a rapidly growing pipeline of business Close business, meet or outperform monthly quotas and generate new, top-of-funnel opportunities Negotiate contracts and research and develop pricing Continually innovate and improve the sales process Collaborate with marketing on programs that meet the ever-evolving needs of the media and advertising space Be a great team member   Required Skills & Experience: Minimum of five years of SaaS experience Experience in TV media with an understanding of how it is bought and sold Working knowledge of media attribution and analytics BA/BS degree from an accredited college or university Experience with CRM software (Salesforce preferred) Experience in high-growth and fast-paced company Working knowledge of the media space Proven ability to exceed performance targets Astute negotiation skills   In Return: 27 days’ holiday Medical, dental and vision coverage Employee Assistance Program Healthcare Savings Plan Life and personal accident insurance Educational Assistance Program 401(k) Retirement Savings Plan enrolment (paid by employee)    Deadline: Please submit your application as soon as possible as we are looking to schedule interviews over the coming weeks.   TVSquared is an Equal Opportunity Employer The personal data that you provide in responding to this job application will be used for the purposes of evaluating your data and considering you for the position applied for. In the event your application is unsuccessful, we will keep your data on file for a six-month period from receipt to consider you for any future roles we feel may be appropriate for you (unless you object to us doing so). You can see full details of how TV Squared processes personal data of individuals who interact with us on our website at https://tvsquared.com/privacy-policy/. TV Squared Limited (Company No SC421072), Head Office, is incorporated in Scotland. Its group companies are TV Squared Inc (File Number 5600204), incorporated in Delaware; and TV Squared GmbH (Registered Number HRB 236077), incorporated in Munich. Further details about TV Squared can be found on our website at https://tvsquared.com/.

description: A2 Medical Inc. is recruiting for a Spine Sales Territory Manager, in the New England area.  A2 Medical is an independent distributor partner of Zimmer Biomet Spine. Our staff provides sales and support to Zimmer Biomet’s spine portfolio.  Our experienced, highly trained sales representatives provide coverage and service in our New England territory. The A2 Medical “Team” is committed to responsive and efficient customer service that has resulted in strong physician relationships and an increasing presence in the New England Market. For more information about A2 medical go to https://www.a2med.com/  The Territory Manager has front-line responsibility for developing and fostering new surgeon and account-level relationships within a geographic territory.  The Territory Manager is primarily responsible for the conversion of prospect surgeons/accounts and penetration of existing customers through incremental sales and managing a book of business. The Sales Consultant will drive sales by understanding customers’ needs, then developing and executing a sales strategy that fulfills those needs.  Responsibilities Include:  Prospecting and Planning Achieve Business Plan objectives Product Sales Build and Maintain Customer Relationships Case Coverage Field Inventory Management  Minimal Requirements:  A Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university/college, OR:  [in lieu of Bachelor’s degree] Associate’s degree, or surgical tech / highly specialized, OR:  [in lieu of Bachelor's degree] Medical training/ certification (e.g. Medical Sales College) plus two (2) years of relevant experience in clinical, hospital, or surgical environments, OR:  [in lieu of Bachelor’s degree] At least four (4) years of orthopedic sales experience,  A minimum of three years of relevant sales or professional experience, preferably in medical device and/or in clinical/hospital/surgical environments.  The ability to work in a lab/operating room environment. A valid driver's license issued in the United States The ability to travel which may include weekend and/or overnight travel.  Preferred Qualifications:   Two (2)+ years of previous experience in one of the following: healthcare sales experience or hospital/operating room experience, or clinical experience in orthopedic sports medicine.  Track record of building a successful territory Selling experience in Trauma, Spine, Orthopedic Sports Medicine, Extremities, or Neurology strongly preferred.  What We Offer: A winning team driven to achieve our mission and deliver remarkable results Quality products that improve the lives of customers and patients Ability to discover your strengths, follow your passion and own your own career

jobTitle: Associate Sales Representative - Detroit, MI - Craniomaxillofacial
description: Who We Want To Work With  You’re a sales professional at heart. You love engaging with customers and colleagues – wherever that might take you. Being responsible for other’s perception of a company’s brand and reputation excites you, as does the challenge of initiating and creatively prospecting new customer relationships – especially in healthcare environments. You enjoy building relationships and understand that collaboration is key to growing any business, especially in a complex and competitive industry. You’re an influencer that is driven to succeed and accountability is important to you. You seek out the hard projects and work to find just the right solutions. You’re resilient and persistent and will stop at nothing to live out Stryker’s mission to make healthcare better.  At Stryker’s Craniomaxillofacial (CMF) Division You’ll work closely with experienced Sales Representatives and Managers to build your knowledge, skill and comfort with clinical and product knowledge as well as selling styles and techniques. They will serve as your coaches and mentors to share lessons learned for how to build and grow a successful business. You’ll receive training and be expected study and prepare independently to perform at the highest levels in the operating room, working amongst surgeons and healthcare professionals. The expectations are challenging, yet rewarding. You’ll represent Stryker as a leader in our industry and the marketplace. You’ll have the opportunity to identify and promote solutions and sell products that change our patient’s lives. You’ll collaborate with our team to build your own business one customer and account at a time. You’ll identify and prospect new customers as well as continually take care of existing customers. You’ll assist Sales Representatives in determining the necessary resources needed for our customers to achieve sales objectives and then execute the plan. These resources may include educational programs, product development initiatives, and sales strategies. You’ll foster a culture and environment that makes CMF destination for top performers and a place where people’s careers thrive. What You Need Highly organized and demonstrate ability to organize a busy schedule. Capacity to deal with competing priorities and potential to be adaptable as days change quickly. Demonstrated ability in building and maintaining relationships in the sales capacity. Must be comfortable in emergency and operating room environments. Prepared to spend up to 90% of time in the field with customers and sales professionals (including some weekends, and some overnight travel). Knowledge of principles and methods for showing, promoting, and selling products or services This would include marketing strategy and tactics, product demonstration, sales techniques and sales control systems Comfortability with adapting to new technology and business advancements. Bachelor’s degree required Would need personal car to transport product inventory and travel to support customers. Learns from set-backs and develops tactics and strategies to minimize recurrence. “Smart, hardworking, and gets along well with others.” John Brown Our Values  Integrity  We do what’s right  Accountability  We do what we say  People  We grow talent  Performance  We deliver  Core Themes And Phrases About Our Workplace Our Culture - Win together as a team We are a team. We constantly challenge ourselves. We challenge each other. We want to achieve more. We win the right way. We care about each other. Growth - Own your career Our company is growing. You can grow with us. We help you discover your strengths. You can discover and follow your passion here. We are a career destination. The Work - Customers and patients are at the heart of everything we do We strive for the best. We improve lives. We go above and beyond. We are proud of our quality products. We are accountable for our work. e Our People - Passionately driven, remarkable results We are passionate. We are driven. We are focused. We deliver remarkable results. We expect to win. We act with purpose. We act with integrity. We do what we say.  Who we are  Stryker is one of the world’s leading medical technology companies and together with our customers, we are driven to make healthcare better. The Company offers a diverse array of innovative medical technologies, including orthopaedics, medical and surgical, and neurotechnology & spine products to help people lead more active and more satisfying lives. Stryker products and services are available in over 100 countries around the world. For more information, please visit our website at www.stryker.com.  In October of 2020, Stryker Corporation (NYSE:SYK) announced that it has been named as one of the 2020 FORTUNE World’s Best Workplaces coming in at #5.  See full list of our awards here: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/about/awards/awards.html  CMF Products: https://www.stryker.com/us/en/portfolios/orthopaedics/craniomaxillofacial.html  #LIInstruments
