companyName: Wellmark Blue Cross and Blue Shield
description: Job Summary  In this role, you will be responsible for providing leadership, strategic direction and oversight for the sales function by developing and evangelizing effective and efficient sales processes and tools, design and administration of incentive compensation that motivates the sales staff and broker community, and sales and broker training curriculums that ensure high performing sales talent. You'll develop and maintain relationships with key agency, broker and consultant contacts to leverage their expertise and marketplace strength in achieving membership and financial growth and retention. Working collaboratively across the organization, you will utilize comprehensive competitive intelligence to monitor the market and will provide development of your leaders and their teams in becoming highly collaborative business partners and trusted advisors by leveraging data to provide insights, consultation, and customized benefit recommendations to meet our strategic goals.  Our ideal candidate is an accomplished industry expert with 10+ years of effective sales leadership experience including extensive knowledge of fully insured, self-funded and stop loss reinsurance and a deep understanding of the Iowa and South Dakota market and the associated players. Highly adept at developing and maintaining a high-performance sales team, including influencing educational programs and incentive structures that generate a highly motivated sales force to deliver exceptional performance. Proven aptitude in leveraging data, competitive intelligence and market insights to drive business decisions and strategy.  Required  Qualifications Bachelor's Degree or direct and applicable work experience Life & Health insurance license (or ability to successfully obtain the license within 60 days of hire) 10 + years effective sales leadership experience; including demonstrated formal leadership experience to include building and developing a high performing team consistently delivering value added results to the business Market and industry experience specific to Iowa and South Dakota, including demonstrated sales, new business development, account retention, or a related role with demonstrated success setting, measuring, and achieving sales goals, including retention; sales experience in the health industry is a plus Significant experience with fully insured, self funded, and stop loss reinsurance Demonstrated effective leadership, motivational and team building skills, including effective interpersonal, verbal and written communication, negotiation and conflict management skills Demonstrated customer relationship management skills including effective interpersonal, verbal and written Communication, presentation and negotiation skills Strong knowledge of legislative requirements Strong analytical, financial, technical, problem solving and decision making skills Proven time management and multiple task management capabilities Innovation and strategic thinking skills Ability to manage organizational change Demonstrated ability to comprehend and process complex concepts Strong PC & software skills (Word, Excel, Contract Management System, etc) Up to 30% travel required, including overnight stays Preferred Bachelor's Degree Strong preference for experience with high producing agencies and agents Intimate knowledge of Wellmark products and services capabilities (including alternative funding arrangements, complex benefit design, underwriting methodology, managed care, etc.) Job Accountabilities  Strategy - In partnership with the EVP Business Development & Client Solutions, develop and implement the strategic business plan for Sales that supports overall divisional objectives. Enterprise Leadership - Provide strategic direction and leadership for a team that supports Wellmark's divisional strategy and goals. Cascade and communicate strategy and initiatives to team members, driving customer/stakeholder service, supporting achievement of divisional and overall company results. Ensure stated membership goals are met, balance membership and financial goals to achieve profitable growth and retention. Involvement in enterprise initiatives including Enterprise Change Committee, Every Voice Counts, etc. Team Leadership - Provide leadership and day-to-day management of financial and human resources, primarily focusing on employee and leader coaching and mentoring, development, performance management and improvement, coordination and budgeting for staff and department(s) specific functions/services. Ensure succession plan is in place for key positions. Sales and Retention Strategies - Accountable to oversee and implement on a comprehensive sales strategy that is consistent with the company mission, vision, and values. Build and foster effective business relationships with agencies, brokers and consulting firms to ensure we are effectively leveraging their knowledge and strengths in the marketplace in conjunction with the overall corporate sales strategy to achieve membership and financial growth for Wellmark book of business. Collaborate with VP's (i.e. Product & Client Solutions, Underwriting, Actuarial, Health Services, Network, etc.) across the organization to effectively utilize comprehensive competitive intelligence and market insights to monitor the competition, make informed decisions in the best interest of Wellmark and our members/groups, and report relevant actions and trends to senior management. Team Development and Expertise - Provide oversight and direction to a group of sales leaders and team members to become highly collaborative business partners and trusted advisors by leveraging data to provide insights, consultation, and customized benefit recommendations to meet our strategic goals. Develop retention strategy and objectives for broker and direct business. Communicate, implement, and execute strategic plans, measurement and monitoring to ensure that objectives and key deliverables are successfully met. Specialty Benefits Sales - Oversee the creation and implementation of an annual business plan for specialty benefits products which fully incorporates customer-specific considerations and aligns with corporate and product strategies and initiatives. Ensure alignment and communication between staff accountable for sales of group health and specialty benefit products. Communication Collaboration - Partner with other Wellmark areas such as product, segment planning, analytics, Indigo, marketing, and sales training to gather relevant data to produce content created for a variety of audiences including customers and agents to ensure integration and alignment for all functions related to distribution channel; business-to-business marketing communications; member acquisition, education and retention. Direct, develop and support continuous process improvements, delegating to and coordinating with internal staff as appropriate. Ensure the development of management control processes for customers and implementation plans to ensure customer needs and contractual obligations are met, and process improvement initiatives are executed when needed. Ensure processes, policies and procedures meet compliance requirements. Other duties as assigned.

The Diagnostic Sales Specialist (DSS) is responsible for effectively communicating and selling the benefits of the APTIMA product line, the ThinPrep Pap Test and adjunctive testing, and the ThinPrep Imaging System, to clinicians in an assigned geographic territory. Additionally, the DSS provides educational support to OB/GYNs and other clinical professionals in the office and hospital setting as well as strategic business planning and development for primary and secondary product lines.  Duties & Responsibilities: - Meet and exceed sales goals and achieve maximum sales in assigned territory - Accurately forecast and maintain an individual territory book of business in accordance with a 90-day quota for assigned and acquired products as required - Achieve individual sales revenue quota on a quarterly and annual basis for assigned and acquired products as required - Develop and execute business plans for targeted accounts. Complete a territory business analysis for management review on a quarterly basis - Maintain ongoing business planning with customers in territory; this includes periodic business reviews with customer's financial departments, as well as sales planning with customer's sales department - Effectively route plan and manage business for assigned territory - Attend quarterly Plan of Action Meetings within district - Periodically provide Rapid fFN Fetal Fibronectin in-services and training to laboratory personnel and Labor and Delivery Staff, per the territory needs of the local Strategic Account Manager (SAM) Perinatal - Support territory sales goals by maintaining core ThinPrep Pap Test business (Account Executive's Primary Line of Business), increasing usage, and prospecting new customers - Effectively sell Hologic's sales message to all customers in the targeted territory - Effectively insulate accounts against competition and regaining lost customer accounts - Maintain consistent and structured communication with Account Executive counterpart and articulate summarized communication to District Sales Manager on a periodic basis - Integrate successfully into team selling environment by partnering sales efforts with Territory Manager and Account Executive, and other Hologic colleagues and laboratory partners - Assist in generating leads for other Hologic products - Manage time effectively; prioritize and make good business judgments and decisions in relationship to efficiency, effectiveness while meeting daily call expectations - Partner with marketing department to support the development and execution of marketing programs and sales materials - Attend local and national professional trade shows and events and promote products to all customers - Update and sync all relevant customer account information into Hologic's Data Management System daily - Perform other duties as required Qualifications: To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the basic knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required: - Demonstrated track record of success and sales accomplishments - Ability to sell in a consultative manner such that the customer need is discovered and addressed in an individualized clinical and data-driven manner - Strong persuasiveness and influence skills required - Ability to understand and articulate complex scientific literature and use extensive and complex clinical data as a key factor in the sales process. - Familiarity with clinical and economic outcome data, reimbursement, and managed care policies and procedures Education: - Bachelor of Arts/Science from an accredited university required  Experience: - Candidate must have a minimum of two years sales experience - Medical background/sales experience, laboratory experience, and/or managed care knowledge desirable - Business-to-business experience highly desired Additional Details: - Since this position requires extensive driving during the workday, a valid driving license and satisfactory driving record, as well as a serviceable vehicle available for work use is mandatory Agency and Third Party Recruiter Notice: Agencies that submit a resume to Hologic must have a current executed Hologic Agency Agreement executed by a member of the Human Resource Department. In addition Agencies may only submit candidates to positions for which they have been invited to do so by a Hologic Recruiter. All resumes must be sent to the Hologic Recruiter under these terms or they will not be considered.  Hologic, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer inclusive of disability and veterans.

Removing the barriers to online commerce helps more new businesses get started, expedites growth for existing companies, and increases economic output and trade globally. You Will Collaborate with our Head of GTM Partnerships and GTM Partner Sales Ops to scale the business, while driving alignment with your Sales Ops peers and the rest of the Sales leadership organization to make sure the plans are aligned with regional and functional priorities Conduct and enable regular business reviews and resource planning Develop and execute initiatives designed to optimize sales team efficiency and productivity Create and manage operational processes such as target setting, forecasting, and budgeting Champion the operational and reporting needs of the organization by defining and prioritizing requirements while working closely with cross functional partners to identify solutions Monitor and report key performance indicators (KPIs), trends, and deliver prescriptive recommendations to drive efficiencies and scale across the org Proactively resolve data quality, process, and policy adherence issues Oversee implementation of enabling systems and tools, working closely with internal systems teams We’re Looking For Someone Who Has 8+ years of sales operations experience in a similar industry Familiarity with SFDC Understanding of the sales cycle and previous exposure to a GTM Partner or Alliances & Channels Sales orgs A passion for understanding systems of work, how to build them and how to improve them through both transformative and iterative approaches Strong problem solving and analytical ability, with a track record of “test & learn” demeanor Ability to multi-task and work in cross-functional, fast-paced environments with the pressure of multiple deadlines, multiple partners / vendors, and complexity Experience and desire for working in a start-up environment, developing business infrastructure, and energetically scaling a working cross-functionally with sales teams and KPIs _SB6

jobTitle: Sales and Marketing Support Executive - Denver, CO
description: Description  Are you passionate about contributing to the well-being of the Medicare population? Are you looking for a role that will let your creative ideas and marketing ability shine? If so, the Sales and Marketing Support Executive works closely with the Market Director, Management team, and Sales Representatives to find sales, marketing, and educational opportunities to help grow the market and increase sales while adhering to CMS guidelines. This position is also responsible for maintaining the local marketing budget and overseeing seminars, special events, educational and orientation programs, and accurately reporting this information. Humana has an inclusive and diverse culture welcoming candidates with multilingual skill sets to service our consumers.  Responsibilities  The Sales and Marketing Support Executive is responsible for coordinating Community Outreach and networking opportunities; partnering with agents and managers to develop and implement marketing plans; managing projects and rolling out corporate programs at the market level; leading seminars and special events; managing expenses and submitting invoices. This position is also responsible for identifying grass roots marketing, educational and sales opportunities.  Humana Perks  Full time associates enjoy Base salary?with commission Medical, Dental, Vision and a variety of?other?supplemental insurances Paid time off?(PTO)?& Paid Holidays 401(k) retirement savings plan?with a competitive match Tuition?reimbursement and/or scholarships for qualifying dependent children And much more! Required Qualifications Bachelor's or Associates degree or 2-3 years of equivalent work experience in a related position Active Health and Life Insurance licenses in CO or ability to obtain within the first 90 days of employment Excellent verbal & written communication skills. Must be self-motivated with a positive attitude. Strong organizational, interpersonal, and presentation skills Great with laptop computers, cell phones and the ability to navigate mobile apps. This also includes knowledge of Microsoft Word, Outlook, Power Point and Excel. Must be passionate about contributing to an organization focused on continuously improving consumer experiences This role is part of Humana's Driver safety program and requires an individual to have a valid state driver's license and proof of personal vehicle liability insurance with at least 100/300/100 limits Ability to travel throughout the territory with some overnight stays Must reside within a daily commutable distance of the assigned market office Preferred Qualifications Prior experience in the health solutions or financial industries Knowledge of Microsoft Publisher Engaged with?the?community?through?service, organizations, activities and volunteerism Bilingual with the ability to speak, read and write in?both?English and an additional language without?limitations?or assistance Prior experience in Sales or Marketing Additional Information After offer acceptance you must be able to complete and pass the AHIP certification (paid for by Humana) prior to your start date Any Humana associate who speaks with a member in a language other than English must take a language proficiency assessment, provided by an outside vendor, to ensure competency. Applicants will be required to take the Interagency Language Rating (ILR) test as provided by the Federal Government. Scheduled Weekly Hours  40  Colorado Pay Range  The compensation range represents a good-faith estimate of annualized starting pay at the time of posting based on a full-time 40-hour workweek and may vary based on geographic location and/or employment type. Individual pay decisions will vary based on demonstrated job-related skills such as education, experience, certifications, etc.  50,100-69,075  Pay Type  Salary  Incentive  This job is eligible for a commission incentive plan. This incentive opportunity is based upon company and/or individual performance.  Description Of Benefits  Humana, Inc. and its affiliated subsidiaries (collectively, "Humana") offers competitive benefits that support whole-person well-being. Associate benefits are designed to encourage personal wellness and smart healthcare decisions for you and your family while also knowing your life extends outside of work. Among our benefits, Humana provides medical, dental and vision benefits, 401(k) retirement savings plan, time off (including paid time off, company and personal holidays, volunteer time off, paid parental and caregiver leave), short-term and long-term disability, life insurance and many other opportunities.

Position Summary: Sales Representative – New Jersey  When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, and you’ll be valued and recognized for your performance. With talented managers and inspiring coworkers to support you, you’ll find the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world.  How will you make an impact?  Our Sales Representatives are responsible for the sales of research products and services within a defined territory. They maintain effective customer relations, develop opportunities for growth within an existing customer base, and assure market penetration and profitability while achieving sales and profit forecasts. This is an excellent opportunity for an energetic professional who is looking to gain experience in Sales with a company that is a world leader in their industry.  Remotely based in Central New Jersey.  What will you do? Develop and maintain effective customer relations with purchasing and end user within assigned territory. Independently make decisions, but also utilize available resources to meet customer needs and work effectively with cross-functional team of supplier and internal resources; Seeks out broader relationships within the account to help facilitate networking and prospecting. Perform sales calls and vendor relations with all customers and potential customers in the assigned territory. Researches competitor and industry activity and keep informed of new products/services and other general information of interest to customers incorporating this data into the business plan; Introduce new products and services. Manage pricing within territory to control profitability. Maintain accurate reporting, records, and files necessary for proper management of territory. Communicate with supervisor any customer issues or potential problems, perform other tasks assigned by manager. Inform customers of supply and price trends and assist in inventory control, consults with customers. Positively represent Thermo Fisher Scientific at all times throughout customer locations. How will you get here? Bachelor’s degree required (BA/BS), in life sciences preferred. 2+ years of sales experience, preferably in the research laboratory industry OR lab experience. Position requires proof of Covid-19 vaccination. Strong interpersonal, oral and written communication, and presentation skills. Computer proficiency in MS Office and the internet. Must possess the organizational skills to multi-task and meet deadlines as needed. Strong industry, pharmaceutical and science background preferred. Able and willing to travel to customer locations. At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 80,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

Job Description As a consultative outside-sales professional, the Relationship Manager/Senior Product Manager is responsible for driving revenue growth and bringing in net new business from prospects. This role set appointments with business owners to educate them about Heartland’s payment processing solution(s). RMs and SPAs do this by prospecting over the phone, face-to-face, through their networks, and building referral partnerships. These positions are compensated with one time commission, residuals and ownership. The compensation is highly leveraged with the opportunity for creating passive income while working flexible hours.  Essential Duties Prospect and close new merchant accounts consistently month after month. Provide after-sales service for the duration of a merchant relationship with HPS unless alternative arrangements have been made with reporting manager Market additional HPS products and services when introduced under company guidelines Travel to and from client sites within a designated, geographical territory Initiate contact with each customer a minimum of four times per year Respond to all sales leads within the required response time and work to solidify and close the sale. Report the results on a regular basis as defined Overcome customer objections, issues or concerns as necessary to solidify the merchant relationship. Candidate should have the ability to obtain a higher value from merchants based on the value-added benefits offered by the product/service Assess customers’ needs and identify the product/service that best meets the needs Forecast merchants’ transaction volumes within acceptable levels of accuracy Gain a full understanding of all hardware, software, and reporting offered by Heartland, and effectively communicate this information to prospects, clients and internal parties Continually learn all aspects of all of the products and services offered by Heartland Work with reporting manager to assist in developing bank, association, value-added reseller, accounting and vertical market channels targeted by Heartland Provide all required documentation to manager  Other Duties Administrative duties as needed  Required Qualifications High School Diploma or equivalent Minimum of 2 years business to business outside-sales experience Territory management experience Proven track record of success in outside sales A RM/SPA is expected to be at full production (as defined by HPS) within his/her first four months  Compensation - Benefits W2 Up front Sign-on bonuses+ Residuals + portfolio equity 401K with company match Benefits: Medical, Dental, Life, & Disability Apply to learn more

ADP is hiring a Sales Operations Analyst: In this position you will be supporting the Sales Analytics function within Worldwide Commercial Operations. The Sales Analytics Group helps ADP to think differently by producing beautifully designed and easy to use insights aligned to the strategic needs of our business. We believe good design challenges us to think differently and enables us to make better decisions. Activities will range include designing and developing automated Tableau dashboards, and participating in the rollout and ongoing education of the resources we provide. You will partner with Sales Leadership, Sales Finance, and Sales Planning, and other functional areas within ADP to improve our sales analytics suite.   Responsibilities: Partner with sales leadership, finance, and operations teams to strengthen the organization's analytics suite. Participate in the Sales Analytics product lifecycle to develop KPIs, such as sales activity, opportunity creation and progression, pipeline health, and sales performance. Design, Develop, and Deploy SQL based Tableau dashboards to enable sales performance management and improve understanding of sales results. Understand and implement data visualization best practices. Work closely with key business stakeholders to gather feedback, evaluate success, and identify opportunities for ongoing improvement.    Skills Required: 2+ years of relational database (SQL) experience Strong quantitative and analytical skills with visualization experience (i.e. Tableau, QlikView, Power BI) Strong Microsoft Office skills -- PowerPoint, Excel Excellent communication and facilitation skills, with the ability to build relationships with cross-functional stakeholders Qualifications Required: Must reside in/near Florham Park, NJ or Chicago, IL BA/BS degree 1-2 years' experience in sales/business analytics or similar function in a corporate environment Experience presenting and communicating data concepts and analyses Exhibits sound business judgment and a proven ability to influence others Able to operate successfully in a lean, fast-paced organization; a proactive, and action-oriented team player  **For the safety of all associates, and consistent with ADP’s strong commitment to providing its associates a safe environment where collaboration and learning can take place, vaccination is a condition of employment for new hires. Absent a qualifying medical condition or religious belief, new hires must be fully vaccinated and provide evidence of vaccination within 45 days of starting their career with ADP.

We're looking for someone to join our small team to grow our existing wholesale accounts in New England.  Who are we looking for?  Someone who pays attention to the details and is self-driven. Need to be able to take initiative & ownership of your work. Must feel comfortable working with people face-to-face and building relationships. This role requires weekly travel (by car) - not for someone that wants to sit at a desk from 9-5. Must live in the Greater Boston Area. This is a work flexible role. You can work from home, from our office and/or in the field.  Our Mission We strive to help our customers source the world's finest area rugs and carpets, enabling them to create beautiful living spaces. With over 40 years of experience and relationships with our manufacturers and importers, we bring New England's highest level of customer satisfaction in the luxury floor covering industry.  Core Values Customer Obsessed We’re committed to helping our customers succeed Straight Shooters Honesty and trust are everything to us Take pride in your work When we say we’re going to do something, we get it done Simplify the Process Life can be complicated – working with us should not  Responsibilities Build and nurture relationships with customers in your assigned territory Make routine in-person visits to our wholesale customers (retail stores and trade showrooms) Identify opportunities to increase sales across our brands and product categories Maintain display units and sampling - to keep our products fully updated on displays Oversee new product launches and training with salespeople  Qualifications 5+ years of professional client-facing experience, preferably in Sales Having experience working in the wholesale industry is a plus An understanding and interest in interior design (preferred) Comfortable being a problem solver Self-driven and an independent worker Ability to travel via Car and Overnight Bachelor's Degree Preferred or Equivalent Experience

description: All roles at JumpCloud are Remote in the U.S. unless otherwise specified in the Job Description.  About JumpCloud  Do you enjoy solving challenging problems using the latest technologies within a great team? Is knowing your work will be highly visible and mission critical a key component for the next step in your career? At JumpCloud, we're looking for best-in-class talent to help define the future of modern identity and device management from the ground up.  JumpCloud's mission is to Make Work HappenÂ®, providing simple, secure access to corporate technology resources from any device, or any location. The JumpCloud Directory Platform gives IT, security operations, and DevOps a single, cloud-based solution to control and manage employee identities, their devices, and apply conditional access controls based on Zero Trust principals. JumpCloud has a global user base of more than 100,000 organizations, with over 3,000 customers including Cars.com, Grab, ClassPass, Uplight, Beyond Finance and Foursquare. JumpCloud is backed by BlackRock, General Atlantic, OpenView, and Foundry Group.  What You'll Be Doing  The SDR role will manage the early stages of the sales process through prospect qualification, helping prospects align to the appropriate resources, reporting, and scheduling for JumpCloud's Sales organization. This role will be handling our prospects on the East Coast and potentially supporting Europe as well.  This will be accomplished by engaging with prospects over the phone and with written communication using email, chat, and calendar tools. You will qualify the prospect's needs and professionally articulate JumpCloud's value proposition. Sources include marketing programs, seminars/events, website downloads and inbound contacts from the web, phone and email as well as navigating through large complex accounts, identifying and engaging with the right technology decision makers.  What We're Looking For 2 years in a sales related role, this could be retail, phones, we're open. Prior SaaS product experience would be helpful in getting up to speed but not necessary. Flexible, reliable, results-oriented and self-motivated to advance your sales career. Extremely detail-oriented with strong time management and prioritization skills. High aptitude for learning new technologies. Exceptional verbal communication and objection handling skills. In accordance with the Colorado Equal Pay for Equal Work Act, the approximate compensation for this role is $63,000 including base salary and any related bonuses or commissions. JumpCloud provides comprehensive benefits including medical, dental and vision insurance, short and long term disability, life insurance and 401k benefits. We have an unlimited vacation policy and also provide commuter benefits for employees in the Denver/Boulder, CO area.  Where you'll be working  All our roles are remote in the U.S. unless otherwise specified. Our Headquarters is in the Denver/Boulder, CO area. Once we reopen our offices you will have the opportunity to remain fully remote (in the U.S.), work from one of our office locations (CO only currently) or flex your time.  Why JumpCloud?  If you thrive working in a fast, SaaS-based environment and you are passionate about solving challenging technical problems, we look forward to hearing from you! JumpCloud is an incredible place to share and grow your expertise! You'll work with amazing talent across each department who are passionate about our mission. We're out of the box thinkers, so your unique ideas and approaches for conceiving a product and/or feature will be welcome. You'll have a voice in the organization as you work with a seasoned executive team, a supportive board and in a proven market that our customers are excited about.  Please submit your rÃ©sumÃ© and brief explanation about yourself and why you would be a good fit for JumpCloud. Please note JumpCloud is not accepting third party resumes at this time.  We're an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

JOB TITLE:             Director, Sales DEPARTMENT:       Senior Management SUPERVISOR:          Chief Commercial Officer (CCO)  GENERAL JOB DESCRIPTION: The Director, Sales requires excellent communication skills, drive, and the ability to collaborate with, marketing, operations, and other support teams to ensure customer value and satisfaction. Success will be measured on developing new customers and ensuring long term relationships at current key accounts. Will be tasked with delivering increased revenue and market share. This is a hands on, individual contributor position.   This position oversees business development, and sales and reports directly to the CCO.  Position is based in Miami, FL.  DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Build and maintain good and lasting relationships with customers in South Florida, greater Florida and possibly states in the southeast region of the country. Develop solid relationships with customers by providing them with customer service second to none. Execute sales strategy and goals to increase revenue base. Understand customer needs and requirements, discusses current EzFill solutions and service offerings, to effectively utilize these offerings to fully serve our customers and improve our position within our customer base. Prepare sales proposal by quoting pricing, credit terms and service offerings to customer based on knowledge of company’s operational capacity and established ROI thresholds Drive revenue growth that meets or exceeds revenue and profitability plans Identify and implement continuous process improvement initiatives, share ideas to enhance the performance of the position, team, and company  JOB REQUIREMENTS: BS degree in business, marketing, or related discipline; MBA strongly preferred. 10+ years of experience in sales within a relevant fast-paced environment. ·        Experience and/or knowledge with mobile fueling services preferable, but not mandatory. ·        Must have experience selling into fleets. Ability to think, plan and sell strategically. Possess a consultative, customer-focused selling philosophy. Expert communication skills; ability to deliver EzFill’s message to senior executives as well as all levels of management. Strong commitment to serving our customers. Strong presentation, organization, and time management skills. Ability to travel 50% of the time. Bilingual English/Spanish strongly preferred.

Hybrid is expanding their marketing team to reach more people to help them in a time of need by providing Online Health Events, LIVE fitness events, Non-profit Events and building healthy communities.  **(This is an Internship for now but we are growing rapidly and pending capabilities and marketing skills this will be a remote work paid opportunity)**  We are specifically needing someone to: Promote our events on Linked In. Help design event flyers Help direct any question needed by people about our programs to our coaches. Connecting to PR firms and Podcast to schedule interviews about the company and our mission. Who We Are:  Aviatrix is a well-funded, pre-IPO, hyper-growth enterprise-software company based in the heart of Silicon Valley (Santa Clara, CA). Aviatrix technology has proven solid at scale with nearly 600 enterprise customers, over 40 of the Global Fortune 500. We have a top-tier, experienced leadership team, combined with a collaborative culture built on proven success, trust, execution, and respect. We’re focused on getting things done!  Read recent article published in Bloomberg on Aviatrix’s incredible rise in value  What We Do:  Aviatrix is networking for the cloud era , delivering a superset of features and capabilities that leverage and control native cloud constructs and add advance network, security and operational visibility features that cloud providers lack, while maintaining the simplicity and automation enterprises expect in cloud. Aviatrix offers the industry’s first and only multi-cloud networking certification ( ACE ), empowering IT to lead and accelerate the transformation to the cloud.  About the role:  We are looking for a highly motivated Regional Sales Manager to join our rapidly growing Go-to-Market (GTM) sales team. The Regional Sales Manager will be responsible for driving sales of Aviatrix products and solutions within a specific geographic territory. The RSM must be quota-driven and will represent Aviatrix and its product suite within the region. S/HE will work with Inside Sales, Systems Engineers, Solution Architects, and Aviatrix Partners to exceed sales objectives. This position will manage all aspects of the sales process including securing net-new business, lead management, qualification, evaluation, close and subsequent account care. The RMS will act as the lead of their territory.  Position Responsibilities:  Define and execute sales plans for the assigned territory  Meet and exceed quotas through prospecting, qualifying, managing, and closing opportunities  Develop and manage sales pipeline, prospect, and assess sales and move a large number of transactions through the sales pipeline  Manage and track customer and transactional information in the Aviatrix CRM system  Provide activity forecasts and regular pipeline reporting through the CRM system  Own and collaborate on all aspects of the sales cycle, including product support and sales engineering  Execute product demonstrations to prospective clients  Develop accounts of various sizes and grow client relationships  Understand the competitive market, be familiar with competing companies and their product suite  Collaborate within the Aviatrix team on strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts, and customer care  Meet with customers daily, both remote and in-person once climate allows  Requirements  8+ years of enterprise software sales experience with a track record of closing complex sales to Fortune 500 companies or 8+ years managing and growing a large geographical territory with YoY growth/success in net-new logo’s  Cloud experience  A Closer – consistent overachievement of sales goals in a large geographic territory  Drive to expand client base and close sales  Excellent communication skills verbal and written, team player  Entrepreneurial – willing to go the extra mile, competitive mindset, great work ethic, resourceful, “get it done” attitude  Must be willing to travel to clients to support sales relationships  Bachelor’s Degree  Aviatrix, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and does not make hiring decisions based on race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Using a combination of traditional sales methodologies and cutting-edge technology tools, the Inside Sales Representative works with various team members to meet revenue goals. By proactively managing the customer-facing sales experience, you will contribute directly to the success of the Sales team.  Responsibilities Manage customer-facing communication channels Manage person engagement and re-engagement strategies Send outbound emails with information on BrainStation's courses, workshops and events Handle inbound and outbound phone conversations Handle front facing communications with excellent customer service skills Execute and identify strategic sales opportunities through community initiatives Liaise and leverage partnerships with key players in the digital space Identify areas of improvement and communicate them in our daily standups  Successful candidates will have Bachelor's degree Proven ability to work independently and under pressure Customer Service experience Ability to engage in conversations with small and large groups with ease Proven work ethic with the utmost integrity and desire to excel and succeed Outgoing, energetic, upbeat and fun personality Motivation driven by KPI's Previous sales experience - an asset Previous experience in student recruitment - an asset  Perks And Benefits Comprehensive Health & Wellness Benefits Package Retirement Planning Parental Leave Program New Device Allowance Socials, Outings & Retreats Culture of Learning & Development Flexible Working Hours Work from Home Flexibility  About BrainStation  Established in 2012, BrainStation is the global leader in digital skills training and workforce transformation. Bonus: Have you been to a campus or joined an online learning opportunity? We are actively seeking individuals that believe in lifelong learning and that have taken part in our On Campus or Online offerings.  NOTE: Only those applicants under consideration will be contacted. Please accept our utmost appreciation for your interest.  BrainStation is committed to maintaining a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants, regardless of race, colour, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status will receive consideration for employment. description: About Booster At Booster we’re on a mission to accelerate the transition to clean, environmentally friendly, cost effective energy by creating the first fuel agnostic energy supply chain. We believe the adoption of alternative energies is slow because of access and we’ve begun to change that with our disruptive new supply platform. By delivering the right fuel to the right vehicle at the right time we create efficiency across the entire energy process. We’ve successfully applied this model to fossil fuels reducing carbon emissions by 1.1 lbs of CO₂ emissions with each delivery. Bio and alternative fuels are next. We’re the catalyst to better energy for you, your community and our planet.  About the Role We are looking for a dynamic leader to support our growing sales organization. This role will oversee revenue operations for Booster including supporting sales strategy, sales data management, cross-functional collaboration, sales analytics, performance management and compensation planning, and technology / tools management.  The ideal candidate should have experience as an individual contributor and/or leading a small sales operations team in a mid or late stage B2B startup with experience building out the function, including processes, procedures, analytics and best practices.  What You Will Be Doing  Support the Sales and Account Management teams in providing daily, weekly and monthly performance reporting and analysis to decision-makers within the business unit Standardize sales dashboards and reporting for the Sales and AM teams in coordination with sales management Track and analyze key metrics including prospect accounts, leads, conversion rates, rep activity, quota attainment, etc. and provide actionable insights to Sales / AM leadership  Support pipeline management and forecasting for Sales and Account Management Partner with Operations to establish appropriate workflows and processes as part of S&OP process Partner with team-members overseeing Salesforce.com (including any implementation, expansion, and ongoing adoption) to ensure that it is effectively optimized within our sales and account management operating system and utilized as intended through the organization. Partner with Sales Enablement and Marketing to ensure all identified opportunities for support and enablement are identified and utilized to their full potential. Ensure efficient allocation of technology, support and training resources impacting the sales organization. Leverage available tools and technology to support the efficacy of the entire commercial organization. Recommend tools where gaps exist. Partner with Sales leadership, HR and finance to establish, track and manage sales team compensation plans  What You Should Have 5+ years of experience in sales operations in a relevant, fast-paced environment  BA/BS degree focused on Business, Mathematics, Economics or Statistics a plus Familiarity with spreadsheet tools such as Excel or Google Sheets Experience with data analysis tools like Looker a plus High integrity, ethics, and team-building abilities Polished communication skills; ability to communicate clearly and effectively with senior stakeholders Proven track record of measurable success with CRM (Salesforce preferred), including the ability to roll up your sleeves and perform and manage admin/configuration work Team player that understands success rests on helping others to be successful Strong individual contributor, continuously seeking to learn and develop Proven track record of effectively interfacing with cross-functional departments and sales management team Have a sense of humor  About Our Benefits Keep Everyone Healthy. We know that you work to take care of your loved ones. That’s why we offer benefits that cover you and your family including 100% employer paid medical, dental, vision, disability and life insurance coverage for you!  Recharge Your Batteries. We have unlimited responsible PTO. Take the quality time you need, when you need it. Take care of personal stuff. Stop and smell the roses. This is a marathon, not a sprint. Invest in You. Utilize our highly-rated savings matches to help meet your long-term financial goals. Be Part of Something.  Not only will you get to build something that could redefine consumer behavior, you’ll be an owner. Get Early Stock Options at a fast-growing startup with strong VC backing. job description  We are pleased to announce that we are looking for a few internship slots from a variety of disciplines to begin training immediately in our Marketing, customer service and sales associates positions here in San Antonio, Texas. Help to Prospect, appoint and onboard new agency partners. Provide guidance and intelligence to leadership on market opportunities and conditions.   ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIEs  Achieve Territory Sales objectives as assigned Solicit and Drive territory submission flow to achieve production goals Prospect, Appoint and Onboard New Agency Partners Develop Sales Pipeline of Opportunities Collaboratively work with Assigned Underwriters to develop and execute territory business plans, agency initiatives, both production and profit, account acquisition and renewal retention   Communicate Company risk appetite and underwriting guidelines, value proposition, operating systems and compensation programs to assigned agencies  Monitor and evaluate competition to assist in developing and improving products and services Manage and review territory production and profitability through agency business plans and initiatives, report analytics and metrics and collaboration with Company team members        Support and train agency sales force on Company Products and Services  Assist with the preparation and attend, as the Company Representative, trade-shows, conventions and conferences  Other duties as assigned   ESSENTIAL JOB REQUIREMENTS, EDUCATION and WORK EXPERIENCE    Bachelors Degree in related field or equivalent experience This is for our FL Territory - Lives in Orlando, Tampa, Jacksonville FL area or Atlanta GA  Area  Five years sales and marketing experience, preferably in the insurance field  Excellent sales skills  Good verbal and written communication skills; ability to communicate with people at all levels, inside and outside of the company  Good organizational skills; proficient decision making skills Ability to travel as required (25-50%) Computer literate; good MS Office skills   NORMAL WORK ENVIRONMENT & PHYSICAL EXPECTATIONS   The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. General office environment  General sedentary work  May lift up to 20 pounds     NOTE:  The information listed above is not intended to be construed as an employment contract, nor is it intended to state or imply an exhaustive list of duties to be performed by this employee or by this job title. We at Yara are part of a global network, collaborating to profitably and responsibly solve some of the world's key challenges - resource scarcity, food insecurity and environmental change.  About The Unit  The Regional Sales Manager’s primary responsibility is to execute sales and grow the business by ensuring market access, customer focus and demand creation within the assigned territory; leading a team of Agronomists and Product Specialists. The Regional Sales Manager will also be responsible for relaying market intelligence information including competition, trends, and other information needed for the development and implementation of go-to market strategies. Reporting to the VP West Coast Sales & Marketing, the Regional Sales Manager will work collaboratively with Product Management, Crop Managers, Marketing, Product Development and Digital Farming to create compelling value propositions for distributors and farmers.  The position holder will ideally be located within the Southwest Region.  Responsibilities Responsible for all commercial business activities within the assigned region including negotiating contracts, prices and any follow-up agreements Ensure that all relevant internal departments have necessary information for successful fulfillment of all internal and external obligations Provide market intelligence related to prices, programs, trends and competitive activities relevant to the region Define the sales plan including budgeting, forecasting and sales and marketing activities in agreement with established business strategy Focus on customers, key retail accounts to ensure market access within the region Implement the Yara Crop Nutrition strategy in the region Works collaboratively with market development, marketing, product management and digital teams to execute Yara’s crop nutrition solutions Manage and develop a team of sales professionals to ensure demand generation and to build farmer relationships Provide link to crop, market access, commercial strategies and customers Execute sales plan Profile Bachelor degree in Agronomy, Ag Business or Ag related field. Master degree may be an advantage 5 years working experience managing sales roles in similar industries, preferably with value added fertilizers exposure and digital tools experience CCA (Certified Crop Advisor) is preferred Extensive travelling requiring a valid driver’s license Strong business orientation Strong market and product knowledge Strong commercial forecasting and risk analysis skills Strong negotiation skills Strong communication skills Strong customer service and interpersonal skills Strong management skills Proficient in MS office, especially Excel and PowerPoint, as well as digital tools, such as Twitter, and Facebook Additional Information Must be a U.S. citizen or lawful permanent resident. Contact Details  Tatiana Oliva, HR Manager  Email: tatiana.oliva@yara.com  Apply No Later Than  October 15, 2021  Knowledge Grows Through Differences  Yara is committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We believe that creating a diverse and inclusive work environment is not only the right thing, but also the smart thing to do. To deliver on this, Yara has firmly anchored Diversity & Inclusion (D&I) in our business strategy and has more than 400 employees worldwide involved in D&I ambassador networks.

Who We Are:  Aviatrix is a well-funded, pre-IPO, hyper-growth enterprise-software company based in the heart of Silicon Valley (Santa Clara, CA). Aviatrix technology has proven solid at scale with nearly 600 enterprise customers, over 40 of the Global Fortune 500. We have a top-tier, experienced leadership team, combined with a collaborative culture built on proven success, trust, execution, and respect. We’re focused on getting things done!  Read recent article published in Bloomberg on Aviatrix’s incredible rise in value  What We Do:  Aviatrix is networking for the cloud era , delivering a superset of features and capabilities that leverage and control native cloud constructs and add advance network, security and operational visibility features that cloud providers lack, while maintaining the simplicity and automation enterprises expect in cloud. Aviatrix offers the industry’s first and only multi-cloud networking certification ( ACE ), empowering IT to lead and accelerate the transformation to the cloud.  About the role:  We are looking for a highly motivated Regional Sales Manager to join our rapidly growing Go-to-Market (GTM) sales team. The Regional Sales Manager will be responsible for driving sales of Aviatrix products and solutions within a specific geographic territory. The RSM must be quota-driven and will represent Aviatrix and its product suite within the region. S/HE will work with Inside Sales, Systems Engineers, Solution Architects, and Aviatrix Partners to exceed sales objectives. This position will manage all aspects of the sales process including securing net-new business, lead management, qualification, evaluation, close and subsequent account care. The RMS will act as the lead of their territory.  Position Responsibilities:  Define and execute sales plans for the assigned territory  Meet and exceed quotas through prospecting, qualifying, managing, and closing opportunities  Develop and manage sales pipeline, prospect, and assess sales and move a large number of transactions through the sales pipeline  Manage and track customer and transactional information in the Aviatrix CRM system  Provide activity forecasts and regular pipeline reporting through the CRM system  Own and collaborate on all aspects of the sales cycle, including product support and sales engineering  Execute product demonstrations to prospective clients  Develop accounts of various sizes and grow client relationships  Understand the competitive market, be familiar with competing companies and their product suite  Collaborate within the Aviatrix team on strategy setting, sales training, marketing efforts, and customer care  Meet with customers daily, both remote and in-person once climate allows  Requirements  8+ years of enterprise software sales experience with a track record of closing complex sales to Fortune 500 companies or 8+ years managing and growing a large geographical territory with YoY growth/success in net-new logo’s  Cloud experience  A Closer – consistent overachievement of sales goals in a large geographic territory  Drive to expand client base and close sales  Excellent communication skills verbal and written, team player  Entrepreneurial – willing to go the extra mile, competitive mindset, great work ethic, resourceful, “get it done” attitude  Must be willing to travel to clients to support sales relationships  Bachelor’s Degree  Aviatrix, Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and does not make hiring decisions based on race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Seasoned sales representative that will call on existing and prospective customers in the defined territory to generate new revenue. The position will be focused on winning new business, along with managing existing accounts. Applicants should be extremely self-motivated with ability to prospect potential customers, manage the day to day sales process, manage existing customers, coordinate & lead presentations and demos, develop proposals and close sales.   Responsibilities Develop market need for dataPARC software products and services by calling on all existing and prospective customers in the defined territory. Maintain an active and healthy pipeline, managing all aspects of their accounts such as on-going maintenance and ongoing services Develop and maintain a sufficient knowledge of core industries (Utilities, Oil & Gas, Chemicals, Metals & Mining, Paper, and Life Sciences) and stay current with their trends and issues to effectively apply dataPARC to meet customer business goals. Perform presentations and demonstrations to prospective customers promoting the value of the dataPARC product for their business needs. Work with technical sales and sales management to answer commercial & technical questions as they arise in the sales process.  Develop software and professional services proposals for new and existing customers. Manage all annual software maintenance renewals & proposals in defined territory with the assistance of inside sales. Maintain knowledge of dataPARC products, and advantages over the competition. Expedite resolution of key customer complaints and problems. Effectively use the available internal resources available in marketing, engineering, sales management and technical support to meet prospects’ individual business goals. Utilize CRM for managing customers, leads, opportunities and forecasting. Regularly meet with sales management and marketing to provide feedback on your needs to grow sales. Prioritize routine work, respects schedule of others, flexible in response to changing environment. Maintain a favorable working relationship with all other company employees to foster aid and promote a cooperative and harmonious working climate which will be conducive to maximum employee morale, productivity, and efficiency/effectiveness Participate in all training offered by Capstone as relevant to department or position Communicate effectively with internal and external customers demonstrating a high level of confidentiality and respect  Qualifications Demonstrated knowledge, interest and skill in the use of Information Technology within the process industry domain, typically derived from employment or consulting IT Skills consisting of a basic knowledge of operating systems, advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office suite, Microsoft Windows and knowledge of a programming language Mobility is mandatory, given that the travel customer sites will be required 25-50% of time Essential traits for success are those of being a self-directed, well-organized, driven, autonomous type of individual. Strong communication (written, verbal and listening) skills, personal tact and diplomacy, and excellent problem solving skills are mandatory. BS, MS or PhD in Engineering (Chemical Preferred) Minimum 2 years’ experience working as an Outside Sales Representative - preference given to experience serving process industries or working for a process information software vendor (such as OSIsoft, Aspen Tech, etc.). Experience working with process historian and data visualization software packages such as OSIsoft’s PI, AspenTech’s IP.21, Honeywell PHD, Siemens XHQ or Capstone’s PARCview. Knowledge of dataPARC or PARCview system a plus  Recruitment Privacy Notice: Please note, before applying to a BTG/Capstone job posting or sending us your resume/CV, kindly refer to BTG’s Recruitment Privacy Notice which is available on our website at https://www.btg.com/recruitment-privacy-notice/ Thank you for the interest in BTG/Capstone; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

COMPANY Venta Air Technologies, Inc. is the US subsidiary of Venta-Luftwäscher GmbH from Weingarten, Germany, one of the leading manufacturers of dual-function filter-free devices for indoor air humidification and air purification. With over 120 employees worldwide and subsidiaries in the USA, Switzerland, the Netherlands, Austria, Japan, and China, Venta has been continuously successful and growing ever since its foundation in 1981. Venta’s products are robust, reliable, easy-to-use, and of the highest quality "Made in Germany". For more information visit www.venta-usa.com.  POSITION Breathing optimal indoor air is important. Today, with more people working from home permanently it is more relevant than ever! Venta is looking for an experienced Senior Sales Manager who will continue to grow Venta’s overall sales revenue and market share by developing new and existing accounts in the US and Canada. If you have experience selling products such as white goods, small domestic appliances, consumer electronics, or similar to large retailers such as Bed, Bath & Beyond, Home Depot, and Lowe's and have a hunter mentality, you’ll be perfectly equipped to be successful in this role. If you live in the greater Chicago area, you will work partially from home and partially out of the office (hybrid model). There's also a fully remote option for out-of-state candidates. The position will report directly to the CEO of Venta US.  OFFER • Excellent compensation and benefits. • A growing company in a futuristic industry. • Work with an international team and the chance to travel to Germany. • A lot of freedom and autonomy and no micromanagement. • The opportunity to sell high-quality products “Made in Germany”.  KEY RESPONSIBILITIES • Developing and executing a business development strategy across North America. • Identifying sales strategies and developing existing accounts while seeking new business development opportunities. • Successfully building sales volumes, maintaining, and growing profitability, and delivering exceptional customer service. • Establishing and maintaining strong customer relations at the local and regional levels, to maximize the value of the short- & long-term business • Identifying new potential customers across the domestic landscape. • Responding to inquiries and pursuing potential opportunities. • Analyzing account requirements and develop penetration plans to increase market share. • Managing and executing promotional and merchandising programs within the retail stores. • Conducting product and promotional training with retail sales associates. • Creating account strategies and managing clear alignment with all functions. • Developing, coordinating, and implementing account plans, including tailored value propositions. • Negotiating/generating agreements with each account, coordinating and driving account promotions. • Managing sales and forecast planning for the assigned accounts within North America. • Writing internal weekly reports to management to communicate all business issues and competitive information.  CANDIDATE PROFILE • Bachelor’s degree in business, sales, or marketing or related field • Proven track record of at least 8 years in a sales/account management role selling to retail/distribution. • Knowledge of the buyers/decision-makers at large retailers or prior experience selling to them • Willingness to travel approximately 25% within North America. • Excellent relationship-building and negotiation skills, exceptional follow-through, strong organizational and time management skills. • Experience in the housewares category or consumer durables, preferably to retailers such as Bed, Bath & Beyond, Home Depot, and Lowe’s. • Experience with Amazon Vendor Central is a plus. • Knowledge of category management and trade marketing is preferred.

Job Description  Our busy and growing client in the DFW, TX area has an immediate need for Vice President of Sales on a direct hire basis.  Company Profile  Busy and growing manufacturing company in business over a decade  Company manufactures pipes for a variety of industries including Oil and Gas, Irrigation, Mining, and Municipalities  Does your resume really present you as the best qualified candidate for the job? Put your voice out there too! We invite you to share your story and complete a quick video interview that will be done in less than 3 minutes. Please follow this link: http://interview.deephire.com/wxg  VP Of Sales Role  In this role, you will report to the CEO and be responsible for overseeing the daily sales activities, meeting with key clients, writing sales reports, designing and implementing effectives sales strategies, and marketing company products and services.  Seeking a strong leader with a high emotional IQ and strong analytical skills!  The candidate we are seeking will have strong leadership skills and possess the ability to drive company success.  In-depth knowledge of the market and competitive products is expected, along with excellent customer service skills and interpersonal skills.  Strong sales leadership of distributor and in house sales.  Working with the engineering department to design print and online promotional materials for the company' s products and services.  Identifying where improvements can be made and developing sales plans and strategies to achieve sales goals.  Recruiting and hiring sales staff and developing training programs.  Coaching of direct reports.  Managing sales teams and maintaining sales operations.  Outlining and managing sales budgets.  Setting quarterly and annual sales goals and motivating the sales teams to achieve their goals.  Monitoring the market and competitor products and activities and providing detailed sales forecasting.  Reviewing customer activity, anticipating consumer needs, and improving customer satisfaction.  Creating sales reports and providing feedback to the leadership team at company meetings.  Ability to pull large amounts of data and write/create strong sales reports.  Establishing and maintaining key customer relationships  VP Of Sales Background Profile  Bachelor' s degree in a business-related field.  Master' s degree in a business-related field is a plus.  Understanding of production scheduling and material specifications and capabilities.  7+ years’ experience in a sales leadership position in a manufacturing industry.  4+ years’ experience working in a selling role and with sales technology and CRM software.  2+ years’ experience in a senior (C-level) leadership role is a plus.  In-depth knowledge of selling strategies and methods, as well as employee motivation techniques.  Strong working knowledge of the company' s products, competitive products, and the market.  Excellent leadership, communication, interpersonal, and customer service skills.  Great strategic planning, organizational, and creative thinking skills  Features And Benefits  Opportunity to participate in an amazing benefits package! description: Job Description Summary ・製品を通じて顧客のニーズを認識し最善の提案を行う。・社内でのコミュニケーションを通じて効率の良いセールスを行う。・導入後のお客様へのフォローアップを通じて満足度を上げていく。・エリアのKOLとの関係を構築し、会社や製品のプレゼンスを向上させる。 Job Description   GEの技術を理解し、技術的・経営的に最適なソリューションを提案する。 エリア営業、コマーシャルスタッフ、エリアサービスと密接に協力して業務を遂行する。 DTI(Demand to Inquiry)に関わる主な技術的役割：プレITO期間中の技術サポートを通じた市場浸透の増加を目指す。 販売地域、製品ライン、市場、販売プロセス、または顧客グループに関する深い知識を深める。 主要なビジネスドライバーを深く理解し、その理解をもとに自分の仕事を遂行する。 過去の経験やOJTを活用して、簡単なタスクを解決する。 口頭および書面による優れたコミュニケーションで問題を分析し、解決する。 プログラムを文書化し、計画し販売実行する能力 とプロジェクト管理する。   Job Description Summary  Responsible for all resources, and logistics required to perform services and maintenance activities on customers' site/property. These activities contribute to, maintain, Responsible for the tender support, planning, design, and project execution for Independent Sector customers’ Diagnostic Imaging orders.  Job Description  Responsibilities include but are not limited to; sales order review, project planning, design/layout, contractor interface, submission of documentation, resource coordination, and issue resolution. Assists Independent Sector customers in achieving their strategic goals for current year and beyond through ownership of the customer programme.  Roles and Responsibilities  Act as the primary liaison between GE, the GE customer team on all aspects of design proposal, construction and project execution. Work closely with customers facility, Turnkey & General Contractors to develop the offer. Provide GE Healthcare leadership during site preparation: Provide support to customers and to sales representatives with site preparation and project management activities; deliver high quality site planning documents and drawings to customers; monitor and communicate site management key dates for recording in the OTR project management systems. Work cross functionally with sales and services teams while owning the project management and implementation process to organise de-installations, relocation of systems, new installations, customer testing and applications training.  Support the sales transfer and project close out in-line with contractual obligations and customer requirements: ensure compliance, handover and reporting procedures are followed; support the customer's acceptance. Hold regular programme and operational meetings with all strategic accounts in order to drive actions and assist customer’s in achieving their strategic goals. Provide customers and GE with greater visibility for project execution during current year and year +1 level through report out. Ensure compliance with contractual requirements and local regulations. Follow and comply with existing GE Healthcare EHS rules and procedures. Be involved in EHS activities and programs (e.g. training, accidents reporting…) in compliance with the environmental health and safety policy.   Qualifications / Requirements:  Experience in cross-functional, customer facing and/or project management roles. Ability to work effectively across functions to deliver results and execute multiple commitments within customer facing large-scale multi-phase projects. Strong organisational skills, multitasking abilities to drive critical issues simultaneously.  Resourcefulness, excellent communication & project leadership skills, negotiation and influencing skills and problem-solving expertise.  Technical background: knowledge of electrics, mechanics, physics, civil works, general construction. Must have a valid driver's license, be willing and able to travel regularly including overnight when necessary.  Desired Characteristics  Cross-functional GEHC business understanding.  Boundary-less player.  Knowledge of social and local regulations, EHS rules.  Working knowledge of Microsoft Windows and Office Applications and Project Management tools and software.  Inclusion and Diversity  GE Healthcare is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, colour, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.      Additional Information  Relocation Assistance Provided: No
