jobTitle: Sales, Business Development Manager - Diagnostic Imaging Channel (East Zone)
description: Sales, Business Development Manager – Diagnostic Imaging Channel  If you are a Colorado resident and this role is a field-based or remote role, you may be eligible to receive additional information about the compensation and benefits for this role, which we will provide upon request.  You may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.  In this role, you have the opportunity to Act as the single point of contact to drive strategy within key Diagnostic Imaging accounts.  The Business Development Manager will own the Executive level relationships within these accounts.   You are responsible for Solidifying the Trusted Advisor Role by providing market insights on industry trends, competitive landscape information, healthcare legislation information that assists the Account(s) in reaching it’s goals. Leveraging the business and partnership relationship to retain and build toward a full Philips solution and product portfolio standardization. Identifying a strong funnel of growth potential by analyzing contract status, standardization plan, products, needs, care gaps, install base and partnership strategies to leverage into deal strategies. Acting as single point of contact for Diagnostic Imaging Organizations and own Executive level relationships. Communicating, aligning and driving the Philips team to execute on the Account strategy. Negotiating and overseeing development of opportunities, RFP’s and partnership growth. Participating in customer meetings to closure. Developing and leveraging relationships to drive deal execution. Maintaining account funnel, forecast and AOP performance. Simplifying the impact of Philips required activities for the customer Leading and coaching internal business partners to meet and manage customer expectations throughout the sales processes of MRI, CT, Ultrasound, DXR, PACS, software solutions and other Philips solutions pertinent to the outpatient imaging market. To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience: Four-year college degree or equivalent preferred 8+ years of Field Sales experience required Experience in selling to accounts that can produce large sales volumes and/or market share growth preferred Experience with C-Level and IDNs required Experience selling Radiology Solutions. The ability to engage the customer and draw them into meaningful, in-depth conversations The ability to educate the customer, not only about the sales organization's products and services, but also about industry trends and business issues The ability to enlighten the customer about new possibilities, and act as a catalyst for innovative ideas  You are a part of A collaborative team with a strong internal network that aligns key players to support the delivery of value to our customers in order to execute deals.  This team maximizes the customer experience by creating a predictable process of information gathering and exchange to present an efficient One Philips approach.   In return, we offer you  Sharpen your talents with new challenges in our dynamic organization. As a market-driven company, we’re used to listening to our customers & apply the same thinking to our employees. We offer a competitive salary, outstanding benefits and flexibility in a career with a positive and supportive atmosphere in which to develop your talents further.  Why should you join Philips?  Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.  It is the policy of Philips to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, pregnancy/childbirth, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran or military status or a person’s relationship or association with a protected veteran, including spouses and other family members, marital or domestic partner status, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.  As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants that require accommodation in the job application process may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.  Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran  No Sponsorship offered: "US work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa."   No Relocation: “Company relocation benefits will not be provided for this position. Candidates need to live within the territory”

How Will You Make An Impact  Management of business development, key commercial accounts and commercial liaison within the LPD OEM business portfolio. Key tasks and responsibilities for this position include but not limited to: building a ‘partner’ relationship with all business users within assigned areas, defining customer requirements & scoping of new opportunities for Business Team review, developing capabilities presentations, managing key contracts, management of overall communications with customer and conducting business reviews (QBR). The candidate shall lead internal cross functional team meetings to accomplish goals and commitments made to the strategic customers and communicate status and issues to customers regularly. This role is considered a key member of the respective business and OEM Commercial team(s) and must have the vision, drive, and interpersonal skills to succeed in a growth environment. The candidate will be a “hands on” account management professional operating with a sense of ownership.  What Will You Do Build strong customer allegiance and partnership, Key Accounts as assigned Manage estimated 3-5 Key Accounts Evaluate and lead all new business development opportunities for LPD OEM Manage contract renewals, price strategies and commercial initiatives to drive growth target of 3% per annum Expand LSG portfolio breadth within account, where possible Evaluate and lead all new business opportunities for LPD OEM projects Lead QBR reviews internal and with customers Provide strategic inputs for product and technology roadmap Commercial and Technical lead for customer interaction prior to full NPD project team assignment BU, Division or corporate leadership approval on all proposals and quotations Drive quotation teams from all LPD manufacturing sites as needed to prepare proposals and quotations for LPD OEM solutions Global travel to support regional commercial teams on presenting capabilities and driving opportunity for new projects (with approval). How Will You Get There 5 plus years of sales experience managing large complex accounts strongly preferred Experience within the Biotech industry strongly preferred BS degree in Science, Business, Engineering strongly preferred Minimum required education: Bachelor degree or Associate degree with 2 years of experience or high school diploma/GED with 4 years of relevant experience Position may require Covid-19 vaccination and/or routing testing, per client discretion Experience Qualifications Demonstrated success and experience working within matrix organizations Demonstrated ability to operate independently with initiative, objective attainment intensity, and solid business judgment Proven ability to sell creative solutions to high level customer personnel Demonstrated excellence in oral and written communications skills Strong organizational and time management skills with good orientation to detail Strong technical, business, and financial acumen Highly effective negotiation skills Sophisticated level of computer proficiency Benefits A choice of national medical and dental plans, and a national vision plan Diversity & Inclusion council and Employee Resource Groups including Women’s Group, LGBTQA, African Heritage, Veteran's, and Working Parents Tax-advantaged savings and spending accounts and commuter benefits Fleet vehicle At least 120 hours paid time off (PTO), 10 paid holidays annually, paid parental leave (3 weeks for bonding and 8 weeks for caregiver leave), accident and life insurance, short- and long-term disability, and volunteer time off in accordance with company policy Retirement and savings programs, such as our competitive 401(k) U.S. retirement savings plan Employees’ Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) offers eligible colleagues the opportunity to purchase company stock at a discount At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 80,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

jobTitle: Outside Sales Representative / Account Manager - Tools and Accessories
description: Altec specializes in the manufacture, sale and service of aerial devices, digger derricks, cranes and specialty equipment for the electric utility, telecommunications, tree care, construction, and light and sign maintenance industries in more than 120 countries throughout the world.  Altec Supply is currently looking for an Outside Sales Representative / Account Manager located in San Antonio, TX; Houston, TX; Austin, TX; and surrounding areas. Altec Supply provides aftermarket parts, accessories and service needs for our customer's equipment. Primary responsibilities include the following:  Produce sales of products in a designated area or designated account(s) to meet pre-established quotas. Manage and support the designated area of responsibility consistent with Altec values. Utilize skills in territory management, account management, and time management. Perform sales calls, presentations, and product demonstrations. Assist in establishing quotas, pricing, forecasting, and receivables collections. Attend product/sales meetings. Develop external and internal personal customer relationships. Complete all sales related paperwork such as sales call logs and expense reports. Maintain a high level of customer service. Produce product sales to meet or exceed established quota. Build and maintain customer profiles and market data. Ensure that sales strategic plan and critical issues are met.  Please apply directly on our website https://jobs.altec.com/  U.S. Military Veterans and Spouses are Encouraged to Apply See https://altecveteranrecruiting.com   Education, Experience, and Skills Required Four-year Bachelor's Degree required. Current valid driver’s license required. At least two years of applicable experience preferred.  Product and/or industry knowledge preferred. Must be available for moderate overnight travel. Total communication and information processing skills are required. PC skills using spreadsheets, word processing, and other office management applications required.  The job level is able to be adjusted at time of hire, if the candidate meets the qualifications for jobs of a more experienced level in the career path.   Customer First - Enjoyment of Work - Family - Financial Stability - Integrity - People are our Greatest Strength - Quality - Spiritual Development – Teamwork  Competitive pay which rewards performance  Comprehensive benefits including Medical, Dental and Prescription Drug Program - Retirement 401(k) Program - Vacation and Holidays - Flexible Spending Accounts - Tuition Assistance Program - Employee Assistance and Mental Health/Substance Abuse Program - Life Insurance, Accidental Death and Dismemberment Insurance Altec Industries, Inc. and its affiliates are equal opportunity employers and maintain affirmative action plans to recruit, retain, develop, and promote qualified individuals without unlawful consideration of race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, citizenship status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law. Altec strives to maintain a work environment free from unlawful discrimination and harassment, where associates are treated with respect and dignity.

How about a gig that allows you to earn money by helping the restaurants you know and love sign up for free programs that enable their success?  Who are we?  Buyers Edge Platform is a Data and Technology Company for the foodservice industry that helps operators (restaurants, hotels, casinos, healthcare facilities, etc.) succeed by saving them money on the products and services they purchase every day. Operator clients take advantage of our contracts with top manufacturers of products ranging from chicken fingers to garbage bags.  We’re an important connection point for the industry – bringing together stakeholders from across the supply chain in order to help all parties succeed. We rely on our proprietary technology to deliver exclusive contracts, supply chain consulting and data services to all of our partners and clients. Our company has grown consistently over 20+ years and is featured annually on the Inc. 5000 list of fastest growing companies in America.  This position will be based near our Waltham, MA or Lake Worth, FL offices. We are unable to offer sponsorship for work authorization for this role.  Who are we looking for?  Rockstar sales people who want to close their own deals and control their own destiny. The wild thing about this position is that you are actually offering Buyers Edge Platform’s services FOR FREE. The biggest hurdle to the sale has been removed – you’re not asking anyone to part with their money. In fact, you’re encouraging them to sign up for a free program that GIVES them money.  To make things even sweeter, you’ll be fed a steady diet of hot leads by our Marketing Team. We mean it… the collaboration we have with our Marketing Dept. is so successful that it’s an anomaly. We actually like each other and they keep our sales team well-stocked with qualified leads to call and close.  The focus of this role is to identify and close new business for our restaurant cost savings programs. You will use a pro-active strategy to reach out to both prospects and existing members to reinforce the value that we provide, help them find new products to help them save money, and develop that warm and fuzzy feeling that bubbles up in our clients when they realize how beneficial we can be. You will connect with thousands of dynamic restaurateurs, chefs and entrepreneurs and will recommend new programs to encourage a more committed relationship between them and us.  Along the way, you’ll get to know the restaurant industry from the ‘other side’… the side you don’t see when you’re picking up pizzas or buying burritos. You’ll get a first-hand look at the cost-side of the restaurant industry – where thousands of entrepreneurs pour their blood and sweat into running the establishments that keep our communities fed and watered.  You rock the following awesome skillset: Ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment Highly organized and self-motivated Seek a culture of positivity and high performance Value feedback and constantly strive to improve and learn Have tenacity and great problem-solving skills Eagerness to learn new technology, such as Salesforce.com  You Love: Crushing dials, closing dozens of deals per month, short sales cycles and instant gratification Thoughtful leadership dedicated to your success as a sales ninja On-going professional development A team-first atmosphere with an all-for-one mentality Working towards 75 dials & 90 mins of talk-time per day Uncapped Commission  Bonus “nice to have” skills: Sales experience as a BDR/SDR Experience using Salesforce You're familiar with the restaurant or food industry You have experience in a quota carrying role You've closed your own deals Ideally 2 - 4 year(s) of work experience but NEW Grads welcome!  What's in this for you?  Amazing coverages to start: Medical, dental, and vision coverages are just the beginning! We also offer ancillary plans, such as flexible spending accounts for both health and dependent care, critical illness, accident, and voluntary life as well as company paid life and long-term-disability plans! On top of this, we also offer a 401(k) plan with company match.  Invest in your success: We will provide you with a thorough training and development program; and offer competitive compensation.  Live well = Work well: Flexible hybrid work schedule. Summer Fridays. Relax with our Personal Responsibility Paid Time Off policy where you don’t have to accrue time off in order to take it!  BEP welcomes all.  BEP is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, age, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, disability or handicap, or veteran status.  Powered by JazzHR  31oFsLFsxQ

description: About Us  Within the sweeping panorama of the north Georgia foothills, Chateau Elan began with the planting of the vineyards in 1981. From these lush vines has grown a 3,500 acre conference and leisure destination. We welcome your interest in applying for a position with Chateau Élan Winery & Resort. For many years, we have served our guests with the highest level of products and service in luxury resorts. We owe our growth and success to our associates who have served our guests with dedication and pride. The key to our continued growth is found in satisfying and exceeding our guests’ expectations.  We look for people with personality, energy, enthusiasm, excellent grooming and commitment. We nurture and train our associates throughout their tenure here. They, in turn, provide the highest level of guest service making Chateau Élan the special place it is today.  Perks include but are not limited to discount hotel stays, discount spa services, discount golf, discount food and beverage, discount retail as well as access to the YouDecide® discount program. YouDecide® offerings include negotiated pricing arrangements for vacation destinations, hotels, vacation planning, rental cars, movie tickets/rentals, consumer electronics, consumer goods and services, personal services and even discounts on cell phones and plans.  We value U.S. military experience and invite all qualified military candidates to apply.  Overview  Manage accounts to achieve guest satisfaction and to solicit past and new business to ensure all revenue goals are achieved or exceeded. Responsible for soliciting new group sales accounts, entertaining, and maintaining relationships with existing accounts to meet and exceed revenue goals in rooms, food, beverage, and room rental.  Responsibilities Solicit new and existing accounts to meet and exceed revenue goals through telephone prospecting, outside sales calls, site inspections and written communication. Book group events ranging in size from 10-400 rooms, including corporate, association, Smerf and sports groups. Book catering events including weddings, day meetings and other requests. Plan and detail events as required. Advanced level of producing room, banquet, and room rental revenue through directly soliciting business via aggressive prospecting, making presentations, developing contracts, negotiating and closing sales. Maximize revenue by selling all facets of the hotel, both orally and in written form to previous, current and potential clients. Handle account details so that all pertinent aspects of solicitation and closing are complete and documented. Coordinate various departments' participation in servicing accounts. Develop and conduct persuasive verbal sales presentations to prospective clients. Prepare information for, meet with and entertain clients as deemed appropriate by potential business from that account. Communicate both verbally and in writing to provide clear direction to all departments in the hotel to ensure high quality of service to customers. Prepare correspondence to customers, internal booking reports and file maintenance. Participate in daily business review meeting, pre-convention meetings, training and other sales-related meetings as required. Attend trade shows, community events and industry meetings. Advanced knowledge of market trends, competition and key customers of the hotel. Comply with attendance rules and be available to work on a regular basis. Position is Atlanta area based, on site at the Resort. Perform any other job related duties as assigned. Qualifications High school or equivalent education required. Bachelor's degree preferred. 3+ years of past group sales experience at a resort or large hotel preferred. Must have experience at a similar size and quality hotel. Requires good communication skills, both verbal and written. Must be able to speak, read, write, and understand English. Must possess computer skills, including, but not limited to, use of Microsoft Word, Excel, and Delphi. Advanced knowledge of sales skills, revenue management, training, and motivation of peers. Advanced knowledge of hotel and competitive market. Ability to execute appropriate action plans. Desire to participate as part of a team. Must be willing to "pitch-in" and help co-workers with their job duties and be a team player. Knowledge of hotel operations, including marketing plans, security and safety programs, personnel and labor relations, preparation of business plans, repairs, maintenance, budget forecasting, quality assurance programs, hospitality law, and long-range planning. Leadership skills to motivate and develop staff and to ensure accomplishment of goals. Able to set priorities, plan, organize, and delegate. Written communication skills to be concise, well organized, complete, and clear. Ability to work effectively under time constraints and deadlines. Effective verbal and written communication skills. Ability to adapt communication style to suit different audiences, such as effectively communicating with supervisors, coworkers, public etc. Benefits  HEI Hotels and Resorts is committed to providing a comprehensive benefit program that offers you choices for your physical, mental and financial wellness, creating value in your most important investment - you!  For your physical and mental wellness we offer competitive Medical and Dental programs through Anthem Blue Cross Blue Shield as well as Vision insurance programs through EyeMed. Our Vacation, Sick and Holiday programs are available for you to rejuvenate with time off. For your financial wellness, HEI provides a wide array of coverage, including Supplemental, Spousal and Child Life insurance as well as Short and Long-Term Disability plans. Our 401(k) Savings Plan with matching funds, and discounts through our 'YouDecide' and Hotel Room Discount programs provide additional incentives for choosing HEI as the employer of your future.  HEI Hotels and Resorts is an equal opportunity employer. We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, and other legally protected characteristics.

description: Job Category  Sales & Business Development  Opportunity Awaits at Altus Group!  Vice President, Sales North America  The Opportunity  We have an exciting opportunity for a Vice President of Sales in North America. In this role, you will be accountable for the successful delivery of go-to-market strategies and resources that meet the revenue goals and customer needs. With multiple offerings across the North America Altus Analytics business, we are looking for a transformative leader to help build and run the new North America sales function.  This is your chance to lead the evolution of Altus Analytics, while further developing and establishing your network across our entire organization, utilizing your drive to explore new ways succeeding through the team and identifying and pursuing untapped opportunities.  What's In It For You Impact and influence. You will develop and implement sales strategies and lead and develop a team of expert sales professionals in delivering revenue goals and driving the success of Altus Analytics across North America Transformative Building. You will lead the team through the change ahead and ensure the people, systems, process and business work effectively together to achieve the visions of growth and client enable through Altus Analytics products and services. Our new Vice President, Sales North America will focus on: Strategic Leadership. Working with the Global Head of Sales, you will design, develop and implement short and mid-term sales strategies, which will align them to the overall strategic goals and priorities within Altus Analytics; deliver defined revenue, growth and customer metrics; and build a winning sales culture with high motivation and engagement. People Leadership. You will lead and develop a team of expert sales professionals, ensuring that the team is focused on the right priorities, are accountable and are measured accordingly; that the structure within the sales function is clearly articulated and aligns to our strategy and operating model; support people processes such as coaching and mentoring and maintaining focus through our compensation plans Operational Leadership. You will ensure that the sales function operates to the highest possible standards by implementing appropriate review and measurement processes to achieve targets; establish a communication approach to effectively disseminate and gather relevant metrics; work with sales ops and other stakeholders to increase productivity and align technology to product and go-to-market strategies; and lead operational cycles such as account planning, sales reviews, etc. Executive Leadership. You will be a key contributor to the Global Sales Leadership team by building cross functional working relationships with stakeholders; sharing knowledge and experience that can be leveraged in other regions; serving as a mentor and role model to other sales professionals; and providing advice, input and feedback into key strategic planning, decision-making, and issue resolution cycles. You Have The education. You have a Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Business Administration, or equivalent. The industry expertise. You have at least 10 years of experience and a proven track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets through a team Transformative leadership: You have experience taking a team through a transformative journey, maintaining engagement and focus while continuously achieving goals. The problem-solving skills. You have strong logical thinking skills to identify a critical path and the necessary steps to completion and can anticipate roadblocks and remove them. The vision. You have the experience and knowledge of how a best-in-class sales function needs to be structured and operate, and a clear picture of how to get there. Sales Leadership skills. You have seasoned leadership skills with a proven ability to attract, retain and motivate sales teams to deliver sustainable revenue goals. You have a disciplined approach to sales management, overseeing its key processes, defining the appropriate metrics to mitigate risk and ensuring the appropriate governance structure is in place to effectively meet our defined goals. The communication and influence skills. You are a strong communicator who enjoys interacting with others, whether it’s selling services to clients by understanding their needs and providing a relevant solution; providing insights to our Marketing & Product teams to assist in creating campaigns, events and product strategy; or coaching your direct reports to manage their performance and develop their skills. Come realize your potential at Altus Group!  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class.  Applicants with disabilities may contact Altus Group to request and arrange for accommodations. If you need assistance to accommodate a disability, you may request an accommodation at any time. Please contact us at accessibilityusa@altusgroup.com or . (416) 641-9500

Job Title: Inside Sales Specialist, Western U.S.A., Rapid Diagnostics Solutions  This role supports the new Rapid Diagnostics Solutions (RDS) business unit, as part of the Specialty Diagnostics Group at Thermo Fisher Scientific. We are focused on increasing access to innovative diagnostic testing solutions to support our mission of making the world cleaner, healthier, safer.  When you’re part of the team at Thermo Fisher Scientific, you’ll do important work, and you’ll be valued and recognized for your performance. With talented managers and inspiring coworkers to support you, you’ll find the resources and opportunities to make significant contributions to the world.  Location/Division Specific Information  Located in: CA, AZ, NM, NV, OR, WA  Approximately 15-20% travel required.  How will you make an impact?  The Rapid Diagnostics Regional Inside Sales Specialist (Western U.S.A) will be responsible for growing the Thermo Fisher Scientific Rapid Diagnostics business in existing and prospect small-medium accounts within the healthcare core segment within the assigned regional geography, Western U.S.A.. The successful Inside Sales Specialist will be responsible to drive opportunities from demand creation through to closure and implementation, with the goal of exceeding revenue objectives.  What will you do? Manage engagement with all regional small-medium healthcare accounts to build customer allegiance. Successfully articulate the value of our products, services, and support to current and prospective customers. Ability to cultivate and maintain strong relationships with key customers within assigned region and accounts. Develop demand and adoption for new molecular diagnostics assays within existing and prospective account base. Identify, prioritize, and develop new customer opportunities to continually build a pipeline for future growth, to meet/exceed revenue targets. Demonstrate effective use of remote selling communication tools including phone, email, and virtual meeting platforms. Collaborate effectively across Thermo Fisher Scientific divisions. Primarily responsible for all communication and coordination between the customer and Thermo Fisher Scientific’s personnel and for ensuring that all new product and system implementations are executed to exceed customer expectations. Perform all commercial administrative duties related to effective territory management including documentation of accounts, customers, and activities and more in corporate CRM (SalesForce.com). Execute effective pipeline management including lead, opportunity, and sales cycle details to effectively forecast the business and exceed regional business objectives. Complete all assigned and required training satisfactorily and on time. Travel as required. How will you get here?  Education And Experience BSc Degree in Life Sciences or Natural Sciences OR 3+ years of related sales experience with proven success, preferably in diagnostics, medical sales or life sciences sales. Knowledge, Skills, Abilities Ability to excel in building and managing relationships which positively influence business growth. Highly analytical with the ability to utilize tools to identify and action on new sales opportunities. Effective problem solver with a consultative approach focused on providing exceptional customer solutions. Strong listening and interpersonal skills, as well as effective oral and written communication skills. Results-driven self-starter and able to work independently. Knowledge of diagnostics core customer segments. Ability to tailor sales approach to multi-level customer types. Effective collaboration in a highly matrixed organization. Knowledge and experience of customer workflow/processes is a plus. Skilled in Microsoft Office applications including Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint. Skilled in Social Selling including LinkedIn Navigator is a plus. Ability to leverage virtual selling platforms. Proficient using SalesForce CRM is a plus. NSNInsideSales

jobTitle: Hospitality Sales Manager - Caesars Las Vegas
description: Job Summary  Job Description  The Hospitality Sales Manager is responsible for the end to end booking of social-group room blocks and contracting restaurant groups process, while cross-selling all areas of the Caesars Entertainment. The Manager assists guests with inquiries for hotel and/or restaurant accommodations, booking and communicating trip details including food and beverage contracts, ensuring inquiries are transferred to appropriate departments and assisting in the overall plan for a group’s trip. The Hospitality Sales Manager is an expert in “what to do” while visiting Caesars Entertainment properties and will provide insight and suggestions for a unique experience.  Hotel Accommodations  Assists guests seeking hotel accommodations of 10 or more rooms by reviewing request, quoting the trip and providing recommendations on properties and/or room types based on guest’s budget. This leader will partner with Hotel Operations and Revenue Management to ensure specific accommodations may be met including premium room types and pricing. When necessary, the manager will meet with clients for site tours of rooms/space. Proactively reaching out to previous guests and upselling all groups into premium accommodations and dining/activities while on property is critical to the success of driving results.  Restaurant Sales  This leader will manage the guest’s inquiry process for restaurant group events which may include receiving phone calls, conducting site inspections, menu and accessory selection, writing standard and customized menus. When applicable, introduces client(s) to manager of restaurant hosting event. Hospitality Sales Manager works closely with all restaurant managers and chefs, compiling accurate and detailed Banquet Event Orders within department timeline parameters. Must be able to post event reconciliation and perform light accounting.  All duties are to be performed in accordance with departmental, property, and corporate policies, practices, and procedures.  Essential Job Functions Effectively partners with business associates of Caesars Entertainment to fulfill client needs including lodging, F&B and event accommodations Maintains efficient and detail-oriented reporting of client/guest trip and function information Practices proper guest relations; meets guest relations standards Courteous and timely telephone/email etiquette; ensures that all guest inquiries have a response within 24-48 hours Proactively reach out to repeat guests and clients to drive incremental bookings Remains informed of current property, entertainment, restaurant and lounge information Has flexible hours and be able to meet and greet clients at arrival of event when necessary Complete task(s) as assigned by Senior Sales Manager, Director or Vice President Assist in site selections of Food and Beverage Group Events and attend site inspections, tastings and pre-con meetings Suggestively sell menus, entertainment and décor for Group Events Sell events, write menus and Banquet Event Orders, enter data into programs including Salesforce, GuestCenter and Tripleseat, distribute bookings to management/culinary teams, etc. Ensure flawless communication of event/trip details Communicate with room managers, chefs and sommeliers to review selections and special requests Attend departmental meetings Organize groups, as assigned to them Adheres to each restaurants’ set of rules and parameters Required  QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s degree in Hotel Management, Business, or related field or equivalent education and experience. At least 3 years’ experience in Hotel Operations, Sales, Food and Beverage, and/or Restaurant Sales Must be proficient in Microsoft Office Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Professional and courteous phone etiquette. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, critical thinking and decision-making skills. Must have a flexible schedule/ability to work nights and weekends as required Work varied shifts, including weekends and holidays Able to effectively communicate in English in both written and oral forms. Preferred Previous experience in LMS, Salesforce, Guest Center, and Tripleseat Physical, Mental And Environmental Demands Must be able to work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends. Must be able to handle a heavy business volume, and sensitive situations relating to team member, candidate, and guest problems, in a timely manner. Must be able to tolerate areas containing secondhand smoke. Must be able to lift and carry 10 pounds. Must be able to bend, crouch, kneel, twist and work at a desk/counter when performing functions of the job. Respond to visual and aural cues. Must have manual dexterity to operate all office equipment. Must be able to maneuver around office and property. Given the demands listed above, this candidate must be able to tolerate areas containing secondary smoke, handle more than one function (or one customer) at a time by being well organized while producing accurate and error free results. Also given the demands listed above, our candidate must be adept at using a personal computer, phones, copier, and PDA. Information Provided By  DIRECTLY SUPERVISES (PLEASE LIST POSITION TITLES ):  Flsa  Exempt (Salary): Non-Exempt (Hourly):  Property Code  Multi-Property: Dual Rate:  Bonus Plan: MGNT CSA Other SALES  License(s) Type: None  EEOC Code  About Us  Caesars Entertainment is the world's most geographically diversified casino-entertainment company. Since its beginning in Reno, Nevada, more than 75 years ago, Caesars has grown into a family of affiliated resort casinos on four continents. Caesars-affiliated casino resorts operate primarily under the Harrah's®, Caesars® and Horseshoe® brand names. Affiliates of Caesars also own the World Series of Poker® and the London Clubs International family of casinos. The Caesars Entertainment family’s success is a result of an unblinking focus of building loyalty and value with guests through a unique combination of great service, excellent products, unsurpassed distribution, operational excellence and technology leadership. Caesars and its affiliates are committed to environmental sustainability and energy conservation and recognize the importance of being a responsible steward of the environment.  Team members of the Caesars family of resort casinos are driven by our Mission, Vision, and Values. We take great pride in living our values Integrity, Service with Passion, Celebrating Success, Diversity, Caring Culture, and Ownership every day. Our mission “We inspire grown-ups to play” fuels our passion for an exciting guest experience and a rewarding career. If you have the desire to create memorable experiences, personalize rewards and delight every guest, every team member every time, we invite you to explore our dynamic yet unique career opportunities.  Caesars Entertainment will engage in an interactive process and make reasonable accommodations, as required by law, for individuals with disabilities or to accommodate pregnancy, pregnancy-related conditions, or where a conflict exists between the position and an individuals’ religious beliefs or practices.  The below statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed in this position. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of the position.  The Company reserves the right to make changes to the job description whenever necessary.  As a part of the new hire process, finalist candidates will be required to complete a drug test and background check prior to an offer being extended, except where applicable law requires that such pre-employment screening occur post-offer. The Company is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate against employees or applicants based on race, color, national origin, sex, age over 40, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Joining our team comes with perks! Now offering a $1,000 Sign On Bonus for this position. Bonus pays $1,000 after 90 days on payroll.  At AT&T, we’re bringing the world together with innovative technology solutions. We’re pushing the limits of what’s possible and driving groundbreaking innovation every single day. Our National Business Sales team is redefining the landscape for our customers by offering customized business solutions from cybersecurity, wireless, cloud, IOT and more.  As a Mid-Market Sales Executive on our National Business Sales team, you'll focus on mid-market businesses selling customized mobility business solutions in a defined territory. Using a combination of cold calling and consultative selling skills, you’ll close complex sales, generate new sales and develop strategic initiatives to grow and retain revenue streams. Success in this role will require you to take on responsibility for everything from the initial account relationship to meeting revenue objectives and performance metrics.  In this role, you’ll also: •  Develop new accounts, while maintaining and growing existing accounts •  Partner with prospective clients to understand business needs, issues, strategies, and priorities and deliver value-added business solutions that meet a wide variety of customers’ needs •  Build and develop networks to share information and cultivate prospects •  Develop responses to Request for Proposals and participate in presenting products and services •  Leverage industry knowledge and applications in order to find and close opportunities identify key trends and customer needs  Experience: •  5 - 8+ years experience in B2B sales in an outside or direct sales environment •  Experience selling business telecommunications and/or technology solutions direct to mid-market, mid-size or enterprise businesses is preferred •  Demonstrated success and sustained record of meeting and exceeding sales goals/quotas  Required Qualifications: •  Valid driver's license with satisfactory driving record •  Current auto insurance •  Reliable vehicle per transportation needs of market Changing the speed of business comes with many rewards – starting with your paycheck. We offer a competitive base pay plus commission with the ability to earn additional compensation based on meeting or exceeding sales quotas. We also provide paid-training and the career resources you’ll need to hit the ground running.  Once you’re a part of the team, you’ll also gain some amazing perks and benefits including paid time off on top of paid holidays, medical/dental coverage, a 401(k) plan and tuition reimbursement. We also provide employee discounts on: •  AT&T Wireless plans & features, including IOT and connected devices •  AT&T internet & fiber •  AT&T phone •  AT&T TV (including free HBO Max), DIRECTV (including Free HBO & NFL Sunday Ticket) or U-verse TV  Ready to close the deal on a career with AT&T? Apply today.

Description  The Specialty Sales Coordinator is responsible for facilitating Specialty Sales Operations Representatives administrative, technical and sales support. This position serves as the first touch of the Dealer Services Phone line, necessitating excellent interpersonal skills. This position will work closely in collaboration with the Specialty Sales Manager and Sales Ops Representatives to facilitate the BD order book in a timely and professional manner in regards to both day-to-day and seasonal aspects.  At BD, benefits begin on the first of the month following your date of hire with a generous portion of medical and dental paid for by BD. You also will get employer paid life insurance, Short and Long Term Disability, as well as other wellness benefits, 401k, vacation and wellness time off, paid parent time, paid volunteer days, and company paid holidays. If that isn't enough, we are also a pet-friendly workplace with a casual dress code! If your passions are also in the outdoors, then you will also enjoy employee discounts on BD gear and apparel.  Requirements  Required Qualifications: Highschool diploma or GED Two (2) to four (4) years of college education (preferred) One (1) plus years of experience in retail and/or wholesale sales in outdoor specialty We Will Count On You To Maintain Dealer Services Workgroup phone line. Including but not limited to; greeting customers and transferring to the appropriate in-house representative, communicating order and product status, new dealer requests and RA tracking Build customer relationships as it pertains to the Sales Operations functions of order related details such as timing, availability, backorder management, PO adjustments, overall account performance, and identifying areas of opportunity. Authorized to answer incoming dealer calls and make outgoing calls to customers. Responsible to report problems and recommend solutions to the Specialty Sales Manager. Authorized and responsible to issue Return Authorizations for any restockable product in accordance with the guidelines set forth in the ISO Returns Procedure. Responsible for obtaining the Specialty Sales Manager & Field Sales Manager’s approval for other returns (i.e.: overstocking and large order cancellations). Authorized to collaborate with regional sales representatives/ sales management as needed to provide the best possible customer experience. Including completion of pre-season product worksheets and facilitating pre-season order revision requests Responsible for importing and distributing all Specialty Retail orders into the internal ERP. Seasonal imports of pre-season orders as well as forecast and ASAP order submissions. Responsible for maintaining New Dealer Requests, Front Desk Fax inboxes, Internal Package Delivery Notifications and maintaining the office supply cabinet Drive account communication in conjunction with NA Sales Coordinator on items that are one month late, SKU swap execution and notifications to internal contacts for account communication Responsible for assisting in territory coverage, order book management and order processing when Sales Ops Representatives are out of office or utilizing paid time off. ADP is hiring a Sales Representative, Human Resources Outsourcing (HRO).   Are you motivated by always progressing and achieving more? Does the thought of winning sales, driving a business forward, and achieving serious results bring you a crazy amount of excitement? Are you ready to step out of your comfort zone to overcome challenges, think dynamically, and take risks that help you and your clients accomplish greatness?   YES? You might be just the person we’re looking for!  First, let’s tell you more about ADP. We believe great companies are built by great people – and for them. Every day we strive to design a better way to work helping employees at organizations around the world to stay productive and achieve their potential. We’re always designing for people, starting right here with our one-of-a-kind culture, and with people like you.   As a strategic Sales Representative in our Human Resources Outsourcing division, you’ll close sales and win new business within a defined territory. You’ll join a champion sales team with years of double-digit growth. (We don’t mean to brag, but we are pretty awesome here.) With a little help from our top-notch training, you’ll work with both new and existing clients to sell solutions that make the workplace better for millions of workers across the hire-to-retire spectrum.   Does this sound like you? Entrepreneurial Spirit. A dreamer and a doer who is optimistic about possibilities, passionate about seeing your vision come to life, and takes thoughtful risks to get there. People Person. A relationship builder who connects with people and values friendship and fun. Fearless. Embraces challenges and knows no boundaries. Trusted Advisor. Lives integrity and delivers on promises … every time.   WHAT YOU’LL DO: Responsibilities Drive Our Business Forward Work within a defined geographic territory to close sales, win business, and reach sales goals. It’s that simple.   Turn Prospects into Loyal Clients and Raving Fans Close sales by recommending the right solutions to help our clients understand the real needs of their business. Earn referral business by networking with existing and soon-to-be clients, and forging partnerships in-person and over the phone with key decision makers at the C-level.   Collaborate Daily Connect with other ADP associates to build a network of internal partners. Collaborate daily to achieve sales together.     Enjoy Rewards and Bask in Recognition When you reach your goals and make a name for yourself at ADP, doors will open for advancement opportunities and industry-leading compensation, benefits, and even luxurious trips. #WheelsUp   EXPERIENCE YOU’LL NEED: Required Qualifications Two or more years of business-to-business sales experience (preferably field sales) within a results-driven environment BONUS POINTS FOR THESE: Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree Demonstrated cold calling sales ability, with assertive, positive and persistent style Excellent verbal and written communication skills, including with C-level executives Motivated, self-starter with effective time management skills Ability to work independently, as well as being a collaborative team member Experience with business-to-business sales, particularly at the executive level  YOU’LL LOVE WORKING HERE BECAUSE YOU CAN: ·       Make your mark. We want you to challenge things and are open to fresh ideas. ·       Find meaning. Feel good as you do work that accelerates progress for employees in organizations all over the world. ·       Be your healthiest. Best-in-class benefits that start on Day 1, because healthy associates are happy ones. ·       Balance work and personal time like a boss. Resources and flexibility to more easily integrate your work and your life. ·       Get paid to pay it forward. Company paid time off for volunteering for causes you care about.   Like what you hear? Then, what are you waiting for? Apply now!   We’re designing a better way to work, so you can achieve what you’re working for. Consistently named one of the ‘Most Admired Companies’ by FORTUNE® Magazine, and recognized by DiversityInc® as one of the ‘Top 50 Companies for Diversity,’ ADP works with more than 740,000 organizations across the globe to help their people work smarter, embrace new challenges, and unleash their talent. “Always Designing for People” means we’re creating platforms that will transform how great work gets done, so together we can unlock a world of opportunity.   At ADP, we believe that diversity fuels innovation. ADP is committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of race, color, genetic information, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, lawful alien status, national origin, age, marital status, or protected veteran status. We support an inclusive workplace where associates excel based on personal merit, qualifications, experience, ability, and job performance.

description: Qualifications: Ability to effectively work under pressure and meet challenging targets Positive attitude with a strong sense of accountability and ownership Excellent problem-solving skills and detail oriented to coordinate/follow up requests Demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks with shifting priorities and tight deadlines in fast pace environment Strong written and oral communication skills to understand the needs of customers and internal stakeholders A team player with the ability to self-manage and flexibility for various tasks Preferred operation experience on distribution business  Duties/Responsibilities: Assist account manager/sales team to meet the performance target to provide an efficient and comprehensive service Support account manager/sales team in handling of inquiries, orders, issues, shipment, tracking, reports, and general follow up Works cross functionally with manufacturing and management teams and resolving issues timely as required Proactively interface with customers and serve as a point of main contact as request Coordinate sales related activities and maintain/monitor accurate data with efficiency Prepare sales operation reports and presentation materials as request Support sales administrative related functions Exercise creative thinking and apply experiences to improve processes as needed  Skills: Proficient in Microsoft Office applications, especially in Excel and PowerPoint, SAP Experience in B2B & distribution business model, tech industries preferred Previous experience supporting sales management preferred Bachelor degree required

Help Drive New Breakthroughs in Physics and Engineering At COMSOL, we develop our own simulation software and provide it to technology enterprises, government facilities, national labs, academic research facilities, and more. Our flagship product, COMSOL MultiphysicsÂ®, is used for simulating technical applications in almost all engineering industries and scientific disciplines. Users of the COMSOLÂ® software are distinguished engineers and scientists in their respective fields who require simulations to advance their research and innovation. This forward-thinking community of users works to invent and optimize the processes and products that impact the future of our world. COMSOL, Inc. is looking for a sales representative with, at least, some experience in Latin American sales who will further our business by identifying, initiating, progressing, and closing opportunities for both prospective and existing accounts. This position will involve close collaboration with COMSOL engineers, who are experts in the software and the fields of science where the software is used. Primary Responsibilities * Drive sales from initial contact to close via phone, web meetings * Increase and develop new accounts in Latin America and other U.S. states * Manage and grow existing accounts through account strategy, resource allocation, and customer service * Engage regularly with customers and prospects to understand their business needs and identify key influencers and decision makers, including purchasing agents and resellers * Understand and articulate the value of simulation software, especially the advantages of multiphysics simulation * Organize and participate in sales presentations and events; explain licensing models; create quotations; and discuss licensing terms and conditions with users, procurement specialists, and other customer personnel * Effectively collaborate with other team members, particularly in the engineering, marketing, licensing, and legal groups Minimum Qualifications * Associate's degree, or 4+ years of relevant sales experience in place of degree * Strong verbal and written communication skills * Ability and willingness to travel for limited times in order to run or assist in COMSOL-sponsored events in North and South America (<5%).  â€¢ Ability to work full-time from COMSOL's Burlington, MA office * Current eligibility to work in the U.S. Preferred Qualifications * Fluent in Spanish * Prior experience in Latin American B2B sales * Bachelor's degree in business, or engineering, physics, applied mathematics, or a physical science * Previous or current involvement with technology-based companies, research organizations, or technical academic institutions * Familiarity with customer relationship management (CRM) software Personal Growth As a member of COMSOL's dynamic sales team, your opportunities for personal growth and development will be extensive, as you collaborate with engineers, developers, and senior salespeople who have worked within the field of simulation software for many years. By interacting with customers and users of the COMSOLÂ® software, you will stand at the center of cutting-edge research and development in all manner of technical applications. Your contribution will lead to the adoption of technology that drives real change in our world today. Working at COMSOL The COMSOL Group is a fast-growing, high-tech engineering software company with a proven track record of success over 35 years. The Group was founded in Stockholm, Sweden, and has grown to include 20 offices in the U.S., Europe, Asia, and South America, while also utilizing a network of distributors. At COMSOL, Inc. we offer our employees: * Compensation commensurate with skills and experience * Health and 401(k) plans and other benefits * Generous vacation times * A spacious, bright, and comfortable office with private work spaces * A surrounding office park with on-site restaurants, hotels, bars, and a free fitness center with yoga and barre (https://www.districtburlington.com/) * Walking distance to many local restaurants, stores, amenities, and the Burlington Mall * An on-site shuttle service to Alewife Station and local bus routes to other locations throughout greater Boston COMSOL is an Affirmative Action/Equal Opportunity Employer. This is an in-office position.

Stripe builds the most powerful and flexible tools for running an internet business. We handle billions of dollars in transactions each year and power hundreds of thousands of businesses—from startups to Fortune 100s—in almost every country around the world. From developers and product managers to founders and CFOs, a broad audience interacts with Stripe’s products and uses them to start, run, and scale their companies. Removing the barriers to online commerce helps more new businesses get started, expedites growth for existing companies, and increases economic output and trade globally.  We are looking for a Strategy & Operations Lead to join our Revenue Operations team, specifically supporting the GTM Partner function as a strategic, operations, and analytics partner. We are looking for someone who is not only a builder at heart, but also ready to dig into operational and performance processes, systems, and data to assess current performance, identify improvement opportunities, and improve efficiency. The ideal candidate will have significant experience: (1) scaling a partner sales org, (2) contributing to the growth and development of a sales operations team, (3) dealing with ambiguity and operating in a fast-growing environment, and (4) superior communication skills to drive collaboration with peers and support senior stakeholders.  You Will Collaborate with our Head of GTM Partnerships and GTM Partner Sales Ops to scale the business, while driving alignment with your Sales Ops peers and the rest of the Sales leadership organization to make sure the plans are aligned with regional and functional priorities Conduct and enable regular business reviews and resource planning Develop and execute initiatives designed to optimize sales team efficiency and productivity Create and manage operational processes such as target setting, forecasting, and budgeting Champion the operational and reporting needs of the organization by defining and prioritizing requirements while working closely with cross functional partners to identify solutions Monitor and report key performance indicators (KPIs), trends, and deliver prescriptive recommendations to drive efficiencies and scale across the org Proactively resolve data quality, process, and policy adherence issues Oversee implementation of enabling systems and tools, working closely with internal systems teams We’re Looking For Someone Who Has 8+ years of sales operations experience in a similar industry Familiarity with SFDC Understanding of the sales cycle and previous exposure to a GTM Partner or Alliances & Channels Sales orgs A passion for understanding systems of work, how to build them and how to improve them through both transformative and iterative approaches Strong problem solving and analytical ability, with a track record of “test & learn” demeanor Ability to multi-task and work in cross-functional, fast-paced environments with the pressure of multiple deadlines, multiple partners / vendors, and complexity Experience and desire for working in a start-up environment, developing business infrastructure, and energetically scaling a high-growth business Has strong analytical skills and a structured approach to solving unique business problems Nice To Haves Prior experience at a growth stage Internet or software company Experience working cross-functionally with sales teams and KPIs _SB6

description: One of our direct clients is hiring for a Sales Support. Details are as follows:   Job Title: Business Development Specialist  Job Duration: 11+ Months  Location: Newtown Square, PA Fresh graduates with a major in Marketing, Sales, Business or related fields can apply.   Job Description: The Business Development Specialist is responsible for running predefined outbound telemarketing campaigns, through cold calling and emailing, to generate top of the funnel opportunities for our Customer Experience LOB in North America. Business Development Specialist will receive high level training to develop an elevator pitch and engage and attract targeted customers. The Business Development Specialist will have access to contact details for accounts they are assigned to via a database.  • Responsible for the development and execution of new Demand Generation strategies for the Customer Experience line of business. • Works in close collaboration with the Customer Experience Accounts Executives, as well as company's peer cloud lines of business and industry Demand Management Executives to drive new and incremental pipeline or sales qualified leads and opportunities for the Customer Experience solutions portfolio • Assess target markets and accounts, identify prospects and conduct intelligence gathering to identify the best possible communication strategy to maximize chances to attract prospects’ interest and create an early sales relationship with them. • Help position our competitive advantage for prospects to leverage the Customer Experience solutions to drive customer business outcomes. • Align work streams with prospects and Customer Experience Account Executives to develop and coordinate a unified demand generation framework. • Demand Generation plan development, documentation, and communication, ensuring transparency to all stakeholders. • Make use of best practices to create repeatable demand generation successes. • Participate in, organize and support strategic and innovating Demand Generation initiatives or projects with moderate supervision, as directed by management.  Requirements: Recent graduate with a Bachelor's degree in Sales OR Must have 1-2 years of verified successful sales experience in the technology industry.

Global Industrial  Corporate Overview  For over 70 years Global Industrial has been an industry leader providing private label and brand name industrial equipment and supplies to businesses throughout North America.  We carry over one million industrial, material handling and business products that are sold through our website, corporate sales people and full color catalogs. We are constantly increasing our product offerings to meet the diverse and changing needs of our customers. Our customers include small to large corporations, institutions, government agencies and consumers across North America.  Key Responsibilities  This position is responsible for the growth of the New York and New Jersey inside sales branches. The sales teams are comprised of 5 Sales Managers and over 100 territory sales account representatives and specialists in NY and NJ. This leader is accountable for achieving sales goals through identified core business objectives, sales strategies and collaboration of business partners. This role provides clear direction and leadership to all associates, while maintaining a "Best in Class" culture.  Essential Duties And Responsibilities Provides quality leadership and vision for internal business objectives. Provide quality leadership and vision for internal business objectives. Provide leadership in change management methodology throughout customer's organization. Facilitates staff meetings, trainings, problem solving activities, creative improvement activities, while inspiring others. Proven ability to achieve corporate revenue and profitability quotas. Sets performance standards to meet service goals and objectives of the company. Proven ability to achieve corporate revenue and profitability quotas. Sets performance standards to meet outlined goals and objectives of the company. Manage a full sales cycle function including: customer contact, solutions based selling, needs identification, demonstration, proposal development and closing. Drives the management team to measure team performance and structure appropriate training and development. Ability to analyze solutions (problem solving skills). Judgment and decision-making ability. Collaborate with peers and internal business partners. Sets direction and standards relative to performance, coaching, mentoring, hiring and career development. Routinely conduct performance appraisals. Prepares and deliver financial based sales presentations and KPI trends to ensure success. Prepare and submit proactive unsolicited proposals to drive compliance toward GI while aligning with customer business objectives. Aligns team members' activities to meet customer strategic initiatives balanced against the needs of GI shareholders. Works closely with local sales leadership teams to align resources and sales efforts. Review and monitor growth trends across client base and in individual accounts to maximize account penetration by identifying additional selling opportunities. Develop clear strategies and tactics to convert business for accounts with competing MRO suppliers: specifically identify and communicate GI differentiators. Coordinate with Regional Sales Vice President to develop strategic sales plans and execute stated goals. Competencies and skills BA/BS Degree with a minimum 8 years' related experience with progressive managerial responsibilities. Proven success in leading managers with high performance teams in a metrics-based environment, while achieving results through others. Experience with revenue responsibility of $50-100 million annually. Ability to train, coach, motivate and excite the sales team. Ability to travel between NY and NJ office (50% travel requirement). Excellent oral/written communication, presentation, negotiation, organizational skills. Knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word, Access. EEO/AA Statement  Global Industrial provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.  This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.  Nearest Major Market: Long Island  Nearest Secondary Market: New York City

Neptune Society is looking for an innovative sales leader to join our growing team. Here you can excel and earn at your true potential when you develop a successful sales team that is able to positively impact the lives of others.  Voted a Great Place to Work 3 years in a row! We are the largest sales and marketing company in pre-arranged cremation services. With over 50 years in the industry, we help over 80,000 families pre-plan each year.  The undisputed industry leader, we spend millions of dollars every year providing our sales team with qualified leads. Our Product represents a tremendous value, and our travel plan ensures peace of mind wherever our customers travel around the world. There is an increased awareness regarding the importance of preplanning, and we expect this to increase exponentially in the future.  The ideal candidate is a professional, results-oriented manager, who will recruit, train and develop a top-notch sales force. Train team members to conduct virtual and in-person presentations. He/she must meet our high standard of service quality and ethics, and stimulate business growth through innovative market strategies.  Qualified candidates will demonstrate strong communication skills and be able to inspire a sales team from a virtual platform as needed, to close leads that are provided at no cost.  We offer a generous compensation opportunity, a comprehensive benefits package including 401(k) with company match, formal corporate and field training, and long term career path development. This is an excellent opportunity to work in a growing industry where you can stand out and be recognized for your accomplishments.  If you are a hard worker with a proven track record of success, and if it is time to find your 'WHY', please contact us to learn more.  Service Corporation International is proud to be North America’s leading provider of funeral, cremation and cemetery services.  Since 1962, SCI has been serving families during their most difficult, personal and challenging times.  Today, we are the company that more than 450,000 families turn to each year for compassionate and professional care.  At Neptune Society, a division of Service Corporation International, our mission is to provide peace of mind  through the end of life planning with a customer-centric workplace that provides families with dignified and affordable cremations services.  Neptune Society is the largest provider of affordable cremation services in the U.S.  With more than 40 locations nationwide, Neptune serves more than 100,000 people each year and has become the respected provider for those choosing cremation.  Neptune Society is a California-based cremation society, providing respected, dignified, cremation services from five California locations.

description: KNWA, FOX24 & KXNW, Nexstar Media Group, Inc. owned NBC, FOX and My Net affiliates in beautiful Northwest Arkansas market, has an incredible opportunity for you! We are looking for a dynamic sales professional to join our phenomenal sales team. The ideal candidate will bring both Broadcast and Digital sales experience and will possess the drive and ability to thrive in a highly competitive market. Your creativity, originality and passion for developing new business and digital will be rewarded!  Northwest Arkansas is a rapidly growing and vibrant community filled with rolling hills, rivers, lakes and Fortune 500 company headquarters. Many high-end business industries call NWA home, and they bring in some of the best talent in their fields. Cost of living is low, and quality of life is high. Add in our world-class museums, performing arts centers, major sporting venues, amazing concerts, fantastic foodie destinations and tons of community-centric events, and Northwest Arkansas can’t be beat!  If interested, email resume and references to Sarah Noblin, Director of Sales @ snoblin@knwa.com.  Implements strategies to consistently grow revenue and exceed revenue goals. Establishes credible relationships with local business community. Makes sales calls on existing and prospective clients. Maintains assigned accounts and develops new accounts. Prepares and delivers sales presentations to clients. Explains to customers how specific types of advertising will help promote their products or services in the most effective way possible. Provides clients with information regarding rates for advertising placement in all media. Develops advertising schedules with clients and station personnel responsible for placing advertising into station media. Works with clients and station personnel to develop advertisements. Performs other duties as assigned.  Requirements & Skills: Bachelor’s degree in Marketing, Advertising or Mass Communications, or a related field, or an equivalent combination of education and work-related experience. Minimum one year’s experience in sales, preferably in the media field. Valid driver’s license with an acceptable driving record. Experience achieving long-range objectives and implementing the strategies and actions to achieve them. Proficiency with computers, telephones, copiers, scanners, fax machines and other office equipment.

Liquid Payments, Inc., a patient payment technology solutions company, is hiring Sales Representatives for the Denver, Phoenix, and Dallas territories.  OPPORTUNITY: As our Direct Sales Representative, you are a hunter, closing new business, for our innovative, fast-growing technology company disrupting the healthcare payments space. Your experience selling technology solutions will propel your success in closing deals with medical, dental, and veterinary practices. As a highly organized problem-solver with excellent communication and follow up skills, you will build and sustain customer relationships and increase sales. This is primarily an inside sales role with leads provided across the US, emphasis on West Coast, from channel partner companies, along with your own direct prospecting.  Reporting to the VP of Sales, the income potential is exceptional as you will earn both commissions and recurring income on renewal sales within your accounts. As your accounts renew and grow, your income grows. You will receive the technical product training you need to excel. As you continuously build your technical product expertise, your sales success will reach new heights.  KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES: Review and pursue inbound warm leads from channel partner companies to determine quality and opportunity.  Build and develop a client base through prospecting, cold calling, and relationship building. Identify and target prospective customers, initiate action plan and secure new business. Prospect effectively utilizing phone and email outreach campaigns. Nurture referral sources and distribution channels to generate opportunities and close deals. Conduct virtual software demos and educate customer on capabilities. Focus on the continued development and market penetration of our suite of solutions. Plan, coordinate, and participate in trade shows and events. Maintain and advance knowledge of solutions offered by Liquid Payments, Inc. Assist in customer implementations, onsite or remotely, as needed.  SUCCESS FACTORS: Highly motivated, self-starter who hungers to excel in accomplishments and earnings. 3+ years of sales experience developing new business with a demonstrated track record of closing deals. Prefer background in solution / technology sales in healthcare. Payment merchant processing is a plus. Experience selling into medical, dental, or veterinary practices is helpful. Thrives in a collaborative, fast-growing entrepreneurial environment. Bachelor’s Degree in business or technology is preferred. Commitment to build strong relationships with clients and referral sources. Well organized to work a disciplined sales plan. Able to travel as needed to visit customers, prospects, attend events, and company meetings.  COMPENSATION & BENEFITS: Liquid Payments, Inc. will reward your sales talents with an attractive compensation plan that includes a base salary plus an uncapped commission plan. Sales reps average $75K-90K+ in year one, with income growing through new business and renewals. By year three, by continuing to add new customers, and renewals from existing customers you should expect to earn $125-140K+. You will work primarily from your home office, with limited travel. As an early stage company there is significant opportunity for professional growth and advancement.  APPLY NOW: If you are a proven sales performer who is adept at prospecting, virtual demos and closing deals, we encourage you to apply online now.   COMPANY: Liquid Payments is a payments technology innovator applying the latest payment technologies to the healthcare space. We possess the executive leadership and software development talent that delivers software solutions that enable our clients to increase revenue, reduce costs, and connect with patients. We currently have solutions deployed in multiple medical payments sectors including healthcare cost-sharing entities and healthcare practices and are currently working on various applications of AI. We are a financially sound, debt free company that is not dependent on a round of funding to fuel our anticipated 30-40% growth in 2022.   For more information please visit www.liquid-payments.com or www.liquid-lending.com  Erin Harris, HR Consultant Safari Solutions Search38@safarisolutions.com   Sales / business development / outside sales / territory manager / technology / technical sales / sales representative / account executive / account manager / medical sales / regional sales / healthcare sales / veterinary / merchant processor / patient payment / virtual sales
