description: We're transforming the grocery industry  Instacart is the North American leader in online grocery and one of the fastest-growing companies in e-commerce. Since 2012, we’ve been working towards creating a world where everyone has access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together.  Groceries delivered to your door in as little as an hour. It seems simple, right? Well, it’s more complex than that. From re-routing deliveries during snowstorms, to connecting customers with coupons and deals for their favorite brands, to updating over half a billion grocery data lines every night...our efforts bring Instacart closer to being the operating system for the grocery industry.  Overview  At Instacart we solve for the customer. That extends beyond the hundreds of thousands of consumers we deliver groceries to and includes many leading and emerging consumer packaged goods (CPG) advertisers that want to shape how consumers perceive, shop, and stay loyal to their brands. Instacart’s Brand Partnerships team is focused on serving these clients through our native advertising platform.  We are hiring a Sales Operations Manager who will support the Sales Capability & Strategy team in building and maintaining a holistic end-to-end sales management process inclusive of account segmentation & quota setting, territory development, and measuring team progress against goals. The role is highly cross-functional with engagement between sales leadership, company management, finance, and strategy. We’re continuing to scale at a fast pace and this integral role will really help in paving the way for continued success and implementing best-in-class scalable processes.  Your day to day… Manage and refine account segmentation and assist with territory management as well as quota setting process Track and analyze key performance metrics within Salesforce including pipeline growth, win/loss rates, and quota attainment Develop dashboards and reports utilizing Salesforce to track sales operations and cross-functional efficiencies, and identify areas for improvement Partnering with Business Analytics to create and maintain Salesforce forecasting models and data Conduct data analyses that will be used to inform strategic decisions You have... 5+ years of experience in a relevant field with demonstrated account segmentation success inclusive of setting sales quotas, ideally in a digital advertising landscape Ability to model data and plan for different scenarios Exposure to and understanding of digital advertising and digital advertising sales cycle Highly proficient in Excel or Google Sheets Proficient in Salesforce with experience building & maintaining reports and dashboards Strong written & verbal communication Excellent attention to detail, follow-through, and resourcefulness Ability to independently manage multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize responsibilities Ability to work cross-functionally with many teams and multi-tasks with a sense of urgency An interest in working in a fast-growing, fast-paced environment with changing responsibilities, and a willingness to lend a helping hand wherever it’s needed Nice to Have… Experience working closely with a distributed sales team Administrative experience with Xactly Certified Salesforce Admin Experience with Tableau or similar BI tools Accommodations & Accessibility  At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.
industries: Marketing and Advertising, Information Technology and Services, and Retail

description: The Diagnostic Sales Specialist (DSS) is responsible for effectively communicating and selling the benefits of the APTIMA product line, the ThinPrep Pap Test and adjunctive testing, and the ThinPrep Imaging System, to clinicians in an assigned geographic territory. Additionally, the DSS provides educational support to OB/GYNs and other clinical professionals in the office and hospital setting as well as strategic business planning and development for primary and secondary product lines.  Duties & Responsibilities: Meet and exceed sales goals and achieve maximum sales in assigned territory Accurately forecast and maintain an individual territory book of business in accordance with a 90-day quota for assigned and acquired products as required Achieve individual sales revenue quota on a quarterly and annual basis for assigned and acquired products as required Develop and execute business plans for targeted accounts. Complete a territory business analysis for management review on a quarterly basis Maintain ongoing business planning with customers in territory; this includes periodic business reviews with customer's financial departments, as well as sales planning with customer's sales department Effectively route plan and manage business for assigned territory Attend quarterly Plan of Action Meetings within district Periodically provide Rapid fFN Fetal Fibronectin in-services and training to laboratory personnel and Labor and Delivery Staff, per the territory needs of the local Strategic Account Manager (SAM) Perinatal Support territory sales goals by maintaining core ThinPrep Pap Test business (Account Executive's Primary Line of Business), increasing usage, and prospecting new customers Effectively sell Hologic's sales message to all customers in the targeted territory Effectively insulate accounts against competition and regaining lost customer accounts Maintain consistent and structured communication with Account Executive counterpart and articulate summarized communication to District Sales Manager on a periodic basis Integrate successfully into team selling environment by partnering sales efforts with Territory Manager and Account Executive, and other Hologic colleagues and laboratory partners Assist in generating leads for other Hologic products Manage time effectively; prioritize and make good business judgments and decisions in relationship to efficiency, effectiveness while meeting daily call expectations Partner with marketing department to support the development and execution of marketing programs and sales materials Attend local and national professional trade shows and events and promote products to all customers Update and sync all relevant customer account information into Hologic's Data Management System daily Perform other duties as required  Qualifications:  To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the basic knowledge, skills, and/or abilities required: Demonstrated track record of success and sales accomplishments Ability to sell in a consultative manner such that the customer need is discovered and addressed in an individualized clinical and data-driven manner Strong persuasiveness and influence skills required Ability to understand and articulate complex scientific literature and use extensive and complex clinical data as a key factor in the sales process. Familiarity with clinical and economic outcome data, reimbursement, and managed care policies and procedures  Education: Bachelor of Arts/Science from an accredited university required  Experience: Candidate must have a minimum of two years sales experience Medical background/sales experience, laboratory experience, and/or managed care knowledge desirable Business-to-business experience highly desired  Additional Details: Since this position requires extensive driving during the workday, a valid driving license and satisfactory driving record, as well as a serviceable vehicle available for work use is mandatory  Agency and Third Party Recruiter Notice: Agencies that submit a resume to Hologic must have a current executed Hologic Agency Agreement executed by a member of the Human Resource Department. In addition Agencies may only submit candidates to positions for which they have been invited to do so by a Hologic Recruiter. All resumes must be sent to the Hologic Recruiter under these terms or they will not be considered.  Hologic, Inc. is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer inclusive of disability and veterans.

Job Description  Sales Representative  Become one of our Sales Representatives by maximizing sales, effective planning and order-writing, as well as supporting and completing incidental activities such as merchandising, shelving and pricing, the Sales Representative acts a sales expert to retail stores and partnering up with nationally recognized customers such as Walmart, Pavillions, Stater Bros, Smart and Final, Target and more. Become an ambassador of world-famous brands like Oreo, Ritz, belVita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among other delicious industry-leading snacks.  As one of our Sales Representatives you develop and maintain a complete knowledge of Mondelēz International, primarily Nabisco products, sales systems, and procedures, including: Ensure Nabisco leading brands (Oreo, Ritz, Belvita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among others) are well represented, stocked and maintained through the implementation of Mondelēz’ guidelines. Sales objectives, campaigns and promotions, sales brochures and order guides, sales presentations, sources of product and distribution, maintaining schematics and uses, as well as proper merchandising. Perform in-store planning by tailoring programs and fact-based sales presentations to the customer's needs, store demographics, and the current consumer base to drive Mondelēz International and customer growth. Develop strong business relationships with store management to provide service and value beyond the customer's expectations. Work with customer to ensure sufficient product is ordered to support consumer take away, including from incremental racks and displays, for DSD. Communicate plans and effectively manage merchandising resources to build sales volume at store level. Work in conjunction with the Merchandiser to ensure inventory is fully stocked, always rotated and presentable; as well as properly credit and dispose of all unsalable merchandise from all stores. Monitor and report on competitive activity and document all pricing activities. Be a collaborator between our Customer Business teams and customer’s store management.  What you can expect from us:  This position offers a comprehensive medical, dental and vision benefit package, in addition to paid vacation, holidays, 401(k) match and Employee Assistance Program benefits. Along with a competitive compensation package, the Sales Representative position is eligible to participate in an incentive program. Mondelez International also offers a company vehicle, which includes a gas card and vehicle maintenance program.  Who is a good fit? Be at least 18 years of age, have a valid driver's license and proof of auto insurance High School Diploma or GED required, college degree highly preferred. Ability to perform hard work in a fast-paced work environment and to meet the defined physical activities like Repetitive lifting bending, and carrying up to 25 lbs., occasionally over 50 lbs., pushing & pulling over. This includes physically moving our products from the stock rooms and stocking the store’s shelves. Previous retail / grocery experience is a plus Be open to relocation, outside of region, and outside of state, as necessary. Willingness to perform merchandiser responsibilities, as needed. Live within 50 miles range from the primary location (Portland, OR) Schedule availability required: Mon - Fri Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, weproduce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country.  Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance.  Job Type RegularField SalesSales
industries: Food Production, Food & Beverages, and Consumer Goods

description: Company Overview:  Masterworks is a platform for investing in blue-chip, multi-million dollar artworks. The company, which is currently based in New York City, is profitable and rapidly scaling its operations. Masterworks currently has over 200,000 users signed up on its platform. “Contemporary” art (defined as art created after WWII) has appreciated at 14% per year for the past 25 years. Prior to Masterworks, only extremely wealthy investors were able to invest in multi-million dollar paintings.  Position Overview:  We are seeking an Inside Sales Manager to co-manage 25 sales reps with our VP of Sales Development (focused on coaching, call monitoring, call script optimization, etc.) on one of our “membership teams.”  Currently, all investors looking to join the Masterworks platform must sign-up and schedule a phone call with a sales representative. Each day, our membership team has 100+ scheduled meetings with potential investors to educate them on the asset class. Over the next several months, we would like to scale that by 2x scheduled meetings per day.  The successful candidate will possess leadership in inbound or outbound sales management to make our sales process more reliable and effective. These qualities include:  A long history of hiring, coaching, and firing of sales reps for inbound or outbound sales organizations. A “player-coach” mentality, sitting in on sales pitches for 2-3 hours a day with existing reps. Onboarding and offboarding reps over time. Monitoring all investor communications (phone, email, etc.) to make sure they are handled correctly with constant coaching and oversight. Constantly measuring metrics on a daily basis and holding the sales team accountable for maintaining and increasing activity levels. Creating and monitoring KPIs (calls, investments started, and other funnel metrics). Strong product knowledge with sales CRMs. Knowledge of Hubspot is a plus. Creating and optimizing commission plans to incent the right behaviors over time.  Team Overview:  The sales organization at Masterworks currently has 30-40 salespeople in various capacities. In order to sell securities, each rep must be licensed with a Series 7 or Series 63 under FINRA. For the right candidate, Masterworks is willing to work with them to obtain these necessary licenses. Requirements or Skill Sets: 5+ years of sales operations experience for an inbound or outbound sales organization. 5+ years of experience in working with sales CRM tools such as Salesforce, Hubspot, or others. Aggressive, analytical, and highly organized. Experience working for a start-up. Experience working with an investment platform is a plus. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Preferred:  Series 7 and 63. For the right candidate, Masterworks is willing to work with them to obtain these necessary licenses.  Compensation:  Compensation to be commensurate with experience level  Additional Requirements:  Must be eligible to work in the US - no exceptions. Must be able to work out of our NYC office
industries: Financial Services, Investment Management, and Capital Markets

description: Master Builders Solutions is a global brand of advanced chemical solutions for construction. Our comprehensive construction chemicals portfolio includes concrete admixtures, waterproofing solutions, concrete repair and protection solutions, performance grouts and performance flooring solutions. We offer advanced chemical solutions for new construction, maintenance, repair or renovation of structures. Our employees form a global community of construction chemicals experts that are passionate about solving our customers’ specific challenges at all stages of construction as well as throughout the lifecycle of the structure.  We constantly strive to solve tomorrow’s challenges through our talented people, sound science, innovation, and communication with our global partners. We provide new solutions to satisfy industry demand for specific structure strengths, while understanding the need for sustainability, and environmental consciousness.  About  We are passionate about providing our customers with solutions to enhance concrete performance by  Master Builders Solutions provides a complete portfolio of high-quality admixtures that improve the placing, pumping, finishing, and long-term performance of concrete. Developing innovative technologies in response to customer & Industry needs Providing product selection and specification guidance for admixture technologies Optimizing concrete mix designs for performance and sustainability Testing concrete in our world-class laboratories Providing technical expertise and troubleshooting We are looking to hire a Head of Sales – Admixture Systems to work in the Beachwood, OH office.  This is just a high-level overview of the role we need you fill for us  The Head of Sales – Admixture Systems (VP title) will be responsible for managing the entire sales organization for the Admixture Systems business line. This includes divisional sales managers, strategic account managers, business development managers, and the concrete technology support role. The position will be responsible for driving sales effectiveness and efficiencies through ongoing talent assessments and ensuring training to the competencies laid out in the Progression Promotion guidelines. Another key component of the role is to support the innovation process through collection of market needs and opportunities, as well as effective launches of new products and solutions. The Head of Sales will also be responsible for ensuring optimum value creation through proper price management and execution. The position shall also promote values of the Master Builders Solutions brand and offering within the industry and academic circles.  These skills and experiences will make you a good fit for this role  Knowledge and Experience B.S. in a construction related field desired 10+ years of demonstrated experience in managing a remote sales organization within the construction or related market sectors Broad knowledge of the concrete industry, including production methods, materials, sales channels, and typical customers Understanding of the construction chemicals business and the value drivers within the construction industry preferred Current or previous membership and participation in industry associations, such as the American Concrete Institute (ACI), the American Society for Testing and Materials (ASTM), the National Ready Mix Concrete Association (NRMCA), the Precast Concrete Institute (PCI), the National Concrete Masonry Association (NCMA), and related associations Understanding of the key drivers of the concrete construction industry Recognized person within the concrete construction industry Established relationships with key stakeholders within the industry Business leadership (P&L) experience preferred Experience with organizational transformations preferred Principal Responsibilities Lead the sales force to success, as measured by overall sales volume growth, sales per FTE, sales of value-added products (VAPs), and other metrics Serve as a key component of the AS Leadership Team, which sets the direction of the business line and supports profitable growth Support the yearly budgeting process and the strategic direction of the business line Mentor divisional, regional and area managers towards leadership positions Support succession planning for the entire sales organization Participate in the Concrete Industry Management programs, including interactions with principal institutions, as well as other academic institutions that support the industry Build relationships with key customers to ensure a sustainable admixture business Support the Request for Proposal (RFP) / tender process for key customers, ensuring a high rate of success in winning and retaining business Connects with other parts of the Master Builders Solutions Admixture Systems business globally to understand and implement best practices What we can offer you as an employee of Master Builder Solutions  The total rewards that you receive as a Master Builder Solutions employee go way beyond a paycheck. From competitive health and insurance plans, to robust retirement benefits that include company-matching contributions, to making sure you never stop learning, we believe investing in you is investing in our success. Working for a large, global organization, you’ll have a chance to grow professionally and personally, expand your network and build a rewarding and dynamic career.  Our work environment is very rewarding, in fact, second to none. Master Builders Solutions strongly supports employee involvement through collaborative thinking and teamwork, while ensuring the safest work environment for all. We reward our employees with a challenging work environment, continued enrichment through educational development, and lifelong learning. We want to empower our team mates to make the best decision possible based on their personal experiences We want our employees to take ownership of their roles and responsibilities We want everyone to take positive action towards a rewarding goal We want everyone to provide leadership to those around them regardless of their role within the company Come BUILD YOUR CAREER with Master Builders Solutions!  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status.  LOCATION: Beachwood, OH
industries: Electrical/Electronic Manufacturing, Information Technology and Services, and Machinery

description: Job Description  Sells Aetna benefits and services to producers or customers in the large group segment based in Colorado. Individual will cultivate strong, productive, and influential relationships with broker/consultants, customers and peers focusing on the larger or more complex accounts/prospects. Implement strategies necessary to attain sales objective in assigned areas. Manages complex negotiations, and position products, rates levels and expanded product portfolios to increase sales and maximize revenue. Manages the integration of client's and Aetna's internal organizations to meet client's installation needs and close the deal. Provides expertise in difficult renewals and collaborates with account management and underwriting for renewals on assigned book of business. Identifies various ways to partner with the client by drawing from entire spectrum of product line. Gains understanding of Aetna's full product array. Provides effective presentations to Aetna constituents.  Required Qualifications  Strong background in producer channel and direct to client selling ideally with 8+ year industry experience. Demonstrated history of successfully meeting or exceeding sales goals  COVID Requirements  COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement  CVS Health requires its Colleagues in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief that prevents them from being vaccinated. If you are vaccinated, you are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status within the first 30 days of your employment. For the two COVID-19 shot regimen, you will be required to provide proof of your second COVID-19 shot within the first 60 days of your employment. Failure to provide timely proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status will result in the termination of your employment with CVS Health. If you are unable to be fully vaccinated due to disability, medical condition, pregnancy, or religious belief, you will be required to apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 30 days of your employment in order to remain employed with CVS Health. As a part of this process, you will be required to provide information or documentation about the reason you cannot be vaccinated. If your request for an accommodation is not approved, then your employment may be terminated. Preferred Qualifications  Applicable state Life & Health producer license.  Education  Bachelors degree desired or equivalent work experience.  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

Wacom is seeking an energetic, results-oriented seller to focus on maximizing sales across Wacom’s product line through Enterprise and Key Education accounts. The ideal candidate will have proven prospecting, marketing building and account management experience. Prior knowledge of Wacom branded products is not necessary but a comfort level in presenting and demonstrating the products is a must.  The primary focus will be to grow B2B business in the Creative Enterprise and Education markets. Target customers are large accounts in the Animation, Gaming, Visual Effects, and Industrial Design fields as well as educational institutions.  Successful candidates need to be located in the Portland, OR metro area or willing to relocate.    What you will be doing: Achieve or exceed volume and revenue targets for the Northwest Region Generate net-new sales through new and existing accounts Develop and grow new relationships within the market Build and maintain a strong sales pipeline and forecast through prospecting, discovery calls and meetings Manage a “total office call”. They will know how to navigate relationships with IT Directors, Design/Art Directors, Artists, and Purchasing Departments Effectively manage and consistently improve on customer relationships to grow Wacom business Present and demonstrate Wacom’s product line to accounts Generate specific plans that recommend solutions and demonstrate an understanding of client objectives Generate quarterly plans that contribute to driving Wacom’s key initiatives  Skills you bring: 5+ years of corporate B2B field sales experience Proven track record of closing business and achieving sales targets in the tech industry. Ability to navigate large corporate customers and manage a long sales cycle Strong presentation, interpersonal, as well as written and verbal communication skills Self-starter with the ability to work both individually and cross-functionally with internal teams such as Sales, Marketing, Product Development, and Logistics to problem solve and drive results Proficiency in Excel, Word, and PowerPoint is a must Must have experience using a CRM tool. Knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics is a plus. Ability to travel up to 30% of the time within designated region Physical Requirements: Must be able to lift 50 pounds  Experience with any of the following is highly desirable: Selling into creative sectors Consumer electronics sales experience  Why work for Wacom? Wacom is the world’s leading manufacturer of pen tablets, interactive pen displays, and digital interface solutions. The advanced technology of Wacom’s intuitive input devices has been used to create some of the most exciting digital art, films, special effects, fashion and designs around the world and provides business and home users with their leading interface technology to express their personality.  With a passion for bringing best in class solutions to our customers, we offer a stellar work environment and an approach that supports work-life integration.  Through our core values of Listen, Connect, Grow Together, we strive to offer team members a balance between a fulfilling professional career and peace of mind with respect to their well-being. Our benefit package includes a variety of programs designed to support your health, your financial future and offer a safety net. Come and join our team and support our vision to bring people and technology closer together through digital pen, ink, and tablet technology.

Sales and Marketing  Broadleaf is a premier supplier of specialty meats. We import and distribute high quality meats to Food Service and Retail Operators. We are committed to delivering to our customers at a high level of standard and consistency. We seek individuals that are highly motivated, dependable, results oriented and operate with a high level of responsibility and integrity.   We are looking for a creative individual who would enjoy building a career that incorporates developing monthly marketing materials for our on-line customers, and a monthly newsletter for established, as well new customers. The position involves creating and building brand awareness, while incorporating sales of Broadleaf specialty premier proteins. Take advantage of this unique opportunity to work for a family owned company in business for over 30 years and growing! www.broadleafgame.com

Industrial Sales Manager, U.S.A. & Canada Company Introduction: Founded in 1929, Magaldi Group is the world’s leading manufacturer of steel belt conveyors to handle materials in severe conditions - including high temperature, abrasive and heavy materials - used in foundries, coal-fired power plants, steel mills, mineral processing plants, cement plants, waste-to-energy plants and solid-fuel power plants, with more than 1,500 installations worldwide.  Magaldi Group’s mission is to design, manufacture and market reliable, high quality systems which are able to provide environmentally sustainable industrial solutions worldwide. Based on its patented technologies, Magaldi produces highly automated systems able to reduce costs and achieve the highest level of quality in accordance with the principal standards. Its products are distributed worldwide through subsidiaries and licensees.  The Magaldi Group operates multiple production facilities in Italy along with sales, service and distribution facilities around the world including the USA, India, Australia, etc.  Find out more at www.magaldi.com.    Position Introduction: Magaldi Technologies, a subsidiary of Magaldi Power S.p.a., has a fantastic opportunity for an Industrial Sales Manager that will focus on Biomass, Waste to Energy, Steel, Primary Metals Manufacturing and Recycling. In this role, the individual’s focus will be to prospect new customers while nurturing current customer relationships in order to provide engineering advice and technical solutions along with feedback to the engineering department on new product ideas and needs. To be successful, applicants should have a good knowledge of all areas of the various plants, competitors, engineering design concepts, sales processes and business development activities. Working with experienced sales engineering support group, the candidate will guide the opportunity management to develop engineered solutions. This role is well suited to people who enjoy problem-solving, consultative selling, are organized, and enjoy prospecting and meeting new customers and representative management.    Position Title: Industrial Sales Manager, U.S.A. & Canada  Experience: 10+ years of Steel, Foundry or Biomass Industry and sales experience  Degree Preferred: Mechanical Engineering or similar preferred  CAD Capabilities: Not required, but a plus. Must be able to read engineered drawings  Travel: Approximately 40-60%  Location: Mid-West or Atlanta  Language Requirements: English  Direct Reports: NONE   Responsibilities:  1.     Project Review and Concept - work with new and potential customers to help develop and assess their needs in order to help the Magaldi Team design a winning solution. 2.     New Customer Development – Prospect new customers and introduce them to the company and its products. 3.     Build Relationships with new and existing Clients - attend meetings with customers and support firms to create a good rapport with them to fully understand their requirements and provide accurate solutions, as well as to provide them with progress updates along the way.  4.     Pipeline Management – Fill and manage projects through the opportunity pipeline in order to make and exceed established budgets.  5.     Budgeting –Responsible to help develop sales targets and provide regular forecasts.  6.     Industry Representation – Represent the company and industry meetings, trade shows and other functions, committees, etc. as needed. 7.     Marketing – Help develop content, support to marketing team requests, identify new products needs and help develop regular competitive analysis within the market.

JOB TITLE: MARKET SALES REPRESENTATIVE  Job Summary: The Market Sales Representative is a regular, full-time salaried outside sales position that is focused on growing both On- & Off-Premise accounts within a specified geographic area. The Market Sales Representative is responsible for maximizing the sales of Terrapin Beer Company brands to assigned accounts through effective planning, selling, merchandising and communication that enables the achievement of company and distributor objectives. The incumbent will report directly to the applicable Regional Sales Manager.  Duties And Responsibilities Develop and maintain strategic partnerships with assigned accounts within assigned area in order to develop preferred supplier status. Analyzes entire account base by visiting each account and identifying potential sales opportunities. Be thoroughly acquainted with every key decision maker or decision influencer within designated accounts. Execute fun and engaging brand interactions for assigned accounts and wholesalers through promotions and events. Responsible for attaining standards of performance goals by achieving the distribution, volume and activity goals as set by management. Understands and works with distributor management on inventory levels by being aware of current inventory and out of stock situations & by alerting management to possible fluctuations in demand. Prepares and delivers professional sales presentations to customers by balancing the companys priorities and customers needs. Ensures maximum brand visibility within accounts by maintaining account standards as determined by management and using effective & current point of sale materials when appropriate. Maintains professional relationships with all suppliers by participating in effective supplier work with sales calls and market blitzes. Remains informed of company activities and updates by attending and actively participating in weekly sales meetings. Responsible for providing accurate and timely communication to management of sales and market related issues affecting successful performance. Assist Regional Sales Manager in communicating brewery's objectives, policies, and procedures with distributor partners. Responsible for managing a personal and professional calendar, with particular attention to balancing multiple deadlines at any given time. Answers all client and distributor inquiries in accordance with company values and expectations. Performs other duties as assigned. Competencies  To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies to perform the essential functions of this position. Problem Solving - the individual identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner, gathers and analyzes information skillfully. Customer Service - the individual manages difficult customer situations, responds promptly to customer needs, solicits customer feedback to improve service, responds to requests for service and assistance and meets commitments. Planning/Organizing - the individual prioritizes and plans work activities and uses time efficiently. Quality Control - the individual demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness, monitors own work to ensure quality and applies feedback to improve performance. Quantity - meets productivity standards and completes work in a timely manner. Adaptability - the individual adapts to changes in the work environment, manages competing demands and is able to deal with frequent change, delays or unexpected events. Dependability - the individual is consistently at work and on time, follows instructions, responds to management direction and solicits feedback to improve performance. Safety & Security - the individual observes safety and security procedures and uses equipment and materials properly. Qualifications  Knowledge & Skills Requirements:  This position requires a 2-year degree in Marketing, Business, Management or a similar degree program with a minimum of 3 years' sales experience.  This position requires frequent travel and applicants must be able to lift up to 50 lbs. Must be able to work 8-10 hours shifts and be able to work varying shifts, including nights and weekends, that are dependent on operational business needs of the brewery.  This position requires being able to maintain business-like behavior during and after the consumption of alcohol during social events.  Other Requirements  At Terrapin Beer Company, the health and safety of our people is our number one priority. That's why all offers of employment in the U.S. where legally permitted are contingent on the candidate showing proof of being fully vaccinated against Covid 19 (currently one dose of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine or two doses of the Pfizer or Moderna vaccine) to pass the pre-employment requirements. Individuals with medical issues or religious beliefs or practices that prevent them from getting the vaccine may request an exemption from the vaccine requirement.  Candidates must have a clean driving record with no restrictions and a reliable source of transportation in line with the Terrapin Beer Company policy. Candidates must also acquire auto insurance coverage in line with the Terrapin Beer Company policy as a condition of employment and are expected to maintain such throughout the course of employment.  Terrapin Beer Company, LLC is a craft beer brewery located in Athens, Georgia dedicated to creating unique experiences through the passionate brewing of the finest-quality craft beers. Employee benefits include health, dental & vision insurance, paid vacation, sick leave and Parental Leave, 401(k) plan with a Company match and a rewarding environment based upon our culture, values and mission.  Terrapin Beer Company, LLC is an equal opportunity employer and will not tolerate discrimination against any employee or applicant seeking employment on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- * This description is not intended to be, nor should it be construed as an all-inclusive list of responsibilities, skills or working conditions associated with the position. It is intended to accurately reflect the activities and requirements of the position, but duties may be added, deleted, or modified as necessary. This description does not constitute a written or implied contract of employment. * ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Apply Now  Start Application  chevron_left  Sign In  Welcome ! Association Headquarters , a leader in Association Management, has a great opportunity for a seasoned sales representative as the Director of Sales. The Director of Sales is responsible for the overall execution of AH's proactive business development sales strategy. The scope of responsibility includes prospecting, research, lead qualification, relationship management, project/hybrid sales, engagement of other AH Executives in the sales process as needed and appropriate and sales collateral development.  This position is a member of AH's Business Development team and actively participates in the development of tools, programs and initiatives to create internal (AH employees) and external brand ambassadors (referral partners) that will ultimately extend the business development sales force to maximize lead generation and client acquisition efforts.  The Director of Sales reports to the VP of Sales and Consulting and will also work closely with the Sales and Consulting Project Manager as well as the AH Corporate MarCom team.  Essential Duties And Responsibilities Be a role model for the company culture Gain a thorough understanding of association management and AH’s services by interacting with and learning from AH department heads, segment leaders and staff on a regular basis. Create awareness, build relationships with decision makers of ideal client targets Attend relevant networking events Build and develop prospect lists Perform cold calls/emails that result in meetings set with AH subject matter experts Lead meetings with ideal project/hybrid client targets Perform the necessary follow up to move qualified prospects through conversion or to a "no" Maintain a customer service oriented, relationship-based approach with decision makers through active pre-proposal, proposal, and post-agreement engagement and conversations, research related to needs and background, and timely follow up and professional communications using a variety of mediums (email, phone, in person, etc.) Provide Project Manager with the information necessary to prepare all hybrid/project proposals and manage proposal review submission processes. Maintain and expand the annual calendar of events for business development purposes, by segment and service area Support marketing campaigns by doing timely follow up on all qualified party interest (web site visits, downloads, etc.) Use Salesforce and maintain accuracy in relevant sales records and reports. Coordinate lead generation efforts with rest of NBD team and maintain required pipeline reporting requirements Assist in refining AH's market positioning through tracking of most sought-after services and most frequently asked questions coming from the growing prospect pool (continuous feedback loop to marketing and other areas of the company) Participate in the creation of sales and marketing collateral in response to feedback from prospects Follow and uphold the documented corporate sales process; ensure best practices are being implemented across the board Support full-service sales opportunities as needed Develop and maintain proposal content in the proposal management software (Loopio) as needed Ensure that business development tools and templates are cataloged and up-to-date in a central repository Look for, recommend and implement changes to existing sales processes to increase win ratio. Present to volunteer boards, CEO and other decision makers Manage the complexity associated with a long sales cycle with multiple influencers MEASUREMENT OF SUCCESS  Measuring Performance Achieving annual sales and prospecting targets Lead generation/acquisition on annual, quarterly, monthly and weekly basis Lead qualification (ensure that leads meet AH’s established ideal client profile and profitability goals) Number of sales calls made by month, by week Number of calls that result in opportunities, proposals and wins Managing AH's pipeline growth, conversion rates, win-loss ratio, etc. Management of AH NBD Salesforce (AH's CRM software) Overseeing all hybrid and project relationships throughout sales funnel (prospecting – close) Increasing revenue via new hybrid and project opportunities and support agreements Department head feedback on performance (i.e. preparedness, completeness of information provided, communication, facilitation of sales calls) Qualifications  The ideal candidate will be an experienced sales professional, with either an understanding of association management or the ability to learn quickly. They will be a problem solver that can easily connect the dots between prospect needs and AH solutions, and effectively communicate that message to prospects. They will be confident and comfortable picking up the phone to outreach to warm and cold leads. They will be great at relationship building and customer service, and provide timely, professional communication to both prospects and internal subject matter experts. They will also be a team player and work collaboratively to constantly improve our processes, messaging, and results.  Education/Experience/Required Proficiencies  Sales experience required, and association management experience strongly preferred.  In accordance with Association Headquarters' commitment to provide and maintain a workplace that is free of known and preventable hazards to safeguard the health of employees and their families, clients, and affiliates, all employees are required to receive the COVID-19 vaccination unless a reasonable accommodation is approved (i.e.: serious health risks or sincere religious beliefs). Such accommodations will be granted where they do not cause AH undue hardship or pose a direct threat to the health and safety of others.  APPLICATION INSTRUCTIONS  To be considered for this position, the online application must be submitted, along with an updated resume. All applicable fields on the application are required.  AH utilizes Spark Hire, a video interview software, to gain better insight into our candidates. Please use the below link to submit your video interview for review. description: Job Description  Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Are you ready to make it happen at Mondelēz International?  Sales Representative  Become one of our Sales Representatives by maximizing sales, effective planning and order-writing, as well as supporting and completing incidental activities such as merchandising, shelving and pricing, the Sales Representative acts a sales expert to retail store s and partnering up with nationally recognized customers such as Walmart, Pavillions , Stater Bros, Smart and Final, Target and more. Become an ambassador of world-famous brands like Oreo, Ritz, belVita , Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among other delicious industry-leading snacks.  As one of our Sales Representatives you develop and maintain a complete knowledge of Mondelēz International, primarily Nabisco products, sales systems, and procedures, including: Ensure Nabisco leading brands (Oreo, Ritz, Belvita , Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among others) are well represented, stocked and maintained through the implementation of Mondelēz’ guidelines. Sales objectives, campaigns and promotions, sales brochures and order guides, sales presentations, sources of product and distribution, maintaining schematics and uses, a s well as proper merchandising. Perform in-store planning by tailoring programs and fact-based sales presentations to the customer's needs, store demographics, and the current consumer base to drive Mondelēz International and customer growth. Develop strong business relationships with store management to provide service and value beyond the customer's expectations. Work with customer to ensure sufficient product is ordered to support consumer take away, including from incremental racks and displays, for DSD. Communicate plans and effectively manage merchandising resources to build sales volume at store level. Work in conjunction with the Merchandiser to ensure inventory is fully stocked, always rotated and presentable ; as well as p roperly credit and dispose of all unsalable merchandise from all stores. Monitor and report on competitive activity and document all pricing activities. Be a collaborator between our Customer Business teams and customer’s store management.  What you can expect from us:  This position offers a comprehensive medical, dental and vision benefit package, in addition to paid vacation, holidays, 401(k) match and Employee Assistance Program benefits. Along with a competitive compensation package, the Sales Representative position is eligible to participate in an incentive program. Mondelez International also offers a company vehicle, which includes a gas card and vehicle maintenance program.  Who is a good fit? Be at least 18 years of age, have a valid driver's license and proof of auto insurance High School Diploma or GED required, c ollege degree highly preferred . Ability to perform hard work in a fast-paced work environment and to meet the defined physical activities like Repetitive lifting bending, and carrying up to 25 lbs., occasionally over 50 lbs., pushing & pulling over. This includes physically moving our products from the stock rooms and stocking the store’s shelves. Previous retail / grocery experience is a plus Be open to relocation, outside of region, and outside of state, as necessary. Willingness to perform merchandiser responsibilities, as needed. Live within 50 miles range from the primary location (San Diego, CA) Schedule availability required: Monday through Friday (starting at 5:00am)  Secondary Location : Clairemont, Pacific Beach, La Jolla, Tierrasanta  No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, weproduce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country.  Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance.  Job Type RegularField SalesSales
industries: Food Production, Food & Beverages, and Consumer Goods

jobTitle: Sales, Sales Specialist - Interventional X-Ray, IGT Systems (NY/NJ)
description: If you are a Colorado resident and this role is a field-based or remote role, you may be eligible to receive additional information about the compensation and benefits for this role, which we will provide upon request.  You may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.  Sales, Sales Specialist – IGT Systems  In this role, you have the opportunity to: The IGT Sales Specialist owns business development in the territory by uncovering and posting opportunities, developing competitive positioning, and owning quote creation, customer concerns, and change orders; partners with Account Executives / Account Managers (AE/AM) to qualify opportunities, design and present winning solutions, and develop business analysis and forecasts; co-owns, with District Sales Leaders (DSL), achieving business goals and forecasting for the territory.  You are responsible for the following: Partner with AM/AEs, using business knowledge and understanding, to develop an account strategy with a solution definition and to design and propose a solution definition and design that addresses the customer’s specific need. Lead the development of product strategy and customer presentations as the clinical, technical, and knowledge expert. Address competitive positioning and value proposition components of the presentation. Attend customer presentations to resolve customer objections or answer questions regarding product and configuration comparisons and competitor pricing. If requested, participate in the customer feedback loop to provide technical expertise.  Partner with AM/AE to coordinate on-site demonstrations, clinical trials, site visits, and national clinical showcase sites. Partner with the AM to identify opportunities by providing insights into possible leads resulting from working with installed base, third party vendors, trade shows, local conferences, and other industry events. Partner with the AM to prioritize opportunities that exist in a given account or market. Partner with the AM on the roll-up of the forecast and funnel. Tie off on the account, timing, and dollars. Agree on a committed and best case plan. Work alongside the AM to ensure the funnel is robust, clean, and well managed. Coordinate product positioning and product qualification with AM/AE, as needed. Collaborate with AM to develop a SWOT analysis and build a database, by hospital, of the entire installed base to establish competitive positioning and understand upcoming opportunities.  Own the business development of the territory. Drive visibility by understanding business opportunities in the region, including emerging markets. Uncover and communicate opportunities to the AM. Share opportunity visibility by entering the opportunity into SFDC. Create a business plan that identifies every opportunity in every account. Ensure the funnel is robust and capable of meeting the AOP.  Attend accountability calls with the AM and DSL to provide input and background. Author a complete and compliant customer quote based on the specific customer needs and requirements. Drive the quote pricing based on configuration and delivery design. Manage any necessary change orders. Build a strong internal network and local customer team to support the delivery of value to our customers and to drive resolution of customer issues. Include Philips teammates from IGT Devices, Clinical Science, Clinical Education, Hospital Information Technology, Ultrasound, Service, Finance, and other Philips groups as needed. Provide Field Marketing with input on sales tools, pricing issues, and competitive threats to enable them to best support specialists and provide input to the IGT Business Unit. Maximize the customer experience by presenting a coordinated and efficient One Philips approach with the AM/AE. Support the DSL/AE/AM through informal product training and education. Share best practices with internal colleagues. Co-own, with the DSL, achieving the business goals including balanced selling and Annual Operating Plan (AOP) attainment. Draw on national knowledge of product and industry to provide input on forecasting to the DSL, as needed, through SFDC. Own the customer issue escalation process. Partner with the AM to determine the right communication to the customer for frequent issues or a delayed remedy. Partner with the AM to select appropriate site visit locations. Participate in the four-meeting process and installation to ensure a smooth customer hand-off. Perform against established performance goals and metrics. Take responsibility for your own personal and professional development, including all required training. Participate as an active member of the sales team, sharing your experience and knowledge with others. Use and comply with standard processes and guidelines. Develop strong knowledge of markets, competitors, and industry trends for products. Demonstrate the Philips Behaviours in all interactions.   You are a part of: Philips IGT Systems led by the National Modality leader.   You will be an integral part of the Chesapeake territory driving each business opportunity for IGT Systems, while collaborating with our Northeast regional sales team along the way.  This team will consist of a Regional Sales Manager, Account Executive(s), and several Account Managers.  To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience: Four-year college degree or equivalent experience preferred 8+ years of demonstrated healthcare experience or equivalent combination of education and experience. Diagnostic Imaging Industry experience highly preferred Deep product knowledge and expertise within interventional product modality. Ability to quickly demonstrate expertise and establish credibility with clinical decision makers. Ability to assess potential application of company products to meet customer needs and prepare detailed product specifications for the development and implementation of customer products/applications/solutions. Strong Business Acumen and organizational skills In return, we offer you: The IGT Sales Specialist role will give you the opportunity to take your career to the next level in a world-leading organization that is backed by a stable 120-year legacy of innovation. Here, you’ll go as far and as wide as you aspire. We make sure of it through support of a formal development planning process, as well as countless opportunities to expand your knowledge and skill set through resources such as the Learning@Philips program, tuition reimbursement and/or mentor relationships.  Why should you join Philips? Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.  To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.  It is the policy of Philips to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, pregnancy/childbirth, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran or military status or a person’s relationship or association with a protected veteran, including spouses and other family members, marital or domestic partner status, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.  As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants that require accommodation in the job application process may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.  Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran  No Sponsorship offered: "US work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa."   No Relocation: “Company relocation benefits will not be provided for this position. Candidates need to live within the territory”  INDSALES1

jobTitle: Director of Sales - Auto Dealer Solutions
description: izmocars (www.izmocars.com / www.frgodata.com ) is a leading Interactive Media and Internet Solutions company with a strong presence in the Automotive industry. With Interactive Media studios in Long Beach, CA & Brussels, Europe, we are the largest producers of automotive content in the world.  Our products include Interactive Media Solutions for Automotive, Data Analytics and Online Retail Platform for the Automotive industry.  We are looking for a proven National Director of Sales to provide leadership to the sales team and grow the sales organization to meet the sales growth objectives of the company. Reporting directly to the CEO, this is a key position in the company and as well as a very important role in our management.  The National Director of Sales (NDS) will provide overall leadership to the sales organization and be responsible for the national expansion of the sales force. This position will also be responsible build and manage the sales infrastructure to meet the growing and changing needs of the company and its client base. The NDS will also develop high-level sales strategies and planning for transforming the sales organization abilities to sell in a value based, multi-solution environment.  Responsibilities: Direct, manage, lead, develop and grow the national sales organization Meet sales targets across product mix. Monitor the establishment, development and enhancement of customer relationships Direct on-going technical training and support to sales organization regarding company’s products and applications Proactively establish and maintain effective working team relationships with all support departments. Evaluate Sales professional development growth and provide effective performance monitoring. Establish goals and objectives to ensure effective execution and optimize productivity of sales professionals. Help develop coordinated marketing strategy for both short and long range plans regarding product lines that directly impact the organization’s business  Requirements: Demonstrated successes in leading and developing a national sales team and with successful market penetration Deep relationships with Top 100 Auto Dealer Groups Experience in selling Automotive Solutions – Web, CRM, DMS, Marketing Demonstrated ability to interact effectively with external/internal key contacts and “C level” decision makers to build long-term relationships Strong organizational and communication skills including oral presentations, written documentation, computer proficiency, and the ability to interact with a diverse customer base Extensive travel may be required Four year college degree highly preferred but not required

Canyon Ranch has imparted integrative expertise to millions of guests, with established wellness destination resorts in Tucson, Arizona, Lenox, Massachusetts and Woodside, California Wellness Retreat, guests can achieve their goal of living younger longer. In addition, Canyon Ranch operates North Americas largest day spa at The VenetianÂ® hotel in Las Vegas, Nevada. Serves as a liaison with other departments, including high-level staff. Maintains accurate records of all sales activities within Delphi/Salesforce and partnership agreements. Assists with data collection, analysis, report preparation and writing, and other plans and projects as directed. Assists with preparation of group letters and contracts with direction from Sales management team members. Works as an integral part of the assigned property Sales Team, assisting with rooming lists in-put, call-in reservations, planner inquiries, weekly reports (GRC, Status Report, etc.) and other projects. Job Title: Sales Development Manager Reports To: VP of Sales & Marketing  Location: Indianapolis, IN (remote option not available)  We are currently seeking a Sales Development Manager to lead and oversee the growth of new business opportunities and the expansion into new verticals. The Sales Development Manager will manage and grow the Sales Development Representative (SDR) team whose goal is to generate revenue by developing opportunities for the sales teams. Additionally, the SDM will train incoming sales executives on SDR activities such as prospecting and cold calling.   Key Responsibilities Recruit, train and optimize a team responsible for outbound sales engagements. Track team activity and hold them accountable for performance. Provide side-by-side coaching and monitor calls.  Optimize call scripts, messaging and process to achieve optimum results.  Establish metrics and help the team improve by understanding their performance. Help create a fun, high energy environment where people love coming to work. Work alongside Sales Operations Specialist to oversee usage of team systems including Outreach, MonsterConnect, Salesforce and Dialpad.  Work closely with Sales and Marketing leadership to ensure success of marketing campaigns. Proactively support process adherence and work with management to improve and/or expand best practices.   Education and Qualifications 5-10 years of sales management (SDR/BDR, Sales, etc.) Outbound call center management experience strongly preferred Self-starter with proven success as a leader Ability to think analytically and pivot to avoid breakdowns in process and goal achievement Must how leadership through coaching/mentoring to develop the strongest team possible and be motivational in your approach Find passion and excitement in a fast growing, fast-paced environment Experience using CRM tools such as Salesforce Excellent written and spoken English Technically adept  Compensation The Sales Development Manager role will be compensated on a mix of base salary and commission based on team performance.

Job Description Kreller Companies seeks an entry level telephonic new business sales representatives located in the Greater Cincinnati area who can sell our exceptional capabilities to a very specific market. We are looking for outbound dialers with a hunter mentality and drive to earn. You will receive a base salary of $40,000 plus a performance based uncapped earning potential. This position is a critical part of our team selling process and provides a professional growth opportunity for those who take advantage of the opportunity we are providing. Candidates must be experienced calling into C Level executives of all industries and sizes. The ideal candidate is focused and self-motivated, and must possess an eagerness to learn quickly. As a Sales Development Rep your key roles and responsibilities will include: · Proactively contacting prospective customers to identify decision makers and opportunities with the goal of setting an appointment for a sales executive. · Working campaigns consisting of pre-qualified calls or cold calls and securing appointments for our sales team. · Qualifying new business opportunities. · Updating client and prospect information in our CRM systems · Managing sensitive customer and prospect information. · Performing outbound calls to C-Level executives generated from targeted outbound electronic prospecting programs. · Meeting all sales and performance objectives including daily phone time, dials per day, etc. Qualifications o Previous experience in Business to Business outbound sales (ranging from entry point to experienced) o Successful track record in new business sales o Proactive, focused on results o Familiarity with CRM platforms o Ability to build rapport with prospects o Strong negotiation skills o Deadline and detail-oriented o Ability to meet multiple sales metrics and work under pressure o Must possess a hunter mentality Job Type: Full-time Salary: $40,000.00 /year We have company guidelines in place, including company paid COVID tests if you come in to direct contact with someone having COVID
