description: INTRODUCTION  Founded in 1856 by Thomas Burberry, Burberry is a global luxury brand with a distinctly British attitude. We are a global business with an extensive network of both owned and franchised stores across EMEIA, Asia Pacific and Americas. We are digital pioneers, and innovative technology underpins every aspect of our business, from product design to distribution and marketing. We believe that modern luxury means being socially and environmentally responsible; this mindset is core to our business and key to our long-term success.  JOB PURPOSE  To meet and strive to exceed individual and store sales goals while executing key strategies of retail led growth, leveraging the franchise, operational excellence and all department category development; embracing and following on a daily basis the Burberry Experience during all interactions, owning the responsibility for developing new customers, as well as maintaining relationships with existing clientele.  Responsibilities  Sales & Service Embrace the Burberry Experience and follow training guidelines and standards to reflect Burberry’s luxury brand standards and image Consistently meet individual sales goals while exhibiting the Burberry Behaviours Provide excellent customer service skills, great selling skills and exhibit motivation to succeed Demonstrate superior interpersonal and communication talent Cultivate Build customer loyalty through active client development and follow-through Maintain an up-to-date and detailed client book Follow all Cultivate requirements and activities such as; courtesy and relationship emails, inviting customers back to shop, reactivation, capture compliance Visual Standards Follow company policies, procedures and use visual techniques to maintain the visual standards according to Burberry guidelines Maintain selling floor by ensuring the following: Understand and execute monthly floorsets Placing and/or hanging back items as you work Replenishing merchandise after selling Folding and placing merchandise on the correct hanger, tissue paper, etc. Place tickets inside the item and not visible to the customer. Floor Presence & Maintenance Beginning of shift/day: Arrive on selling floor ready, ensure floor is ready for customers End of shift/day: Ensure selling floor is replenished and ready for the next day Be active and busy on the floor at all day Ensure to place and/or hang back items as you work and replenish merchandise after selling Ensure clean up and maintenance of fitting rooms Back of The House Support Assist in the mark down process Assist in the bi-annual inventory process Participation and achievement of pre-sale goals Participate in store contests Assist in stock room maintenance and keep it organized Responsible for stock pulled; all stock must be put away in orderly fashion PERSONAL PROFILE Willing to work in and promote a team oriented environment. Excellent interpersonal skills required to ensure clear, effective communication with all management and staff. Consistently show a positive attitude & take responsibility for own actions. Must be results driven and flexible to change Relevant interest in Fashion / Design. Advanced knowledge of POS and store systems. A minimum of 1 year on sales, preferably in a luxury retail environment. Proven experience in driving sales and meeting sales targets. Excellent customer service level. Strong clienteling background.

In a world increasingly focused on how humans can responsibly live within our environment, OTT is on the frontlines, creating the critical water and weather solutions that ensure a safer future for us all. By partnering with our customers around the world, we help detect floods, make solar power more efficient, protect the environment, and ultimately save lives.  Our collaborative, diverse team is made up of engineers and scientists, marketers and researchers; people who’ve been in the industry for decades or have just arrived with fresh ideas. We’re driven by a love of problem-solving and inventive thinking, and by the unique impact our customers make on people’s everyday lives. Bringing our global team together within our renowned brands affords us unsurpassed strength and expertise in meteorology and hydrology—and gives you the chance to build a meaningful career.  OTT HydroMet is proud to be one of Danaher's Water Quality companies. Motivated by the highest possible stakes of climate change and global health, we’re working together within a rapidly digitizing industry to find innovative technologies that guarantee the safety of our water and our environment.  About the Territory Sales Manager role:  The Territory Manager is responsible for the growth and expansion of direct sales and profit margins within the defined territory/region on products and/or services. Establishes professional relationships with key personnel in customer accounts. Meets assigned targets for profitable sales volume and margin dollars.  Territory Sales Manager will cover all of Florida. Qualified candidates may live anywhere in this territory Promotion and sales OTT HydroMet product lines to core customers and new accounts Participates in sales activities including customer site visits, telephone contacts, trade seminars and shows, product demonstrations/evaluations, customer seminars, and channel management. Ability to develop and execute a business plan and manage territory as one’s own business Demonstrate time & territory balance by executing planned activities to maximize time in the field with customers and prospects Engages stakeholders and internal resources to best serve customers Collects and reports information on all competitive activity, business opportunities, the voice of the customer, sales trends, and results within the assigned market providing input during monthly business review Uses metrics, KPI, and forecasting to self-manage productivity Develops, nurtures, and understands health of customer opportunity funnel and openly works with leadership and sales operations to ensure best results Ability to develop creative and strategic solutions. Report and manage all sales activities through our CRM (SalesForce.com) Prepares and presents a monthly funnel review utilizing SalesForce.com to demonstrate the quality of the funnel, activity plans, and command of the account base. 50% Travel activity Are you qualified? 5-10 years of direct B2B sales experience, preferably selling water quality, flow, discharge, telemetry, and data management software solutions to urban hydrologists/meteorologists, Federal Government Agencies, State agencies, and local/muni flood and storm water agencies A degree in a science-related field such as Biology, Environmental Science, Hydrological and Meteorological Studies, Engineering, or equivalent is an asset Must have a valid driver's license and acceptable driving record When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 69,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.  Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. We value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.  The EEO posters are available here.  We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us at applyassistance@danaher.com to request accommodation.  If you’ve ever wondered what’s within you, there’s no better time to find out.

Benefitfocus Inc.  Benefitfocus (NASDAQ: BNFT) is a growing national software company, founded and headquartered in Charleston, South Carolina. We provide industry-leading cloud-based benefits management solutions that simplify how organizations and individuals shop for, enroll in, manage and exchange benefits. At Benefitfocus we are driven by the impact we make in the lives of our customers, and we value our Associates as our #1 asset to our success.  Benefitfocus is looking to add a Sales Development Representative to our Charleston, SC based team. This is a remote opportunity. The Sales Development Representative is responsible for generating interest in our Benefitfocus solutions and for cultivating new sales opportunities for our Employer Account Executives. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills, customer facing experience, and a solution oriented mindset.  Generate New Sales Opportunities Source new sales opportunities through inbound campaign follow up and outbound cold calls, emails, and LinkedIn messages Drive conversion of suspect to prospect through account research, identifying key players and generating interest in Benefitfocus solutions Route qualified prospects to appropriate Account Executive with validated account information Develop sales team relationships and processes to ensure efficient lead passing and timely follow up to develop prospects Collaborate with area sales teams to manage the suspect / prospect pipeline for additional activity Effectively Supporting Marketing Initiatives Re-qualify incoming leads from trade shows, events, Web and other sales/marketing activities Follow up on direct AE sales activities to include - drops, targeted letters/ email, local events Collaborate with AEs to source valuable account information in Salesforce Partner with local AE to build targeted strategic campaigns Drive cross selling activities in customer base - media sales, portal, communications Demonstrate Technical, Product & Industry Expertise Be proficient in our CRM, Salesforce.com and Salesforce Engage. Dedicated to data quality and meticulous population of key sales information Have the ability to provide an overview of Benefitfocus Portfolio of Products & Services in written form and verbally. Must know how to answer basic questions about our service offerings. Demonstrate ability to articulate Benefitfocus value messaging. Devote to continuous learning of industry - trends, competitors, market Experience in Microsoft Excel, Hoovers, Zoominfo, and MiEdge Experience And Skills High energy level: make large number of calls and targeted emails daily Self motivated: set personal goals (activities, results, income) and track success Dedication to quality Team player: share best practices, contribute to team success, build internal partnerships Time management: ability to multi task and manage time effectively to achieve weekly and monthly goals Results oriented: understand where you are against all established goals, make corrections and adjustments accordingly Creative: use tools, campaigns, events to deliver successful results across a variety of accounts and industries. Demonstrate ability to tailor messaging and approach. Strong interpersonal skills: must be able to build positive relationships both internally and externally to achieve success Bachelor's Degree. SaaS/HCM industry knowledge is preferred. Experience working with Account Executives Excellent knowledge and utilization of Salesforce for accurate pipeline and account management. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and interpersonal skills Solution oriented mindset; overcome sales objections

Work from anywhere in Florida!! Boveda Inc. of Minneapolis, MN is seeking a qualified Sales Executive in the Cannabis Industry, local to Florida, who will be responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with new and existing Boveda customers. This position offers a competitive base salary + commission and excellent benefits including medical, dental, vision and life insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, and paid holidays. If this sounds like the leading-edge opportunity that you've been looking for, apply today!  A DAY IN THE LIFE AS A BOVEDA SALES EXECUTIVE  As a Boveda Sales Executive in the Cannabis industry, you strategically promote and sell Boveda products to meet our customers' needs. You confidently conduct product evaluations in field and office settings, persuasively demonstrating the value of our products. Systematically tracking your territory progress, you proactively communicate your findings with our Sales Manager-US and push yourself to exceed each goal. When onsite with clients, you use your product knowledge and quick thinking to solve problems. You take great pride in meticulously managing and maintaining your territory for both current and prospective customers. As a Boveda Sales Executive you love living in the fast lane and find purpose in the hunt.  Qualifications To Be Our Sales Executive - Cannabis Challenger. A person who seeks out the hard projects and works to find just the right solutions. Teammate. A partner who listens to ideas, shares thoughts and works together to move the business forward. Charismatic Networker. A relationships-savvy person who intentionally makes connections with both internal partners and external contacts. Strategic Closer. A Salesperson who closes profitable business and consistently exceeds his/her performance objectives. Customer-oriented Achiever. A representative with an unparalleled work ethic and customer-focused attitude who will bring value to their partnerships. Game Changer. A persistent Salesperson who will stop at nothing to live out Boveda's mission as the industry leader in Two-way Humidity Control. 5+ years in an outside sales position (B2B sales preferred) or a bachelor's degree from an Accredited University with at least 2+ years of outside sales experience Ability and willingness to work on weekends (about 25%) NetSuite or ERP experience is a plus, but it is not required. Do you have strong communication skills, both verbal and written? Are you aware of business trends? Can you work independently? Do you love closing deals? If so, we want you on our team!  About Boveda  Boveda is the original creator of 2-way humidity control packets used to protect moisture-sensitive products like cigars, cannabis and wooden instruments. Boveda's ready-to-use packets are made of a semipermeable membrane which contains a combination of all-natural salts and purified water. A simple product that effectively and consistently solves an everyday problem of moisture loss, as well as excess moisture. Becoming the global leader in any category doesn't happen overnight. Becoming the global leader in a category that didn't even exist is even harder. But that's exactly what Boveda did and continues to do since 1997.  Boveda's commitment to their clients involves producing tens of millions of 2-way humidity control packets getting shipped out each year to protect the finest cigars, regulate the environment of a favorite guitar and keep the terpenes in cannabis where they belong. That's a lot to expect out of a humble brown packet, but Boveda has dedicated more than 20 years to protecting people's passions.  Boveda's Values Reflect The Foundations Which Held Our Company From It's Very Beginnings And Continue To Support It As We Grow Our Sales And Develop Our Most Valuable Asset, Our Employees Be humble Do the right thing Never, ever, ever give up If you're curious about our company, possess the skill set we need and have a desire to learn and grow alongside world class employees, then definitely consider applying for an open position. Boveda is an equal opportunity employer and we are grateful to be able to offer competitive salaries, exceptional benefits and a culture that supports you as an employee and as an individual. If you would like to learn more about Boveda Inc. please visit our website at www.bovedainc.com  ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?  We understand your time is valuable and that is why we have a very quick and easy application process. If you feel that you would be right for this position, please fill out our initial 3-minute, mobile-friendly application so that we can review your information. We look forward to meeting you!

ba&sh is one of the most influential French accessible luxury brands. Named after the initials of its two founders, childhood friends Barbara Boccara and Sharon Krief, ba&sh has designed and manufactured a full range of women’s apparel since 2003. Its style remains distinctly Parisian and Feminine uniting an expression of freedom with an effortless and joyful elegance. In 2015, L Catterton private equity firm acquired a 50% stake in the Parisian brand to sustain its development and international expansion, with the support of LVMH expertise and wide network. Today, ba&sh has over 400 points of sales around the world, with a leadership presence in Europe and a fast-growing development in North America and Asia.  ba&sh is looking for talented new recruits to join the team and embark in the journey of expanding the brand in the US. Are you ready for a new challenge?  ba&sh is seeking for a Sales Associates part-time in Malibu, CA. Your job is to generate sales and ensure customer satisfaction by providing a unique selling environment and expert advice. As a part of the ba&sh team you will be expected to help develop the brand with dedication, enthusiasm, elegance, and generosity. YOU NEED TO … Have 1+ years prior fashion retail experience in a high-end environment Demonstrate outstanding customer service Show strong styling and merchandising skills Be a fashion expert with impeccable presentation and good personality Have excellent communication skills both verbal and written Be dynamic and proactive Be a team player Have exceptional time management skills  WHAT YOU WILL BE DOING? •        Maximize sales •        Demonstrate an in-depth knowledge of the merchandise •        Comply with all sales related policies and procedures •        Be able to identify customer needs and overcome objections if raised •        Provide the highest level of customer service •        Build and maintain client base; manage client book •        Resolve all client problems and complaints quickly and effectively, ensuring client satisfaction •        Keep selling floor and merchandise neat, organized, and stocked •        Assist in all areas of stock, inventory shipping, receiving, while respecting protocol/policies •        Adhere to work schedule, inclusive of time and attendance  WE OFFER YOU… Take part in the expansion of a dynamic brand in a fashion entrepreneurial environment Career growth opportunities for advancement Health, Vision, and Dental Insurance 401K Savings Plan Generous shopping discount Vacation / Time-off Benefits

Position: Regional Sales Manager Location: Mid-West Territory   Established provider of specialized design, manufacturing, and consulting services is seeking a talented Regional Sales Manager to join their team. The ideal candidate will have experience in technical B2B sales in HVAC or construction related industries as well as the ability to collaborate with internal engineering teams.    Summary  The Regional Sales Manager works as a team member to grow sales, conduct business development activities, and build and sustain key customer and specifier relationships. This position is the front-line contact between the company and customers.  This individual promotes positive brand awareness and supports the companies goals and objectives; oversees all aspects of projects and customer communications; works closely with the sales support team to pursue new business development opportunities; prepare leads, quotes and submittals; and converts opportunities to profitable sales orders.   The Regional Sales Manager supports Project Managers in the follow up of project execution to ensure profitability and customer satisfaction.  Requirements 4 year college degree in business, math, or engineering related major with previous sales or department management experience. Previous experience in sales or account management preferred. Previous experience with traditional business computer applications including but not limited to: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Mail or other similar applications. Read technical drawings Visualize product design related to equipment design. Strong time management skills, exceptionally organized. Must be able to multitask and work on several projects at one time Ability to create and manage processes Excellent written and verbal communication skills Collaborative team spirit and positive attitude. Proficient at communicating effectively with both written and oral methods such as email, phone calls, trade shows, etc. Travel up to 50% of the time.

The Services Team represents the driving force to improving Cisco’s recurring revenue, which is one of Cisco’s strategic priorities and one of the most meaningful areas for our future growth. Our Services Sales organization is owning the way in growing Cisco relevancy with our customers and aligning their needs to the outcomes delivered.  What You'll Do  In this highly visible role, you'll be responsible for leading and transforming the team through collaboration, influence and respect. You will Build, mentor, develop, and direct a team of Services Sellers, passionate about both Premium and Core offers. Define team strategy to grow services, to include increasing attach and renewal rates in Technical Services and growing our Advanced Services business in size and impact to our customers. Support the team to develop new business both with existing and new customers, utilizing existing Cisco sales motions like Lifecycle selling, Performance IT and concepts from Selling Value in the Digital Age. Meet and exceed Service bookings targets on a weekly, monthly, quarterly and annual basis and increase Service penetration across all customer segments. Work closely with Cisco's partners to complement Cisco's offering and to integrate Cisco's Services into their portfolio. Ensure collaboration with the Portfolio sales teams to achieve sales stretch goals. Align closely with CX Delivery, Renewals, and Customer success to ensure all groups are delivering what is in the best interest of our customers and in alignment with the account team customer strategy. Invest in your team members careers by providing performance and developmental feedback. Lead cross functional initiatives to build new programs and resolve issues. Promote Cisco services in the external marketplace - both to customers and channel partners. Continued focus and alignment on the Services strategy to benefit the overall Cisco's Services operation.  Who You'll Work With The team of sales professionals and extended support members. The product sales teams and post sales customer experience leads and you will be a full member of the Service Sales Leadership Team. Our customers, helping to meet their business outcome Legal, finance, CX product marketing, Incubation Sales, etc. to ensure your team has the appropriate level of support to move deals forward.  Who You Are  Required Skills 10+ years of field-based services sales experience in a high-technology environment 5+ years of sales management experience A sales professional with services and consulting experience with the ability to lead a hardworking team A comfort level with Solution Selling and an aptitude for identifying customer needs and opportunities. Strong skills in strategic outlining, planning, customer relation and retention, contract development and negotiation, support operations and business management Leadership, collaboration, influencing, ability to inspire change Outside / in selling methodologies Ability to handle a sophisticated environment with a data driven approach Consistent track record of collaboration across multiple organizations Ability to manage and direct sales strategies to customers as well as aligning with channel partners General understanding of legal contracts Excellent written, verbal communications and presentation skills required You have a clear focus on operational perfection and execution We Are Cisco  #WeAreCisco, where each person is unique, but we bring our talents to work as a team and make a difference powering an inclusive future for all.  We embrace digital, and help our customers implement change in their digital businesses. Some may think we’re “old” (36 years strong) and only about hardware, but we’re also a software company. And a security company. We even invented an intuitive network that adapts, predicts, learns and protects. No other company can do what we do – you can’t put us in a box!  But “Digital Transformation” is an empty buzz phrase without a culture that allows for innovation, creativity, and yes, even failure (if you learn from it.)  Day to day, we focus on the give and take. We give our best, give our egos a break, and give of ourselves (because giving back is built into our DNA.) We take accountability, bold steps, and take difference to heart. Because without diversity of thought and a dedication to equality for all, there is no moving forward.  So, you have colorful hair? Don’t care. Tattoos? Show off your ink. Like polka dots? That’s cool. Pop culture geek? Many of us are. Passion for technology and world changing? Be you, with us!
industries: Computer Hardware, Computer Software, and Computer Networking

description: SKYCHARGER is taking the EV charging space by storm. Our approach of making EV charging affordable and not a luxury makes us stand out from our competitors. We are installing charging stations where EV drivers want them! We are looking for a dynamic sales professional ready to roll up their sleeves and help us create a network of low-cost, premium charging stations. We are helping small businesses bring a new demographic in their doors. We are making it easy for office complexes, multi-unit dwellings, and others to bring.  How do you know if you are the right person? You have a track record of success; you hate to lose, and you love to have a ton of fun while working hard. EVs and EV charging are uncharted waters. There isn’t a playbook that we can follow. You will help us build a playbook, tear it up, start over, and rewrite it until we have it right. Does this excite you or scare you? If it’s the latter, this isn’t the right position for you if your heart started racing at the thought of building a business and a market, then we want to hear from you.  Is there an opportunity to grow and develop? You can’t even imagine! The next decade is going to be amazing in the EV space. Come work with someone that wants to help you grow and develop. Do you think you are underqualified or overqualified for a Regional Sales Manager position? No worries, you can still reach out. We will be building a team, and we love having connections that we can reach out to when the time is right.  You: a proven track record of success; we will verify passion for the products that you have sold; you can’t fake passion a list of referrals; we want to hear about your greatness in their words can follow instructions; as we have a rough draft playbook can accept change, defeat, and moving targets; this comes with uncharted waters *Note: This is a remote position and is for a Regional Sales Manager - Northeast. You should reside in the Northeast. Preference to Boston, Hartford, NYC, or Albany.  What to do now? Send us your Resume in PDF format Send us your Cover Letter in PDF format Include your greatest accomplishment in your Cover Letter In your submission, please include two images that you think will help us know who you are Email your submission to: hrinfo@skycharger.com

The Opportunity  As our Solution Sales Consultant for all Teladoc Health’s (TDH) mental health products (mSC, TD Mental Health, etc.) you will support sales and market expansion of our comprehensive platform. This critical role ensures our sales team and our clients have full detail on our suite of products in order to drive sales and impact member product utilization. You will collaborate extensively with our sales, marketing, product, product marketing, business development, and client success teams in this role. Ultimately, your goal will be to be the strategic consultant for this suite of products, educating and driving awareness of product features, capabilities, pricing models and outcomes in order to drive meaningful growth for both TDH and our partners. This is a remote position Responsibilities Drive growth of ALL our solutions across the various segments Teladoc Health serves, with an emphasis on mental health Educate internal and external teams about TDH’s offerings Collaborate with product and commercial marketing, clinical and other internal stakeholders to develop necessary positioning to win in the market. Review and enhance product-specific sales pitch slides, live demos and supporting materials Coordinate with field sales team on pipeline opportunities to ensure support is provided to improve deal velocity and win rate Utilize Salesforce.com for all engagement documentation and reporting Understand competitive landscape and appropriately position products accordingly to increase win rate Candidate Profile 6+ years of relevant experience in sales, marketing, and/or channel management, clinical experience preferred Product management, clinical integration, sales training, and/or consulting experience Experience working with large employers, health plans, health systems and benefits consultants The ability to energize, develop and build rapport at all levels within an organization Strong motivation and initiative, with a passion for exceeding goals Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Strong writing and presentation skills, with the ability to convey compelling messages in small and large group settings, both in-person and remotely Strong project and account management skills Strong critical-thinking and analytical skills A strong sense of teamwork, with productive collaboration skills A B.S./B.A. degree Why Join Teladoc Health?  A New Category in Healthcare:  Teladoc Health is transforming the healthcare experience and empowering people everywhere to live healthier lives.  Our Work Truly Matters: Recognized as the world leader in whole-person virtual care, Teladoc Health uses proprietary health signals and personalized interactions to drive better health outcomes across the full continuum of care, at every stage in a person’s health journey.  Make an Impact: In more than 175 countries and ranked Best in KLAS for Virtual Care Platforms in 2020, Teladoc Health leverages more than a decade of expertise and data-driven insights to meet the growing virtual care needs of consumers and healthcare professionals.  Focus on PEOPLE:  Teladoc Health has been recognized as a top employer by numerous media and professional organizations. Talented, passionate individuals make the difference, in this fast-moving, collaborative, and inspiring environment.  Diversity and Inclusion:  At Teladoc Health we believe that personal and professional diversity is the key to innovation. We hire based solely on your strengths and qualifications, and the way in which those strengths can directly contribute to your success in your new position.  Growth and Innovation:  We’ve already made healthcare yet remain on the threshold of very big things. Come grow with us and support our mission to make a tangible difference in the lives of our Members.  As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we never have and never will discriminate against any job candidate or employee due to age, race, religion, color, ethnicity, national origin, gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, membership in an employee organization, medical condition, family history, genetic information, veteran status, marital status, parental status or pregnancy (including breastfeeding – we have a mother’s room in both our offices). In our innovative and inclusive workplace, we prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind.

description: Position Title: Analyst Sales Operations & Analysis  Position Summary  The Analyst Sales Operations & Analysis supports the Manager Sales Operations & Analysis in providing analytical feedback and support to the overall sales organization and Commercial team. The Analyst works closely with Revenue Management and Commercial leadership reporting on sales efforts and effectiveness of strategies implemented. The Analyst is responsible for the day to day management of various internal and external sales projects as well as management of all large sales team events and advertising.  Essential Responsibilities Present client information to sales managers or commercial leadership at a timely fashion in order to support strategy decisions Provide valuable feedback on strategy relative to events, advertising, and projects utilizing data and knowledge of the corporate sales environment Support field Sales Managers in the efforts to drive incremental revenue in corporate business travel Responsible for rolling up reports on Sales Manager revenue targets Support operations and workflows through CRM system, salesforce.com Oversee contract management process and day-to-day activities Support large event planning, development, and billing Generate sales reports to support the development of existing and new contracts Maintain reports and assist in development of sales tools Other duties as assigned Minimum Experience And Qualifications Bachelor's Degree in any field of study One (1) year of revenue management, sales, or marketing experience Effective written, verbal and presentation skills Demonstrate proficiency in Microsoft Excel through an onsite, computer-based work sample Highly motivated and capable of managing multiple projects simultaneously Available for occasional overnight travel (15%) Must pass a ten (10) year background check and pre-employment drug test Must be legally eligible to work in the country in which the position is located Preferred Experience And Qualifications Advanced knowledge of SQL, Microsoft Access or other database software Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Microsoft Power BI, or Tibco Spotfire Experience with salesforce.com Crewmember Expectations Regular attendance and punctuality Potential need to work flexible hours and be available to respond on short-notice Well-groomed and able to maintain a professional appearance When working or traveling on JetBlue flights, and if time permits, all capable crewmembers are asked to assist with light cleaning of the aircraft Must be an appropriate organizational fit for the JetBlue culture, that is, exhibit the JetBlue values of Safety, Caring, Integrity, Passion and Fun Promote JetBlue’s #1 value of safety as a Safety Ambassador, supporting JetBlue’s Safety Management System (SMS) components, Safety Policy and behavioral standards Identify safety and/or security concerns, issues, incidents or hazards that should be reported and report them whenever possible and by any means necessary including JetBlue’s confidential reporting systems (Aviation Safety Action Program (ASAP) or Safety Action Report(SAR)) Equipment Computer and other office equipment Work Environment Normal Office Environment Physical Effort Generally not required, or up to 10 pounds occasionally, 0 pounds frequently. (Sedentary)

description: Description Actsoft is a leader in Mobile Resource Management Solutions. We are a team-oriented company with a strong passion for empowering our employees to succeed while always upholding integrity and personal responsibility.  We are looking for a Regional Director who is a true hunter! A Regional Director is responsible for Enterprise Level new client acquisition. They will be held to metrics and quota attainment on a monthly, quarterly and yearly basis. You need to be comfortable with outbound cold calling, connecting with customers to establish a relationship, Face to Face presentation pitches and using customer relationship management (CRM) software. Our ideal candidate has an impressive track record of closing enterprise sales deals in the B2B SaaS Industry and excellent negotiation and communication skills. Cold calling, prospecting new leads, follow up emails, discovery calls, uncovering pain points and closing deals are all part of the day to day.  This is an ideal position for someone who enjoys winning, is highly self-motivated and extremely competitive.   Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned. · Source new leads through cold calling/prospecting/canvasing/F2F presentations · Identify and follow up with key decisions makers (C-Suite Executives, Business Owners)  · Follow up on leads to find new enterprise logos · Use negotiation skills and consultative selling to close deals · Use CRM to move leads through sales cycle  · Use other tech stack productivity products to generate leads resulting in sales  · Consistently meet or exceed sales metrics/KPI’s and quotas  · Continually learning software updates to be a SME   Other Responsibilities:  · Perform web-based demo’s and F2F presentations to potential customers  · Perform ROI Calculations  · Schedule client discovery calls / follow up calls  · Send follow up emails to prospects  · Ask for referrals  · Use of case studies   Qualifications: · Preferred locations include Seattle or Denver · This position requires someone who is an expert in SaaS based solution selling · Proven record of influencing, negotiating, and closing sales on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis · Solid understanding of the need to utilize CRM in an effective way to follow consultative and key insight sales processes, manage lead opportunities and create accurate forecasts · Exceptional presentation and listening skills · Excellent follow-up skills · Should be an expert in sales prospecting tools and web selling · Must be metrics and KPI driven  · Must be highly competitive and like to win · Strong prospecting skills and excellent closing skills · Must have strong negotiation skills · Exceptional verbal and written communication skills · Must be able to think on your feet and have a high sense of urgency  · Familiarity with email sequencing and zoom info leveraging for cold calling activity · Ideal candidate will have time attendance, payroll software, fleet or other applicable backgrounds  Education/Experience: · Bachelor’s degree required  · 5-7 years of B2B SaaS, web based Inside Sales experience  · Must have experience making 75-100 calls/ day  · Must have quick transaction sales closure experience   Physical Demands: While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to sit, stand, walk, and crouch; work with computers and other office equipment, talk and hear. The employee is occasionally required to climb and lift 50 pounds. The vision requirements include: close vision, distance vision, and ability to adjust focus.

description: Company Overview:  Masterworks is doubling the size of its Equity Sales team, which is comprised of Membership Managers who onboard more than 200 new investors each day. The team guides new clients towards their initial investment by uncovering client goals and answering questions about the art market and specific art-related offerings. We’re growing quickly and are looking for people to join the team  Market Overview:  “Blue-chip” Art has outperformed the S&P 500 by 180% since 2000. Even more impressive, its “store of value” characteristics allowed it to retain value in the 2008-09 financial crisis versus the S&P. We believe the risk-adjusted returns of this asset class are superior to most other asset classes and are making it available to anyone to invest. Masterworks is the only company that is offering Blue-Chip Art to investors in this format.  Position Overview:  We are seeking Equity Sales Representatives to Interview, educate, and sell investment opportunities to new investors applying for access to our platform.  Responsibilities:  Each day, our membership team interviews more than 200 prospective investors for access to our community. The successful candidate will:  Advise potential clients on making initial investments in Blue-Chip Art as an alternative investment class Work exclusively with pre-qualified, pre-scheduled clients (No Cold-Calling) Be highly organized, capable of using technology to improve effectiveness and efficiency (CRM tools, custom reports, etc.). Be effective at follow-up with investors who are lukewarm but not yet sold  Requirements or Skill Sets:  Note: Due to regulatory requirements, this position requires the successful candidate to hold and maintain a Series 7 license from FINRA. Strong interest in selling finance or investment-related products to potential investors. Strong interest in art as an asset class, or the “business of art,” is a plus. Highly organized. Hard-driving achiever, with a balance between the sales process and results orientation. Excellent verbal and written communication skills.  Additional:  Must be in the NYC area - not a remote position. Must be eligible to work in the US - no exceptions.
industries: Financial Services, Investment Management, and Capital Markets

companyName: Pella Windows & Doors of Northern Indiana
description: Pella Trade Outside Sales Representative - South Bend  Who we are: We are a private, locally owned Pella distributorship that sells, services and fulfills Pella Projects. We believe in transparency, trust and honest business. Not only do we have world class products and warranties, but we have an open and supportive culture, and an all-star roster to achieve excellent results. This is a team you will enjoy working with and a fun and rewarding culture.   What will you be doing? You will take your training, sales tools, and expertise and dive into your sales territory with an existing account base sourced out of the South Bend branch. Your day to day will be diverse with detailed office work on one end, visits to job sites on one, and formal product presentations on yet another. You will bring to the table a myriad of products and services by which you will enhance the building experience for new home builders, remodelers, architects, designers, and homeowners. By a careful study of inputs vs outputs will develop this customer base into a group of pre-Pella advocates and become the window and door expert for your area.  What will we give you for being GREAT at it? You will receive a salary base with a no-cap commission plan. Achievable monthly and yearly bonus. Home office setup, cell phone, reimbursed car allowance, reimbursed expenses, and a financial and health insurance package.  Who is the right person for the job? The right person is one who thrives on crossing over into hostile territory and winning over accounts and market share. He or she works best as an autonomous, self-reliant, and resourceful salesperson and can make the necessary adjustments to scheduling and work hours without a watchful eye. The right person has a temperament and personality that facilitates a sales friendly experience. He or she is outgoing, personable, articulate, versatile, and professional.  We are open to those with or without sales experience if there is a healthy sense of urgency to become successful and proven. Clean, ethical business, having fun, and a desire to be successful are not negotiable. Clear driving record and background check is required.  How do you Apply? Contact Brittany Brown – bbrown@pellani.com Or Richard Handley – rhandley@pellani.com

The Sales Development Representative Position  The Sales Development Representative (SDR) role is a full-time, 12-week contract opportunity for ambitious, hard-working, outgoing individuals who desire an elevated professional opportunity in sales but have not had the opportunity to develop a track record/resume to qualify for our primary Sales Professional opportunity.   During the 12-week contract, the SDR will learn and gain mastery of our proven prospecting, lead nurturing and appointment setting methodologies. The SDR will be assigned to an experienced Sales Professional to support their sales activities by adding additional selling opportunities to their schedule. SDRs who demonstrate the work ethic, coachability, and aptitude for generating quality leads and appointments will have the opportunity to be hired into our full-fledged Sales Professional opportunity at the end of their contract.  In addition to increasing sales through their core prospecting and phone calling activities, SDRs will also have an opportunity to learn about our long-term career path and witness our selling processes and client interactions during a 1x/week field ride with their assigned Sales Professional. This allows both the SDR and Tom James Company a first-hand look at whether a long-term selling opportunity at Tom James is a fit for the SDR.  Expectations for our SDRs are set high to result in high rewards. Our SDRs are paid a competitive hourly wage as well as commissions on orders sold to prospects and former customers they book into their leaders’ calendars. SDRs who achieve expectation in the program can earn up to $3,500 - $4,000/monthly while developing the skills and habits necessary for even greater opportunity in our uncapped, unlimited Sales Professional opportunity.  SDRs will participate in a comprehensive, structured training program equipping them for each activity assigned.  At the end of the 12-week contract, depending on performance and other factors, Tom James will determine whether to:  Extend an offer for regular employment with Tom James, including the potential for our full-time Sales Professional position; Extension of the SDR contract; Opt not to renew the contract, and provide verification of program completion to assist the SDR in their next job search  Job Duties include but are not limited to: Prospecting for potential new clients: utilize our prospecting platforms including ZoomInfo, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and Outreach to identify, connect with and warm up quality prospects; Updating contact information and conducting direct contact/marketing outreach to customers who haven’t purchased from us in a while; Phone Skills & Dials: 85+ dials/day with a goal to set around 20-25 appointments/week Conduct client & prospect research on the individuals the Sales Professional meets with to identify potential connections to other ideal customers for referrals; Assist with some customer service communications to provide a world-class experience and additional sales opportunities  About Us Tom James is the world’s leading professional image consulting business. Our customers come to us for our custom fit, convenience, selection and expertise. Our product is clothing, but our passion is developing sales professionals to achieve extraordinary results. We are an employee-owned, privately held clothing company with 100 locations and 16 subsidiaries in the specialty retail industry. Our “We come to you” model has earned the trust of the world’s leading professionals in markets throughout the world.  What We Do Our clients are highly successful, busy professionals, and we help them look better and feel more comfortable in their clothing, whatever the setting. You don’t need to be a fashion expert to do what we do, but you DO need to be passionate about listening to and serving your customers! We can teach the rest from our 55 years of experience building wardrobes for men and women. We network and prospect for great potential clients, and we use the phone, email, social media and other communication tools to connect and share our service with them. When we do our job right by taking care of our clients, they work with us season after season as we help them stay current, updated and fresh for whatever comes their way.  www.tomjamescareers.com

This position is responsible for the ground-up development and nurturing of key Client relationships within the commercial fitness industry, including health clubs, boutique studios, and anywhere functional training solutions may be needed.  Client Details  We amplify functional training spaces for health clubs, boutique studios, and fitness amenities alike. Our mission is to design safe, and supremely functional spaces supporting our clients delivery of inspirational exercise experiences.  We balance exercise trend and technology to create user engagement in every gym we design. Our team of Functional Design Specialists are passionate about creating spaces for exercise that will keep every workout fresh.  Our creative process establishes efficiency and purpose for every project. We incorporate leading architectural and interior design principles with the latest in exercise trend and equipment solution.  Description  Identify prospective clients from a variety of sources (known key accounts, trade shows, marketing, referrals and beyond) and achieve targeted sales goals. Schedule meetings with, and present to, leading health club and studio chains- you will primarily target clients seeking to create dedicated space(s) for movement-based programming and the equipment solutions that facilitate them. Provide facility design expertise around our unique dynamic training solutions and the equipment required to power them. Prepare and presents proposals to prospective and repeat clients (including equipment recommendations, space plans, installation guidance, and payment options). Attend designated trade shows, cultivate relationships, and represents the energy of the brand always. Profile  Customer Focus, Managing & Measuring Work, Problem Solving, Drive for Results, Action Oriented, Process Management, Planning, Listening, Conflict Management, Timely Decision Making.  Job Offer  Seeking well-qualified sales and project management professionals ready to join our rapidly growing team as a Regional Sales Director.  Collaborative, innovative, visionary leadership Full Benefits package (Medical, FSA, Dental, Vision, and Life insurance) 401(K) Plan A PTO policy that ensures you can find a happy work-to-life balance Access to cutting-edge functional fitness equipment Flexible Work-from-Home and Remote Positions available Headquarters located in sunny Santa Monica, CA Desired Skills and Experience  -Business Development and Relationship Management. -Effective interpersonal, negotiating and conflict management skills required. -Ability to articulate complex business solutions to clients through presentations and proposals -Ability to manage multiple projects, work under pressure, and adapt to sudden changes in the work environment is essential. -Demonstrates strong organization, planning, communication, diplomacy and presentation ability. -Minimum (8) years successful national or key account sales experience within the fitness industry. -Excellent communications skills, both written and verbal -Ability to organize well during multi-faceted projects -Proficiency in Microsoft for Windows Applications -College degree with a concentration in business or exercise science and/or compelling equivalent fitness industry work experience required

Build the solution that transforms the real estate industry!  Want to infuse a $25B sector of the insurance and real estate industry with predictive analytics and a tech-forward customer experience? Yearning for a startup culture within a profitable nationwide company? Join Doma and send an entirely new type of real estate model into the wild.  About Us  Doma and its family of brands - States Title, North American Title Company (NATC) and North American Title Insurance Company (NATIC) - offer solutions for lenders, real estate professionals, title agents, and homeowners that make closings vastly more simple and efficient, reducing cost and increasing customer satisfaction.  Our Values Customer Obsessed – We always put our customers first. Solution Driven – We solve problems that other people are afraid to. People leaders – We grow all of our people into leaders. One Team – We believe inclusion and teamwork produce the best results. Direct with Respect – We communicate with honesty and respect to our colleagues, customers, and partners. Doma is seeking a high-energy, execution-oriented Sales Representative to support our tremendous growth and our transformative solution.  Doma’s Sales Executives are hardworking and driven with high energy, passion, and the initiative to drive new business relationships. Doma is making title and escrow a simpler, seamless process for lenders, agents, and homebuyers across the country. We are building transformative technology driven by our passion to improve the customer experience.  The Sales team focuses exclusively on formulating and executing a pipeline generation strategy within assigned territories, resulting in aggressive pipeline growth and new customer acquisition.  With an inclusive and collaborative culture, Doma is changing and innovating the title industry.  Our sales leadership is committed to hiring, mentoring, and growing the best salesforce by inspiring and enabling success for everyone on the team.  Principal Duties And Responsibilities Take ownership of revenue generation, develop new opportunities, manage pipeline, create, and execute account strategies, and close deals! Understand prospects & customers business needs and effectively communicate how Doma can solve them mastering the ability to communicate our value propositions to prospective clients. Foster long-term relationships with customers and prospective buyers, own the sales process, and strive to achieve individual and team revenue goals. Build an intimate understanding of Doma’s solution and products and their place in the industry Plan and execute a sales strategy which meets regular activity and business development goals Identify opportunities using various techniques such as networking, email marketing, phone, and face-to-face appointments. Overcome objections and use investigative questioning techniques to qualify prospects and determine if they have a business challenge or need, we can address through our offerings. What you should bring to the table as our Ideal Sales Representative: Hunter mentality with solid Sales DNA and willingness to learn and be a part of something great! Meaningful (4+ years) experience in a closing role; preferably in B2B in SaaS or similar marketplace industry with a confident and consultative approach to selling and a record of top performance. Highly professional in your communication style. You earn and instill trust, encouraging prospects to share business goals, strategies, deficiencies, and priorities. Comfort with ambiguity: experience adapting in rapidly changing environments and contributing to an evolving sales process. Experience interfacing with both internal team members and external prospects as a part of a collaborative, solution-based sales process. The mentality of an entrepreneur/owner and a strong bias to action Strong interest in real estate preferred Bachelor’s degree highly preferred We want the work you do here to be the best work of your life.  We believe the most valuable investment we can make - and the greatest boost we can give to your career - is to build an outstanding team of colleagues who are passionate about our mission.  We currently offer the following benefits and will continually evolve them with the goal of efficiently attracting, retaining, and leveraging the very highest quality talent. Our passionate, capable team will always be our #1 benefit We are proud of the team we have built so far, and we are excited about the team we have yet to add Learn something new every day Get more done than you would anywhere else Competitive salaries Top-of-the-line computer equipment Multiple Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits options to allow you to customize to your and your Family’s needs Paid Time Off Health & Dependent Care Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) Short Term & Long-Term Disability Commuter Flexible Spending Account (i.e., Transit or Parking) Supplemental Life and AD&D Insurance Auto & Home Insurance Group Life Insurance Pet Insurance We believe in Equal Opportunity  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  #CB  #ZIP

description: INTRODUCTION  Founded in 1856 by Thomas Burberry, Burberry is a global luxury brand with a distinctly British attitude. We are a global business with an extensive network of both owned and franchised stores across EMEIA, Asia Pacific and Americas. We are digital pioneers, and innovative technology underpins every aspect of our business, from product design to distribution and marketing. We believe that modern luxury means being socially and environmentally responsible; this mindset is core to our business and key to our long-term success.  JOB PURPOSE  To meet and strive to exceed individual and store sales goals while executing key strategies of retail led growth, leveraging the franchise, operational excellence and all department category development; embracing and following on a daily basis the Burberry Experience during all interactions, owning the responsibility for developing new customers, as well as maintaining relationships with existing clientele.  Responsibilities  Sales & Service Embrace the Burberry Experience and follow training guidelines and standards to reflect Burberry’s luxury brand standards and image Consistently meet individual sales goals while exhibiting the Burberry Behaviours Provide excellent customer service skills, great selling skills and exhibit motivation to succeed Demonstrate superior interpersonal and communication talent Cultivate Build customer loyalty through active client development and follow-through Maintain an up-to-date and detailed client book Follow all Cultivate requirements and activities such as; courtesy and relationship emails, inviting customers back to shop, reactivation, capture compliance Visual Standards Follow company policies, procedures and use visual techniques to maintain the visual standards according to Burberry guidelines Maintain selling floor by ensuring the following: Understand and execute monthly floorsets Placing and/or hanging back items as you work Replenishing merchandise after selling Folding and placing merchandise on the correct hanger, tissue paper, etc. Place tickets inside the item and not visible to the customer. Floor Presence & Maintenance Beginning of shift/day: Arrive on selling floor ready, ensure floor is ready for customers End of shift/day: Ensure selling floor is replenished and ready for the next day Be active and busy on the floor at all day Ensure to place and/or hang back items as you work and replenish merchandise after selling Ensure clean up and maintenance of fitting rooms Back of The House Support Assist in the mark down process Assist in the bi-annual inventory process Participation and achievement of pre-sale goals Participate in store contests Assist in stock room maintenance and keep it organized Responsible for stock pulled; all stock must be put away in orderly fashion PERSONAL PROFILE Willing to work in and promote a team oriented environment. Excellent interpersonal skills required to ensure clear, effective communication with all management and staff. Consistently show a positive attitude & take responsibility for own actions. Must be results driven and flexible to change Relevant interest in Fashion / Design. Advanced knowledge of POS and store systems. A minimum of 1 year on sales, preferably in a luxury retail environment. Proven experience in driving sales and meeting sales targets. Excellent customer service level. Strong clienteling background.

About Us  Image Craft is locally owned and nationally recognized for planning, production, and execution of a wide variety of unique and exciting printed visual communications. Since 1979, we have been providing customers with the highest quality deliverables delivered with great customer service. From vehicle wraps to wall murals - from banners to fine art reproductions - from POP to 3-dimensional lettering.     Our motto is “Any Image. Any Size. Anywhere.”  Summary  Our Inside Sales/Project Coordinator combines outbound business-building activities with internally focused client support, acting as the key liaison between clients, sales, and our production teams. This requires asking the right questions, accurate details on work orders/estimates, and thorough communication with all parties including the production staff. The ability to consistently deliver accurate and timely communications is the key success factor for this position. Must be able to beat deadlines, juggle multiple projects, and work independently in a fast-paced environment.   Essential Duties and Responsibilities Inside Sales (50%) Qualify new sales opportunities through follow up on outbound social media, email, and other marketing efforts Prospect for net new clients via outbound cold calls and emails Research market segments and individual prospects to identify key influencers and focus sales and marketing efforts.    Leverage corporate marketing collateral, trade shows, and lead-generating tools to acquire new business.     Provide detailed call and activity reports as well as account plans to the management team Project Coordinator (50%) Be the primary point of contact between client, sales, production, and installation teams Will work directly with sales, prepress, print, install, and shipping departments. Once the project is approved, you will take ownership and see the project through completion working with all departments.  Responsible for keeping current clients satisfied and delivering exceptional client service on a day-to-day basis Manage client expectations through email, phone, online presentations, and in-person meetings Enhance existing client relationships via cross and up-selling of other existing and new Image Craft offerings. Prepare, generate, and follow up on verbal or written quotations to secure orders, or determine the reason for loss of order. Spot check assigned projects to ensure client expectations and quality are met prior to shipment.    Other Duties  Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  Key Qualifications    2-5 years of customer service and account management experience  Knowledge of large format print production and installation is a plus Proven inside sales experience a plus Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively. Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously, while paying strict attention to detail    Excellent listening, negotiation, and presentation skills Self-motivated and able to thrive in a results-driven environment Natural relationship builder with integrity, reliability, and maturity Ability to prioritize among competing tasks Critical thinking and problem-solving skills Excellent time and project management skills. You're always looking to improve inefficient processes Keen attention to detail and adherence to deadlines  Skills & Proficiencies  Prospecting Skills Teamwork Planning Build Relationships Excellent verbal and written communications skills People Skills Experience with Cyrious database Control is a plus Proficiency with all aspects of Microsoft Suite - Word, Excel, Powerpoint, SharePoint etc.  Initiative Customer Focus Emphasize Excellence   AAP/EEO Statement  Image Craft LLC provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Image Craft complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.  Image Craft expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Image Craft employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.  Work Authorization/Security Clearance  Must be eligible to work in the United States without restriction.

Make recognition fun. Love your work. 🤗💚🎉  Join our small but growing team dedicated to building engaged, recognition-rich cultures in workplaces across the globe!  To learn what makes our company culture unique, take a peek at our Employee Un-Handbook, check out our  Instagram, , and read what employees say it’s like to work here.  *** COVID-19 Update: Bonusly is still hiring! We will be conducting all interviews and on-boarding new hires remotely until further notice. Until it is safe to return to office-based work, Bonusly will furnish all employees with what they need to work remotely, and employees may choose to work from any location (provided they follow local health guidelines). ***  What is Bonusly?  Bonusly provides solutions to create high-performance, high-engagement teams. We believe that success in business is determined by people, working on teams, to solve novel problems. That belief extends to our own team, and we'd love for you to be a part of it.  What is our mission? Our mission is to help people connect with their work and each other in meaningful ways. Our vision is for every organization to reach success by using Bonusly to build high-performance, high-engagement teams. We believe that the way we work today can be so much better.  How do we get there?  Our top-rated SaaS platform is built by the talented and creative team here at Bonusly. We work with autonomy, responsibility, and purpose. We are driven by a desire to make meaningful impacts for our customers, and to be excellent teammates to each other along the way.  Job Description Boulder/Denver Metro Area, Colorado (Relocation Provided)   Bonusly is looking for an experienced, innovative and results-oriented SMB Sales Representative. We are looking for a Salesperson with great instincts that has the ability to succeed in an SMB inbound sales environment. We need someone who is creative, highly skilled in sales, and has a track record of delivering sales strategies amongst a variety of SMB clientele. You’ll be challenged to manage all aspects of the sales life cycle, while continuing to uphold Bonusly’s great reputation in this space.   Your team will sell products that transform workplace recognition and feedback at the most innovative and fastest-growing companies in the world.   What you’ll do Sell Bonusly’s amazing products to SMB customers Prospect and generate leads to create outbound processing of sales functions  Manage and convert a high volume of inbound sales leads Use a variety of modern sales technologies (Social selling, automation tools) technologies to proactively sell to SMB Clientele Work in a rapidly paced sales cycle Own the entire sales process from end to end: Generate new leads, convert leads, conduct discovery calls, conduct demos, negotiate contracts and close deals Foster practices that encourage improvement and bias towards action through retrospection, learning and outcomes.   Join an inclusive, collaborative, and skilled sales team that loves to sell reliable, scalable, intuitive, and useful products. 💯You should apply if you….. Have 2 + years of professional sales experience  Have experience selling Software Are ambitious and motivated with a #Go-Get-Results attitude that will drive you to convert inbound leads Have experience or familiarity with a CRM  Have experience with social selling, prospecting, or utilizing a sales automation tool  Have a BS degree or higher in any field, or equivalent experience Bonus Points for….. Have experience selling Human Resources (or related) Technologies  Have experience selling to SMB Clientele Have experience with outbound sales Compensation Salary: $50,000 - $55,000 base Target Commission + Equity: $60,000 🎉Benefits and opportunities include... • Collaborating with a growing team of smart & passionate creators. • Making work more enjoyable and meaningful by reimagining the way companies recognize and reward their employees. • Being empowered to innovate, take ownership, and motivate change at a growing company. • Flexible “work-from” policies. • Fully covered Medical/Dental/Vision insurance. • Fully covered short-term/long-term disability and life insurance • Progressive vacation policy. • 401(k) with employer matching. • Subsidized wellness, transit, and professional development. • Bonusly! (Of course we use our own product for peer, work anniversary, and birthday recognition)   💚 What's it like to work at Bonusly?  Culture and employee experience are some of our top priorities! See what we're all about at https://bonus.ly/about, and check out our official Employee Unhandbook to learn more about our culture and values.   🔸 We actively work toward greater diversity, equity, and inclusion We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

ChaosSearch is a well-funded startup that signed a new $40M round of funding in late 2020. Our mission is to enable every organization to have fast and easy access to data. Our cloud-built Data Lake engine delivers instant elasticity and unlimited scale, secure data access and disruptive pricing for Log and BI analytics.  Last year was a record breaking year for ChaosSearch. We tripled our customer base, increased revenue close to 8X, launched ChaosSearch 2.0 and ended the year with a $40 Million Series B financing round. We are building on this success and adding to our team in 2021. The time to join couldn’t be better.  The Role  ChaosSearch is looking for a world-class technical Sales Engineer to be part of a team that is responsible for the technical sales cycles of ChaosSearch presentations, proof-of-concepts and trials at our customers. The Sales Engineer will work directly with customers, partners, sales and the engineering and product teams to sell ChaosSearch. This person must be a self-starter and used to a fast-paced, fun, energetic environment and comfortable with dealing with ambiguity. This person must also have a passion to solve unique world-changing technology problems. The Sales Engineer will be responsible for providing the technical expertise to make ChaosSearch customers successful.  Responsibilities Be a technical expert on all aspects of ChaosSearch Work hands-on with customers to demonstrate and prove out the ChaosSearch technology. Maintain deep understanding of competitive and complementary technologies and vendors and how to position ChaosSearch in relation to them Collaborate with Product Management, Engineering, and Marketing to continuously improve ChaosSearch products and positioning Support the technical needs of customers and resolve technical issues, along with engaging them on any additional issues, problems, or opportunities regarding the ChaosSearch service. Working with the ChaosSearch Sales Team, prepare and present the ChaosSearch service and address any technical questions or concerns that come up during the sales cycle. May include travel to clients and potential client sites, hosting remote meetings, and serving as a technical interface with customers. Support broader Sales and Marketing efforts including content creation, webinar presentations, trade show participation, and general technical support. Qualifications 5+ years as a Sales Engineer/Solutions Architect Understanding of log management systems, preferably the ELK stack and Elasticsearch Domain experience in any of the following areas: SaaS services, Cloud Solutions (AWS/Azure/GCP), Log Management and Log Analysis, Knowledge and understanding of distributed systems architectures Knowledge of Information Retrieval and/or Analytics domain Understanding of Linux, Java, and databases Software coding experience with C/C++, Java, Python, Ruby, Perl, Bash Experience with non-relational platforms and tools for large-scale data processing (e.g. Hadoop, HBase, Spark) Familiarity and experience with common BI and data exploration tools (e.g. Kibana, Looker, Tableau) Experience and understanding of large-scale infrastructure-as-a-service platforms (e.g. Amazon AWS, Microsoft Azure, GCP, etc.) Experience implementing ETL pipelines using custom and packaged tools Experience using AWS services such as S3, IAM, SQS, Kinesis, EMR, Redshift, Athena Successful track record selling enterprise SaaS software Great presentation skills with the ability to speak in front of audiences both large and small About ChaosSearch  Headquartered in Boston, we are conveniently located across the street from TD Garden -- a 60 second walk from North Station and the Orange Line. Besides excellent benefits, we offer a competitive compensation package, career growth, and a hybrid working model. Our culture has been described as a “we culture”. We’re a team building an amazing, successful product and company.  At ChaosSearch, we are committed to building and fostering a culture where everyone feels included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to create a better experience for everyone. However you identify and whatever background you bring, please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come to work each day.

Base Salary (doe) and commission Should make 6 figures. You should have good time management skills, good people skills, and be able to get past the gatekeeper.  We offer: Company Phone Company Vehicle Health Insurance Dental Insurance Paid Holiday Paid Vacation Paid Sick Days

Company Description  Since 2004, Mandiant has been a trusted partner to security-conscious organizations. Effective security is based on the right combination of expertise, intelligence, and adaptive technology, and the Mandiant Advantage SaaS platform scales decades of frontline experience and industry-leading threat intelligence to deliver a range of dynamic cyber defense solutions. Mandiant’s approach helps organizations develop more effective and efficient cyber security programs and instills confidence in their readiness to defend against and respond to cyber threats.  Job Description  As the Sr Director, SLED Sales you will be responsible for leading a sales team of highly skilled, seasoned sales professionals throughout the US. You must possess strong leadership skills and the ability to build a complex sales strategy to ensure both short- and long-term goals, objectives, and quotas. You will act as the front-line executive who recruits, hires, develops, and manages a specialized, competency sales team. In addition, you will work closely with new as well as established channel partners to generate new business opportunities.  Responsibilities: Supporting direct reports by participating and leading in client and prospect meetings within assigned regions. Proven ability to work effectively with and across all levels of business and IT contacts within very large and complex organizations Extensive experience negotiating large 7 figure deals with extremely complex terms, conditions, price pressures and considerations History of coordination within an internal set of multi-functional teams such as Systems Engineers, Inside Reps, Field Marketing, Professional Services, and Channel Management to ensure target quotas as achieved and exceeded Conducting weekly forecast meetings. Coach direct reports regarding strategies to drive closure Reporting on sales activity and forecast to senior sales management  Qualifications  Requirements: 5+ years of high-level management experience of 5 or more direct reports in a fast paced, highly competitive, ever-changing software sales environment Minimum of 10 years in a quota carrying software sales role with demonstrated achievement Ability to travel 30 – 50% of the time  Additional Qualifications: Excellent presentation and listening skills Must be able to thrive in a very fast paced environment  Additional Information  At FireEye we are committed to our #OneTeam approach combining diversity, collaboration, and excellence. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, sex, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, protected veteran status, or on the basis of disability.
