Reporting directly to the President, Flight Solutions Group, this senior level position will head the sales organization to maximize airframe, engine, and helicopter business revenue, asset acquisition, consignment, lease and service-related opportunities, for the Company, as assigned in the entire Americas region.  Responsibilities Provide leadership and vision in developing and executing strategic sales and services, as well as potential product line development to meet revenue and margins targets in the United States, Canada, Caribbean, and Latin America region Manage, attract, retain and develop a high performing sales team and culture capable of advancement and supporting Company goals and directives Build and leverage customer relationships at the highest levels, including the CEO/COO/VP of airlines, to identify new opportunities and create long-term partnerships Devise innovative and customer centric solutions while utilizing best practices across business units Ensure process and procedure adherence at all levels to support all Quality system compliance Achieve customer management targets as it relates key metrics for customer satisfaction, retention, and growth Achieve cross-selling targets with 4 additional business units including MRO, Engine MRO, Asset Management and Digital platforms, and build the GA Telesis brand as the leading global integrated aviation solutions provider Collaborate with the product line and services leaders to provide wholistic solutions to address customers' needs. Provide definitive customer planning and maintenance schedules into all product line teams to ensure a continuous pipeline of product to be available for sales. Budget a quarterly / yearly AOP sales forecast while ensure maximum growth of the region in line with business unit expectations Increase yearly lease, repair management and flight hour service programs to maximize inventory utilization and overall revenues/margins associated with such programs Coordinate all sales and relevant sourcing activities for the region together with the COO to ensure the highest level of on-time delivery and customer satisfaction Requirements 10+ years' experience in a Sales Leadership role in aviation Proven business thinker with exceptional strategic skills and capacity to understand the business from a market and P&L prospective Excellent commercial skills, including negotiating and closing complex international contracts Proven ability to develop peer relationships with C-Suite contacts in the region Significant existing network of industry executives Able to travel 50%+

Benefitfocus Inc.  Benefitfocus (NASDAQ: BNFT) is a growing national software company, founded and headquartered in Charleston, South Carolina. We provide industry-leading cloud-based benefits management solutions that simplify how organizations and individuals shop for, enroll in, manage and exchange benefits. At Benefitfocus we are driven by the impact we make in the lives of our customers, and we value our Associates as our #1 asset to our success.  Benefitfocus is looking to add a Sales Development Representative to our Charleston, SC based team. This is a remote opportunity. The Sales Development Representative is responsible for generating interest in our Benefitfocus solutions and for cultivating new sales opportunities for our Employer Account Executives. The ideal candidate will have strong communication skills, customer facing experience, and a solution oriented mindset.  Generate New Sales Opportunities Source new sales opportunities through inbound campaign follow up and outbound cold calls, emails, and LinkedIn messages Drive conversion of suspect to prospect through account research, identifying key players and generating interest in Benefitfocus solutions Route qualified prospects to appropriate Account Executive with validated account information Develop sales team relationships and processes to ensure efficient lead passing and timely follow up to develop prospects Collaborate with area sales teams to manage the suspect / prospect pipeline for additional activity Effectively Supporting Marketing Initiatives Re-qualify incoming leads from trade shows, events, Web and other sales/marketing activities Follow up on direct AE sales activities to include - drops, targeted letters/ email, local events Collaborate with AEs to source valuable account information in Salesforce Partner with local AE to build targeted strategic campaigns Drive cross selling activities in customer base - media sales, portal, communications Demonstrate Technical, Product & Industry Expertise Be proficient in our CRM, Salesforce.com and Salesforce Engage. Dedicated to data quality and meticulous population of key sales information Have the ability to provide an overview of Benefitfocus Portfolio of Products & Services in written form and verbally. Must know how to answer basic questions about our service offerings. Demonstrate ability to articulate Benefitfocus value messaging. Devote to continuous learning of industry - trends, competitors, market Experience in Microsoft Excel, Hoovers, Zoominfo, and MiEdge Experience And Skills High energy level: make large number of calls and targeted emails daily Self motivated: set personal goals (activities, results, income) and track success Dedication to quality Team player: share best practices, contribute to team success, build internal partnerships Time management: ability to multi task and manage time effectively to achieve weekly and monthly goals Results oriented: understand where you are against all established goals, make corrections and adjustments accordingly Creative: use tools, campaigns, events to deliver successful results across a variety of accounts and industries. Demonstrate ability to tailor messaging and approach. Strong interpersonal skills: must be able to build positive relationships both internally and externally to achieve success Bachelor's Degree. SaaS/HCM industry knowledge is preferred. Experience working with Account Executives Excellent knowledge and utilization of Salesforce for accurate pipeline and account management. Excellent verbal and written communication skills and interpersonal skills Solution oriented mindset; overcome sales objections

Overview  Userful is growing and we are expanding our sales teams globally. We are looking for energetic people who thrive working in a fast-paced startup environment following up with people who contact us—over the phone and by email.  This is an excellent entry-level Sales Development Representative (SDR) opportunity with potential to develop into a team lead position within 6 months.  This position will include qualifying inbound leads, scheduling product demos and logging customer project data into the CRM in order to transfer highly qualified leads to the sales team to close.  You will be supported by a very tenured team from marketing, sales, product marketing, and others to help you be successful.  Responsibilities Strategizing, Qualifying inbound leads and ensuring that the highest quality leads are provided to the sales organization. Interacting by phone, email and LinkedIn with key customer personnel up to, and including, C-Level executives. Analyzing customer business needs, understanding processes, identifying projects, determining requirements and ascertaining potential solutions. Acquiring and maintaining a working knowledge of the complete capabilities of our product. Log contacts, conversations, and accounts in CRM system. Achieve targets for booking meetings on behalf of our sales organization. Provide effective back-up support to key phases in the sales process. Establishing yourself as an expert in the above responsibilities, and demonstrating leadership capabilities to advance to team lead position. Qualifications 1 year of sales experience, past SDR or SaaS sales experience preferred. Highly motivated and competitive with desire to advance to a leadership role. Organized and process driven. Thrive on working in a fast-paced environment. Effective when working independently and in team environments. Strong business judgment and common sense. Excellent English communication (verbal, written, and presentation) Spanish communication (verbal, written, and presentation) is an asset. Working Conditions  This job will be 40 hours per week, in an office setting at Userful’s downtown Calgary office.  Remuneration  We offer a competitive package comprising salary, stock options, and health benefits plan. Regular work weeks consist of forty hours with flex time, as Userful strives to support a work-life balance. A health benefit plan, gym, friendly corporate environment, connection to the +15 on the second floor, and many other incentives are included for all of our employees.  Our Commitment to Equal Opportunity and Diversity  Hiring decisions are based on qualifications, job requirements, and business needs. All applicants are considered regardless of race, religious beliefs, gender, gender expression, physical disability, mental disability, age, national origin, marital status, or sexual orientation. Accommodation for applicants with disabilities is also available on request during the recruitment process.  Userful has a Zero Tolerance policy and is opposed to all forms of harassment or retaliation, including sexual, racial, and ethnic or religious harassment, regardless of whether the harassment or retaliation occurs directly or indirectly.  Come join us at Userful! Take advantage of the onsite, full-equipped gym and access to the +15!  Job originally posted on GrabJobs. If you need to report this job please contact GrabJobs

Our values are reflected in everything we do - it's what sets us apart.  The United States is a high potential, high growth market for Page Group and we are investing now for our future growth. We have a proven track record of growth led by a highly experienced senior management team. Our emphasis on organic career growth starts with our world-class training, which spans across your entire career trajectory. With over 150 locations worldwide, we provide excellent career advancement potential, both locally and beyond.  Description  All Recruitment Consultants at Michael Page operate in 360 degree roles, proactively headhunting candidates whilst developing and establishing new business relationships. This position consists of a competitive base salary coupled with uncapped financial earning and career potential that is second to none. Those that have leadership experience and / or demonstrate the potential to lead teams will have the ability to fast track.    As a Recruitment Consultant, you will:  Manage your own portfolio of clients and candidates, both existing and new Build close partnerships with clients and help their business grow by developing and delivering the best solutions for attracting candidates Search, source, and screen potential candidates, utilizing multiple online resources Manage the process from interview through offer stage Conduct in-person interviews to thoroughly evaluate candidates Be responsible for "hunting" new business opportunities and lead generation Have an involvement in proposal process by developing and pitching proposals Negotiate commercial terms of business and rates Profile  Ideal candidates will possess the following:  Ability to think strategically, execute effectively, and deliver high quality jobTitle: Strategic Inside Sales Representative - Uber for Business
description: About The Role  We're looking for an experienced and driven Strategic Inside Sales Representative to support our Uber for Business Strategic sales team. This high-impact position will provide sales support to Strategic Account Executives through the development of qualified leads that result in achieving our business goals. You will be calling upon our largest, and most strategic client accounts. This role will serve as a training ground for a pathway into an Account Executive position with demonstrated success.  You'll be responsible for conducting outbound prospecting campaigns (both call and email). Develop rapport with contacts in an effort to understand where the prospect is in the buying cycle. Work with Strategic Account Executives, to ensure that the leads provided accurately qualified and will progress through the sales funnel. This involves gathering key information to update our Salesforce system and identifying next steps for Strategic Account Executives to connect with these prospects and overall Account Global expansion.  What You'll Do Generate new business opportunities in an assigned vertical or territory and partner with assigned Strategic Account Executives Develop our largest Strategic accounts Outbound prospecting via targeted calling, email, and marketing campaigns Build and execute on strategic and measurable demand generation campaigns Uncover a prospect's business challenges and identify new business opportunities, while highlighting the Uber for Business value proposition Conduct high-level conversations with senior executives Manage, track, and report on all sales activities and results using Salesforce Work closely with sales management to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities for new business Collaborate with the sales team to share best practices and make recommendations to more effectively close sales and ensure customer loyalty Work effectively with internal departments to deliver the best solution for the client and ensure an excellent experience Travel to attend trade shows or other client meetings when requested or necessary Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree required Preferred Qualifications 3+ years of experience cold-calling and sales/business development experience Experience with prospecting and closing transactional deals Experience using a CRM (ex: Salesforce) to manage daily activities Experience with email campaigns and Salesforce preferred Ability to build extraordinary customer relationships Salesforce, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, Zoom Info and Groove experience preferred Excellent communication skills Ability to multitask, prioritize, and manage time efficiently Have a positive, self-driven team-first mentality with a desire to learn

description: GitLab's DevOps platform empowers 100,000+ organizations to deliver software faster and more efficiently. We are one of the world’s largest all-remote companies with 1,400+ team members and values that guide a culture where people embrace the belief that everyone can contribute .  This position is 100% remote, based in North America.  GitLab is looking for an enthusiastic and strategic Sales Development Representative (SDR), to join our growing Revenue Marketing team. As a SDR at GitLab, you get the opportunity to lead the initial outreach to targeted Enterprise accounts working in conjunction with the Field and Digital Marketing teams. In this role you will leverage creative marketing and sales tactics to prospect and engage with multiple buyer personas and roles to introduce GitLab’s value. You will be responsible for generating qualified meetings and pipeline for GitLab's Sales organization.  Don’t have a ton of knowledge about GitLab yet? Don’t worry. We have an extensive onboarding and training program at GitLab and you will be provided with necessary DevOps and GitLab knowledge to fulfill your role.  What you'll do in this role Effectively manage inbound lead flow as well as executing outbound prospecting initiative Conduct high-level discovery conversations in target accounts Meet or exceed SDR sourced Sales Accepted Opportunity (SAO) volume targets Collaborate with and leverage teammates to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities Utilize business and industry knowledge to research accounts, identify key players, generate interest, create/identify compelling events, and develop accounts Work to have a variety of touches (call, email, social, etc.) on all leads in your assigned territory using Outreach.io Manage, track, and report on all activities and results using Salesforce Participate in documenting all processes in the GitLab handbook and update as needed with your Sales Development Manager Work in collaboration with Field and Corporate Marketing to drive attendance at regional marketing events Attend field marketing events to engage with participants identify opportunities, and to schedule meetings Act as a mentor for new SDR hires in helping them navigate their key accounts Work in collaboration with Digital Marketing to develop targeted marketing tactics against your assigned target accounts We’re a diverse team and we’re looking for you to bring your own unique flavor to the SDR role! We're looking for Someone excited by the prospect of working cross-functionally with sales and different marketing departments. You'll have exposure to different departments like Sales, Marketing, Finance, Recruiting, Enablement, Engineering, etc. which will help you determine your career path at GitLab. Positive and energetic phone skills, excellent listening skills, strong writing skills A self-starter with a track record of successful, credible achievements Knowledge of business process, roles, and organizational structure Determined personality with a desire to grow and win Passionate about being a part of GitLab’s journey Proficient in using Salesforce and LinkedIn 2+ years work experience in a professional environment Previous tech industry experience or experience in sales development, marketing and/or sales is a plus Outbound prospecting experience is a plus Globally we require excellent written and spoken English which is our company language Ability to use GitLab A shared interest in our values , and working in accordance with those values Also, we know it’s tough, but please try to avoid the confidence gap . You don’t have to match all the listed requirements exactly to be considered for this role.  Hiring Process  To view the full job description and hiring process, please view our handbook . Additional details about our process can also be found on our hiring page .  Remote-Americas  Country Hiring Guidelines  GitLab hires new team members in countries around the world. All of our roles are remote, however some roles may carry specific location-based eligibility requirements. Our Talent Acquisition team can help answer any questions about location after starting the recruiting process.  Your Privacy  For information about our privacy practices in the recruitment process, please visit our Recruitment Privacy Policy page.

description: Experiencing together a unique human adventure  Animal health is key to the health of the planet. Working at Virbac means taking part in a unique human adventure in which the engagement of each individual contributes to its evolution. Encouraging internal mobility between positions and countries, offering individual development plans and building a partnership based on trust between managers and employees are as many perspectives of motivation for our teams. We also offer them a work environment conducive to exploring new territories and balancing their professional and personal lives. Finally, fostering their engagement to animal health also means listening to them and helping them to acquire new skills, preparing them for the challenges of tomorrow and encouraging them to contribute to an ever more responsible approach to our business.      Essential skills for the position:    Demonstrate Customer Focus    Communicate Effectively    Manage execution showing drive and results orientation    Establish efficient plans    Analyze problems and situations    Make sound and courageous decisions    Demonstrate ability to adapt and develop personal skills    Cross-Functional Relationships : which may impact the job's activities    Daily contact with veterinary professionals in veterinary practices. Exposure to dogs and cats is regular and continual.    Contact with second tier customers such as distributor management, distributor representatives (inside and outside)    Contact with Virbac sales management, sales support and inside sales representatives.    Contact with other Virbac Departments (marketing, technical services).    Context and Environment: main threats and/or opportunities that impact the job; level of autonomy of the job    Threat: continued weakness or worsening of the national economy Opportunity: sales expansion plans over next three years will result in a dynamic territory, but will enable TM to focus on smaller number of customers Successful candidates in this position will exhibit a degree of autonomy in self-motivation, self-reliance and independent thinking in order to achieve sales goals. Communication with peers and managers is important, as is adhering to company policies and procedures.    Training / Experience necessary to fulfill the job    Educational level or equivalent experience:    Bachelor's Degree required    Total number of years' experience required to fulfil the role:    3 - 5 years experience in a selling or marketing role    Career pre-requisites:    1 - 2 years experience in an animal health or human health field

How Will You Make An Impact  Management of business development, key commercial accounts and commercial liaison within the LPD OEM business portfolio. Key tasks and responsibilities for this position include but not limited to: building a ‘partner’ relationship with all business users within assigned areas, defining customer requirements & scoping of new opportunities for Business Team review, developing capabilities presentations, managing key contracts, management of overall communications with customer and conducting business reviews (QBR). The candidate shall lead internal cross functional team meetings to accomplish goals and commitments made to the strategic customers and communicate status and issues to customers regularly. This role is considered a key member of the respective business and OEM Commercial team(s) and must have the vision, drive, and interpersonal skills to succeed in a growth environment. The candidate will be a “hands on” account management professional operating with a sense of ownership.  What Will You Do Build strong customer allegiance and partnership, Key Accounts as assigned Manage estimated 3-5 Key Accounts Evaluate and lead all new business development opportunities for LPD OEM Manage contract renewals, price strategies and commercial initiatives to drive growth target of 3% per annum Expand LSG portfolio breadth within account, where possible Evaluate and lead all new business opportunities for LPD OEM projects Lead QBR reviews internal and with customers Provide strategic inputs for product and technology roadmap Commercial and Technical lead for customer interaction prior to full NPD project team assignment BU, Division or corporate leadership approval on all proposals and quotations Drive quotation teams from all LPD manufacturing sites as needed to prepare proposals and quotations for LPD OEM solutions Global travel to support regional commercial teams on presenting capabilities and driving opportunity for new projects (with approval). How Will You Get There 5 plus years of sales experience managing large complex accounts strongly preferred Experience within the Biotech industry strongly preferred BS degree in Science, Business, Engineering strongly preferred Minimum required education: Bachelor degree or Associate degree with 2 years of experience or high school diploma/GED with 4 years of relevant experience Position may require Covid-19 vaccination and/or routing testing, per client discretion Experience Qualifications Demonstrated success and experience working within matrix organizations Demonstrated ability to operate independently with initiative, objective attainment intensity, and solid business judgment Proven ability to sell creative solutions to high level customer personnel Demonstrated excellence in oral and written communications skills Strong organizational and time management skills with good orientation to detail Strong technical, business, and financial acumen Highly effective negotiation skills Sophisticated level of computer proficiency Benefits A choice of national medical and dental plans, and a national vision plan Diversity & Inclusion council and Employee Resource Groups including Women’s Group, LGBTQA, African Heritage, Veteran's, and Working Parents Tax-advantaged savings and spending accounts and commuter benefits Fleet vehicle At least 120 hours paid time off (PTO), 10 paid holidays annually, paid parental leave (3 weeks for bonding and 8 weeks for caregiver leave), accident and life insurance, short- and long-term disability, and volunteer time off in accordance with company policy Retirement and savings programs, such as our competitive 401(k) U.S. retirement savings plan Employees’ Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP) offers eligible colleagues the opportunity to purchase company stock at a discount At Thermo Fisher Scientific, each one of our 80,000 extraordinary minds has a unique story to tell. Join us and contribute to our singular mission—enabling our customers to make the world healthier, cleaner and safer.

description: Job Description  Work with the brightest minds, and industry-leading solutions, to help customers solve the business challenges that stand in the way of their growth and success!  Oracle is a fast-paced, collaborative environment passionate about creating customer success. We offer the most comprehensive, cloud-based technology. At Oracle, learning is constant. We develop our workforce through training, mentoring and internal mobility opportunities to help everyone succeed and achieve their aspirations.  Join us in identifying, progressing, and closing opportunities in established high profile organizations and be a part of the exciting transformation to the cloud!  Our Solutions: https://www.oracle.com/cloud/  Your Role You will be responsible for identifying, progressing and encouraging long-term strategic relationships within specialized industry verticals such as; Financial Services, Utilities, Communications, Healthcare, Oil & Gas, Logistics. You will develop a robust project pipeline and handle account planning, creating, owning and forecasting You will be the trusted advisor and influencer in winning customer decisions to buy, architect and adopt Oracle solutions. You will understand what motivates customers to buy and know how to tap into those needs in an effective way. You will work across the Oracle ecosystems and our technology partners to transform customer organizations and build enduring capabilities. What You Will Do Master and share the “why Oracle story” that represents the value we provide to customers with our unified, multi-pillar offerings. Nurture client relationships by building trust, partnership and an emotional connection to the Oracle brand and team. Build and execute key sales and business development initiatives to improve awareness of Oracle OCI and increase sales pipeline. Successfully prospect into your assigned accounts to discover, and develop viable selling opportunities. Gain access and build relationships with key executives and decision makers. Initiate and manage complex sales cycles, leveraging the support and strengths of key internal partners (Pre-Sales, Product Management, Executives and Industry Global Business Units to name a few). Travel as required. About You You have an entrepreneurial spirit, and thrive in a dynamic environment You are creative You excel in a team-selling environment You are driven You have deep experience selling SaaS, IaaS, PaaS, Database You have experience selling to the C-suite, engineering and DevOps You are familiar with open source and other cloud tools (Dockers, Kubernetes, Terraform, Linux, Java) You are solutions-oriented You are inventive You are results-oriented You have a track-record of success selling complex solutions and exceeding expectations You are committed to continuous learning You are confident You have expertise in building business value proposals What You’ll Bring You demonstrate sound independent judgment, initiative, collaboration and leadership You exhibit outstanding written, verbal, presentation and negotiation skills Your sales experience has a proven record of accomplishment of selling to large, complex accounts, working with C-level executives, qualifying prospects, solving problems and generating positive customer outcomes. You have 3+ years of relevant work experience with a Bachelor’s degree Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to a large number of named accounts/non-named accounts/geographical territory (mainly Tier 3 accounts).  Primary job duty is to sell technology software products and related services in a defined territory. Identifies, qualifies and closes new opportunities. Manages accounts including the entire sales process from business development prospecting and specifications through contract negotiations, signing, and post-sales support. Leverages the Oracle sales model to maximize revenue growth and increase local market share. Builds and expands business partner revenue and self sufficiency.  Job duties are varied and complex, needing independent judgment. May have project lead role. 5 years field sales experience including technology sales experience. Ability to forecast, manage sales expenses, and successfully close new Oracle business. Business development, prospecting and presentation skills. Excellent communication skills and problem solving ability. Proven track record of exceeding sales objective and territory/account development. Experience as the focal point for clients for all sales and related issues. Oracle knowledge and/or knowledge of Oracle's competitors. Travel may be needed. Bachelor degree or equivalent.  If you are a Colorado resident, Please Contact us or Email us at oracle-salary-inquiries_us@oracle.com to receive compensation and benefits information for this role. Please include this Job ID: 124356 in the subject line of the email.  About Us  Innovation starts with inclusion at Oracle. We are committed to creating a workplace where all kinds of people can be themselves and do their best work. It’s when everyone’s voice is heard and valued, that we are inspired to go beyond what’s been done before. That’s why we need people with diverse backgrounds, beliefs, and abilities to help us create the future, and are proud to be an affirmative-action equal opportunity employer.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. Oracle will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records pursuant to applicable law.

Curated connects people who are shopping online for skiing/snowboarding equipment with qualified, knowledgeable ski and snowboard sales Experts who can help them find the perfect gear. Discounts on 2021/2022 gear Sponsored events in cities with 10+ Experts Gear giveaways and insider promos Access to demo days Powered by JazzHR  w3uE8t0fA6

You will excel in this role if you are a: Great socializer who enjoys talking to people of all walks of life Have expertise as a skier and snowboarder with high knowledge about the equipment involved Patient salesperson who can work with everyone regardless of their skill levels Gearhead who enjoys learning, using, and explaining industry terminology with coworkers and customers Requirements: Promptness and effective communication skills Assisting several different customers while browsing multiple websites to find the right setup Educating customers about ski equipment and its usage Friendly attitude Winter sports Junkie Some Added Perks: Keep 100% of customer tips! Discounts on 2021/2022 gear Sponsored events in cities with 10+ Experts Gear giveaways and insider promos Access to demo days Powered by JazzHR  h5WNzAcnHK

description: We are looking for an energetic business development associate to help drive ourselves and grow the business. The business. You will attract new clients and build solid relationships with them while maintaining existing relationships.  The successful applicant will be resourceful, organized and motivated to increase sales, enhance the company's reputation, and look for new and creative ways to market our services with our lead system.. A background in sales and marketing is strongly desirable.  Responsibilities Willing to familiarize yourself with the company's vision and mission, seeking to accomplish set goals and objectives. Cultivating stronger relationships with new clients via our lead system, while maintaining existing client relationships. Collating and maintaining client information in the CRM database. Working closely with staff across departments to implement growth strategies. Developing and implementing cell strategies, client service and retention plans, and analyzing sales data to inform or update marketing strategies. Demonstrate strong interpersonal skills with the ability to engage effectively with various levels of management, staff, and clients. Requirements 1 to 2 years relevant work experience and business development or similar field preferred. Excellent written and verbal communication skills Is ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously and work under pressure. Strong organization and project management skills. Friendly and personable demeanor. Proficient in Microsoft office and relevant software. Employment Type: Full Time  Years Experience: 1 - 3 years  Salary: $50,000 - $180,000 Annual  Bonus/Commission: Yes

Job Location: Portland, ME Must be willing to reside in Portland, ME or Manchester NH Summary  The Retail Sales Representative will ensure flawless execution of store level sales and promotion plans with customer retailers in assigned territory. The territory consists of high volume food chain grocers and mass merchandiser customers. The RSR masters retail execution plans by driving incremental sales, implementing and maintaining best-in-class promotional and merchandising strategies, and ensuring 100% distribution on authorized Hershey items across all classes of trade.  Responsibilities  Drive Customer Points of Sale through Consultative Business Partnering  Customer Relationship Development and Management: Build and maintain consultative business relationships with customer Key Decision Makers (KDMs) at all levels. Partner with KDMs to develop and execute a detailed action plan to increase and improve sales results within their stores based on sales analytics and best practices. Cultivate a network of influential contacts at all levels of internal and external customers to achieve sales objectives within assigned territory. Use strategic relationship with KDMs to influence and negotiate customers’ assistance in the merchandising of Hershey products.  Data Analysis and Sales Call Preparation: Prepare for retail sales calls by obtaining and analyzing relevant store, product and market data and creating effective selling tools and presentations for KDM delivery during call. Utilize and complete pre-call planning methods and other company tools. Review and make recommendations to the District sales manager to modify routes that maximize business efficiencies for all sales calls within territory.  Sales: Engage in forward selling utilizing consultative sales techniques of predetermined customer sales plans with store and market KDMs in every retail sales call, using provided data sources, technology, processes and procedures. Maximize sales and display opportunities by conducting store walk-throughs and gaining commitment by KDMs on successful outcomes. Tailor selling and consultative strategies to influence KDMs to order additional products to increase incremental sales and to obtain best in class quality of merchandising locations of promotional products.  Merchandising  Achieve all merchandising objectives executing customer specific promotional plans through the effective use of forward selling and maintaining permanent secondary displays and other display vehicles established within the Retail Execution Plan. Insure new items are placed on the shelf and out of stocks are addressed and corrected in every call.  Administrative Responsibilities  Complete and submit electronic and/or written reports of daily and weekly activities, expenses, competitive activity, account changes, promotions and all administrative functions within assigned territory using company approved methods and technology  Strategy Development & Process Improvement  Develop and recommend strategies aimed to improve the overall effectiveness of the territory, district and/or area business activities. As requested, drive advocate partnerships within the assigned category. This is a non-exhaustive list of duties, as some RSRs may perform additional or different duties depending on, among other things, their education, work experience, assigned supervisor, personal preferences, customers, territory, and other factors. Moreover, depending on these and other factors, different RSRs may devote more or less time to any given responsibility. Qualifications  Education and Experience: Bachelors Degree Preferred. Bachelors Degree or HS Diploma/GED and 3 or more years recent sales or customer service experience required.  Minimum knowledge, skills and abilities required to successfully perform major duties/responsibilities: Must have a valid US state issued driver’s license Must reside within territory boundaries Must be able to drive long distances to make multiple sales calls on a daily basis Must be able to work occasional weekends and overnight stays as required by the territory Must be able to lift 10-40 lbs. on a regular basis with or without reasonable accommodations Must be able to bend, kneel, stoop down and demonstrate manual dexterity on a frequent basis with or without reasonable accommodations Must be able to use tablet technology; some roles will require an intermediate level of computer skills with the Microsoft Office products Must have daily access to wireless internet Must have flexibility and adaptability to changes in territory coverage The Hershey Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer. The policy of The Hershey Company is to extend opportunities to qualified applicants and employees on an equal basis regardless of an individual's race, color, gender, age, national origin, religion, citizenship status, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, transgender status, physical or mental disability, protected veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other categories protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.  The Hershey Company is an Equal Opportunity Employer - Minority/Female/Disabled/Protected Veterans

description: Job Description  Job Title: Sales Representative  Branch: Deerfield Beach, FL  Department: Sales  Reports to (Title): Sales Manager  Date: 09/02/2021  BASIC FUNCTION  Primary Responsibility: The Sales Representative is responsible for working in assigned territory, maintain relationships, expand/upgrade equipment/system usage, and take orders from existing customers and secure new customers by calling or visiting customers and prospects. Meet or exceed projected dollar volumes in terms of sales and profitability, as well as meeting activity requirements. Do appropriate planning and paperwork in support of sales function.  WORK PERFORMED  ADA DUTY % TIME  E  Secure orders from existing and potential customers by means of visiting. The customer facility or contacting by phone:  v Secure opportunities to quote on customer requirements  v Follow up (by phone or visit) on quotations submitted to customers  v Establish professional customer/vendor relationships with appropriate customer personnel (purchasing, engineering, manufacturing, quality assurance, management and other key personnel)  v Meet activity requirements and quotas as outlined in compensation program and as directed by management  85%  E  Submit weekly activity/call reports concerning customer-related activities for quotes, orders and other problems concerning customer/vendor relationships. Provide lost business reports; territory sales forecasts as required.  10%  E  Perform Other Duties As Required  5%  Education Requirements Bachelors degree or equivalent professional experience. Experience Requirements  A minimum of two (2) to five (5) years outside B2B sales experience, preferably on a commission basis. Related industry experience preferred.  Additional Skills Required Ability to work independently and as part of a sales team. Excellent communication skills Self-motivated Self-starter Sense of urgency Personable Extroverted personality Well organized Good time management skills and ability to learn new technologies WORK ENVIRONMENT Work in areas which require attention to detail in a varied environment. General office environment. May spend long hours sitting or standing. Some physical effort is required which may involve bending, reaching, stretching, or similar activities as well as lifting or moving items weighing up to 60 pounds Requires a valid state driver's license and minimum level of auto insurance coverage per company policy for position entails extensive use of personal car while on company business. Special Requirements Employee must complete required courses as described by Human Resources for all employees. This description presents the major responsibilities required for this job title. Individual positions may require the performance of additional duties as assigned. Requires a valid state driver's license and minimum level of auto insurance coverage per company policy for position entails extensive use of personal car while on company business. MUST BE ABLE TO PASS A DRUG SCREEN AND BACKGROUND CHECK BUDGET RESPONSIBILITY Secure and maintain work environment; PC, Phone and other assigned equipment.

Job Description  Sells a subset of product or services directly or via partners to small-and-medium sized accounts. The role is a combination of a Field Sales Rep and Inside Sales Rep.  Works to achieve maximum sales profitability, growth, and account penetration within an assigned territory. Territory may be combination of geographic, product, industry and other customer / market dimensions. Sells to the territory directly or via partners. The territory that this rep covers does not have an Inside Sales Rep or Field Rep. Utilizes inbound and/or outbound techniques to identify, qualify and close new opportunities. Manages accounts throughout the entire sales process, and collaborates with team members in business development, consulting and support to uncover all customer needs. Responsible for understanding Oracle's product offerings and competitive issues to develop solution proposals encompassing all aspects of the application. Travels to customer sites to identify / develop sales opportunities. Participates in the development, presentation, and sales of a value proposition. Onsite customer presentation with C-levels to negotiate and close strategic and complex deals. Liaises with customer contacts for the purpose of managing the customer relationship, identifying new opportunities and maximizing sales.  Duties and tasks are standard with some variation. Completes own role largely independently within defined policies and procedures. Successful sales track record. Oracle knowledge and/or knowledge of Oracle's competitors. Interaction with C level players. Team player. Ability to penetrate accounts and meet with stakeholders within accounts. Excellent communication, negotiating, and closing skills. Strong marketing skills. Travels to customer as needed. 2 or more years of relevant sales experience. BA/BS degree or equivalent preferred.If you are a Colorado resident, Please Contact us or Email us at oracle-salary-inquiries_us@oracle.com to receive compensation and benefits information for this role. description: TERRITORY: Southwest Region  Company Description  Santen is a specialized pharmaceutical company with a 130-year heritage focused exclusively on ophthalmology. With sales in over 60 countries, Santen’s 4,000 global employees work to deliver life-changing therapies that make hope a reality for people facing vision impairment and loss. Santen Inc., located in Emeryville, CA (North America HQ), contributes important research & development and commercialization efforts. This office is home to about half of our 300-total staff in North America, including our Toronto, Canada site and our recent acquisitions of Eyevance Pharmaceuticals (Fort Worth, TX) and InnFocus (Miami, FL).  About Eyevance  Since inception in 2017, Eyevance remains dedicated to advancing ocular health through the development and commercialization of innovative and impactful topical ophthalmic products targeting the ocular surface and anterior segment that enable optimal vision and better quality of life, while also ensuring patient access for all patients throughout the U.S. In September 2020, Eyevance was acquired by Santen.  About The Position  This position reports directly to the Vice President of Sales.  This individual must have a passion for building and leading high performing teams that deliver exceptional results. The role will hire mentor, coach, counsel, co-travel and train field sales personnel. They should also be experienced at coaching and presenting detailed scientific subject matter in a clear and understandable fashion. Must be a driven professional with sound business aptitude and adaptable to a dynamic startup environment.  Essential Responsibilities Responsible for building, developing and leading a field sales team consisting of: Ophthalmic Territory Managers (OTM’s) Coach/mentor field sales team externally, through co-traveling, to evaluate them based on a benchmark measurement system Works closely with Sales Operations, Marketing and Market Access Responsible for the understanding and utilization of sales reports, CRM, and TRx/financial forecasts Responsible for managing Regional Sales / Expense budgets Responsible for coaching and training the sales model to the sales team Responsible for meeting monthly, quarterly, and yearly sales goals Works with Human Resources and management to develop sales team policies. Ensures adherence to those and any Eyevance corporate policies as appropriate Works closely with Sales Training to execute a POA at Regional and National Sales meetings Leads all regional sales activities including personnel matters Attend and represent Company at industry conferences/congresses Metrics Expected to achieve financial and TRx goals for assigned region. Language And Communication Skills Interacts at multiple levels inside and outside the company Tact, diplomacy, and a high level of professionalism are essential Exhibits good listening skills and comprehension Requirements Bachelor’s degree with 5+ years documented successful pharmaceutical/biotech/medical device commercial sales experience Additionally, 3+ years of experience preferred as a Regional or District Sales Manager (leading Sales Representatives or similar), or equivalent combination of education and experience Proven commercial acumen, with clear insight and understanding of the business market dynamics and the ability to accurately assess and convey this intelligence to inform plans and targets Experience in ophthalmics, marketing, managed care, and/or sales training is a plus Experience building sales teams/organizations from ground zero is a strong plus Must have exceptional talent selection skills, oral and written communication skills Executive presence and excellent presentation and organizational skills Ability to travel as necessary (overnight) and willingness to travel up to 50% Proficiency with MS Office applications (Word, Excel, PowerPoint) COVID-19 Vaccination Requirement: Santen requires anyone working on-site or visiting company offices to confirm they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless a medical or religious accommodation is timely requested and approved. Please reach out if you have questions or concerns about this policy and how it may apply to your candidacy for a role with Santen.  For more information about our company and the work experience, please visit www.eyevance.com , www.santenusa.com and https://www.santenusa.com/career-culture .

GitLab's DevOps platform empowers 100,000+ organizations to deliver software faster and more efficiently. We are one of the world’s largest all-remote companies with 1,400+ team members and values that guide a culture where people embrace the belief that everyone can contribute .  This position is 100% remote, based in North America.  GitLab is looking for an enthusiastic and strategic Sales Development Representative (SDR), to join our growing Revenue Marketing team. As a SDR at GitLab, you get the opportunity to lead the initial outreach to targeted Enterprise accounts working in conjunction with the Field and Digital Marketing teams. In this role you will leverage creative marketing and sales tactics to prospect and engage with multiple buyer personas and roles to introduce GitLab’s value. You will be responsible for generating qualified meetings and pipeline for GitLab's Sales organization.  Don’t have a ton of knowledge about GitLab yet? Don’t worry. We have an extensive onboarding and training program at GitLab and you will be provided with necessary DevOps and GitLab knowledge to fulfill your role.  What you'll do in this role Effectively manage inbound lead flow as well as executing outbound prospecting initiative Conduct high-level discovery conversations in target accounts Meet or exceed SDR sourced Sales Accepted Opportunity (SAO) volume targets Collaborate with and leverage teammates to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities Utilize business and industry knowledge to research accounts, identify key players, generate interest, create/identify compelling events, and develop accounts Work to have a variety of touches (call, email, social, etc.) on all leads in your assigned territory using Outreach.io Manage, track, and report on all activities and results using Salesforce Participate in documenting all processes in the GitLab handbook and update as needed with your Sales Development Manager Work in collaboration with Field and Corporate Marketing to drive attendance at regional marketing events Attend field marketing events to engage with participants identify opportunities, and to schedule meetings Act as a mentor for new SDR hires in helping them navigate their key accounts Work in collaboration with Digital Marketing to develop targeted marketing tactics against your assigned target accounts We’re a diverse team and we’re looking for you to bring your own unique flavor to the SDR role! We're looking for Someone excited by the prospect of working cross-functionally with sales and different marketing departments. You'll have exposure to different departments like Sales, Marketing, Finance, Recruiting, Enablement, Engineering, etc. which will help you determine your career path at GitLab. Positive and energetic phone skills, excellent listening skills, strong writing skills A self-starter with a track record of successful, credible achievements Knowledge of business process, roles, and organizational structure Determined personality with a desire to grow and win Passionate about being a part of GitLab’s journey Proficient in using Salesforce and LinkedIn 2+ years work experience in a professional environment Previous tech industry experience or experience in sales development, marketing and/or sales is a plus Outbound prospecting experience is a plus Globally we require excellent written and spoken English which is our company language Ability to use GitLab A shared interest in our values , and working in accordance with those values Also, we know it’s tough, but please try to avoid the confidence gap . You don’t have to match all the listed requirements exactly to be considered for this role.  Hiring Process  To view the full job description and hiring process, please view our handbook . Additional details about our process can also be found on our hiring page .  Remote-Americas  Country Hiring Guidelines  GitLab hires new team members in countries around the world. All of our roles are remote, however some roles may carry specific location-based eligibility requirements. Our Talent Acquisition team can help answer any questions about location after starting the recruiting process.  Your Privacy  For information about our privacy practices in the recruitment process, please visit our Recruitment Privacy Policy page.

description: Job Description  Seeking qualified candidates from the mid west to the east coast to fill this Regional Medicare Sales Executive role  The Regional Medicare Sales Executive will assist in serving the mid west distribution as well as grow business and meet market plans.  You will develop and execute market level sales strategies for the broker and tele-sales distribution distribution of Aetna's Medicare Supplement and Ancillary products.  Required Qualifications  Demonstrated sales ability, travel ability (60% - 70% travel), negotiation skills, service and result oriented.  Preferred Qualifications  Well versed in Medicare and Medicare supplement experience, contract knowledge, communication and organizational skills.  Ability to conduct trainings and webinars.  Ability to identify market trends and use competitive intelligence analysis to drive sales growth.  Skilled in Excel and PowerPoint.  Education  Undergraduate degree preferred.  Business Overview  At Aetna, a CVS Health company, we are joined in a common purpose: helping people on their path to better health. We are working to transform health care through innovations that make quality care more accessible, easier to use, less expensive and patient-focused. Working together and organizing around the individual, we are pioneering a new approach to total health that puts people at the heart.  We are committed to maintaining a diverse and inclusive workplace. CVS Health is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We do not discriminate in recruiting, hiring or promotion based on race, ethnicity, gender, gender identity, age, disability or protected veteran status. We proudly support and encourage people with military experience (active, veterans, reservists and National Guard) as well as military spouses to apply for CVS Health job opportunities.

Boveda Inc. of Minneapolis, MN is seeking a qualified Sales Executive in the Cannabis Industry, local to Oklahoma, who will be responsible for developing and maintaining relationships with new and existing Boveda customers. This position offers a competitive base salary + commission and excellent benefits including medical, dental, vision and life insurance, a 401(k) plan with company match, and paid holidays. If this sounds like the leading-edge opportunity that you've been looking for, apply today!  A DAY IN THE LIFE AS A BOVEDA SALES EXECUTIVE  As a Boveda Sales Executive in the Cannabis industry, you strategically promote and sell Boveda products to meet our customers' needs. You confidently conduct product evaluations in field and office settings, persuasively demonstrating the value of our products. Systematically tracking your territory progress, you proactively communicate your findings with our Sales Manager-US and push yourself to exceed each goal. When onsite with clients, you use your product knowledge and quick thinking to solve problems. You take great pride in meticulously managing and maintaining your territory for both current and prospective customers. As a Boveda Sales Executive you love living in the fast lane and find purpose in the hunt.  Qualifications To Be Our Sales Executive - Cannabis Challenger. A person who seeks out the hard projects and works to find just the right solutions. Teammate. A partner who listens to ideas, shares thoughts and works together to move the business forward. Charismatic Networker. A relationships-savvy person who intentionally makes connections with both internal partners and external contacts. Strategic Closer. A Salesperson who closes profitable business and consistently exceeds his/her performance objectives. Customer-oriented Achiever. A representative with an unparalleled work ethic and customer-focused attitude who will bring value to their partnerships. Game Changer. A persistent Salesperson who will stop at nothing to live out Boveda's mission as the industry leader in Two-way Humidity Control. 5+ years in an outside sales position (B2B sales preferred) or a bachelor's degree from an Accredited University with at least 2+ years of outside sales experience Ability and willingness to work on weekends (about 25%) NetSuite or ERP experience is a plus, but it is not required. Do you have strong communication skills, both verbal and written? Are you aware of business trends? Can you work independently? Do you love closing deals? If so, we want you on our team!  About Boveda  Boveda is the original creator of 2-way humidity control packets used to protect moisture-sensitive products like cigars, cannabis and wooden instruments. Boveda's ready-to-use packets are made of a semipermeable membrane which contains a combination of all-natural salts and purified water. A simple product that effectively and consistently solves an everyday problem of moisture loss, as well as excess moisture. Becoming the global leader in any category doesn't happen overnight. Becoming the global leader in a category that didn't even exist is even harder. But that's exactly what Boveda did and continues to do since 1997.  Boveda's commitment to their clients involves producing tens of millions of 2-way humidity control packets getting shipped out each year to protect the finest cigars, regulate the environment of a favorite guitar and keep the terpenes in cannabis where they belong. That's a lot to expect out of a humble brown packet, but Boveda has dedicated more than 20 years to protecting people's passions.  Boveda's Values Reflect The Foundations Which Held Our Company From It's Very Beginnings And Continue To Support It As We Grow Our Sales And Develop Our Most Valuable Asset, Our Employees Be humble Do the right thing Never, ever, ever give up If you're curious about our company, possess the skill set we need and have a desire to learn and grow alongside world class employees, then definitely consider applying for an open position. Boveda is an equal opportunity employer and we are grateful to be able to offer competitive salaries, exceptional benefits and a culture that supports you as an employee and as an individual. If you would like to learn more about Boveda Inc. please visit our website at www.bovedainc.com

About Us  In 2010, StemExpress was created to change the entire life science and medical industry. We accelerate research and clinical trials through our expansive Stem Cell Collection Centers, state-of-the-art cell manufacturing laboratories, and by actively building the largest global network of hospitals and clinics. In doing this, we change the landscape of research and clinical projects, effectively, efficiently, and at the speed in which patients expect. That means new cures and treatments can reach patient care faster, giving months and years back to the people afflicted with serious medical conditions.  Our Mission  We accelerate the cure and prevention of significant medical conditions at life changing speed.  Our Values  We feel strongly that interpersonal behaviors are as important as technical aptitude. Thus, our values of Integrity, Curiosity, Accountability, Nimbleness, Drive and Ownership are represented by the acronym I CAN DO! In our fun and fast-paced environment, we bring the I CAN DO enthusiasm to everything we accomplish for each other and the amazing clients and patients that we serve.  The Team  The StemExpress Executive Team is driven to establish strategic focus, balance risk and innovation, anticipate future needs and opportunities, and ensure future sustainability of the organization. The Team takes an enterprise view, working together to push collaboration throughout the organization by listening and communicating effectively with trust and respect.  The Role: Duties and Essential Job Functions  The Vice President of Sales role encompasses a wide range of strategies to meet specific organizational objectives. This leader is a key member of the Executive Team responsible for managing all direct sales and distribution channels for the organization. They are responsible for developing the strategic sales plans based on company goals that will promote sales growth and customer satisfaction for the organization. Specific responsibilities include customer management, management of sales growth and customer satisfaction, sales team hiring and compensation plan development for the entire sales department through implementation to achieve company target forecast and goals. This leader will oversee the sales division and client service department.  To be successful, the Vice President of Sales will do the following: As a member of the company's Executive Team, lead company's planning and execution of strategies to increase sales and company growth. Responsible to lead the development and execution of a comprehensive sales strategy with the support of the marketing department. Drive revenue growth through the management of the Global Sales Manager and sales team to focus on customer and client expansion, territory growth, account penetration, product differentiation and sales team development to achieve revenue goals as assigned. Accountable for the sales team in identifying, evaluating, and developing customer and client prospects for new and existing business opportunities. Continue to develop and oversee the new client services function to streamline service and delivery for existing customers. Oversee all commercial marketing efforts, both internally and externally. Own and report on all key metrics to monitor ROI on all sales and client service departmental activities. Responsible for negotiations and securing contracts with key accounts, as well as manage ongoing contracts. Drive and manage interaction of the sales manager and sales team with key accounts by facilitating communication, tracking milestones and identifying scope for enhancing these relationships. Accountable for the development of sales leadership among the team to provide cross functional capabilities to ensure career development within StemExpress. Lead, coach and mentor the Sales and Client Services team to foster an I CAN DO culture. Accountable for effective sales department organizational design, including sales job roles, sales resource deployment, compensation and department goals. Communicate cross functionally to ensure seamless execution of the sales department needs and provide interdepartmental feedback for continuous improvement Other responsibilities may be assigned based on company needs and growth. Work location: Corporate Headquarters in Folsom, California but position can be remote  Reporting Relationships  This position will report to the Chief Executive Officer and have oversight for the Sales and Client Services Departments.  Minimum Qualifications  Education and/or Experience Bachelor's degree (B.S.) required in Business Administration, or biological science or related discipline Ten or more years in progressively responsible roles within a sales environment; 3-5 years as a senior sales leader with a proven track record of rapid revenue growth. Prior experience in selling or understanding of biospecimens and human primary cells Understanding of the research/biotechnology industry as well as StemExpress clientele Language Skills Demonstrated ability to read, analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents Demonstrated ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community Demonstrated ability to effectively present information to top management, staff, public groups, and/or boards of directors Strong written communication skills and ability to communication to all levels of audiences Leadership Skills Demonstrated leadership skills and ability to coach and mentor both direct reports and others within the organization Excellent conflict resolution skills and ability to deliver transparent feedback Commitment to transparency, integrity and professionalism Preferred Qualifications Master's degree in business administration or biological sciences Preferred experience includes Vice President of multifunctional teams in a relevant industry such as biologics, cell and gene therapy, blood banking or pharmaceutical StemExpress is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity, and values the ways in which we are different.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other characteristic protected by applicable law.

description: JOB ID: 1187424We are a growing respiratory company specializing in treating the most challenging respiratory patients inside the home by pairing the best in class technology & equipment with the clinical care of a full-time Respiratory Therapist. Our mission is to educate, nurture, and inspire our patients to lead better lives.  Our Disease Management program has earned national attention, making us the number one independent ventilation provider in the United States. In recent random studies of our patient population, we have shown a 30-day COPD re-admission rate of 5.7% compared to the industry average of 20-22%*. Over 93% of our patients share that they actually “Breathe Better” on our treatment program!  While our Respiratory Therapists provide the highest level of clinical care and support for our patients, our Respiratory Sales Representatives work in conjunction with healthcare decision-makers to ensure a comfortable transition for the patient from the hospital to their home. This achieves better management of the length of stay and re-admission rates to hospitals, which reduces costs for patients and brings personalized clinical care directly to the patient from the comfort of their own home.  We are currently experiencing explosive growth throughout the country! We are actively seeking dynamic individuals to join our VieMed family. If you are self-motivated, energetic, and career-minded, Viemed could be the company for you!  Position Summary  This position is a field-based, business development, hands-on clinical sales position that requires a candidate with the drive and skill to be a patient advocate, and positive representative of VieMed. This position is responsible for identifying & initiating one-on-one dialog with new potential referral sources and maintaining positive relationships with existing referral sources. They will leverage their clinical and sales expertise to design/develop cutting edge sales strategies to drive VieMed’s disease management program and respiratory products to new market potential to grow the business within the assigned territory.  The candidate will spend most of their time (80% or more) in the field: networking, building relationships, and educating referral sources* within the hospital on all the benefits of VieMed’s disease management program will improve the lives of their patients with Chronic Respiratory Failure. Hospital Referral Sources: Pulmonologist, Hospitalist, Critical Care Physicians, Case Managers, and Social Workers.  Essential Sales Duties And Responsibilities  Market VieMed’s disease management program to potential and existing referral sources  Develop sales territory action plans and call strategies to maintain ongoing business with current accounts and apply working knowledge of clinical, consultative, and strategic selling skills to drive new market potential to grow the business within assigned territory  Coordinate and provide educational presentations and in-services for healthcare providers  Responsible for account activity, sales documentation, reports, and territory management  Partners with all clinical, managerial, sales staff, and other internal departments within to promote and market our home respiratory therapy services to all referral sources to drive sales growth  Works with the office staff to ensure prompt and accurate billing and documentation of services, including providing adequate information to satisfy third-party payor guidelines for coverage  Required to provide availability for patient contact and response to patient needs  Maintain a level of performance that meets or exceeds the sales quotas  Other duties/projects as assigned  Competencies  Demonstrated ability to build and maintain solid working relationships with internal and external referral sources geographically located within assigned territory  Exhibits effective oral and written communication with physicians, location staff, patients, and all referral sources to ensure questions and concerns are processed promptly  Ability to plan, implement, and execute strategies independently to achieve sales goals effectively  Exhibit a sense of urgency for goal achievement with a strong commitment to results  Builds relationships with referral sources, patients, and caregivers  Strong organizational, prioritizing, and territory management skills  Be flexible, self-driven, accountable for results, autonomous, yet supportive of team efforts  Requirements  Qualifications:  The Qualified Candidate  Must be a resourceful problem solver who thrives in a fast-paced environment.  Must be well-connected and have established relationships with the Pulmonary, Critical Care, & Hospitalist physicians within the territory (required)  Must be able to provide three letters of recommendation from Pulmonologist physicians (required)  Must have a current, valid, active state driver’s license with a clean driving record and own reliable transportation is required  Employment is contingent upon a drug screening test and background check  VieMed requires all employees to be vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment, except where prohibited by state or local law. To demonstrate compliance with VieMed’s vaccination policy, proof of COVID-19 vaccination status will be requested upon a conditional offer of employment.  Sales Experience  A proven track record of successful sales experience in a health care setting, and experience working with physicians, nursing management, discharge planners, case managers, and social workers  Two or more years demonstrated full life cycle healthcare sales experience from lead generation, educating the referral source, persistent follow-up, and follow through on all leads, issues, and success stories  Two or more years of experience as a Clinical Liaison, preferably within the LTACH level of care  Previous marketing and/or LTACH marketing experience  Previous clinical experience preferred with demonstrated skills in clinical patient assessment  Formal sales training preferred  Preferred Licensure & Education  The preferred applicant would be a Respiratory Therapist or Nurse with Adult Critical Care experience with business development/physician marketing experience or have a proven sales record in the local Home Medical Equipment market  Work Environment  Clinical Licensure Preferred (RT, RRT, CRT, RCP, RN, LPN)  Sales: This job operates in the field by calling on, marketing to both existing and potential referral sources:  i.e., Pulmonologist, Hospitalist, Critical Care Physicians, Hospitals, Case Managers, Social Workers, etc.  VieMed Offers  Competitive Base Salary  Uncapped Commissions  Excellent Orientation Program  Health, Dental, & Vision Insurance  PTO  401K Retirement Plan  Monthly Car & Cell Phone Allowance  Fuel Card  Marketing Allowance  Life Insurance  And Much More!  You will be expected to work during regular business hours, Monday through Friday, 8:00 a.m. – 5:00 p.m. Please note this job description is not designed to cover and/or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties, or responsibilities required of the employee for this job. Duties and responsibilities may change at any time with or without notice.

description: About Us  Ecosense is a rapidly growing technology company based in Los Angeles. Our purpose is to invent, inspire and transform how we experience light. Our strategy is audacious and our expectations are high. We are pioneering in the areas of color science, photometry and mixed reality. Using the sun and the moon as inspiration, we are using our inventions to enhance our industry's understanding of light and materially transform expectations for artificial light.  We have been fortunate to light some of the most coveted spaces on earth and to be recognized by the likes of Red Dot for innovation and design, as well as Inc 500 and Deloitte for consistently making their fastest growing companies lists.  Ecosense hires curious, collaborative, autonomous and smart people who also happen to be very nice. We have a passion for tackling the unknown, solving hard problems, and answering questions that haven't been explored.  Primary Role And Responsibility Use the companies Go to Market playbook to create strategies and plans that drive sales in the New York region Within 18-24 months have best practices implemented in your region compared to other North America regions Measurement of success will be based on penetration rates by product family. Penetration rate should be north of the average of the top 10 North America Specification Markets Ability to effectively launch new products into market Mandate the adoption of sales tools Hubspot and Sisense within your region Hubspot and Sisense should be viewed as tools to track activity, success, and areas that need to be improved Partner with VP of Sales and the finance team to craft aggressive annual quotas that are linked to the best in-class penetration rates Initiate accurate sales forecasts that provide information to management of each customer's potential revenue within the sales cycle Ability to manage others while still being responsible for a territory (Player/Coach) Plan, conduct, and lead marketing activities, e.g., informational seminars and/or user group seminars. Attend and participate in Company sponsored trade shows Required Skills/Qualifications Bachelor's Degree or higher is preferred Industry experience is required Results oriented and driven Excellent motivational and leadership skills Excellent written, oral communication and presentation skills Excellent presentation skills and intimate contacts with local business associations Detail oriented, sensitive to customers' needs and company's requirement for interaction to record and track customer information in company CRM program Ability to adapt creative solutions Strong business acumen Must be able to manage multiple projects simultaneously and have strong organizational skills with a strong attention to detail Travel Required; Field time/customer face to face 75%+ All qualified applicants will receive equal consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, or covered veteran status.

Description Job Title: Director, Sales Job Location: New York, NY or East Coast Remote About Bond: Bond is revolutionizing personal security by providing greater safety and peace of mind for all people and situations. Our 24/7 Personal Security Agents are just a tap away from our app, ready to help with any safety need. Our mission is to reimagine what it means to feel safe. What it means for you. For your loved ones. For everyone. Because we believe every life should be lived fully, confidently, and without fear. Reimagining safety is our promise. Keeping you safer is our bond. Download our app in Google Play or iTunes. If you want to learn more, visit our website www.ourbond.com . Interested in joining our human-centric mission as a Sales Director to help shape the future of personal safety and security? We’re looking for enthusiastic and passionate professionals who wish to join our sales force and drive the growth of our novel services while revolutionizing personal security. THE ROLE The Bond personal security services are offered directly to consumers and in parallel to institutions: corporations, universities, and communities. Encouraged by our success and growing demand for services, we’re in the process of growing a world-class enterprise sales organization. WHAT YOU'LL DO Drive full-cycle sales from prospecting to close. Consult with and present to executives and decision-makers at such enterprises/companies to showcase the unique value of our services and technology Successfully navigate the complex organizations with multiple decision-makers to negotiate and close deals Successfully develop and execute against sales plans to consistently meet or exceed revenue targets Create and maintain an accurate sales pipeline and forecast through the use of CRM tools; tracking trends and potential risks for a robust, methodical, and data-driven sales process Requirements 5+ years’ experience as a Sales Director/ Senior Manager, prospecting, generating leads and selling software or services to medium and large enterprises/companies, including SaaS or cloud software. 3+ years of selling experience in the security industry Experience working in corporate security, government security (e.g. FBI, CIA, Homeland Security, Secret Service) or other institutional security teams a plus Previous experience in a big and successful enterprise (For example: Everbridge, VMware, Oracle, Microsoft, Google, SAP, Workday, Salesforce.com, Rave, etc.) Experience selling solutions directly into large corporations, navigating complex organizations, and the ability to adapt your communication style to different audiences with proven success closing large deals. Experience creating a methodical, data driven sales process to fill and drive the sales pipeline Strong organizational, management, communication and presentation skills Experience working with sales tools Salesforce (CRM), ZoomInfo (lead gen) Education - Bachelor’s degree at a minimum, technical degree preferred You'll need the following to work from home, while we temporarily operate in a remote capacity (and follow the most current stay-at-home guidelines): Well-lit, dedicated and quiet area from where to work remotely without interruption or distraction. Must have a neutral visual background Workspace large enough to accommodate one monitor and a notebook computer (which will be provided to you by Bond). High Speed Broadband service (wired only) with a minimum of 150 Mbps in a dedicated (single person use) environment or 300 Mbps if in a shared environment (having a backup internet provider is a plus!) All communication regarding this role will come from one of the following domains: OurBond.com or from SMS (text message to your mobile device).
