description: Description  The Inside Sales Representative 2 responds to inbound calls inquiring about commercial health plans, places outbound calls based on leads, and completes the sales of products and/or services. The Inside Sales Representative 2 performs varied activities and moderately complex administrative/operational/customer support assignments. Performs computations. Typically works on semi-routine assignments.  Responsibilities  The Sales Development Representative qualifies inquiries into sales opportunities for our inside sales agents. Responsible for managing the day-to-day phone and web lead volume by responding in a professional and timely manner . Accountable for meeting our defined lead to quote conversion metrics. Works within defined parameters to identify work expectations and quality standards, but has some latitude over prioritization/timing, and works under minimal direction. Follows standard policies/practices that allow for some opportunity for interpretation/deviation and/or independent discretion. Collaborates with our licensed inside sales agents to optimize our process flows and overall customer experience. Qualify inbound phone and web leads into sales opportunities Represent Humana to prospective small business customers Collaborate with licensed sales agents (ISE's) to optimize our process flows and overall customer experience Accurately and thoroughly update records in CRM Ability to overcome prospective customer objections Perform outbound sales activities such as phone calls and emails during non-peak season to generate additional lead volume Required Qualifications At least 1 year of work experience such as sales, internships, customer service, marketing, etc. Attention to detail and ability to work under pressure Demonstrated multi tasking skills Strong written and verbal communication skills Proficient in Microsoft Office suite: Word, Excel, Powerpoint, Outlook Must have the ability to provide a high-speed DSL or cable modem for a home office (Satellite and Wireless Internet service is NOT allowed for this role). A minimum standard speed of 10x1 (10mbs download x 1mbs upload) is required. Preferred Qualifications 1 year of Sales experience highly preferred Bachelors degree preferred Additional Information  This will be a Limited Term position to end in Feb 2022.  Scheduled Weekly Hours  40

Make An Impact Solutran is a leading FinTech company committed to creating game-changing, customer-friendly solutions. We serve health-seeking populations by partnering with the nation’s largest health plans, government programs, such as WIC and SNAP, as well as with employers and retailers. We’ve established a reputation for delivering modern, advanced customer experiences through best-in-class solutions used by millions.  Solutran has grown over four times in size in the last couple of years. As a result, in January we became part of the Optum Financial family (a part of UnitedHealth Group).  The Solutran team and our platform are now at the center of the most significant healthcare payments innovation in modern history. The journey is just beginning. We expect this growth to accelerate and invite you to grow with us!  Position Summary: The Associate Account Executive is a key sales position who will work with small to mid-large size Consumer-Packaged Goods (CPGs) companies and media agencies who represent them. This is an opportunity to work with Marketing and Sales departments at consumer-packaged goods companies nationwide. This is a remote position, with opportunity to travel to trade show events and conferences for networking and promotional purposes.  What You’ll Do: Prospect and call into B2B (CPG companies and Marketing Agencies) to offer valuable partnership opportunities and services that will help them grow their brand and gain share in the marketplace. Conduct market research to identify selling opportunities by evaluating customer needs for CPG manufacturers. Deliver new business and finalist presentations to represent product offering, service experience, and coordinate attendees from other service-related areas to support the sales conversation as required. Identify opportunities for product improvement, as well as new and unique selling opportunities that will improve the value of Solutran service offerings to our clients. Effective management of your assigned accounts and responsibilities. Act as a subject matter expert and consultant for existing clients to ensure the most effective use of products and services. Work with the Operations team to ensure effective implementation and onboarding of new clients. Convey written and spoken information effectively in a clear and concise manner. Present a positive image of Solutran’s commitment to support CPGs in the marketplace. Make follow-up calls and build/maintain positive customer relationships. Provide clear documentation in the sales database (CRM) of the prospect, client and expected growth.  An individual in this position must be able to successfully perform the essential duties and responsibilities listed above. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this position.  Qualifications and Experience: Bachelor’s degree, preferably in Business, Marketing or Communications. Confident, self-motivated individual with the desire to learn and succeed! 1+ years of sales/marketing/or related experience. Ability to successfully manager customer relationships. Ability to travel (25%).  Preferred Skills: Highly self-motivated. B2B sales experience. Experience in data analytics. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Experience with Tableau and Salesforce. Experience in the CPG industry.  Where you will work: The position is based in Plymouth, MN and is opened to remote candidates.   Learn and Grow: We’re committed to growing the capabilities of our people. At Solutran, you have the opportunity to work with diverse individuals, explore new ways of thinking, and expand your capabilities. Our employees are both teachers and learners who are valued for their contributions and the perspective they bring.  Company Benefits and Perks: Great Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, and Life insurance plans. Start accruing 18 or 23 PTO days per year (based on salary grade) when working 40 hours per week.  PTO accrual is pro-rated for our part-time employees.  Your number of PTO days increase with your years of service. 8 Paid Holidays Paid Parental Leave 401(k) savings plan and company match Tuition Reimbursement Program. Employee Referral Bonus Support for Community Involvement Casual dress when working in the office  Travel Requirement: This position requires travel –up to 25%.  Language Skills Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business communication, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to write reports and business correspondence. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, and/or vendors.  Please note: This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.  AAP/EEO All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local law.

Want to build a stronger, more sustainable future and cultivate your career? Join Cargill's global team of 160,000 employees who use new technologies, dynamic insights and over 154 years of experience to connect farmers with markets, customers with ingredients, and people and animals with the food they need to thrive.  Job Purpose and Impact  The Digital Sales Account Executive for Poultry North America is responsible for developing and executing Cargill Digital Solutions’ commercial vision and achieve short- and medium-term goals for the customer accounts that will drive growth for Cargill Animal Nutrition, while providing customers with software and technology solutions to improve customer production and profitability.This role will focus on explaining the value of the Digital portfolio of software and technology in close collaboration with local Cargill nutrition poultry sales teams. As such, we seek a seasoned professional that can work independently, knows the poultry industry well, has excellent customer relationship skills, and is able to become a subject matter expert in applying different technology in poultry production.  Location: This is a remote position within Eastern US only.  Key Accountabilities Develop and execute the sales planning process for complex accounts for multiple value propositions and solutions as part of the account plan. Develop and structure complex sales proposals that represent maximum value optimization to customer and business. Develop strong client relationships that provide significant input to planning product, price, and service strategies. Work with Cargill Animal Nutrition sales teams to align on goals and build actions plans to achieve results. Analyse competitor capabilities to determine gaps and to position offerings against competitive options. Independently handle complex issues with minimal supervision, while escalating only the most complex issues to appropriate staff. Other duties as assigned. External applicant Information This position is posted both internally and externally. This is a remote position within Eastern US only. Minimum travel may be required Qualifications  Minimum Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in any relevant business discipline. Minimum of four years of related work experience preferably in poultry nutrition industry. Working experience with presentations and communication using Microsoft tools. Open to create reports and be able to share technical knowledge to non-technical audience. Preferred Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in animal nutrition or science. Master`s degree will be a plus. Minimun five years of business experience in value added sales solution in poultry nutrition and / or health industry. Proven performance that demonstrates high accountability, strong initiative, with a sense-of-urgency and an entrepreneurial approach. Solid interpersonal skills; being an effective listener, verbal, and written communication. Experience with go-to-market, including sales Strong entrepreneurial spirit; skilled in market assessment, strategy development and annual business planning. Ability to travel up to 35% within North America (post Covid-19). Equal Opportunity Employer, including Disability/Vet.

description: Experienced Remodeling Sales Professional  OVERVIEW:  Luxury Bath Technologies of Louisville is growing at an impressive pace. Lead flow is strong and we need to hire an experienced and professional Selling Sales Manager ASAP. Our success has been built upon quality products and expert installation.  You will be working with individuals who have a passion for exceeding the customer’s expectation. We're not just another Home Improvement Contractor; we are known in the community as a company with the highest standards of work and an undisputed reputation for Customer Service.  THE “PROFILE” OF THE IDEAL CANDIDATE:  The individual we are looking for is NOT the typical salesperson most people think of. We have found that our customers want to buy our products and services but don’t like being “sold.” So, rather than a “pushy” salesperson, we need someone who asks questions, listens to the homeowner, determines their needs, offers options for them to choose from and closes the deal.  ABOUT YOUR MANAGER:  You will be working directly with the owner of the company, an individual who is committed to your success. She/he is responsible for your training and ongoing development. She/he is not a micro-manager; she/he expects that you will work independently on your own but is always available to provide backup and support when needed.  SCHEDULE:  We will schedule sales calls based upon your availability whenever possible. If you want appointments at night so you can take care of your needs during the day, we will work with you as much as we can. Sometimes you may need to meet with a homeowner on a Saturday morning.  ATTRIBUTES NEED TO BE SUCCESSFUL: Customer focused. Coachable -- trainable. Persistent and tenacious. Results oriented -- goal driven. Able to relate to different personality styles. Responsible and accountable for personal results. Capable of handling multiple tasks simultaneously. Works successfully without requiring close supervision.  REQUIREMENTS: 3 years sales experience in remodeling industry. Bath, window, and roofing experience a plus. Professional appearance and demeanor. Excellent computer skills -- MS Office, database management, etc. Be willing to undergo a background check and drug screen, in accordance with local law/regulations  WHAT YOU CAN EXPECT FROM US: Salary Plus Commission- Earning potential of $120k+ Medical Paid Vacation Paid Sick Time  If you feel that we may be a good fit, please take 10 minutes to complete the assessment below. Take this in a quiet place and be as honest as possible and if you don't know something do not fill it in. There are no right or wrong replies.  Powered by JazzHR  uNCWfAw5CJ

description: Role: The Business Development and Sales Manager manages all construction and design leads and informs potential clients and industry professionals about our services. You will organize and manage all incoming leads from intake to sale, including overseeing the proposal and estimating process. You will act as the point of contact for new clients, communicating with them throughout the estimating and final sale process. You will also actively schedule meetings and follow ups with realtors, designers, architects, and other industry contacts. The ideal candidate will be outgoing, self-driven and have excellent communication and sales skills.  Responsibilities: Contacting realtors, designers, architects, and other industry professionals to establish rapport and arrange meetings. Work directly with executive team and CEO to determine sales goals and strategies. Researching organizations and individuals to find new industry contacts. Finding and developing new markets and improving sales. Developing or overseeing development of proposals for clients. Developing goals for business growth and ensuring they are met. Training personnel and helping team members develop their skills. Attending conferences, meetings, and industry events. Attending networking events.  Business Development Manager Skills: Bachelor’s degree in business, marketing, or related field desired. Experience in sales, marketing, or related field. Strong communication skills and IT fluency. Ability to manage complex projects and multi-task. Excellent organizational skills. Ability to flourish with minimal guidance, be proactive, and handle uncertainty. Proficient in Word, Excel, and Outlook. Comfortable using a computer for various tasks. Knowledge of construction and construction practices a plus but not required.  Job Type: Full-time  Pay: DOE

Part Time Brand Sales Ambassador The a2 Milk Company is changing the way the world drinks milk - bringing people back to dairy, one glass at a time.  Ordinary cows’ milk naturally contains a mix of both A1 and A2 proteins. The a2 Milk® brand comes from cows that naturally produce only the A2 protein and no A1. Published research suggests that some people who have digestion issues when drinking ordinary milk find they can enjoy a2 Milk® and avoid this discomfort.  Founded in 2000 in New Zealand The a2 Milk Company are on a mission to bring people delicious, nutritious and pure a2 Milk® so they can enjoy a better life. The a2 Milk Company has achieved long-term success in the Australian market achieving 10% market share in total supermarket milk and more recently early signs of success in the US market. So that’s where you fit in. Fresh from our success down under, we’re working to satisfy the desire of millions of US milk lovers for real, natural milk that’s delicious and easier on digestion.  Summary: We are seeking a professional Brand Ambassador that is reliable, enthusiastic and a go getter. As a BA you will serve as the face and voice of a2 Milk, you will educate the buyers on what a2 is and build brand recognition. You will work closely with the Regional Sales Manager to formulate a game plan on educating stores and the development and execution of all aspects of a2 Milk retail needs. The chosen candidate will be a road warrior hitting stores. Must be an early riser, self-motivated individual willing to travel with overnight stay.  Responsibilities Hit 9-12 stores per day educating Dairy buyers as well as selling in distribution voids, increasing facings, gaining better shelf presence, placing POS/IRC’s, packing out backstock and fixing missing tags Ability to coordinate/route yourself to hit different stores and navigate yourself throughout this region Accurately report all completed retail tasks by utilizing a software program on your cellular device Ability to interface effectively with clients, leadership and managers in a professional manner. Communicate effectively with store personnel/management, regarding tasks, sales activities, promotions and store sales plan objectives Ability to lift 25 pounds routinely with repetition. Re-sets: can be very physical in nature. Re-set activities could include: removing items from the shelf, moving shelves, building fixtures and displays, reorganizing the products according to POG  Qualifications Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience Prior retail/grocery reset and sales/merchandising experience Must have current valid driver’s license and clean driving record Results oriented, strong interpersonal skills, problem solving skills, communication and teamwork Creative thinker, highly approachable, social, outgoing and energetic with an positive attitude Naturally entrepreneurial, with a high sense of responsibility and initiative Must be self-motivated, team player and results oriented and can work independently. Early riser, in the stores by 8am Maximum 30 hours a week Overnight travel up to 50%  What’s in it for you? Besides working in a great environment interacting with Grocery/Dairy buyers daily, you will earn a competitive pay. No more sitting behind a desk every day, get to see the great outdoors Work independently, early mornings having weekends off Competitive pay with expenses paid Work Mileage paid Accrued vacation

A solid understanding of account planning in an advertising agency or group. Ability to travel to clients when needed. #ZR #hotjobs

description: ABOUT KEET  Were a team of passionate, fun-having, taco-loving people on a mission to make healthcare experiences feel better.  At Keet, we help put humanity back into healthcare. It feels good to know that what we do ultimately contributes to a patients well-being. We know our clients, and our clients patients want to get back to doing more of what they love, so that is the core of our culture merging talented people doing what they love, to create products that help others do the same. Keet is part of the Clinicient family of companies.  SALES EXECUTIVE  ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Work with management team to establish aggressively achievable sales forecasts and targets for assigned region. Manage the sales process and client relationship from lead generation to contract closure to meet and/or exceed sales targets. Includes prospecting, responding to incoming leads, identifying customer needs, presenting Clinicient solution and contract negotiation and closure. Develop strong knowledge of competitive products and work with sales and marketing team to develop approaches to overcome competitive pressure. Maintain accurate and thorough customer records in Keets CRM. Partner with the implementation and training team to ensure appropriate expectation setting during the sales process and a smooth hand-off of clients from sales to operations. Travel up to 25% required. Provide input on how increase the effectiveness of the sales process. Work with sales and marketing team on promotional opportunities. Develop relationships with industry influencers and organizations within assigned region.  SECONDARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES  Projects ad hoc  EXPERIENCE AND EDUCATION  3-5 years relevant experience Bachelors degree required Experience in healthcare, business and/or technology preferred Experience selling over the phone leveraging web-based tools and social media Demonstrated success in a consultative selling environment Relevant value-add sales training  OUR CORE VALUES*  Collaboration: We're continuously learning how to work together, better. Heart: We've got it, and we're not afraid to show it. Innovation: We are lifelong learners. Service: Were here to serve. Humility: We're humans, and we come from dirt. *We love and strive to embody our core values daily, and well expect you to do the same.  KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES  Must be a role model of Keets Core Values: Collaboration, Heart, Innovation, Service, and Humility. Able to work in a fast-paced, self-directed entrepreneurial environment. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, including excellent telephone sales personality. Passion for providing excellent customer solution, identifying unmet customer needs and providing solutions. Highly energetic and self-starter. Ability multi-task and work with shifting priorities. Honest, assertive, and systematic.  PERKS  (We've got them).  Keet offers a competitive benefits package with medical benefits, unlimited PTO, company hosted lunches, happy hours, and special events.  We have a flexible work from home policy dependent upon productivity and ability to communicate effectively. Oh, and we have snacks. Our office is located in the hip south river district of Austin, TX in the heart of Austin weirdness.  Keet is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

description: At the heart of QIAGEN’s business is a vision to make improvements in life possible.  We are on an exciting mission to make a real difference in science and healthcare. We are still the entrepreneurial company we started out as and have today achieved a size where we can bring our full power to many initiatives and to our presence across the globe.  Our most valuable asset are our employees – more than 5000 in over 35 locations around the world. Our ambition is to ensure we have outstanding and passionate people working in the best teams and we are constantly looking for new talent to join us.  There are few players who have shaped the world of modern science and healthcare as much as QIAGEN, and we have only just started. If you are looking to advance your career, are seeking new challenges and opportunities, enjoy working in dynamic and international, diverse teams and want to make a real impact on people’s lives, then QIAGEN is where you need to be.  Join us. At QIAGEN, you make a difference every day.  Position Description We are looking for a Manager Sales Controlling NA to join our team in Germantown, Maryland.  This role is dedicated to be the link between the North American sales organization and Controlling, specifically for our Molecular Diagnostics (MDx) business. The position is responsible for monitoring and optimizing the goal achievement and efficiency of the respective sales organization.  You will act as a business partner to Head of Sales MDx North America with entrepreneurial attitude being co-responsible for business decisions. Help present data findings in meetings with C-suite executives, assist in the creation of business cases for new investment opportunities, help define and enforce CRM standards, etc.  Key responsibilities include: -Provide commercial guidance for the development of QIAGEN -Cost and revenue budget planning (short to long term) -Cost Controller -Revenue Controlling, business intelligence -Revenue goal achievement by region/product/customer segment -Sales force performance metrics -Market penetration -Preparation of business reviews -Adoption rates of new products -Coordinating and analyzing the monthly expense and revenue forecast  -Tender, quote and contract calculation and Controlling -Commission handling -Risk Management -Translating market opportunities into actionable recommendations. -Sales channel optimization -Assistance in year-end closing activities; including audit procedures and providing information to the external auditors  Position Requirements -Master’s degree in Business Administration or equivalent education; at least 4-6 years of experience in (Sales) Controlling -Microsoft Excel mastery is an absolute must have (VBA, Pivot Tables, etc.) -Knowledge of SAP BW/Analysis for Excel -Proficiency in PowerPoint -Proficiency with SQL -Salesforce.com experience a plus -Ability to manipulate medium to large data sets -Ability to interpret and present findings effectively to leadership  Personal Requirements -Self-motivated and able to work independently within region with the right level of teamwork to connect with peers -Demonstrates accountability -Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with an ability to build strong relationships with business partners -Outstanding analytical skills with excellent attention to detail -Flexible attitude and the ability to work under pressure and to achieve deadlines -Proactive and innovative thinking  At the heart of QIAGEN are our people who drive our success. We act with passion, always challenging the status quo to drive innovation and continuous improvement. We inspire with our leadership and make an impact with our actions. We create a collaborative, safe and engaging workplace which forms the basis for high performing individuals and teams. We drive accountability and entrepreneurial decision-making and want you to excel your growth and shape the future of QIAGEN.  QIAGEN is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), sex stereotyping (including but not limited to assumptions about a person’s appearance or behavior, gender roles, gender expression, or gender identity), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, mental or physical disability, ancestry, medical condition, marital status, military or veteran status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.

The director owns the responsibility to achieve the company's annual revenue and profit targets.  Responsibilities: Achieve annual sales revenue and profit targets  Develop and execute strategic plan to achieve sales targets and expand customer base  Lead, support and coach a large sales team to achieve individual annual objectives while supporting the transformation of the company to a more services-centric organization.  Create a culture of accountability  Work Lead the process to identify, recruit and onboard top talent.  Develop key growth strategies, tactics, and action plans by understanding industry trends, market dynamics and client buying behaviors. description: Job Description  Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?  Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Matter.  As an organization we are committed to developing the next generation of Makers and Bakers. Joining us at an early career stage in our fast paced and ever changing environment will enable you to do more, learn more and grow more. You will be encouraged to step outside your comfort zone– you may even surprise yourself! We will ensure you are given the support you need to be at your best and enable you to be yourself and bring passion and personality. Here you can lean in and speak up and bring your own flavor.  As a Sales Leadership Development Associate, you will have the opportunity to join our Sales Team and help us Create Delicious Moments of Joy for our consumers.  The Mondelez International Sales Leadership Development Program is a 24-month accelerated learning program designed to prepare selected recruits for future leadership roles with our Sales team.  Sales Leadership Development Associates (SLDAs) gain broad exposure to the Sales Organization through a combination of diverse rotational assignments and formal training. SLDAs are sponsored by a committed network of senior leaders, dedicated mentors, and advocates. Through these dynamic experiences and relationships, participants will hone their leadership capabilities and analytical skills to become a vital member of our world-class organization.  As a Sales Leadership Development Associate, you will: Participate in a formal rotational program providing exposure across our Sales organization. Develop a working knowledge of many key areas in Sales through your experiences in direct selling, people and account management, insights and analytics, customer development, and sales planning. Build a strong development and formal career plan with guidance and support. Form a strong network of supporters, along with exposure and networking opportunities with senior leaders.  Upon successful completion of the Sales Leadership Development Program, participants will be placed in a permanent full-time management role within the Sales organization.  Qualifications Bachelor’s Degree required – business related degree preferred Record of strong academic performance Must be willing to relocate Demonstrated leadership abilities Learning agile Adaptable and open to change Creativity and idea leadership Ability to work individually/within a team Excellent interpersonal skills Demonstrated ability to deal with complexity Strong drive for results Highly motivated, self-starter  Please note: A company vehicle will be provided to you, so a valid drivers’ license will be required.  Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, weproduce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country.  Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance.  Job Type RegularGraduatesEarly Careers

description: Phenomenal opportunity for someone looking to get into Medical Device Sales in Chattanooga TN !  Mammotome associates know that every moment matters when it comes to advancing breast cancer diagnostics and surgical solutions. When you come to work at Mammotome, you’re collaborating with a global team of engineers, designers, communicators, strategists, and specialists to improve patient outcomes. If you want to be inspired to grow every day, join our diverse, hardworking, high-performing team.  Be part of a company that’s a trusted leader in breast cancer diagnostics and support products you can feel passionate about!  Mammotome is proud to work alongside a community of six fellow Diagnostics Companies at Danaher. Together, we’re working at the pace of change to improve patient lives with diagnostic tools that address the world’s biggest health challenges.  Excellent opportunity to get into Medical Device Sales!  Nearly every one of us has been impacted by cancer in some way. When you join Mammotome, you’re helping make a difference in advancing breast cancer diagnostics. Join our team as an Associate Sales Representative and help us transform the industry! We train our Representatives to be responsible for growth and expansion of direct sales and profit margins within assigned accounts and/or territory/region on products or services. You will learn how to establish professional relationships with key personnel in customer accounts.  We teach our team the following in order to be successful: Demonstrate proper application, use of all Breast Care/Biopsy products. Communicate entire Breast Care/Biopsy product line and value proposition. Clinical literature to support use of vacuum assisted biopsy over core needle and open-surgical procedures. Clinical literature to support use of gamma guidance in performance of sentinel lymph node mapping for the breast, parathyroid, and melanoma. Capital and disposable equipment technical specifications to perform accredited in-service and training. Proper use of current selling methods learned in sales training courses including use of sales tools, sales aids, and proper demonstration of product features and related benefits to patients. Conduct state of the business reviews at key accounts to discuss Mammotome’s value proposition alignment with account vision if appropriate. Analyze the market in which you work: optimizing territory plans by consistently tracking market information, using account Optimizers to run analyses on accounts, cost and impact decision-making in accounts. Maintain a list of specific products and potential sales by account. Work with Regional Sales Manager (RSM) and Sales Representatives to allocate time efficiently across territory. Build excellent customer relations with key Surgeons, Radiologists, hospital personnel and strategic partners (i.e. Siemens, GE, Invivo, etc). Your areas of knowledge and expertise that matters most for this role: Bachelor’s degree required Minimum of 2 years of relevant business experience required. Must have documented proof of vaccinations and immunization records to include TB tests, Hepatitis B vaccine, MRR (measles, mumps, rubella) and Varicella (chicken pox) Frequent travel is required. Check out our benefits here: www.danaherbenefits.com  When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 69,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.  Danaher is committed to a diverse and inclusive culture where everyone feels they belong and all voices are heard. We believe in our associates and the unique perspectives they bring to every challenge, which is why we’ll empower you to push the boundaries of what’s possible.  If you’ve ever wondered what’s within you, there’s no better time to find out.  When you join us, you’ll also be joining Danaher’s global organization, where 69,000 people wake up every day determined to help our customers win. As an associate, you’ll try new things, work hard, and advance your skills with guidance from dedicated leaders, all with the support of powerful Danaher Business System tools and the stability of a tested organization.  Danaher Corporation and all Danaher Companies are committed to equal opportunity regardless of race, color, national origin, religion, sex, age, marital status, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or other characteristics protected by law. We value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.  The EEO posters are available here. Please contact us at applyassistance@danaher.com to request accommodation.  If you’ve ever wondered what’s within you, there’s no better time to find out.

jobTitle: Key Account Sales Support - The Childrens Group
description: The Children's Group is a dynamic, Omni-Channel business located in beautiful Madison VA. Our brand HearthSong is a dynamic industry leader in active play for children and experiencing tremendous growth in all channels including direct to consumer and wholesale markets. We are looking for a detail oriented, sales minded person to join our steam and support or Key Account sales growth. We offer the opportunity for global work experience, working with our Shanghai sourcing office, focused on sales and the consumers through support of our sales reps and customers. All while working to successfully position fun toys for kids offering them screen-free experiences. To succeed, a conscientious work style, extreme attention to detail, and sales minded approach will turn this opportunity into your next career advancement.  Essential Duties And Responsibilities Provide daily support via email and digital meetings of Key Accounts sales reps for accounts Monitor and review customer's forecasts and commitments to adjust inventory forecasting and holding inventory. Work with IC for additional purchases for Key Accounts needs. Monitor open order report weekly to review upcoming PO's and on hand, reserved, or incoming inventory for availability, reserving inventory as needed with Inventory Control, working with rep or inventory planners to adjust PO qty and ship/cancel dates as needed. Collect and feedback all of operations' challenges and opportunities, involve at post-mortem review to continuing make improvements Understand and analyze vendors' compliance guidelines. Work with Finance Department and China office to process necessary import paperwork for payment and customs clearance. Work directly with our customers vendor guides and our warehouse to ensure requirements are processed in compliance. Ensure ASN, carton UCC labeling, and retail tickets are accurate and meet the necessary guidelines. Coordinate for receiving and booking shipments. Work effectively with Warehouse Operations and China office to execute BOLs, pallet requirements, and other online traffic management systems. Verify the highest fulfillment of orders by working with all departments and meeting customer's ordering needs. Responsible for taking ownership of and resolving customer inquiries and problems. Call customers or Vendor Compliance as necessary to advise on shipment status or to obtain shipment information in a professional manner. Responsible for providing the highest level of customer service in all communications and transactions of the job. Coordinate with inside support staff, Importing Department and our China manufacturing facility to successfully process and ship all major orders ensuring compliance with customer requirements. Meet with Sales and Marketing Representatives for communication needs. Report weekly to Team and Department Manager on all open projects. Work with Logistics Department concerning domestic and international orders to ensure compliant document preparation. Understand and monitor order receipts process through various EDI portals. Qualifications  The requirements listed below represent the minimum knowledge, skill, and/or ability required, to perform job function:  Experience/Education Bachelor's degree in a business-related field Strong data analysis skills Bilingual Chinese/English speaking preferred Minimum 2 years of related experience. Strong MS Office skills with advanced knowledge of Excel and Access Strong attention to details. Good organizational skills, written and verbal communication skills. Knowledge or experience in retail buying and/or wholesale vendor guidelines a plus.

Job Description Supreme Golf is seeking a qualified sales development representative (SDR) to find, screen and close golf course customers who can benefit from our SaaS technology and consulting services. As the first line of communication with prospects, ideal SDRs have a strong understanding of the sales process, starting new relationships, and closing sales. You should be a quick learner with strong communication skills and have the ability to build a book of business. Successful SDRs have great career path opportunities at Supreme Golf. Knowledge of the golf industry is a plus, but not required.  Objectives of this Role Generate leads and build relationships by finding new prospects and nurturing leads Utilize HubSpot, cold calling, email & LinkedIn to generate new sales opportunities Manage and maintain a pipeline of prospects Identify best practices to refine the company’s lead generation playbook Identify prospect's needs and suggest appropriate products/services Build long-term trusting relationships with prospects to qualify leads as sales opportunities Set up meetings or calls between prospective customers to close sales Report to sales manager with weekly, monthly, and quarterly results  Required Skills and Qualifications Prior experience as a sales development rep with a track record of achieving sales quotas Previous success cold calling prospects 2-3 years of sales experience, with a history of exceeding lead targets Strong communication skills via phone and email Proven creative problem-solving approach and strong analytical skills Strong desire and ability to move up within a sales organization  Preferred Qualifications ·     Proficiency with HubSpot or other CRM software  Opportunity Career advancement with a fast-growing golf technology firm Work in our office in Dallas, TX preferred but not required To join a fun and exciting organization  About Supreme Golf Supreme Golf, in association with CBS Sports Digital, offers the world’s largest inventory of golf tee times, providing golfers the ability to search and book over 16 million tee times at more than 12,000 golf courses in 41 countries. Supreme Golf owned booking sites include SupremeGolf.com and GolfBook.com, which are also available on iOS and Android. Partner sites include PGA Tee Times for The PGA of America, Barstool Sports, Golf Digest and CBSSports.  Supreme Golf works closely with golf course owners and operators to provide technology, marketing and business solutions to help manage their facilities. Leading management companies such as Century Golf Partners, Arnold Palmer Golf Management, American Golf Corporation and Hampton Golf, and golf courses such as the world-famous PGA West, The Citrus Club, Walt Disney World Golf and PGA Member owned Trophy Club of Apalachee are just a few of the courses who leverage Supreme Golf’s software and business solutions.  Our business solution's team is made up of the brightest, and most knowledgeable minds in golf who are experts in advanced revenue and cost management. Previously only available to large golf course management companies, Supreme Golf offers public memberships, tee time distribution and other business solutions to all golf course owners.

Hiring for 2 positions! Account Manager and Field Sales Representative Both can be either Full-time, Part-time, or Internship!  About Rallie, Inc. Let’s Rallie is a spontaneous mobile app that immediately sends you available things to do within 10 miles of your current location. Rallie, Inc. is rapidly growing and employees are needed in all neighborhoods. Employees can create flexible hours and will be assigned to a territory that is close to home. Rallie, Inc. is looking for teammates who are willing to put on multiple hats and do whatever it takes to create a strong brand presence in all neighborhoods. Check out Rallie’s Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn, and website.  Account Manager Position Summary Account/Project Manager works under the supervision of the partners. A/P Manager oversees overall day-to-day customer/ partner service and supports to ensure the effective execution of customer and partner objectives in marketing and sales. The position encompasses administration, project tracking duties, and management of field sales representatives. Duties of an A/P Manager include composing client correspondence, maintaining contact lists, and assisting with marketing and sales. They will also work closely with users, businesses, partners (clients), and internal teams to best meet client needs. They must also pitch ideas, assist in developing strategies, and demonstrate problem-solving abilities to address client issues and business growth.  Field Sales Representative Position Summary The Field Sales Representative reports to the Account/Project Manager. As a Field Sales Representative, you will develop sales strategies and be responsible for attracting new users and businesses to the Let’s Rallie app. The field representative is responsible for new sales opportunities and closing deals. This person is responsible for tracking their time, and reporting their conversions.  Contact Information If interested, please reach out to Robbie Verna at robbie@letsrallie.com for more information!

The Position: Aesthetic Sales Representative – Inside Sales Job  Why LaserAway? Generous compensation structure including uncapped commission. Career growth and advancement. Flexible schedule and work-life balance. Cutting edge medical equipment. Employee discounts on products and services. Supportive and uplifting office culture.  Aesthetic Sales Representative Job Description: A LaserAway Aesthetic Sales Representative is vital to delivering customer service and driving sales results by selling and promoting LaserAway’s hair removal and non-surgical cosmetic services. We are looking for top performers with a track record of success. The Ideal candidate is confident with high integrity coupled with a customer-centric attitude. This person will be responsible for consultations and generating enthusiasm for our non-invasive procedures. Our expert marketing team will provide you with warm leads through their social media initiatives. This position does not require any cold calling or telemarketing. In addition to new patient sales, this role requires following up with previous potential clients/patients who have not purchased with us in the past. Our successful Aesthetic Sales Representatives are able to renew interest by promoting laser hair removal and non-surgical cosmetic services.  Aesthetic Sales Representative Job Responsibilities: Initiate sales process by scheduling appointments with warm leads; conduct initial consultation; describe LaserAway’s treatments and skincare line professionally and with an expert knowledge base. Close sales by building rapport with potential patient; explain product and service capabilities; overcome objections; prepare financing contracts with lenders such as Care Credit and Loan Hero. Expand sales in existing accounts by introducing new products and services. Create client retention by upselling additional products and services. Recommend new products and services by evaluating current aesthetic treatment process. Manage front desk duties such as checking patients in/out while ensuring a positive and warm experience and maintaining a clean and professional clinic. Adhere to LaserAway policies and protocols.  Aesthetic Sales Representative Skills and Qualifications: Education/ Experience:Previous sales experience required. Communication Skills:Strong interpersonal and communication skills. Ability to effectively communicate with patients, peers, and management. Ability to communicate with proper etiquette. Reasoning Ability:Ability to multi-task, while being attentive to patients and remaining flexible to the needs of the business. Ability to work as part of a team and take initiative independent of direct supervision. Other Skills:Enthusiastic, friendly, and energetic with a genuine desire to provide outstanding service. ** Bilingual a plus!  About LaserAway: LaserAway is a medical company set in beautiful retail settings that offer the latest innovations in non-surgical aesthetic dermatological treatments. We are the fastest growing company in the industry with 70+ locations in CA, NY, TX, NV, AZ, FL and IL. From attentive sales representatives to meticulous clinicians, we are a team of professionals driven by customer satisfaction to offer the most advanced aesthetic dermatological treatments including laser hair removal, skin rejuvenation, CoolSculpting, and Botox.  Aesthetic Sales Representative Compensation: LaserAway offers a generous pay structure with additional earning potential through commissions and bonuses. Additional benefits include (but not limited to) Healthcare benefits Dental, Vision, and 401(k) Paid Time Off Generous employee discounts. This job description is not all inclusive. In addition, LaserAway reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. LaserAway is an Equal Opportunity Employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

GitLab's DevOps platform empowers 100,000+ organizations to deliver software faster and more efficiently. We are one of the world’s largest all-remote companies with 1,400+ team members and values that guide a culture where people embrace the belief that everyone can contribute .  This position is 100% remote, based in North America.  GitLab is looking for an enthusiastic and strategic Sales Development Representative (SDR), to join our growing Revenue Marketing team. As a SDR at GitLab, you get the opportunity to lead the initial outreach to targeted Enterprise accounts working in conjunction with the Field and Digital Marketing teams. In this role you will leverage creative marketing and sales tactics to prospect and engage with multiple buyer personas and roles to introduce GitLab’s value. You will be responsible for generating qualified meetings and pipeline for GitLab's Sales organization.  Don’t have a ton of knowledge about GitLab yet? Don’t worry. We have an extensive onboarding and training program at GitLab and you will be provided with necessary DevOps and GitLab knowledge to fulfill your role.  What you'll do in this role Effectively manage inbound lead flow as well as executing outbound prospecting initiative Conduct high-level discovery conversations in target accounts Meet or exceed SDR sourced Sales Accepted Opportunity (SAO) volume targets Collaborate with and leverage teammates to develop targeted lists, call strategies, and messaging to drive opportunities Utilize business and industry knowledge to research accounts, identify key players, generate interest, create/identify compelling events, and develop accounts Work to have a variety of touches (call, email, social, etc.) on all leads in your assigned territory using Outreach.io Manage, track, and report on all activities and results using Salesforce Participate in documenting all processes in the GitLab handbook and update as needed with your Sales Development Manager Work in collaboration with Field and Corporate Marketing to drive attendance at regional marketing events Attend field marketing events to engage with participants identify opportunities, and to schedule meetings Act as a mentor for new SDR hires in helping them navigate their key accounts Work in collaboration with Digital Marketing to develop targeted marketing tactics against your assigned target accounts We’re a diverse team and we’re looking for you to bring your own unique flavor to the SDR role! We're looking for Someone excited by the prospect of working cross-functionally with sales and different marketing departments. You'll have exposure to different departments like Sales, Marketing, Finance, Recruiting, Enablement, Engineering, etc. which will help you determine your career path at GitLab. Positive and energetic phone skills, excellent listening skills, strong writing skills A self-starter with a track record of successful, credible achievements Knowledge of business process, roles, and organizational structure Determined personality with a desire to grow and win Passionate about being a part of GitLab’s journey Proficient in using Salesforce and LinkedIn 2+ years work experience in a professional environment Previous tech industry experience or experience in sales development, marketing and/or sales is a plus Outbound prospecting experience is a plus Globally we require excellent written and spoken English which is our company language Ability to use GitLab A shared interest in our values , and working in accordance with those values Also, we know it’s tough, but please try to avoid the confidence gap . You don’t have to match all the listed requirements exactly to be considered for this role.  Hiring Process  To view the full job description and hiring process, please view our handbook . Additional details about our process can also be found on our hiring page .  Remote-Americas  Country Hiring Guidelines  GitLab hires new team members in countries around the world. All of our roles are remote, however some roles may carry specific location-based eligibility requirements. Our Talent Acquisition team can help answer any questions about location after starting the recruiting process.  Your Privacy  For information about our privacy practices in the recruitment process, please visit our Recruitment Privacy Policy page.

description: Mark Anthony Brands, Inc. is hiring a Field Sales Representative who will be responsible for executing all aspects of Mark Anthony Brands portfolio brand plans in the assigned market of Dallas, TX. The Field Sales Representative will implement wholesaler plans, execute distributor incentive programs, and ensure key account execution. Market areas will be defined as AA markets, comprised of one or more distributors.  As a Field Sales Representative, Your Responsibilities Will Include Executing all aspects of sales plan with wholesaler network. Executing brand plans and programming by working with District Manager level influencers at their distributors. Tracking and reporting on-going and consistent market conditions, conditions through internal tools Weekly retail/market recap of execution and performance, providing manager feedback on market using internal tools Brand execution at the market level. Brand standards to include pricing, shelf placement, cold box placement, display, draft and bottle placement Monitor and evaluate personal performance on a monthly basis to identify and develop personal areas for growth 18 days (90% of time) ensuring retail execution, surveying (with key influencer of the wholesaler), evaluating distribution, display and ad feature execution 2 full days (10% of time) managing all administrative requirements due on a monthly basis (fiscal responsibility, distribution tracking, program execution tracking and performance management) as well as all local initiatives The Field Sales Representative position is well-suited for you if you: Work with teammates on regular basis in the field. Provide best practice sharing and coordinate in market execution/activation drives against key market/account initiatives, new item launches and/or distribution drives. Consistently demonstrates the Mark Anthony Brands Way to sell (Taste the Difference, MABI meetings, DAP3, and Performance Dashboard) Exhibit a very high sense of urgency, be well organized, possess a great attitude, be a team player and have the ability to build strong working relationships with all internal and external stakeholders Are energized by the opportunity to work for the leading Flavored Malt Beverage company in the US and be committed to investing significant time and energy into their career Fully embodies the Mark Anthony Brands culture Keep abreast of competitive trends and report appropriate developments Qualified Candidates Will Have Bachelor's degree 0-3 years of sales experience preferred or recent graduate with sales internship experience Fact based selling and ability to establish rapport Strong analytical and math skills Mobility is mandatory as high performers will be rewarded with new opportunities over time that will in most cases require continued relocation Strong computer skills, Office (Excel, PowerPoint and Word)- including the ability to do quality presentations Relocation Available? Yes, for the right candidate  BRING FLAVOR TO LIFE  Are you interested in selling and marketing the brands of the fastest growing beer company in the US?  Mark Anthony Brands, Inc. provides sales and marketing support in the US for The Mark Anthony Group of Companies including brands like the iconic White Claw® Hard Seltzer, Mike’s® Hard Lemonade, Mike’s® Harder® Lemonade, Cayman Jack®, an MXD.  As the company grows, so does its inclusive and expressive culture. Sad people don’t drink mike’s; nor do they sell it. With over 250 team members nationwide, and a Chicago-based headquarters, Mike’s employees are bringing zest from east to west.  Company Information  We are a private, family owned business that cares for people and are proud to offer the best tasting products in the industry. In the United States, the Mark Anthony Group pioneered the flavored malt beverage category with the launch of Mike’s® Hard Lemonade in 1999. Today, Mike's has achieved iconic brand status and is the category leader. We are a disruptive innovator and true high performer in the brewing industry.  The Company is a unique blend of entrepreneurial determination and drive with advanced information systems and disciplined focus on creating and making better tasting products that consumers love to discover. Using our proprietary technology, we brew one of the cleanest tasting alcohol bases in the industry.  We are grounded in our core values of Sense of Urgency, Authenticity, Simplicity, Humility, and Trust. These come to life everyday through our 5Cs, the 5 core behaviors necessary to be successful here: Communication, Collaboration, Commitment, Competence and Curiosity.  If you are curious, collaborative, focused and thrive in a fast-paced environment and are looking for a long-term role with a company that is transforming the industry - while having some fun, we want you to consider joining our family!  We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We are committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. Please reach out to careers@markanthony.com for assistance.
industries: Food & Beverages, Wine and Spirits, and Consumer Goods

description: Arizona Propane is a locally owned and operated propane company (48 years) servicing greater Phoenix area including: Tucson, Casa Grande.  We are seeking an experienced Sales Representative.  Sales Representative will be primarily responsible for growing the customer base, customer satisfaction, as well as pro-active problem solving.  Employee Benefits  Health, Vision, Dental and Life Insurance  401 K  Vacation pay  Company Vehicle  Account Sales Manager  This is a high energy/high profile area that is looking to increase our sales for residential and commercial customers: Residential,  commercial, forklift gas, exchange cylinders, patio heater exchange cylinders, etc.  Candidate must have all sales skills necessary to close, and retain customers, and establish strong relationships with prospective customers through the use of various prospecting and business development techniques.  Key Responsibilities  Develop a Growth Action Plan for assigned territory.  Travel throughout assigned territory to call on prospective customers to solicit business.  Exercises a leadership role that supports and champions customer service as a TOP PRIORITY.  Train customers on the safe handling and dispensing of propane by becoming an "expert" on product knowledge and solutions.  Develop an Account Retention Plan that builds customer loyalty and protects customer base from competitive threats by conducting periodic visits with key accounts.  Secure necessary permits from city building department and fire marshal ordinance for propane tank installations.

description: Plastic Surgery Practice - Practice Sales Patient Coordinator  • World class Houston, Texas plastic surgeon - based inside the loop near Medical Center - is seeking a sales superstar living within 20 minutes of the office for a daily patient care coordinator role with a strong sales background, for a growing medical practice. • This practice is owned by a board certified, well-respected, fellowship trained plastic surgeon, and caters to an elite, but family-focused clientele, where thousands of procedures have been executed with the most natural and impressive results, while maintaining a down-to-Earth family-focused office setting. This practice specializes in breast and body procedures, skin resurfacing, fillers and injectables such as Botox, esthetician services and more. • The winning candidate must be willing to work in a sleeves-rolled, hands-on fashion, doing "whatever it takes" to help the team grow. There must be a focus on driving sales and results, coupled with a strong desire to implement and sustain organization and efficiency throughout the practice. There is a need for the winning candidate to be comfortable and capable working with a team of tenured front and back-office employees and surgical patient care coordinators. Relationship building ability as well as a desire to perform outreach with a positive attitude and friendly demeanor is a must.  • Responsibilities: 1. Sales - sell plastic surgery procedures and aesthetic services to prospective patients through extensive phone conversations and live consultations. 3-5 days per week will be focused on selling, driving leads to sell, and other sales-related functions. Comfort with quoting and selling procedures and treatments ranging from hundreds of dollars to over 30 thousand dollars is necessary. Making 100 or more calls and emails daily can regularly be a part of this position so you must love people, phones, and computers! 2. Additional Responsibilities - • Organization – Task orientation, timely completion of assignments, and an innate desire to “get things done” is a must. Knowledge of medical software like Patient NOW or NexTech is preferred but not required. • Positivity – we love patient care and seek a bubbly, positive, sunny outlook from our winning candidate. We have a zero-tolerance approach to drama and team members must work together positively and build one another up. • Whatever it takes attitude with a sales focus – Typical hours 9am-6pm M-F, but at times more or less is needed. The winning candidate will have significant income upside - with no cap or limit - if results are achieved but must be willing to learn new concepts and unlearn intuitive ideas that do not match with the practice's structure. This is a great role for an achiever looking to grow and accomplish vs. seeking purely stability and a place to come daily. The selected candidate will report directly to the physician owner and practice manager as well as have oversight and training from an industry leading medical practice consulting group which has overseen some of the most selected doctors in the nation.  Job Requirements: o Bachelor’s degree preferred o 2-5+ years of sales experience – preferably in cosmetic medical, plastic surgery, direct sales, Vector Marketing, med spa field or similar - ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate prior results in a sales and service capacity - real data showing achievement is key vs. simply tenure in a particular job. This position is not an administration position with sales work. It is a sales position with administrative work. Are you no-drama, task-oriented, self-competitive, and motivated to achieve personally and for your team? Then this may be a great position for you. o Must be confident and comfortable presenting prices ranging from 5 to over 25 thousand dollars and asking for the order and closing the sale on the spot. A belief in and understanding of how to sell luxury items is a must. o Outstanding communication and presentation skills o Belief in the power of cosmetic surgery to change the lives of appropriate candidates for the better o Type accurately at no less than 40 wpm - 55wpm a must. Strong computer skills with the ability to learn proprietary software for the medical industry quickly. Nextech skills are a plus. o Excellent follow-up and organizational skills – an addiction to timely task completion without compromising quality is a must. o Professionalism in dress and presentation, honesty, excellent work ethic, and positive attitude a must. o Willingness to utilize existing skills and talent, while simultaneously learning and executing the company’s proven system  Pay Structure, Perks, and Benefits: • Annual pay based on results for year one is composed of a base pay and bonuses. Typical base is around $40,000-$49,000/year with average bonuses of $20,000 to $50,000+ in year one. Income can grow significantly over time based on results and top executive sales patient care coordinators regularly can earn six figures over time. • Paid Vacation • Medical benefits provided after probation period per company policy • Positive work environment working directly, daily, with the doctor. Trust is placed to work independently several days per week. Reasonable hours. • Opportunity to grow by working with a successful practice, but also with a larger practice training organization committed to the success and personal growth of every employee  PLEASE INCLUDE A BRIEF COVER LETTER AND CURRENT RESUME AND PERIODICALLY CHECK YOUR “JUNK” FOLDER FOR CORRESPONDENCE FROM OUR OFFICES SHOULD YOU NOT RECEIVE A REPLY. WE APPRECIATE YOUR TIME AND CONSIDERATION.

About Wheel  Wheel is powering virtual care. We are a healthcare technology company bringing together both the tech infrastructure and clinicians to power many of the industry’s leading telehealth services. By enabling more companies and clinicians to participate in virtual care, Wheel is helping to connect patients to the best care for their health needs.  We’re a remote-first company with a hub in Austin, Texas, and we are proud to have been recently named one of Built In Austin’s Best Places to Work and Best Small Company to Work For. Wheel is backed by top investors; Lightspeed Venture Partners, CRV, Tusk Ventures, and Silverton Partners. We’re looking for new Wheelies who share a passion for making a positive difference in healthcare and feel connected to our core values.  Learn More About What We Are Building In Forbes.  Our Values: We believe we can help build a future for everyone by ensuring how we work is aligned with our core values of:  Further, together.  Empathy, every day.  Be trusted.  Grit to grow.  High Velocity.  To learn more about how we work, check out our careers page .  Position Summary  We are seeking an insightful, strategic, and creative sales enablement professional that is passionate about helping others succeed.  Responsibilities Responsible for owning the strategy, design, and implementation of our Sales Enablement function Responsible for training, instruction and continuous education across the Commercial organization. Your ability to measure and action on data will be an essential aspect of the role. Own the process of evolving our training and onboarding system to keep up with the growing needs of the team as we scale. Leverage your strong operational management skills to establish an appropriate cadence for critical meetings across the commercial team. Lead the planning of all-commercial All Hands, stand up structure, and more. Partner with Product, Operations, Legal, Marketing, and Clinical teams to ensure accuracy and consistency of client facing materials. Partner with Management and top performing Account Executives to uncover business needs, design solutions, launch, iterate, and measure the impact of those materials. Qualifications 5+ years sales enablement experience, preferably in SaaS Ability to represent complex concepts into a curriculum that sales professionals can absorb and apply Highly proficient at building trust with senior level sales managers Excellent written and verbal communication skills Experience using Sales Enablement tools to build agile learning programs. Highly organized and proactive A collaborative working style, with experience working across the company with teams of varied size to achieve common goals Strong project management and operational management skills Possesses strong background and understanding of the sales process and various sales methodologies Background in Healthcare is preferred, but not required Wheel continues to maintain its commitment to creating an inclusive and equitable work environment, and believes pay transparency is an important component. We are reviewing our internal policies and practices to ensure this is enabled for all employees, regardless of where they are located. In the meantime, this role can be performed remotely, with the exception of Colorado on a temporary basis. Colorado-based candidates will resume consideration in Q1 2022.  Equal Employment Opportunity Statement - At Wheel, we know we will go further together by celebrating diversity and that starts by honoring each of our unique lived experiences. We look for a diverse pool of applicants including those from historically marginalized groups: women, people with disabilities, people of color, formerly incarcerated people, people who are lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and/or gender non-conforming, first and second-generation immigrants, veterans and people from different socioeconomic backgrounds. We are committed to ensuring a safe work environment where employees are not discriminated against based on age, race, ancestry, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, pregnancy, marital status, physical or mental disability, military or veteran status, national origin, or any other characteristic protected by law. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that believes in health, equity, equality, and prosperity for all so we can succeed in changing the way healthcare works.

Other responsibilities include top-down relationships with major regional customer distribution accounts, local relationships with national account personnel, and end-user relationships to deliver top-line sales revenue and profitability targets. Delivers results while maintaining the highest level of integrity. Fosters an environment that generates breakthrough ideas and leads a collaborative and open organization that lives the values of Newell Brands. Develops an operating rhythm of joint meetings to manage opportunities, negotiations, and issues that deliver value Addresses customer concerns/needs and elevates as appropriate to sales management Actively utilizes SFDC to create opportunities, campaigns, and reporting to improve the close ratio Comfortable cold-calling to support campaigns and ownership of the field at the end-user level and spends 80% of time in the field. pipeline discussions with all accounts to grow both the customer’s and Newell Brands business; follows up/measures success regularly Aligns goals with sales enablement, finance, product, and supply chain to execute strategies and plans Manages end-user pricing and P&L to meet divisional sales and gross margin targets Market, Channel, & Category Understanding Collaborates cross-functionally to provide market insights to the customer Utilizes best in class insights to develop customer strategies as they relate to purchasing behavior and commercial opportunities Develops and shares new ideas/innovation based on sales trends and insights Builds category plan consistent with customer and Newell Brands strategies Financial Management Leverages our brands and product mix to improve profitability and meet customer and Newell targets Tracks company and competitor pricing across vertical and provides feedback Monitors the impact of price on sell-through Organization Development And Talent Management Takes responsibility for and identifies opportunities for personal development Works with customer and internal sellers to ensure understanding of our products and solutions Participates in internal communities of practice relevant to the job role and external trade organizations, where appropriate Values And Behaviors Drives commitment for the brand and consumer leadership with our company and customers Embraces a culture in which learning is widely shared across functions, businesses, regions, and teams Fosters an environment that generates break-through thinking and ideas, while at the same time remaining consumer, shopper, and customer-focused Drives organizational culture, strategy execution, and achievement of the Newell vision by living the values and demonstrating the leadership competencies daily Practices the values hold self and others accountable for living the values and recognizes the right behaviors Supports an environment where people can be empowered to make solid decisions towards winning with our unique consumers and customers Supports an environment where successes are recognized, shared, and celebrated together Acts with integrity; conduct business fairly, honestly, and ethically every day Qualifications Bachelors/University degree in Business Administration 2+ years of sales and/or trade marketing experience For hundreds of millions of consumers, Newell Brands makes life better every day, where they live, learn, work and play.
