Position Summary  Incumbent will be responsible for developing and implementing strategies to increase market share within the assigned territory, supporting existing business and prospecting new opportunities. Promote and sell to commercial hospitals, physician offices, wound care centers and Federal Government accounts to include VA’s and active duty Military hospitals.  Essential Duties & Responsibilities  Achieves sales performance goals as specified in the sales/quota plan.  Define and identify key market opportunities, implement marketing strategies and effectively implement sales direction to penetrate existing accounts and gain new customers.  Successfully complete sales training and continually stay updated and informed on competitors and market dynamics by participating in corporate updates and ongoing training.  Proficient in presenting to individuals and large groups of customers on all products and applicable company programs.  Develop territory business plan to ensure achievement of monthly revenue goals and overall sustainable long term growth, in agreement with Regional Sales Director make adjustments to plan ensuring potential sales issues are addressed in a timely manner assuring monthly and quarterly quota is met.  Conducts all job functions in a manner that promotes a high level of customer service to both internal and external customers.  Promotes positive team relationship and maintains open lines of communication with Regional Director, Marketing, Clinical, Reimbursement, Customer Care, and Administrative personnel and Sr. Management to achieve corporate goals and objectives.  Attends industry conferences as needed.  Works within assigned expense budget.  Ensures all activities are in alignment and conform to TissueTech (BT/Amniox) corporate policies.  In addition to direct selling duties; will work with the Marketing team to provide field intelligence on market trends and changes. Collaborate with Marketing on new programs as needed.  Position Expertise/Qualifications  Bachelors Business Administration or related field required  5 years Outside sales in the medical device, wound care, biotechnology or tissue segment preferred  5 years High growth organizations building market share required  Skills & Abilities  Excellent communication skills (oral/written)  High energy, flexible, results oriented individual.  Organization Excellent organizational skills  Sales Targets Proven track record of meeting or exceeding territory and company sales goals, reflecting both a broad knowledge of the product line and business acumen, as well as successful efforts to educate customers or prospects.  Courteous, friendly, and helpful to both customers and team members  Demonstrated ability to analyze markets, plan sales strategies and effectively present scientific and clinical data to physicians, office/nursing staff and economic buyers.  Strong conceptual, analytical and problem-solving ability.  Microsoft Office: Standard Applications, proficient in Microsoft software applications: Excel, Word, PowerPoint and Outlook.  ADA Statement  Candidates who cannot perform one or more of these requirements due to disability will be eligible for consideration based on whether the candidate can perform the essential functions of the position with a reasonable accommodation.

👋 It’s great to meet you. Thanks for taking the time to read about our latest job opening. Read on to find out more about Blocknative, get some insights into the role we are hiring for, and learn about our process.  Blocknative is the leading provider of mempool data. We count many of the top DeFi and NFT projects as customers and we power many top trading operations. Our diverse product portfolio includes Mempool Explorer , Onboard.js , Notify.js , Gas Platform , Simulation Platform , and our API and SDK .  To learn more about Blocknative, please visit our About or Career pages.  Overview  At Blocknative, you will be working with some of top blockchain projects to help them manage the mempool. We are excited to have you join our global, remote team to help scale foundational blockchain infrastructure.  Responsibilities: Develop account plans and strategies to drive revenue growth within new accounts. Conduct periodic business review meetings with stakeholders to ensure ongoing alignment with our clients’ business objectives. Contribute to the design and implementation of new strategies to generate revenue from current clients. Facilitate delivery of feedback and any new product requirements back to the Product and Engineering teams. Contribute to GTM team projects that will further shape and refine our sales and relationship management process. Develop a deep understanding of our product and industry to help our customers succeed.  Preferred* Experience: You are able to form and foster deep client relationships You have a deep understanding of traditional financial services, products and strategies as required to provide thought leadership and strategic support to your clients and the goals they have to implement their own strategies You know how to tell a good story in both conversation and writing - i.e. you have excellent narrative skills, a refined vocabulary, a compelling voice, and an engaging personality You have "executive presence," i.e. confidence and composure interfacing with financial investors and C-level executives You have deep technical knowledge or are able to quickly gain knowledge on Blockchain primitives. You have a keen ability to adapt and learn quickly as business strategies evolve and new products are introduced. You self-describe as some combination of the following: creative, humble, ambitious, detail-oriented, hardworking, trustworthy, eager to learn, methodical, action-oriented, and tenacious You have experience using a modern CRM (ex. Hubspot, Salesforce, etc..) You’re willing to travel for business (as COV-19 allows) We prioritize people above all else. If you think you’d add to the depth and diversity of our team but don’t fit these qualifications exactly, we want you to apply!  We hope you apply!  We are also open to exploring contract opportunities as we get to know each other.  We’re a bunch of data nerds 🤓  Our CTO started his career at NASA’s Jet Propulsion Lab building real-time data streaming software  We’ve published several reports that have been well received in the space:  Evidence of Mempool Manipulation on Black Thursday: Hammerbots, Mempool Compression, and Spontaneous Stuck Transactions  Ethereum Gas Prices: How the Mempool acts as a Competitive Market for Settlement  Understanding Ethereum Transaction Simulation — And Why It Matters  Blocknative’s infrastructure records thousands of mempool events every second  We’re backed by leading VCs  Given our early stage, we strive to have you meet as much of the team as possible before extending an offer. Here’s what you can expect:  Application review  Schedule a call with the recruitment team  Schedule a call with the our CEO (Growth) or CTO (product/technical)  Schedule a group interview with the growth or Product Technical team  Reference calls/security checks  📝 Offer

CarNow has a home base in Atlanta, GA. however, this role will be for candidates in the Chicago, IL area and will be based out of the home. Set and conduct appointments with decision makers. Present CarNow products and services to prospective customers. Grow CarNow’s market presence in your market area. Network and build relationships within your territory to gain referrals for new accounts Assist in maintaining long-term customer relationships New account development Creating partnerships with key executives Strong work ethic Must be a “people person” Positive attitude Must have excellent verbal and written communication skills Self-motivated, productive while unsupervised Ability to multi-task and shift priorities  Requirements: Bachelor’s Degree of higher. 3+ years of automotive software sales is a must. A demonstrated understanding of a customer’s key business drivers Must be able to establish and maintain customer confidence. Project Sales Representative (Dallas - Fort Worth, TX)  Growth-Minded, Established Rigging Contractor In the last 10 years, ProLift Rigging has become one of the nation’s leading rigging, crane, and transportation contractor serving fast growing US markets. Our local branch sales and operations teams collaborate to develop engineered rigging, crane, and transport solutions based on our customers operational pains. ProLift has deep roots in rigging, and brings fresh, innovative solutions to an established marketplace.  We are Driven by these Core Values Safety – Evaluate risk, plan to mitigate it to protect our customers, our team, the public and property. Superintend – Take seriously the opportunity to wisely invest our time, talent, and capital for the benefit of others. Diligence – Remember that any meaningful goal is achieved through diligent persistence and staying engaged. Do whatever it takes to achieve our mission within the constraints of our values. Teamwork – We are a team that needs each members’ contribution to achieve our mission.  Does the Following Describe You? Value-seller Sales Hunter Always prospecting Coachable Top performer who excels under pressure  Enjoys accountability  Who We Want As we continue to grow our market and customer footprint in DFW, TX, we are seeking a local Project Sales Representative who believes they are a true Sales Hunter. They are self-motivated and take pride in exceeding their prospecting and closed sales goals. Our ideal Project Sales Representative can strategically prospect into new and existing top accounts within our ProLift Rigging major markets. They welcome the challenge of working our sales process to discover and solve their top account’s operational pains related to rigging, crane, and transportation scopes of work to build ProLift/Top Account lasting relationships.   What You’ll Do As a Project Sales Representative, you will be responsible for uncovering and qualifying new prospects in our DFW, TX region. You will work with our team to learn and execute our sales process to solve our customer’s pain(s) relating to our core scopes of work. As a valued member of our branch team, you will collaborate internally with our sales, operations, and engineering departments to close quality work, continuously improving and growing our local DFW, TX branch. You will maintain a high level of personal accountability by keeping our CRM system updated and actively participating in our branch weekly sales meeting.   Qualifications  Required: 5+ years of successful outside B2B sales experience Excellent hunting/prospecting skills  Preferred: Experience in the crane & rigging industry Strong CRM skills Consultative approach to building relationships and achieving sales goals  What We Will Include ProLift Rigging will set you up for success through a targeted onboarding process. For the right individual, it will be an amazing fit and opportunity. We offer a competitive base salary plus a performance-based bonus, retirement and health care benefits, PTO, and recurrent training.  How to apply Please click “Apply” & send a copy of your resume with a brief cover letter or email explaining who you are and why you believe you are the best choice for this position.

jobTitle: Sales, Sales Specialist - Interventional X-Ray, IGT Systems (NY/NJ)
description: If you are a Colorado resident and this role is a field-based or remote role, you may be eligible to receive additional information about the compensation and benefits for this role, which we will provide upon request.  You may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.  Sales, Sales Specialist – IGT Systems  In this role, you have the opportunity to: The IGT Sales Specialist owns business development in the territory by uncovering and posting opportunities, developing competitive positioning, and owning quote creation, customer concerns, and change orders; partners with Account Executives / Account Managers (AE/AM) to qualify opportunities, design and present winning solutions, and develop business analysis and forecasts; co-owns, with District Sales Leaders (DSL), achieving business goals and forecasting for the territory.  You are responsible for the following: Partner with AM/AEs, using business knowledge and understanding, to develop an account strategy with a solution definition and to design and propose a solution definition and design that addresses the customer’s specific need. Lead the development of product strategy and customer presentations as the clinical, technical, and knowledge expert. Address competitive positioning and value proposition components of the presentation. Attend customer presentations to resolve customer objections or answer questions regarding product and configuration comparisons and competitor pricing. If requested, participate in the customer feedback loop to provide technical expertise.  Partner with AM/AE to coordinate on-site demonstrations, clinical trials, site visits, and national clinical showcase sites. Partner with the AM to identify opportunities by providing insights into possible leads resulting from working with installed base, third party vendors, trade shows, local conferences, and other industry events. Partner with the AM to prioritize opportunities that exist in a given account or market. Partner with the AM on the roll-up of the forecast and funnel. Tie off on the account, timing, and dollars. Agree on a committed and best case plan. Work alongside the AM to ensure the funnel is robust, clean, and well managed. Coordinate product positioning and product qualification with AM/AE, as needed. Collaborate with AM to develop a SWOT analysis and build a database, by hospital, of the entire installed base to establish competitive positioning and understand upcoming opportunities.  Own the business development of the territory. Drive visibility by understanding business opportunities in the region, including emerging markets. Uncover and communicate opportunities to the AM. Share opportunity visibility by entering the opportunity into SFDC. Create a business plan that identifies every opportunity in every account. Ensure the funnel is robust and capable of meeting the AOP.  Attend accountability calls with the AM and DSL to provide input and background. Author a complete and compliant customer quote based on the specific customer needs and requirements. Drive the quote pricing based on configuration and delivery design. Manage any necessary change orders. Build a strong internal network and local customer team to support the delivery of value to our customers and to drive resolution of customer issues. Include Philips teammates from IGT Devices, Clinical Science, Clinical Education, Hospital Information Technology, Ultrasound, Service, Finance, and other Philips groups as needed. Provide Field Marketing with input on sales tools, pricing issues, and competitive threats to enable them to best support specialists and provide input to the IGT Business Unit. Maximize the customer experience by presenting a coordinated and efficient One Philips approach with the AM/AE. Support the DSL/AE/AM through informal product training and education. Share best practices with internal colleagues. Co-own, with the DSL, achieving the business goals including balanced selling and Annual Operating Plan (AOP) attainment. Draw on national knowledge of product and industry to provide input on forecasting to the DSL, as needed, through SFDC. Own the customer issue escalation process. Partner with the AM to determine the right communication to the customer for frequent issues or a delayed remedy. Partner with the AM to select appropriate site visit locations. Participate in the four-meeting process and installation to ensure a smooth customer hand-off. Perform against established performance goals and metrics. Take responsibility for your own personal and professional development, including all required training. Participate as an active member of the sales team, sharing your experience and knowledge with others. Use and comply with standard processes and guidelines. Develop strong knowledge of markets, competitors, and industry trends for products. Demonstrate the Philips Behaviours in all interactions.   You are a part of: Philips IGT Systems led by the National Modality leader.   You will be an integral part of the Chesapeake territory driving each business opportunity for IGT Systems, while collaborating with our Northeast regional sales team along the way.  This team will consist of a Regional Sales Manager, Account Executive(s), and several Account Managers.  To succeed in this role, you should have the following skills and experience: Four-year college degree or equivalent experience preferred 8+ years of demonstrated healthcare experience or equivalent combination of education and experience. Diagnostic Imaging Industry experience highly preferred Deep product knowledge and expertise within interventional product modality. Ability to quickly demonstrate expertise and establish credibility with clinical decision makers. Ability to assess potential application of company products to meet customer needs and prepare detailed product specifications for the development and implementation of customer products/applications/solutions. Strong Business Acumen and organizational skills In return, we offer you: The IGT Sales Specialist role will give you the opportunity to take your career to the next level in a world-leading organization that is backed by a stable 120-year legacy of innovation. Here, you’ll go as far and as wide as you aspire. We make sure of it through support of a formal development planning process, as well as countless opportunities to expand your knowledge and skill set through resources such as the Learning@Philips program, tuition reimbursement and/or mentor relationships.  Why should you join Philips? Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum. Our people experience a variety of unexpected moments when their lives and careers come together in meaningful ways. Learn more by watching this video.  To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions.  It is the policy of Philips to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all colleagues and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, ethnicity, religion, gender, pregnancy/childbirth, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability or perceived disability, genetic information, citizenship, veteran or military status or a person’s relationship or association with a protected veteran, including spouses and other family members, marital or domestic partner status, or any other category protected by federal, state and/or local laws.  As an equal opportunity employer, Philips is committed to a diverse workforce. In order to ensure reasonable accommodation for individuals protected by Section 503 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, the Vietnam Veterans' Readjustment Act of 1974, and Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990, applicants that require accommodation in the job application process may contact 888-367-7223, option 5, for assistance.  Equal Employment and Opportunity Employer/Disabled/Veteran  No Sponsorship offered: "US work authorization is a precondition of employment. The company will not consider candidates who require sponsorship for a work-authorized visa."   No Relocation: “Company relocation benefits will not be provided for this position. Candidates need to live within the territory”  INDSALES1

Position Overview   We are looking for a passionate certified Inside Sales Growth Manager  to join  our growing team!  The successful candidate will turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.  The perfect candidate will live and breathe sales, with a passion in upselling current clients for social media services.  The Inside Sales Growth Manager will communicate with clients regularly and discuss their needs surrounding brands and competitors, to better understand the services that may be of best assistance to them. They will optimize relationships, suggest improvements, and support with client requests. If  you are a self-drive individual who is passionate about social media and sales, we want to talk to you!   100% fully remote opportunity! Work from anywhere in the world in the US or Canada.  Inside Sales Growth Manager responsibilities include:   Communicate with clients and help them to better understand ways to optimize their impact in the social media space Upselling clients on current services to further develop sustainable, bi-lateral business partnerships Optimizing services on an ongoing basis to support client social listening needs Respond quickly and nimbly to client requests  and be ever involved in the nature of the brand and its client relationships Work with management to prioritize business and information needs Locate and define new process improvement opportunities  Requirements   Proven working experience in business development and/or sales  (5 years)  Must have Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, and LinkedIn accounts; be a regular user on them; and be knowledgeable of other social media and data sites to include Snapchat, Tik Tok, Google Analytics, etc.  Technical expertise  regarding social media management, listening, and analytics tools  Strong  analytical skills  with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy Strong usage of Microsoft Suite and comfortable in a virtual office environment.  Strong time management skills with the ability to plan, prioritize, monitor, and respond to changes quickly Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint proficiency needed.  Background in business development and sales EMEA location or willingness to work according to US/Canadian time zones  ICUC embraces and celebrates diversity and inclusivity. We are committed to creating a safe and respectful work environment and building a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We are a worldwide media agency network that represents global clients. The more inclusive and collaborative we are, the more great work we can create together.   ICUC encourages all qualified candidates to apply and has an exceptional record of accommodating the needs of our staff. If you require accommodation at any stage of the application process, please let us know. ICUC thanks all applicants, however only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted

We are expanding our highly motivated and energetic sales team to lead our customers through some of their most critical transformation initiatives.  Impetus LeapLogic helps customers migrate from their legacy technologies like Teradata, Netezza, Oracle among others to a cloud-native deployment with 90%+ automation. We call it Automagical...and welcome you to share this magic of Workload Transformation with our customers.  Impetus' Gathr is the only product that unifies Ingestion, ETL and Analytics for our customers with a WYSIWYG interface. We welcome you to help our customers in transforming their data transformation challenges on the cloud with Gathr.  As they say, "It takes a village to..." Impetus and its community of Partners will join you on this transformation initiative. This position will report to the VP of North America Sales and would be responsible for leading revenue generation and customer acquisition in your assigned territory.  Responsibilities: Working with the VP of Sales, develop and implement a strategy for signing new accounts in your assigned territory. Work closely with Partners to generate new leads and opportunities. Be actively involved in prospect generation with your assigned business development executive and/or by self. Leverage executive-level relationships to enhance Impetus’ presence. Serve as a trusted advisor to Impetus' clients and partners. Work closely with assigned Account Managers/Account Directors and the Pre-Sales Engineering teams to build winning sales proposals and phenomenal relationships.  What are we looking for in you: Are you a great listener? Have you successfully sold to the best of the best and retained them as a customer over the years? Are you the customer's trusted partner? Can you build phenomenal relationships that yield a mutually beneficial result? Do you understand the world of Big Data, Cloud & Analytics?"

description: - New York / New England  We are seeking a smart, energetic, and highly motivated individual with experience selling A/B testing and Experimentation products and services.  SiteSpect, Inc. The Regional Sales Manager is a hunter position. Responsible for all new business sales activities within their assigned region for SiteSpect Products and Services. The Manager will develop short-term plans to meet aggressive revenue goals and new logo attainment aligned with the company's long-term strategy. The ideal candidate must be extremely results-driven, customer-focused, technologically savvy, and skilled at building relationships.  Position Activities Include Current Rolodex of potential customers Prospect for potential customers using various direct methods (cold calling, attendance at trade events.) Drive the entire sales cycle from initial customer engagement to closed sales Using MEDDIC or Force Selling to qualify prospects against company criteria for ideal customers and sales Perform on-site and remote meetings with customers as needed to advance and qualify sales prospects. Make presentations to Prospect senior managers and decision-makers Draft and deliver proposals Work with team technical staff and product specialists where required to address customer requirements Develop and maintain key account plans that identify opportunities for company to deliver value, strategic motivators, main stakeholders, buying processes and forecasted sales Report on sales activity (include desired frequency - updated weekly Keep detailed notes on prospect and customer interactions updated weekly Provide forecasts on best case and most likely sales volumes over relevant time periods Work with delivery teams to proactively address problems Cultivate strong relationships with third party and partner companies that may be required to deliver full solutions to customers Work with marketing to plan and execute lead generation campaigns Provide feedback to sales management on ways to decrease the sales cycle, enhance sales, and improve company brand and reputation Provide feedback to company management on market trends, competitive threats, unmet needs, and opportunities to deliver greater value to customers by extending company offerings Identify sales support requirements and work with marketing to develop improve sales tools Be a positive representative of the company and its brand in the marketplace Conduct all sales activities with the highest degree of professionalism and integrity Participate in strategic planning sessions with the sales management team on a quarterly and annual basis. Desired Skills & Experience  We are searching for Regional Sales Managers that demonstrate a strong grasp of SiteSpect's value proposition and the ability to communicate that message effectively. Experience selling into marketing and IT teams >Knowledge of A /B testing and Optimization solutions  >Team player with a drive to win Demonstrated ability to sell product solutions between $50k and $250k Documented history selling enterprise solutions and exceeding assigned sales quotas Experience with target account selling, solution selling, and/or consultative sales techniques. A minimum of 4 years of direct customer solution selling experience Strong verbal and written communications skills, including presentation skills. Passionate relationship building and negotiating skills. Ability to work collaboratively with functional peers across all organizational functions An aptitude for understanding how technology products and solutions solve business problems. Demonstrated experience working with Sales organizations and technical teams. Ability to foster a positive work environment and attitude. Ability to work remotely, and able and willing to travel on short notice SiteSpect is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, creed, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other protected status as defined by federal, state or local law.  About SiteSpect  SiteSpect is leading the advancement of testing, targeting, and personalization software that empowers the world's most successful digital businesses to drive revenue growth, deepen customer engagements and sharpen their competitive edge. Only the SiteSpect Digital Optimization solution enables customers to test the entire user experience, from the front-end "look and feel" to the back-end functionality, and centrally manage those tests across channels, product lines, and business units.

Job Description  Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?  Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Are you ready to make it happen at Mondelēz International?  Sales Representative  Become one of our Sales Representatives by maximizing sales, effective planning and order-writing, as well as supporting and completing incidental activities such as merchandising, shelving and pricing, the Sales Representative acts a sales expert to retail stores and partnering up with nationally recognized customers such as Walmart, Target, Homeland, Food Pyramid and more. Become an ambassador of world-famous brands like Oreo, Ritz, belVita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among other delicious industry-leading snacks.  As one of our Sales Representatives you develop and maintain a complete knowledge of Mondelēz International, primarily Nabisco products, sales systems, and procedures, including: Ensure Nabisco leading brands (Oreo, Ritz, Belvita, Chips Ahoy, Triscuit among others) are well represented, stocked and maintained through the implementation of Mondelēz’ guidelines. Sales objectives, campaigns and promotions, sales brochures and order guides, sales presentations, sources of product and distribution, maintaining schematics and uses, as well as proper merchandising. Perform in-store planning by tailoring programs and fact-based sales presentations to the customer's needs, store demographics, and the current consumer base to drive Mondelēz International and customer growth. Develop strong business relationships with store management to provide service and value beyond the customer's expectations. Work with customer to ensure sufficient product is ordered to support consumer take away, including from incremental racks and displays, for DSD. Communicate plans and effectively manage merchandising resources to build sales volume at store level. Work in conjunction with the Merchandiser to ensure inventory is fully stocked, always rotated and presentable; as well as properly credit and dispose of all unsalable merchandise from all stores. Monitor and report on competitive activity and document all pricing activities. Be a collaborator between our Customer Business teams and customer’s store management.  What you can expect from us:  This position offers a comprehensive medical, dental and vision benefit package, in addition to paid vacation, holidays, 401(k) match and Employee Assistance Program benefits. Along with a competitive compensation package, the Sales Representative position is eligible to participate in an incentive program. Mondelez International also offers a company vehicle, which includes a gas card and vehicle maintenance program.  Who is a good fit? Be at least 18 years of age, have a valid driver's license and proof of auto insurance High School Diploma or GED required, college degree highly preferred. Ability to perform hard work in a fast-paced work environment and to meet the defined physical activities like Repetitive lifting bending, and carrying up to 25 lbs., occasionally over 50 lbs., pushing & pulling over. This includes physically moving our products from the stock rooms and stocking the store’s shelves. Previous retail / grocery experience is a plus Be open to relocation, outside of region, and outside of state, as necessary. Willingness to perform merchandiser responsibilities, as needed. Live within 50 miles range from the primary location: Muskogee, OK Schedule availability required: Monday - Friday, with occasional weekends No Relocation support available Business Unit Summary The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, weproduce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including Oreo and Chips Ahoy! cookies, Ritz, Wheat Thins and Triscuit crackers, and Swedish Fish and Sour Patch Kids confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country.  Mondelēz Global LLC is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact 847-943-5460 for assistance.  Job Type RegularField SalesSales

description: The Sales Executive is responsible for developing and executing solution sales tactics that utilize URAC accreditation products to solve the unmet needs of priority healthcare segments, such as health plans, pharmacy, accountable care, clinical integration, utilization management and case management. The Sales Executive is responsible for achieving a new business sales target within an assigned territory. They must demonstrate a deep understanding of priority healthcare segment trends, accreditation products, relationship building, and a consultative selling approach that challenges prospects to improve their business process via accreditation. By combining these competencies with strong communication and presentation skills, the Sales Executive will execute an effective plan to achieve accreditation product sales goals.  Job Duties And Responsibilities Achieve assigned new business sales targets under the direction of the Director, Sales & Business Development Capitalize on knowledge of trends (commercial, state & federal government, ACA) within URACs priority healthcare segments to position the value of accreditation as the solution to a prospects unmet needs. Comprehends the capabilities of URAC and communicate the value of URAC products to prospects. Utilizes research sources that are available in priority healthcare segments, media and prospect publications to identify needs and develop prospect specific value propositions. Prioritizes the call plan and then applies a personalized list of screening questions. Challenges the decision maker with the value of the differentiating features and its impact for the prospect. Applies business knowledge to show enough value that naturally interests the prospect in follow-up talks. Credibly positions URAC products as a better alternative to the competitors strengths and weaknesses. Works with prospects to co-define and co-develop a URAC product solution. Identifies and collaborates with internal teammates to find a successful URAC solution for a prospect. Educates and sells a product solution previously unknown to the prospect who has already acknowledged and understood their problem. Functions as a resource to sales prospects, providing relevant, valuable information to prospective clients. Asks probing questions that yield insight into the business drivers to motivate a discussion about URAC as well as asking and receiving revealing answers about the competitive landscape. Uses probing questions to identify the real underlying concern and creatively works to eliminate objections. Uses executive sponsors to understand the drivers critical to advance a sale with senior decision makers. Uses standardized criteria in a Salesforce forecast report to accurately predict the timing of closed sales. Designs and confidently delivers oral & written presentations in a structured format that engages, provokes questions, brings energy, provides new insights and challenges the existing thinking of prospects. Shapes potential new product opportunities through collaborative discussions with URAC sales director, product, marketing, and other team members. Provides information, reports, articles, news clips, and unique insights to prospects to help them meet their needs and better manage their business. Shares contrarian views with both sales prospects and URAC colleagues with the goal of increasing alignment between products and the unmet needs of prospects. Ability to solve problems and build relationships. Enters and maintains data accurately in Salesforce and other internal business systems. Utilizes social media (LinkedIn, Twitter) to develop and nurture relationships with prospects. Other duties as assigned. Proven Experience, Knowledge, And Accomplishment Requirements Proven sales success meeting the items listed in the job duties and responsibilities section above. Knowledge of health insurance, pharmacy business trends, accountable care, clinical integration, health care information technology and the Affordable Care Act. Proven consultative selling success and ability to develop relationships at the executive level. Entrepreneurial drive, energy, and sense of urgency coupled with team first attitude. Education And Training Requirements Bachelors degree, preferably in business, life science or health science. 8 or more years of successfully meeting sales targets, healthcare experience strongly preferred. Outside sales training. Knowledge of Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint. Knowledge of CRM tool, preferably Salesforce. Knowledge of online meeting and presentation tools.

companyName: Maker&Son - The most comfortable chairs in the world
description: Job Description SENIOR SALES CONSULTANT – Luxury furniture & homewares Base Salary + Commission with annual compensation target of $90,000 - $110,000  Company Overview Maker&Son is one of the world’s fastest growing luxury furniture & homewares businesses. We design and make the world’s most comfortable chairs, sofas and beds, entirely from natural and ethically sourced materials. We’re an ambitious, young company, with a vision to become a globally recognized brand, changing the face of luxury home retail. We sell directly to our customers via our website, and our team of Sales Consultants who bring our trademark mobile showrooms to our customers’ homes. We are headquartered in the United Kingdom, with a presence in the UK, Ireland, Australia, New Zealand and the US where we are already established in New York, Los Angeles and Florida. We are excited to continue our U.S. expansion in 2021 into a number of additional U.S. metropolitan markets including all of California. We offer a flexible, remote-based work schedule, with amazing benefits (Including 20 paid days off per year + 8 holidays).  Role Overview Working through leads generated from our impressive social media platforms, website and local marketing efforts, the Senior Sales Consultant is responsible for attaining or exceeding revenue targets through a combination of telephone, email, and in-person home visits leveraging our unique Mobile Showrooms within their assigned territory. This is a remote-based position, with frequent travel throughout the assigned territory, reporting to the Western Sales Manager. The Senior Sales Consultant will lead a direct report Sales Consultant as a team, and work collaboratively with various company partners to deliver an exceptional experience to every customer. As we are a fast-moving business currently establishing our brand in the U.S., the role is best suited for someone with an entrepreneurial spirit who loves to roll up their sleeves and get involved in any and all aspects of the business. Excellent planning skills, with an ability to remain flexible and agile to the changing nature of the business is key. A passion for sustainably and ethically made furniture, home interiors, and delivering top-notch customer service are essential to success in the role.  Key Responsibilities Meet or exceed sales targets by maximizing leads through effective phone, email, video conference, and in-person sales consultations. Proactively manage potential leads by utilizing ZenDesk CRM system. Maintain a strategic weekly schedule that maximizes opportunities for Mobile Showroom customer visits within assigned territory. Maintain sales database including updates of customer details, payments and invoicing. Ensure exceptional service before, during, and after mobile showroom visits to customers’ homes. Provide product, design and space planning advice to customers that drives sales of Maker&Son furniture. Be an Ambassador of the Maker&Son brand through friendly, thorough, and professional written and verbal communication. Set and execute specific plans to build relationships within the Interior Design community that drive sales and brand loyalty. Work closely with Western Sales Manager and US Marketing Manager to identify opportunities to expand brand awareness through local marketing efforts, events and partnerships. Uphold Maker&Son company values. Build and maintain healthy and productive relationships with fellow Maker&Son business partners.  Skills and Experience Minimum 5 years of experience in Sales with proven track record of meeting or exceeding annual sales targets. Ability to assess customer needs, provide design guidance and overcome concerns that will lead to customer satisfaction, long-term brand loyalty, and sales growth. A passion for, and experience with interior design, furniture and home goods, preferably with an established book of contacts. An entrepreneurial spirit with a passion for growing sales and brand awareness within assigned territory. Ability to effectively organize, manage and delegate job tasks. Prior experience leading direct report(s). Excellent verbal and written communication skills, and ability to manage the needs of multiple customers simultaneously and professionally. Prompt and thorough follow up maintained consistently. Excellent listening skills. Self-motivated, and able to manage time effectively. Ability to create strategic plans for accomplishing tasks, while remaining agile and flexible. Previous experience working with Google, ZenDesk, Xero, Tawk or similar CRM tools is an asset. Clean driving record is required. Experience driving a mid-sized van is helpful, but not required.  To apply please send your CV and cover letter explaining why you believe you would excel this this role to Recruitment@makerandson.com, or apply via LinkedIn/Indeed/BOH.

Remote-based position; MUST reside in the ATL area*  ClearScale is a leading cloud systems integration company and AWS Premier Consulting Partner providing a wide range of cloud services including cloud consulting, architecture design, migration, automation, application development, data & analytics and managed services. We help Fortune 500 enterprises, mid-size businesses, and startups across various verticals and market segments succeed with ambitious, challenging, and unique cloud transformation projects. We architect, develop, and launch innovative solutions using cutting-edge cloud technologies. ClearScale is growing rapidly and there is a high demand for the services we provide; e.g. Migrations, Data & Analytics, Containerization, Serverless Infrastructure, Microservices, IoT, Machine Learning, DevOps and more.  ClearScale is looking for a high energy and dynamic Sales Development Representative to identify and generate sales opportunities through both inbound and outbound activities. The right candidate will be one who works well under pressure, thinks out-of-the-box, easily initiates relaxed but informative two-way phone conversations with prospects, and is highly self-motivated. The right candidate will also understand how to assess a company’s needs and cater the outreach to each prospect specifically. This position requires heavy outbound phone calling, qualification, consultative selling skills and tight collaboration with the Account Executives to generate new opportunities. The SDR will be expected to report on qualification and call activity and stay thoroughly informed on all ClearScale offerings and the Public Cloud industry in general. This is not a silo position. We want a collaborative and energetic individual that can contribute to the sales and marketing teams, work in a dynamic environment, deliver messaging and solution feedback back into the marketing and product organization and work proactively to drive overall sales performance.  Requirements: 0-4+ years experience (will consider a new grad or someone with applicable experience) Proven business development success through effective use of core sales tools like Salesforce, Zoominfo, LinkedIn, Outreach, etc Demonstrated ability to collaborate with a distributed sales team Capability of understanding customer pain points, requirements and correlating potential business to value that can be provided by ClearScale Strong and professional communication skills -- written, verbal, presentation Aptitude to manage numerous requests and time demands concurrently, while achieving production goals from assigned territory or set of accounts Promotes a strong sense of urgency for reaching goals and key deliverables. Acts without being told what to do. Brings new ideas to the company. Contributes fully to the team effort and plays an integral part in the smooth running of teams without necessarily taking the lead Drive, Grit, Team Oriented: strong desire to compete and win BA/BS degree or relevant experience  What’s in it for you? Competitive Salary; Benefits Paid Time Off Opportunity to build a sales career in the fast growing Cloud industry with an industry leader Annual compensation re-evaluation Collaborative, high-energy culture Flexible work arrangements Learning opportunities Powered by JazzHR  fnxLM5gE4G

description: AppOmni is looking for a talented Sales & Marketing Operations hire to join our rapidly growing team.  The opportunity:  As the first Sales & Marketing Operations hire at AppOmni, you'll help build and shape the entire revenue ops function. You'll work closely with the sales, marketing, financial, and product teams to support go-to-market (GTM) initiatives. You will be responsible for optimizing the GTM process and the sales enablement experience by driving tool enhancements, improving cross-functional team workflows, and enabling internal stakeholders to maximize the effectiveness of their available tools. You will also be responsible for managing marketing automation solutions and tracking pipeline performance.  Successful candidates will have experience supporting sales and marketing operations at a high-growth technology company. Title and compensation for this role will be determined based on the candidate.  You have: 3+ years experience with Salesforce as an Administrator, Reporting Analyst, or Power User. Domain knowledge of sales methodologies, tools, and operational best practices. Strong communication and interpersonal skills to support cross-team collaboration. Self-motivation and the ability to work both independently and with cross-functional teams. A level of comfort working in a fast-paced startup environment. Experience with marketing automation software such as: HubSpot, ZoomInfo, 6sense, Sendoso and future martech stack additions. Working knowledge of the latest digital marketing and sales enablement strategies to connect the dots throughout the contact lifecycle.  In the role, you'll: Serve as a champion for process improvement and scalability by managing the various systems and tools aligned to the GTM organization, including Salesforce, HubSpot, ZoomInfo, and other SaaS tools. Partner with the sales and product teams to advise and execute on technical components of GTM initiatives. Support data-driven decision-making, and help teams prepare for board meetings with Reports and Dashboards. Communicate effectively across functions with status updates to relevant stakeholders. Enable AppOmni stakeholders with training and collateral to ensure team members know how to leverage the tools available to them in their roles.  We have: One of the fastest-growing security startups with triple-digit growth and incredibly high customer retention, and A flexible, supportive, remote-first culture, with A team of talented individuals who love answering questions, guided by A high bar for quality and commitment to self-improvement and personal growth, and An open mind for new ideas and methodologies, offering Competitive salary and benefit options, as well as Opportunities and support for massive career growth  Location  This position can be fully remote or located in either of our two engineering offices: San Francisco Bay Area Carbondale, CO  Note that due to COVID-19, this role will start fully remote regardless of location.  Culture  We believe in cultivating excellence - within ourselves, and in the work that we do. Our team of customer-centric, data-driven experts are brought together by a shared passion to create tools for the greater good. We are determined to make a difference, to positively impact our way of life by securing the technology that is changing the world.  We believe in being a trusted and transparent partner to our customers, and we are fervent about providing them with high-quality, usable, and dependable software focused on the human experience, built out of a collaborative culture and a deep understanding of customer needs and goals.  We value passion, courage, and kindness. We also know that outstanding talent isn't found in one location. Our team - veterans of cloud software, security startups, international travel brands, and some of the biggest giants in technology - spans from the mountains of Colorado to the skylines of San Francisco and New York City.  We value our people, and know that wellness and a healthy work/life balance enables them to thrive and bring us their best.  About AppOmni  AppOmni is a leading provider of SaaS Security Management software. The company was founded by a team of security veterans from top SaaS providers and cybersecurity vendors, and its customer base includes global leaders across technology, healthcare, banking, and finance as well as many of the most well-known cybersecurity providers.  AppOmni's patented technology scans APIs, security controls, and configuration settings to compare the current state of enterprise SaaS deployments against best practices and business intent. The solution offers fast deployment, instant visibility, and makes it easy for security and IT teams to secure their entire SaaS environment from each vendor to every end user. As SaaS applications evolve, AppOmni stays current with all updates and releases to keep customer environments secure over time.  https://appomni.com/about/

description: We're transforming the grocery industry  Instacart is the North American leader in online grocery and one of the fastest-growing companies in e-commerce. Since 2012, we’ve been working towards creating a world where everyone has access to the food they love and more time to enjoy it together.  Groceries delivered to your door in as little as an hour. It seems simple, right? Well, it’s more complex than that. From re-routing deliveries during snowstorms, to connecting customers with coupons and deals for their favorite brands, to updating over half a billion grocery data lines every night...our efforts bring Instacart closer to being the operating system for the grocery industry.  Overview  At Instacart we solve for the customer. That extends beyond the hundreds of thousands of consumers we deliver groceries to and includes many leading and emerging consumer packaged goods (CPG) advertisers that want to shape how consumers perceive, shop, and stay loyal to their brands. Instacart’s Brand Partnerships team is focused on serving these clients through our native advertising platform.  We are hiring a Sales Operations Manager who will support the Sales Capability & Strategy team in building and maintaining a holistic end-to-end sales management process inclusive of account segmentation & quota setting, territory development, and measuring team progress against goals. The role is highly cross-functional with engagement between sales leadership, company management, finance, and strategy. We’re continuing to scale at a fast pace and this integral role will really help in paving the way for continued success and implementing best-in-class scalable processes.  Your day to day… Manage and refine account segmentation and assist with territory management as well as quota setting process Track and analyze key performance metrics within Salesforce including pipeline growth, win/loss rates, and quota attainment Develop dashboards and reports utilizing Salesforce to track sales operations and cross-functional efficiencies, and identify areas for improvement Partnering with Business Analytics to create and maintain Salesforce forecasting models and data Conduct data analyses that will be used to inform strategic decisions You have... 5+ years of experience in a relevant field with demonstrated account segmentation success inclusive of setting sales quotas, ideally in a digital advertising landscape Ability to model data and plan for different scenarios Exposure to and understanding of digital advertising and digital advertising sales cycle Highly proficient in Excel or Google Sheets Proficient in Salesforce with experience building & maintaining reports and dashboards Strong written & verbal communication Excellent attention to detail, follow-through, and resourcefulness Ability to independently manage multiple tasks simultaneously and prioritize responsibilities Ability to work cross-functionally with many teams and multi-tasks with a sense of urgency An interest in working in a fast-growing, fast-paced environment with changing responsibilities, and a willingness to lend a helping hand wherever it’s needed Nice to Have… Experience working closely with a distributed sales team Administrative experience with Xactly Certified Salesforce Admin Experience with Tableau or similar BI tools Accommodations & Accessibility  At Instacart, we strive to create an accessible and inclusive experience for all candidates. If you need assistance submitting an application through our career site due to a disability, please submit an Accommodations Request Form and someone from our team will reach out soon to see how we may be able to assist.

description: ToolBelt, the fastest growing construction tech platform, is seeking top sales talent! We are looking for an outgoing, well-spoken inside sales representative with experience overcoming objections and closing deals to join our elite sales team.  This full-time remote sales position will play a fundamental role in achieving our team's ambitious growth goals this year and into 2022. Are you a skilled closer? Join the construction industry’s fast-growing technology company!  Ideal Candidates Will Possess The Following B2B, SaaS, or construction sales experience (5 Years Minimum) Strong video demo skills, cold calling telesales ability, focusing on delivering value proposition, overcoming objections and closing sales Sell to Enterprise Customers Ability to effectively explain and demonstrate production services to decision-makers in residential building and general contracting Proficient use of Microsoft products, video conferencing software & sales CRM (Hubspot) Ability to develop report, listen to understand needs and deliver solutions Ability to insure successful onboarding of new customers Benefits Include Full-time, salaried position plus bonuses Remote sales position working Monday-Friday 8am-5pm PST with occasional weekend appointments Appointments set for you Goals in place to help you meet and exceed targets Huge growth opportunities within the ToolBelt organization Serve as an ambassador for a technology product that is redefining the residential contracting industry Job Type: Full-time, Remote, Telesales  What Makes Us Great  Fast growing tech startup located in PDX/Vancouver, WA  Excellent corporate culture & work / life balance  Competitive pay + health / stock benefits  Solid 2 yr. growth plan  OEN Company of the Year 2020  TAO Company of the Year 2020
